text:
I took my daughter here for her 21st birthday and what a mistake I made!!! We rented two rooms and to begin with the carpets were filthy in the room and hallways, one room the sofa a ripped lining which hung on the floor. The alarm clock made this really weird humming noise and I had to unplug the makeup mirror was broken and had no light as well as the base was broken so it listed to one side. When you flushed the toilet the outside sink gurgled for a few minutes. I asked for two non-smoking rooms and one stunk of cigarette smoke.

I stayed at the Rio for three days and one of my rooms was not cleaned for two consecutive days. When I called housekeeping they tried to say that we were in the room too long in the morning but we were up and out by 11AM each day. The Rio has two pools one with a waterfall and another that is heated were kid mainly enough themselves. This pool was absolutely disgusting. The white tile had a filthy black ring around it. Once I returned home I completed a survey sent to me by the Rio and I heard nothing but once I posted a review such as this one on Trip Advisor I was contacted by the Total Rewards depart offering me an upgraded room the next time I visited. 

This tells me that they in fact had cleaner and better maintained rooms if you pay extra, otherwise you get filth, no housekeeping services and tattered furniture. I would have to be out of my mind to throw good money behind bad. Keep in mind that the Rio "All Suites" Hotel and Casino is owned by Caesars Entertain who also own Caesars Palace, Paris, Bally the Quad and a number of other "Strip" properties. It's clear to me that the Rio is there "Ghetto" property where they clip poor unsuspecting tourists who are trying to save a few dollars while on vacation. 

Since my return I have done extensive research on this property and the vast majority of the negative reviews are consistent with the property being a poorly maintained dump. Don't believe the glitz and glamour that you see on the Discovery Channel this place truly sucks and management knows about it. 

BUYERS BEWARE!!!!

If you are an intellectual, you will love this place. You can sit it in your hotel room, far away from the Strip, and ponder whether it is a good business decision for the Rio to sell overpriced food at their restaurants. Doesn't that just remind people how far away they are from the cheaper food on the Strip? Should they be using the Madison Square Garden concession model when they don't have the Knicks? Then you can stare at your bathroom door and wonder why an outfit which runs and expensive Mardi Gras sky show can't paint the door and replace the broken door stop. You will have a lot of time to think, because after the Penn and Teller show, there is nothing else to do.

Her name is Rio, and she... well, she used to do a lot more.

Told friends we were staying at the Rio and comments ranged from "I heard that was a great place to stay a long time ago", to "aren't they going to close the Rio?", to "why?"

Flash back with me to 1990.  I heard nothing but people visiting Vegas talk about the VooDoo Lounge, on the 51st floor, the shocking cocktail waitress outfits here, the amazing huge suites, and the masquerade in the sky carnival show.

Well, the VooDoo lounge is not as exclusive, trendy, or fancy as it used to be, but it's not trying to be.  Still cannot beat that view at night.  It can get windy, but it's amazing.

The shocking cocktail waitress thongs have been covered up, as trends do, although the lacy negligee black lace outfits are still very sexy.  The suites were nothing if you've stayed at the Venetian, or in a suite at Caesar's Palace, but it did look like the bathrooms had been remodeled, as they were in modern granite, and very very, like superbly clean.  Not a speck or indication of use anywhere.  

Speaking of bathrooms, the ones here have a strange square window portal where you can see right in.  Not sure who came up with that bright idea, but it skeeved me out to think people visiting could see me on the potty or in the shower.  Anyway.  

Check in was a breeze, even though there was a line.  There are so many deals that even the front desk was confused.  Ours, booked through the hotel's specials page, included two 24 hour buffet wristbands, for two days, for two people.  

And use those wristbands we did, eating four meals a day.  The buffet here (the regular one, not the seafood one, which we did not try) is amazing, especially the mongolian bbq\/teppanyaki stations.  Lots of fresh cut vegetables, and a little of everything - sushi, italian, chinese, salad bar, etc.  

Everything except the Palms is a major hike from here.  There is a shuttered strip club across from the Rio, which is funny to look at.  I imagine there are cobwebs covered with glitter inside.  

The outside of the building has peeling glass film, which is U-G-L-Y.  They need to renovate that.  

And, as others have mentioned, the Masquerade in the Sky has gone to that big place in the sky where floats and showgirls dwell, long ago -- it is no longer. 

They do have some of the cocktail servers get up on platforms near the slot machines and dance.  I think they do that some other places, and it's strange, but also a welcome vibe among the quiet seniors pulling slot handles.

Amazingly, the pool here is fantastic.  Actually four pools, one of which is adult... I mean "European"... I mean topless or whatever the euphemism is these days.  It is basically "toptional", so no kids, and whether you wear a top or not is up to you.  

Enjoyed the shuttle to the other Caesar's properties, including Bally's, Paris Las Vegas, Harrah's, and Caesar's Palace.  That saved a lot of driving or taxicab fare. 

WiFi is included in your resort fee, but is for ONE device.  So if you connect your tablet, forget your computer or phone.  Ice buckets worked fine, and housekeeping was on it with extra towels and other items needed.  

Two towers here, the Masquerade tower, where we stayed, and I think the Carnival Tower, which is a little closer.  Masquerade tower is a slight walk, but not too bad.  Burger King Bar (which was not visited) and the Chippendale's show are on this tower's side.  

We did see Penn and Teller, which was packed, even though parts of it was the same show I saw 10 plus years ago.  But it was a great great show nonetheless. 

The best part was the view of the lightning, thunderstorms, and lights of las vegas from our room on the 31st floor.

Totally disappointed in this place. Had wondered about it for years... many, in fact... but it was a HUGE disappointment with a few exceptions. I won't even begin to explain the 7 times I waited in line to deal with screw ups on my tab\/billing and NO I am not talking about mysterious charges. I am talking about .... ah never mind.... it was a fkin nightmare. The Indian restaurant's food was good but unbelievably over-priced.... seriously over-priced. Many of the bar-tenders were great but a few were complete assholes... The Pool experience with a rented cabana was nice but seriously.... a ceiling fan, a small flat screen TV, and some water aside from our open tab..... for that much??!!??  OK, well, that said our attendant Teri was incredible and made the day feel very good and it is more or less worth it BUT  ...  idk... just seemed lacking beyond our server....  also, food options are VERY limited even in  cabana... The rooms (I rented 3 for various people on this trip) were worn and obviously in need of updating. The desk staff were nice but useless. I really wanted to like this place but fk no... there is no way I could recommend this place to a friend.  Caesars is killing a lot of places and this is one - I suspect the Palace Station folks will probably grab it soon..... and honestly it might improve....

We went to go see Chippendale's and was quite.. disappointed. What's with all the slow jams singing? Seriously just take it off. I guess I wasn't really aware of what this show was really leaning towards. The dancing was off, you can see them count their 8-counts steps. The men were sexy, but that's just about it.  The experience was alright though, I suppose. I just would think it'd be better. -_-

Paid $175 for a non-smoking newly renovated Samba Suite.  The upholstery had stains, there were crumbs on the carpet and the room smelled of smoke and deodorizer.  We asked to be moved and were happy with our Samba Suite on the 37th floor until we realized we could've danced to 3am in our own room.  We were able to hear the pounding beats of the Voodoo Lounge from the 51st floor!  I believe the Rio has an obligation to make their guests aware of this significant fact.  Don't get me wrong, we enjoy a good party... Just like my sleep too!

This review is just for The Village seafood buffet which I heard so many great things about. My mom and a few co-workers said Rio has the best seafood buffet so how could I go wrong ? So I couldn't wait to eat at this buffet and I was thinking it would be better then Valley View Casino in San diego.

So I knew it would be a little pricey at about 50 bucks and I was fine with that. I got there and the cashier said I could take a look around just to see if I would like it. So I did and I didn't see any lobster claws but I did see some lobster tails about the size of your pinky finger. That just blew my mind but I was hungry and I did want seafood so I just stayed there.

They had a lot of cold crab which I've never been a big fan of but they did have warm crab also. The buffet was a little small for my taste but that's alright. There was Asian food, Mexican and American but for the price it just didn't measure up. I order a lemonade and it was terrible the only things that I liked was the warm crab and some of the desserts. 

I wouldn't really recommend this buffet because it's way to pricey, they have small lobster tails that didn't even taste good and it's kind of small.

This review is for the downstairs areas and casino only as we did not stay here, only gambled here and walked around. 

We had tickets to see Penn and Teller Friday night and had heard from my mother that the seafood buffet at the Rio was good, so we decided to come here for dinner, show, gambling. The hotel itself was quite nice, but packed with families(which I always find odd for Vegas). There were these circus like contraptions floating up above our heads with people dancing inside of them and throwing down beads like at Mardi Gras w\/out boobies showing. The women were scantily clad and the men were topless (nice bodies I might add). It was a fun show to popular music and I am sure the powers that be get amused seeing people crawling on the floor for cheap ass beads...anyway.

We played table games here-a little Let it Ride and some 3\/5\/7. Neither of us had much luck, so when it was time to go to our show, we were happily able to leave the table. After the show, I decided to check out their poker room. I played for a couple of hours and left with the same amount of money I bought in for. There was a terribly intoxicated jerk across from me who got his panties all in an uproar because someone river-ed him against his pocket 8's. What a jerk. The casino host should have recognized his level of intoxication and escorted him out of the poker room, but I am sure the regulars (locals) were enjoying taking his money just a little too much.

I would come back here again, but not any time soon.
A crummy run down old hotel.  it's evident that the incredibly poorly run Caesars corporation owns and operates this hotel.

My first time ever staying at the rio. Went there on august 15,2015. First thing we did was went to the pool area! OMG! I had such a blast! !! We ended up staying there from 11am-6pm at the pool. The music was bumpin! I was pretty buzzed off of sooo many margarita refills I've had!! I made sooooo many friends at the pool that it took me soo long to say bye to everyone! Never have I ever had soooo much fun in vegas before. .. thanks to my buddies that I went with!! Now I know pool parties in vegas during the summer is the shiiieeett!!  That's where you'll find me now anytime imma be out in vegas for the summer!! Yeeeaaaahhh!!!

For being an off strip casino, this place is still a good casino and this is coming from a Vegas local. Hotel rooms are reasonably priced, uber\/lyfts or shuttles to the strip are convenient, Chippendales is here (for those that indulge in male reviews) and the buffet is still just as good. They consolidated the seafood and combined it with the carnival world buffet and made that vacated spot into a cool putt putt golf area and arcade which is fun for the kids and immature adults. The flare bartenders are still there and good rock and roll cover band music provides good ambience at night. During the summer the Rio pool is an underrated spot as it is huge and has a separate adult area with a live dj.

I miss when Rio had the Mardi Gras decor that moved around the casino ceiling, that was pretty cool to watch. Another thing they got rid of is the entertainment on the big stage in the casino. Rio is pretty outdated and tired. It's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle on the strip, but it's also nice to have something that makes your casino stand out, which I feel this does not anymore. 
I'm a players club member and found the gals working the players desk to be the uneducated on the rules and no help with my free play questions. I was having a problem with a slot machine and the club attendant attempted to help me, but it never worked out. Now I have a worthless coupon for free play I'm carrying around in my purse for no reason at all. 
The cocktail girls were nowhere to be seen...something one expects when gambling - a drink! I ended up running into the gift shop to buy a beer. 
I will say the valet staff was prompt and friendly. A second star for the fact that the Kiss miniature golf is here, super cool for a family outing.

Always enjoy this hotel when we stay here. Huge rooms and close to the strip. Just play a little and you get comped rooms next time you come. We got married in Vegas in August 2011 and our wedding party stayed here and had no complaints.

I like this hotel a lot! Why are the ratings so low?! Anyway, it's one block away from the Strip and it has an amazing buffet. Go there. You will enjoy the food. So. Much! 

You're welcome. :D

While the accommodations are okay(very outdated, and uncomfortable beds), the hotel management is deplorable. If I were to ever treat a customer the way the front desk treats guests, I can guarantee I would be fired. When issues arose with my card being charged three times, no empathy of understanding was offered. Che'ree Johnson, the manager I spoke to, was extremely rude, snide, and smug. Luckily my bank caught one of the charges and listed it as fraud but the other two charges went through. I also wasn't the only one to have issues with their charges that evening. While I waited to speak to someone, there were three other parties that were also overcharged. The rooms may be less expensive but you get what you pay for and then some.

Can I put ZERO stars?!! I only stayed here because my work convention was hosted in this hotel, but never again. Worst experience ever. Very dissatisfied and disappointed. I have to admit, I booked the delux with 2 queens and the room was a lot bigger than anticipated. But everything after that went downhill from there. I was in a non smoking room, that smelled like smoke. My room fridge was dirty. I stopped my the vending machine for water and it took my money. Called the front desk to see if someone can fix it but they said it was from an outside vendor and they had no access to it, and that was as far as that conversation went (useless). And to top it off when I got to the hotel from a night out at 2am I came to find out that the water wasn't working!! The toilets, the sinks, the showers!! No water! I called the front desk and again they were useless, pretty much told me the water won't turn on until 5:30am and there was nothing they could do, or were willing to do. I told them this was unacceptable and wanted to talk to a manager. They put me on hold for too long I had to hang up and call again, then got transferred to 2 different people before getting the manager, who was again useless.

Like many other Yelpers have said, this hotel has gone downhill.. WAY downhill. We stayed at the Ipanema Tower which, I think, is the older of the two towers so perhaps those who stayed at the Masquerade Tower had a better experience. They also used to have a float parade (forgot what it was called) in the casino which provided some entertainment for the guests but now it's all quiet and mostly empty.

Price: It's definitely cheaper than most hotels on\/near the strip especially for the size of the room that you're getting. But BEWARE, they charge extra $30 per person per night for anything more than 2 people staying in the same room.

Parking: Free. It's one of the remaining few hotels on\/near the strip that do not charge for parking.

Room: It's big and the beds are comfortable. Other than that, the room is very outdated - carpet has tears and looks dirty, pull out couch is broken and looks like it hasn't been cleaned\/replaced in 20+ years, mirror near the bed had hand marks... you get the picture.

Check-in: Fast and easy. I received an email saying I could check in online so I did. Got there around 2 pm and our room was ready. They didn't charge for early check-in fee (I made sure to ask about that).

Buffet: Mediocre. The buffet has a huge selection but the food is sadly underwhelming. For $32\/person + tax (kids 4 and under are free, $15 for ages 5-12) for weekend brunch, I was expecting much better quality but I guess they went with quantity.

Meh, this place is okay, went here for a wsop tournament. It is annoying how you have to take a cab too and from this place. I also saw Penn and Teller here which was awesome, would definitely recommend that. I have heard from a few other poker player that the Rio has huge problems with theft around the wsop

The only thing that I enjoyed about this Hotel\/ Casino is the buffet. Oh, and their roof-top party which offers a beautiful view. Other than that, they'll never get my money ever again. Customer Service is TERRIBLE ! Their HIDDEN fees are BS. They charge you for either (1) services that you don't intend on using or (2) Services that they can't even deliver: Wi-fi. I spent over an hour on the phone with their Tech Support trying to fix the issue with unsuccessful outcome. It never worked. No one followed up yet they were quick enough to add an additional $22.50\/ per night .

Unless you're really old, only plan on staying in--ONE--casino, and enjoy the smell of cigarette [third hand smoke], then stay here. (This hotel is so old that cigarette smoke is all you smell.. it's trapped in their carpet.) Otherwise, I'd  much rather pay a few bucks more and stay on the strip at a newer hotel.

Although it's not located too far off the strip, expect to pay about $20\/one way to the strip, and $30 to the airport. Sure they provide shuttles, but it's not always convenient, trust me! Sometimes you want to just jump on the cab and get to your destination.

I got an upgrade, but had to pay $10. My room was in the same tower with room 50001 the Presidential Suite where I had my meeting the next day. Interesting fact: because the number four is unlucky in Asian culture there is no 40th floor. The numbers go from 1-39 to 50-51. There are actually 41 floors. I was promised a view of the strip and I got one--but there was a killer view from the rooms on the other side of the hallway. I'm sure not every room is full and don't know why she couldn't have put me across the hall for my $10. Also, she couldn't put me in a room above floor 23. Perhaps the higher rooms are smoking--IDK. 

The room was really large, well kept and had a nice view of the red lights of the smaller Rio tower across. The tub was extra large and deluxe.

I ate dinner at the Voodoo Restaurant on floor "50". The table had a nice view, the lamb was good and the waiter brought me a second glass of wine when the first came from a bottle that had been opened a while and didn't taste very good. He asked me how it was and I said, "Just ok". He offered to change it and I was surprised because I hadn't made an issue out of it. I asked him to pick a different wine and he made an economical and good choice. He surpassed my expectations. Someone like he should be at the front desk.

Worst hotel we have ever stayed at! They stole our car right out of valet parking. Someone picked up our ticket and they released the car to that person. The supervisor of valet Kevin told us they have had this happen to them before and he was very careless really didn't care that we were left stranded. Other hotels like the Wynn in Vegas does ask for a form of ID when releasing a vehicle. They tried to tell us that it's a legal contract when reading the policy on the ticket it states they are not held responsible for personal items left inside the car... NOT THE WHOLE FUCKING VEHICLE! They completely treated it like it was not a big deal what so ever

Stayed here for a work conference. The front staff was good. Not great. I had a package delivered to the hotel that I never received. I didn't have time to make it to the pool. Mostly because i was trying to track this package down. My room was good.  A bit dated but the floor plan was good. I don't plan on staying here again.

OMG, I never stayed in such an old overprice hotel in Vegas before,  well this is it. 

I loved their buffet but they could definitely upgrade their rooms. We went with a group and heard their room was a bit more modern but all the TV's had big backs on them? come on, all that $ and can't even upgrade to flat screens? 

The shower had little to nothing water pressure and I felt like i was showering with drops of water...Will NEVER stay there again.

Failure at customer service. Staff needs a lot of training in how to work with people. Don't chose to stay here if you have any sort of special need: vision impaired, hearing impaired with service dog. The facility's is fine, it's the insensitive employees that bother me.

BIG, clean, and well designed suites but not the place to go for luxury. The lobby is decorated with fake cobblestones - it makes the place feel like a huge half-empty basement. To add tot he creepy basement feel - there's a large, disembodied, 2-sided head mounted on the ceiling. It apparently is also mounted on a track and lights up as it travels across the lobby. Creepy much? Anyway, the room is fine but the lobby is sparsely populated by desperate-looking gamblers wearing oversized tee shirts and stone washed jeans and jean-shorts with fanny packs (bum bags for you UK people). It just has a sad and slightly deserted vibe that I do not like. The only plus is the room. Some crafty person was really thinking and did double sinks - one inside the bathroom and one outside the bathroom so people can get ready w\/o taking up the entire bath. Overall, this place is not really my cup of tea - I prefer the action and hustle-bustle of the Strip - but it may work for you if you'd like a more quiet and low-key vegas stay.
$14 a day for internet service in the room is an insult. $3 for a soda from the vending machine is an insult.

I stayed at the Rio once. It was nice and affordable. Its not located on the strip but its only 5 minutes away. The view I had was a distant strip view. 

The room was clean and the staff was nice. They dont have room service. Parking wasnt too bad. Overall, I'd recommend it.

Checked in at the small VIP area at the RIO.  Yes, it was quiet and away from the bustle of the crowd but it was rather stuffy.  The lobby is not that big (compared to the other huge hotels in LV) although still busy on a Sunday night.

HUGE rooms, like the wet bar, can sleep 6 easy.  Great view of the strip. adequate parking.  Shops are ok but not high-end. I like the fact that it is away from the strip where you can experience the craziness of LV and still have some down time.

Servers also double up as performers every 15 minutes (sing and\/or dance) on small stages set within the casino floor.  Awesome outfits custom-made for each girl.  Hot stuff ...

RIO is ok.  Nothing to rave about, but off the beaten path if you want to enjoy a bit of Vegas without going really crazy.

My friends are committed Vegas people, they get these comps that are ridiculous, so to speak!!!!  My friend had a big party celebration in Vegas and invited us to go, you wouldn't believe where we stayed at in the Rio.   We had the Presidential suites, OMG, it was amazing, private entrance, limo service everywhere, elevators in suites, game room, living room was bigger than my apartment itself, there were tv's eveywhere, speaker system and high, high ceilings, long ass balcony and toilets to clean you butt with walk in closets for him and her.  This place had a 4-6 bedrooms, are with turn down service, it was classy.  Cases and cases of Evian were brought to us, and we didn't have to pay a dime......I heard it was 8 grand a night, I know I said the same thing, WHATTTT....

Some of us stayed at the Venetian and some here.....Now I know how the rich live and it is no joke......All in all, the place was beautiful

Damn you, Oprah!

Since Oprah ended up doing a show with Cher and Tina Turner, Caesar's Palace overbooked 200 rooms.  They ended up kicking out all the people who had family discounts and put them in sister hotels.  They told us that the Rio rooms were nice and since everything was comped, we didn't have much to complain about.

The room did end up being very nice and the restaurant inside wasn't bad either.  The pool however, was nasty.  They had music and a bar closeby which was nice, but the chairs were dirty and had bird poop all over them.  The water was freezing and the bottom of the pools were stained brown.  Yuck.  Thankfully we had access to the Caesar's pool...so we only had to endure that pool for one day.  

I don't really like how it's so far off the strip, but the short cab lines make up for it.  Would I stay here again?  Maybe.  But I wouldn't go out of my way to make reservations here.

i really enjoyed my time at this hotel.  Yeah its off the strip but makes up for it with the amenities and fun things to do at the hotel. The room was huge and very comfortable. The only complaint I had is the shower took forever to get warm and had low flow. Otherwise I do agree this is a hidden gem in Vegas to stay at.

I stayed there last weekend and I am not going to lie.. i was a little scared after reading the reviews. Here is my review

Parking: So easy and quick. we decided to park in the structure and it was no prob to park and take the mini bridge to the hotel. 

Check-in: My bf did have a little trouble checking in because the reservation was under a different name, but once the manager stepped in everything was great. 

Room: I was expected horrible but the room was actually pretty great. Sure is need to be updated a bit but overall it was clean, spacious, and nice. We did have a fridge in the room, the bathroom was huge, and OMG the beds... aammaazziinngg i slept like a baby. 

Pool: The pool was fun and our waitress was very nice and friendly. Drinks were of course not cheap because its Vegas but they were very good. The only thing i did not like is the fact that you cant take your own drink to the pool. All the other hotels I have stayed at usually allow one drink. 

Food: We only had lunch at the "Sports Grill" i think that is what its called well the pizza was delicious .. we had it two days in a row. 

Service: The staff was great and friendly i didnt have a bad experience with anyone. 

Overall this hotel was excellent! If only it was closer to the strip.

Just finished up a stay at the RIO.  Front desk service was terrible. The staff member who checked us in never looked us in the face and in fact never smiled the entire time.   They offered us an upgrade to a better room.   I would have hated to see our original room. The shower head was broken ,  there was duct tape on the carpet to hold it down and the bathroom faucet water smelled of sewage.   When we first checked in there was a room service tray in the hallway outside our room.  When we checked out three days later the tray was still there.    I would not recommend this hotel.

Amazing hotel and casino. Great place to hold conventions! We attended the Supernatural this weekend and it was fantastic! The only complaint, which is to be expected, is that the walk from our room to the elevator was like half a mile. Then another half a mile to the convention area. Don't mind walking, just wear comfy shoes.

If you're looking to stay off the Vegas strip Rio is a great option.  It's close the the I-15 freeway & close to the strip for a good price. We stayed in a basic room in the Ipanema Tower & the room was very spacious & clean.  It had a decent view of the strip from the 7th floor.  We could hear when doors closed in the hallway but other than that we never heard any noise from neighboring rooms.  The beds\/pillows were comfortable & the room had a mini-fridge which was a plus since many Vegas hotels do not come with one.  I really can't review the customer service since I used the self check in\/out kiosk in the lobby & the only interaction I had was with the person who gave us directions to how to get to our room.  The self check in\/out kiosk was easy to use & it was nice to not have to wait in the line at the front desk which looked quite long.  Total Rewards desk staff was friendly as well.  Though we did not eat at the hotel there were a lot of options to choose from & a few different shops to browse.  One of the nights we caught a live band performing on the casino floor.  My only complaint would be that it was a pain to get from the parking garage to Ipanema Tower.  It was on opposite sides & it involved a lot of going up & down elevators to get to & from.  Masquerade Tower is much close to the parking garage.  I would totally stay here again though.

I had a great view of the strip, but paid 20 bucks a day for that said view. Oh well. That would be no big deal, but it was in the winter, and the pools are drained, and they are quite the eyesore. The concierge was fairly useless, or never answered the phone. My suite was newly renovated though, so it was pretty. it's too far from the strip really for a normal "stay". The shuttles to Bally's and Harrah's helps, though.

I am also baffled by the 3-star average rating. My SO booked a couple nights at this place, so I went to read up on it and was terrified by all the negative reviews. What the heck, people, what do you expect from a hotel??

In any case, our room was large and comfy, though apparently if you pick the "mountain view" you're actually getting the "hotel roof and maybe a mountain in the distance view." Who cares, though; I was here to nap in the mega bed and watch trashy television all day. Which I did, to great success. I did not sample the pool or food or casino (why would you eat casino food when you're in a city with 30711 actual restaurants!?!), but for pure hotel function, this place was great.

Oh, wait-- we did get roomservice pancakes. They were nice and fluffy. And we got a bucket of beer, which we managed to completely forget about and leave in the room fridge... :(

All I can say about the Rio is that it's a strange place. We went to the casino which is pretty low class by Vegas standards with temporary signs hung for the Irish Bar and lower end decor in some places. Overall I don't like the atmosphere of the casino but that's just my personal opinion.

We also ate at the Carnival  Buffet and although the food was decent, the service was terrible. The women seating and serving you are robotic and don't care. I asked the front desk to borrow a scissors for one minute to open a medicine I needed and they refused. So much for customer service.

Overall, it's an OK place with decent food at the buffets as long as you don't expect much from the customer service.
Great Place, I like the International Buffet but stay away from the Seafood Buffet.

First off, the valet was awesome, then the check in waited 30 mins in line and no favors. Then to the room, it's spacious but as peeling wall paper, no microwave and the fridge is struggling to get cold. Went down to get a new total rewards card and the guy I'm talking to blows off a silver member asking where the high stakes table are. Then proceeds to treat me like a bother also. And the shuttle is a joke. Download a uber or lyft app. Will not stay here again and this place speaks for their corporate.

Avoid this hotel even if you have a conference here.

Booked a premium room with king bed. Arrived and wanted 3 hours in a line to check in. They told us we have been moved to a standard smoking room because our room had maintenance and they'll call us tomorrow when our original room is ready. They didn't call us so we went to reception to follow up. We were given another basic room (smaller than the first) with two beds instead of our king. Our parents had the same situation except they had to move out of their second room because the air conditioner was broken and the room smelled of smoke. 

My room then got broken into and got my things stolen.. I claimed it and no follow up was made.

I usually come with the whole company  for our annual conference and book more than 8 rooms all premium suites and every single room I booked was downgraded and had so many problems. The worst service I've experienced in Vegas.

Loved this hotel! Did not know what to expect because all of the mixed reviews but when we got there (my girlfriend and I) we were blown away. The price that we got the suite for was ridiculously good. Very spacious, clean, and the view was great. Didn't have any problems whatsoever besides leaving

This place used to be one of the best overall deals in town.  It was off the strip but right across from the Palms and those amazing clubs they have over there.  The rooms were very inexpensive compared to other hotels and the staff was really nice.

It's gone pretty far down hill from that point in the last couple of years.  We had friends staying there and ever though we usually stay at the Palms we decided we'd join them at the Rio this trip.  WOW, big mistake.  We went to check in at 3pm and were told that they were sold out and the room we booked wasn't available so we could wait until 6pm or accept another room without a view in the older tower.  We thought... ok this can't be that bad and took it.  Keep in mind we booked our rooms a month prior.  When we got to our room we noticed the smell of something chemical, almost like paint..  It was strange.  Couldn't figure out what it was but decided to forget it by grabbing a beer from the mini bar.  Well, upon picking up the beer we noticed it wasn't at all cold.  The mini bar power light was on and the lights inside worked but it wasn't actually cold.  Since we already picked up the beer the little magnetic thing charged us.  We called the front desk about it and were told we needed to come down to speak with someone.  Really?  

I proceeded to go downstairs and was almost killed by a lady in a motorized scooter.  That was a freak thing and in the end we laughed about it.  Then I got out of the elevator on the lobby level and almost got hit by 2 more of these seniors in scooters while walking to the front desk.  It turns out they rent those scooters there and everyone seems to have one.  It was like walking around on a live go-cart track.

In the end we re-booked at the Palms and got the manager to refund us everything.  She was very apologetic and even expressed frustration about the scooters.  You could tell she didn't like those things either.

Even after all that I would have given them a 3 stars because management really did try and make it right and in the end I got a refund.  The reason I'm dropping this to a 2 star is because after I left the lobby I went to the valet to get my car and no joke, it took them 35 minutes to get our car !  I went back to the booth 2 times asking why it was taking so long and was told each time that there were reward club members automatically ahead of us because that's a perk of being park of their players club thing.  So while I was waiting every person that came after me for the next 25 minutes were apparently part of the reward club and they didn't even try to get my car.  Only after I started yelling at the guy and getting very loud did they magically have the time to get my car.

So this was a fail fail fail and then fail again.  I can't see myself going back anytime soon.

The Rio is a classic hotel and I always love to stop by and check out the interior. It does remind me of Carnival! I'm super bummed that they don't do their free Carnival show anymore so there really is no point in venturing off strip to see this older casino.

The buffet is my mom's favorite so maybe the buffet is worth coming to try? I don't know... a lot of other new casinos on the strip are a lot more glamorous and have better buffets.

3 stars for A-OK hotel and casino because it has stayed a float all these years!

Horrible. Sitting here with no wifi. I get passed around and no one can help. All this money for a room with no internet access at all. Hell, at least motel 6 could of given me wifi. Huge dissapointment.

Never Again.  See Exhibit A. 
http:\/\/www.lasvegassun.com\/news\/2013\/dec\/02\/health-department-norovirus-caused-100-sicknesses-\/

Most of my family contracted the norvovirus while at the Rio over this last weekend.  Now, I understand that the Rio isn't to blame for all of this.  However, the way that they handled the outbreak was so classless and cheap that I will never patronize this hotel again. 

My boyfriend and I got sick Friday night and assumed it was food poisoning.  However, then my sister, who hadn't ate with us, got sick on Saturday morning.  I noticed that the cleaning staff had started wearing medical masks that morning as well.  Finally, because we were all sick in bed, we saw this story on CNN and called down to the hotel.  They confirmed the virus and said it didn't make sense to leave because we were already sick and contagious.  The hotel didn't issue a statement until Saturday afternoon.  The hotel had known that these kids who spread the virus were sick as of Friday morning.  

The Rio took steps to notify and protect their staff before their guests.  Had we been given the information earlier, we very well may have left before we were able to get sick.  It absolutely ruined our trip.  Even after you're down with the stomach flu portion of the virus, you are incredibly tired and achey for the next day or so after.  So, we weren't really able to leave the hotel.  

Further, the Rio was absolutely rude about extending our check out time.  Our plan had been to check out on Sunday, leave our stuff in my mom's room, and go to the strip until our flight at 5.  My boyfriend was still pretty bed bound Sunday morning.  I asked the hotel for a check out extension because we were sick with this stomach flu and couldn't really leave the hotel.  They would only extend it for a short time and said I had to come down in person for an extension until 5.  I explained to them that I had minimal sleep and needed to shower and really didn't feel like hiking it to reservations - they wouldn't budge.  I showered and went downstairs and the lady in reservations was so unpleasant.  Her exact words to me were "I don't see what your issue could be, you already have late check out." 

Lastly, the Rio never offered any kind of compensation for the hassle we went through.  Now I know they don't have to, but they were fully aware of how awful this virus is and knew the guests who had it wouldn't be able to enjoy their stay.  Hotels give out rooms and gambling credits like candy in Vegas.  It would have been the classy thing to do.  

My advice - stay away.  Far away.

I usually stay for a few weeks each trip(multiple times per year) and the Rio has been my go-to second home in Vegas.
I'm disappointed now though, with how they are handling their brand-new mandatory resort fee. I recently called to make my next reservation, and was informed of the extra new fee(about $20 more per night). It's detouring me from coming back since they wouldn't waive it, and it was going to be over $300 more than what I expected for the stay I intended to book.

We just stayed here and not to happy with this hotel.  Went to the Pool and it was freezing during Sept and everything is over priced. Customer service workers do not care about their guest. Ordered a tuna sandwich and they gave us wrong order we were charged $17.  No drink or side included told we could order something else so played safe ordered a hamburger and there is a difference in pay. I told them and she said she would have to get manager over a hamburger we felt like we were not  treated as a guest but that we were bothering them. During lunch:eating the worker told us to go the cashier and that Mgr wanted to speak to usthat he would give us $2.00. Unbelievable service !. After a day of spending money on drinks and a expensive bag of chips. Manager was very rude& didn't care & I told him.  Gambling at their tables and machines and never winning once between the both of us.  Very strange hmmm.. We r not ur penny gambling people Say no to the Rio...Anyways next day we went to older part of Vegas and gambled and won nice people than our own hotel we made the best out of ur trip by just sleeping there and going to other casinos we wont be coming back to the Rio they do not care about their guest. 9\/12 to 9\/14 was our stay...unwelcoming stay....they want every penny and don't care if u return or not ....!

Rooms can't be beat, they're all suites with fridges and pull out sofas for extra visitors. Front desk personnel are pretty cold if you don't flash your diamond card, found out the difference when I forgot to show my card and the drastic change in attitude when I found it. The housekeeping crew are as sweet as can be. Don't forget to leave them a daily tip, they work they're asses off to clean up your nasty messes, hook them up!

The AABG restaurant food is pretty good. Go see our friend Tracy, he's probably the nicest guy you'll meet. Great customer service, always smiling. 

Voodoo Steak House food is AWESOME. Well worth the pricing $$$$. The lounge has an amazing full strip view. Our waiter was super nice.

The poker room is a great place for conversation and to meet good people. The dealers are so sweet,  you'll definitely meet some characters late night. The "beverage ambassadors" are, for the most part, really nice and remember your favorites real fast.

I don't list reviews about the casinos, they're pretty much all the same when you're losing. If you want to win, high limit slots is the way to go. My luck is impeccable in those things.

This Hotel is old, dingy, and needs to be renovated ASAP!
I felt like I was in Reno , instead of Las Vegas....
The hotel has ok food options, but the rooms were the most disappointing to me. 

PLEASE update your 1990s style ZENITH tube tv to a nice sleek Samsung flat screen!!!!!!!!!!!

this place is a solid 3 for me.  

The casino is ok.
the buffeet is better than ok (carnival buffet)
the spa is blah (yeah, it rhymes)
the rooms are ok
the beds are BAD.  

but for $200 for 3 nights (holiday weekend), there isn't much room to really complain.  They treated me right.

3 of us missed our flight so we used hoteltonight app to book a cheap room, which was about $100 for the night. the hotel is really dark and sad looking.. our room was spacious and had a big living room but the bathroom is pretty outdated. while my friend was in the bathroom he saw one tiny black bug and saw blood when he squished it. he scared me by saying, "i hope it's not a bed bug." i never experienced bed bugs before and i hope i never do. i had a hard time sleeping on top of the sheets. i woke up in the morning and didn't see any bites so phew that was good.

Ehh... This wouldn't be my first choice to go when I'm in Vegas but this was a complimentary room for my uncle who was a Diamond member.  They offered a 1 bedroom suite and a studio suite.  Not bad for complimentary. The rooms were very nice for what they were.  

One bedroom suite: Very spacious, comes with a dining table for 8 people, a very nice foyer, half bathroom for the guest.  The master bathroom's doors don't lock but it was super spacious with a nice jacuzzi.  What made me really mad was that the half bathroom sink and toilet weren't functioning correctly.  What a shame.

Studio suite: we got the newly renovated suite so it was nice.  Not much complain about it.

I didn't like coming here because it's so far from the Strip but at least it had a free shuttle to take you.  Unfortunately, it gets crowded very quickly and the shuttle comes every 30 mins or so.

Spacious rooms and ours faced the strip, looking towards the Masquerade Tower.  Not kid-friendly, as there was no arcade section.  Standard buffet was pricey ($28pp), and the seafood buffet costs more ($40pp), but selections were vast.  Their website prices are not accurate.  Shuttle service to some of the neighboring casinos was a plus.  Drinks were high priced at the bars i.e., I-BAR, Voodoo Lounge, etc. ($20\/drink) - typical Vegas style.  Get your happy hour drinks on all day at the buffet instead ($3\/beer & well drinks).  I enjoyed walking to the Gold Coast casino next door & winning my money back on black jack.  No luck at Rio, as their black jack tables start at $25+ & take your money every time - no wins for sure.  Coupon books were a bonus & their rewards center was courteous.  Starbucks is not open 24\/7 on weekdays.

Between the 2 legionnaires this year (2017) and the horrible or lack there of filtered ventilation this is not a good place for some one with breathing issues. I stayed for the Star Trek convention, I wouldn't have stayed for any other reason. NOT where I would suggest for any visitor to Vegas. The only good part that between the second hand smoke and the over priced food everywhere I lost 5 lbs in my week stay there.

Terribly outdated, no microwave, keurig no; no coffee, housekeeping mediocre, toiletries blah, front desk slow & incompetent, super far away from EVERYTHING. Annoying & expensive cab ride, or nearly 2 hour shuttle because its at the end of the earth. Food, underwhelming w\/ typical Vegas pricing, and  the last but the MOST annoying thing ever was their WIFI, terrible terrible terrible and the still want to charge you for sketch service . 
 But you get what you pay for, my stay overall was pretty cheap. 5 night stay in a suite for under $450. I had an awesome view of the RIO sign, ha! and a microscopic view of the strip.  Their many pools are pretty decent and great for kids though, so pricing and pools are what makes me give these guys the well deserved two stars

We stayed here recently on a trip to see friends, and Rio had the best deal of the nearby hotels. The "deluxe suite" is just a bigger, regular room, not at all a suite, but it was still a decent deal and we got a view of the Strip.

Other than the buffet, there aren't too many exciting restaurants. We only ate at Smashburger, which was overpriced. That area of the casino is a little sad and run down, with cheapy souvenir shops and empty storefronts. No arcade or kid-friendly activities in the hotel. This is an older hotel and one of the hotels that still offers free, abundant parking. 

We didn't get to use the pool, but it looked awesome from our view! Several, spacious pools, a waterfall, and fake "beaches" with waves. Would love to try it out next time. 

Nothing special about this one, but if it's the best deal for the weekend and you don't have expectations, you won't go wrong! Or if you just want to see Chippendale's posters of shirtless men everywhere. That's a reason to book, too.

I like to think of the Rio as the ugly stepchild of all of the Harrah's group casinos. It's old and awkward and just underwhelming in so many ways.

But, nonetheless, I find myself exploring the Rio fairly often as it is frequently the chosen location of political events (Jefferson-Jackson dinner, Netroots, etc.). So I've seen far more than I ever wanted to of their various conference rooms, etc. I do have to admit, though, that the whole conference \/ meeting area isn't so bad - well taken care, good restrooms, and easy access to outside.

The restaurants are lackluster, the pool is ok, the rooms are whatever, there are male cocktail servers, the show in the sky thingy is fun to do once, the random girls dancing around the casino floor on platforms are amusing, etc.

However, I can never set foot in the Rio without thinking of one particular night a couple years back - and this pretty much sums up what the Rio is like. Left unattended when my friend went to the restroom, I was approached, whilst sitting at a slot machine playing (and wearing a rather conservative outfit), and asked "how much?". Yeah, seriously. I move to another location. Same guy, same question. Move again. Same thing. Move to the bar and tell the bartender. "Oh yeah, that guy. He does that all the time. That's just kind of what happens around here." I was at a loss for words.

So yeah, can't say I would go out of my way to patronize the Rio. However, I can't really quite give it just 2 stars either. And hey, if you are in the market for a lady of the night, I guess the Rio is the place for you to prowl.

My husband and I decided to stay here on our way to San Diego.  The young man that checked us in was awesome and I wish that I had gotten his name because I would write a glowing review to his boss.  

We were upgraded to a suite in the Masquerade Tower and it was 1600 square feet big.  Upon walking in to our suite I felt as if I had been transported back in time to the 70's.  Even with 1600 square feet of space I felt like I couldn't breath in our room.  It felt old and dirty.  I could not relax, I actually felt like crying...our room did not have a good feel to it.
Great hotel. Very clean and nice rooms. And also very quiet. Stuff is friendly and helpful.

As many may or may not know, this used to be the place to stay back in the day. They were the first to have all their rooms super sized and hence called all their rooms "suites".  The rooms are pretty generous with their sizing. The rooms we stayed in this trip have been redone, but many are still looking tired and old.  

The hotel was in quite a disarray when we arrived as there were two fires in the masquerade tower the previous day and the sprinklers had flooded many of the rooms making them unavailable to use. They placed many of the guests that were supposed to stay here, but were relocated to other Ceasars properties on the strip. 

Considering all the craziness we were still able to get our room located in the Ipanema tower, as that tower was unaffected by the fire situation.  

The drink service on the floor was very lackluster as many of the servers decided to call out and were not replaced.  

Overall, many of the Caesar's properties lack the general routine maintenance with their pending bankruptcy still not resolved. 

Many of the hotels are now charging parking on the strip. Things are changing here in Vegas and it's just not the same as it used to be. It may be best to just avoid all strip properties and get a bit more of a bang for your buck.

The room was spacious and well appointed with a lovely view. However, I was disappointed by the $15 charge for WiFi. And by the $10 per person extra charge to use the pool(s), of which there are four -- one adults-only, one closed, one freezing cold and one that was overcrowded until it closed without notice at 5pm!!  All in all, it is hard not to feel like you're being taken for a ride. Oh, and there's no coffee in the room.  

(Also, there are nearly-naked women all over the place in the casino dealing cards, serving drinks and just sort of gyrating. You'll have to walk your kids past them when you go to see Penn & Teller. But, hey, if that bothers you, maybe Vegas isn't your kind of town.)

Rooms are comfortably big, but on the old side. Double beds, comes with a small living room area, a restroom and a separate additional sink\/closet area. Like typical (finding a trend here)vegas hotels, we found the housekeeping to be mediocre! Found a lot of trash and wrappers under the bed and other hidden places. 
The pool area offers many pools which divides the crowd and I like that. The beach area is nice but rough sand and freezing cold water but nice shade and waterfall. The pool closes early- at 6 pm!! Probably because by that time the whole place is shady, lost all the sun to keep the pools warm.
Buffet is decent, we purchAsed the 24 hrs buffet. However, front staff aren't knowledgeAble of the hours of the buffet so we missed breakfast bc they told us it didn't open until 11 when in fact they did serve breakfast from 8-11!! They also gave us the run around when we inquired about prices of the buffet. They really have zero clue until u reach the front counter of the buffet but there isn't a direct line and no one offered to connect us for the right answers. 
If you enjoy zip lining, they offer that from one rio building to the next. Very high but you're sitting in a seat with a partner.
The arcade area is KISS theme, the rock band. There's also miniature golfing available but mostly adults play in the game room. There isn't much to do in this hotel if you have young kids other than swimming and buffet. 
I do recommend getting the pina colada for $11 at the buffet because it comes with a souvenir cup and tastes perfect! They offer the same cup and drink at the pool for double the price $25 and refills are $12- ridiculous! So get the cup from buffet for $11 And then u can bring it to the pool for refills during your whole stay! 
Overall, it is a good stay. This place does not charge for parking (yay to that!) and offers free shuttle to harrah's and paris. However service for valet and bell desk are slow compared to other hotels.

Rooms are beautiful and spacious. Great restaurants and buffets. Be aware of the $100 resort fees. Zip line is available here too. Great casinos . It's truly a pleasure staying here. I have no complaints

I love Rio rooms very large suites. enjoy the swimming pool, and hot tub. in Jan. 2013 I won around $700 off the Wizard of OZ slots this summer not as good winnings. the only thing drinks at the pool bar very expensive 

The waitresses, and staff are very nice always a cocktail around the corner when you gamble this casino is excellent love them comps.

I came here during the Life is Beautiful festival. The prices in Vegas were unusually higher this weekend due to the iHeartFestival happening as well. I found a really good deal to this place online and was very hesitant to book this place. First reason, this hotel is OLD! I remember staying here when I was very young. SECOND, it was off the strip. 

I made the best decision by staying here, because the rooms were renovated and there were a lot of new additions that have happened such as new restaurants, an added zip-line, etc. 

I would definitely recommend this place if you don't care to stay on the strip and if you are looking to save a little bit of money. 

One star less for the swimming pools not being fully open. 

Now, I need to have a reason to come back since I forgot to cash my $100 chip :(

We really enjoyed the room it was big and spacious. One issue was with one of beds the bed springs were completely worn out.  But my major issue is, we placed our reservations over the phone part of the payment was charged at that time of the reservation. The other portion would be charged when we arrived and check in. We were told No additional charges would be charge if we would not be charging anything else to the room.  We didn't charge anything to the room but on the day of check out we had a fee $16.80 (room fee). We called to the front desk and no one could explain the charge. We received several different responses 1) it's because we called the reservation instead of booking it online 2) It's because we booked online instead of calling in. No one could explain why that charge was not applied at the time we placed our reservation.  In none of the conversation we had with had any rep were we told of a fee of $16.80.  I believe this should have been disclosed.  Has anyone else experienced this? I feel they need to be up front about the fees.  We already paid a resort fee and room fees.  I feel it's pretty messed up to get a fee of $16.80 that the workers are unable to explain.
Bad costumer service at total rewards center, didn't give all information on tier credit points to redeem gifts
great customer service from von !!!!!!!!! when i picked up tickets for penn and tellrr

My hubby and I booked Sept 28 - Oct 1 for my birthday celebration as well as both our first time experiencing Vegas. We had a wonderful experience! They easily pulled up our Groupon reservation and checked us in even though we were hours late. The bus boys were so helpful and quick with our bags. We even extended our stay another night. It's more of an older crowd as were in our mid 20s but it's close to the clubs and we had a great time in the casino! Clean, good size rooms, good views, good food!

This place gets 2 stars instead of 1 star because of the price.  

Probably one of the cheapest hotels you can stay at (off the strip).  The rooms are huge and have pretty nice views; however everything inside the hotel\/room\/casino looked like they haven't been replaced since the hotel opened.  Everything seemed old and outdated.  The decor needs a facelift.  The lights in the bathroom didn't turn on, showering in the dark was fun.  Didn't bother calling the front desk because that likely won't accomplish anything.  Front desk reps were rude and didn't really seem to want to help.  

I'd only go back if I didn't have to pay for a room.

Stayed here with my son over the weekend 11\/24-11\/26.  It was the worst stay I have ever had in Las Vegas.  The rooms smelled of smoke ( and we were on the 26th floor).  When checking in the girl at the front desk had a blank look on her face and as I asked questions about staying there and the high resort fee, her only response was "it is a standard charge" no real explanation,  Why do I want to pay to use the internet and my cell phone is a HOT SPOT!

They never came to clean our room and when we checked out I asked why, the check out girl who was as blank in the approach as the girl who checked us in said we asked for a food credit. No we didn't, and no one advised us of a food credit.  Her response?  Well I read here you asked for a room credit.  BUT I DID NOT!  the blank check in girl gave me something I did not ask for.  I 

I wanted my bed made and I wanted clean towels.  For the price and the unrefundable - unquestionable resort fee, that should not be too much to ask.

I HATED MY STAY!

We decided to stay off the strip this time around. We wanted to relax more, without all the crowds. Plus the rooms were a lot cheaper, so we put the extra money we saved on a rental car. We drove everywhere, so we didn't have to walk as much. It was pretty cool, because it didn't take us forever to get to one location to another. Especially when we went out at night, instead of getting a taxi, we hopped into our car.  
I was very pleased with the room, it was fancy, but huge and comfortable compare to other Vegas trips I have been on. Only problem was that we booked for double beds and they were only able to give us a King bed, but there was a pull out couch. 
The food choices was okay. We went back on the strip to eat though, but the bar at the pool was pretty cool. The pools wasn't crowded like the other casinos, plus they had a DJ playing music and the bar was open. It was a nice day at the pool.
When I come back to Vegas, I'll come back to RIO and stay, if I want to rent a car.

The WORST hotel to have stayed at. I highly recommend staying somewhere else if you can afford it. Let's start with before check in, you're immediately harassed by some person in a tux trying to get you to sit in on a time share seminar or something. Mind you they're in the most trafficked areas like the check in and the elevators and they'll try to harass you every day. Check in\/out is exceptionally horrendous with at most 2 to 3 clerks working it at any given time. You WILL wait at least 30 mins before seeing one of them. Our initial room was trash, there was a hole in the wall where the door stopper should be, the door latch was coming off its hinges so I'm sure someone with enough force could've opened the door, and finally they apparently had an issue with their water systems and shut off all the hot water to our room and some others. The desk clerk (the 3rd one I called) was completely clueless as to why we still didn't have hot water (when she was assured by the "engineer" that we had hot water) switched us to a new room. So I had to go down to the main area to get a new key card and behold, the problems continue with all 8 elevators not working at all. I had to climb down 8? flights of stairs and then go through the entirety of the fire escape route to get out of the building and walk all the way around the complex to get back to the main entrance with all the other guests like Mary Jane E. When was the last time this place was inspected? This new room was decent besides the fact that someone was drilling (which the even more clueless desk clerk said there was no authorized construction anywhere near my room) and the screaming from the people riding the zip line. This was all topped off with the fact that I only came to this hotel to see Penn and Teller to be told that there were absolutely no tickets available for the duration of my stay and there are no amenities for hotel guests get first dibs on the tix. Speaking of shows, we went to see Zarkana which was at the Aria and the shuttle system Rio has is dumb. It is 2 buses that either drop you off at Harrah's or Bally's which are within walking distance of each other. Somewhere further down the strip like Aria or Excalibur would've been way better. This all came to a head when near the end of my stay I had been comped $50 for the hot water fiasco and then they tell me I had to pay for the stuff I had bought using that $50! I wasn't having it and made them check the supposed "notes" one of the other clueless clerks put in with my room or whatever outdated technology they use because this clerk that was trying to charge me tried to get all nasty with me by cleaning off her garbage from the computer monitor and then turning it around to try to show me I still owed them. I bet she felt like a true idiot (I could see it in her face) when she finally looked at the "notes". Thanks Rio for ruining my vacation, I will not be staying here again.

Where do I start???  I am a big fan of Las Vegas and had an amazing weekend.  I usually stay at the Rio, because it has the best priced suites and a shuttle that takes you back and forth to the strip.

We usually go play some craps, hit the slots (getting as many free drinks as we can intake, well not really free because we tip nicely) and then hit the clubs (somewhere else).

Location: It's off the strip, but the shuttle comes every 15 minutes, so not a big deal.  Plus its close to the Palms, where we like to party.

Atmosphere: It's nice to sit around, get some drinks and have a live show perform for you.  We will mess around with the slots, drink a tad and watch the singing\/dancing show in the sky.

Food: Best buffet in Vegas!!!  The cafe is also good and has great service.

Price:  Awesome.  Great price for the size of the room.  Buffet is expensive, but it's worth it. 

Value Tip:  Get a players card and you can receive points for future comps.  Gamble, Gamble,Gamble and you will love your stay!

Overall: I want to give it 5 stars, but I had a bad experience the moment I got there.  The valet guy was a Doche and we (almost) got removed from the hotel for our costumes.

Stayed here for 3 free nights on a strip view suite. Super comfortable beds and giant rooms with plenty of amenities. Casino is pretty good and the location off the strip was nice because the traffic was not too bad. Recommend staying here.

Yes this hotel may be outdated and not necessarily as some may be looking forward to in Las Vegas, but for 30$ a night you really can't beat it. Room service took awhile but the staff was always extremely nice. Pool was pretty cool too as it's covered with sand on the bottom and beach themed

I was part of a group that stayed at the Rio from 7\/22 - 7\/25.  I booked a standard room for my husband, young daughter and mother to stay in.  We arrived at the desk a little after 3:00 p.m. and the line was quite long.  It took us about 25 minutes to check in.  Our room was on the 16th floor of the Ipanema tower.  The rooms were large, but nothing fancy which was expected as our room was comped.  We had a mini fridge and it felt too warm to keep perishables in.  It was a bit of a hassle because they are not self-adjusting and we had to wait for maintenance to come and lower the temperature to keep my mom's medicine cold.  The room appeared clean, but on the last day (thankfully) I did notice a huge pile of dirt and grime in the corner of the bathroom.

The pool area was great!  One pool has sand around making it appear like a beach.  They have waterfalls which were a hit with our daughter.  The middle pool is just a standard pool and the third pool is like the first without the sand.  The pools are all shallow with the deepest being like 4 feet or so.  The only problem we had was that the pool area closes at 7 p.m. which is rather early in Vegas standards.  It makes it difficult to spend the day on the strip and come back for an afternoon swim.  The sandy pool closed at 6 p.m. and they turned the waterfalls off at 6 p.m. on the other pool too.  It does open at 9 a.m. so you could always do the pool first and then explore the strip in the afternoon as it is definitely hot enough to swim at 9 a.m. in Vegas (in July at least).  

I would suggest renting a car as the Rio is quite far from the strip.  They do offer a shuttle service that runs to Bally's and back.  The first time we walked by, it was full and people were standing and waiting.  The second time there wasn't as many people, so it's hit or miss on the shuttle crowds.  If you are renting a car and staying in the Ipanema tower, make sure to park in the smaller parking garage (3-story) as it is much closer to the rooms.  

All in all, I would stay here again if the rooms were comped or priced the same as it was for my friend who didn't get her room free ($30.00 a night).

We have stayed here many times since the hotel was new.  It is getting a bit long in the tooth...time for a facelift.  Duct tape on frayed carpet edges reflect some of the deferred maintenance.  TV in the room needs to be replaced, the display was too dark to view.  Caulking in the bathroom needs to be repaired. Room service trays were left in the hallway all day.  Elevators were slow and some not working at all. Interesting shops and clothing stores have been replaced by junk trinket shops.
Sao Paolo cafe service was GREAT!  food was mediocre, cold waffles and toast two days in a row.  Kudos however, to the manager at Sao Paolo, Airrion, for rescuing my Saumsung tablet I left behind accidentally.  Thank you Airrion for putting it safely in a drawer til I retreived it.

We'll be staying elsewhere on our next visit.  This property really needs a do-over.

Stayed at the Rio because it was fairly cheap and have had a good experience here int he past, but you get what you pay for. Dirty shower, a refrigerator that is not level so it tips every time it is opened and closed causing the cabinet it is in to be worn away at the bottom, beers in the room that taste like they have been there for a long time and food all up and down the hall my room was in from spilled room service trays. Will stay elsewhere from now on.

Horrible experience staying here. We are in Vegas often, this was the first and last time I've stayed here. Staff was rude. Rooms are outdated dirty and not like the pics. They're called suites but are not very suite like. The room was dirtier after housekeeping than before. All in all terrible experience. Stay elsewhere!!!!

Very disappointed. Won't stay here again. Stayed here only for WSOP. Front desk service slow. No coffee in room. Room stunk. Key did not work twice on different days. Filthy head boards. Old pillows. Waited 20 minutes for valet, so we self parked. When we returned to our car, we found a major dent in the door.

I really wanted to give this hotel 5 stars but we had a slight bad experience. We arrived Thursday night and everything was great. The front service was great, everyone was nice and the room was good until we noticed a stain on the chair. Straight looked like blood! Gross af! Then, Friday morning we left our room to walk the strip and all that. We arrived back to our room at about 4 or so to discover our hotel door wide open!!! We knew we hadnt left it open bc We put the do not disturb sign up. When we walked in the room, our beds were made and all of our stuff was moved around. My friends credit cards and purse contents were all over the place and out of place. I couldn't believe they left the door open!! Thank God nothing was taken from our room. I'm thinking, would Rio have replaced everything? 

Anyway, I went and asked the housekeeper that was further down if he had cleaned the room and he said no and I told him I needed to speak to someone about this situation. He said he would send his supervisor up. No one ever showed up. So later that night, we were taking a nap (mind you we had the do not disturb sign up) and the housekeeping people came and started knocking obnoxiously!! Like, can they not read or wtf? Lol We didn't say anything and he walked right on in! Asking if we needed anything? I asked him if he was the supervisor and he said no. No respect for privacy. I tried to talk to someone during our check out of this but that got me nowhere pure transparent apologies. (I didn't want thing think free or anything but at least a manager so I could express my concerns!) 

Anyway, the rooms were big and nice (besides the bloody chair lol). I liked that they have a free shuttle for hotel guests that takes you to Paris, Bally's or Harrah's. The shuttle comes every 30 mins or so. I honestly don't know if I'd stay here again. It's sad bc I'm a total rewards member and was so excited to bring my friends and family to the hotel bc I had heard nice things but I don't really feel like getting my stuff stolen or woken up after a night out lol we will see..

So, I've stayed here twice and that will be it. I got a deal for discounted rooms both times but tbh I don't even think the Rio is worth it at a lower rate. If you are opposed to indoor smoking, this is NOT the place for you. If you are for a relaxing shower and a sink that drains properly, this is NOT the place for you (the shower is practically the end of a hose). If you want a club in your hotel that has a bomb DJ, this is NOT the place for you. The DJ really was certifiably awful, cutting things up too soon and in places and with other songs that just did not work. There were literally dead silent moments between songs. Wat? The bartender was nice, though. That Witch Doctor drink is NOTHING to play with lol split it with 3-4 people of you want to see straight by the end of the night. If you're in the market for a LOT of walking, like clear across the hotel to get from your room to the shuttles or almost as far for the spa, buffet or check-in desk, this IS the place for you. Seriously there is nothing within 3 mins walking distance from the Masquerade tower. 

The pluses are the rooms are quite large, the masquerade tower provides great views, the beds are VERY comfortable, and the spa was relaxing (though of course strip hotels have MUCH nicer, more extravagant facilities). 

Don't ever pay full price here and don't expect to be able to breathe downstairs. Pay a little extra to be on the strip in luxury.

This is a bit long for a Yelp review so I'll put the juicy bit up front: 4 stars to the Rio for keepin it sexy, with the naughty cocktail waitress outfits, the newly revamped and more sexy carnival show, and for the ladies a lot of cameo appearances by Chippendales dancers.  There is always something to see here.


* * * * * 

Ok so now the dull part:

About the poker room here.  It's a small room that was renovated a year or two ago, clean and well run.  The WSOP in the Rio convention center obviously overshadows it, but there is some good spillover into the cash games here late at night.  There were about ten full tables of no limit (1\/3 and 2\/5) going at midnight.  Not as much drinking going on as I would have liked.  

Here is a hand I played last night, sorry that this is a bit long, it's from a report I did for a poker site I post at, but it may give other players some idea of the action to be had here when the wsop is in town:

The 2\/5 no limit was a very tight aggressive table with a lot of tough players. Average stack was about $1000 with two guys well above that. I sat down with $500 and limped in to a few hands, not hitting much, mostly just observing these guys. I picked up 9d8d on the button and limped in for $20 with 3 other players. The flop was 10d8c8s, which I very much liked. The first player to act thought he'd take down the pot nice and quick with a $40 bet. 

As I was thinking of how much to raise him the player immediately to my right, the big stack at the table raised it to $80. That surprised me. I honestly had no idea what to think about that. He had a lot of chips so it was very possible he was making a move. After due consideration I called his bet with the hope of improvement in my hand in the form of a runner runner flush draw or straight possibilities. 

The initial raiser mucked quickly and the turn was the Q of h. Big Stack looks at it for a lil bit and bets $200. It didn't take him very long to bet. 

A problem I had with this hand is I hadn't been at the table very long and didn't know enough about how these guys played. I should not have gotten involved in a big hand this early, since it was possible this guy only bet monsters. But as the big stack I assumed he was pushing people around a lot, and I was not going to call away half my stack at this point, and I did have the inside straight draw. So I went all in for $400 on top of his bet. 

Obviously at this point I was also hoping that my trips were good. 

They were not. He called and flipped over Jx8x for the better kicker. I had ignored all of the signs that this guy was very strong and followed my trips into quite the trap. I knew he was strong but could not lay down my hand. The river was the lovely Ace of Spades and so the kicker issue became irrelevant and we split the pot. 

I am including this in this thread which started with me whining about flopping a big straight and being run down by a lucky caller, to show that luck can come full circle I suppose. Nice to be the one sucking out on this one. 

Last comment, now that I think about it, the thing that really bothered me about Big Stack betting big was there was no flush or straight draw for him to be betting, and he seemed like the type of player that would do that. Which led me to think he had the other 8. And a better kicker. Which he did. And I called anyway like a fish, lol. And then got lucky.  Ah poker.

This place is disgusting. Staff is fairly friendly  but 5 star party stained rug. Tiles falling off the wall in bathroom.  You think with money spent giving you three new bars of soap each day they could afford to give you more than two sheets on the bed and maybe a blanket in ipomea tower.  Also disconcerning hearing front desk offend a 50+yr woman at check in desk when inquiring  about preferring to stay in a room without an adjoining door.  Concierge told her she was a pretty lady so apparently it was a privilege to be harrassed by neighbors who racked on walls and stuck fingers under door all night. Thanks Steve, you're a class act.  Casino pretty good. Definite better bang for your buck elsewhere.

Stay away from the sunday brunch buffet. We waited an hour before getting sat and they were picking and choosing who to sit first. People with the same number of people in their party as ours but were behind us were seated first. When we asked why the cashier guy said maybe they didn't like your picture (upon entering the buffet you have to have a picture taken. Not sure why. You are not offered a way to have the picture given to you or sent to you. You can not even see the picture taken. They don't ask any info just demand a picture of you). The food was very poor quality. And they didn't have it very organized.  There was breakfast in several areas not just one,  they also had Italian food mixed in with the asian food. Three times we found dirty dishes in the clean dishes. Eggs were runny (literally like water) and the spaghetti  was cold. champagne was good and the waiter was great. Everything else... Horrible. Everyone in my party also got sick within an hour or so after eating, sitting on the toilets more than the tables.
Absolutely great show!  Sammy, Dean and Joey are VERY good, but Frank NAILS it.  Come and see this show!

The place is not well kept at all. The first hotel room we stayed in, we had to move out of after one night. I called the front desk and asked to be moved and was asked why? There were several reasons, tile was missing from the floor in the bathroom (actual chunk of tile missing), the safe didn't work, the front door lock (the security one you can flip closed) didn't lock, the wallpaper in the bathroom was gross and faded from water splatter (maybe wallpaper doesn't belong in a bathroom if you can't upkeep it!), the shade for the lamp was all wonky because it had been bent back into place instead of just replaced, the shower barely put out enough water to get the soap out of my hair, and there was a weird spot (blood?) on the ceiling above the bed. All in all, it was like a cheap motel 6. Sure we could have "upgraded" to the samba rooms that just were remodeled for extra $$ per night. The rooms we stayed in were not the older rooms, they were the rooms that have been redone in the last few years but obviously not up kept. 

The hotel did move us rooms, but still had issues, The security lock on the door still didn't work. Also, we were there for a conference and apparently the boilers they have for hot water are insufficient because good luck getting a warm (let alone hot) shower during normal shower times because it won't happen. The hotel is also in need of a good scrubbing, the light fixtures shouldn't be hairy with so much dust.... Ick!

Stopped in for a little gambling, Voodoo Steak, and Penn & Teller = great night! The casino area and property are gorgeous yet comfortable and fun. Good ventilation in the casino, did not walk out smelling like an ashtray, hurray! Friendly helpful staff.
