The steak was cooked to perfection and very flavorful. The waiter also came by and gave us a GIGANTIC slice of red velvet cake, for free!!! (i guess it was extra?)

Make sure to use your Total rewards card at every restaurant because you get a discount!

The pool area, called VooDoo Beach, is really fun. They have 4 pools and plenty of room. Lots of places to sit. There's also a place to get some decent food and two bars! One of the pools is 21 and over which is nice because there's no kids. But, men have to pay to get in that one. It is fenced off and private.

They have a rooftop lounge which provides a fabulous view of Vegas. I think it was only 10 dollars a person -- don't quote me on that, but I don't remember it being overly expensive at all. It was not very crowded or "hopping" but the view was definitely worth it to take some pictures and stuff.

I give the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 because I feel like the hotel could use a renovation as far as style of the rooms...it's pretty outdated. Also, when you go to pick up your car from Valet in the morning, it takes foreverrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr.

The first impressions of this hotel were terrible - we had to wait almost an hour to even check in! After we got to the reception, the woman tried to give us a bigger room but with a view on mountains, not the city (which we reserved). After a bit of haggle and searching, she gave us the room we wanted. But she also charged us for 28$ for services and we didn't even really know we accepted to that - we were really exhausted and it was getting a bit late. But after a bit of struggle to find the elevator (it's really a big two-building hotel), we got to our room - and the view view really stunning. Everything there was clean and I liked the way the room looked. The only downside of the room was that there is a shared door to the other room and you can easily hear the noise from there. The waiting line, the 28$ fee and the fact of no free wifi unfortunately made this for me a 3-star stay.

I LooooVE this hotel!! The workers are so friendly and helpful. We have stayed there 3-4 times. Last time they gave us a super room, I don't even know for how much it was but we paid for a standard room and they gave us a room which was like 1000 sq feet with a Jacuzzi. Actually there were two rooms in one suite. Also they serve the best free drinks...They taste really good, not crappy like in other hotels. OK, it's not a fancy hotel but it's a really nice and affordable place. Thank you.

On 2\/22 we had a company retreat in Rio.  We have reserved 16 rooms and checked in all at the same time, paid all by a company credit card.  There were not only room charges but also other charges like ball room, meeting equipment, beverage, and so on.  While believing we have paid for everything, today 6\/6 I received this collection call from a collection agent.  His name is Nelson.  He said that it is reported to credit agency that $72.00 was unpaid.  All the 16 rooms and all the expenses, thousands of dollars were paid, and $72.00 was unpaid???
I paid for it.  Then I called in to the billing department trying to figure out how the mistake happened and trying to find a way to remove it from my record.  The lady in billing department was very rude and talked like I am someone trying to steal their money.  She totally ignore the fact (and refuse to check) we have already paid 15 other rooms with one credit card and all 16 rooms were checked in and out together.  Rio made a mistake and send me to collection without at least trying to inform me.  That event cost $5,000 and were all paid for.  I don't understand why Rio believes that I am not paying $72.00 but have paid all the other rooms and expenses.
This is a bad experience.  If you go to Rio please make sure you get your "Paid" invoice after you check out.  That part was my mistake to trust RIO.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would! I hate the lack of customer service it's absolutely ridiculous! In this economy with so many people out of work I'm sure Human Resources could do a better job of hiring people. Jeffrey the supervisor of registration is a total jerk! I reserved a room to attend my brothers corpsman ball with my family. He missed his ceremony in December since he was in Afghanistan. I booked my room to Kayak for one night & when I got to the hotel to check in I was told I didn't have a registration. The girl wouldn't even check my reservation number I asked for her manager he was even more rude they told me they had been sold out & I needed to call Kayak they were unwilling to do anything. I know now that this was a Kayak error so beware using that website but I would have appreciated more help from Rio. I will never book here again this hotel sucks!!

I should've known better since I booked this hotel with what seemed like a deal for Vegas prices. Yes we checked in on a fight weekend (wasn't even Pacquiao or Floyd) so I anticipated some delays but this place was ridiculous. After driving around in circles for bellhop services, the VIP bellhop guy finally took pity on us and helped unload our bags, which included all our toddler items. Check in line was just as bad but thankfully they had automated kiosks. If I would've known I would've just waited in line to speak to a person and requested the Ipanema tower. We got assigned a room on the 15th floor of the masquerade tower. I didn't even care that it was old and outdated. I did mind the very inconvenient way you had to course to a maze like path just to get to the floor to take the elevators to our floor. Well I guess it is off strip and one of the older hotels. Lesson learned and will not be booking this place again.

Not even sure where to start with this review. I'd give this hotel zero stars if possible. First off, I booked a room with a view of the strip. What I got was a room next to the elevator with a view of the roof of the building. I can hear the elevator whizzing by at all hours of the night. Also, the door has a lock where the privacy switch doesn't work. What does that mean? Well, when you decide to leave the room and close the door, the switch swings around in a full circle because it's loose and malfunctions. Meaning, the door thinks it's in privacy mode and doesn't allow you to get back into your room with your own key. I learned this the hard way. 

Had a security guard show up when I called the front desk. He had no idea what was going on. So he called for back up. Back up came in the form of an EMT worker. He had an override key. He was able to open the room door but he didn't know what was going on. His explanation; door needs a new battery. Wrong answer. They submitted a "work order" which never was addressed. We were on our way down to the front desk to find a solution when a different security guard saw us and asked if we needed help. I had to repeat the story again. As I'm explaining it, a floor manager walks by, looks directly at us and keeps going. Doesn't stop to help or try to fix the situation or move us to a different room. Nothing. Anyways, security guard number two came up to our room and explained the privacy switch situation. He said he would submit a work order and should be resolved in 20 minutes. Did that happen; NOPE. Came back two hours later and still not fixed.

Called front desk for an update, was on hold for 20 minutes, she said someone will come by shortly. It's been another 20 minutes and still nobody came. Seems like they all lie here and give us the run around just to shut us up. Paid a bunch of money for crap service. Will definitely be taking this up with Rio management. And Curtis at the front desk says there's no manager at 2:30am.
The Rio is an older hotel with old Las Vegas style. They have a show called "Show In The Sky" with singing and dancing. They throw beads and you can catch them.

One of the worst hotels in Vegas. After booking a room on-line, when arriving we were surprised with a fee for wanting to enter the room early, even though it is an option given on-line. However, we were told no room was available. It wasn't until we complained that a room miraculously became available; go figure! Upon arriving in the room we found a clogged sink, toilet paper that is one grade lower than sand paper, and fewer amenities than you come to expect at all MOTELS.  

After leaving for several hours the next day, the cleaning service did not make it to our room so we just got towels from the cart so we would not be subjected to disruption. The worst part was the fact that one of the four elevators was working so people were cramming into the elevator & the hotel "security" didn't seem to have an answer as to what was happening. Incidentally, if an emergency did occur, this "security officer" would be of little to no use. Poor man, he needs to be sitting at a pool himself. 

Needless to say, go elsewhere. If I could give a half star I would because one full star is too much to give. A true disappointment. 

In addition, when walking by the shops, I don't want to be disrupted by shopkeepers asking if I want a sample of their lotion. No, I don't because if I did I would go in and ask for a sample. By intentionally annoying me I would never purchase anything from that shop no matter how badly I initially wanted whatever it was!

My husband and I came to Vegas to celebrate my birthday. We originally had booked the MGM Grand, however due to hurricane Irma our flight got delayed and the MGM Grand couldn't accommodate our new dates since they are booked because of the fight.  So we scrambled to find a hotel and came across the Rio.  

I have to say that based on the reviews I read I wasn't expecting very much and honestly a little worried.  We checked in yesterday and are checking out on Monday.  Upon arriving our room wasn't ready so we hung around and came back at 3.  Check in at the kiosk was simple and a breeze.  They even gave us coupons to use around Vegas.  Once we got to our room we were very pleased.  We are staying in the Deluxe King Mountain View.  The room is very spacious and clean.  It has the feeling of a studio apartment.  Our view of the mountains is nice, however being on the 4th floor of the Ipanema tower also comes with a view of the roof. Not the best.

The casino is much smaller than most on the strip but has it's charm.  Very easy access to Ride share where you can pick up a Uber or Lyft.  We used this several times so far to get to the strip since the Rio is located off the strip.

My only major complain is the bed. The mattress is not a plush pillowtop that other casinos provide.  It's basically a box spring mattress that is hard and a bit uncomfortable. We have been waking up sore, but the water massages by the pool help with the muscle aches.

All in all I am not sure why there are so many bad reviews for this hotel.  For the money you spend it's a great option and a nice hotel. I would definitely come stay here again and maybe upgrade to a different room in hopes the bed will be better.

Worst place I've ever stayed at for my Vegas trip. My friends & I will for sure never ever consider Rio as our hotel stay for a Vegas trip ever again.  However, most employees (such as housekeeping & the servers) were super nice & helpful. So here's my experience at Rio:

1st thing we noticed when checking into our room was the animal urine\/piss smell. So I dialed "0" for the front desk to report it.  All she could say was she'll send housekeeping to clean it for us. (Wtf can they really do to "clean" the smell other than to spray air freshners in the room just to mask it?) So I told them we wanted another room... She wouldn't give us one & even insisted that we can upgrade to another room for extra charge. (They gave us a room that smelled like pee in the first place.) So I even resorted to request for a "smoking room" cause we'd rather smell smoke than urine. But she said that we'd still have to wait til the next day to transfer us to another room. Meaning we'd still have to sleep in the "urine" room for one night.  Then she tries to tell me that it's been raining the past few days in Vegas & that's why we're smelling this stench & that it's from the humidity.  Such bullshit! 

So we stuck it out & slept in this room for the night.  Since we were only staying for 2 nights we decided to stay in the room because we were too tired & didn't want to waste time packing & moving our belongings to another room. (Keep in mind also that front desk never bothered to check on us.) The following day we realized how ghetto the room really was. 1) The room stunk of piss. 2) The bathroom toilet paper holder was broken. 3) Black electric tape covered over light switches because the switches lights up orange in the dark. 4) Found disgusting pubic hair in the shower before our first shower in that room. 

I really tried to enjoy my stay at Rio by exploring their casino & other entertainments. But what pushed me to the limit was when I was playing the "Big Wheel" game.  A female server approached all the male players asking if they needed a drink. But she never once asked me if I wanted anything and I was thirsty AF. I confirmed this by asking the other male players if she had come by to ask them for drinks & she did. So not happy at all with my recent Vegas experience.  

I might come back to try their famous seafood buffet or watch a show. But I will never book a room here again.
Still fabulous place. Great food, plenty of slots and table games. Another MS Stud would be useful. The seafood buffet is incredible. Neat shops and plenty of bars.

She's like an aging beauty queen.  30 years ago she might have been the hottest thing in down town, but now she's run down, haggard, and perpetually reeks of smoke.  Even by Vegas standards, this place takes Cheesy to a new level.

Rooms are nice, great restaurants and buffets inside the hotel. the shuttle service is horrible. They said shuttles run every 30 minutes seemed more like 45-55 minutes, never were they 30 minutes. In my opinion it's not worth it because you literally have to be the first ones waiting for the shuttle in order to get a seat or else you wait another 45 minutes for the next one. Also, walking to the strip is almost impossible since you are just above the freeway. If they had better shuttle service I would book again, otherwise I'm not interested.

My 13 year old daughter and I stayed here for two nights because we were attending a conference. The conference space is good, lots of smaller rooms for breakout sessions, and the main rooms for dinner\/keynote are spacious and well lit. The restrooms are well kept and properly stocked. Conference food was about what you'd expect, acceptable. Staff was friendly.

It is a pretty tired hotel. Just about every lampshade in the accommodation corridor was broken\/cracked, like someone had punched them all. The carpet was fixed with duct tape. We were in room 1129 in the Ipanena tower. The shower in our room had two settings - a lot of water, and really a lot of water, like being hosed. Standard of cleanliness was ok, but when the walls are marked and the carpet stained, it's hard for anyone to make it look really clean. The windows needed cleaning. The curtains were off their hooks in several places, and were hard to open and close. We found the beds comfortable enough, and the sound proofing was ok. The room was large and spacious, and the bathroom had a separately located sink, which was useful.  

We found the guy on the check-in desk to be rather frosty. He didn't give us a map of the hotel, which we begged off the concierge later. Check out was better - we opted for email receipt and were able to leave our bag with the bell hop.

The ground floor is full of casino tables and slot machines as you'd expect. You have to navigate through these to get to the hotel area and the food outlets. We ate at the Chinese restaurant on our first night, which was just about ok - rather a lot of MSG, and the chicken with cashew nuts literally had six cashews in it.  Breakfast on first morning at the Hash House A Go Go, pretty standard breakfast menu, large portions, nothing special. Breakfast on the second morning at the World Carnival Buffet. We had 90 minutes to kill and nearly ate ourselves to death. That was good.

Being off the strip is a disadvantage if you have portions of time to use up. During the day on Saturday we took the complimentary shuttle over to the strip and were able to be tourists, looking at The Venetian and other hotels. We had to wait 30 mins for the shuttle back. On Sunday we had a couple of hours we could have used for more tourism if we'd been closer to the strip, but we didn't want to rush or risk it. If we came back to Las Vegas for vacation, we'd definitely go to a hotel on the strip. I also think that this is not a particularly appropriate hotel for a minor: A few too many exotic dancers among the tables.

Shuttle is horrible late, staff is unaware where it actually picks up, the rooms are outdated....like from the 80s. The sink backed up first night and was never fixed....I would never recommend this hotel. Its off the strip and not worth the money even of on the cheap side

I have stay at The Rio two times a year for the last six years. I would have to say that the Rio is lucky that WINN comes here. I'm constantly u satisfied and even infuriated with the service and their "A" class service! Wrong- sorry Gary Selesner.... The Rio might as well be the motel 5, oh no wait- motel 5 YOU CAN GET COFFEE IN YOUR ROOM. 

Also- the banquet staff is horrible. No one know anything. Do they not have captains and leads?

Saw the World Series of Poker here. A little boring to watch, but exciting to see players throwing down 2 million dollar bets.

I played my first black jack table here. Which was amazing! Our dealer, Mabel, was very helpful and patient. She took into consideration that 2 out the 3 players were newbies. 

I can see myself staying here on the next excursion to Vegas.

The suite was nice.  The view was wonderful.  The employees and customer service were great.  The only problem was that music could be heard late at night.  We were on the 37th floor so I guess the music was coming from the Voodoo Lounge.  I guess this would not be a problem if this was our going out Vegas trip.  This trip was our relaxation, early show trip.  We still had an enjoyable time.  Love the Diamond Lounge here. The fact that the Rio offers a free shuttle to the strip is great!

First time staying off the strip...
Casino- good amount of machines and tables the waitresses were very attentive and super friendly kept the drinks coming 
Suites- nice and spacious our room was very clean and well kept, bathroom was a good size it also had a separate area with a second sink and mirror to get ready which was a huge plus
Overall- a good deal but I would rather pay extra and stay on the strip my next visit just for a more party atmosphere

Booked a deal on Groupon and let's just say I will never go there again. Where to start?
Checking in, they charge a $22.00 fee for checking in before 3:00pm. (2:25pm)
The rooms are dirty, grungy and smell funky! Found a cockroach in the closet and called down to see what they would do about it and got attitude from the operator. Air conditioner did not circulate the whole room and when me and my family where there while it was 116 degrees out having it set to the lowest 60 degrees it still felt like it was 98 degrees. Called down to the operator waited on the phone for 15 mins to inform me that a technician would be dispatched to investigate. 1 hour an 30 minutes later the technician showed up and stated that the air conditioner was working just fine. The slot machines were tight and they Stopped doing the ship show apparently 5 years ago. Beds felt like they were 25 years old and belonged to my 10 year old son. I have Many more complaints but figured if you read this entire post that you would get the point. I would never go back!!!! Not a happy customer or tenant.

The staff with the exception of the bartenders was outstanding. DO NOT DINE HERE!!!!!! Food was fair to shitty, I ate everywhere, but Vodoo.  Room was clean and functional. Casino could have used two more crap tables during prime time. Dealers were pleasant and helpful.
 Unloading and loading is a cluster fuck, if you drive in. The bell staff is competent and helpful. Which offsets the pain of the loading\/unloading experience a bit.

Great deal but lacking the Vegas experience.

This all-suite hotel offers rates similar to those on-strip hotels except you're getting 600+ sq ft of space.  The space, the double sinks, extra fridge, shelves, floor length mirrors, etc. were definitely appreciated but I just couldn't shake this large studio apartment feel off my standard suite.  I was still pretty happy with the hotel until I drove over to the strip and was reminded of the crowds and bright lights.  The Rio was just a little too serene for the hustle and bustle I wanted out of Las Vegas.

There was a blackout during our stay at the Masquerade tower.  All the lights went out as soon as we opened our room door.  I sorta thought that it was us who short circuited the place!  :O  So glad we were able to get into our room because the hallway was completely dark without any emergency lights.  We called front desk right away and they sent out security to investigate, so they said.  It wouldn't have been too bad if our room wasn't right next to the emergency stairway and we heard all the banging of the staircase and talking from everyone who was walking down.  That was very loud and scary.  We did not hear from front desk or security again.  We tried to call front desk a while later for updates but was put on hold rather indefinitely.  I suppose there's nothing they should do but to get the problem fixed ASAP as any announcement would just cause unnecessary panic.  The ordeal lasted about a couple of hours.  :(

Our first experience at The Rio was the check-in line.  We waited for about 45 min just to get to the end and be told that there were not enough rooms ready.  They said to come back in 2 hours for a room.

When we finally checked in I was thoroughly impressed with the room itself.  It had a wonderful view of the strip (backside of Bellagio and Ceasers) and was spacious with a king bed and sectional couch.  The TV had a line going down the middle of it but we barely used it anyway.  The mini-bar was expensive ($9 for a Keurig coffee cup) but I guess that is standard in Vegas.  There was a separate mini fridge available so we could store water bottles and beer we purchased at a grocery store nearby.

I thought the amenities, bars, restaurants, and casino floor were very nice.  I think the piece that was most lacking was an engaged hotel staff.  The check in\/out process was not terribly friendly and staff we spoke with were not very knowledgeable about hotel policies, events, and hours.  I've had better experiences with hotel staff at airport hotels.

Overall, I feel the amenities and atmosphere are worth 4 stars but the customer service brings the overall experience down to 3.

Avoid this hotel unless you must have a bed because bad weather wont allow for outdoor sleeping

It is bad beyond imagination: rooms are smell & leaky room, rude staff. They call their rooms suit because by Vegas rule, if the room is 600sq ft, they can call it a suit. It is just a room w old furniture

What is great about the Rio:  The room size and lay out.  The rooms are larger than standard strip rooms, and now the price point makes this place a great value.  It is off strip - but barely (by car or taxi).  There are shuttles run by Caesar's Ent to it's strip properties - so you can save a little on taxi's.  The pool is still great but it now has been upstaged by other properties - MGM, Palms, Hard Rock and Mandalay Bay. 

What is not so great:  The staff attitude and food quality is mediocre.
This hotel has the worst service. If it were not for hosting the WSOP it would probably have to file bankruptcy as no person in their right mind would stay here otherwise.

I went here for my birthday last year they have a great buffet, I loved it, especially the red velvet cake, so good. Sal the restaurant manager was very nice and took a picture with me. I can't review the hotel as I never stayed here, but I am sure according to the other review that it's very nice. If I am in Vegas this year for my birthday I am trying to get back here again for the buffet or go somewhere else in Vegas just as awesome :).

Clean, but showing it's age.

We stayed in the Masquerade Tower.  Our room was large, with a couch, had a fridge (in addition to the honor fridge) and a room safe which I like so you can have a place to securely lock up your winnings (HA!).   

The carpet had a big stain near the entrance and the sofa had a few small stains as well.  There were also cigarette burns in it.  They also haven't upgraded to flat screen TV's yet (at least in our room).  

The bed was on the firm side and slightly uncomfortable.  I found the pillows also firm and flat.  Needless to say, I didn't sleep well.  

A weird thing, but both rolls of toilet paper only had less than and 1\/8 of the roll left and there was no spare. You would have thought at least one of the rolls would have been changed.

Went to the Seafood Buffet, which is another review.  

Played a little in the casino and did OK.  Also walked next door to the Gold Coast casino the next morning to play.

This was weekday so we didn't see any of the overhead shows they do in the casino, but I've seen them before and they are fun and free!

In the end, except being a little far from the strip, (they do have a shuttle to take you to Planet Hollywood), it was OK.  Would like to see them upgrade their rooms in the next few years to help make it a fist class hotel, but then, who goes to Vegas to spend time in their hotel room?

They should call it the Rio All Stains Hotel and Casino. 

First of all, they are not ALL suites. Just because it is a little bigger and has a couch, it is not a suite. Suites have separate spaces. 

The reason for the snarky all stains remark? Stains....everywhere! In the elevator lobby, in the hallways, on the frayed carpet in our room, on the ceilings, on the couch, on the SHEETS. Our supposedly fresh set of sheets had what appeared to be old blood stains, vomit, or coffee. Either way, disgusting and unacceptable. I called housekeeping and they did not apologize but one of the maids came and changed them out within an hour. However, our regular maid does not vacuum and steals change. There was also sticky stuff stuck to the carpet right in front of the sink.

During one of the busiest times of the summer (WSOP and BCA\/CSI pool tournaments) they allowed an elevator to be broken for 2 weeks and another broke a few days ago. They finally fixed the recently broken one, but that other one seems to be like the elevator on Big Bang Theory....perpetually out of order. This caused a major jam and sometimes it would take 15 minutes to catch an elevator up to your room and 10 minutes to get downstairs because it stopped on every floor. 

It was our first time here in Vegas, so we went to see the other hotels on the Strip. Wow. I was impressed by those other places, with their good variety of restaurants, features and shops, non-reeking casinos and cleanliness. I was a little disappointed  when it was time to hop on the free shuttle back to Rio, (the only amenity I know of besides soap).

I could keep going about the hotel fighting us to pay waived resort fees, the Strip View being a view of the railroad tracks and air conditioning fans, serving raw hamburger in the Billiard Cafe, or not having running water for 5 hours, but I'll spare you those details. I'll end with the only positive: the day spa. The women there are super nice, treat you like a queen, and the services are top-notch.

That being said, I will not be staying here ever again.  But, I may visit the spa while staying somewhere else.

I have no idea how this place is rated 3 stars. Ive been to vegas 3 times. We try to stay at different places to check out new hotels. But by far this is the best hotel we have stayed at.

Pros 
Huge rooms
Huge bed
Safe 

The have a shuttle that stops at 1am and circulates every 30 min.

FRIDGE!! Weve stayed in other hotels way more expensive. They have no fridge. Your in vegas for goodnes sake you need a fridge  

Spa services need to relax you get to go once each day you stay it was amazing. N they have delicious drinks in there.

Wifi some hotels still have dial up wtf ?! Lol

Cons:
Its off the strip. Some people might find that a bad thing but i really enjoyed it. It was all drunk party people on the strip and you got to experience that but then you go to rio and you feel like you were away from all the craziness but still in vegas. 

Its a bit hard to get around. If we left somethin in the car it was a mission to go get it lol. 

Its so great you really need to check it out.

I was pretty disappointed. The check in line was long and they did not have any seats around for the other people who you are with to sit down and wait until you check in. I didnt see them accommodate the seniors while they wait in this long line. I also notice a manager or supervisor come from the back and walk around without helping the other employees with the line. They could have had two more employees to help with the line. When I reached my room called guest services for some toothpaste and the woman on the phone was really nice but it never was sent up. I am long checked out and I am still waiting for the toothpaste. The room needs some work as the walls in the bathroom needed to be repaired from the water or moisture.  The beds were very comfortable so I would probably rate this place a 3 to a 3.5 but not a 4 at all.

I stayed here with my 2 dogs (allowed 2 dogs to stay in your hotel per night) and my fiance 2 weekends ago and really enjoyed it. It was my first time coming to Las Vegas w\/ my dogs so I really didn't know what to expect.
When I first got here a little after 4 pm on a Sunday, there was a long line trying to check in, so the wait was probably about 20- 25 minutes until I had my chance to check in at the front desk. 
The lady who helped me was pretty friendly and answered all my questions. (by the way, you can pull up to the front of the hotel and try to get the bell hop to take your luggage to your room, but on the day we arrived, we were told it would be at least 1 hour for our luggage to arrive to our room because they were really busy since a big group of people for a conference had just arrived). 
Anyways, we stayed on the 4th floor (people staying with their pets stay on either the 4th or 5th floor... make sure you ask for a room that is further away from the elevator if you have dogs like mine that are easily distracted by noise). The room was really nice and big, with plenty of room for the 4 of us (I forgot to mention that the pet rooms also come with 2 free cute little dog bowls for your pups). We had our choice to have either 2 queen size beds or 1 king size (we opted for the 2 queen so that our dogs could sleep on the other bed). 
The restroom was very nice and big. There is a vanity mirror right outside of the restroom and I loved that the restroom and the vanity mirror area had it's own separate sinks. There is also a little fridge to store our bottled water (make sure you bring some water with you if you come to Vegas in the summer) and snacks. 
The hotel itself is a nice place with 2 great buffets and a place for your to gamble away all your money. Also love the free Show in the Sky. The pool itself is nice and big and seemed pretty clean while we were there.
But I didn't like that there was no free wifi! (Honestly I was a bit shock that pretty much all of the hotels on the strip and off did not offer free wifi) I also didn't like that the pet relief area was a bit of a walk from our hotel room (but I believe all the other hotels here have their pet relief area far away from their rooms as well). Also would have liked the pet relief to be shaded and\/ or covered. But did appreciate that there were bags available, along with trash cans. 
Overall, I really enjoyed staying at this hotel with my dogs because I felt like the hotel accommodated us well. We had the option to either not have housekeeping come into our rooms or pick a time for them to come in. We were able to get a room that had less traffic (much further away from the elevator) and request for 2 queen size beds. We were even given 2 dog bowls and a few extra bags upon check in. We had no problem walking with our dogs in and out of the hotel. I would totally come here again the next time I travel with my dogs.

Recently stayed at the Rio. It was a great experience.
We were able to get a suite for $50 a night. The suite was large and comfortable.
Buffet is one of the best we've had.
There is a shuttle to Paris and Ballys.
The breakfast buffet across the street at Gold Coast is only $5.99.

The place needs major renovations! So dated, carpets are old, worn out and bit smelly. Room decors are so old. Resort fee is outrageous for $35.00 which you have no choice but to pay when you get there.
Won't stay there again

This review is specifically for"GANZ"- SECURITY at the RIO, I was here as a new hire for orientation,  as I walked around the casino trying to find out exactly where I needed to be she was the first security officer I seen, I asked her where orientation for new hires should go, she was terribly nasty, she asked where I parked? After I answer she said I was not allowed to park there & I had to go back & move my car. I asked her again if she could just point me in the direction of where I had to be, & she ignored me & walked away, I called after her where as she started running away from me, all I wanted to know was her name. As I had to run to catch up to her I asked her name & she lied told me "Larry" & covered her badge, which I had already seen. She continued to run up to security as shw noticed I was walking towards them & whispered to the other female who said I couldn't park in the garage & needed to move my vehicle. They called out a supervisor who was just as helpful as them, yes, that's sarcasm, he said they were right I was in the wrong area & had to go back to my car & drive to valleyview & twain. & that's the information he told me. 
I am very embarrassed to be a new hire with this chain of company who have people who don't provide quality service to not only guests, but to fellow co workers of theirs. What we have learned in our orientation,  & the service I was given by all three of these sercurity officers & 1 being a supervisor fell very short!! He continued to tell me that it was my fault & how unprepared I was for not knowing where I was going. As if this was something I didnt already know. I know, I will NEVER RECOMMEND this place to anyone in the future, for this experience with all 4 feet MRS. GANZ !!! Thanks for a horrible experience in your hotel, I will never be back !!!

I visited Las Vegas in the off-season (February) and found that it's one of the best times to go. It's not crowded and a lot easier to get around through the crowds both in the hotels and on the streets. 

Rio was a decent hotel, though I would probably try to stay elsewhere in the future. The beds are comfy, the towels nice and full, and the water pressure is so good it almost shoots you through the wall like Kramer in that one episode of Seinfeld. The room service was tricky though, as the three times we called down for it they were operating on a 1-2 hour wait. We only ate at the Grand Buffet and the American Grille. Both places were just ok for where and what they are. Nothing great.

The pool area was lovely for lying in the sunshine, but I imagine gets crowded with a full hotel. The desk and bell staff were all very friendly and helpful, as were most of the food servers. Every single person greeted me with a 'hello' as I passed them in the halls, from the housekeeping staff to the bellmen and room service servers. 

Everything is expensive, and that's a bummer (but I guess it's like that in a lot of the Strip area). $14 for an Amstel Light and a Bloody Mary, for example.

I chose to stay in the the Rio because I was in town for the WSOP. The Rio is obviously not a preferred hotel for me, but for convenience I chose to stay there. As I hate most of the food options at the WSOP, I bring my own food and supplies with me to keep in the room. I had a large bag filled to the top with Tupperware, silver wear, plates, cups, vitamins, etc. It was all kept in a brown grocery bag by the refrigerator in the room. On the second day there, the housekeeper must have taken the bag out of the room, (I'll assume mistakenly, although I can't image how anyone could have thought a bag filled to the top with all that stuff was garbage). In any case, I filed a security report and they said they would get back to me. After not hearing from anyone in a couple days, I went down to the front desk to speak with the manager. I was received by Cheree, the hotel manager on duty. I can best describe her as a character right off the Jerry Springer show. Sure enough, all I received from her was a lot of attitude, and was told they spoke to the maid who denied taking anything from my room. She said their investigation revealed no wrongdoing, so too bad for you. They offered nothing in compensation. Frankly, the value of the stuff taken wasn't so much, probably $200 to $300, but I was now going to have to waste a morning of my trip driving around to replace everything. They could have offered a free buffet or two, maybe waived a few nights of the resort fee, or something. But no, Cheree just stood there relishing in the fact that she could stick it to me on this one. In poker terms, the Rio is the nut low.

3 Stars at the most would be all that the Rio would get from me! I got a chance to experience the Rio this past weekend that my cousins visited for the Mayweather fight weekend! This hotel was only chose because it was apart of a package that was booked via expedia I believe. Even though I know we checked in on a insanely busy weekend I feel that's no excuse to have less than enough staff working the front desk to check in the guest. We stood in line for at least 45 mins no lie... Anyways to add insult to injury as soon as we get to the front a girl behind the desk tell us "oh I'm not taking anybody else right now sorry.. Then we go back to the front of the line only for another representative to walk away from their window as well?? wtf where is the customer service around here? After check in was complete on our way up to the room that was located on the 3rd it was alllllll the way at the end if the hall '___' if you are looking to do Vegas on a budget this place is good however be prepared to have your walking shoes ready because it's located OFF the strip you will need to take a taxi because it's too hot to be walking any long distances in Vegas! The carnival buffet is good but it's not the best..

For $49 a night, this place was a steal! I was in town last week for the Megadeth\/Motorhead concert down the street at the Palms. Seeing as I didn't wanna drive too far or take a cab to the show, I decided to book at the Rio. I had previously stayed a couple of times before and had pretty good experiences. The room may have felt just a tad bit outdated, but it was still a great deal considering how much I was paying.

Pros:
- Very spacious and clean room, even if just a bit outdated.
- Front desk was very nice and courteous, both during check in and check out.
- Friendly staff.
- Hotel is right next to I-15, so there's easy highway access.
- Complimentary shuttles to the strip.

Cons:
- Not too great of a dining selection. You're probably better off finding mom and pop restaurants down the street.
- Off of the strip. This normally means you'll run into some sketchy individuals and some scary areas.
- $20+ charge for checking-in early.

This place is amazing! The rooms are clean and loaded with amenities . It helps to upgrade to a room a little more then your basic room. You won't be sorry. I will stay her ever time we come to Vegas . The only downfall is EVERYONE IN THE CASINO IS TRYING TO SELL YOU SHIT. They dress like casino employees and will sell you there first child if you will give the a measly $125.00. It's crazy.
The best buffet in town.  There's a reason why the locals brave the tourists and come here too! ;)

My wife and I went to Rio for a short vacation. This hotel is run down and not what it used to be. First Rio does not have the show above the ceiling. Which I use to enjoy watching. That is sad=T. 
Customer service is not good either. The first room we had had a wet carpet floor, so the front desk gave us another room. Room 664 did not have soap etc. I had to call front desk to get soap. The hotel is outdated and needs new carpets. 
Upon checkout we had to pay a resort fee of 18 dollars per night plus a 12% tax rate which could not be waived. Even though the rooms for two nights is suppose to be comp. There were no signs , front desk did not even tell us there is a resort fee , etc. What is the point of a free couple of nights at Rio if you still have to pay for a resort fee. Complimentary means free not HIDDEN FEES!  

To put this in perspective .... The Gold Coast Casino which is next door DOES NOT charge you a dime when they give you complimentary nights. Gold Coast staff is friendly, have good restaurants open late at night, and provides shuttle services. And oh yeah...they have signs all over the front desk telling you there is a resort fee of 9.99 per night so you are aware of the fees. 

The good:
They have a free shuttle that takes you to the strip every 30 minutes until 1am. Hotel is outdated but is in ok condition.

The bad:
Resort Fees are hidden.
Not friendly front desk.
Not not on the strip.
Hotel is out dated.
No good places to eat late at night in the hotel except Burger King (Yuk!).

Would I stay here again? No way! I rather pay alittle more for a better hotel.
They have the best buffet in all of Vegas. It's pricey but if you are starving, have a good appetitie and want to eat a bit of everything.

Hotel Room:
Stayed here over the weekend, room 7007.  This room had two queen size beds, side by side with a view of the desert from the masquerade towers. Also an "L" shaped couch.  A mini-fridge accompanied the outside sink which paralleled the mirrored sliding doors for or to a closet.  This room also had a restroom, nothing fancy mentioning about... I'd say overall an average of 3 stars.

Casino:
As for the gaming goes, I give it 4 stars, for the slots to the poker tables it lacked people and variety or which i like to call "flavor", the choices of slots were the usuals and old fashioned;  Texas Tea is an old one but its actually one of my favorites.  They also had a new version on it called the Texas Tina but didn't pay out. As for the Poker room, only had 3 tables all $1\/$3 no-limit.  All the other games were the standard games.

Buffet:
Carnival something. I'd say this one is the better buffet out of the seven available for 30 bucks. Got to try out Caesars and Planet Hollywood as well.  Make sure u put it on your rewards card because that bracelet is a pain in the ass to have for 24hrs.

Overall, it was fun so 4 stars.

I only gave 2 stars because the pool is nice. Unfortunately the hotel is crap the rooms are old the walls had holes and the bed linans where tattered. The furniture was broken it was just horrible. The Flamingo is cheaper and 100 times better. I will try to download photos.
Interesting during the wsop event only for me. It would not be my first choice otherwise. They raise prices exponentially during that time frame.

We arrived shortly after 6pm at the rio Las Vegas (after a 7 hour drive). We tried to use the self check in kiosk because the line was LOOONG to check in with a front desk clerk. Only two people were working with about ten people in line (and growing). The kiosk checked us into a room, but would not print out keys and asked us to stand in line. Kind of a hassle, but not a big deal. 

After 15 or so minutes we make our way to a very stressed out woman who finally went behind the counter and asked to help us. She prints our keys and we make the long walk to the room. We used the keys she provided to open the door and IT IS SOMEONE ELSES ROOM THAT IS STILL CHECKED IN. Their belongings are EVERYWHERE, they obviously weren't planning on leaving. But we got checked into another room!!! Luckily these people weren't there at the moment, but imagine if they were! Seeing people use a key to open the door to your hotel room. 

When we went back to the front desk, the same woman just gave us a new key... said we should be "understanding" and that the kiosk is the source of the issue, not her double checking the room we got checked into before printing out new keys. She didn't apologize once, or try to talk to us, let us speak to her, answer any questions or offer any answers besides "it's the kiosks fault, they're new". , She didn't even offer SOMETHING for the inconvenience of being checked into another persons room, she handed us new keys and walked away. No apology, resort credit, room comp, tickets to a show, discounts or coupons to anything offered on site, or even a LATE CHECK OUT was offered. 

I totally get it's stressful (and I work retail so I know) but it was handled horribly. In most customer service industries you try to compensate people for errors on your part (whether you personally or something at your place of work, machines, etc.) but we received none of that at the rio. 

It was a terrible experience and when I tell people about how we weren't checked into another persons room, given keys, and offered NOTHING in return, they're appalled. Many San Diegan's frequent Vegas during the summer for a fun get away but I'm telling everyone I know about my terrible service at the Rio.

I stayed here with my family quite a few years ago when my dad was extremely insistent on eating the infamous Rio seafood buffet not once, but twice on the trip.

As much as I love seafood, this was just a tad of an overkill. I think I stopped eating shrimp for a year after this trip. I don't remember the hotel casinos and lobbies much because this was during a time when I was immensely confused as to why Las Vegas hotels were different and I could never find a clear path between the lobby and the elevators but I do remember being comfortably situated in the armrest chair in our suite while being very uncomfortably over stuffed with seafood.

Rio is a bit of a walk. Yes, we actually walked from Rio to the strip.  This involved crossing a freeway, not as much fun as you would think it is. I wish we rented a car, but renting a car in Vegas is almost pointless since for the most part most people confine themselves to a walkable distance within the strip.

What does this mean for you? Don't stay here without a car unless you expect to hike up your trip with cab fares from the Rio to the rest of Las Vegas.
I liked it. Sorry I don't have more than that. But it was a nice big room and had lots of things to do like the zip line and Penn and Teller.
Crummy customer service. Crummy businessmen. Plenty of other people to give my business to in LV

When we arrive no valet service because the lot WAs full, when I booked the room I thought the room was remodeled but the gave me old room, I wanted upgrade room paying extra for new remodeled room but room was not available. After 2pm the hall was too loud and next door neighbor was too loud crying, yelling, fighting so call security but nothing happen.
This is the worst experience I ever had in Vegas..
I would never come back to this hotel.

Hotel has no concerns to their clients....

Meh. I used to love staying here. It was my favorite hotel and sometimes I wouldn't even leave the whole weekend. Now, I can't really stand to stay here. I do like the rooms, because they are good sized "suites." However, they are getting really dated feeling now. Also, the non-smoking rooms are not. But does this really matter much? You get soaked in cigarette smoke if you spend more than a nanosecond in the casino anyway. 

But what I do like about this place, and it's why they got 3-stars from me, is the rest of the hotel. Although I can't say much about the shops upstairs. These are always overpriced and I never shop at them anyway. The restaurants and wine bar are awesome though.

My brother got married in vegas and we stayed for one night in the masquerade suite. 

The suite itself was very big, and had plenty of room for the 15 people who came to hang out before going clubbing after the wedding itself. 

Note: None of the ice machines were working during our stay. After the wedding, I needed ice badly, and went to three different floors to find it. Finally, I called the front desk to wait on hold for 10 minutes, before hanging up and calling room service. I explained to the lady that I needed ice as all the machines were broken. She said sure, $5 a bucket.
Are you telling me that you are going to charge me $5 (outrageous for ice) per bucket, when I normally would get this IN ANY OTHER CASINO OR HOTEL --- for free??? You have ice machines, and blatantly know that none of them work.

Ridiculous. Especially for someone calling from a suite. This is unacceptable. 

The people staying here were extremely ghetto as well. I will never book another room at the Rio again. What a bummer!

Our stay at Rio this time around was definitely a better experience than last yr... And that may be because we didn't have our dog with us. 

We booked our room through priceline and was pleasantly surprised to find out that breakfast was included. Breakfast can only be from Starbucks, which works since they have breakfast sandwiches, fruit, yogurt and drinks! But you only get $9\/day - per person. Just have to make sure you tell the barista to charge it to your room and show your ID. 

Our room was located all the way at the end of the hall, which was a pain at first but had the best view of the mountains. And unlike our last stay, we had a coffee maker AND trash cans! 


I still like the fact that we can bring our little guy with us, for an additional cost and a smelly room, but leaving him at home with a friend is definitely more comfortable.

There may have been a time when the Rio was a decent place to stay. Based on my experiences the past four years, this was a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away. It's convenient to stay there during the Star Trek convention, but every time I have problems that make my stay miserable.

This past trip (August 2014):

We learned that the bartenders at Shutters and Masquerade were rounding up charges! For example, if you got a receipt with your beer, it showed $7.11 .. but they charged $7.25 or $7.50. Long story short, I worked my way up to their SVP of Legal who said it was NOT a corporate policy to do this (even though I found out they don't have small coins in the cash drawers ... hmm) and it was an "isolated incident' even though more than two dozen people confirmed my findings. I think they get enough of our money, but to cheat us as well? Reprehensible.

1. Tiny closet with four hangars in it.
2. Called housekeeping for more hangars, took an hour to arrive, and some didn't fit the closet rack.
3. No ashtrays in a smoking room, and when requested, took 90 minutes for them to arrive.
4. Air conditioning return duct was clotted with dust and filth (allergies went off the chart as soon after I arrived)
5. Overall room is mediocre ... I asked for a great room based on prior year issues, and they gave me a Mountain View King Samba Suite. It looks like it was decorated by a sightless, color blind person. Not the "fabulous" room I was promised.
6. They call them suites, but really it is a slightly oversized hotel room with a wall.
7. Don't look behind the TV\/refrigerator cabinet unless you like viewing dirt and dust from the Reagan years.
8. A refrigerator! Great!! Except it froze all the food I put in there.
9. Minibar was not serviced before I arrived, and there was a half-eaten Rice Krispie bar in there from the prior tenant.
10. "High Speed Wifi" is not what they offer. Speeds are slower that dial up! If you are tech-savvy: I ran a speed test and download speed was 1.5; upload was .75. Yes. POINT SEVEN FIVE!! (Run a speedtest.net on your own and compare.) When I complained they admitted they had to upgrade their system. This is not only atrocious but false advertising - especially as they are aware of the issue.
11. Tub stopper broken


These are just the issues I recall. Basically, unless you are spending less than $50 a night at this property, you are paying too much. I'm  never staying there again.

I have never stayed at this hotel and I have gone to Vegas more than 30 times in my life. It is a very decent hotel. The weekend we came... Rooms were like $35 a night. That's really a very affordable room and this hotel has its perks. Service was great. They even have shuttles to take you to the strip since this is off the strip. We never once had to use our car over the weekend. The shuttle run until 1:00am and it picks up every 30 minutes. There's a Starbucks downstairs, the masquerade bar is nice if you don't feel like going to another hotel for drinks. I loved the Voodoo Steakhouse. Fancy and affordable for fine dining. I highly recommend this hotel.

Rio has very slow elevator, when it's busy you may need to wait for a long time.
we stayed at the honeymoon suite. it has two living room and 1 dining room.
the Jacuzzi bath tub is almost in the room because there no wall between the bathroom and bedroom. separate room for toilet and shower. and one more half bathroom in the living room.
this will be a room I want to come back for.

Massive suite-ness!  So much elbow room (yeah, that's it, "elbow")!  Rio be overlooking the main hotel, the pools (one of them shaped like a fish), and the West side of the Strip!

We stayed Sunday night (the 20th) and it really is a beautiful thing when it's comp'd.  When I think of a standard (average to above-average) hotel in Sin City, this is what I would imagine.  Instead, it was a no frills reality.  It's not shabby, but it's not fancy schmancy either.  In other words, way better than Bally's suites, similar to Paris, but not as good as The Palazzo.  

I wonder if their buffet is still one of the greatest..  Anywho, cheers to free and super quick shuttle service to and from the Strip (7a - 1a)!
The sleeping room in the new tower are better than old tower. The meeting space is beautiful and newly remodeled.

In all honesty the Rio isn't a 5 star resort by today's Vegas standard. But however for each time I've stayed here on my own accord or with TR members the staff has been terrific in making us feel like VIP minus 1 check out. It gets the 5 for continuing to stick to it's marketing approach and win or lose I don't feel like I'm getting jacked at the tables.... so kudos all around

The price is right at this hotel, especially if you go mid week.  Got bumped up to a corner suite that was absolutely incredible, went to the Voodoo lounge and it was a blast, and the prices are great.  I would recommend it to any budget minded travelers.

I'm writing this while I'm standing in line to check in. It's midnight on a Thursday and 55 minutes have passed. I've estimated that there was a hundred people or so ahead of me and now about down to 25 left with 3 desk attendants checking folks in.... I'd like to give zero stars but not the app requires at that I leave at least 1 ...

This past Thanksgiving was my first stay at the Rio and it was really good. The staff was really friendly and greeted us when they saw us arriving. The hotel receptionist was actually nice and didn't get upset with my many questions. The rooms were very nice, we ended up with the basic room which was still a suite! My only complaint about the room is the bed, it wasn't the best bed I've slept on but I'm not saying it was horrible, I've just had better at other Harrahs owned hotels. I really like how their casino is spread out so it really seems big but it's just the design. You get free entertainment near the bar at the masquerade tower, the bar tenders will show off their flare tricks and every hour after 7pm you'll get a show from performers on a ceiling carnival. I didn't play too much on the tables but the dealers were pretty nice and patient. My favorite game there was the new virtual blackjack tables with a video dealer who comments and talks to you. I think it's great not staying on the strip and having free transportation to the strip when you want too. 
Overall, I really like this place and I plan on coming back my next visit to Vegas.

well first off everything that happened inside was great. from the table games to the restaurants and bars everything was good. but a word of warning, dont use the valet service. i entrusted the valet with my brand new lexus is and they left the windows open while it rained overnight. when i got my car the next morning, water had been left standing on the leather. not wanting to run late for class, i wiped off the seat and left. later that night i talkes to the manager sophia who basically told me there was nothing they could do. 

thats not the worst. 

after i got back to LA, I got a carwash, and discovered there was a big old chemical burn on my hood. it looks as if something had dripped down overnight and ate away at the paint. 

yeah, dont trust them with your car.

Thank you Rio for the 5 star treatment.

From my phone call to reservations where they lowered my price from the advertised rate to $20 less if I take a smoking room --
To checking in, and being upgraded without being asked.

So, we're expecting a Smoking Jr Suite, and get a Non Smoking top floor VIP Suite.
It was SMOKIN' -- hot, not smoke filled.

OMG, this is how I was meant to live !! 

Off the strip, yes.  
Well worth the cab ride ( or shuttle) to the strip.

They didn't even charge us for the mini bar -- so amazing, I'm totally
overlooking the pathetic meal we had in the lounge area, and the fact that this major hotel only has this silly retro diner open at 11pm.  
I would think that with all the hungry people taking red eyes to Vegas, that the Rio would have a better late night option--but forgiven.

Hey Rio, we're coming back in January -- what do you say to giving us that same suite-- quid pro, and all that??

I stayed at the Rio when it first opened many, many years ago.  It was a grand resort.  Sadly they have let her fall into disrepair.  She is starting to look old, dirty and neglected.

The staff was great and I always felt welcome so my one star review has nothing to do with the staff.  Management should start a floor by floor renovation and bring the place back to her former glory before they have to demolish her in explosive Vegas fashion.

Coffee Fans beware...bring your own K-cups or SB Via packets.
Keurig machine is in the room, but the K-cups are in the mini-bar at $9 each.

Smoky casino down below. The escalator-going down (by Burger King) was closed for repairs and it was a hassle.

BUT the comfy beds, "Hash House a Go Go", and the pool made this place a memorable spot!

I wasn't expecting this place to be the best of Vegas, but I must say that I was still a little disappointed.

The shuttle to the strip only goes to Harrah's or Bally's, so if you want to go to the other side of the strip (i.e. Mandalay Bay, New York New York, etc.) get ready for a lot of walking or taxi riding.  I would actually encourage riding the taxi if you have a group of 3-5 people because the ride to either end of the strip is only about $10 (about $12 w\/ tip), and that's not too much off from if you were to take a shuttle and tip a couple dollars per person - plus there's practically no wait time for a taxi.

Some of the shuttle drivers were ok, but one in particular did not let our friend on with a small roller bag.  We told him that we had come on with bigger bags the day before and he basically told us, "Well not on MY bus."

Pool hours are only 9 AM to 6 PM so if you have your heart set on a night swim or hot tub, don't stay at the Rio.  Also, it's $22 for a day pass to the gym.  I don't know if that's normal for Vegas, but it made me a little sad to not be able to work out before going to so many buffets...

The Carnival World Buffet was only okay (still think Planet Hollywood's Spice buffet is better), but I will say that  this buffet's dessert section was pretty amazing.  If you try the Carnival buffet you HAVE to have one of the little fruit tarts at the dessert section.  My friend asked me what I thought the cookie base was made of and I told them that they must be baked with magic...

Rooms are definitely not as big as they're made out to be.  With it being an "All-Suite" hotel, we thought that the place was going to be huge, but it seemed like just a slightly larger regular room with a couch.  My friends and I were running on a budget, so we shared six to a room (two to each bed, one on the couch and one on the floor) without many problems, but I still don't know if I'd call it a suite.

KUDOS to Ben Domidico!!!!  What a treat...we were completely lost and he took the time to walk us to Hertz in the casino.  Unfortunately it was closed (was supposed to be open until 3pm and we were there at 1:30).  So shame on Hertz, but awesome job to Ben!!!  He's a keeper!!!

Stayed here with this past weekend...

I knew this was an older hotel but still decided to stay here regardless. The rooms were very large compared to other hotels I've stayed at. The beds were comfortable and the view was great. The big plus and something that I really liked and appreciated about this hotel was their toiletries. They not only provide the basic lotion, shampoo and conditioner but they also had a dental kit with a toothbrush, toothpaste and mouthwash ! And that's not all they also provided a shaving kit, which included a razor and shaving creme! How awesome is that ?! This is the first time I've seen this and it's the most common things that I always tend to forget! The get huge thumbs up for this. 

The one thing that did make me upset was that when we arrived after going out on Saturday night they had "too many" cars in their valet and we had to self park. They sent us to a parking garage and our truck did not fit in the garage so we had to come back and ask to be sent elsewhere ! So frustrating having to find parking at 3 am when all I wanted to do was get to my room and sleep. 

The restaurant Hash a gogo was tasty. Had their breakfast and the dishes were huge. I do wish they would have told us this when we ordered a massive flapjack for each kid in our party, when all 4 could have probably shared one. 
The buffet was delicious and they and bottomless mimosas that morning, it was perfect. 

I would most definitely consider staying here again.

I had an awesome experience here!! After struggling to find our credit cards at check-in, the front desk attendant upgraded us to a penthouse suite! He told us he was upgrading us to a king bed, but we were in for a big surprise when we got in the elevator to push our floor number!! I found this to be a "magical moment" (like the ones at Disney). The penthouse suite was beautiful!!! The hotel\/casino itself feels much older than the other places on the strip, but it stands out and gives a very happy, Vegas feel! It's a bit far from the strip but nothing a cab or shuttle can't help with! I ended up liking that it was a bit far because it felt more relaxing and less crowded.

I would probably not book with Rio ever again. Although they have a lot of slots and decent restaurants the room was outdated and we got charged an additional $20 per person which is a resort fee. I know it's up to luck but dam their machines were tight not even $20. Service was okay nothing outstanding.

Went to have a mani\/pedi at the spa in the Rio today, and scored when I met Kristine. She is professional, and does great work. She also has an awesome personality. I am very happy with the way she cleaned my nails. 
Go see Kristine! You wont be sorry.
The rooms are great, and they take dogs. We love the Rio. Best Carnival buffet. I usually dont like buffets either.

Only stayed here bc of my convention was here. Would not stay again. Internet slow and unreliable, shower water luke warm with 80s shower head, air not working right and outdated rooms. Also, gave us two queens when we reserved a king. Very uncomfortable especially for the price we paid. However, hotel was beautiful in and of itself with decent restaurants and service. Unpleasant experience, to say the least.

I don't get the bad reviews. I mean, a few broken sconces and you can't muster a 3 star review? Maybe I'm just not high maintenance like these people but when I am driving through Vegas and need to stay a night, I choose Rio. I choose it because it has a great pool, a rooftop nightclub, flair bar tending, penny slots, a Starbucks, and a few good dining options whether you wants some Wetzels Pretzels or an actual restaurant. 

Can I just ask a favor, fellow Yelpers? Stop listing "not on the strip" as a CON. That's your fault for booking a hotel off the strip of you were looking for one. I mean, come on!! Anyway, as I lay here in the soft Rio bed after my perfectly hot shower with well stocked amenities, I couldn't help but giggle at the foot-stomping and childish whining in these reviews. You want a hotel with different stuff? Go there. Don't dock it points because it doesn't fit your mold. 

Free valet, and bags brought to your room in a timely manner. Friendly and professional staff. Not too smokey smelling compared to strip hotels. Great club for ladies, my friends frequent it when we come through Vegas for sure.

I came here for my bday on 3\/3\/12. Sucky hotel. I would always go to the casino & buffet. So thought the rooms would be decent. But they sucked, huge crack on the ceiling above the bed that had been quickly patched. OLD freaking furniture & tv. OUTDATED. floss on the floor. Would NOT stay here again. Oh dropped my cell phone and checked back with security no1 seemed to find it. Security staff were assholes as well.

I do love their buffet though

I stayed here because a friend had  a comped room.  It was called a suite....ummm....it was bigger than a standard room, but not a suite.  Sliders from the restaurant were ok.  The adults only pool was a lackluster attempt to capitalize on the trend.  The rooftop nightclub is the best feature of the club in the summer.  The casino reeked of smoke and many of the gamblers seemed sad.  Once we took the shuttle, and it was more trouble than it was worth.  I'm not sure if I would stay here again even if it was comp'ed.
We had a 4 day stay at the Rio and it was wonderful! The Penthouse is beautiful, the service was superb! All our needs were quickly taken care of!  Woot woot! We will be back!

This hotel is cheap but it's for the reason.
Had a reservation through hotels.com and when I arrived they said there is no room available except at the floor where there are owners with the dogs.

They treated us really bad and we had to leave.

Rio needs to upgrade itself.  Not worth the price to stay.  Only fast food open is burger king, no other fast food, all other restaurants dont open till 4pm so your pretty much screwed on eating till 4pm unless you want burger king.  
No fans or air conditioning in bathrooms. In room toilet paper located on other side of bathroom.
Offstrip, shuttles to the strip are slow.
Seafood buffet is good but hotel guests should get priority seating. Huge lines.
Cool bar on top, not open until 8pm.

BEWARE! The RIO Hotel staff, managers, supervisors, restaurant manager along with hostess', and their security lack customer service skills and any human skills to be exact. I Just stayed at the RIO Hotel from 12\/20-12\/23 with a large party of 12 and had booked 5 rooms. Two of our rooms had a breakfast buffet included each morning for the duration of our stay. We attempted to use this the morning after check-in and was given hell at the cashier at the carnival buffet after waiting in line for 1 hr, another 45 min. wasted on incompetent cashier that didn't understand and for the front desk giving her wrong info. After 1 hr. 45 min, my husband aggravated along with 11 others in the group, patiently waiting to finally eat, when the hostess threw our receipts on the ground after telling her to please hurry up and seat us because of the long wait. She deliberately threw the receipts on the floor and ignored our party and deliberately took the party behind us. Upset and beyond shocked on what occurred, my husband started yelling and raising his voice on what occurred. This brought the restaurant assistant manager Abby, came to the scene defending her hostess and wasted no time talking to us, but rather doing nothing except for calling security and refusing our parties service. All we wanted at this point, was an apology, respect and to sit and eat. She said we weren't welcomed and we had to leave and they would refund us our $. After telling security we weren't leaving all we wanted was to be served, they told us to leave. We were escorted out by 2 security guards that had no regard for what happened in the restaurant and chose not to listen to our side of the story only the assistant manager. They lead our group out all the way to the reception desk as if we were drug dealers or had stole something. The head of security, Richard, was the only sympathetic and apologetic person we saw through the whole ordeal. He advised that he had no control over on the restaurant level and that the assistant manager Abby, has the authority to deny service to anyone. He walked back to the restaurant to receive our refund and Richard remained with us the whole time. We asked him to speak to the hotel manager to reflect on what just happened at the carnival buffet and to receive some type of apology.  Pamela Irion, hotel manager came to the scene and very quickly wasted no time to defend  the RIO staff and saw that we were at fault. She basically said they're private owned and showed no regard for what happened. I told her we were expecting an apology and maybe you as a hotel manager would care about the customer and keeping the customer happy for long term business and would offer our party a complimentary alternative. She immediately responded and said that that's not something she would do and refused. At this point, we were disgusted by the whole ordeal and our  stay at the hotel. We left to another hotel to eat and returned back in the evening and at this time walked by the front desk and asked to speak to a general manager, they told us he was on vacation and settled to talk with another hotel manager, Giacomo "Jack" D'Aleo who right Off the bat talked with a tone of voice that us in acceptable claiming that my husband looked at him in a intimidating way and he could understand why the carnival buffet ordeal happened. We were merely having a normal tone conversation and he was accusing us and again had no desire to hear anything from us. After getting no where with "Jack" did he end the conversation abruptly and we walked our way to the rooms. After about 1 hr., seating in my room, I found a knock at the door....a huge security guard along with "Jack," D'Aleo hotel manager, asking to speak with me. I had thought that after leaving him downstairs he came to his sense and was coming to apologize but in fact threatening us that if anything else happens from myself or anyone in my party that our rooms are considered "TERMINATED".......really! All I know after they left my room, did my party and I come to realize that this was all due to DISCRIMINATION, I urge you not to waste your time and $. Paying a little extra $ to stay at a 5-Star hotel to ensure your family a good time is priceless. Just think of it as discounted price = no customer service!

I've stayed at this hotel three times over the last couple of years.  I attributed my bad prior experiences to the fact that they were renovating.  Now that renovations have been complete for a while, I can state with confidence that it's a systemic problem with the property.

(By the way, calling this place "All Suites" is misleading.  I consider a "suite" to include a separate sitting area from the bedroom; my room was just a large room.  If that's the standard, all hotels are "all suites.")

Check-in is a nightmare.  If you can get the online check-in system to work, do yourself a favor and do it--it will cut your time at the front desk in half.  Sadly, it will not cut it down to near-zero; you'll still have to stand in line, no matter when you get there.  Oh, and if you want to check in early, they'll be happy to do that--for a significant fee.

Although the conference center is nice, the hotel is far below the standards they claim to aim for (and price for).  Despite recent renovations, the carpets are shabby, the bedding (mattress and linens) and other furnishings are cheap and uncomfortable, and the construction workmanship is shoddy (poorly grouted\/caulked tiles, loose fixtures, etc).

But that stuff pales in comparison to what I can only describe is a "chiseling" financial policy.  When I booked the room, I was told to expect a "resort" fee--unfortunately, the latest scam from hotels in Vegas and elsewhere--that would cover services I had no use for, like admission to the spa, as well as bottom-tier internet access.  The confirmation email had three different rates quoted--$18, $20, and $22 per day.  I've also seen $24 and $28, as though they are raising the "resort" fee so fast they can't keep up with what they're telling guests.  Prices at the vending machines on the floors are outrageous--but those are topped only by the even higher prices at the gift shop for the same items! 

The food options...cripes, they far overcharge for substandard quality. You can get much better food elsewhere for a lot less money.

On the resort fee, it took me an hour on the phone, two escalations, and hints at a class-action lawsuit for unfair trade practices before a hotel manager would agree to honor the $18\/day I was quoted.  (In fairness, she did also agree to refund one day of that for my trouble.)

Incredibly, they also attempted to charge me an additional $14\/day for internet access, even though their "resort fee" also supposedly covered that!  

Checkout is nearly as bad as check-in.  Good luck with the online checkout--but don't dare just leave.  Most hotels you can trust to get it right or to fix the problem with one phone call if your bill isn't what you'd expect, but I wouldn't trust these jokers with a ham sandwich.

The bottom line for this off-strip hotel:  Stay far, far away from it.  For the same amount of money, you can find a comfortable room in good condition, ON THE STRIP, with reasonable prices for amenities, and with helpful staff and honest management--just not at the Rio. 

If I could give this place zero stars, I would.

What a dump this once-proud hotel has become. We had a reservation for six nights and arrived at midnight. OK, I understand that even though we've already paid, we got two queen beds instead of one king because of availability. However, when the carpet is damp, yuck. When there's some kind of black gunk on the closet door runner, double yuck. When the shower is small and dank, three yucks and we're out. I'm giving a second star only because we were able to cancel our additional nights on our way out the door, which was a friendly gesture. My in-laws were staying there as well and did not heed our advice to make haste. The second morning they were there, my mother-in-law discovered that the bath water included a lot of black sediment. They left too.

Pros include free parking, a large sundries shop, and very friendly employees.

The casino is no great shakes, and there are no restaurants so unique that I can't find something similar elsewhere. I've already seen Penn & Teller, so I can't think of any reason that I'll ever go to the Rio again.

I like the Rio quite a bit. I have visited before but never stayed. The rooms are a good size and have a large couch as well as double beds. Our room had a window into the shower which was interesting. Rio's not too expensive and is not directly on the stip, however, it is large enough and has several things to do that it can keep you well occupied without having to go anywhere else.

This hotel main theme is All Suites.  But don't  get your hopes up.  The rooms are larger than normal, and that's it. When you think Suites you think up scale.  Not the case here. Very poor excuses for a so called upscale room. Bathroom  is no better than a gas station.

You want a Suite go to a more upscale place. MGM Grand, Caesars, or Wynn.   Those suites are what a suite really should be.  Check in was very good, just what you would  expect.

We ate at the Hash House,  not good.  Next day ate at a Cafe and bar restaurant  in the hotel,  outstanding food, great service.

I would not stay there again. And yes Resort fee $32.00 a day.  Plain rip-off.

I stay at the Rio twice a year for a convention. It's not the nicest in Vegas but it's ok. The staff is friendly. Although the Masquerade tower could use renovation since it's terribly outdated, the Ipanema tower is great. Never had any issues with my room. Wish they had better food choices but I don't mind leaving for dinner. Also, there's not many options as far as shopping.  Can't tell you much about the Casino since I don't gamble but nonetheless I enjoyed my stays.

I actually enjoyed my stay @ Rio this trip. Room was comfortable, spa was fine, food was good. 

The whole Legionella outbreak that happened while I stayed there (which probably explains why I was so out of it when I got back to LA that weekend) kinda brought the whole experience down. Thanks for the letter notifying me that there was a Legionella outbreak Rio!  I know increased resort fees should include costs for amenities but I'll pass if Legionella is one of those options next time.
Rooms are great! Housekeeping did a great job! Prices are a bit high but its Vegas! Had fun here!

I've stayed in just about every hotel on the strip and only a couple off the strip now including the RIO; I'm afraid to say it will also be the last. My husband and I got a room super cheap for my birthday weekend with his reward points and well... You know what they say "you get what you pay for". We pretty much thought what the heck it's super cheap and it never looked too bad since we always visit their World Buffet which has always been awesome so we figured the hotel couldn't be too bad. WRONG!!! First off the rooms need some major updating and better maintenance. The suite we got was pretty big and had a huge long window which we thought "sweet! Good view!" And it would have been except one half of the window curtain was broken and we couldn't open that side at all. Another thing that needs major updating is the plumbing! You can hear water running through one sink if the other one is running and the tub gets filled with water while you're taking a shower and will only empty if you flush the toilet a few times. The mini fridge didn't really work either (didn't really cool things). Walking thought the hotel halls you can smell this weird sewer odor and the elevators get stuck constantly.
