I saved the best for last! When we came into the room we noticed this weird little squared window that gives you a view from the shower into the bed area; I gotta say I've never seen that before and I'm still pretty puzzled about it. So if you visit vegas this is not the hotel to stay at but its great to gamble and eat.

My boyfriend and I have already decided that we won't be staying here anymore and the biggest reason of all was that we were off the strip.
Sure, we both agreed that it was fine to just take the free shuttle service, but after a day of being separated from all the fun that could have awaited just outside our hotel doors, it got dull.

 A few notes:

HOTEL ROOM
-- Decently sized. A bunch of people who want to save money and aren't going to be spending a lot of time in the hotel should stay here.
-- Out-dated. I could also hear the water running through the pipes making a knocking sound run underneath the sink I was at when my BF was using the other one. The bathtub had a leaky spout too. 
-- We didn't even get the room we BOOKED! We reserved a King bed with a view of the strip, instead we got a room with 2 Queen sized beds and a view of construction and an empty lot in the back.

CASINO
-- There was only one cocktail waitress going around in the section of slots I was in. Not fun when you want to get your drink on while gambling.
-- I could do without the random cocktail waitress karaoke performances throughout the night. Just get off the stage and serve drinks, no wonder I can't find you guys!
-- Small in comparison to the other casinos in Vegas.

OH. And they also tried to charge us $45.00 in refreshments when we were checking out, saying that it was all from the mini-bar. WHAT THE HECK!? We just touched it, joking about opening a beer and filling it up with water after we finished it, then putting it in back. They must have charged us for the joke. In the end, they took it off.. but still!? We didn't even have one thing from there.. how are they going to claim we took 7 items?

This place is totally out-dated. I wouldn't stay here, but the buffets are good so that's why I made my way over here from the strip. 

I'm going to write about my experience with their service.
We bought the Buffet of Buffet passes ($45 for hotel guests and $50 for non buffet guests) and the cashier lady is super mean! She's old and cranky and holds up the line. My trip was so good, but her nasty attitude ruined my day for a good 5 minutes. hahah But really, she was pretty bad though. :( You can read my review for Carnival Buffet about my experience if you're interested. 

Anyways, this hotel charged me twice for our passes. TWICE. It was my boyfriend and me so our passes should have cost 100 bucks. I bought it online and then they charged me again when I came to pick up my wristbands. When I was explaining it to them, they kept saying that they charged me correctly. I'm like, so you're trying to tell me my buffet passes caused me 200 bucks? Why would I pay 200 bucks to eat at a buffet? 

We had our email confirmation and everything. The staff have no communication amongst each other and they get all crazy pissy. 

The only reason I gave them 2 stars is because I enjoyed the food, and they "quickly" refunded me after everything was settled.

Save your money and avoid this place!
They don't even have running water in the hotel room. I came back from casino tiredly at about 3am, and I was just trying to take a shower and sleep. and then I found out there is not water! Can you believe a hotel doesn't have water! Even a motel wouldn't let this happen! And the front desk service is the worst, people need to wait in line for more than one hour to check in. And when I called them regarding the no-water issue, they asked me to buy water from gift shop. This place is ridiculous! Pls just do yourself a favor and stay in another hotel.

Masquerade tower upgraded strip view, king mini-suite. Dated decor, but spacious and clean. Can't complain. On a comp.  Recommend Caesar's Total Rewards; best comps.  Checked in at 8pm, room was clean, but noticed a large hand print on the window.

I am sitting here in my room at a casino. Why, you ask?  Because some nimrod cleaning person left one of our sinks full of water. Dirty water. Are you stupid?!  Aren't you supposed to call maintenance so the guest doesn't have to see what an imbecile you are?!  So I called the front desk within 10 minutes of our check-in. After waiting about 30 minutes we decided to have dinner because maintenance still hadn't arrived. I went back to the room afterward, checked the sink and -- guess what! -- still clogged. I called again and they sent up someone again but that person just sucked the water out of the sink. Now I'm about to call for the THIRD TIME because the water sucker told me someone should be by in less than 15 minutes with a snake AND NOBODY SHOWED UP.   So yeah, instead of playing craps I am sitting here twiddling my thumbs. Thanks, Rio. 

Update:  The snaker didn't show up. Called again and now we have to change rooms. So my mom's and my birthday weekend is ruined. First of two nights spent in hotel room waiting and then moving rooms. The guy who was supposed to call back with an update but he didn't so I had to wait on hold FOR THE FOURTH TIME. Found out he changed the room but didn't call me back.  Bellhop is supposed to have been here but isn't. 

I only have one 50th birthday, and Rio, you messed it up royally.

I recently stayed here with family on our long trip in Vegas and I have very mixed feelings about this place. It's easier to write a list of pros and cons than try to explain everything in detail.

Pros:
+Comfy beds. Seriously, these beds were the best I've ever slept in while in Vegas. I couldn't say anything about the pillows because I brought my own, but they were good to hug as I fell asleep!

+Large rooms. Four suitcases and 3 people in one room? No problem! The bathroom had a sink on the outside and inside (they had a dressing room area), so we could all get ready for the day without having to wait long.

+The Buffet is really tasty. Expensive, but worth it at least once.

+The valet people outside are real gentlemen. There was one named Oscar that was just spectacular and he deserves a raise! They ask if you need directions and try to be as helpful and friendly as possible.

+The pool! So warm and inviting, I wish I could have swam more this trip. I would love to come back to go to the European-style pool (aka the Topless pool) so I can get a nice tan!

Cons:

+FINDING A FECES COVERED WASHCLOTH IN MY BATHROOM. EW. EW. EW!!!!!!
SERIOUSLY.
EW.

Why would you have room cleaning if they don't do actual cleaning? Our carpet wasn't vacuumed when we first got in and then I found the gem above. Thank goodness that they picked it up and apologized, because seriously. EW.

-13.95 internet? Really? I work from my computer, so having to pay that cuts into my paycheck. Plus it was super slow and not worth the price.

-Blackjack was $25.00 minimum MOST of the days I was there...including Monday! WHY? Just because they have a $5 automated machine doesn't mean that you should have such expensive tables. I felt a little cheated because I just had to throw my money at machines to just have fun. Their machines are tight too, no such thing as a loose machine here.

-Lack of food. No fast food, at least. The rest was pricey, including the cafe that was only open for breakfast. Seriously Rio, you want us to pay `12.00 for 3 pancakes? Unbelievable.


As "nice" as it was, I probably won't ever ever stay here again. Visit for fun? Yes....but on someone else's dollar. I'm not rich enough to even really step foot in this place and it's not even on the strip!

(Oh, and the room was comped most of the time except one night and I have no idea what the price of the room was so I can't talk about their prices.)

We've stayed at the Rio a couple times in the last year and after the second visit I've noticed a few details that will affect our decision to return or not. The hotel is starting to appear run down - it's the little things. Many of the buttons in the elevator are broken, the carptet is looking tired and frayed, the broken elevator floor indicator had a clear piece of plexiglass covering the LED display so that all the electronics were visible. I don't think these are huge issues, but they tend to wear on you when you obtain a good rate and then add 50% of that rate as a resort fee so that great rate isn't so great after all. The hotel is really in a convenient location and I'd like to return due to the convenience. Maybe I should check out the pool before making the final decision. To be continued.....

Overall our week long stay was great! The one huge downside for us is to pay for wifi. The near thousand dollars we spent for a week plus wifi fees is insane.  The food choices were good but again very expensive. Our room was nice, older but nice and quite large. The staff was nice and attentive. Over all we will come again, the pool is fantastic! No complaints other than the wifi situation. We will be back!

Nice big room, clean, great views of the strip and mountains. 
Casino was fun, lots to do. We will be going back

Now the Rio is one of the older hotels in Vegas, especially when you compare it to some of the newer establishments on the strip.  Its off the main strip so you have to take a shuttle or cab.  You could walk it but I would not recommend that.  I haven't stayed in the rio for a number of years, whats good about this place is that all the rooms are suites, so if you have a big family, these rooms can easily accommodate 4 adults.  Since it is an older establishment, the décor is a little outdated but overall the room and beds are comfortable.  As far as dining options are concerned, they have the seafood buffet that is pretty good and was once one of the best but now that some of the new hotels have popped up, the buffet doesn't have the same appeal as it once did.  If your not in the mood for a buffet, they have an Italian restaurant, seafood , restaurant and All-American bar and grill.

We were disappointed with the condition of The Rio. It's tired. It used to be lively, and exciting, but overall it needs a full upgrade. We were thankful we felt safe during the tragedy this week.  I also don't understand why the waterfall pool was so cold that it hurt my toes. The other pool was packed.  The pool server was attentive and great!  Overall the checkin staff was amazing. The valets and ease of movement. But save this hotel. Put some money into it

Book a room at the Rio and third-party websites for $29. After taxes and everything, I  ended up paying $45. Terribly terrible and misleading. Finally checking in, I  find out an additional $32 has to be paid for mandatory Resort fees?!??? Considering I checked in at just past 7:30 roughly around 7:45, the attendant informs me I would pay for the resort fee to use the spa from 6am. I CHECK OUT AT 7am!!!! Sad because there was no way they would allow me to check in without spending the extra money. To make matters worst, I was told the resort fee was covering the use of the internet and to make local calls. THAT'S WHAT MY CELL PHONE IS FOR!!!! Additionally, $100 needed to be given in order to even checked in!!!! Sad because the night before $50 was asked for. Sad. I really hate to have had to pay for this room twice when all I need it for was to have a sleep. Couldn't use the facilities because they were close and I would only have 1 hour to use it for the next day. The resort fee should have been waived. Then I had a conversation with management and still no accommodation. Sad, no coffee pots in rooms either. Never again, never again
Rio is a solid 4 star hotel, nice big rooms, clean, lots of good places to eat, big sports book, cocktail waitresses in the upper tier, if you know what I mean.
Roach spotted in ladies room closest to the Big Seafood Buffet. YUK!
Awesome bar tender at Shutters bar. Jimmy made me a special margarita, although my request was unusual, he made it possible. I like Pomegranate Margarita on the rocks! Jimmy rocks!

This review is more so for the Hotel itself (as in, staying as a guest).

We'll never be back here.  Came here for a couple comp nights because I wanted to use up some points before they expired.  I can't imagine any hotel stay being any worse (knock on wood).

Service was non-existent, room was atrocious & unkempt.  TV was ridiculously placed in the room so it was not convenient for you to watch from the couch or the bed, and the bathroom set-up was an even bigger nightmare.  The only positive I guess I could say is that there are 2 fridges (one a mini-bar and one to actually store away your alcohol).

Seriously, there could be nothing worse.

I've stayed at the Rio 2 times in the last 30 days for the WSOP event.  I like that the rooms are large. However, be aware that the rooms can be rather worn. The problem is that they do not have a coffee pot or micro in the room.  I tried ordering a pot of hot water from room service so I could have my tea in the evenings and I was told "we don't do that anymore".  I know another person was there and bribed housekeeping for a coffee pot.  BRIBED!  Didn't know a guest would have to do that.

My billing statement was screwed up and billing customer service had to be called twice to rectify the problems.  My first call to customer service was rude!  

Last year I was accosted in the elevator and security and management were of no help.  Blew it off like it was nothing.

Gaming tables were all at a higher min bet during the WSOP which was off putting.  

The best thing going at the Rio is the sports deli has the best chicken wings and the Vietnamese food section wonton mein is excellent.

I will no longer stay at the Rio. Mandalay Bay has much nicer rooms for a comparable price including much better pool areas.  8 pools and a slow floating river. You walk into a real lobby without entering the casino and it was well lit and no smokey smell.

Loved check-in.  Nice place.  Pretty.  Good food. 

Worst part was those SWARMY marketing timeshare people.  OMG for unsuspecting nice people, they promise you the MOON, lie, accept your cash and give you sh*t for your money.
Promotional BS.  They out and out LIE.  No food or show or lunch promise was kept.  Sure you got to eat and watch things but quality? Not even close.
And I paid $50.  Shame on me.  NEVER AGAIN.

Sorry, RIO, it's up to you to not have them there. You should know better.  Ask someone for directions in a jacket and they lie and cheat you out of money.  

I didn't fall for Wyndham, but these guys throwing bait at visitors are SCUM.
For the value you get it's five stars.  Room is large & well kept, restaurants are decent & off strip cost, pool\/spa are very nice.   For $80\/night how can you go wrong.

The Rio has never failed me once. Yes, it is away from the strip but it tends to have the best deals and the service is really good too. 

The room we got last time had two beds and a pull out bed and even with all that the room was huge. But let's be honest, you're in Vegas all you really need is a place to shower, release bodily fluids, and change clothes. If you're concerned about all the little details about your room then you are not partying in Vegas at all. But in all fairness, the Rio is a very nice place to stay even though it doesn't look as attractive from the outside. 

You are allowed to smoke in the hallways next to the elevators, in case you are a smoker.

The Rio also has, in my opinion, THE best buffet in all of Vegas. I've been to the Bellagio and the thing that disappointed me most was they didn't have everything I wanted. However, at the Rio they had EVERYTHING! all of it tasted really delicious too, so you're definitely getting your money's worth. I believe this hotel is known for their buffet as well, so go here!

Stayed here because it was convenient for my dad as he was in the World Series poker tournament. This place is gross. The pool was filled with leaves & trash, the restaurants were sub par, and the rooms need to be majorly updated (even though we were in an updated one!) the only good thing about this place is all the rooms are suites & have refrigerators so you can bring your own food\/drinks.

Love the Rio one of my favorite place to visit when in Vegas and the club is way cool on the roof top.
 
Seafood buffet is well worth the money!

Not good.

Had to tip the desk clerk a pile of money to get the room I reserved. The while place smells like smoke and the line to check-in is usually at least an hour long.

The food isn't good. The place is depressing.

Don't do it. Just don't.

RIO, RIO, RIO. It is the BEST Buffet in Vegas. During our stay there, me and the family ate at the World Buffet. Endless snow crab legs, Chinese, Japanese, Mexican, and American. All I could say about the deserts was AHHHHH YUMMY !!!!! We walked out weighing atleast 10 lbs heavier but who cares. The food was GREAT !!! Worth the weight gain.

I brought my family here to spend a couple nights to get away. I had seen the photos on the Rio's website of the rooms they have and chose my room based largely on the "remodeled" nature of the rooms. Our room's "remodel" consisted apparently of new bedding and a new tv. Weird wicker furniture is the rest and it doesn't seem all that impressive or comfortable.

The TV is placed on a cabinet in the MIDDLE of the windows! My room is a pool view but you can't see out the windows because of the TV and cabinet...

Worse still overall is the lameness of the pool hours. The pool closes at 6pm. When checkin isn't until 4pm, and there's a line a mile long to checkin, by the time you get to your room and get ready to swim, the pool is closed. Very disappointed children.

As expected the food here is over-priced, but at least decent quality.

Just a warning too for others traveling with children or non-romantically linked people.... I'm not sure if this is how it is in all rooms, but there's a WINDOW from the shower into the main part of our room. Not frosted. Not mirrored. Just an open creepy hole in the wall with a piece of glass.

We decided to come to Las Vegas for the Thanksgiving weekend to hangout and have a little bit of fun so 15 of my family members, including myself and my husband decided upon the Rio as our hotel of choice. It was the most reasonable in cost and a short distance to the strip. Since my husband and I arrived first we decided to upgrade our room to a suite so that everyone can hangout comfortably before retiring to their individual rooms. Well we were given the Star McCormick Suite (Room 20029) on the 20th floor in the Masquerade tower. Upon first entering, the room seemed to be amazing. It was about 1600 sq. ft. with a beautiful strip view, floor to ceiling windows, living & dining areas, 1\/2 guest bath. The bedroom had a separate jetted tub & shower and a water closet (toilet room) as well as double sinks and separate vanity and stool. The floor to ceiling windows carried all the way through the entire suite, even the bathroom! The decor seemed to be updated to besides the wood tables that were beat up but had glass places on the top. Here's where things turned a bit. 

The wet bar in the dining area had a sink that only had cold water because the hot water didn't work, the guest bath door would stay closed, the phone in the living area didn't work because it was not even plugged in and the plug was under a plate in the floor that had to be removed first. The phone in the bedroom you could hardly hear on it, there was a high pitched intermittent noise coming from the tub area. Some of the lights didn't work and the main door would automatically close after opening it. We called about these issues and maintenance came to fix what they could and tickets were opened for the other issues. By the time we left on Tuesday, those issues were still present.

When my family checked in on late Friday evening, they didn't get the rooms they were promised as well as what they had paid for because they had been given away to other guests before my family arrived. They said that they had overbooked the rooms. WHAT?! They were told that they would be switching their rooms the next day after some guest checked out. The temporary rooms that they did get were a mess. One of the rooms had a couch that looked as if it was retrieved from a garbage dumpster and the sheets on the bed in another room had stains that appeared to be of urine! They placed another one of the rooms on the dog floor without even asking if it was ok. The next day when the rooms were suppose to be switched, the hotel then decided that they were not going to honor what they previously said they would do. After a lot of time at the registration counter and speaking with many different people, they finally switched the rooms.

The whole room situation was a catastrophe! If it wasn't for all of this, this hotel would have been ok. So if you are deciding to stay at this hotel during your time in Vegas be thorough in your requests and make sure that the room is up to par with YOUR standards!

This review is for a visit and not a stay. I thought this was a fun casino here at the rio, it's off the main strip but worth a visit!     
I liked the I-Bar (we had full table service here for a birthday party so all i could drink was covered and top shelve...even better!!) bartenders and servers were all nice.
Enjoyed the world buffet, many choices of food here. The buffet attracts crowds here so expect a wait in line.
The mardi gras flying floats are a lot of fun, and i had a great time at the rooftop club "Voodoo Lounge" great views but pricey up there.
All in all i enjoyed my time here and even left with a little more money then i arrived with,
even better!!

Stayed here for 4 day, 3 nights. I like this hotel because it is away from the strip but not far away as it's easy to drive across the bridge or even walk it. The rooms are spacious, clean, and staff friendly.

The cons of this place is the way they implement the resort fee. I understand and totally get that's how hotels are making extra $$ and I don't mind paying for it without so many restrictions. At Rio, you are forced to pay $28 per day resort fee, but there are limitations despite that outrageous fee: only two devices can utilize the "resort fee" internet per day, only two people can utilize the gym. Why enforce such silly rules? I have no idea. That itself lost a star.

There most be something about booking through Expedia where you get crappy views; this is not the first hotel that this has happened.

I am very very pleased with my stay at the rio.  I have stayed many places in vegas in the past;however, this was my daughter's bday and her biggest wish was to see an elvis impersonator  (she's only 14 and a huge fan) so I wanted to give her the most special bday and to go with that we had to stay at a awesome hotel in my price wage.  The gentleman at the registration went way beyond his job description to make that happen.  We payed a little bit more and he put us in an amazing suite on the 19th floor.  My daughter was so happy she didn't even want to leave the room.  The service here is exceptional,hotel, valet, and the buffet, even the girls at Starbucks were awesome.  Thank you rio for making my daughter's bday great.

I have mixed feelings about the Rio.  It definitely is past its prime; the rooms are quite large and spacious, but need a remodel.  The first room they gave me had cigarette burns in the furniture and floor and reeked of cigarettes, even though we requested a nonsmoking room, and within 5 minutes of being in the room, my daughter was getting a headache.  We went back down, they took us to the front of the line to the clerk that originally checked us in and she gave us a new room, no problem.  This room was much nicer and very clean, though you could tell it needed a remodel big time.  (knicked up furniture, peeling off wall paper, etc) We rented a car so we used the complimentary parking lots.  I always found parking relatively close.  EVERY employee we encountered was friendly and helpful.  All the restaraunts we tried had good food and I felt they gave you enormous servings for the price.  I don't gamble and I don't smoke (we were there for a conference), so two notes on that:  I was surprised that the gambling area as you walked through was not nearly as smokey as say, The Orleans. I appreciated that.  The pool area was closed and there was NO WHERE to just sit down outside and read a book.  Seriously, NO WHERE.  I found a very uncomfortable bench at the convention center that was used for shuttle pick up.  The consierge told me I could go sit on the stairs.  No thanks!

Great value hotel. $100 for 3 nights! Cant go wrong. Rooms were big, clean n nice. I could care less how nice a room really is because i come to vegas to have fun and not for the room. As long the bed is good and clean. Anyways the rio has some good restaurants good staff. Only downside is they are located off the strip. So i spent alot of taxis.  The kJ chinese restaurant is good. Also this is where the WSOP event is held so has to be good! Great value hotel at its best.

Worst experience, you have to either blind or broke to stay here. Room was dated in early. 80's furniture, drapery,and carpeting .the wall paper was peeling the ceiling had major visible cracks. The room smelled like animals were living there. Stay away!!!!!!!
Check-in was tough and we got a large suite because we were getting married. But the room was a huge disappointment. We down sized to a regular room which was a lot cheaper and closer to family.

I had a wonderful night's sleep here.  With the age of the resort you won't get the latest and greatest vibe of most hotels on the strip.  But what you lack in that department is made up with cleanliness and service. 

Basic simplicity at its best with quick access to the casino from the parking structure.  The Rio carnival buffet is a must stop for all visitors!

Got a room for $22 a night, super cheap, the rooms were pretty nice though. I stayed in the old wing and you could tell that everything in there was pretty old, but it was still clean and a huge room. The gaming is alright, they don't have a very popular poker room for 1\/2 NL, only about 2-3 tables going during prime time. Getting from the Rio to the strip was really easy though with the shuttles.

I like Rio because they're big, clean, and attractive. The cons are that they are off of the strip, they don't have any special free attractions for adults or children so its kinda boring. Each hotel on the strip does, whether it's the statutes at Caesars, the fountains at Bellagio, the habitat at Flamingo, the Circus at Circus, Circus, or the Stratosphere's rides. So they seem lacking in that sense. Otherwise the rooms are big, clean, and awesome, and they have Penn and Teller.

Si está bien el hotel está limpio me gusto el bufet la comida de ahí me encanto y más por qué dan cupones para utilizarlos ahí lo único que no me gusto fue una cosa una noche antes de regresar fuimos a pasar la noche a la discoteca y en el baño de mujeres había una tipa "trabajadora"de ahí que vendía cosas yo estaba cansada de mis zapatillas y le devolver a a mi amiga ella nos contestó que tenía sandalias de 10 dólares para la gente pobre y para los ricos unas en 30 dólares que son especiales según ella y que si de plano éramos muy pobres tenía calcetines por 5 dólares pienso que su comentario fue muy racista yo pude haber comprado las de 30 dólares pero no las compre por su estupido comentario así que decidí aguantar mis zapatillas que mal que un empleado así eche a perder el servicio del hotel lo de mas estuvo bien

This place has seen much better days and could feel better with a new ventilations system (or kick that cigar store out?) I had a huge suite with a spectacular view.  the bed was great but the decor could use a little upgrading.  The much touted buffet was dull but the the seafood buffet was pretty good.  it's not on the strip but works out to be about the same distance from one end of the strip to the other so it didn't matter.  the shuttle service was fine,

My room had not been properly cleaned. Bathroom was dirty and someone elses clothes were hanging in th bathroom. A\/C worked sometimes and sometimes it blew hot air. Everything is top dollar even the in room coffee which you have to pay for. I stay in Vegas a lot I will never stay here again

Beware of the Time Share Agents that are roaming around the Casino Floors including the SLOTS area too...because they wasted 5 minutes of my time telling me I can win a Brand New Red Corvette that's there on the floor just because I took a picture next to it.....LOL

I'm well aware that every big hotel has these Agents roaming around in them.  But the RIO has allow them to set up shop in the SLOTS area.......that' just SHADY.  

I saw a couple filling out their information on the computers here....sad....they are going to waste hours of their life that they can't get back by attending a time share presentation for some lame free perks that they sell you on.

I spoke to the female agent for a minute while she told me let's find out if I won by filling out my information on the computer that they had there. SHADY.

 After talking to me for 2 minutes or so asking me where I was staying and if I liked the hotel I was staying at, she passed me on to another male agent telling me "so n so" will be helping me now. AGAIN, SHADY.

 The male time share agent swooped in to ask me what hotel I was staying at and how long I was in Vegas for and what I did for a living.  Same questions AGAIN.  They both asked me the same questions....LOL

I liked how they worked as a team in switching off while talking to you to get you to attend a Time Share presentation.  Can't hate their efforts, it's getting enough suckers to attend. OVERALL, JUST SHADY.

 AVOID THEM IF YOU CAN SINCE THEY ARE LOCATED IN THIS CASINO GAMING FLOOR AND SLOTS AREA!!   

Anyhow, I got up and told him I'm good and don't need this.  

You should do the same thing too. Don't fall for their tactics. Again...I wasted 5 minutes talking to these scammers. 5 minutes that should of been spent doing something else. Damn.

Nuff Said.

We ended up upgrading our room to a presidential suite type room which was gorgeous. It was huge with a beautiful panaramic view all the way around the room and the tub was big and spacious. The problem with this hotel is the staff and the horrible customer service. I called downstairs to ask a question and the phone rang for like 20 mins. I hung up and called back two more times still no one ever answered. I eventually had to go all the way downstairs and when I asked why they won't answer the phones I was told they have a policy that if a guest is in front of them they don't answer their phones. Well considering the line is around the damn corner basically they have a no answer phone policy. I told them that policy is crazy and how can you ignore people once they have paid for their room. It's interesting that when you call to book a room they have no problem picking up but the minute they have your money they are done with you. I won't be back to this hotel. They clearly don't care about their guest needs and only assist those who are paying for a room.

Good size room. But the furniture are very old.  Air condition does not generate any cool air, only noise. Check out staff is not very friendly, especially when we mentioned the air condition problem.  The buffet is too expensive for the low quality food. Overall, not satisfied, wifi not stay here in the future.

Pros: 
- Most of the staff is very kind - janitor, fix-it man, room cleaner, man at the elevator ALL out of this world kind. We loved them. 

Cons: 
- Rooms are dirty! 
- Mold in the bathroom 
- Peeling wallpaper on walls 
- Broken curtains - couldn't open to see our view! 
- Poor lighting in bathroom - got ready in entryway 
- Mirror for closet broken - would not stay open or closed
- Shower head was 30 years old - water pressure shoots like a fire hydrant
- Bed pillows are 1\/2 size, decorator pillows
- Bedding dirty 
- Shower curtain is missing plastic piece for IN the shower- material gets wet, sticks to material decor curtain on outside and floods bathroom 
- Bathroom door off hinge and has to be slammed to shut 
- Room service is not open 24 hours 
- Room service requires you to leave your room to go downstairs and make your order
- Food is excessively expensive: $20 for 3 eggs (plus $8 for them to walk to your room)
- Absolutely NO amenities - empty fridge, no paper cups for water, room service has no "forgotten" items: toothpaste, qtips, etc. 
- I think the biggest insult was the "gym" - we were charged $40 to workout in a shoebox. I've never seen such a small gym in a hotel, including the shitty hotels you stay in for a quick overnight. I was appalled that we paid so much - and you can't see the gym before you pay because it's nestled 5 miles into a labyrinth of hallways. 
- No express checkout - This takes quite some time so be prepared and allot time for it.

It all started with super long lines at registration -- at 11 am!?! There's never enough staff -- working, that is. They poke their head out and can see that the registration and the keys\/mail line is congested, but they must've seen their shadow because they popped back into the back room behind registration before you could say, "Groundhog Day!" Once you get your room key, you get absolutely no directions on how to get there! No instructions for wi-fi use either. Is it "free" because I paid the hefty resort fee? So, which wi-fi service do I use now?

Faulty faucets throughout the room, as well. Not only does the handle turn, but the entire fixture does too! The furniture looks horrible. This place needs some serious renovations in order to compete. Period.

I'm staying at the Rio right now, and I'm pretty underwhelmed. The price is definitely right and I suppose I shouldn't complain but there were a couple of things that didn't sit right with me. My room, though I didn't spend much time in it, was pretty gross. Outdated for sure, but the worst part was the smell. It smelled like an Indian food restaurant that didn't pass inspections in my hotel room. It is gag-worthy, and I did actually gag several times. I called the front desk ( all the staff are pretty okay here btw) and they said they would fix it, but they didn't do anything that made a difference. 

The gaming was pretty blah. They need more blackjack tables but they have a weird mix of games you've never heard of (wtf is wacky poker?) and baccarat. Yeah no thanks. One thing I did enjoy was that they will feed you drinks all night if you are sitting at a game, and the waitresses are definitely nice to look at. 

The food was actually pretty good and fairly cheap compared to other options. They definitely realize that you are spending a boat load of cash and they kept the food pretty reasonable. 

I might stay here again assuming the price point is consistent, but won't expect much honestly. 5\/10 meh

Rio, along with Paris, is outdated.  I think the only reason they are in business is because of Penn & Teller (whose show was amaZing) and the casino. The hotel itself isn't that great. 

Our suite had a nice view with a huge bathroom. Sure, that's normal. But the beds weren't that comfy and the wallpapers were outdated like the hotel.  Old dreary sofas but clean and nice bath.
While walking through the hotel, we could tell the Rio tried to slap stuff on the walls like the Cosmopolitan. Heck, the animal\/human portraits in front of the P&T theatre, the glass flower posters in the same hall, the tasteless drawings of a room.... They're all so cheap. Rio, do you know why the Cosmopolitan has more elegance than yours? They're electronic. Yes I understand your hotel is older, but  you can still make some improvements, ya know? 

If you would like to taste some of that Vegas-ness, I would recommend Ol' Rio.

This review is just for the buffet:

not bad in terms of options especially for the price but the taste of most of the good is pretty meh,

things that i particularly liked were the salisbury steak and prime rib so if you do go there make sure to hit that biz up.

their shrimp and crab legs were sorta weird texture wise, iunno if that's indicative of their lack of freshness but that's usually what i'm most excited about in vegas buffets

The Rio was the host for a work conference that I was attending with a co-worker for three days.  I stayed in a room, ate at their restaurants, attended meetings in the convention center and played their table games. The only thing we didn't really do there was attend a show. 

We were in the masquerade tower which hosts their recently renovated rooms which are $15-$25 more than a standard room. Recently renovated to me means within the last year. The carpet was new, the bathroom wasn't bad but there was still a lot of 1995 in that room. The TV was a flat screen but it had a lot of lines\/receiving issues that just made it hard to watch tv. The furniture had a lot of scratches and dings, not bad but not great. We were on the 32nd floor so when the zip liners were taking off we could hear the screams too. There was also a flip flop imprint on the ceiling of our room - I'm not sure if I want to know the story behind that.

The first night we went up to the rooftop bar - VooDoo. If you haven't been, it's worth visiting the Rio just to see that view at night. There's a $10 cover but the view was worth it. There's a few bars up there too with a DJ.  They have a specialty cocktail called the Witchdoctor which is basically just rum and more rum.  It's very tasty, but dangerous.

On my second day, I was in the convention center for most of the day. The chairs were comfy, the sound systems worked, they had power strips in all of the rooms too which was convenient when the laptops started running low. The food was great for the first day, not great on the second day so overall, pretty decent place for a convention.  

We also played some roulette and then sat at a bar to play video poker.  Perhaps, we're spoiled with the casinos in Reno, but I expected the cocktail server to come around more than once per hour while we were playing roulette.  We were at the table for about three hours and were served three drinks.  After Jason won all the blue chips that he could (that was the end game after all), we decided to have a drink at the bar, throw in a few bucks in the machine and then call it a night.  Again, I might be spoiled by the Reno Casinos, but usually when we sit down at the bar to play their video games, the drinks are comped as long as you don't order anything crazy.  Apparently that was not the case at the Rio.  We sat at the machines for about an hour (long enough for me to hit four three's) and only one of our drinks was comped.  The rest we had to pay for.  

Overall, the Rio was an okay place to stay\/visit if you're planning a trip to Vegas.  They are not directly on the strip, so if you're looking for more of that experience then this isn't the place for you.  But even if you just visit to see the view from VooDoo, it's worth going out of your way for.  If my "business meeting" hadn't been in the hotel itself with the discounted room rates, then I probably would have stayed somewhere else.

I just got back from Staying at the Rio and it was a GREAT experience. I know its not one of the nicest, or flashiest hotels in Vegas, but it was clean, the people were nice the rooms are HUGE. Generally the food was great and we received great service. I know some of my Co-Workers rooms were pretty shady-so I suggest checkign out your room as soon as you check in and calling if there are any issues. You can't beat the price though i've stayed at the Excalibur in Vegas before becuse its Cheap but it looks and feels cheap the Rio did not- I would stay there again.

Just off the strip, this is a fine, older type of hotel. The rooms are very nice, the price is good and the staff are quite nice. Three pools which can be cold but cater to different types of folks. No river pool, however. Best seafood buffet in Vegas!

I'm going to try not to blast this place, as I had a good time, but this place is going downhill. I stayed here for 4 nights last week for a pool tournament they were hosting. I stayed here last year for the same tournament and had a better experience. This year I stayed in room 1987 in the Ipanema tower. Upon entry to the room I noticed many things neglected. The carpets were stained and ripped, the curtains were torn in a few spots and one side wouldn't operate properly. The couch was stained and had mismatched cushions. The breaker in the vanity area would trip when plugging in different items, the phone didn't work and the water pressure was lacking. The elevators were slow, as two of them were out of order so there were many people trying to use fewer elevators. It was so bad at times that lines would start forming in the hall down stairs. I waited nearly 10 minutes a handful of times just to get to my floor. The floor of two of the elevators were sticky from what I assumed was beer and was that way all four nights. The dealers were somewhat rude, and a few of them tried to short me a few times. Mostly on let it ride. I had one blackjack dealer counting with her fingers!!! This property is showing its age and management seems neglectful. Seats in the slot area were ripped and had cigarette holes. You will go thirsty waiting on a drink as well. Their restaurants are pricey for the quality. We ate off site the majority of the time. The buffet at the cosmopolitan blew our mind! It was amazing, unlike the one at the Rio. Don't waste your time or money. The pool area is nice and so we're the non Casino staff. The housekeepers were super friendly and accommodating, as was the guys at the taxi line area. I would stay here again, but it's definitely not my first choice. You definitely get what you pay for, I know it's not a five star resort, but damn, they need to up their game and stay competitive.

Husband and I checked in on Sunday I was pleased they offer an early check in for only $20.00 as we didn't want to leave our bags. But the room is right by the elevators so we hear them all night, the tub would not hold water for a bath, and the sofa and chaise set were stained.  Called about switching rooms says only double beds available so having maintenance check the tub. I chose this location because of the size of the rooms and the price but you get what you pay for. Benefits are the views ask for a high floor and strip view. They do provide a free shuttle service to Harrahs and Ballys. So far the casino has not paid out well at all.

Great place to be. Great rooms and for the price you cannot go wrong. Great bars and rooftop lounge is awesome. Also the adult pool is the place to be. I recommend you join the Total Rewards Program helps you get discounts off the buffet and other amenities at the hotel.

Decent table limits and good rooms. They are suite rooms and got some pretty cool features. One was a TV inside the bathroom mirror. 
It did have an HDTV, but no HDTV channels.
I found it funny that one of the channels on the TV rebooted on us and I saw it start to DHCP finding an IP address. 

Casino was pretty good. A lot of tables and it wasn't crowded.

It is off the strip so take that into consideration when planning. We had a car so it was a non issue.

I've stayed here over ten to fifteen times over the past 5 years.  Sometimes for up to three weeks at a time.  But I am fed up with the nickel and diming.  
The last straw was the throttling of the internet down and an extra fee for higher speeds.  Is it not enough that we get charged for it in the resort fee?  
I could barely check emails and god forbid I tried to surf two pages at the same time.  For a good connection I'd have to shell out another $8.99 per day in addition to the $25.99 resort fee.
No thanks.
Hotel is older, however, the price was right and the rooms were a very good size, I would stay here again, not too far from the Strip, and the buffet was amazing!

We used to stay here once a year but the trip this August will be our last. Our floor had all the light fixtures broken, looked like they were punched in. We stayed a week and not one was fixed. There was a nail poking out of the carpet in our room where the carpet was peeling and freying from the entry way. One bloody foot in the dark later...pool would spontaneously close early at different times on different days with no warning. Asking the 15 year old staff, the only ones present, when they planned to close that day never lead to a true answer. They don't open the "beach" pool on weekedays. All but one of the jacuzzis are closed. There are bandaids and cigarettes floating in the water first thing in the morning and used cups left everywhere, even when it just opened. Buffet staff could not be bothered to bring drinks durring a very quiet brunch that we paid 40 bucks for. Its become a hole. Not coming back. There are a lot nicer places to stay for less all over Vegas.

Having been to Vegas several times before, the Rio stands out and not for the right reasons. It's completely off the strip, and shuttle buses to and from the strip are immediately packed and unreliable; they come and go in 30-minute intervals, and people queue for a space long before a shuttle arrives. Each bus holds roughly 15 people... you do the math.

I can't complain about the price as I was there for an event, so my $100 covered a three-night span where I was crammed into a two-bedroom with several friends (including people sleeping on the floor). However, I don't even think this was worth $33\/night! It was pretty ill-equipped, and I can't get over how far it was from everything. The pool area was okay, but it wouldn't even hold a match, much less a candle, to some of the newer hotels on the strip.

The clubs and bars have a weird atmosphere, and they seemed to attract an older demographic. This is definitely not the place for college-aged\/mid-20's people who want to see and experience Las Vegas. It's more fit for families\/senior citizens who don't mind being far-removed.

When the Rio opened, the suites were clean and looked great. I have stayed at the Rio at least once a year for the subsequent 7 years and then I quit going. I quit going because the hotel has not kept the place fresh and clean.  There are too many new hotels to really bother complaining.

I do miss the memories though and their Seafood Buffet is fun and was a good value. 

They have a system of rating players like all casinos. The more you play, the more you earn points.  If you find that the machines or tables aren't working for you, take a breather and go the the bar and watch the Carnival floats and play video poker for a while. You might get lucky and even get a picture taken with one of the dancers.  I did and even get offered to attend a private meeting!  I refused because I am wired as a committed type but I felt good that a hottie asked me if I could party with her after work.

If you plan to book here, make sure you get an upgraded suite. Pay more and you will get more.  You'll feel better and may lift your spirits rather than the rooms they offer normal people.

This was my second one staying at the rio. First time was good this time was a problem ... Missing door handles water not coming out the sink...we was told one thing than it change rude customer service on the phone when I called to speak to manager I was promise a call back I had go down to the desk and the agent didn't even put in the ticket we called we check out 11\/27 check into the encore it's a big difference ! Valet was good and customer service at total rewards was the best though that's why two stars. I got my fees waived just a little I should got my room switch to better or taken off I had brought 4 rooms this holiday and was a member !

All I can say is this place is not even worth it
Early check in is 7am and they charge you $20 plus tax for that on top off resort fees that are way to high 
I had been driving for 9 hours and ask if they could get me in prior to 7am (by the way it was already after 5am ) girl said sure but I will have to charge you half the room rate of $125 for a Sunday what a joke I have never had a problem getting early check in at any other hotels in the last 10 years never again

Review is for phone service:

Booking here has always been soooooo awesome!
Have made 3 reservations through their phone bookers and they are always very funny and happy to get the best deal possible! I decided to forego the new fancier hotels for my anniversary and called Rio to see what kind of deals there were.

Viola! Amazing offer due to my gaming - too amazing to pass up! 

Just going to upgrade when we check in and enjoy using our saved money for gaming and shopping! 

Thanks Rio ~ Your phone workers rock!

This was my first time staying at the Rio since our "host" who booked and planned our stay has been here so many times. Not only was I disappointed for a first timer, he said this place has fallen off the map, big time.

We were told there would be a pull-out bed from the couch and asked for a roll-away bed . . . the couch did not pull-out into a bed and they never brought the roll away. 
The shower head is terrible - all lime scaled and the weirdest setting, you can barely shower, it's like mist. 
They apparently close the pool at 6pm even on weekends . . really? How lame. 
The hotel is full of mostly 50 year olds and just seems tacky. 
The shops are insanely expensive, even for Vegas. 
The casino was decent, except for the stupid three-card poker table that took my money . . . stupid game.

Charged A Resort Fee But No Services Were Provided   

I was charged a resort fee of $24.64 for staying at the Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino.  However, the resort area, swimming pool etc, was not open on the date.  The sign outside of the pool area says it will not be open for the whole season.  How can they close the pool area and still think that charging a resort fee is fair?  I also stayed at Golden Nugget and had no problem paying their resort fee.  

The room I got at Rio was ok.

Not good, not bad. My wife and I went for our anniversary and couldn't pass up the cheap rate we were getting for the room. Room was decent enough. You can tell it's pretty run down though and needs renovations bad. Wish they gave you more toiletries than just a bar of soap and a small shampoo. The Rio used to have some good things going for it like the sky parade in the casino, the show on the big stage, and the buffet used to be quite good. Not the case anymore. I hope Caesar's Entertainment does some major overhaul to this place ASAP because it is a good hotel. Close enough to the strip, but gives you a break from the hustle and bustle that the strip can bring though. It's decent enough if you're the type of person that's out and about for most of the day but if you're going to be confined to your room for most of the day, I'd look elsewhere.

Wow...

The last time I stayed here was almost ten years ago... man I feel old.  The rooms look the same way they did 10 years ago.  Old school tube television.  Color schemes from the 80s and worn out furniture.  Why did it even get 3 stars from me... 

I got the room comped over new years weekend and the hotel was pet friendly... which meant that we got to take the spoiled princess dog with us on a little vay-cay.  Other than that it would have been probably 2 stars.  It was sorta nice to be a little bit away from the insane strip madness on new years, which I have done before, but still convenient enough to get back and forth between here and the strip via the secret back roads behind the Rio.

This place made me sad.

 I kept imagining the difference between being a manager at The Rio and being one at one of the nice places on The Strip. 
- Handle completely missing on a glass door between the casino and the parking lot? Bellagio: Fixed immediately. The Rio: Meh, whatever.
- Eye sore of a dilapidated towel return box at the pool?
Caesar's Palace: Sanded and repainted overnight. The Rio: Meh.
- Tile falling out inside an elevator?
Pallazo: Replaced or reset. The Rio: Whatever. Tape it down.
- Ten percent of the signature blue\/red neon lights burned out on the building's now fading exterior?
- The Mirage: Refinished and replaced. The Rio: Nope.
- Vintage in-room refrigerator loud enough to keep you from sleeping....
You get the idea.

Granted, I'm aware of the price differences between 4.5-5 star resorts and The Rio, but it would be nice to feel like the place hadn't been left for dead. Also, it's not a suite if you can't make it around the bed or couch without banging into the desk or coffee table. 

On the other hand, the pool was kinda fun and there were never any crowds to navigate through in the casino. The zip-line looks fun too.

Also - the airplane style hyper-flushing toilets would be the scariest thing here, but the window-into-the-shower and toilet took that prize. When was this ever fun and sexy? Just creepy when you're traveling with your teenager.

Really, Rio?  I've been coming to your casino for years, but you just keep making it harder for me to find a reason.  First, you eliminate the Show in the Sky and the flair show in the village along with most of the personalities working the bar there.  Then you cut out the bevertainers after practically initiating the concept.  You've eliminated the dancers in the iBar and installed video poker machines instead.  Tonight, the Friday of the fourth of July weekend, there's not even a DJ at the iBar.  The 6 other customers and I got to watch an informercial about the 360 degree mop.  Not only that, but the 24x7x365 American Grille was closed!  I realize there have been hard times financially the last few years, but you're in the hospitality business, you need to spend money to make money.  It looks to me like you're just cutting costs, no matter what, with no consideration of what that expense  returned to the bottom line.  I'm afraid if it weren't for the friends I've made among the staff over the years, I wouldn't have any reason to come back.  A shout out to Jaime, Juan and Parker, who do what they can to keep it working!

Reception review:
So long that its exhausting to just wait and wait, seems like its not moving...50 people waiting to check in and there is 6 receptionist....

So I met this music manager thru my work...he was so fun to talk to and seemed to have a really strong spirit.  He was telling me about an upcoming tour that I should be a part of.  hmmm...I was thinking..maybe, sounds like a great opportunity.  So me and two of my girls went to Vegas to meet his manager and check out his artists.  

When we arrived we were not pleasantly surprised by this old dude that had another agenda in mind.  One of his artists was a friend of mine and spoke highly of him and the opportunity, but little did anyone know he was just a PERVE!!

So we arrived at the Rio...Maral was so excited she stuck her body out of her huge car to capture a picture of the Prince sign on the building.  The lobby was okay, we couldn't get into the club for free, and the company outside of this douche bag was wonderful.  He wanted us to stay in his room...whatev!! 

So we got a room on our own and enjoyed it sooo much.  The room was HUGE!! and the facilities new like...and we just had a blast.  Got some liquor from a liquor store and had a wonderful party.  Made new friends, went dancing, got caught in traffic, and made new memories with the most amazing gals alive.  Thank you Connie and Maral...I love you!  Such amazing support they gave me that weekend.  And it was delightful Connie's bday!  :)

So all in all, it was an amazing trip, although what brought us there was sooo sad.  We left with smiles and great memories.

Worst hotel ever. I "upgraded" to the VIP suites floor 20 and the entire room was out dated. Bed & Pillows were horrible, couches were old and bathrooms were not luxurious at all. Pool was also horrible. I have to go back for work and will never stay here again.

How can you not grab a meal here during a Vegas stay? This place never gets old as the food they carry are all around average (except some sushis). 

Their mongolian grill gets a little too sweet with the soy sauce but you can tell the cook you want it not so sweet and everything will be fine. Their service is always inconsistent but in the end, if you want service then I guess I should just go to a fancier place.

But overall, this place is great as a buffet.

I stayed at the Rio a couple of weeks ago and it was a decent experience. Maybe I'm just being harsh because I stayed at the Palazzo a couple months ago and nothing can compare. 

On the positive side, the Rio was clean and check-in was prompt. They were also accommodating in bringing us extra blankets and towels. The pool area looked nice but we were there at the end of the season and only one of the resorts' pools was open. I could see it being a fun place to hang out in the summer.

For the negative side, it's a mile walk to the strip. There is a free shuttle that takes you to either Harrah's or Bally's but it only runs every 30 minutes or so until 12:30 a.m. The room was a decent size but being advertised as an all-suite hotel, I guess I expected more. 

One thing that I found odd was the window from the shower to the bedroom. This would be fine with your significant other but when staying with a group of friends, it's a little strange and potentially awkward.

The king suite had pool view and we could see the Voodo Zipline at night going by. We had a lovely experience. Had fun at the KISS indoors mini golf, penn & teller magic show, and great restaurant choices from Pho soup (vietnamese food) and great mexican food at El Burro Borracho from Guy Fieri. We liked the Mascarade section and their slot machines were fun. The overall experience was great. Here some areas that need work:  the free shuttle from Rio to Bally is free, but be careful with driver, at times he lets others cut in line and we lost a ride because of that. We had to get Uber instead, so make sure your driver does not let others in, talk to them before he lets people in, they are not tough enough. Also, the buffet needs work. It has a big selection, but their steak was under cooked. Need to pay more attention on the cooking, hint hint, chefs out there. Overall, the rooms and bathroom were clean and very very BIG rooms, you get lots of sq. footage for your bucks. Great place to make bets on sports, horses, etc. Overall very safe atmosphere and nice hotel. If you don't like to see heavy traffic from other people in other hotels like you see in the main strip, this is for you. At night it gets really quiet and you kind of feel the entire gambling area is for yourself. They have a Smash Burger inside and many many choices for food and convenience stores, even a hair salon, etc. I will stay here again next time I am back in vegas.

Room Was Sub Par They Then Took a Despot of $100 and said they would Return it the Next Business day and didn't recive it and has been 3 Business day had to dispute charges this is not a Casino\/Hotel you want to stay at you will not receive your money back in timely fashion

I have stayed at the Rio 3 times now and love it.  My upcoming trip to Las Vegas we are going to stay at the Rio again.  This place rocks when it comes to overall service.  I have stayed at many places on the strip.

Regards,

Adam

pros- 
-24 hour deal for the buffets such as Carnival, PH, Paris, etc. 

cons-
-parking is far 
-old people casino
-bad customer service
-worse room I have ever stayed in

Experienced the worst customer service here. When we got to the room, we were disappointed to see how "big" the room was...which it was not that big at all being a suite & all.. It seemed like a regular hotel room. 
The air conditioner sucked ass.. we had blasted at 60 and we were still fanning ourselves and that was after we had complained and they had someone "fix it" by replacing the filter.. I guess you cant expect too much since the RIO is one of the oldest hotels in vegas...
The towel hangers came off... yea..surprise surprise..

the bed sheets had nasty brown spots..

the refrigerator felt like a cooler would have been a better and cooler option. 

Lastly the pull out bed looked like it has been "pulled" all over the place.. the mattress was completely falling apart... it was sad for my friend who had to put up with it for one night and he even hurt himself trying to pull that disgusting old thing out of the couch. 


When I complained the next day all they could do was "send someone out for repairs"... I really was not trying to upgrade to a bigger room just a room that is not terrible... even if it is the same kind just a different room. ..and I asked the lady how long it would take because obviously this is an inconvenience for us.. she stared at me with a nasty look and replied, "well you can stay int he room!"..-- wow what an awesome customer service you just gave me you incompetent worthless customer service representative... I mean really I just want to be comfortable and do you really expect that we can sleep and feel like we have some privacy with 3 men walking around the room and fixing things and moving the couch out and putting in a new one? really? really? okay yeah sure I would love to stay in the room and awkwardly try to ignore the three men trying to "fix things". 


the casino sucked as well.. its all OLD people. like old people that smell.

they offer a shuttle every 30 mins but its too bad its only good until 1 am so if you are out partying late then you either walk you ass home or pay for a cab(about $15).


overall our experience here was terrible. 

I recommend that you DO NOT plan on getting a room here.
Get the 24 hour buffet deal if you dont want to spend a lot on food.. buy it around 7 pm and you will be covered until 7 pm the next day.. so that covers your dinner, breakfast, lunch, and dinner again. Just don't stuff you face just because its a "buffet". We took advantage and ate at the Rio, Planet Hollywood, and almost at the Paris for crepes but we made it too late.

I also recommend bringing your own blankets.. the brown one that they give you is gross and feels like its made out of foam.. its not comfortable or soft. 


don't bother looking into this hotel.

not a good experience.  Employees were great, management sucked at buffet though.  The food was just ok.  The Prime Rib was undercooked to the point of being unappetizing at the buffet.  But the kicker was the Buffet management.  I had an issue and asked a manager a question at the buffet and he looked at me and walked away.  i wont be going back.  unnecessary trip to go there anyway.   can lose just as bad at other more friendly casinos.   This manager was a big wig i guess.  to big to give a crud about me i guess.

I had ordered tickets for Penn and Teller online and selected to pick them up at Will Call. The email said to pick them up the day of the show at the Rio's Penn and Teller Theater, but no less than one hour before the show. So we showed up at 10am on the day of the show and found that the theater window was closed. but there was a sign to go to the main box office at the front desk. 

We went there only to find out it wasn't open until 11am, so we decided to walk around the casino. Unfortunately, there are these manhole covers on the floor, which sit just below floor level and I didn't see it, so I rolled my ankle on the stupid thing. We also found that the games were way less contemporary than those on the strip and the payouts were horrible.

When we showed up at 11 am the window didn't open on time and there was a fairly long line. 

We also found the parking lot at night when we went back was really dark and made me incredibly uncomfortable.

Pros:
Clean Hotel
Huge Rooms
Cheap Rates
Great Food and Dining Options
Ample Parking
Great Service

Cons:
Away from Strip. taxi will usually run about $8-10 bucks but I heard they do have shuttle service to the strip
High Minimum's on Table Games
Rooms are far away from the parking lot 


I would probably stay here again but next time I would definitely stay on the strip!

So smoky and stinky inside. This place has definitely gone down hill since the last time I was here. I couldn't even find the entrance to the Masquerade tower for EVER. So confusing. The casino was a bust. Room was kind of stuffy. Valet was full one night when we got back in from downtown. There's a strange peephole "window" in the bedroom looking into the bathroom. What do we need that for?? Just overall not impressed with this place. Harrah's should be able to step it up. OH! And we could hear our neighboring hotel guests at 3:30 in the morning hacking up a lung and shouting and laughing as loud as they could. The thinnest walls ever!

We are presently staying at the Rio for the NATCA Conference on Safety and Communication, and have been delighted with our stay so far. We are on the 22nd floor in 22011. The Masquerade Tower. Our room is spotless! We arrived on Friday and will stay 8 days. The check-in staff were professional and informative, and our room is large (a small suite) that has recently been updated with all new carpet, and gorgeous granite in the bath area. Brand new mattress set. No smell of smoke at all! no excess noise even though we are not far from the elevators. the windows in the suites actually have a feature that will allow you to let in some fresh air. The seated makeup vanity is a special added bonus, and made me feel like I was on vacation. The view from out room was over the swimming pools (several beautiful ones).  Off to the right is the Las Vegas Strip, and in the background an excellent panoramic view of the mountains. We hate to waste time and products, so we did not request room service until Sunday. Claudia was excellent! She was kind, professional, and her area (our room as an indicator) is SPOTLESS!!!
 (I say it again). I requested a limited service, but she quickly dusted and did a mini-full service. Her attitude was compassionate and caring. A runner also brought me some extra hangers because we are staying longer than an average stay. All of this happened within 30 minutes of my request! The staff that I have come in contact with, even in the casinos, has been warm and welcoming. They greet me and give eye contact when I walk by, and are kind when answering questions they must have hear 1000 times. When we were playing slot machines last night, a young man came up and took out drink order on an IPad and within minutes we had our beverages. We have been treated with warmth and respect. The Prime Rib at the buffet and mashed potatoes were perfectly cooked. The desserts were fun. The cost of the buffet seemed like a lot, so we just ate there one night. The breakfast restaurant in the convention area was excellent and reasonable and there are two Starbucks on site. If you are driving, I suggest you bring water as it is $3.50 a bottle unless you are gambling. I bought a water bottle that filters at the gift shop. it will pay for itself this week! The shuttle to the Other Caesar's properties took us to the strip and we spent a delightful afternoon shopping. This had truly been a memorable experience. I love watching the chickens cook on the spit over fire, and enjoyed a steak cooked on an open flame at another eatery on site (they Cook red meat perfectly at the rio). No complaints here. Excited about the rest of our stay! The payoff is in the small details, like cleanliness and how you treat your guests, and the Rio is doing a great job with that!

my husband and I stayed at the rio over the past few days and it is one hotel that we will not be returning to, First off we check in and they ask one bed or two I said 1 and when we got there we had 2 beds, whatever. The toliet was acting up the whole time we were there and the shower had no pressure. There was a mini bar there but we didnt realize that once you picked something up you were automatically charged and they provided a keurig machine but did not provide coffee, you had to go down to their convenience store and buy some. My husband tried connecting to wifi on his phone and they wanted to charge 13 dollars to use it. The air conditioner sucked too, I was sweating every night unless i slept at the foot of my bed. I was excited for the pool but when we got there right when it opened the sand on the beach was filthy i was disgusted. We tried the sand pool and it was extremely cold, not enjoyable at all. We tried the "jacuzzi" the 1st was out of order, the 2nd was cold and the third was lukewarm. We tried the fish pool they had it was like a pool you would see at your neighbor's house, nothing special. I was also excited for the buffet  we went right when it opened, some food looked like it was sitting over night. We also took the shuttle to and from harrahs, it was a time sucker, not convenient at all.

The casino is nice and clean.  The restaurants are ok, the buffet is WAY over priced at $30+ per person.  No breakfast buffet available.  Rooms need repair.  Peeling wallpaper, little water pressure in the shower, curtains difficult to open and close.  Maid service was terrible.  I had to call at 8pm on 2 different days to have them come take care of the room, then they act like I am bothering them.  Overall ok if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in the room.

I have stayed at Rio multiple times. All my other stays have been average, not too memorable. This visit however is horrible. We checked in on Friday at 12:30pm. They're normal check in is at 4. They charged us $22 for early check in, which we have never paid before in any hotels we have stayed at including this one. With 2 kids in tow, ok sure we'll pay the fee and the resort fee of $29 per day which only include 2 wifi logged in per day... again never heard of that before. 

The rooms are big which is why we don't mind staying here if the kids are with us. At about 5pm on Friday, I decided to call down to the front desk to see if we can be moved to a different room, because the neighbors we had were a bunch of obnoxious guys that kept yelling in their room and down the hall. The response I got is sorry, you've been in that room for more than 10-15 min and is considered used. You can check back with us again tomorrow. Really, let me go ahead and just put up with yelling all night, doors slamming all day, all night, and them leaving empty beer bottles right in the middle of our door. REALLY?! 

We will never choose to stay at Rio again even if the 2 of the 3 nights are comped.

Rio feels like a second home to me. I've been there 3 times since December. It does help that my sis is Diamond so the rooms are FREE FREE FREE. I love that they have two Starbucks in the hotel and they stay open almost 24 hours and there pastries are good. If you have had to much junk food all day the Starbucks has a nice fruit salad. I just wish the Starbucks had WIFI. Our suite was large enough for six ladies and our luggage. They brought a roll away bed for me and when I got in it I felt like I was in my own apartment. The buffet is great, the club is fab, and the pool looks good. The down fall is it is off the strip but hey its FREE!!!!!!!!!! I love the convenience store because they always have whatever stuff I have forgotten and they have beautiful masks to play with. I do wish they had a circ de soleil show here though.

Rooms are good staff is nice, there is always a but. They will get u for every little thing.  Double check your bill and what ever u do DO NOT use the house phone in the the room. They will bend u over and charge u $21.00 per phone call.  Nobody will take responsibility.  Come on people somebody needs to pass this on to the bean counters upstairs to stop trying to F ur clients.  Very disappointing.  Will never stay here again.  I'd rathe B n B instead.

Worst hotel in Vegas EVER!

Rooms are super old, ugly color scheme, and the couches are filthy. I had requested that my bed sheets be changed daily, and they completely ignored me. i accidently spilled coke on the sheets and they just re-made the bed with the stains on it. wtf?
Also, somehow I got a cricket in my room, and the thing was super loud. Called the front desk to come and fix it for me, housekeeping NEVER came!
The A\/C in my room also didn't work very well and even when I set it to 65, the room was still always 75 and extremely uncomfortable. I called to have maintenance come and fix it, of course they never came. 

Horrible experience! NEVER again!

I would give 2-1\/2 stars IF I could, but I can't so I won't... The wife and I take at least one trip to Vegas each year, usually much more often but this one is the first time we've hit the Rio up in at least five years or so. (The only reason we did was this was a last minute trip and there was no room availability at Paris and Planet Hollywood, our first and second choices). I have to say, my oh my how things have changed... Some for the better, some so\/so, but unfortunately, more so for the worse.

The better, as follows:

For one, the slots seem to be much, much looser than what I remember from before. Not sure if it was just me or what, but we had never had any "reel" luck here, but we did pretty good this past visit. Because it "isn't what it used to be" (re; the bad), the casino for the most part is quite "open" and finding a machine or sitting at a table is not too difficult. It's "off-strip" so that in and of itself lends to a more "intimate" feel. The All American Grill will always serve you up a good steak and or seafood, (particularly rib eye and salmon). The Hotel provides a free shuttle if one has had a few refreshing beverages, wants to hit the strip casinos, (Harrah's properties of course), and avoid walking or cab fees. Works for me!!! All (and I do mean ALL), of the staff we interacted with, from those at the check-in desk, to food and beverage peeps, to folks working in the Sports-book were absolutely fantastic!!! 

The so\/so:

The rooms are nice and large for the most part. And while I've heard that many, many upgrades had been made, ours hadn't. BUT... And this is a big but, It was very clean, unlike other reviews I've read. The bed was very, very comfortable as well, however the TV was older and the picture was not very bright. (We had to close all the curtains during daylight hours to get a good, clear, viewable picture). That said, we don't spend too much time in the room anyways and it's not too big a deal, hence the so\/so comment... Parking was fine for us, (unlike some other reviewers mentioned), but we always valet so not sure how applicable that one is. Same scenario with the pools but then how many Las Vegas pools are open in mid-January anyway??? But, our previous experiences with the pool area at the Rio have always been good, again, hence the so\/so.

The Bad:

$20 Resort Fee... Really? We didn't use the spa, or the gym... Not even the Internet!!! Why not the Internet? Because when I DID try to connect, it freakin' wouldn't let me!!! $20 a day (actually $22.40 w\/tax) is just a ripoff. And that is for one device only!!! Absolute bull$hit if you ask me... But here is the kicker (and this is what bothers me most of all)... I remember when the Rio was a fairly happening casino, with lots going on and many decent restaurants to choose from. Our daughters, (when they were young ladies), always loved the "Masquerade in the Sky" show and looked forward to "catching beads" from the performers. All of the available shop space upstairs was utilized and business was, (for lack of a better term), "booming". What we noticed this visit was much of the shop space upstairs and downstairs was now "available", because many restaurants had closed. To me, without the "Masquerade in the Sky" show, the place almost seemed like it had been put out to pasture and it was on its last leg :-(. Too, too, bad. I had always felt that the Rio was still our "fallback" hotel\/casino and I'm not sure that is the case any longer.

The last word:

While overall, we had a great time, we couldn't help but feel kind of sorry for the Rio and reminisce of the good ol' days, when we were younger, full of energy, life and the Rio Hotel and Casino was too... Bottom line is after staying for years at some of the other Harrah's properties, if we had to "re-stay" at the Rio, would we??? The jury is still out...

Rio haha they should be called the budget suites. From missing buttons in the elevator, no hot water in the shower, and toilet not flushing. Called the front desk "engineer is on their way" they said. Two night later we were still waiting for the engineer. Rooms over $100 a night, I've gotten better service and hotter water at other smaller hotels.

The room is stuck in the 70's. The check in process is stuck in  aggravation land. 
 
OK value, big room, a fridge in the room but no coffee machine. A  comfortable bed, but really people you must renovate it. 

I stayed there several times years before, because the available parking for trucks and trailers. And the attractive pricing. 

The check in time was so complicated and long I almost wanted to check out right there and then.  There is no reason to wait twice in two different lines. Just to get a bunch of coupons and sign some more documents, that could have been handled in the line for "screen check in" before. 

Buttom line, if you are looking for value, and don't mind the decor or the wait. That's the place for you. I won't be staying there again, I will try to shop for rooms way in advanced and stay at a better hotel.

I'm in the middle of my shower at 3:30AM when I hear a noise in the pipes and the water literally stops running. My husband calls the front desk,they tell us there is work being done on a block of rooms down the hall and it must affect our room. You think??? Waiting on bottled water to come up to rinse my hair. And there's no guarantee when water will come on and there are no empty rooms!

The Rio.  My old second home.  Seriously its like I lived here.  Back in the day I was quite the gambler.  So I stayed exclusively at Harrahs properties.  But back then they were Caesars properties.... OK I'm dating myself.  Anywho, Rio was my hotel of choice.  Now lets get down to the good, the bad and the ugly.

THE GOOD:

Gambling here is amazing.  At least from a Craps girls point of view.  When I want to throw my hard earned money away with little to no chance of ever getting it back here is where I want to do it.  Its lively and exciting, and once you get at a good table that drink lady is there ever 5 minutes.  Me being the lush I am, I never turned her down.  Which led to me having 3 drinks at once.  Oh the good times.  

The rooms..... OK, here is the trick to the rooms.  If you want a newly remodeled room stay in the new towers.  The decor is nice but the rooms are small.  Me personally Id rather have a larger room then new decor.  But to each their own.  In Vegas I need all the room I can get to throw my stuff around.  The rooms in the Masquerade a HUGE.  But, beware.... Some of the rooms have a window into the shower.  I didn't notice until I was taking a shower and saw my son. I felt violated.  lol.
