Also, if you ever get the chance stay in a Masquerade Suite.  AMAZING.  Dining room, living room, picture windows, great view......  I miss this place already.

The amenities... The Buffet, Voodoo Lounge, The Pool.  All great.


THE BAD:

Location.  The major drawback is that the Rio is off the strip.  But thanks to cabs this is an obstacle you can overcome.  So deal with it, your wallet will thank you.

THE UGLY:

OK maybe I jumped the gun with The Ugly, but it rolled right off my thumbs.



For Harrahs Diamond Players go visit the Diamond Lounge.  Free food and drinks, I love it.

we stayed here cuz the boy friend was playing in a few of the WSOP tournaments here and + by the time we booked  it waas the cheapest place to stay other than imperial palace which is a major dump( but its located on the strip) i was a bit worried about the suites being majorly outdated and nasty but i made sure to ask the recepetionist for one of their updated suites and it was nice. theres a fridge as well. one fridge is stocked with stuff. and one fridge is empty for ur usage ! their mini bar has sensors or something so don't remove anything just to see. i did it and got dinnged 1 2 bucks lol even though i put it back with in 10 seconds. oh wells.

I stayed at planet hollywood earlier this year in thier studio suite, and all in all I did enjoy the rio much better, the rios bed were much more coomfy !! only down side was.. our room was next to the pool so come saturday morning the music was on full blast ! not good for someone suffering from a major hang over. =) oh and lastly the table limits were really high !! well for my standards they are anyways. the minimun bet for Pai Gow Poker was 50 bucks a hand..woah. 0_o..so needless to say I didnt do much gabmbling there.

as for the VooDoo lounge.  the receptions gave us a stack of those cards that gives u free cover before 10 so we went there twice. since it was freee i enjoyed. but if i had to pay probly not. good music though, just no where to sit, and the crowd was much older.

THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT. My family was robbed while we were in our hotel room sleeping. They stole $500+ cash and my dads Rolex watch. To make things worse, the hotel staff was rude, unhelpful, and condescending when we informed them of the robbery. My family came across two other families that had been robbed the same night as us. This hotel has a racket going on and the hotel management seems to be aware, but is doing nothing to stop it. DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE ROBBED! Also, it smells AWFUL. I wanted to throw up every time I walked in the hotel lobby because of the retched odor

55 a night? Then on a "back to back" reservation (hotel lingo) just 50? No way? Yes way.

You really dont have to venture out of this hotel as most everything you need is right there.

The suite was big, webtv rocks, the mini-bar went empty and it was a party once I started spilling drinks on the sectional couch. Sorry.

Overlooking the pools 26 stories up with no chance of jumping as all the windows are sealed. Piped in air sucks.

The gaming is decent and the floor is large! The restaurants serve good food, especially the RubBBQ! The bars are easy to get a seat at and the bartenders are cool. Best thing are the little platforms around the casino in which the cocktail waitresses either dance or sing on every 15 minutes or so and their scantilly clad outfits are great!

Got a Players card thinking I might spend enough to get a comp on something - no way big spender! 3 days and only 4 bucks in comps. Something stinks in Vegas.

Clean, good service, great pool area with a sandy beach, free shuttle service to the strip, pretty girls, good sportsbook... Im going back soon!

What a dump. In town a couple days visiting relatives and cheaped out as we weren't "doing" Vegas. The room was dirty, shabby and worn out. Mirrors in the elevator and the Elevator sign on the 14th floor we're gang tagged. Puddle of urine on the floor of the self-parking lot elevator. Never again.

In the 90s and 00s, this was was one of my favorite casinos because of the food court glutfest that is the carnival buffet, the flair bartenders with barside video poker that had the double or nothing option (which was the only truly 50-50 odds with no house edge in Vegas), the Bevmertainment servers who dance on little stages between slots, and suites so big you can fit a dozen of your loser friends. 

They still have the glutfest buffet, which is the only reason to come, if you are willing to fork over $45 bucks. But no more dancers, no more flair, and no more double or nothing.  And unless I am mistaken, the rooms don't seem as big. Maybe it is just I who is bigger.  Now the only cool thing is pretending I lost my way and "accidentally" walking into Thunder Down Under to see some ripped australian penis.

Anyhoo, this visit we had someone in a tux intercept us at the hella long check-in line to assist us, and it took a minute to realize it was some Wyndham time share bullshit.  What is this, Cabo??  They're even camped out in front of the room elevators. We will never be back.  For now, we have two more nights of this unnecessary hell, so instead of avoiding and dodging them, I'm gonna shake their hands with a handful of Oobleck and two wet jolly ranchers.

GHETTO.....Ghetto, with a capital 'F' - it's 9:30 on a Sunday night and you would think the casino were the set for a Cheech and Chong movie - more smoke than a magic show, sh*t.  And the rooms - feel like a 70s Holiday Inn (as was just described by someone I work for).

VooDoo lounge - great view - but the place feels like...a club from the 70s, in upstate NY.

Just bad all around - and even better, nothing near it, so hope for a short wait for the shuttle, a short line for a cab, or the temps to dip below 108 to hoof it to the strip for something that has oxygen pumped in, rather than non-existent.

I am not a Vegas pro, but I know trash when I smell it.

Made a reservation at the beginning of this month for a room in August. They charged my card approximately $500 as a deposit, which is fine, but I canceled because I found a better room. They said they would issue a refund and I waited 3 weeks before calling about it.  They told me they refunded my money and that they won't do anything else for me. It has been nearly 3 weeks since they "refunded" the money, but neither my bank or my account reflect this. Now my bank is investigating them for fraud and they are refusing to respond... So it's safe to say you shouldn't trust them or give them any business. Do what you will with this information, just wanted to issue a warning for future guests.

Do NOT stay in the classic rooms.  What a hot mess! The fact that they charge a resort fee of $25.00 more per night for these rooms is a joke.  They are only worth about $25.00 a night.  Ripped wallpaper, torn lampshades in the hallway, broken fixtures in the rooms, cracked bathroom tile, scratched furnishings, etc. Stay anywhere else but the classic rooms at the Rio  "All Suite" hotel.

Although not directly on the strip it is only about a half mile from it about a $5 uber ride. This hotel has 4 flower shaped pools that unfortunately close at 6 no matter what time of year or how hot it is. That was a bummer, I was only there for 1 day and missed the pool.

On the upside parking is not too bad since its not directly on the strip and we had a 2 bed room on the 14th which was comfortable for 4 or 5 people. It had a couch and a lot of floor space. And was not too crazy expensive.

The hotel has aged a lot over the years. I havent been here in several years. Checked in on friday at 4pm had a very long line but went fairly fast with all the windows staffed.

A hotel employee was handing out bottled water to people in line which was a nice for people who needed or wanted them.

The room was very large and comfortable. The bed was a little bouncy and not that firm but ok. There's a coffee pot in the room but no complimentary coffee.

It must be purchased from the in room service refrigerator which automatically charges when items are removed .

The wall paper in the bathroom was peeling next to the sink at the baseboards and the wood borders needed paint.  The room had no walk in shower and only a old style tub with a SHOWER CURTAIN..Really? Everything was clean and no visible mold

Around one of windows was masking tape on the border of the window, not sure if it was to seal an air leak or if it was used to mask when painting, it had paint over spray on it. It had been there for a long time.

The air conditioning worked very well and had a updated digital control.

The gaming floor is large and the hotel is busy on Friday afternoon. I did notice there are a lot more dollar machines then in the past. Not a fan of dollar machines.

There were two things that are very annoying on the gaming floor. They have a company on the gaming floor set up to sell time shares. It's  very annoying, they have set up numerous areas staffed with well dressed individuals who bother people and target couples.

They solicit personal information and you enter a drawing for a new Corvette. They hand out a coupon for a "FREE" two day cruise on the east coast. But it's up to you to get there first , at your cost.

It's all TIME SHARE so beware.!!
It's all TIME SHARE DID I SAY THAT!!!
I DONT CARE IF THEY GIVE ME FIVE GALLONS OF FREE BEER ON THE CRUISE,  I'M NOT SITTING THROUGH A ONE ON ONE SALES PITCH WITH A YELLOW TOOTHED HYPED SALES PERSON PRESSURING ME TO PURCHASE A FRIGGEN TIME SHARE.........HELP!!!!!!!

If I wanted a time share I would of purchased one in the 90's and would of been using it and not vacationing at the RIO.....please no time shares it's annoying and a thing of the past ......TACKY! !

On the second level next to Burger King is a cosmetic business . The employee's stand at the doorway and bother people. They hand out decorative bags that contain skin lotion products,  this is to get you to stop. They then use every tactic to engage you in a conversation to discuss your grooming standards as it relates to skin care products. There trying to get you in the store to solicit products. They will actually  say        " LET ME SHOW YOU SOMETHING INSIDE "
Really??....if I wanted skin care products I would be at the mall......please!!

They have one Starbucks set up on a very small scale kind of hidden next to a set of elevators The employees are working as fast as they can!!.  Extremely long lines, my wife waited 35 minutes in line just to order two coffees. This was on Saturday morning at 10 am.......they need more Starbucks like other casinos set up in various locations in the casino

There are a lot of food options , we ordered from a walk up deli and the line was short, but the wait was just terrible. The order receiver at the cash register was just plain slow and confused. We ordered well done french fries and they were barely cooked, we ordered a cobb salad but it was more like a chef salad.
After ordering it was another long wait to receive the order. They had also forgot to give my wife a drink cup while ordering, she thought it was at the fountain machine which it was not and had to stand in line again to get the cup that WASN'T given to her the first time......ANNOYING and INCOMPETENT EMPLOYEES.   
In the past the hotel had entertainment in the sky with decorative lively entertainers flying around on a ceiling mounted track above the gaming floor , I didn't see any of this on Friday nite. The hotel was just not as lively and boaring. 

The cocktail waitresses were very attentive and very personable and just didn't walk by and yell "DRINKS"
they would actually stop next to you and engage in conversation. 

FIVE DAY PRIOR RESERVATION ON RIOS WEB PAGE.
TOTAL FOR ONE DAY INCLUDING RESORT FEES WAS $163.00  NCLUDING TAXES....DON'T FORGET ABOUT RESORT FEES WHEN YOU BOOK THEY ADD UP DAILY.....

Overall I would rate my experience at the hotel as a THREE I guess.Would I stay here again, maybe!
The vibe was just missing this time!

Thats it!.......

My 2 girlfriends and I went here for a Vegas getaway and it was great.  For being off-strip, it was a great hotel with all the imenities i needed.  The suite was very spacious with the two beds, a sofa and a nice sized bathroom.

Not a bad hotel and casino to stay at quite frankly. Though others seem to have had problems here, my family and I had a real nice stay.

Check in was relatively easy and hassle free. I'm not a fan of the kiosk digital check-in so I recommend waiting in line and seeing a human being in person. The desk person was friendly and professional. 

Our premium two queen bed room\/suite was 600 sq ft and nicely appointed. Some furniture was showing it's age but the room was very clean. It was nice to have the extra space too so we could all spread out and not feel boxed in. It allowed us to relax faster so we rested faster - getting us back out into the casino quicker. 

We had a great meal at the All American Bar and Grill and a meal for the three of us ran about $65 (before tip). That was the best chicken fried steak I have ever had. Well-done!

I am the founder of a tech startup and a regular visitor to Vegas (50+ times). I was late booking my travel to this year's CES conference (January 2015), so had limited options for hotels on\/near the strip. I've stayed at nearly all the hotels on the strip, but for this trip the best option from a cost and location standpoint seemed to be Rio. This was my first booking here. 

Total nightmare. They didn't have my room ready, and finally instead of a Deluxe King room I was put into an older double bed room. It was 40 degrees in Vegas and the heater was broken in my room. I called Maintenence three times to no avail, and finally went down to the front desk to speak with a manager myself. The customer service rep, Joanna, was rude and unhelpful. She told me I would just have to sleep in the cold. The manager, William, said it was a hotel-wide problem, with no heat in any rooms. For $350\/night that is unacceptable. He said he couldn't move me to any other room and offered me $30 for the inconvenience. $30?.... A credit for my stay would be more suitable. Aside from the maintenance and check-in issues, the demeanor and lack of professionalism from the staff was very upsetting. I have never seen that before here in Vegas, where hotels staffs' typical bend over backwards to ensure you have an incredible stay. 

I will not stay at the rio again and do not recommend it. Stay at MGM, Palms, or Mandalay Bay for the same price. Or pay more for the Wynn, Palazzo, Bellagio or Venetian.

Booked a basic king room. Attempted to take a shower ... 15 seconds after i turned on the faucet a bunch of gross black stuff came up from the tub drain... fuckin gross... i am waiting on "engineering" to come to my room to somehow "fix" the problem but it may take about 30 min for smeone tocome up.this is unacceptable. I deserve a clean shower. I went downstairs , showed them the pictures and the guy helping mewasnt even fazed, didnt apologize. He gave me a new "vip room" however it looked exactly the same, maybe a better couch. At least it had a clean shower.

Please check your faucets, drains, showers before using the water.

Rio is a great hotel that has recently been refabbed and cheaper than hotels on the strip.  Like I said, it is off the strip, but I walked back from the stip one day and it really wasn't a long walk.  Great hotel, with cool people and decent nightspots.  Certainly not upscale, but still very nice.

Horrible service.  Best was room service delivered in Styrofoam boxes drinks in plastic cups and plastic utensils.  No class at all. Old tower rooms are OLD. Bathrooms horrible.  Old tub showers.  Rooms dated. No one picks up the phone if you call the desk the bellman etc.  Always on hold 10 or 15 mins.  Spend a few more bucks and stay in a nice place on the strip.  If you complain no one cares

Back in the days when I had to pay for a hotel stay, Rio was no doubt my choice for a hotel.  What can I say, I need my space and it was the only all-suites hotel.  Granted it was off the strip (which is why you can really find some bargain price at certain times of the year), but the free shuttle bus which takes you to Harrah's ( and now Caesars and Bally's) is convenient and saves you the hassle of having to find parking.  

Now that I have so many hotels to choose from for free, I don't stay at the Rio as much.  And with the other hotels updating their rooms to ultra modern with cool shower fixtures, Rio's room just seems so..........unattractive.  

Maybe I am spoiled now and I can no longer stand the water-saving shower head at the Rio.  To make matters worse, it ran out of hot water (it was only lukewarm) by the time I woke up at noon!  I practically shivered the whole time I was in the shower!  What the heck!  How can a hotel run out of hot water???  Then the other time, I woke up to the sound of dripping water!  Holly crap!  It had started raining and our room was leaking.  I couldn't believe it!  It took me a few minutes to find the leak and I called the front desk.  They sent someone to look at it.  but all he could do was placing some towels by the window.  I was too tired to move and thankfully the rain stopped the next day.  

I still go there to play and the free buffet at the World Carnival Buffet is fine when I feel like pigging out, but I haven't stayed there in many many months.  I am wishing very  very hard that they will start renovating their rooms like they are doing with Paris and Flamingo.    After all, I do like Suites!

The room was clean. And that was fine... my complaint is the beds. Not only were they uncomfortable but mine was indented in the middle...like a super fat guy slept in it for a year straight.  So we changed rooms and had the same issue in that room! And another issue is that they need elevators near the end of the hotels! If you are at the last room you better like walking...because it's a long journey to the elevators! Plus everything was on the pricey side. the alcohol in the gift shop is ridiculous!  At least at the orleans the liquor store in the hotel was regular price!the resort fees are too high too! 
Will not stay there again.
Plus they charge and extra 200 you and you have to fight to get it back! Don't stay there or deal with these crooks!
We recently visited your buffet and received outstanding service from one of your employees John Roberson. My family will visit again thank you John.

This hotel disappointed me.  It's out dated!!!  We had comped rooms which I appreciated because I would not have been impressed if I had to pay for them.  Yes, the room was large but it reminded us of a cheap Travelodge with the crazy fabric patterns on the bed, the canopy and wall size window.  We couldn't figure out why they have a window from the shower into the bed area.  Every night I was woken up with lights shining in my eyes when he got up, turned on the light  to use the bathroom.... in the bathroom!  I had a fabulous meal at the Voodoo Restaurant and the view is beautiful.  We then checked out the Voodoo Lounge.  I was surprised how small it was.  The main area is outside on the roof top but it was cold as it was February.  Bottle service, for about $300 is definitely the focus in order for you to get a table.  We danced a little but left as we had to place to sit and the only heaters outside were set up for people who had bottle service outside.  I liked the vibe at Voodoo Lounge and will check it out again when it is warmer.  I'd rather stay on the strip and be within walking distance to other venues.  But thanks for the comped rooms Rio!!!!

I've stayed at The Rio on two Vegas trips, one time back in 2005 and on my most recent trip a few months ago.  

The first time we got to stay at a Masquerade Suite.  The suite was very roomy and had floor to ceiling windows with a wonderful view of the Strip.  Access to the Strip was pretty easy since it had a shuttle that took you to Harrah's and back.  And food-wise, both the Carnival World Buffet and Village Seafood Buffet were good enough to satisfy our hungry stomachs.  I also enjoyed the festive atmosphere in the Masquerade casino area.  It was a great experience.

Fast forward to 2017 the experience was just slightly underwhelming, but still okay for the most part.  This time we stayed in a Classic Suite so the room was much smaller.  Didn't matter too much to me though since I pretty much was only there to rest and sleep.  Amazingly, parking is still free in their self-parking garage.  Since I had a rental car, that was a huuuuuge convenience for me.  The Village Seafood Buffet was no longer a separate buffet and had been absorbed into the Carnival World Buffet.  The downside was that it was only open for dinner only.  Because I had made dinner plans for other places around Vegas, I didn't have time to check out the buffet.

Overall, The Rio has been a good resort to stay at.  I haven't really taken advantage of its amenities because I only stayed there to rest and sleep, but I did like how it's conveniently located within close proximity to the Strip and Chinatown which made it easy to travel by car.

They call this a suite... no microwave, they have a coffee maker, BUT... the coffee for the coffee maker is $8 in the mini bar.  Really.. I paid a $20 + resort fee, plus the room and now you want $8 for the coffee...

No good, don't expect me to spend money in your casino if you nickel and dime me in the room.

The Rio is an economical place to stay that is close to the Strip. It had been awhile since I had been to the Rio, so I was pleasantly surprised with the food choices. Hash House a Go Go is great for breakfast. Split the plate those as the portions are large. The pool area is nice and we had no trouble finding seating, which happens at the larger casinos. Our room was spacious. Overall no complaints about the hotel. The resort fee cost more than the room, which is becoming standard at the cheaper hotels. Don't miss the buffet.. add the seafood cost, well worth the extra $25. You get a whole lobster.

Rio All-Suites Hotel used to be my favorite hotel in Vegas...but now it's getting worse n worse!!!
It used to advertise that it does not charge a resort fee...now it does!!! Not only that even when the room is ready, if want to go in the room before 4pm, u have to pay another $20...other hotels advertise check-in time after 3 or 4 pm, but if the room is ready, they usually give u the room!!! Rio doesn't have to try to squeeze every little bit of money from its patrons!!! Where do they think we gonna spend money if checked-early...in the gambling tables or slot machines...Within the Rio!!!
Instead of services getting better, it's just about how much it could squeeze money out of its patrons!!!
I think this might be my last time I'm staying @Rio!!!
I do expect to lose in gambling but other hotels does it better without making u feel like a piece of meat they could tear into!!! For example, one time I was able to check into Cosmopolitan @8am without them charging early check-in fee!!! Same goes for MGM or Mandalay Bay hotels!!! By checking-in early I lost more money within the hotel I checked into since I was there longer!!!
I have no problems with the rest of services in Rio...but I do wish it would change regarding the early check-in policy because plane does not always follow the exact check-in time!!!

Very disappointed in this hotel. We come twice a year to a convention and have never stayed here... I thought it would be more convenient to stay here this time, so we did. Mistake!!! Checking took 45 minutes, we stood in a long line with only 2 people at the counter. This is unacceptable! Our room was large and comfortable bed, but was overshadowed by peeling wall paper in bathroom and unglued baseboards in the bathroom as well! These are easy fixes that make a huge impression!!!!! The light fixture had a burned out bulb, the light fixtures in the  hallway were new and had white spackling over the old screw holes....How hard would it be to cover those up? Little details make a huge impression. The staff was friendly! Breakfast room service was $61 without a tip for 2 omelets, one cup of coffee ($6), and one bottle of water($5)... RIDICULOUS!!!!!!!

This place nickel and dimes you to death. They have a fancy Keurig in the room but makes you pay for the coffee. Really?!?! Not only is all the food prices inflated,  they charge an extra 8 bucks to get room service. So my chicken bacon wrap was 28 bucks and that's not including tip yet. Even the Starbucks is over priced. The only good thing was the maid that cleaned our room. She was nice and efficient. She even let me have a serving of coffee for the machine. Hope they don't deduct it from her pay. So I left her a nice big tip after the cleanings.

Was there in March for a conference. Due to the conference, and a bunch of other stuff in town, the room rate was $189 for two nights and $289 a third night. Luckily I was on the expense account!

For a conference, it was fine. I spent a lot of time displaying my companies product in the convention area.

The good: lots of good restaurants inside, the Penn and Teller show, the gigantic suite (I paced it off, it must be 20x20), room furnishing and decor, the vibe of the outside pool areas (pretty and relaxing during the day.)

I enjoyed a free trip (on a vendor) to the Voodoo Lounge, Rooftop - Great views at sunset, free drinks and food on the vendor, that was "sweet".

The bad: 

I'm a "young" 49 - i was hoping to see a lot of of young folks whooping it up in the casino and going crazy. The casino seemed to be filled with folks my age and older grinding out nickels and dimes against the dealers. Maybe that was an artifact of the conference I was at.

For some reason, the place seems dated to me (exterior, casino area) although the rooms were decent. 

The check-in process was a nightmare. When my boss got there he had to wait like 20 minutes to get in. "Priority card" holders have their own line. 

Its off the strip - the free shuttle bus to the strip was appreciated, but I always seemed to be riding with a bunch of blue haired seniors from Iron River, WI, or wherever.  I suppose I could have cabbed, but all that riding made me wish I stayed on the strip.

Check in was wonderful.  We upgraded to the renovated tower for an extra $20 a night which was fine since we initially reserved our room at around $60.  

The room itself is nice.  An empty mini fridge is provided for each room.  We save a lot of money by buying some water bottles and snacks.  They have in room internet but it is not wireless.  We had a great view of the pool and strip.

The off strip location can be a good or bad thing.  They do offer shuttle service to Bally's, Paris, and Harrah's around every 30 minutes.  And I mean 20-30 minutes.  I would have wished they had more shuttles operating more frequently, especially since the World Series of Poker was taking place.  However, if you have a car you're good.

Restaurants: Not the best selection.  If you're looking for fine dining, don't eat here.  Although I did like Gaylord India and the wine cellar.  Shopping is not that great here either.

Pool: Loved it.  The crowd was not annoying like they are at some of the pools on the strip.  Also, if you're not a Rio guest but sign up for the total rewards card you can use the pool for free.

Customer Service: Outstanding.  We had an unfortunate incident where we needed a jump to start our car.  Rio guest services and security were so helpful and nice.  

Overall, its a nice hotel.  And if you're thinking of playing at the WSOP I would recommend staying here.

Having worked on Wall Street since the 80's, one knows rumors exist. I've heard for the past few years Caesars (CZR) is going bankrupt. Having played in the WSOP for many years, I have doubted those rumors and continued to be a loyal customer.
Here for a birthday stay, at the Rip and tickets to see Elton tonight.

Conclusion; bankruptcy seems more real. Yesterday, I attempted to order a bottle of wine from room service. The recording said room service is closed between 1-4.

Ok...no $80 for a $25 bottle for me.

Today, ordered breakfast. A lovely woman, who has worked here 25 years delivered a paper bag with $65 worth of crummy food on paper plates. She was embarrassed, said their policy changed in the Summer. Said it might be time to retire.

For me, time to see what Mr. Adelson or Mr. Wynn is doing. Never coming back.

#nomorerio
#CZR
#beancounterskilledmyhotel
i would say for the price its worth it. It is a older hotel, but the size and cleanliness makes up for it. Staff are pretty nice. Pool is not too bad.. its pretty chill here.

Sal si puedes. 

From a business trip perspective, this place was major fail.

I was here for a conference, related to internet commerce. Hey, guess what didn't work? Give up? 'K, I'll tell you.  Internet. 

The people at the check-in counter were happy to announce that the hotel had recently upgraded to wifi. Recently? This should have been done a long time ago, not last week. See my last review from two years ago, regarding no internet.

If it wants to host conferences, the Rio needs to be able to support the conference's needs.  I was refunded the $14\/day internet access fee, as were most other conference-goers who complained I'm sure, but it cost the guests much more than that. It cost them their business, as virtual meetings and skype calls, and even simple activities like checking email, could not be done. 

And for $200\/night to stay there? No. 

There remain two redeeming features of the Rio.

* Gaylord's Indian restaurant. Completely decent Indian food at completely decent prices, in a well-appointed space. Totally overlooked and underappreciated by most Rio guests as they surge  frantically towards the All-Murkin bar and grill.  And because so few people dine there, they don't have the staff to handle moderate traffic from the all-murkin bar and grill spillover at lunchtime. Poor guys. I say to them: Sal Si Puedes.

* The second feature is the free shuttle, because it takes you *away* from the Rio. SAL SI PUEDES!

Old style Vegas showroom set-up, nice to see. Pity we were in the cheap seats. And additional pity that the dress code in Vegas means the floor show patrons felt that shorts, sandals, and BALL CAPS were appropriate. Ball caps. Really.

We checked in online after requesting a king size bed with the reservation. We checked in at the kiosk when we arrived and were told to wait until until 3:00 to get the keys. Confirmed at that time it was a king sized bed. Checked in again at 3:00 at the kiosk. Confirmed it was a king sized bed. Got to the room....no...two queens. 26th wedding anniversary and we are sleeping separately. Safe is locked from previous occupant. Sitting here waiting for the engineer. Don't stay here. Hotel response was to go to a different hotel.

Penn & Teller show 
Didn't stay at this resort, just came for the Penn & Teller show because magic is awesome!
When we walked through the resort, it looked nice and I wouldn't mind staying here.  It's off the strip but there's a free shuttle which drops you off at Harrahs, I think...

The auditorium for the show was very nice, the lobby as well, I like the lights \/ chandeliers.

Mixed bag on our stay.    Good price, but heads up at check-out....

Price-wise, got a heckuva good deal for stay from Sept 1 - 5 --  $29 for each of the first four nights and $99 for the last night (a Friday).  Not bad!  Their website did state there was a $13 per night resort fee which -- according to the website --  included wi-fi, pools and workout room.  That was OK with us, given the good price we got on the room and we did use the wi-fi every night before going to sleep.  But we used ONLY the wi-fi, not the other offerings. (More on this below...)   The room itself was good, not great.  Big room, comfy bed, and we really liked the floor-to-ceiling windows.   We didn't have any cleanliness issues as some previous posters mentioned, and our room was cleaned daily.    Front desk staff was nice at check-in (see below for my check-out story), and we got lucky with valet service and didn't have to wait long for either drop-off or pick-up the entire week.

NOW the downside. 

First, if you're on a budget, get your meals somewhere else.  The restaurants are outrageously priced -- at the All-American Bar and Grill, burgers and one beer each for two for $50?  Seriously??    Yeah, I could have gone to Burger King upstairs for cheap burgers, but who the hell wants to eat that in Vegas??  None of the few other on-site places were any better price-wise and as a result, we didn't eat at the Rio after that so I can't review the other places. 

Second,  go elsewhere to play slots.  The machines at the Rio were extremely  tight the entire week.    I realize that slots anywhere are pretty much a losing proposition, but most places have machines that pay back a little to keep you interested. Not the Rio.  Not once did I hear anyone yell or whoop over a big win, and all the discussion I heard while walking the floor was how ridiculous it was that no one was winning even a small amount. 

Third, and most important --- DO NOT USE QUICK CHECKOUT !!!  GO TO THE FRONT DESK TO CHECK OUT because you might find -- as did I -- that there may be a significant increase in what they intend to charge you.  When I went to check out, they tried to charge me $25 per night resort fees, saying that the original $13 was "only for Wi-Fi".    I stated that their website said only $13 per night, and the clerk started arguing with me.  When I explained to her that I used only wi-fi during our stay and should be charged only $13 anyway, she insisted that I was lying to her.  I then pulled out my tablet, went to their website and SHOWED HER on their website where it said $13 -- no mention of $24.99.    Even then, she said, "Well, you should have told check-in that you were going to use only wi-fi."    I replied with the point that their website AND the person who took my phone reservation both stated that resort fees were $13 per night.   It's not like this was just $2 or $3 we were talking about -- it was $60.   

After all that, she got rude and huffy, yanked my room keycards from my hand, and started pounding away on the keyboard.   She then came back with a figure that was still way over what it should have been.  When I asked about THAT, she loudly exhaled and said "Your rate was $49 per night Monday through Thursday and $129 for Friday."   I said, "Uh, no," and produced a printout of the reservation emailed to me after I placed my reservation over the phone.     She again got exasperated, took the paper from my hand, and said "Well, I guess I have to give it to you at that rate."   By now, I was starting to get upset and replied, 'Yeah, I guess you do."  Oh, she did not like that.  It was as if I was taking the money directly from her pocket.  Finally, after nearly 20 minutes at the counter, I paid the rate I HAD BEEN QUOTED, she printed the receipt, slapped it on the counter and said, "Here."   No "thank you", no "sorry for any confusion,"  nothing.  I contemplated asking for a supervisor, but my wife tugged at my shirt and said, "Let's just go. There are other places to stay next time."   And she was right.  

We go to Vegas at least once a year for a golf vacation, and despite the good rate I was quoted and finally ended up paying after persistence,  I don't think the Rio will be on our list of places to stay again.  The other things -- high prices at restaurants and tight slots -- I can overlook those.  After all, there are other places in Vegas to eat and gamble.  What I can NOT overlook is the fact that they tried to stick me for  nearly an additional $170 above the quote I got on the phone.   Maybe the clerk was having a bad day...  I'd be willing to cut her some slack if that was the case or there was some error in tabulating my stay. But when she got rude with me, my benevolence went out the window.     I was polite with her through the entire discussion, getting a bit flippant ONLY when she reluctantly  told me that she was  charging me what I was quoted.    My only regret is that I wish I had taken the time to get her name.

I'm sure you can do a lot worse in Vegas, but I was a bit disappointed in my stay at the Rio. Maybe my expectations of the Rio are outdated, just like their room decor. Seriously, avoid the Masquerade Towers... at least the 19th floor, unless you're craving extreme nostalgia from the early 90's. Sparsely decorated room, hideous drapes, worn out couch, CRT TV, and a toilet that moves when you sit on it. Totally misrepresented by the pictures on their website. I'll give it its size though, but really the rest of it made me not want to be in the room that much. Plus for having an empty fridge for personal items. Majority table limits were $10 minimum too, even in the mornings. Maybe check out Gold Coast next door if you're looking for cheaper tables. The free shuttle to Bally's or Harrah's is convenient and definitely welcome, considering Rio isn't really walking distance to anything. It runs 10am-1am every 30 min. Also, the Show in the Sky wasn't performing the weekend we were there either. Kind of hard pressed to recommend staying here unless you score an awesome deal or are getting comped.

Not the most glamorous place on the strip with the most beautiful people, but it will do.....  Our room was clean, but wasn't up to par with some of the other Vegas hotels I have stayed in recently.  We were in a remodeled tower, but I felt like our room was already crumbling. Although it was large, the room lacked character. We were on the 4th floor, and heard loud music all night long, so it was difficult to sleep, but hey it's Vegas I guess I wasn't supposed to be in the room and trying to sleep. The front desk staff was kind and efficient but the check-in line was SOO long and I felt they could have used way more check-in staff. I would stay there again in a bind, but it won't be my first choice.

I stayed here one night (03\/30 - 03\/31) and reserved the deluxe king room. Got a great rate on the room, i wasn't expecting something that nice but I was surprised with how clean the room was. The layout was great, clean bedding and comfortable mattress. I would definitely stay here again! The only thing I would change about my stay here was my visit to the buffet. For the price, I've had better tasting buffets for less.

I recently went to Vegas for my bachlorette party in early December. I booked Rio because for 4 girls, 2 rooms with a strip view the total was $400 that's a $100 each! We stayed over during the weekend and by comparison this was the best deal.

I was really confused with picking a place to stay at in Vegas but looking at some of the pictures and a map of the Rio I decided to stay here once I noticed the price was so great! 

The rooms were cool, we stayed at the imperial suites the "strip view" was lame but the beds were comfy room service was great! and we were glad Chippendale's was downstairs--- it made for our easiest night out! 

The CONS to this place,
you're forced to cab it everywhere-- that or take the shuttle everywhere definitely NOT walking distance to anything. 

If you were as confused as I was when booking I'd recommend staying at 
The Paris hotel
or
The Venetian 

My 2 favorite places while I was there! My next trip I will definitely book there! 

Rio was okay for what it was and my bridesmaids were happy as it was everyone's first time in Vegas so it wasn't a total miss we all made it work but I'd definitely pay a little more to be on the strip next time.

I was here as it was the host hotel for a training seminar. The hotel is starting to show its age. Food prices are what you would expect to pay in a hotel...pricey. What I wasn't prepared for was the $9.00 basic cocktails at any of the casino bars.

The rooms are large and kept clean. The bed was very comfortable...it is the decor that could use an updating.

WOOHOO!!! RIO!!! I love this place. You don't need Dubai or make a city the center of Las Vegas, you just need to make customers happy.

I am here, right now, for a Video Poker Tournament and MMA XPlosion Fight Event. My friends will arrive early Saturday morning and I think I am going to enjoy this hotel room to myself. Since I am in the tournament, I am staying and got a $50 for free. 

I got a nice view of the Pool Area and the freeway and strip. The only problem I have is the Ice Machine. The Ice Machine is broken. Its hot outside and NO ICE. I will have to knock off a star. I am on the Impanema Tower. Not sure what the other tower is called, but that's the building you see from the freeway. I am resting comfortably. Its a big suite, but I don't know what a classification of a sweet is these days.

Umm, I checked in about 11am and I was surprised they let me in early. Some hotels you have to wait until 4pm. So, I will add back the star for a PERFECT 5 STAR. You made me not wait in the heat. 

Have Fun here and Keep Yelping!!

Small Update (07-18-10): They fixed the Ice Machine...lol..It should be 6 Stars Now...lol..

First time at Rio - check in at 5 took 20 minutes - now at taxi everyone trying leave Rio - this place suck & will never stay again - I stay cuz of friends - not worth my time or money!!! Stay away if u under 35

Here is a rundown of the hotel:

Rooms -  Stayed in a studio suite in the Ipanema tower.  Overall, the room was very spacious and attractive.  The rooms in this tower seem to have been upgraded so all the fixtures and furniture were all modern looking.  As everyone else said, their were a few things, chipped tiles in the bathroom, a faint smell of smoke coming through the vents...however, we enjoyed our stay in the room.  I say, if you can, stay in the Ipanema tower.

Casino - We were here the during the week, Tue - Fri so things were pretty quite.  This casino is my Stepdad's favorite since Harrah's likes to comp him handsomely for his play.  In fact, we didn't have to pay for any of the room or lodging on this trip.  All of the tables seem to be 10 min.  They should think about changing them to $5 since they are not a strip hotel.  When leaving on Friday, more people were coming in and the casino did liven up.  However, the casino itself is small compared to other Vegas casinos.  All in all, I had fun playing the Quick Hit penny slots and won about $200.

Pool -  Awesome pool for the kids...not sure how good it is for adults, not a whole lot of action in way of pool party fun but then again, we weren't there on the weekend.  Also, from the pool is where you can tell how deteriorated the façade of the hotel has become.  A few concerns, there were drink cups all over the "sandy" part of the pool.  A dirty diaper on the stoop under the water fall, however, after mentioning it to the staff, these things were taken care of but in my opinion, these things should have been caught before the pool opened. 

Food - The American Bar and Grill is the best place to eat in the casino, hands down.  Solid steaks and prime rib.  Great burgers...their BBQ wings are the bomb.  The buffet doesn't look like it is the gem it used to be.  So my recommendation is to eat at the American Bar and Grill...sure it is a little pricey but if you are up late playing in the casino, it is your only bet and the staff at the bar are really, really friendly.

Shuttle - They do have a shuttle that drops you off at either Bally's \/ Paris or Harrah's.  Do Harrah's as it is in the middle of the strip and not the beginning where Bally's is.  The shuttles run every 30 minutes, give or take.

All in all, we had a great time at the Rio.  I don't know if the bad reviews (dirty rooms) stem from the Masquerade tower...also, the staff at the Rio were very nice and accommodating.  I would recommend this the Rio to my friends and I would stay again 

All in all, we had a great time at the Rio.

Luckly everything was booked my Dad's boss.
We got a presidential suite with 2 other families. 
3 bedrooms and 1 huge livingroom.
Clean and it gives you great deals like free concert tickets.
We got couple concert tickets to see Bi-Rain(Korean Pop Star).
Steam room in the shower was pretty cool.

This review is mainly for the casino portion of Rio, especially for people gambling younger than 30. I was disappointed at how the staff treated my group as one member notified us that if we showed our ID to the front desk we would receive a wristband to show we were 21+ and thus would not be asked to have our ID seen again. This was completely wrong as we were asked for ID every 5 minutes after that. It was very annoying in the middle of our turn to stop and pull out our ID for every single member in our group. We asked what are these wristbands for then? And every time we got that it didn't matter. If one of your staff is going to tell us one thing and then everyone else just blows it aside I would try another casino where they are more consistent.
In addition, ventilation is very poor. Smells like smoke EVERYWHERE even in the buffet which is a disappointment bc the food was good but it's connected to the casino so it smells horribly and throws the taste off. I ended up getting sick because of the ventilation and second hand smoking and had a bad cough and allergies\/runny nose. 
Other than that the rooms are nice and food WOULDVE been good...

Been meaning to leave feedback . The hotel
Rooms are big which is nice but was very disappointed with the showers . They had tons of mold. When I told the front desk at check out there was not even an apology or nothing just "will
Let housekeeping know" .
Was here for the Penn and Teller show. The Rio seemed outdated and smelled like stale cigarettes.

This place is a far cry from what it used to be 20 years ago. The casino floor, cocktail waitresses, decor, food and accommodations have all taken a big hit. 

We got a King Suite from a Groupon offer. If it weren't for that the room would have been grossly overpriced. If there wasn't the 'Resort Fee' tagged on it actually would have been a good deal and warranted a higher rating. The furniture was run down and TV was in the most awkward position. Housekeeping was adequate, asked for extra towels but never got them.

The best thing I can say was that room service was spot on. I got exactly what I asked for in a timely Manor. The only thing missing, which even the front desk couldn't provide, was a itemized receipt of the room service charges.

To call this a poker "room" would be a farce. It's more of a warehouse. You'll find any game or tournament you want to play. You'll see the WSOP. You'll walk behind the Grinder and say wassup. You'll watch Patrik Antonius win a 100k pot. You'll be at a fun table all watching games and mucking hands. Service really sucks for such a prestigious place, but the dealers are the best around. The walk from the strip can be a bitch in 100 degree weather, but it's well worth it.
Nice clean modern rooms. Great views. Take advantage of the shuttle system. Had a great time during my stay at the Rio.

Sounds like people's reviews are divided between which tower they were in. I was in the happy fun tower (Ipanasomethingorother). The room was HUGE and really nice. We had huge windows that had a view of the hotel and pools (which were closed since it was December). We also went to the Voodoo lounge, which was a lot of fun (though I was pretty drunk as that was the end of the evening for us . .. but I do recall that being on the roof was AMAZING). There's a free shuttle to all the other Harrah's resorts. The restaurants, gambling, and shops in the Rio are only okay, but the room is great, and a lot cheaper than other hotels. We didn't spend much of our time at the Rio itself. The room? 5 stars. The rest of the place? 2 stars. It averages out.
Four stars: The buffet is good. I won money playing the slots. 'Tis all.
Terrible Service and no Coca Cola?? Cashier's treat non platinum members like dirt, dealers try to take valid bets, housekeeping well pretty close to an urban legend.

It took damn near 30-45 minutes to check in.  That was terrible especially when I was tired and cranky already. 

A first glance walking in the room it looks decent. However I'm not finding the cleanliness of the room to my liking. The bathroom floor I could still see hair from the previous guest. The shower is a lil grimy for my taste. The drawers weren't cleaned out very well. The linen had small rips in them. Carpet had a few stains here and there. 

On top of that they charge a resort fee. The hotel fee is already pricey then you lump another fee on top smh To put the icing on the cake they needed an additional $75 per day for incidentals...well there goes my shopping money. Would I recommend? I'm not totally sold.

Pretty average, nothing special here when compared to other hotels in the area.  Location is close to the strip, but the walk is inconvenient, but it is close enough that you don't feel like you need to call a cab.  A Mardi Gras theme and lots of bars inside if you are into the nightlife but none of them were packed while I was there.

This was my first time ever staying here. I highly recommend this hotel. First of all, it's  huge and doesn't feel too crowded. The entire staff has been extremely friendly and pleasant. Everyone says hi to you when you walk by. From security, to house keeping, and etc. I felt like they truly care about their guest here and wanted to make sure you were having a good time.  Just straight up nice and not trying to sell you anything. We booked a Deluxe mountain view room online and got a complimentary upgrade when we checked in Sunday night. Our room was amazing! Lots of space and big windows. I'm writing this review as I am currently staying here now and I don't check out until tomorrow. The pools are amazing as well.  Lots of space and music wasnt too loud. It was actually very relaxing. Skip the deli, we had the Philly cheesesteak that someone recommended and it was really gross. Very dry and barely even had cheese. I recommend eating at the pho place and getting the fried egg rolls.

Should be called Rio All-Yuck Hotel & Casino.

Had to stay here for a conference, and the rooms suck balls.  Major balls.  I liken the rooms here to rooms in Reno, Nevada and that's not a compliment.

Sure the room is larger then my apartment, but the tacky window between the bedroom and the shower, obviously not clean sheets, a couch I wouldn't even put my suitcase on, and the musty stench were deal breakers.  

Every time I got in a cab and said I was going to the Rio, I would hide my head in shame.

To be fair, I was in the old tower, but the new conference wing was REALLY nice and so were the new villas I saw from the window.

I was excited to stay at the famous Rio this last weekend with a friend. However, upon entering the room there was great disappointment. The room was very dusty, wall paper in the bathroom was ripped, face plate on the electric outlets were cracked\/broken, and the bath tub was so small I could only fit 1\/3 of my body at a time. No paper or pen to make notes on. What happened to this place?? 
All and all a VERY BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!

My wifey\/roomie is a baller with the Rio and its affiliates so me and my Joy Luck Club Crew rolled through Diamond status stylez.... 

The suite was very nice, and I could say it is a notch below my current fave, Venetian in terms of room size and noise level. We were on the 18th floor though so that may make a difference. 

The casino is a bit smokey for my taste, but the ammenities and service were great. The buffet is pretty good, plus we got in quick with diamond status. Voodoo, the club upstairs was small, but the rooftop was tight!! Too bad there was a seriously cold wind frenzy that night, but we chilled anyways. 

People were mixed and chill compared to the upscale clubs on the strip. I would probably go here before the "hot spots" because unless you are top model status and like to wait around for a long as time to get denied, this will fulfill you dancing spirit's thirst!
Had a great time staying here this weekend! Didn't win any money, but hey. Awesome shuttle service and super friendly staff!

I love this place! Came here for a friend's 21st birthday and had a blast. The rooms were ridiculously nice (Just don't touch anything in the fridge no matter how drunk you are because most of the mini bottles are $10+!) 

We ended up walking to Walgreens on the strip and buying a bottle of Gin and I bought some wine. Now that's more like it.

Total Rewards: Unethical, bait and switch, double charging.

Trying to cancel or change the reservation is a nightmare. The communication, on the website, email, and over the phone is vague and dishonest.  It's just bad business.  

The link in the email to change or cancel doesn't work.  When we called, David (he was from Total Rewards, which is the website used by Rio to make reservations) was relentless in giving us sales pitches, trying to overcharge us.  Spent 1\/2 hour on the phone arguing.  

Finally, he changed the dates at a reasonable rate.  He charged an extra deposit on the card, not taking into account the original deposit.  

Checked the website and there was no total for the rooms available. We called back to try and cancel the whole thing.  She said there was only the first deposit of $26.66 was charged and no record of the $39.20 that David charged.  Got the cancellation email, but no dollar amount listed that was refunded.

Now we have to find out from the credit card company to find the $39.20 David charged and fight to get that back.

Update:  A manager at Caesar's Entertainment was very helpful.  He clarified the information to make clear what had happened and got us a good deal on another property.  The lesson is, contact Ceasar's Entertainment directly and don't deal with Total Rewards.

This place will never see me again. Added fees upon check-in. Long wait to check in on a Wed. afternoon. The couch was horrible, you sink in so far its' stupid. Tried to eat dinner at the American bar and grill, and at 5:30 was told you can't sit in the restaurant because they only have one server. They sat us in the bar with loud tvs and yelling people. Immediately got up and left that scene. Tried the buffet, which was adequate but nothing special. The best part was we got a bottle of wine for only $12. The worst part...they have a coffee machine in the room, but refuse to give you coffee. You have to pay $9 for a single serving cup...RIDUCULOUS! That alone is enough to piss you off and make sure you never come again. Only one roulette table in operation in the casino. Wayfinding is bad, even for a big casino in Vegas. Outdated rooms, and didn't want to inspect the cleanliness too closely. Let me see, they have one show just for women, and one show just for men, so couples are screwed if they want to see a show appropriate for both sexes. This is my worst review ever, so I'll stop now.

Rooms were great except THEY TOOK THE COFFEE POTS AWAY! Really? It is "to encourage guests to go downstairs and buy coffee"!!! So one goes downstairs to get coffee and the lines are super long and it takes an hour to get a cup of coffee. NOT HAPPY!!

Only thing good about this place is once a year WSOP is here. Otherwise it's ok but definitely not my fav. I
Kind of out of the way from other casinos

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #48:
coming into this place via one of the parking garages, I thought I was really going to hate it, because there is definitely a "game show" and "carnival cruise" vibe to the one end of the casino - loud & obnoxious were the words that came to me; but on further exploration, it's not so bad; first off, the property is huge, and there's another part of the casino that is more my speed, especially the hottie dealers, waitresses, and go-go girls in the center; has a very nice & lively sports book, with a decent deli\/grill adjacent for chow; affordable shopping on the floor above the casino level; a lot of mid-level bachelorette parties roaming about, probably due to the Chippendales show; really liked the classy vibe at the Wine Cellar & Tasting Room, but sadly it was pretty empty; best craft beer bet = the restaurants & bars have pretty standard\/boring fare, but thankfully, there is a sundries store & a liquor store on premesis, both with a worthy selection of craft bottles to go; overall, probably worthy of 3.5 stars, but just can't give it 4

the rio is off from the strip in the back of cesar's palace sorta .. when we first arrived we waited about 20 to get our car parked .. its super expensive they overprice lil to much but the buffet inside is delicious & HUGE but paid OVER 300$ for 6 people BUT ate for the whole weekend with our wrist bands they give you  just show them and your in (breakfast dinner and lunch ) doesn't apply for mon-Thursday Tho .. our sweet was decent but beds were kinda hard   .. the lobby is huge & the staff & security wasn't rude or anything ..  wouldn't recommend any gambling tho at this hotel tho .. not going give the 5 star cuz of our wait to register in & Cuz it's off from the strip

It was a comfortable Suite and clean...Definately could use some newer furniture...Having a refrigerator was handy and easy access to the lobby with Starbucks right there.....Pho restaurant was good and reasonable for Vegas...The combo pho had a tasty broth and the Bun had delicious grilled chicken...Noodles were overcooked in both dishes...Hash House has ginormous portions but flavors aren't there....Good to share a meal that is basic just to refuel...Otherwise make the trek to the Peppermill near the Stratosphere...We chose to not use housekeeping and they gave us a,10.00 food credit..Loved that!...Shuttle is convenient and takes you center strip Harrah's....Easy pick up and drop off for Uber and Lyft...Cost for L yft was about $13.00 from the airport....I left a blouse behind on the bed that was new and called to report...I was directed to a form on the website that would not allow me to submit...Some kind of glitch they are aware of...I called back and left a detailed message and outgoing message said to leave details if you were unable to submit lost and found report...Hmm so you know about the glitch in your system!...Then the recording says "due to high volume of calls they will only return your call if they found your item .. They basically set it up so they Don't have to do anything about getting you your lost item. .I still gave them 4 stars and I think that is generous with or without the lost item situation....I would appreciate a response as I expect more from a Total Rewards property...They are typically amazing when it comes to customer service..  Overall a good stay and if you like the quiet away from the strip then this is your spot...
Smells gross in our supposed non smoking room. Only one elevator is working. Had to wait 20 minutes to go downstairs. Would not stay here again.

All in all, the Rio isn't a bad place to stay in Vegas. If the exact same property were located directly on the strip, I think I would consider returning.  But since it's located off strip and the property is in need of a fresh coat of paint and some serious Sin City cool-factor rebranding, I wouldn't stay here again. Customer service here is decent, other than the long lines for check-in\/out. The rooms are nice, all suites, which was the selling point for me for booking there. Housekeeping seemed a little confused about what towels were required in room. One day we had towels and bathmat, but no washcloth, and another we had washcloths, but no bath mat. 
I'm not a big gambler, and the casino felt a little sad (although to be fair I think all casinos seem a little sad). The cocktail waitresses may don the trashiest and skimpiest waitressing outfits in Vegas, and it felt contrived and pathetic when the loud drumming starts up every 15 minutes one of said cocktail waitresses has to get on a stage and dance for her life. I did appreciate that whenever I sat down to gamble for more than a couple minutes, a server would come by to take my drink order. Other than the buffets, the restaurants are pretty scarce including a forlorn and grungy McFadden's. The four pools (including one private topless pool) were rather nice, and offered great people watching. 
The Rio is definitely showing its age and as anyone in Vegas knows, once the years are showing, it's time to reinvent yourself and get some work done, or get out of the business.

This place is a dump that should be condemned by the health department. Just stayed there my room was dirty, paint chips falling from the ceiling and today I learned that they've had an outbreak of Legionnaires Disease they've known about for months but haven't bothered to inform new guests about. Disgraceful.

The Rio Poker Room is in need of new management, to put it lightly. Everyone knows well managed poker rooms expand and earn money and respect, increase player counts, and make more money.

The dealers were the biggest disappointment. I would advise players seek another location, because the local players at the Rio do not have enough money to win anyway. I felt as though I was in a trailer park game room. Believe me I wish it was a better experience. It was the 4th time we stayed there in 4 months.

I do not plan on staying at the Rio or playing in there poker room, tournaments excluded of course.

Other table games like craps, blackjack, etc. are very professional and knowledgable. Both the Venetian and Bellagio are poker rooms to learn from.

Venue: Rio All Suites Hotel & Casino

Decor: Red, Purple, Blue(ish)
 
Service:  Decent
 
Environment:  A Younger Vegas
 
Food:  Different venues (Whopper Bar, Village Seafood buffet)
 
Prices:  Not too bad
 
Debbie Downers:Perhaps it needs to be on the strip but then again off the strip isn't too bad depending how you look at it.
 
Conclusion:  Great thing it is right off I-15 on Flamingo.  Plentiful parking, decent entertainment venue, rooftop lounge (Voodoo) overseeing the skyline.  Huge Pool area.  It is an above average hotel & casino for your food, lodging and entertainment needs.  Carries multiple of shows.  Options between the Masquerade Tower or Ipanema.  A viable option to stay if you choose to stay off the strip.  
 
Overall: B

Stayed there for business, and felt they DO NOT care about customers.

Front desk was RUDE.
I guess he was dumped by someone the night before.
I dont really care about fancy tv or huge bed as long as its  CLEAN.
The room was dirty, smell, and orange juice in my glass, seriously?
called front desk, and someone said "I do not have anything available" when I was still speaking and trying to let her understand the room was pretty messy.

Wont go back again, you can get a better place on the strip for less.

Waited for the Rio Shuttle to Bally for around an hour. When I called the customer service, they informed me that the shuttle service has discontinued from November 6. There were no signs notifying that the shuttle was discontinued, and many other hotel guests were wasting their time as well.

I stayed here recently when a friend came to town ( I am a local) . I booked via the total rewards website and wanted a king bed and strip view. Upon arriving I was treated like royalty by the guy at the front desk. My room was not ready as I had requested early check in. He made a call and found a room that was ready. 

The room was HUGE but a bit dated. The views were great and it was fun seeing the zipliners going across and back. They are braver than me. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean.

There are some great games in the casino and some really tasty places to eat. I left a review of the buffet as well.

I won a bit of money and used the shuttle to go to the strip. It is free and easy.

If you want a fun show they have a few here as well including chippendales, Penn and teller and Rock of ages.

The one complaint is that they took out the free air float show. I was really looking forward to seeing that and only the tracks are still there. This is why I took off a star as that is lame and they need to start that show up again.

Tried to get on internet for work had trouble all evening... Rooms and bathroom are big but bare so remember to ask for additional towels and toiletries. No breakfast buffet as the buffet opens at 11am and considered as lunch.

Do not stay here!

40 minute wait to get checked in and then the keys didn't work.
35 minutes to get a new key.
I was here for a meeting. I would never recommend this place to anyone.
Check in online and the wait was only 25
Minutes.
While we were there we heard that the 
Parent company Caesars declared bankruptcy. The disrepair and lack of staff 
made sense.
The restaurants weren't bad. Expensive though.

Visit:

Thursday March 20, 2003

We had an epic room and the trip started out with me and a coworker and a local friend who showed up. We wound up going clubbing at the Beach and Rain and other spots, but that's another story. :)

This hotel was great, we were up on the upper most floors and as this is an all suite hotel we had an Epic view of Las Vegas as well as a kitchen, giant tub, couch, great TV and a stereo in the room. At the time, one of the nicest suite hotels and our room had just been redone. Service was excellent. The staff was great. We had one small problem with the bathroom which they resolved within 15 minutes. I was really impressed. This stay would be among my first of many, many stays to come. :)

You know that one aunt who always insists that you celebrate family holidays at her off-the-beaten-path, kind-of dated home that reeks of stale cigarettes and Old Milwaukee but you don't bother arguing because it's free and fits the whole family? 

Yeah, well Rio is the Las Vegas hotel equivalent of that.

It's not on The Strip, the decor is tired, but how can you argue their prices for a full suite? The rooms here are gigantic and comfortable to lounge in without feeling like you're just chilling in a bedroom. Speaking of beds, theirs are incredibly comfortable (or maybe I'm just enjoying not having dog paws in my back all night long, ha!).

All the usual suspects manifest on the casino floor with fair table minimums, unlike some of the bigger guys on the strip. $15 blackjack hands are completely feasible. My beef with Rio's casino is their self-serving policy of single deck rules while dealing from a six deck shoe. As if the house didn't already have the advantage!

Speaking of bending over the hotel guests, I paid $3.85 for a 12 ounce Pepsi in their gift shop this morning. Jeeeeeeez.

Please streamline your valet, Rio. It's a fantastic complimentary perk to offer, however the wait to have your car retrieved is generally ten minutes. I can only imagine that a huge resort like this could implement more creative ways to provide better service in this one area. Allow guests to scan their valet ticket to your valet desk on their way down from the room? There's got to be a better mouse trap. 

All-In (that's Hold 'Em speak, ya'll) we really enjoy Rio. We'll see you again next time we visit.

The Rio continues to do an excellent job of running the WSOP each year.  With so many events, players, fans, press, etc. you'd think it would be far more chaotic.  Luckily, the Rio has their crap together which allows poker fans like me to get up close and personal with the pros, but with enough security around so no one goes ape sh*t after suffering a bad beat to Hellmuth and witnessing his over-the-top celebration.

Besides that, the Carnival Buffet is damn near top-notch, which is evident by the fact that we ate there twice within 5 hours (get the Buffet of Buffets pass).  Give us a break!  They had changed out MOST of the entrees by then, ha ha...

Where to start with the Rio Hotel & Casino. Usually my wife and I stay on the strip or Fremont Street but we have a baby on the way so we decided to do this Vegas trip on a bit of a budget ($30.00\/night on Kayak.com) .Both of us have been coming to Vegas for over 10 years and have experienced many types of hotels, dining, and entertainment here. 

We arrived right around check-in time. We got lucky in the sense that only about 5 people were in front of us waiting to check in but we still waited almost 30 minutes to get to the front desk despite the fact that there were four or 5 agents checking people in. While we were waiting the line to check in grew to twenty plus waiting to check in and I started to feel glad that we arrived when we did. During check in we were informed that there was a $20,00\/night "resort fee". So much for getting the room for 30 bucks a night. If we had not already paid through kayak.com we probably would have went somewhere else for 50 a night. 

The resort fee also included 2 complimentary entries into the gym. The gym is located in the spa so I guess if you go more than twice you have to pay. We were there three days so I used it twice. Also included in the resort fee was internet service. You still have to "pay" a charge of $13.95 when you connect but it gets comp'd when you check out. Of course they don't tell you this so the first time you try to use it you are left wondering how it works and have to call the front desk to ask why you are being charged when the internet is included in the resort fee. Seems it would be much easier to either explain how it works at check in or place an instruction sheet in the room. Either way my wife and I bot have smart phones and rarely need a laptop while traveling so it would be nice to have the option of purchasing the internet or not instead of having it included in a resort fee.

Our room was located high on the 37th floor which we thought would be great since it is away from the noise of everything. We were sadly mistaken. Turns out the rooftop nightclub is only 5 floors above us. We got in a little after midnight the fist night and could hear bass reverberating throughout the room. We could clearly hear partying going on as well. We called the front desk to ask what time the club closed and were told 2 am. 2 am comes.... the club does not close. It finally stopped around 3:30 am. We complained the next day and were told that the club pretty much shuts down whenever people leave. There were apparently no similar room s to move us into they let us upgrade to a 1600 sq ft suite for an additional $60.00 a night. Our $100.00 original lodging cost on kayak.com has now turned into $300.00 after the cost to upgrade and pay for the resort fee.

The Rio has lots of pools which is nice and several hot tubs. One of the pools even features and artificial beach which was nice. One thing that really drew us to the Rio was that they featured an adults only (21 and up) pool area with cabanas and reserved round sofa type areas. We were first disappointed to learn that the adults only pool area was closed Tuesday and Wednesday (two of the three days we were there). We went on Thursday planning to rent a cabana for what we figured would be an hourly charge only to find out that they are free but have a $250.00 bar minimum for the cabanas and a $100.00 minimum for the sofas. A little steep I think for the quality of hotel the Rio is. I would have paid 50 for an hour  but you would have to stay all day at the pool to rack up $250 bucks in drinks. We ended up just using the regular lounge chairs which were much nicer that the non-adult side. The adult pool was nice and large and there were two hot tubs as well. One thing I noticed about the Rio is that they are big on go-go dancers. You see them throughout the hotel and we also saw them at the adult pool. Kind of interesting but a little strange as well to have them out at the pool.

We came and went a lot since we drove and the hotel is just off the strip. One thing that really threw me off this place is that unless you are a seven star member of some sort the valet will not bring your car around when you are getting ready to leave. You must go down to the valet wait in line to give the valet guy your ticket then wait for you car to come around. My wife is 8 months pregnant so we ask the valet and front desk for an exception and they wouldn't budge. I have never stayed at a hotel anywhere that you could not call and have your car brought around when you were leaving.

Our stay included 2 complimentary breakfast buffets. We used them but the buffet was noting write home about. Needless to say, it was a free breakfast, but If you are paying, go somewhere else. It definitely is not worth the $30.00 bucks or so that they charge regularly.

Overall, I would only recommend this hotel if you could find no other suitable accommodations for similar price and if you spend most of the time away from the hotel.

Worst experience ever!
I booked here just because I had went to WSOP. 
Here is the reason why I will never book at RIO.
1. On June 10th when I checked in, they told me they have to transfer me to Planet Hollywood due to one of tower was shut down, so the first night stay was complimentary. However they didn't refund my first night deposit.
2. The second day when I was ready to check in, they ran out of the type of room which I chose. And then they just charged me again and again, which I mean I got over charged twice!!!
3. When front desk manager can't solve the problem, they only can give you answer " I don't know

Paid for an unlimited wristband and it ended up being a complete waste of $70 to those who are already VIP members at the hotel. The gaudy manager who goes by the name Art Pepper gave awful service to guests. His tone of voice was uncalled for. The cashier with bad makeup who goes by the name "Sasha" gave a snarky attitude to the guests as well. They need to reevaluate the way they treat their guests at this hotel. I can get better service at a Burger King drive-thru.

I like this place. It's my first time staying here and I like it. Maybe because I just came from the shit hole of the Hilton vacation grand bullshit. By comparison the room is so much better. Sure this place don't have a new gym or microwave and toaster, but it has a min fridge and a lot of space, so I don't have to feel like I am staying in a closet. Rio has a casino, so the parking is free. The staff here are laid back, no bull shit, and friendly. Rooms are reasonably priced and clean. There is no free wi-fi or in-room coffee. Internet is $15 a day, wired. They have a Keurig, but you have to buy the Keurig cups from the mini bar ($8 for 3 cups). So bring your own if you need coffee 24-7.

For what it is, the Rio is a 4 star hotel. It's not fancy like the Bellagio, it's not a crazy party like planet Hollywood. It's a good deal for the price. We asked for extra pillows and then blankets and both were brought up reasonably quick. The room is clean and spacious. The negatives would be the slow elevators that always seem to have something wrong with them so lines build up. the hotel is also showing it's age in some areas but nothing extreme. We will probably stay here again in the future.

Off the Strip  - which is what we prefer! Still loud, disorienting  at times (we understand this is a goal of   a casino to get you to spend more money).  Entering from the self-parking garage did not give us clear  directions  to the front desk for check in. Thankfully, other guests had wandered so we didn't have to. ..and we were lead to the general direction by them. 

We were approached  by time share reps as we were getting to the registration  desk line. Delaying or check in by about 30 min(we accept  this part in us. ..willing to speak with them), on top if the 20-30 min line wait times. We were able to safely set our  items within view & sign up for free meals, shows, & tourist perks of  committing to the 2-3 hrs (max so they said) time share intro would take. 

The check in process was easy once we got to the front desk. (Mind you this was Friday 3p-ish). While my husband checked us in, I Went to nearby slots to sit. I never found Convenient benches to wait at near check-in\/Lobby while my party was registering. -I know I wasn't the only Limited Mobility guest waiting, yet I realize I am a minority. 

I had reserved our 'King Size Suite' prior to getting there. I had -not-  pre-requested an ADA compliant room, yet they had one available. I appreciate when I can use one as it easier for me. 

The 'Suite' was very similar to an apartment studio Including 600 sqft. King Size Bed, Desk, 2 night stands, Couch \/hide-a-bed and Coffee Table, side table & TV armoire. 

Coffee Lovers there are Keurig pots in the room with 'Rio Blend' and Starbucks on the Casino \/ First Floor. Since I do not drink Coffee, depend on someone else's review for this. :) 

Staff was friendly, and helpful. Public bathrooms were always clean & ready for use.  Cocktail  waitress  were assisted by a pre-order reps during busy times. 
Slot Machines  were consistently being up kept and maintained. 

Comment re Time Share  Reps.. we were kept almost 4 hrs & 45 min! Not the 2-3 hrs committed.  IF you choose to earn their perks. ..stay  away from the Gateway Vacation  Time Share out  on S. Las Vegas Blvd.
It looks like all of the Vegas hotels in the Caesar's (formerly Harrah's) chain have PetStay rooms now.  But again, some are harder to get comped than others.

I am in Vegas often for work. Usually stay somewhere else but from time to time, stay at other hotels. Used to stay at Rio a lot as I had a friend there, she would always get me great rates for amazing rooms. She has since moved on. I stayed at Rio for a week in September. It was not remarkable but it was okay. Not a great view or anything but who goes to Vegas to sit in front of a hotel window in awe of the view? September, had a great room "which I paid a premium for" service was just okay, even at the pool, restaurants, etc. Last week booked another room at Rio, 1 night, I was only up for 1 day handling business. I booked a King. When I went to check in, the girl at the desk, (don't remember her name but she was from Gulf Port) was not pleasant at all. She ran my card for "resort fee", no problem. Then ran it a second time for "incidentals" and told me my card was declined which I knew wasn't possible. I called them, waited the ten minutes for my call to be answered. They told me a fraud hold had been placed automatically but that they would lift the hold, give it a few more minutes and run it again. After a few minutes, the condescending girl swiped the card what seemed like few times, told me again it was declined. Not wanting to go through 15 more minutes on the phone, I used a different card. This one worked. Attitude of the girl behind the counter had gotten pretty bad. O. way to the rokm, stopped at one of the shops and used same card she said declined to buy drinks and snacks. It worked fine. (more later)
