Service: Can't really say, we were just partying it up in there. 
Location: Not on The Strip, but close enough, with free shuttle service to Harrahs and Ballys. 
Pool: It was amazing with a bold, capital A. Crowded, but not overwhelmingly so. Beautiful people all around, and not overrun with the douchebags you see so much of at somewhere like, say, the Palms or Mandalay Bay pool areas. One cheesy, but cool touch was the waterfall that came out of a clam. 
Miscellaneous: As great as the room was, I was charged a security deposit of $50 that I had no way of knowing about beforehand. At least it wasn't a blasted resort fee, but still.

The Final Verdict:

Pros:
More than enough space.
Fridge in the room.
Lovely view.
Epic pool.
Free shuttle to the Strip.
Nice enough bathroom. 
Offered two free passes to the Voodoo Lounge.
Lots of things to do on the property.
Got the room for a pretty sweet price as well ($53.00).

Cons:
Sneaky security deposit. It's refunded when you check out but still. 

Suggestions: Please let people know about the security deposit in advance. So next time someone wants to have their birthday there they won't be $50 short on drinking and partying funds. 

Would I stay here again? I'd stay here again just for that pool.

If the Rio were actually on the Strip, it would be my choice every single time. The rooms are all suites and super clean. They feature some great restaurants, including one of the best wine bars in Las Vegas, both on the Strip and off of it. 

The buffet, if that's your scene (it's not mine) has some of the best food...though you must visit the seafood buffet, not the regular carnival buffet. 

Their Lounge, Voodoo, is one of my favorite after hours spots, located on the top floor\/roof of the hotel. The ride up is amazing, with clear elevators that take you all the way up!!! The drinks at Voodoo are a bit over priced, but the flare bartenders and the size of most of their drinks are worth the extra price!!!

I just got back from my second stay there.   It's a nice hotel.   It is all suites which works out well since there were 4 guys sharing one room.   We had enough room to move around and get around and store our luggage.   
It is off the strip, but if you rent a car, it's not so bad.   I will be back again next year.

First, rates - conference rate booked months in advance was twice the non-conference rate posted on Internet three days prior to arrival. To their credit, they changed my rate after I called. Second - coffee. This is a huge busy hotel. They took coffee makers out of most rooms about 6 months ago. The lines outside the  hotel owned Starbucks are ridiculous. Third - It is smoky and many of those at the conference struggled all week with itchy bloodshot eyes, sneezing and congestion. It was worse in some rooms than others. The rooms are a mixed bag. Some are good, some old and with crummy furniture. The room keys work unpredictably so more long lines to get new key. Only gave me one so with no ID after a morning run I was required to wait in line to get new key. Woman was rude. Then wait for security and return to line for a new key. At conference receptions all food was the same and mostly uncreative. Catering charges expensive. There were some very friendly staff and others not so much. Oh and the same bottle of wine in the store here was $40 compared to $17 at the Gold Coast next door. I won't be back.

Stayed at the Rio weekend of August 26-28........... cant say that I was all that impressed. Did enjoy the free show while gambling. The pool was nice. Met some awesome people. Food was to expensive. 5 thumbs up for the room because it was free, nice size. That's about all I can say about the Rio.

Ben was a great server but apon asking for help Janet was rude and replied "im not supposed to be your server" and walked away before i was even finished ordering . I would not recommend this diamond lounge for the simple reason of how rude Janet was

My husband and I stayed at the Rio last month and found it to be very unpleasant. The elevator was not working properly on several occasions. (We were on the 5th floor) So, we decided to go down the stairs. When we ended up on the first floor, the door was locked! And, along the wall where a sign posted "emergency phone" There was no phone! So, we continued along towards the exit signs until the sign read, "Alarm will sound if door opened" At this time we didn't care. We still had to get out. So when we exited through that door, the alarm didn't even go off. So, if there was a real emergency good luck!
   What is up with housekeeping over there? The room next to us had left some cups outside of their room by the door. the same cups were there the whole 2 days.
   Ok, if you all decide to park on the upper level where the club is at. Beware.. People might leave drinks, empty bottles of beer, cheap wine boxes, and broken bottles by and or under the tires. We were lucky that we didn't park that close. But still, it was obvious that the Rio was understaffed.
  The best part was the Seafood buffet!

I was here a few days ago with my auntie. She took me here for dinner at the Carnival World Buffet. This was my first here, so I was amazed with this hotel & casnio.

The atsmosphere is such a lovely place with a New Orleans theme to it in my opinion. I like all the showy things, entertainment going on, slots, games, and the fact Penn & Teller is here is amazing as well. After dinner, we walked around the place. I played one of the Brittney Spears slots & won $23 on the first spin. I felt lucky. 

I got a water massage while I was here to. It was awesome & cheap. I gave it 4 Stars because I didn't see everything this place has to offer. Parking was easy and conveniet. 

I would highly recommend making a stop here to check out this beatiful casnio and hotel.

I stayed at the Rio last night. Almost everything was great. Had the typical suite. My issues we're unrelated to the customer's service, which was great.

1) You have rooms that large and don't have a central lighting fixure. Had to go around the room and turn on all four lamps to see anything.

2) The shuttle service to the strip is great, but they don't allow lugguge, so I had to pay for an Uber. That would be a nice courtesy. Granted, I made the dumb decision to stay off the strip, so I guess I derve it.

This was our first time to Vegas with our kids. The rooms were spacious but very outdated and our shower had black mold growing in the corners. The room service was quick and the food was delicious. The staff was great as well. The Valet situation is one like I have never seen at any hotel anywhere. We checked in and out of valet 3 times and all three times we got stuck in a horrible line that took upwards of 20 minutes just to drop our car off. On one occasion our car was blocked in by 8 other vehicles. The valet were friendly and seemed to be doing what they could but the system is obviously broken. Overall the stay was just ok. We will not be staying here again.

What can I say about Rio? 

I hate their Masquerade Tower---too outdate, too hideous. I felt so stuck, like I never wanted to leave the room because the decor just put me in a bad mood and inhibited me (yeah I know, backwards).  Ipanema Tower is not so bad but get a mountain view because a strip view will make you subject to the loud music coming from the pool. Ugh!

One thing that's extra special about the Rio is their pool. PHENOMENAL They have a super cold one with a beautiful oyster, a nice adult section, two warm pools, one with sand and a big rock and another a simple swimming pool. Fantastic. I would go to Rio just for their pool. Otherwise, I felt nickel and dimed. I would go to VooDoo and Crown if I am staying at Rio but otherwise I would have no desire. I did not really like the show options that Rio had. 

I did not have a lot of fun at Rio but I felt like others were. So I gave it 3 stars...to be fair.

This was our first time at the Rio, and we really enjoyed ourselves (it was my birthday and our first trip away with just the two of us since we had our baby in 2012). Here are my thoughts:

The Hotel Lobby\/Downstairs\/Casino - While the casino and lobby aren't the most elegant, they are well-maintained and not so vast that you need allow a half an hour to walk to and from your room (like with some of the other casinos). The place is VERY smoky - I was seriously shocked to see people wheeling their babies through the clouds of secondhand smoke. In no time during my daughter's infancy would I have thought to take her to Las Vegas - ugh. Even if you have a non-smoking room, just walking through the casino will be enough to drench your luggage in wafting clouds of smelly nicotine. Plan on washing EVERYTHING you bring with you - regardless of whether or not you ended up wearing it. 
CHECK IN - The check-in time was a bit late and the line was LONG! But the staff moved quickly and got us checked in without any hassle. 

THE ROOM - Our desk agent, Steven, was awesome and put us into a great room with a king-size bed, fabulous view of the Strip - the zip line literally went right past our window - it was funny watching everyone be terrified! The bed was super comfortable and all the furniture was cute and functional. I was kind of bummed that they anchored this big dresser and TV right in the middle of the gorgeous view, it would have been better to leave the view purely unobstructed because it is fabulous! The bathroom area was divided into a large vanity area and a tiny room for the toilet and shower (two sinks - one at the vanity, one in the tiny bathroom). The water pressure SUCKED - seriously it was like trying to get clean with a water fountain. Plus, in an effort to be artsy, they have this window from the tiny bathroom into the bedroom - which is just weird and completely nonsensical, the doors are thin, and there is NO ventilation fan - so if you're someone who has bathroom performance anxiety when others are listening, like me, this set up isn't ideal.

CASINO - I liked that the casino wasn't so huge that you got lost easily. There were also plenty of low-stakes blackjack tables (my game of choice), but for the most part the dealers they employ are sour-faced, unattractive, uncharismatic people who look they REALLY don't want to be there. They have this go go dancer gambling areas where live women dance while you gamble, as a woman, it made me feel way too much like I was Tony Soprano. I also couldn't believe the idiocy of some of my fellow gamblers - no consistency, hitting on 13 when the dealer's showing a 2! Gah!!!! I joined the Total Rewards program, but half the slot machines I put it into couldn't read it (but it worked fine at some of them and at the tables.

FOOD - We (wisely) brought a 

THE GOOD - It was nice that the hotel wasn't so huge that leaving the room felt like a hike. But the hotel also felt big enough that we were able to stay in for a full night and not lack for things to do - we ate the the American Steak House, saw Penn and Teller, gambled, and debated going to the Voo Doo Lounge, but were pretty poor after Penn and Teller. It would be nice if the hotel could offer guests a 2 for 1 deal to the nightclub, that way it would encourage people to go and they would spend money on drinks inside. We were there for my 37th birthday, and it was nice to feel like were weren't the oldest people there - in fact, we felt like some of the youngest. Large mix of people, lots of diversity and not super judgmental - like you shouldn't feel too self-conscious about taking your shirt off at the pool (which isn't bad, but nothing compared to some of the other more opulent hotels on the strip - sneak over to one of those if you're looking for a kick ass pool. 

THE BAD - The gift shop staff were HORRIBLE! They wouldn't accept my photo ID so I could use my ATM card. I had to walk down the hall to the ATM machine, which charged me $7.00 to take out the $10 I needed to buy my husband some cereal and milk. I was LIVID. The manager's name was Ben Levitt (I believe) and he was so the most unaccommodating, rudest, person at your entire establishment. I was so turned off that it really will impact whether or not we stay with you again - as up until that point we were planning to make The Rio our regular hotel and come back with a large group of our friends in a few months, but I don't know if I want to subject people to the rudeness of that particular employee (who really made me feel like I was insignificant and not valued as a customer). 

Plus, the guy driving the shuttle to\/from was a total ass - but it's worth it not to have to cab it. Avoid the cabs, do Uber if necessary!

It had been a while since our last visit, approximately 10 yrs., so we decided to go back. Boy were we ever sorry. We reserved two rooms because we took family. For starters the carpet in the hall ways were filthy, the rooms had pieces of carpet missing and the sofas were torn. This place is in much need of an overhaul....sad because it was a decent place to stay.

I go to Vegas once a year for a Star Trek convention, as I told a dealer once I only gamble with my life never my money so I can't speak for anything casino related. This review is for those that like me are there for something other than gambling.
Let me get my one complaint out of the way, which is there is not enough low cost eating options in the hotel which wouldn't be an issue on the strip but since the Rio is off strip you're kind of trapped unless you want to drive or cab it somewhere else. That being said it's an all-suite hotel so each room has a refrigerator so just do what we do and buy food for breakfast and lunch and spend your money on dinner or better yet the buffet which is great, this would be high praise from me you see because I had a bad incident at a Home Town Buffet once which really put me off that dining concept forever, that is until I ate at the Rio's Buffet.
The convention space is great very roomy and much better than the old hotel where the Star Trek convention used to be held, I'm not refusing to name it I just have no idea what they're going by today as they have changed their name a couple of times since I was last there. While I'm on that subject I can't say enough about how well the Rio treats the Trek fans while the old place acted like we were some sort of inconvenience the Rio has been very welcoming every year and the room rate is better than Motel 6 as is the cliental, I'm reasonably sure the FBI could find most of their most wanted list at the Motel 6 in Las Vegas, not that you need to know that but they're likely reading this review since they read everything and I just thought I'd give a heads up.

We have stayed at the Rio many many times over the years. 
Always asked for a high floor and away from the elevators and non smoking. They always gave us what we asked for if they had it available.

We loved staying here because the rooms were always so spacious, Not like a typical motel room. The views are beautiful from the Rio too!

We always gambled at the properties tied in together so we could use our players card at each one. Even though the Rio is not on the strip they do shuttle you to the other properties we never used it because we had our own car.

The Rio also has had some great shows over the years and some good restaurants that we hated to see go.. And they still have one of our favorites.

We weren't too crazy about the bevertainers that changed a lot because it made it nosier and when gambling near these areas. And a few other changes over the years but we still liked going here.

We enjoy going to the Voo Doo lounge too. Over all it is one of our favorite Hotels to go to still.
If you have never been to the Rio make sure to check out the lounge at night! It is really beautiful up there!

I've been to the Rio a couple of times, during previous Vegas trips, but this was my first time staying there. I scored a great mid-week deal, between Christmas and New Year, that cost me $83 out the door (including taxes and the obnoxious resort fee). 
I chose to park, via valet, which was real easy and the gentleman taking my car was polite. 
I LOVE the self check-in\/out kiosks! So fast and easy to navigate, so in less than 5 minutes, we had our room keys and a map on how to locate our tower elevators! 
The casino is nice, and from what I saw on the grounds, there were many places to eat and grab a drink. 
The room is gorgeous. Hands-down. I knew they were "all suites," but the square footage still impressed me. The couch in our room was a tad worn\/distressed and I was bummed it didn't pull out into a sleeper sofa. This trip was with my two daughters (11 & 14), so in saving on the room rate with a King (instead of 2 queens), would have been a little cramped. So, the youngest chose to sleep on the couch. There wasn't any extra blankets, so I kept the heat up enough and gave her the sheet off the bed. 
I refuse to give a hotel 5 stars, when they do not offer coffee in the room. It's the dumbest thing ever, in my opinion. Luckily, our room was in a tower close to Smashburger and I threw clothes on to order some there. Later, when we checked out, I saw the Starbucks line that was AT LEAST 20 people deep! You've got to be kidding me! I want my caffeine right when I wake up. Don't make me work for it people!

I've stayed here on a couple different occasions. Once a long time ago when the Village Buffet was hot. Another time for an all girl weekend excursion.  My last stay was for a convention. I love... The pool. It has a beachy sand area so it makes you feel like you're some place tropical- but not really. It kind of reminds me of the Mirage. Eating at the bar top of Bizou (seafood restaurant) wasnt bad. 
The rooms are nice and pretty clean. Ive slept on the pull out couch before which isnt as comfy. I like my rooms cold so i had to turn the AC to 65 degrees.
The crowd here is much different from what you would expect at....The Cosmo for instance. It's a mix.
Perk? A shuttle runs every 1\/2 hour and will take you to Bally's or Harrahs. Go to the back of thd building pass the valet. There are signs indicating which waiting area is for what.

Such a deal for the size of the rooms! It's a little out dated in the hallways and casino and out of the way a bit from the strip but the suites are really worth it. Great views and powder rooms. This is a hotel I would stay at again.

Feel mixed about this place.  Can be very fun but the rooms are a gamble.  You never know if its join to be okay or or not.  The worst thing is that I get a sinus infection every time I go... the non smoking rooms even seem like you are in an ash tray.  Or maybe the ventilation just needs cleaning.  It unfortunate since the rest of the place can be tons of fun

I came in here simply to visit the casino, which is where my opinion of this place both starts and ends. I didn't visit any restaurants or the hotel or anything like that. 

My first impression of this place was it was a bit outdated and old. I had heard that Danny from Count's Kustoms had a tattoo shop inside the hotel. That's actually how I recognized the Rio Hotel and Casino. 

I went in and noticed it's a bit old. It's not nearly as dingy and gross as Binion's on Freemont Street, so that was a good sign. Lol. The casino is big, and I found several machines that I enjoyed playing. 

I love the KISS themed section they have. I took several pictures with the KISS VW Bug that was custom designed and painted in there. That was probably the highlight of my visit, and some of my favorite pics with my mom that we took during the trip. So kudos for that one, right there. 

Overall, I would return. I had no complaints about the casino, as it was fun. Definitely enjoyed the photo opportunities here. 

Review 120 of 2017.

Stayed at the Rio for a couple nights during a tradeshow that was being hosted in their convention center. The property has definitely seen its better days - just kind of old and worn down. If you sign up for the Total Rewards card you can get some smokin' rates too - so if you're on a budget that might be handy.

The rooms are all suites here, which is nice. They're quite spacious and comfortable. Overall, nothing about this place blew me away or made me want to come back. I didn't really see anything in the way of customer service - the staff all just seemed to have blank expressions and didn't really offer up any recommendations unless asked. Again, no biggie, but I just didn't feel like anyone there was very personable.

As I've mentioned before, I'm usually not too picky when it comes to hotels - if it's clean and there's a comfortable bed, I'm good to go. I suppose the Rio fit the bill. Relatively clean (though the hallways were ALWAYS littered with in-room dining remnants) and my toilet would sometimes make weird gurgling noises. 

Oh and side note on the Rio - Voodoo Steakhouse and Lounge (located at the top of the Rio) are both actually really nice. If you don't stay at this hotel, it's worth it to check out the food and view one night during your trip to Sin City.

Mmm an OK hotel, not the greatest.. little run down. You get what you pay for tho. Good location. The man that checked us in seemed like he hated his job. The hold for the hotel kept saying declined, however I check my bank app and said it was charged. They couldn't do anything until 24 hours. The buffet was delicious!! If you're on a budget, stay here. Worth the price!

This is my worst hotel experience ever! I had to stay here for a conference so I was stuck. The rooms were dingy and lacked basics like a coffee maker. One phone in the room didn't work. House keeping missed 2-3 days of cleaning during the week and grossest of all the pillow case had red brown stain on it (?blood). I reported all of this at checkout and management didn't bother to call me back.

Showing its age.  Nothing was really pleasing.  Decent convention spot and my room was generally clean but it's not the strip and it's got that non stop third rate feel.  My room had a nice view but you get what you pay for.  The pool seemed nice enough but the clientele are sad and depressing.
I never have a bad experience here this place is kid friendly and my favorite the machines and tables I spend all my money there I have the best time ever

The rio is great for the price.  Really its only draw back is that it is off the strip. oh and now you have to pay a resort fee too so that kind of goes against the cheap prices too.  Needless to say the rio is still a cheap option just make sure you have a car to get to the strip.  The casino is pretty nice.  It has that sweet smell of cigarets smoke and despair in the air coupled with the musical clanking of slot machines that I love so much.  There is a feeling of grungyness and greasyness in the casino do the fact that really brings a cheaper crowd, but that also makes for the expirience and good time.  The pool is one of the better in vegas plenty of over priced alcohol and european dudes with slicked back hair head banging fist pumping to the techno blastin throughout the whole pool..its hilarious to watch.  All the rooms are suites so they are huge you really get a lot for the money.  If you got money go to cosmo or bellagio but if ur doing vegas on a budet rio is a great option.

This place is awesome!

Last week was my Mom's birthday, and what better way to celebrate her big day with a surprise in Vegas.

I am an only child, so I love spending all the time I can with my parents. I could think of no better way than hang in luxury in a suite.

The Rio was pretty awesome! We had a 19th floor luxury suite that faced the strip. Caesar's Palace, Bellagio, Wynn, Paris. We could see it all!

The dining area and living room was huge. We had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a ridiculous living room and my favorite part....a wet bar, with keurig coffee maker :)

The rooms are well-maintained (at least on this floor, and in the ipanema tower), and the rates are pretty reasonable. The staff is very accommodating.

If I need to stay near the strip, this would be a good option.

Nice work, Rio! Thanks for making my Mom's birthday stay an enjoyable one.

The rooms were spacious and they accommodated our request to be put in adjoining rooms. The a\/c worked great, the beds were very comfortable, they have a decent buffet. This place really was A-OK! I would recommend staying there if you're traveling to Vegas.  

The only downfall was the check-in process. We must have waited in line for about 30 minutes at 8PM at night. They (Vegas in general) really should come up with a new check-in system. Keeping customers waiting in line for that long is a damn shame.

We had a wonderful room. It was huge. We will defiantly
Be using this hotel again. It was reasonable and well worth the money. 
We had a view of many hotels from our bay windows
Our room was clean as could be. 
It was a suite with 2 queen beds sectional couch. 
Lots of outlets for our electronics and lots of room for dressing and showering.

Don't book this hotel. We have been standing trying to check in for 23 minutes and there is still 7 people waiting to check in only 5 clerks available. Never never come here again. We have reservations at Vodoo the steak house tonight, hopefully that experience is better than the slow check in. Still waiting.

I LOVE this hotel! The rooms are clean, not out-dated looking, and the staff is VERY friendly. I was very fortunate to get a corner room with a view of the Strip and it had lots of windows...ask for that type of room for an even NICER hotel experience. Didn't get a chance to eat at the hotel but they have a great selection to appease even the pickiest eaters. The only advice I would give is make sure your door is closed tightly since they do not close very tight on their own...there is even a sign reminding guests of this, which is nice. However, the maid DID NOT follow this advice as I discovered when returning to my room. Luckily, no one entered my room...but just a head's up. I can't wait to return to the Rio!

We used to come to Rio when it first opened in the 90's and loved it! Came back about 8 years ago and could really see they had gone downhill. Stopped in last night to check it out again and from the minute you're greeted by some bonehead security\/bouncer doofus at the door to the drippy staff througout hotel this place feels like it's barely hanging on. They lost their identity - no Mardi Gras ceiling show and many stores in The Masqerade Village out of business. Not sure if how the rooms are or if they've updated but we would probably never come back unless we heard they got a makeover. Too bad.

This new checking system sucks! You can't check in on the kiosk if you're early do just stand in line like everyone else.

Going back to the Boyd's hotels from now on.

The Rio is a must to stop at when you're in Vegas.
The buffet is awesome, they have something for everyone.
In the masquerade side of the casino they have a show on the hour after 5 with real singers\/dancers (not lip syncers). And they throw mardi gras beads out during the show in the sky. (Really cool)
The bartenders even do a bottle spinning show and whoever screams the loudest gets frees drinks\/shots.

Totally fun and a surprise (I thought it was going to be depressing and run-down)

We will be staying here next time if I can get a comp.
Great rooms. They just need to upgrade the TV to the 21st Century.

I had the opportunity to see Penn and Teller here this past week and visit a friend staying in one of the hotel rooms. The room, casino, and theater were all pretty nice. The parking was extremely convenient (and free!). I noticed they have an indoor Kiss PutPut Golf area by the casino too, so now it looks like I'll be returning again soon.

I would never stay here again. I am currently here for a conference and never have I stayed in such gross accommodations. Unraveling carpet, broken lamps, dingy overall rooms. The part that I cannot deal with are the suspicious liquid stains on the couch, all over the carpet, and the wall (!) next to the bed, and the fact that the faucet is broken and water leaks all over the counter when you wash your hands. Ruined several make up items the first time I had a puddle. Also the shower curtain had dark spots all over it but they at least replaced that. 

I tried to get another cleaner room but they were out of non smoking rooms so they GUARANTEED that someone would call my cell phone between 11-4 today to get me moved to a new room. It is almost 6, no call, so I called down and asked what was up. The manager didn't seem very apologetic at all, and told me if I wanted another room I needed to wait in the huge line at check in and they would probably have one for me. I had a business meeting in 25 minutes, waited in line but it was going too slow. I might try again when I'm back from my event but I cannot really say anything good about this hotel.

They had an option to check in n your phone before you arrive, but still had to wait in a line for about 45 min. The first thing I noticed when we walked in was the smell. It was like an old folks home. We check in and head up to our room. We rented a suite and was semi pleased until I walked into the master bathroom. 

It was in need of a makeover and the tile on the floor was missing in some areas and looked very dirty in the shower. If your looking for a cheap, cheap place to stay.....this would be the place.

To be completely honest, I was hesitant to book our room at the Rio because of some of the reviews I read. I'm not sure what happened when other people stayed here, but our stay was awesome.

We were flying in late and arriving to the Rio super late.. I checked in online and was told to get my key from the "keys" line at the front desk- super painless experience, under 10 minutes!
We grabbed our keys and ventured to the elevator to bring us to our room in the Masquerade Tower. Our room was perfect- big, clean and in an awesome spot. I loved looking out our window to view the hotels on the strip, and we also had a view of the hotel's zipline (which kept me entertained all hours of the day).
Housekeeping always came kind of later in the day, which was perfect for us because we needed those extra hours of sleep when drinking all night lol.
Room service was kind of pricey, but it always is! However, it was fast and of good quality.

The Rio has great bars and restaurants.. It even has a starbucks that is open 24 hours on the weekend! Though I felt the casino didn't have the best selection of slot machines, I still had no problem spending all my $$$.

I choose this hotel strictly because we were going to the Penn and Teller show.. However, I would definitely stay here again! A very pleasant experience!

First time here at this casino. Out of all the times I've been to Vegas, I've never been here. The casino area is a bit small and pricey. I love to play cards especially paigow. When I play paigow I usually like to enjoy myself and take it slow while the cocktail waitress brings me drinks, but I couldn't do that when the paigow tables cost $15 a hand. Going here with $100 would only last me a few hands. One other thing was that I actually came here to try a new game that they didn't have at other casinos (Asia Poker) $25 hands were just to ridiculous with the bankroll I brought to this casino means that I only have 4 hands to play if I lost every single hand. Yeah the game was new and it was one of the reasons why we went to this casino. So I decided, heck I should just try a few hands (even though I've never even played this game before) maybe I can bring some beginners luck to the table. What do you know I lose the first hand and after that, I had a decision to make either stay for another hand and try to get my money back that I don't completely know the full game about, or try my money some where else. Since I was already sitting at the table I just again said, hell with it I'm going to just stick around and try my luck. After a few more hands I ended up losing $25 at the table and moved onto playing 3 card poker.

All in all this casino just seemed a bit small, they had a few shops, but nothing to interesting for me to stick around and look in any shops. What I did find interesting though when sitting at the tables was their "male cocktail waiters" pretty weird which left me a bad impression when sitting at a card table and leaving the casino. HHhmmmm.....I'd rather go to another casino off the strip than this one and plus their are others casinos just down the street that I'd prefer than this one. Wish I got to stick around for their light show they had in the casino, but my experience here wasn't that great for me to stick around long enough for the show.

arrived at 2:40 pm for check-in... they wanted $25 to check in before check in time... we said no way... so we checked our bags with the bell desk. and went out on the town.
the free shuttle is pretty nice from rio to ballys. polite happy drivers. 
when we finally arrived back to check into our hotel it was 1am. we were exhausted... got to our room and it wreaked of stale old cigarette smoke. this was a non smoking room. awful smoky!
the room was large. old and dated. worn out. odd layout. old t.v. horrible lighting. and honest to god the sheets on the bed felt like sandpaper. yes..... sandpaper. bathroom had dirt and grime build up in the corners on the floor...
the shower the next morning was horrendous. no pressure, and I compared it to a cow peeing on a rock.... and the pee sputtering off of the rock on all sorts of different directions. none of the water hitting you as you stand underneath the shower head. I had to straddle the bathtub with my feet and put mu head within 2cm under shower nozzle to wash my hair. awful....
buffet was overpriced. 20.00 a person. for nothing impressive. voodoo steak was great tho. my filet was insane!! but expensive. I don't mind paying more for a meal. but it has to be good.
wifi..... lol.... don't even try.... its a TOTAL joke.
will absolutely not stay there ever again.
*side note: two weeks later at home and my luggage still wreaks of smoke. no joke........

The rooms are great and spacious.
The all suite makes it amazing as you don't have to juggle for the price on which room to pick.
The rooms are clean and the staff maintains it all the time.
Staff is wonderful.
I normally prefer this to stay as it has low rates and also not so busy to get in and out.
No strip traffic if you commute in your car.
They have a shuttle\/bus service from the casino to Bally's in case you don't have a car and want to hang out on the Strip.

Get the pool view room as it also overlooks the strip.

Rio was perfect for being in Vegas while on business and needing off strip accommodations. 

There was a decent line for check in, especially for a random Tuesday night, but I was able to skip it due to being Diamond (I don't gamble a lot, PM me to learn how to become Diamond without the big bets). I stayed in the Ipanema Tower in a south facing room with a mountain view. The room was a bit outdated but overall clean and spacious. All elevators were operable during my stay contrary to a lot of other reviews. 

Everyone I came into contact with was very polite and friendly, from housekeeping to the dealers.

Casino is large with a good spread of table games and a ton of slot machines. Drink service was spotty, great at times, and completely ignored at others. 

Valet was awesome. Very friendly and efficient. 

Overall, unless I had business in Vegas, I would definitely stick to one of the Caesar strip properties.

Rooms are large and okay except the showers are terrible! Resort fee includes internet for 1 device per day otherwise it's $13.
Pool area is nice and has sand and waterfalls but pools range from cold to lukewarm and even the hot tub is not hot. The fish pool is heated kinda. 
They have a shuttle to Harrahs and a shuttle to Ballys that are free and run every half hour or so. 
They have a Burger King which has a limited menu and the meals come with a beer, but if you're starving at 4am, it's a godsend
Casino floor is decent size, ironically, not a lot of poker players.

$25 for a one nighter + $15 for resort fee. 

It was cheap, so we decided to stay here for Thursday night. 
Yes, it was off strip but it wasn't a far drive to get to the strip (5 min?). 

We got a back strip view room (facing the Trump). If you get  a strip view room, get the back strip because the front view has trains passing underneath it frequently + freeway traffic noise. It was so annoying we moved from front to back. Definitely much better!

Rooms are all suites... a little outdated looking but works. Large bathroom, floor to ceiling windows, nice king bed. If they did a little modernization in the rooms, I think this would definitely be 4 stars!

PROS: The room was quite big, nice pool and lots of entertainment to choose from.

CONS: I was checked out 2 hours in advance without my knowledge that's want my room keys doesnt work. Sofa bed was so old and beat up it sank every time I get on it. Sleepless night in Rio...
A very ocnfusing casino layout, but isn't that their goal?  Some pits were very warm while others were very cold.  Off the beaten path but worth a visit to see the casino and shops.

So I decided to visit the Harrahs for a good time in Vegas. I wanted a decent room with the normal amenities in order to function at this first world lifestyle pace. Our room came fully equipped with heart ache and despair, and is lacking a refrigerator and microwave and last but not least no fan for our bathroom where we take constant dumpers because of the food quality.

Every time we walk through the hotel, I am reminded why I should not stay here again. Thanks. If I wanted a shitty hotel with bad humor and no democratic appeal I would have stayed in the Trump Tower. Again, thanks.

Finally, I was watching my wife play some slot's (penny) and we have gambled a bit before and never had anyone approached us for a drink and she was winning nicely. We finally get someone coming our way so we get excited to get a drink, and instead of giving us a proper greeting I was told by some hater that my wife appeared too Young and needed to leave her seat.

Fucking disaster, thanks for supporting your vets.

I  had a very bad experience at this hotel. The hotel is not very well maintained. The room were not clean and sanitary. I discovered  mold in the bathroom and was completely thrown away. This place is not recommended.

Our Las Vegas trip was planned to be a food trip. With that said, we knew that had to see\/try the "largest buffet on the strip" - Carnival World Buffet at the Rio. 

Giving it 2 stars is a bit harsh I know... but truth hurts as they say. Honestly, I've been to a Golden Coral in Virginia Beach, VA that serves waaaaaaaay better food. I came here for the crab legs. I mean, who doesn't want all you can eat crab legs, right? To say the least, the crab legs were tiny and dried out for being in the counter for too long. Nothing special caught my eye. Even the tacos were horrible. The best part for me was dessert. I mean, how do you really mess up ice cream? The price was fair I guess for a "good" buffet.

I'm reading all these positive feedbacks and I can't help but be jealous. Definitely not the same when we were there last March. I guess it's a hit or miss? Enter at your own risk, perhaps?

they have the best rooms for the price.  It has a mini fridge.  Although it is far from the strip, you can take a free shuttle there.
Did I mention nice cocktail staff outfits :P

Attended a business conference. The meeting facilities are a pleasant place to hold a venue. The catering was very good, especially the desserts and the staff very nice. The hotel and casino itself feels dated and the low ceilings make it for a less pleasant feel than some of the other hotels on the strip. The suites are comfortable and a generous size. I also found them very quiet and slept well. The tv needs to be updated.

I don't know where these other people have stayed in Vegas, but the Rio is HORRIBLE & DISGUSTING if you're used to any of the following: Mandalay Bay, the Hotel, Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn, Encore, Bellagio, Paris, etc..  It is not classy, the rooms are old and basic (corner suites are barely okay), the service is tired and staff almost seems to resent working there, the casino is small and gets boring fast.  I'd compare it to the Sahara, except the Sahara has a better casino.  Stay at the Rio if the price is right and you're not looking for luxury, but just know what you're getting.....

We upgraded our room, it was 1200 sq huge, renovated flat. Colourful and clean. Beds were comfy and beautiful.
It's little off from Main Street but I loved it

The Giant and I love their pool.  Not open until the first few weeks of May though.  The cabana pricing has gone up from last year for DURING THE WEEK!  

Voo Doo lounge is an experience in itself.  Good food and awesome view of the city.  They could use a few heat lamps though!

Did you know you can ride the floats in the masquerade show?  I have not found the time or plan ahead to get in line - but if you can, do it!  Looks like so much fund

Limited pit playing during the day - and pricing per table is equivalent to the strip.  

Rooms are nice...but amenities offered in the rooms are limited.  You have to pay for coffee!!!  However, I was able to check in two hours early, which was so nice after a long day.

This hotel is always busy!! But they keep it up and its always clean.. Even the elevators in the parking garage and thats a plus not all are like this!!
They have great shops, food places and shows.. Will always be back

This place leaves much to be desired. Don't let the cheap room rates sucker you in, learn from my mistake. If you want to stay at a legit 4 star resort in Vegas, do not stay here. My bed was comfy, I will admit.  However, my couch had stains all over it. Yuck. Never sat on that bad boy. Shower had zero water pressure which sucks for someone who actually wants to wash their hair and there was mold in the shower area. Ick. The dealers had zero personality. At least talk to me while you take my money. The restaurants on site were so, so. One thing that will never do me wrong at the Rio is the Voodoo Lounge. The view of the strip is amazing. Two stars, one for the comfy bed and one for the lounge.

Very outdated rooms. Nice view. TV and furniture and bathroom and basically the whole entire room looked like it's from the 70s. The TV had 20 channels and most of them you could barely see because the tv was so blurry.  The TV was positioned in the middle of the window which I didn't like either. I did like how spacious the rooms are.  The buffet is nothing special. Everyone kept raving about this Buffett but I didnt see what the big deal was here.  Sure the Buffett was HUGE but the food was dried out and there wasn't that much of it left. The breakfast buffet was way better than the dinner buffet. The best part of the hotel was the Voodoo Lounge on the 51st floor of the hotel. part of this club is outside and it has a 360 view of Vegas which was AMAZING! But be forewarned the beers were $8 each and I didn't realize it until the next morning lol. Also the hotels restaurant options are bad. In my opinion this hotel really needs to be demolished and rebuilt and start over from scratch to stay with the 21st century. I would not stay here again, but I would come here to go to the Voodoo Lounge again!

Booked for 4 nights as a joint convention trip, family vacation & 12th Anniversary celebration.
So smokey, food expensive for value.
No real area for children other than pool which closes randomly. Also our girls were playing with many children in pool with a water ball. The ball was last seen by the lifeguards on duty, with their admittance, they WERE playing with my daughter's toy - but the ball was not returned, and one of the life guards actually was yelling at my daughter & followed her out of the pool area still yelling at her.
I am 99% certain I am missing an article of clothing.
Have this last night here......leave tomorrow.
OK - HOME NOW.... WILL APOLOGIZE for missing article of clothing (did find it at home\/left home at 3 am). I AM SORRY FOR THE ACCUSATION..
THE REST OF REVIEW STAYS THE SAME........LIFEGUARDS, FOOD......NO PLACE FOR CHILDREN.

Stayed here on 2 different occasions. Recently stayed during my trip to Magic Market Week in room 34025.  Great view, clean, updated rooms and extra comfortable beds. The hotel has a variety of restaurants that are very good. 
The pool closes at 6p, which I thought was a bummer at first, but then realized the sun goes down anyway so it really isn't that big of a deal!  
Über has to pick you up on the side of the building past the Strip Shuttle, which was annoying. 
Overall, this is a great hotel off of the Strip but still very close to the Strip!!  I would recommend staying at this hotel!

http:\/\/www.chareelenee.com

IG: @chareelenee

http:\/\/www.shopzsador.com

IG: @zsadorboutique

We got a good deal on this hotel through Kayak, and wanted to be near the strip. Overall the hotel was good, especially for the price. (About $35\/night). My few complaints were that I found the pillows they have on the bed a little uncomfortable. We also had to leave the water running in the shower for about 5-10 minutes for it to get hot.

The hotel has a good casino, good location, and good food. They also offer a shuttle to the strip, which is nice if you're going to be drinking a lot.

DO NOT RECOMMEND...
It has been 3 hours to check in. First we tried the self check in machines and was supposed to get a email in a hour. So we walked around and got some drinks. No email and another 2 hours later to find out from vince who asked us to check in st tgecself check in machined said... "ya they are sending the emsils and you have to stand in line. Do here we are still in line 2 hours later....

The rooms were very spacious, and there's a pull out couch if more people want to crash. Sadly, we didn't have a view of the main strip. There's a shuttle that takes you to the main strip.  However the shuttle only runs till 1 or 2 am. Anything after, you need a taxi. The pools are nice: there are three pools- two kiddie pools and a "grown up" pool. A lot of the seating at the pool was all reserved, making it hard to find places to sit They also offer mimosas and other drinks. The cabanas are wayy over priced. I believe it's $110 per person an hr? My main gripe for the hotel was that they didn't give us the wifi code. When we went down to the reception, they told us to use our registration info but it still didn't work. We didn't stay long in the hotel room for wifi to matter too much; it was more a place to crash after a long night. But wifi! Can't live without it.
been here 2x. loved it both time. rooftop lounge is incredible after 10pm. nice pools. good food. good sports book.  great prices.

This past weekened\/week my company visited Las Vegas. We stayed at two hotels, this being the second one. Not only were the rooms completed outdated, the tub in the suite was gross and dripping water, the maids took hours to clean two rooms and still managed to leave clothing from the previous renters in the room. The only reason why I would go here again is to get a cheaper rate.

I DO NOT recommend this hotel. Oh did I mention, the bell boy broke my co-worker luggage zipper and ripped it. Did not say sorry even though we were standing right there and discussed what happened to the bag.

Our stay at the Rio hotel was very decent, especially for the price.  It was "off-the-strip", but close enough we walked to the strip a number of times.  Their regular free shuttle is also fairly convenient.  It may seem far, until you realize you're closer to Caesars hotel than if you stayed at MGM or NY-NY.

We stayed in the short tower (Ipanema I think).  We were pretty high up, with an AMAZING strip view.  The room was fairly updated, though the carpet and furniture had some discoloration and stains on them.  The coffee maker and fridge were very useful (though the fridge was set very cold, and froze some of the water we put in there).

My two major complaints would be the pool music was fairly loud even as high as we were, and was annoying while the pool was open.  Also the hot water was not very hot at all, and even at 3am (It's Vegas) was quite cool.  It seems a hotel in Vegas could work on providing hot water to it's guests.

Overall the Rio is a good deal if you're willing to stay just off the strip, it's a bit outdated, as people mention, but it's well maintained, and still has the hotel\/casino feel.  Grab it if you can find a good deal on the hotel.

Voodoo Lounge night life was great right on the roof top.  DJ was awesome.  You can catch the Las Vegas Skyline from the top. Rooms was good for the price. The Rio buffet was ok lacked flavor.  Other than that I would stay there again.

In 2012 I was working in Las Vegas every other week, so I got to try almost every hotel in Vegas... I loved the Rio... except its proximity to anything. 

People always say its just off the strip... technically ok, but it is across a freeway over the strip. I love the food options and have no complaints whatsoever... we even go to their seafood buffet when we aren't staying there.

I booked a room and I guess they overbooked rooms and was upgraded to a suite!! WHAT!?!?!?! And the suite was beautiful. I was sad I was there for work and not with hubby... that huge room all alone for a week :( but no complaints.

I highly recommend this hotel.
Booked this place literally the night before after a booking disaster at another hotel. The place is alright but not great. The beds are too hard though. Quick checkout and nice staff.

Lets just get straight down to it ... The rio is an older hotel\/casino off the strip, so it's dated, but it's still nicer than most of the hotels in down town Las Vegas, but it has a tough time keeping up with the higher end hotel\/casinos on the strip...

The new automatic check-in kiosks are awesome - it was great to be able to check in quickly without having to wait in line.  Also, it was awesome to be able to upgrade to an amazing suite for only $30 per night ... I would say the room upgrade was the best part of my stay although the rooms here should get upgraded because they are waaay dated.  But as I mentioned it's a great place to stay for cheaper suites ...

The hotel is fairly clean, but there's not a ton of stuff going on here ... Some okay food... A not so great lounge, a horribly lame comedy\/magic show, but hey @ least it's right off the strip and the suites are big, have refrigerators, and super cheap compared to some place like wynn or Caesars... Just don't stay at the rio and expect it to be like the Venetian because you will get a ruuuude awakening!!

Overall, I may stay here again but I would not eat or do anything entertainment wise ... The rio is only good for the large sized cheap suite close to the strip! That is all! Boom ;)

I really hate leaving this review but what's happened to this place?

At any given time half the elevators were down.  I guess it didn't help there was a large conference happening but they have to be used to this and they need more than 2 or 3 elevators working at any time.

The rooms are dated but really large.  Half the things in my washroom worked well.  The service wasn't that great, getting help was a pain, like getting my keys changed because they stopped working for some reason.

The shuttle only goes to Harrah's now.  I don't think I'd stay here again as it was such a mission to get back to my room due to the elevators but if you're on a budget it's a great option.

The pool is nice though!

Overall.....not great. First thing we stayed 2 nights and never received maid service.....returned to the room @9:30 PM and no maid. Second the door NEVER locked. NEVER.  We didn't learn of this until the last evening when it didn't matter. The light on the door when you put in your key, didn't light, and I just pushed the handle. When it opened I thought the light was broke.....not the lock. As far as restaurants were concerned......again not great, American Bar and Grill, not bad, expensive, but nothing special. No gambling as the cheapest Black Jack table was $15.00 min.  Too expensive for a Monday evening.

Was not happy with my stay. Not a good location. Off the strip. For over $100 a night I Had to drink out of paper cups. Then I was informed by my friends that they got a $40 food credit for not having the rooms cleaned and Jose the manager told me that he's sorry that his check in people did not let me know but there's nothing he could do For me in the last 12 hours of my stay. Instead of saying I'm so sorry we didn't let you know let us make it up to you. Our mistake. He just said no. Not the caliber of hotel that I would ever recommend for that price. If my conference had not been in this building I would never have stayed here. Don't recommend

The views from the 20th floor are amazing. We stayed three days two nights. The staff was very attentive amazing. Room service was delicious and prompt. You don't need millions of dollars to have a great vacation in Vegas and live almost like a luxury. The parking wasn't too far we did self parking , they have valet also ,but the line was a little long; so we rode around for about 15 minutes and found our own parking. I think the Rio hotel should have parking like the airports!  $30 to park your car out front, have the valet basically supervise it ,but let people park their cars upfront on their own and just put the $30 in a the machine And get a digital receipt. Other than parking the trip total perfection. The meals were delicious.Oh we did have a run-in with the weird drunk guy in the elevator and he kept ringing the alarm inside the elevator. it was like six of us crammed into an elevator with the weirdo drunkie . But the people at the Rio called over the intercom they were very professional and attentive and I felt safe knowing they could see and hear us with this drunko.
The four stars are for the jackpot on the quarter slots after playing for 10 minutes! Definitely memorable.

The Rio is a nice hotel. They have some of the sexiest cocktail servers (men and women). The only casino that I know of with male cocktail servers for the ladies. 
Though they're away from the strip there is plenty to do here. They have a free shuttle to either Harrahs or Balleys on the strip. The shuttle runs about every 30 minutes until 1:00am. 
There is Voodoo Nightclub. A rooftop nightclub with an amazing view. One DJ outside and one DJ inside.

OK it took me a couple of days to get my thoughts together in regards to this review. I went to Rio Hotel for the weekend for a girls trip and my birthday, and from the moment we set foot on the property everything that could go wrong did go wrong but what made it so bad is when they couldn't pretty much appease us with free tickets, they were very uncooperative and "NO" seem to be the only thing that they were good at saying to us.  
So let me break it down first it took us almost 2 hours to check in then we were told all the rooms are suites but they were placing us in a part of the hotel that was due to be renovated everything in the room was old and soiled.
They never vacuumed, the couch you wouldn't be caught dead sitting on They was leftover food dried on the furniture,windows were filthy and we were under the assumption it was a two bedroom suite it was not... this was a two beds in a room.
Now imagine six grown females two beds one bathroom. 
Now to take it a little bit further the air-conditioning wasn't working and we had to have housekeeping come up three times. One to remove and replace the couch, second to clean the room, (It was supposed to be a non smoking room) third to fix the air conditioning. I'm sure you're wondering why we just didn't move to another room. Well they wouldn't let us! The room for the weekend was almost $1000 so if you ever go to the Rio make sure you ask which tower is being renovated and make sure that they put you in the tower that has just been completely redone this complication made our girl trip not such a great trip.

Had a recent four-day stay here courtesy of work, during the World Series of Poker tournaments. I didn't handle our reservation or check in, so all I can say is that we were able to get a room for what seemed to be a good price, with a couple of days notice, during the WSOP.

Our room was a two bed suite in the Masquerade Towers with an awesome view of the mountain skyline and the pools. The room itself was very nice- large, with a couch and sitting area, extended bathroom area with counter and sink outside of the toilet\/shower space. Both beds were super luxe- comfortable pillow top mattresses that worked well for a group that liked both soft and firm beds, with clean and fresh quality linens and lots of pillows.  
The only odd thing about our room was that there was a small window in the wall inside the shower, looking into the bedroom. I don't know if it's intended so that an adult can keep eyes on kids while taking a shower, or so that you can watch TV while in the shower (which is what I did), or if the room was created for some wacky swingers group and I just wasn't told about it. Either way, it was odd but not a problem or anything. One of our group was a little put off by it, but was easily able to tuck some rolled up extra towels in the space to avoid anyone looking in at him- although no one was even trying, for the record.

The property itself has a lot to offer, from the Carnival Buffet, American Grill, Sports Deli, Yogo Gogo, and Evening Call for drinking and dining options,  to the poker room and WSOP tournament in the convention space, as well as hosting the Penn and Teller show (though we didn't see it). There were always employees in sight if anything was needed, and most of them were helpful when we had any questions or concerns. 

Though we'd probably stay somewhere cheaper in the future if the bill was our responsibility, this hotel and casino was a really good pick and we very much enjoyed our time here! Highly recommend.

4.5****
Summer hotel sale: Recently, Rio Suites has been my preferred choice for short stays during my personal business trips. Caesar's Entertainment has a summer sale. Deals are honestly awesome! On a weekend stay I got a double queen deluxe suite for base price $56. Weekday stay I booked a king suite base price $30.  

Total Rewards benefit: All it takes is SIGN UP for TOTAL REWARDS MEMBERSHIP for FREE. I earned a $25 food credit too! Had to order in room service & credit is given at check out. You can pick non-smoking \/ smoking rooms;  mountain views \/ strip views;  single king size bed \/ double queens. And what of the resort & service fees? Not bad... still a great deal!

Location: Close enough to the strip, but isn't crazy trying to leave the hotel lot. Easier access to suburb area eateries & shops. A block away from Bellagio & Caesars Palace. A walk away from Palms.

Amenities: An awesome pool, gym, spa, great restaurants, cool bars (Purple Zebra too cool), popular shows (Rock of Ages, Chippendales, Penn & Teller).  Didn't get to see any but this is where they're at. This hotel has two Starbucks'.

Early check in: is $20 fee.  Standard check in time is 4pm; check out 11am. FYI Sunday early check in is the same line as check out guests. Complimentary water bottles are given out with long lines. Schedule a check in online & email confirm directs you to fall in the Keys & Mail line. Security checks card keys at the Masquerade Tower elevators, but not at Ipanema Tower.

Professionalism: I got slightly lost. Coming from the Masquerade parking structure, there are directions as to which floor takes you to the casino - from the 4th floor parking structure it  brings you to the 2nd floor hotel shops . There aren't any signs directing toward guest registration until I was in the casino. 
The main number to call for information seemed like the call center was in another country cuz the representative didn't seem to know the layout of the hotel, and what she was saying sounded like she was reading off a script - which didn't answer my question. So I just kept walking.
After finding guest reg, they were friendly, patient, quick, & informative. Clearly disclosing resort fee, outlining stay details, and courteous even with a long line on Sunday. Thanks for not being huffy & puffy. And Marilyn from room service delivered my breakfast before the 30 minutes they mentioned.

Recommendation: You'll enjoy your stay. Just try to avoid calling the 800# and ask an in house rep your questions.
Terrible experience. Has to change rooms and was told we had 20 minutes to change. The staff at the front desk was rude and very unhelpful!!!  So many better places to stay.

I've now stayed here probably well over a dozen times in the last 6-7yrs. Frequently the casino even more.
Pros: 
-Just off the Las Vegas strip, so avoiding the typically major strip traffic but still near all the action. Note that one of the busiest intersections, LV Blvd\/Flamingo is just around the corner.
-Rooms are larger than the average hotel room. Included mini-fridge. The rooms ain't 5 star but aren't trashy either. There have been some minor problems a few times, but nothing to ruin a trip.
-At least in my experiences, except for one major incident*, the employees have been real friendly and interactive.
-Parking is ample. There are 2 parking structures, one each on opposite ends of the property and valet is also an option.
-Locals get 50% off the Carnival buffet Monday to Friday lunch and 25% at a couple other food spots. There's a few other locals discounts but that is the most popular one I believe. Pho shop & Deli next to Sportsbook is good for a quick bite.
-Penn & Teller, if you're into magic shows.
Cons:
-Late night dining options are pretty slim. BK Whopper bar on one end of the property and All-American B&G(which if you saw my reviews, I've had bad experiences). Usually friends and I will venture off property for late night grinds. There's room service too I suppose, if you're staying there.
-Machines(video poker\/slots) payouts & table game limits are in line with strip casinos. There is the Palms across the street and Gold Coast next door that offer better gaming options in both aspects.
-For being the home of the World Series of Poker, the poker action is pretty sparse there. Even when there is a game, its mostly locals too.
The Rio seems to try to market themselves as a locals casino with things like food discounts, 2-4-1 tickets to certain shows, staycations. Priority parking for local Diamond\/Seven Star members. It can't be easy with 2 casinos next to them who offer more to local players.
I believe the Rio sure beats staying at some of the lower end casino\/hotels on the strip. The room prices are in mid range. At the same time, it doesn't compare to places like the Venetian, Bellagio, Wynn etc. But overall not a bad option depending on your budget\/needs.

*Three years ago, when I had a Seven Stars Companion players card. Friend and I were playing craps. In the middle of my turn, the pit boss interrupts my roll to 'ask' if I had another players card since this one isn't valid. I tell him it's definitely valid and current but he claims to never have seen this card before. What sucks is, right after this brief exchange, I throw the dice and crap out. You could hear a collective groan from the table of players. If you're familiar with gaming etiquette and craps in particular, it's considered bad luck to interrupt someone's turn like that and like clockwork, I lose right away. I was calm but not happy. I think the rest of the players weren't too glad about what happened. I know my friend was pretty mad about the pit boss interrupting my turn. Of course we both stopped playing right then, but I had to wait while the pit boss sorted it out. I found out he had called the shift manager. She showed up and did some calling and running around, I guess finding out if my card was real or not. After keeping us waiting about 15-20min, she finally introduced herself and explained the situation. She said she had not even seen that particular players card either but did check into it and indeed I am exactly what my card says I am and apologized for the inconvenience. When we cashed out at the craps table, all the pit boss said to us was 'good luck.' He didn't seem sorry at all for his lack of tact and etiquette. I was ok though since the shift manager cleared it up and felt really bad about it all.

Give this place 1 star . It smells , the room have no water or anything in it. I come to Vegas for the pass 20 years never I seen a hotel this bad. Well I guess it's my fault for believing in Expedia for giving them 4 star. What a fucking liar Expedia . Not going to use you guys again. Pay $145 for a night . What a joke this is??? Lucky I only stay 1 night and went to Aria. What's big difference . 6 stars for Aria . The place is clean , don't smell and there's plenty of goodies in the room. Never going stay at Rio if it's free...

My first impression of this hotel suite was really nice. It was really big. But this is coming from someone who has not really been in a lot of suites. I was able to afford it through Groupon.  My real complaint was the shower head. I was sure that someone had stolen the shower head from the shower. When I called maintenance, it took 5hrs to respond. They knocked once and left before I can get to the door. I had to wait until the next morning to take a proper shower. I found out that no one had stolen the shower head, it was just a raggedly shower head. But it was changed to a newer shower head but at these prices, it should have already been in place. The staff was nice. Valet was free. 19th floor had a night view to die for. There are beautiful mirrors in the suite. No microwave, no coffee maker, but there was a refrigerator and a safe.

Casinos off the strip really need to step up because they cannot compete with the strip casinos.  Often they need to have cheaper tables, looser machines or some type of novelty to lure people in their casino.  Rio doesn't deliver, as with most off strip casino.  Rooms are large, but dated.  Views of the rooms are boring.  Casino, while large and cheap tables, doesn't seem to have any excitement.  I guess updating with newer slots is not a consideration here.  It's ok, but once you get on the strip, this place is kind of boring and tacky.

I would actually give this casino 3.5 stars.  it was nice on the inside, I think the shows bring the traffic to the casino.  However, nice atmosphere.  Not alot of shops or food places.  However, I highly recommend the Whopper Bar.  The best Whopper sandwich I have had from a Burger King.

Forgive me Yelpers, for I have sinned.

I should have warned you to stay away from this Hotel du Yuck while I was there, but I waited until I was safely back at home. 

This was my 4th trip to Vegas in as many years and I've stayed in a different hotel each time. After about 1.5 hours in the Rio, I thought it was scheduled for demolition in the very near future. 

Start with the understaffed check-in counter. When I arrived the line wasn't terribly long but it still took about 45 minutes to get checked in. Later in the day it stretched for yards and people were complaining of hour plus wait times. Welcome to Las Vegas!

Then there is the general condition of the hotel. I think the word I want is "Ratty." Not filled with rats! Just worn down and scuffed and not maintained.

And then there was my room. I was there for a conference and my room was actually pretty good in comparison to what some of my fellow attendees endured. I only had nasty stained sink counters a sink that gurgled when I or the person in the neighboring room flushed the toilet (gag.) 

I won't comment on what other conference attendees complained of - they can write their own dang reviews - except to say again that my room was one of the good rooms.

But not all hotels are four star hotels. I understand there are different standards for hotels off the strip. What earned the Rio its solo star is the way it sold these rooms - These were in the Ipanema tower and offered as a special deal. Yeah, because they're all slated for remodeling and in various states of Skank. Oh that's cute.

So the lesson for today Yelpers - If you see a really sweet deal for a room in LV, ask if the room is scheduled for remodeling. If they say yes, proceed with caution.

Hotel: the rooms were a bit dated and there recently was an outbreak of legionnaire's disease via their water, which I believe they have worked on "sanitizing." There is a $30 "resort fee" added each day to the room rate, that doesn't really cover much. One pro is that they still seem to have free parking.

Poker room: I called the room and went through their prompts and it rang and rang for about 4 minutes, so I called back and let it ring while driving there to see how long it would take. It rang for a full 14 minutes and no one picked up. The room itself was not great and I had a great dealer named Devon, but another terrible dealer (I didn't get her name as she wasn't even wearing a name tag). Overall, there are far better rooms to play in on the strip. 

Table games: it's your average lower end casino games-one benefit is lower minimums than some of the nicer hotels. Nothing much to note, here.

WSOP: not bad--mixed dealers (some very good, some need training). You don't make any comps and obviously there are no automatic shufflers.

This is a spectacular hotel casino.  Yes, it is off the Strip, but hey, it has everything here and you may not need to venture off to Las Vegas Boulevard!  Fabulous free show, fantastic rooms.  But if you just got to get to the Strip, they do have a shuttle bus that will take you to Harrahs.

I stayed at the Rio for almost a week last August while attending the Star Trek convention. This was the first year the convention was held at the Rio after moving from the Hilton. There were pros and cons.

Pros:
- The suites are definitely large, but our room in the Masquerade Suites either hadn't been renovated, or remained a fixture of the 1970s. CRT TVs and old carpet. This was definitely the most out-dated room I've stayed in in Vegas (compared to the Luxor Towers, MGM, and Hilton.) Despite stepping into the past, the larger room is definitely a plus; it just wasn't what was advertised on the web site (at all.) 
- The overall atmosphere of the casino is much more energetic than the Hilton. It has a nice show, shopping, and dining area (towards the Masquerade towers). Two Starbucks and a fair amount of restaurants. 
- They offered Zumba classes, which my room mate took part in. They were held outside in the pool area and while I never made it down to the pool, I liked how many pools they had. 
- Convention space was HUGE. Sadly, the main hall and vendor's room were spaced pretty far apart (not bad since I don't mind the walk, but I did feel bad for cosplayers in difficult costumes or hells.) 

Cons:
- Of the few casinos I've stayed in in Vegas, the Rio was the only one that made me sick. I'm not sure if it was poor ventilation or old carpet, but despite all casinos allowing smoke, it has never affected me as much as it did in August. I woke up hoarse every morning and had the sniffles every day (not a full blown cold, but similar to an allergy, although I have none.) 
- Though there were a variety of restaurants, they're all open varied hours and the food wasn't superb at any of them. I didn't get a chance to try the famous Carnival Buffet (when I did walk by, it was PACKED) but the breakfast buffet was formidable. The seafood buffet restaurant was meh. We ate at the breakfast restaurant several times and it probably had the best food to choose from, but is breakfast only. My room mate sampled the seafood restaurant and wasn't impressed with it either. 
- Again, the outdated rooms could have been better.
- Shuttle system wasn't spectacular, either.

if I'm able to attend the convention again next year, I'd only stay at the Rio again out of convenience (and unreliability of the shuttle). Fortunately they've got that going for them, but I wouldn't stay here for any other reason.

Total rewards property are usually nice . This was a giant mistake . Stay at a better properly the Rio is a S hole. Dirty rooms and horrible attitude from most of the staff. I will never come here again
Although the Rio isn't the newest hotel out there, there is still allot to do here. Voodoo lounge and Penn & teller are a must!!! Mcfaddens serves GREAT Irish Car Bombs and bar food.

I stayed here before, but was a little disappointed this time. No coffee, resort fees, rude bartender, and cold water in shower. Had to go to Walmart Grocery store to buy my coffee. Not going to spend $9 in room , when I can get 18 K-cups for $8. Free coffe in the room is a staple in my opinion. The price of the room was good, but a little put off by the cheapness of the hotel.

This was the worst hotel experience we have ever had. They twice screwed up our room and then put us in a room that was partially cleaned, didn't have the view we were promised, we had to lug our stuff to a different tower and smelled of smoke. The staff was not very pleasant or helpful. We will never stay here again.
Did not stay here but visited the casino to gamble. Enjoyed the gambling the waitress were attentive and nice.  Did not win much here but had much fun.

This place is kinda gross. Look, I'm not a prude but I don't necessarily want to watch every single cocktail waitress walk around in a thong and I'm kind of sick of go-go dancers in teddys EVERYWHERE in this casino. The clientele are a bunch of creepy older men who stare at the dancers and waitresses while they sip their drinks- and then they try to hit on the women at the bar (my friends and me). Um NO. 
There is pretty much nothing redeemable about this place.No good restaurants, no entertaining shopping or shows (other than Penn and Tellar). I've had more fun at the Hooters casino than this place. At least Hooters has chicken wings!

I would like to use this review on Yelp to say how's Grateful we are to the security team, VIP reservation for their smart, hard works in loving heart to find our Little Yorkshire back in the very short time, We really are appreciated for the hard work of Rio's security Team, Thanks you so much RIO, 
ViVA RIO
Robert Vu

This place is terrible and unsafe. My friends just got burglarized last night while they were in the room! The guts of this burglar! Rio took a report but didn't even offer to change their room. They had to spend the rest of the night in the same room! This is how they keep their guests safe? I can only imagine how much scarier it would feel for females or families with kids that stay at Rio.

So another conference at this hotel.... smoky, lackluster.  I wish they would eliminate smoking in the area approaching the spa\/conference area. Smoke  seeps into rooms,& conference rooms too. Since they are staying alive with conferences,  they should have better soundproofing, microwaves to reheat leftovers for conference attendees,and coffee makers. A full length mirror would be a nice touch. I attended 3 conferences here this year. A lot more of empty retail space in the masquerade area.  rock of ages.. c, chippendales... a+  guy fieoro s a+ American grill... b

This review is strictly for the **pool** area.

It has a nice set-up with different areas so not everyone is jammed together. I stayed at the one with the walk in pool that had sand right as you walk in. Found a chair and put our (my son and I) stuff down. I noticed as soon as I took off my shoes that the sand was extremely hot!! I mean, I figured it would be hot as it is 98 degrees today. So I picked up my son and literally had to RUN to the pool. The distance was maybe two car lengths. If you see the pool its basically from near the hot tub area. Well I finally came back to the room and I literally have blisters on my feet!!!!! That sand is insane!! How bad does that sand get when the temperature holds well over 100 degrees!!! 

I am really disappointed! I am just super thankful that I did not let my child walk! You would think for a nice hotel that they would do something differently.

I know it's cheap. Have will power.  This is terrible. Much better options. 
It took 3 room changes to get a good one. 
Room 1 had terrible food odor. The floor head housekeeper told me she was getting an ozonator to fix it and to get another room. So  I went back to the desk. 
Room 2 had the heat blasting at 78 degrees. The a\/c did not work. Heater was stuck on. 
Room 3 was ok, but to punish me it was at the very end of the hall.  
The front desk supervisor gave me attitude after room 2, to the point I had to ask for the manager. 
She apologized and gave me the room furthest from the elevator. 
I tweeted and complained and lost 90 minutes trying to get a room. 
No compensation. 
Then on checkout they charged for wifi that was supposed to be free with resort fee. 
Horrible. Stay away.

i booked a room on vegas.com with this place and it was awful. i booked the stay for 4 days and 3 nights but only stayed one night. the staff was rude and the ac didnt work in the room and they did nothing to fix this problem. i have never been so disappointed. it was my first time in vegas too. never again. dont stay here.
Terrible registration service right. 25 guests and only 3 staffers. Manager was no help in speeding line

The Rio has always been a staple of each of my Las Vegas visits, mainly for the Seafood Buffet. This trip was a bit different as we actually booked our room here. The room itself was pretty decent. The view was terrible, overlooking the trash area and the roof. The first day we were here, the wind was blowing and you could here it blowing through the old seals of the windows. This place can use some TLC. New window seals,  fresh window tint since the current tint is peeling and cracking, and the hallways really need some new lampshades. One of the hallway lights was missing a lampshade altogether, and the rest looked terrible with holes or just being out of shape. The curtains on the windows were really wrinkled. Even with all of that, the room was pretty good. I like the size, bed was decent, water pressure was great in the shower, but I could hear the people in the room next door fairly clearly. I would probably stay here again, but I would need a room with a better view.

Poolside lifeguard asleep, wearing shoes and socks. Disgusting to know that i took time out of my day to find a manager; I was directed to security and waited 15mins for a manager, who just wanted to end the situation, had me wait another 20mins as he disappeared on me, I did text this picture to another suited-mgr-type.. Again, he showed no interest in the safety issue of the pool. VERY DISAPPOINTING to know that you cannot find anyone who cares when you need assistance..... besides the poor young man who should be fired immediately, I believe management should be reviewed for how they make someone feel comfortable with something like this. CUSTOMER SERVICE they don't have! don't stay here EVER!!!!!
