I stayed at this hotel last week. The hotel itself is in need of an update but the room was spacious and clean I was pleasantly surprised when I entered the room after herring there through a dingy hallway. The staff was friendly and helpful

The only reason to stay at the Rio is if every other room in LV is booked because you tried to make reservations three days before CES (as was the case with me one year) or if you really, really want to be within walking distance of the amazing buffet. It's as good as advertised.

I've been to every notable buffet in Vegas and I still contend that Bally's Sunday brunch and Rio's world buffet are 1 and 1a when it comes to best places to eat in LV. It's too bad these food Meccas are in such janky locations...

3 stars on the strength of the buffet. 1 extra star because they upgraded me to a suite that was literally 1\/3 of a tower floor, had 4 bathrooms, 2 ridiculously long hallways, and about 900 lbs. worth of oversized CRT televisions straight out of the early '90s.

A hotel off the strip that seems to be a bit forgotten.  So it's not crazy packed on the casino floor and there is more than enough parking too. 

I came here to try the famous buffet and gambled a bit.  The feel of it reminds me of Excalibur just not as crowded.  The decor could use some update as well.

Got a masquerade suite here room was 1600 sqft and rosa was the best host . She helped me plan an amazing event to celebrate and she was very helpful and took care of everything from a-z. Yes this casino is off the strip but with the shuttle ride it's not to bad . I love the space the rooms have to offer here .

Terrible, awful, nasty hotel, restaurants and service!  Comedy was awful also!
Wayne Gorsek

So, no this isn't the nicest hotel in Vegas, pretty far from actually.  And yes, I know it's a bit off the strip.  This is where my friends and I used to stay when we were young and broke and cramped 15 kids in a room and filled the tub with cans of Bud Light and Smirinoff.

However, their newly remodeled rooms are pretty nice.  The suite was huge! Came with two spacious queen sized beds, had a nice big bathroom with dual sinks and plenty of getting ready space (3-4 girls could use the mirror at once!) The living room was a separate room with a huge couch as well a dining table for 6 and bar area with an EMPTY mini-fridge...no bathtub coolers now kids!   There was also another smaller bathroom by the hallway--for you shy folks.  The bedroom has a door closing off the living room as well, an added bonus for late-night rendezvous and not having to kick out your friends...or make them pretend sleep.  Our other friends got a room at the Venetian and were quite jealous that our suite and bathroom was double the size of their room.

The room was comped for us, but it's def. worth your buck.

Pro: Buffet is downstairs...I prefer Rio buffet over Bellagio.
Cons: off-strip
pillows aren't as plush as the nicer hotels..but whatever.

Pros: clean room and nice housekeeping staff. Good water pressure in shower. TV with cable in room. Good sized room. Comfortable couches in room. 

Cons: main hotel area is dingy and dark. Poor building maintenance. Rooms not as described. Not in central location. Uncomfortable beds and pillows. Allergy attacks like never before (allergic to MOLD)

Review:

My roommate and I stayed here for a convention in April 2016. We stayed a total of seven nights and it was a very uncomfortable experience to say the least. Not only was the hotel room not as described, but for such an expensive accommodation there is no coffee maker in the room. That may seem like a small complaint by when you are charge five dollars for every cup of coffee you buy in the casino area or at Starbucks, it really adds up. I mean, come on. Even a hotel six has a coffee maker in the freaking rooms.

Aside from that you do not feel as if you are staying in a expensive Casino Hotel, especially when there are no lampshades on the lights in the hallway's and you are walking over strips of duct tape that hold the carpet together. 

The beds are very uncomfortable and the pillows are like sacks of cotton balls. I have traveled a lot in my life and have never stayed at such a large, popular, and expensive hotel and gotten such terrible accommodations in return.

To make matters absolutely worse, my roommate has had awful allergies after we checked in due to her reaction that only happens when she is around mold. That's right, mold. The room smells musty so I am not surprised. But if you or anyone you are staying with has asthma or bad allergies then you should definitely stay somewhere else.

Because you are not close to the Las Vegas strip if you stay in the Rio, you are forced to eat at the few restaurants inside of the hotel. That means a lot of very long lines and cranky staff members. Not to mention grossly overpriced food. Oh yeah, and if you want to order room service there is an eight dollar fee tacked on to every single order you make. So suddenly that $18 omelette you've ordered has become a $26 omelette.

We did not have a choice in where to stay because of the conference we attended, but in the future, if we have any choice at all, we will never stay at the Rio again.

Definitely seemed like the most adult of the hotel\/casino's... Chippendale's plus flying strip show, plus strip stage on main casino floor...  I would not advise going with children, but would probably be great with a group of friends. Also with the right kind of couple.  But I didn't go in the hotel area.  Also not particularly close to the other casinos.

This is my first time to stay at the Rio and I would have booked a different hotel if I had been aware of how old and run down our accommodations and the amenities would be. From the stains on the ultra outdated and sunken-in sofa, as well as all the other sitting surfaces in the room, to the  closet and vanity area smelling like feces, there is absolutely no sense of any kind of luxury felt anywhere that I've seen on this property. Prior to our trip, I inquired about the availability of a pool cabana online and didn't see the email reply. Now that I see the pool cabanas, I'm really glad I didn't waste money on a subpar cabana. On a positive note, it could be a lot worse :\/

The suites here are average, and kind of disappointing.  The room was dark and just felt blah (dull).  I guess that I was expecting a suite like at the Venetian.  Boy, was I wrong.  It was not even close.

I would not recommend staying here unless there was no charge.  On the positive side, the Carnival World Buffet serves yummy food!

Horrible stay. No running water at 3am. Finally water came on at 5am, but no hot water. Called down and was told there was a pipeleak at hotel and to let hot water run for 10 mins and it would become hot. Never happened. I walked down to front desk, agent was unaware of the situation, had to go in the back to understand issue. They offer for me to go to the gym and take a hot shower. Ridiculous. Was told to try running it for 15 mins and hot will come back. Offered to have someone check on the water in my room. But even agent said it wouldn't make a difference. Tried the 15 min suggestion and it didn't work. Oh, in my 3-day stay the room key didn't work twice and had to go downstairs to get key.

The Rio is more often frequented by the high-rollers in Las Vegas... but back in the day it had the best buffet (now its been out-done by newer casinos) and it had the swankiest lay-out. Nowadays, it is a pretty cool place to hang out or a cool place to stay. All the room shere are suites, so although the average room price is a little steep,  every room here is nice. I think this is a good place to stay for busy holidays because its slightly off-strip and because the rooms are affordable for what they are.

What used to be a great fun hotel and party place to stay, hang out, get great food and gamble (and even win sometimes), is now like a senior citizen, creaking at the seams and very tired. Room appointments were old. High school style featureless showers and bath, with shower head straight out of the YMCA. Lumpy mattress and a bed that sinks in the middle. Lighting insufficient to make the room comfortable at evening and WIFI that doesn't go beyond 2 bars - insufficient to stream or really have 3-4 windows open. One of the sinks didn't drain and a grumpy plumber arrived who drilled for 30 minutes to get it working. Noisy refridgerator.

The casino itself is equally aged and featureless. Gone are the stunning hostesses in green outfits... replaced by haggard irritated staff who run around but never someone a drink. Grumpy valets outside want you to pull right up to the bumper of the car in the front of the queue though there is only the two cars in the entire valet section. Front desk check in took 30 minutes. Buffet choices were full of dry meat, oily pastas and potatoes, over sweetened desserts without finesse.

Needless to say, for the same money (room of $100 a night), right on the Strip, there are now many choices and we won't be back.

Room Tip: Best tip - don't come to the Rio.

Had so much fun at the coo pool! Great Dj with some
Good old school and new age hip hop. Would def recommend !

Out of all my years visiting Vegas, Rio has always been a hotel of choice for their friendly dealers and front desk staff.  This past experience I had with Rio was heartbroken.  I am sad to say the Rio will no longer be my hotel of choice.  I arrived and checked in around 6:30PM and housekeeping barely finished cleaning my room.  One of the towels was not folded and hang correctly and so I got a little skeptic and started checking the room.  I opened the mini bar and sure enough there were half emptied bottles and the bottles were not in placed.  I asked my boyfriend to take a picture of the bar and I called front desk.  I told the female representative about the situation and asked her to make a note of what's going on.  I asked if someone needs to come up to the room to verify we did not touched anything and she said it was not necessary and she will make a note of it.  I made sure when I checked out I was only supposed to pay for the amount that was agreed and sure enough she said that was all she's shown I needed to pay.  When my billing statement came, I saw an additional transaction that tripled my other transaction.  Of course the first thing I did was call Rio to see what was going on.  I spoke with a female representative name Marie and she said she's shown I was only supposed to be charged the amount that I recognized.  She provided me with another phone number to call but said they're not available until Monday to help me out.  I don't know what's going on with management at the Rio.  I have been a loyal customer for years and my family as well but this is not a very honest way to run a business, especially such a big business.  Everyone, be careful.

UPDATE:  Apparently the Rio charges my card because a different hotel guest shared the same last name.  Come on Rio!

This review is only for the hotel room we stayed in for two nights. 
We had two queen beds in our room on the 17th floor, had a great view and was close to the elevators. The decor was outdated, but the room itself was clean... except for the shower head which had mineral deposit on it, needs to be replaced ASAP! Fridge was an old model, it did the job of keeping our drinks and my baby's milk cold, though. 
The fire escape plan on our door did not show where we were (usually indicated by a red dot which says 'you are here').
Overall, I had a good time during our stay at this hotel, it does need a little updating on the decor, though.

I'm really happy with our stay at the Rio. I got an awesome deal for a 3 night stay (wed-sat) for only $127 total!  I booked thru the total rewards website ( make sure to sign in) and got the cheapest rates I could find. Then 24 hours before we arrived, I check the hotel prices and they dropped. I immediately called Rio and they gladly dropped my hotel reservations $80 to a total of $127 for 3 nights. WOW!!!  I was a little skeptical about the rooms with all the poor reviews but I was really surprised.  Yes it was a little dated but I don't care. The room was clean, big, NO bed bugs and very quiet.  I did not hear any of my neighbors or rowdy people walking the halls.  I really loved the fridge.  I heard they have Keurig coffee machines, so I brought my own coffee pods and made fresh free coffee each morning!  The pool was pretty big ( 3 pools) and very spacious.  We also had a rental car so it was very easy to get back and forth to the strip. I can't wait to go back! 
If you don't have a Total rewards card, if you sign up, you get $10 comp money that can be used for your hotel stay, food, etc. It's so much better than slot play!!!

We stayed there for four nights.  I would not return.  Gordon Ramsay  should feature this place on his new show Hotel Hell. It took 6 hours for us to check in.  No Joke.  When we arrived Sunday morning we were told that there were no rooms ready for check in.  We were told to come back after 4pm.  We valet parked the car and it took the valet 30 minutes to bring the car around.  They reserve their service for their Diamond Members.  Then after we returned we were told that our room was still not  ready.  The clerk told us that the system said "MIR" Maid in Room for the past 2 hours and there was nothing they could do because the manager of housekeeping was at lunch.  After I had a chat with the Hotel manager he gave us another room, and upgraded us to a full suite.  I thought Great!  Not so fast.  The wallpaper was peeling, there was no hot water, and the T.V. in the master bedroom had no reception.  We were told there was nothing they could do.  The casino was loud, smokey, and dark.  On a good note our room maid Christine was very attentive, and the drink servers in the casino were friendly, fast, and accurate.  We didn't win, but what do you expect?

Sorry Rio but you guys need some major updates. First off we were offered a free upgrade via email before checking in but there were no upgraded rooms available. The room had not been vacuumed well because there was trash still on the carpet. The carpet was stained all over. 

Why are we paying $30 per day for a resort fee when you have to call internet support to get connected to WIFI? The tech admitted that they have to do this for almost every guest. 

I guess you get what you pay for because 2 of the 3 days were comped.

Rio All Suites Hotel and Casino is a very decent hotel for low price. It's located off of Flamingo near the Las Vegas Freeway (I-15) which is off the strip. 

Another year of my vacation time. I decided to try Rio again. The last time I stayed at the Rio was back in early 2000's with my parents. The room here was pretty cheap, $30\/night. Stayed for 2 night. It wasn't too bad. It got an great view of Las Vegas and the mountain. For $30, you get a suite which is great for those who's on the budget or don't want to pay for a expensive hotel room elsewhere.

They got casino to play and win some money (only if you have good luck), restaurants including buffet which I am gonna write about in my next yelp review, and some other great stuff.

Bottom line, try Rio for your next vacation time.

For locals discounts:  http:\/\/www.riolasvegas.com\/locals\/discounts.html

I stayed at the Rio on Thu\/8 Nov using a $59 TravelZoo.com local deal voucher which included a 1 night stay, $30 dining credit and 2 passes to Voodoo Lounge.

5-stars because:
- All of Harrah's properties (Rio, Paris, Flamingo...) doesn't charge a resort fee (usually $20\/night) for a stay.
- Rio treats locals with TotalRewards especially well: 50% off drinks at any casino bar and The Irish Pub (which has a cool lounge area with sofas and room for beer pong), 25% off their restaurants (except for Hamada) and 50% off Rio Carnival World Buffett for me + up to 7 other people in my party and other discounts (eg show tix).
- Rio has that free Masquerade Parade in the Sky performance Thu - Sat.  It's ok but it is free (other free shows include Treasure Island's pirate show, Bellagio water fountain show, Mirage volcano eruption and the Fremont Street Experience).

Kind of a fluke:
- That $59 TravelZoo deal turned out really well for me since at the hotel I only had to pay an additional $3 or so in taxes\/fees (since there's no resort fee).  I checked the Rio website and an equivalent room that night was priced at $250+.
- TravelZoo also included a $30 dining credit which I used at the Rio Village Seafood Buffett (which I wasn't really impressed with).  I had been to the Voodoo Lounge before so I didn't bother to go there that time even though they have a great view (especially at night) of the Strip\/Vegas.
- During check-in the Rio employee gave me a free upgrade to the 1,600(!) square feet room.  The room had a beautiful 140 or so degrees view of Flamingo Road (which Rio, Gold Coast and Palms are located).  It's kinda funny that the Rio room is bigger than my house (which is 1,548 sq feet with 4 bedrooms) but the Rio room only has 1 bedroom.

The Rio is pretty stellar. Although it's an older establishment, it only means the prices are much more reasonable than comparable places on the Strip. This place is by no means second-rate. The rooms are extremely clean and nicely furnished with a separate sitting area. Granite countertops in the bathroom and vanity area are also a nice touch. 

The all-suite guest rooms are great for big groups, lots of room for throwing shoes around and passing out drunk.  You can even request adjoining rooms with your buds for immediate access to borrow lipgloss or take group tequila shots.

The location is a little out of the way, however they provide a free shuttle service to Harrah's on the strip and Palms is within walking distance. Save a few bucks on the cab fare!

No reason to stay here, unless of course the show you're in town to attend, is there...

I was recently in Vegas for a convention, which happened to be at the Rio. The show was worth it and a great event. Sadly I can't say the same about the hotel. They're larger 'suite' rooms are a plus but that's about where the positives end.

The rooms are incredibly outdated (circa 1980's) and there were so many things wrong with the room that I started a list to keep track. I won't list them all, but the highlights include a safe door in the closet that wouldn't close, preventing closet doors from opening properly. Frayed rug, filthy drapes, issues with shower doors, plumbing issues...the list goes on and on...

Also disappointing was the food in the restaurants. I was only able to find two places I could eat and neither were great. Although Smash Burgers was the highlight if that tells you anything (they had a decent veggie burger).

I won't be back, unless of course the show I attended returns there...fingers crossed that they find a better venue...

The room was beautiful but the beds could be softer. Great view and good AC. TV had less than basic cable, mostly local networks and Cartoon Network. Casino was clean but I wasn't on e offered a drink after several hours of playing. Pools were nice but jacuzzis were pretty dirty and they closed about 6:00 pm. Very odd for a Vegas pool. 

Here's why it only got two stars. After first day noticed a $100 charge that was explained to be a security deposit. They made no mention of this at check-in. Then on 2nd day nearly $100 more charges of mini bar purchases that I never made. $10 bottle of water and and $55 WiFi charges. WiFi charges! Something that Motel 6 gives you for free! They removed the charges but told me it would take several days for the refunds to hit my bank account. 

Left town hundreds of dollars poorer not from the slots but from underhanded business practices and charges for things that the most basic budget motels don't charge for.

I'm going to keep this simple.  I believe the RIO has a systematic scam in place for various customers.  Let me explain...I stayed for two nights.  Upon checkout, i was asked if I took a Heineken out of the minibar.  I responded, "no".  He then looked at me and said, "oK, I will remove the charge for $12."  I said, "Your G-d right you are, I put the Do NOT Disturb Sign on my door for the entire stay and your cleaning staff has never entered my room.  So tell me how the F did you think someone took a beer" ??? I bet if I hadn't checked out in person, they would have kept that BS charge on my bill.  I will never stay here again, because you obviously have a system designed to rip people off.  I have advised the local BBB and the Gambling and Hotel assc.  PS- you are obviously catering to an "urban' crowd now and I am not sure how anyone thinks that will result in more profit.

This room was comped so all we had to do was pay for our flights. The hotel is off the strip therefore, it was mostly the older crowd staying here. Its a bit old but not decrepit. Our suite was in the Masquerade tower and the view was of the pool which was nice. Check in was easy breezy because we used the VIP room for members so no need to stand in line. 
Would I stay here again? No. Why not? Because its off the strip and walking\/taking taxi to Caesar's Palace(my fav Vegas hotel) to shop is really inconvenient and they charged us for refreshments which we did NOT use. Morning we were leaving, we noticed 2 cans of refreshments were missing from the fridge so we shrugged it off. 
We got the bill after arriving back home and there was a $9 charge for that. Freaking ridiculous.
My favorite part was the pool. There was an adult section where you needed an ID to get in and there was another pool with sand!!! 1st day we were in the adult area and the next day we went to the one with sand which was filled with kids of course. Not a good idea cos the sand was FUCKING HOT. But hey! A+ for effort.

I've stayed here three times. twice in the winter and once in the summer. The hotel rooms are always nice and the rates always a steal! All the rooms are suit sizes so it's perfect for big groups to be comfortable!

Winter trips: this hotel is perfect for winter trips. It doesn't matter that it's off the strip because its too cold to walk around outside anyways. and rates during the winter are so cheap. I just got back and only paid 70 bucks a night!

Summer trip: A hotel on the strip would be better during summer but this is a nice alternative. The pool is really nice, didn't realize the private pool area was topless but its all good! The pool is definitely the best part of the hotel, a lot of fun!

Good hotel! no complaints !

I have stayed at the Rio several times over the past few years. Each time was great, but that all changed with my most recent stay. My review is only for the ROOM, not the buffet, casino, or the casino floor shows.

 I went there for my birthday, Feb. 1, 2012, and we upgraded our reservation to the Masquerade Suite. Having stayed in the spacious apartment sized room (900 square feet, I think) with 360 degree views, a separate bedroom, huge living room and dining area, two bathrooms, a jacuzzi tub and TVs in the bedroom and living room,  I had high expectations, as our stay in October was wonderful. The room was clean, updated and lovely.

 Unfortunately, not all Masquerade Suites are created equal. 

First, I should have known anything on the thirteenth floor couldn't be good! I should have asked for another room immediately, however, I was ready to unpack, regroup and  get the party started.  My desire to start celebrating my birthday caused me to overlook the numerous flaws awaiting me as I came back to my room, ready for bed.

To my dismay, the water took FOREVER to get hot and the shower door was unhinged and wouldn't close AT ALL. I was afraid to try and force it, because it felt like I would pull it off its hinges! Yikes!

Then, I started noticing more and more issues one wouldn't want to find in the "luxury" suites. Now, I've stayed plenty of times in the regular suites and could overlook alot of this stuff, but when you're trying to upgrade a bit because of a special birthday event, willing to pay the extra bucks, you hope all the amenities will be there for you. This "luxury" suite was a DUMP!

The carpet was stained and burned (and this was a non-smoking suite)....there was someone else's hotel key card and discarded arm band in between the cushions of the sofa (which leads me to believe the house keeping staff didn't clean and vacuum that sofa, right?)....the duvet on the bed didn't seem clean AT ALL....the mini fridge didn't work....and the twenty year old  CRT tv's were a joke. The remotes didn't work and the picture was awful. PLUS, it smelled pretty musty and the windows were filthy. 

The last Masquerade Suite I stayed in had better TV sets for sure and it was clean and in great repair....not so with this thirteenth floor dump. If I'm paying the big bucks for a fancy suite (fancy for Rio, anyway) I want to feel like I'm experiencing a degree of luxury! This thirteenth floor suite was not luxurious at all, and the hotel shouldn't charge the same for it as they do the nicer Masquerade Suites, because they absolutely do not compare.

On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were crisp and clean. Also, we had plenty of towels and two big closets with lots of hangers. 

Another thing I have observed at the Rio is the utter indifference the staff has if you complain about ANYTHING. When we said there was no hot water they just said to let it run a long time and acted totally annoyed that we dare complain that the shower wouldn't close! FAIL on that for sure.

It was my birthday, and although I have heard that special celebrations will often garner upgrades, or a bottle of champagne, that has never been my experience at the Rio. I have spent three birthdays with them and no one ever did anything special or say "happy birthday" or ANYTHING! We don't even stay through the weekend because my birthday is always around the Super Bowl and we get out of Vegas at least by Saturday, so it's not a super busy time for the hotel. I'm surprised they didn't offer us a nicer room, because I'm sure they weren't booked.

Despite being frequent guests, being Total Rewards members, paying for upgraded rooms when we could have had comped rooms, being nice, and tipping generously, Rio hasn't shown us any love lately!

I will say that if you gamble there, the cocktail servers are attentive and sweet, but despite others saying how sexy the girls and guys are, I find them anything but! They just look like regular folks trying to make  living and I totally respect that!

Bottom line, DO NOT take the Masquerade Suite on the thirteenth floor! It is not worth the money!!!! If you have comped rooms,go for one of those regular "suites" (I just say they are large rooms) but for something special, go somewhere else!

I'm going to try Paris or Planet Hollywood next time we go. Rio used to be a favorite, but the rooms aren't what they used to be.

We stayed from 6\/1\/207-06\/06\/2017 the suite was awesome we were in Room 22001 the maid service was awesome she was the best!! We went to the pool out of 6 days we were there we went to the pool 4 times....If you go look for a server named Terry she is awesome best service as well. Main lobby bar also very good service night and day. To be honest no major complaints. Was an awesome experience!!!

I only came here to check out a show (Ok, ok, Chippendale's ;P ) so I didn't check the casino or anything else out much. From what I saw, it was a lot like most I've seen. Seemed a little more dated than other places I've gone to, but again, that was just from a glance. It is a little bit off the strip (I don't think I'd walk there) but it was nice to check out a little since I hadn't in the past. The show was entertaining though and I enjoy the outside look of the hotel, very colorful :) I would probably come by another time to see more of the interior.

Unless you plan to stay on the 34th Floor or higher DONT STAY HERE. It is filthy, doesnt have a coffee maker or microwave in the room. When the toilet flushed you would hear it running through the sink pipes (gross) . Thr walls were dripping a yellow substance and the ceiling had water spots from a leak. God only knows what and where the leak was coming from. It has a small fridge with a tiny freezer on top and the feeezer freezes your refrigerated food. They dont have a business office, they have a computer that you pay to use. You have to buy minites in order to use it.  This is probably the worst place I've had the displeasure of staying.  The one redeeming feature of this hotel is their employees and I give them 5 stars. If I  was in the casino, lobby, food court, anywhere, an employee would walk over to me and ask "is there something I can help you find? Do you need help?" At first I thought it was a fluke but it happened over and over again. The cocktail waitresses were quick and polite and attentive. So, that aspect of this business is good. Now, if they could teach their managers that same level of customer service.

Nice pool!

Locals can use it for free!!!!!

While the Rio is off-strip, it does have a free shuttle taking you to other Caesar's\/Harrah's properties along the strip. That's useful for getting to shows or other events, but not for airport travel, as luggage isn't allowed on the shuttle.

I was at the Rio for a conference called Defcon, a computer hacking event. Kudos to the Rio for being willing to hold a conference like that, which I've heard can be hard to find a host hotel for.

I played some blackjack. The minimum bet was $15, our dealer was friendly to both the winners and losers and drinks were fast. Blackjack pays a traditional 3 to 2 at the Rio, which is a more desirable payout that narrows the house's advantage. While I was just having beers, a friend at the table was ordering top shelf cocktails and getting them almost immediately. Service was fast. Like any casino, drinks are free if you're gambling, but do remember to tip your server and your dealer.

On the downside, your only good option for food is the Sports Deli for pizza, burgers, and the like. DO NOT go to the buffet, which is as overpriced as it is mediocre.
Service here is nice. Donna manager of cashier is super friendly and Karen in room service is great.

A tired hotel in need of some serious updating.

There are many goo features: Dog friendly, the buffet, the pool area, and the vibe on the casino floor. However the rooms and hallways are in serious need of a spruce up.

I think this hotel has now slipped into the bargain bin category of hotels. It's fine if you can get it cheap sub $50\/night and avoid the exorbitant resort fee, otherwise look elsewhere.

Dear Rio,
You are old, falling apart, inconsistent with service and your hotel rooms smell musty. Fortunately we are here on a work trip and didn't have to pay to stay.
Just had a stay there for a few days. The place was clean and very well maintained. The room was very nice and the view we had was excellent. c.

Check in super easy and Georgie was very nice and set us up in one of the newly renovated rooms in the masquerade tower.  Pleasantly surprised, I was expecting horrible everything based on reviews.  Nothing special in the casino and definitely nothing to come back for but I would come back in a larger group if we could all get the masquerade tower.  It was an uneventful stay.  No complaints

I love this place because you are somewhat removed from all the craziness on the strip. That tends to suck when you want to go out and party since you have to cab it everywhere but it was worth it nonetheless. The rooms were large enough for a bunch of crazy messy girls and the casino host we had was great. I am thankful that this place doesn't have tons of shops. Prevented me from doing drunk shopping.

Bad hotel. I reserved a non-smoking room, but they gave me a smoking-permitted room (which is essentially just a smoking room, since there are do differences between smoking permitted and smoking; the hotel doesn't force anybody to smoke in smoking rooms, after all). The manager was a complete moron, and stated that they could only guarantee me a room, not a non-smoking room. So, I left and when to a different hotel after they refunded my money. I should have never considered such a trashy hotel in the first place.

It was like walking into 1987 with "Take my Breath Away" by Berlin playing in my head as I looked through the room. I think this is the only hotel in Las Vegas with tube televisions. Even the Excalibur has LCD TVs at $37 a night. The room is a good size, but all I can look at is outdated decor- brass lamps, green carpet, and brown cabinets. Expedia rated this hotel with 4 stars and the pictures online looked good as well so it was a fat disappointment to stay at this hotel. Most of the people who are staying at this hotel look like they are from Fresno, CA. The hotel shops have cheap boutiques like a strip mall. 

The rate was reasonable but next time I will spend an extra buck to get a better room somewhere else,

My wife and I were looking for a place to stay during our anniversary.  I found a great rate online for the Rio so I decided to book a room.  The booking process was easy and I received my confirmation through email  I also received a reminder and a book in suggestion the day of our reservation.  I chose that option because I thought it was going to be easier.

Arriving at the hotel I proceeded to the self check in kiosk.  I had a bit of difficulty with the machine reading my driver's license but I eventually received my room keys.  I found ample parking in the structure adjacent to the Rio and I parked on a shaded level.  I would recommend parking on one of the shaded levels due to the heat.  We took all our bags and proceeded to our room.  Our room was located on the 10th floor so getting there was not too difficult.

Room - The room was spacious and had a large King bed that was very soft.  There was also a large couch with a coffee table and a smaller table with 2 chairs if you decided to eat in your room.  There was plenty of storage as well as closet space.  The bathroom had the usual with a tub with a shower.  Getting into the tub to take a shower was a bit of a challenge.  The room had a refrigerator but it kept things to cold that everything froze.  I tried to find a way to adjust the temperature of the refrigerator but could not locate anything.  It would have been nice to have a microwave in the room.  

Pool - There is a beautiful pool at this hotel but getting to it takes a lot.  You have to walk through the entire casino to get to the pool.  The music at the pool is really loud so if you have a room facing the pool it challenging to rest during the day.  

I am pretty sure that I will not be staying at this hotel again.

The most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept in. Every morning we would wake up in so much pain. When I went to plug my phone in I found women's hair ties behind the dresser, and the worst part was our shower and sink didn't want to drain. We also spent WAY TOO MUCH money trying to get a buzz on the drinks at The Rio.. They were so watered down... Also when we walked through the building there were garbage cans out to catch water leaks. We wont be staying here again.

Bait and switch practice, we bought a coupon package and we had a difficult time in getting them to honor their prices.

Could not do TV in room or online check out.

Sink drained slowly.

Buffet pre-cut crab legs were dry and salty.

Will not be staying here again.

First time ever to Vegas!
I really like the service at rio.
Enjoyed the pool, all the restaurants here and of course the casino was awesome. Definitely want to return soon!

Hotel: 3.5 stars
The Rio was our homebase for this trip to Vegas. It was really convienent to have the shuttle that went from the hotel to the strip every half hour. The room was pretty nice. The pullout bed was kinda comfortable and room service was pretty quick to bring up the bedding when we requested it.

Seafood Buffet: 2.5 Stars
I'm not a huge seafood lover, but my friends are. So we each shelled out (pun intended) $45 for all you can eat seafood buffet. Some of the stuff okay, the sushi was fresh, but the shrimp was over cooked and it was freezing cold in the restaurant.

I found this hotel pleasing for a number of reasons. First, they have an amazing coffee and dessert place in the Masquerade Walk next to McFadden's. It serves up these amazing fruit tartes with a good six varieties of fruit, and these taste like someone just sliced the fruit five minutes ago. I was in foodie heaven with the blend of pear, pineapple, blueberry, raspberry, strawberry, apple, etc. 

Second, they created an entire theatre for Penn and Teller. If you haven't seen Penn & Teller already, GO SEE THEM NOW. They're a Vegas staple, they're a national treasure, and they're worth every penny of their tickets. 

Third, the buffet. Oh, sweet Lord, the buffet. If you haven't experienced what appears to be a mile long parade of everything from sushi to pork chili verde to peach cobbler, you're missing out. 

Fourth, if I recall correctly, they have a beach by their pool, for your toes in the sand-dipping pleasure. What more could anyone want? 

Granted, I haven't tried their suites, so I can't really comment on everything, but I really enjoyed myself there. I was certainly tempted numerous times by their "Sky" show masks at the gift shops, but managed to forebear. Perhaps next time...

I stayed at the Rio not long after its opening...... it was nice back then, and had a flavor of Brasil, accurate to its namesake. But years have past, and styles have changed, and the Brasilian theme has evidently been orphaned by the new owners. 

The best thing about the hotel, for us, was the yogurt shop near the front entrance. Two nights in a row, we paid our $5, and figured our own way to "fill the heck" out of the 12 ounce cups that they provide. Your challenge, if you're up to it, is to fill up the cup with "unlimited frozen yogurt", and whatever toppings you can fit in... best deal in the hotel. 

If it hadn't been for our trade show being based out of the Rio a few months ago, I'd have stayed at one of the Hilton Grand Vacation Resorts in town, or far off the strip in Henderson. The room we had reminded me of my stays in the mid 90's... and considering we're in the first decade of the 2000's... this hotel, with its new ownership, is evidently being milked for all it can give. Eventually, I figure someone will "renovate." 

The capper to our shared opinion was when the shuttle driver and the cabbies we had all shared negative comments about the hotel. We thought we were being snobbish in our opinion that the "class of clients" and the hotel itself, had severely gone downhill. But we didn't have to look far for agreement. For me, this recent stay brought back memories of the Fremont St. hotels in the late 60's... early 70's, long before Steve Wynn "renovated" the Golden Nugget and made it golden. The Rio needs that kind of makeover..... the sooner the better.

I have stayed at the Rio for many years. Last night after a very long work day, I decided to order room service. I don't mind paying for overpriced food( you pay for convenience ), but when your food is delivered in takeout cartons,it's unexceptable. And to add insult to injury, they charge you $8.00 delivery charge, and not one dollar goes to the person who brought it. Well, this will be the last time I will be a guest of the Rio and if they continue to listen to the genius that thought this one up, they're going to lose more customers like me.

We got there an hour before check in and were told had to wait, or else pay $45 for early check in. Walked around the hotel a bit while we waited, and figured out quickly we wouldn't be spending much time here. 

The room was spacious, but just a generic hotel room.

The shuttle to\/from the strip was a nice amenity, except for that it caused a lot of stress. We were always worried about getting to the stop in time to catch the next shuttle, because they only run every 30 min. While waiting more and more people would get there, and then we'd worry about if we'd even get on. The shuttles didn't usually run on time either. UGH not worth the stress!

Pool was nice and I liked the rocky\/natural decor.

Parking was free! Huge bonus

Overall wouldn't stay here again

Hotel is decent but nothing spectacular. The restaurants and bars are average as are the tables and slots. As a hotel guest, the worst part are the amenities- the gym has horrible hours (even lower end hotels now mostly offer 24 hour gym access), the coffee supplied in the room is replaced by a chain coffee kiosk in the lobby that has a long line and poor service. Complaints are basically "we are sorry" with no improvement in sight.

Nice hotel and rooms but I'm here for a seminar. Very long walk to the meeting rooms making it not handicap friendly. No coffee, not enough food, etc. for all participants even though we paid a lot of money to be here. There are people sitting on the floor because there's not enough seats.

I've been doing these Vegas seminars for 30 years but if our governing organization picks this venue again we probably won't go.
They have live shows throughout the casino in the style of Carnival with beads and floats and everything! Their Carnival buffet has the biggest selection of food I've seen anywhere.

Not good.

Room: premium suite; one bed (whew), one sofa, one desk with chair, tv on credenza.  Only one person could see tv from sofa. A simple move of desk and sofa would have been good for tv viewing and seeing the view outside. Bed was ok pillows were not.

Dining: expensive and generally as good as a Denny's. Service was average to poor except Juan in the all american grill - he was great. Guy F mexican only open for dinner. Trash can nachos - should have left the trash can for the 90% dry chips so we could enjoy the chips with something on them. We ordered an extra $4 salsa that made the nachos better but we should have ordered 2. Katie, however, was friendly and provided great service. 

Room service : wouldn't try it. $23 for an omelet and $8 delivery charge.  Thankfully they had a starbucks!!

Check in\/out were quick and friendly. 

One star for Juan and Katie, for the maid service, and the front desk.

The Rio isn't what it used to be nor will they see us again.

Another stay at Rio.  We like the place even though it's aging. 

Staff is first class. They really seem to work hard at customer service.

WiFi: slow, included in the resort fee, but only for 1 device. Watch out if you have several phones, ipads, and computers. You'll pay $14 a day for each if you sign in thinking wifi is free. It is, for 1 device only.

Parking: Always a challenge. Valet is the way to go. They get your car parked safely and retrieve it toot sweet.
I like it. This is one casino I'll always go to. It is a really big casino that offers every game compare to other casino with lots of food selection

When we checked in the guy helping us said he upgraded our room but it turned out to be a smoking room, we reserved non smoking. We were tired and went to bed as it was 3ish in the morning and when I went to get it fixed the lady said there were no non smoking rooms left. I wouldn't have been so pissed if I wasn't lied to at check in. We asked when what money would be taken out and he said the deposit for $200 would be taken now and the rest when we check out. The next day all of it was taken out and we had three days left in our vacation. My pay day fell two days later which is why we asked. I'm only giving two stars because my experience at the voodoo nightclub was pretty cool.
Largest room we stayed in, wide variety of food at the Carnival buffet, Diamond lounge was nice and free shuttle to the strip every 30 min.

Terrible customer service. We had booked a luxury suite and instead got a smaller room that reeked of marijuana. Complained and even got a smaller room. We tried working things out but because our room was "complementary" they were treating us terrible and kept saying "well your room is complementary so we can't do anything for u." Regardless if it was comped or not we were customers and the reason we were comped is due to gambling in Vegas...will never stay at this hotel ever again. Although I do have to say the employees at Vale were super nice. Aside from that not worth it at all.

Noisy sums it up. The rooms are reasonably large and have most things that you'd expect (but no tea and coffee). Some have great views, but all that I've tried (3) have noise issues, although I am a bit sensitive to noise when trying to sleep. The staff were pleasant and helpful, but the internet technical support was rubbish (a switch failled removing wired and wireless access, but still wasn't fixed over 36 hours after it was diagnosed, when I left).

One of the classic hotels of Las Vegas...due to the BUFFETS :p

  It's a great, simple hotel nothing too over the top but definitely worth the stay here. Despite the age of the Rio they did a great job updating the furniture, making it contemporary and very comfortable.

  There was a long line at check in but what do you expect? It's the weekend, everyone goes to Vegas on the weekends. But once we got to the front of the line the staff was very helpful and cordial.

  Personally if I had to deal with all those people, I would lose my mind haha, so kudos to the staff of the Rio for keeping their cool. Obviously it's a little far from the strip so bring extra money for cabs.

Still a great place to stay after all these years, keep it going Rio :D

Went to Vegas with the fellas to play in the Colossus "World Series of poker" tournament. The tournament is held at the Rio, so we decided to book our rooms there for the weekend.
This was the first time I had been to Vegas in about 6 years, and I can't believe they still let people smoke in the casino, it's very off putting when your sitting at a table and the guy next to you is puffing on a cigarette.
The overall casino was decent...it has plenty of gaming tables as well as restaurants and bars to choose from. The pool area is ok, could use some updating.
The rooms could use some updating as well...furniture is old and rundown. 
We were having issues with the lock on the door...which we requested be fixed, that never happened. Also we wanted to use the safe, but the door was already closed and locked, figured we were waisting our time to call the front desk again. We requested a late checkout which they declined.
I would recommend checking out the voodoo lounge on the 51st floor at night...very cool and awesome views of the strip and city.
All in all I prob will not stay at the Rio again.

Older hotel rooms but still in decent shape, queen beds could use replacement. Service was good as well. Pool was a great place to hang out, ton of kids, pools and jacuzzis could use a little rehab. Decent stay, would go again.

For a Vegas hotel, when there are so many to deal with, you think the concierge would not suck.  Alas, not true.

We waited for tickets with maybe five people ahead of us in line, but that wait about forty minutes.  When I asked if we were in the right place to PICK UP (meaning paid-for) tickets, I was told here was nowhere else to go.  

There were only two people dealing with tickets, one of whom had his thumb up his ass and was incredibly incompetent, and the other who was slightly better but had to deal with everyone, since the other guy working the counter might as well have not been there.  Fortunately for me, the gaming area was next to the concierge, so I could watch the Cubs game while I waited for the poor staff.

The other concierge line was worse though, with maybe fifty people in it and the line moving just as slowly.  If your job is to provide service, you would hope that these people would know how to do so.

My wife and 3 of our children decided to celebrate my birthday in Las Vegas!
We rented Four (4) rooms!
I usually try to keep up with my work using my Lap Top!
To accomplish this I must use the Internet!
The WiFi at the RIO is so slow it was impossible for me to conclude any work!
The cost of the WiFi use is included in the resort fee, of $22.00 plus tax!
But only for 1 device. Watch out if you have several phones, ipads, and computers. It is, for 1 device only!  I asked if I could use the Business office or another office and they are all the same!
I felt ripped off and will never stay at the RIO again!
E Wood
Bellevue Washington

I came here the year it opened, and it was amazing. The concept that all rooms were suites was totally new. The prices compare well with the other Major strip hotels (although this one is someway off the Strip).


 The Buffet is one of the best in Vegas. The Cocktail Waitresses probably the sexiest and the rooms are lovely.


 Now they host the Annual World Series of Poker, so I will be visiting again.

Short version: Unimpressed. 

Long Version: 

Understaffed front desk made for an extremely long wait to check in, probably 30 minute plus wait. 

Room is dated. Mold in shower, crusty stains on carpet. Spacious. 

Spoke with front desk, house keeping, manager to no avail. If you need a microwave to cook your own food due to food allergies, you WILL NOT get a microwave here. You will also be told that there are no options anywhere in hotel that would allow use of a microwave or offer services to heat\/cook personal food. 

Wifi performance was spotty. 

Conference area is actually pretty decent, hence 2 stars instead of 1.

The hotel is ok. It's dated and all but there are some fun bars and they brought back poker after canceling it years ago to put in yet more slots. So that's good. 

Big negative that you cannot get Lyft or uber in front of hotel. You have to go to a scary back door basically forcing you to take skanky vegas taxis from there.

Okay, so the Rio sucks! We are Vegas regulars and aren't really picky but I won't be coming back to the Rio any time soon! First thing was when we checked in, the guy could see we had three kids with us (we were in town for a wrestling tournament being held at the Rio) yet he put us in one of the closest rooms up top by the Voodoo Lounge which is open until 4am! So as we are trying to sleep, we just heard the base of speakers BOOM all f' ing night! And we had kids that needed to be up early to wrestle! Arghhhhh, we were pissed!  Being so tired when I woke up, I thought I would just make some of the "in room" coffee.  Nope, if you want coffee, it costs 8 bucks!  I don't even think Motel 6 does that!  Can you say tacky?!? Second, the elevators suck. It takes 10 minutes for one to get up that high and it takes 10 minutes if you are downstairs so you are screwed either way. Not like you can walk up and down 30 flights of stairs! Third, the rooms are totally dated and not very clean. No one ever came to clean our room during our entire stay.  Fourth, ate breakfast at the breakfast cafe and it sucked.  The food sucked, the prices sucked (16 bucks for a bacon and egg breakfast) and the service sucked.  Fifth, I did spend some time at the tables there and ordered mai tais from the cocktail server.  I had about five of them and they were different every time!  Not one of the drinks I received was an actual mai tai!  Ewwwww.  Oh, and the slot machines suck too.  I probably lost $300 bucks on the stupid slots there.  So tight, didn't hit a damn thing!  Now I'm wishing I would've taken advantage of the free rooms and food I was being offered at The Orlean's.  That would have been a much better option.  If you do stay here, make sure you don't gamble, don't eat, don't drink and request a room on a lower floor away from the lounge unless the crazy boom of a speaker lulls you to sleep at night.
This review is for the Carnival Buffet. 10 stars....a must when you visit this city!

Worse experience ever. We book a room from 9\/16 to 9\/18. We checked out the room on 9\/18. They sent us a receipt for it. A week later, we received another charge for 1k. I called Billing department to dispute. Billing tell me to call front desk. I call front desk. They tell me to call Billing. I requested to spoke to manager, all response I get is manager do not take direct phone call. They have to email the manager and have the manager call back. I hate it then they over charge but refuse to resolve the issue.

Avoid staying here at all cost because you might run into same situation like me where no one care to help.

We just finished our stay here. Our family stayed for 2 nights and we were in town for the rock and roll marathon. 
We brought our two kids with us even though they did not participate in the marathon. Our plans included swimming since the Rio web site stated that they had pools and the times and days of the week were noted too. 
With my kids in tow we head to the pool only to find it was "closed for the season". WHAT! I was so upset and so were the kids. After that my husband took the kids upstairs, I stayed back to speak with the front desk and was remanded to the manager. 
All I got was an apology and late check out.
-The buffet was okay, I'm a picky eater, but the fam seemed to like it. 
-No pool!
-Room size were a nice size with a seating area and nice floor to ceiling windows. 
-beds were not comfortable. 
-many toiletries. 
All in all I give it their average right 3. Maybe we'll be back , but advertising something that is not available is not cool and resort fee is for gym, wifi, free phone calls. That's vogus

The Rio is nice but a bit pricey for an "off strip" casino. They do host Penn and Teller, (very entertaining) an amazing seafood buffet and the WSOP. If you want more value on games, there are definitely some better spots.

Big props to The Rio for taking great care of us due to a fire in the big tower.

Total pros

The hotel and room was OK but no hot water. These LV hotels are ripping people off with the so called resort fee. $34.00 per night for using hotel features that should be paid for in the room price. Just a way to offer lower room prices and then jacking up the rates once you show up at the hotel, what a ripoff! When you book they don't tell you about the resort fee, just say that there may be other changes that apply. They should just add it to the room price so there's no surprises when you arrive. Come on $34.00 per night is outrageous. I won't be back to Vegas for awhile! Oh by the way the shuttle service doesn't take you wherever you want to go, as we were told when we called to make the reservation, only to Harras or Balleys. Then you have to walk from there.

Customer service suck, rooms were outdated and the food was aweful. The pools close at 7pm, WAIT WHAT? it's  175° outside at night , WTH!. Eddie Griffin show tickets start at $73 and up.  Club wasnt even open til Wednesdays. Maybe Rio was having a bad week?
I'm good, thanks.  I will never be back and they won't miss me.

My husband and I stayed at the Rio the last time we were in Vegas. We just had a standard room and I thought it was just fine. The bed was comfortable enough and everything was clean. I don't think you need much more then that when you spend most of your time outside of the room. We ate breakfast a few times at the Sao Paulo Cafe and it was excellent both times (the service was very good too). The only downside that I could see was that it was not conveniently located on the Strip. We will be going again in February, but we will staying on the strip at Planet Hollywood.

Besides the lock for the front door, none of the other locks worked. Locks come in handy when you are sitting on the throne and do not want to be bothered by the people you are staying with!  That is probably my only problem with this hotel. 

Everything else was great. The staff, the cleaners, and the people who calls the taxis.
 
There is a burger king on the property and I love burger king.

The rooms here are super large, but very ugly. Dirty looking carpets, small shower with a slow drain, and old TV\/furniture. Bed is soft, but pillows suck- they flatten too easily and shed too much feathers. Overall, our room was poorly furnished so all that space just kinda went to waste. Not only that, the hotel is located off the strip...too far from all the action. If it weren't for the World Series of Poker, I wouldn't be staying here.

Front desk is misinformed and tries to accommodate, but majorly fails. When checking in at 1pm, they were out of smoking rooms and we didn't want to wait 2-3 hours for one to be available. So the lady offered us an upgrade to their 1600 sq ft Masquerade suite for an extra $100 per night for 7 nights, which we agreed to take...but then she rescinded that offer after she realized my boyfriend had a 3 week reservation. Apparently they were afraid he would not leave the suite and they'd have no choice but to let him keep the suite at a low rate for 3 weeks. Umm, what!? Set up some better policies or let us pre-pay or even sign a contract saying we will switch rooms. The boyfriend was even willing to cancel the remainder of his reservation in order to get those 7 nights...but then the manager decided to cut it down to 5 nights. WTF. Talk about poor customer service. After like a half hour of getting nowhere at the front desk, we declined the upgrade and checked into a non-smoking room for a few hours to rest, shower, and then immediately changed into a smoking room once it was available. *sigh* Oh how life would be much easier if I wasn't dating a smoker!

Only positives I can think of for this hotel is the mini fridge in your room that you can stock up with your own drinks and the large pool area, with 4 different pools and plenty of chairs.

Gyro. G is right this place is heading down hill. Starting with the world buffet. I cant tell the diffrence between hometown buffet an this place. Shower heads are disgusting. Some of the staff have the does it look like i give a F look on there face. Rio used to be a good hotel key words used to be. Check in staff and supervisor staff needs to be trained on empathy.

I went to Vegas for the first time for my bday weekend and it was amazing!! I stayed at this hotel and I can say my stay was pleasant. Neither did my boyfriend, cousins or I have any problems while our stay here. The bed was comfortable and the sheets as well. The room was pretty cheap too, altogether it was about $300 (2 nights). It wasn't all glamorous of course but I think for the price it was decent. The bathroom was clean and so was the area where I got all dolled up! ;) Few things I didn't like was that the snacks and drinks they offer in a lil fridge are too expensive. $5 for a can of soda or a snickers? $10 for nuts? That's ridiculous! Of course one can take their own snacks but I just thought i'd mention that. Another thing is the housekeeping. On Saturday morning we woke up at 7 (yes, i know, it's early lol) and were out of the hotel room by 8 am. We went and explored the strip, had some breakfast, went shopping and didn't get back to the hotel until about 4 pm. As we walk to our rooms we see the house cleaners' utilities there and we are like "Wow, they are barely cleaning?" Neither my cousins' or our room were even cleaned!!! This is why it loses a star. I mean I would think they would have done this in the morning. My boyfriend and I even ate at my cousins room, we chilled for about an hr or so and our room was not cleaned yet and no one had gone to their room to check if we still needed the cleaning. We finally went back to our own room and as soon as we got comfortable enough to take a nap after a long day of walking there's a knock on the door. "Housekeeping" Seriously? At that point we just declined it because we were too tired. That is the only "bad" experience we had. Other than that, our stay here was pleasant!

Great prices for rooms here. Definitely the place to book if you're bringing your dog along on your stay. Pet friendly property.

They offer substantial savings on their buffet for locals. 

Free parking. Not on The Strip but only a few minutes away.

Lot's of shops here. Nothing too thrilling in their shops. Their on site restaurants are okay but not exceptional.

Your kids might like the commotion created by their nightly giant ark that floats around their casino area from which they toss Mardi Gras Beads.

This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. This is more along the lines of motel. Arrived and supposedly got an upgrade. Got to the room and it was one of the dingiest, oldest rooms ever. Called the front desk to change rooms and just get the one I paid for from Vegas.com that according to Vegas.com was supposed to have a walk in shower.

Got to the room and no walk in shower just a disgusting tub shower combo. The room reeked of cigarettes even though it was a non smoking rooms and everything looked it was out of the 1970s. Called the front desk to check on the walk-in shower and was told that they only have that amenity for the $300 suites. The receptionist was very rude and insisted that it was Vegas.com's fault and that I should take it up with them. She then went on to suggest I pay extra for the $300 suite. I declined and reached out to Vegas.com.

They just put the blame back on the Rio. By this time after my 14 hour drive from Colorado I was over it and decided to just bite the bullet and stay. 

When my 3 nights were up, my boyfriend got food poisoning on the last night. I called the front desk and asked if we could stay an extra night because we definitely could not drive in his condition. They said we would have to moved rooms and it would be an extra $200!!! That was ridiculous. I went direct to resort websites and got a fantastic deal at the Wynn. Got an early check in, a beautiful clean room, and the staff were the nicest people on earth. 

Please if you want to have a good time in Las Vegas don't stay at the Rio. I was so upset that I wasted 3 nights of my life in that hell hole, the Rio. Pay a little extra and spring for a nice room somewhere else. You'll just smell like an ashtray, get a rash from their 20 year old mattresses and hate humanity if you stay at the damn Rio. You've been warned.

I had an awesome experience here. This place is very close to the strip, so we rented a car and drove everywhere we needed to go (thank you, Las Vegas Strip, for having  free parking almost everywhere!).

We got a free upgrade because of my brother's birthday, so each couple got a bigger room, but it was in the smoking rooms. FYI if you hang up your clothes here, they WILL smell like cigarettes within the first day. But the room was spacious, comfortable, and had great views. 

Penn and Teller has shows here, but it's not that great. Lots of restaurants in the hotel, lots of games in the casino that are both cards and machines. Sign up for the rewards card if you gamble a lot, and you will rack up points to spent on rooms or eating.

This place was a steal to book, and I would gladly come again.

Haven't had an opportunity to stay here until this last weekend. Although the hotel was pretty packed, we had a great time. The rooms were adequate and the facilities are nice.

Cons - pools need more servers and they need to be promoted more by the hotel.

I will say a big plus is the fact Rio has not given into politics and have not yet stated to charge for valet, like all the other money hungry casinos. We were are Bally's for 15 mins and they charged us $18, sad!
Fell in love last year on a girls trip. So had to come back with the Hubby to celebrate his bday. Loved the buffet, late check in, Lyft is easy to find and rooms are so spacious.

We booked months ago for a double bedroom at Rio.

Our flight was delayed a bit, and the shuttle took off late.

We arrived at 11:30pm to check-in along with a large group (they were probably in our flight). 

When our friend came up to the counter to check-in under her name, they said the double bedroom was unavailable. 

Apparently, the Rewards system we used is 'subject to availability'.  

With that said,  we were tired and resigned that this is not going to be a good Vegas Trip after all.

The most they could accommodate was to give us a King bedroom with a roll away bed in a 'renovated' room.

We had to go to the Masquerade Tower on the 9th Floor.

Our bedroom is a King sized bed. The rollaway is meant for 1 person (seriously, and if you are taller than 5ft. Good luck fitting in it).

And there is a small couch. 

The room itself is half-way renovated in my opinion. The carpet is still old and musky with some stains on it. The couch is definitely not comfortable. (I feel like I will sink in it if I sit on it).

The shower is substandard. It's loud and it seems like it takes awhile for it to start working (this was around 6:30-7am).

Oh and a creepy thing about this room? There's a window that you can look into from the bedroom.

We are hoping we can get the 2-bedroom. And the friends that are coming today can get a room as well. 

Here's hoping. And also a warning to others to not book through a Rewards system because of that subject to availability.

One star is already an understatement. They didn't let me select 0 stars, but this is what this hotel deserves. We booked 2 connecting rooms and after we checked in, which I should mention, took 45 minutes, we noticed one of our room's privacy lock was kind of sticky and wouldn't close properly. We proceeded to go downstairs and talked to customer service. Again, we were disappointed with the service. The guy who helped us, Jay, offered us 2 rooms that weren't connecting and at the very end of the hallway. He wasn't accommodating at all. He asked us if we wanted someone to come fix the lock so we asked him how long it would take. He said "that's a good question". We took the other 2 rooms because we thought he said it was connected and after walking back and forth, it was worse than the first 2 rooms we originally booked. We waited in the line again, which took another 20 minutes and spoke to Laverne. She asked us what was wrong while Jay was standing right next to her. We told her about the situation and she said "why would you want to move back into the room with the broken lock?" Well, if you guys could manage to fix our problems then maybe we could be staying in a working room. Not to mention, the pool was closed to a private event in the middle of the day. We have stayed here many times before, but now the customer service is rapidly decreasing in helpfulness. Really really not satisfied with Rio and their business. Never coming back again.

This place is a dump.  Housekeeping skipped our room twice.  Internet was down most of the time.  A call for help got a rude visit from the general mechanic.  Casino is noisy, dark and kinda cheap.  Location (off the strip) makes for lots of cab rides.  Pool has a ton of rules for where you can sit and what the minimums are.  Won't stay here again

I occassionally book at the Rio because it is of course a suite and the size of the room is great.  I've been coming to this hotel since 2000 because I get comped or really good rates.  Can't beat getting a suite for $20.00.  

The casino\/resort is on a whole fairly average.  The rooms are large but the bathrooms need to be updated.  The times I have stayed here, it was always clean.  The beds are comfortable and the seating area is big.  You can have room service sent up and you have the room to eat comfortably.  I have no complaints, except that it does need updating.  

I would stay here again because of the comps and the deals as well as the size of the suites.

This is a slightly off the strip experience. So if you have had your fill of that, then the Rio is a great option! It's close to the Palm's Place and other resorts. It's also close to the Asian district of Spring Valley if you want to grab food or visit small businesses. 

The hotel is older. Things are not going to be brand spankin new and polished but it's not without its charm. We stayed in the Ipanema tower. The rooms were clean and minimal with a pleasant whites and earth tones. A friend of ours compared it to the Mandalay Bay. The room was spacious with a large vanity area separate from the bathroom. It was clean and comfortable and totally did reflected a remodel since the hallways outside looked more dated. The hallways of this tower reminded me of an old cruise ship.

The slots were alright but they did not have the newer slots that even downtown LV has. On one end of the casino floor there is a stimulated outdoor area with businesses on the second floor to peruse. It's supposed to look like an outdoor Rio De Janeiro. This area feels somewhat disconnected from the main casino floor. There is a stage here for live music also.  

The pool was icy cold. It isn't heated so plan to go while the sun scorches the water and warms it up. It was kind of a strange sensation. There are multiple pools of different depth and size including one large deeper one. 

All in all, if you are looking are a more quiet experience to explore LV slightly off the strip then I would definitely book at the Rio. It's a fun and casual experience. There are dancers on platforms for your entertainment while you gamble. The dealers are dressed in fun top hats and bowties like sexy magician assistants. If you have the moolah and are looking for a rich high end experience, then you probably need to go elsewhere. But this doesn't detract from the experience at the Rio! I had a blast and will remember that one visit to Sin City.

The room is really nice. I actually had a room with one of those shower windows. I thought it was cool because you could watch TV and shower at the same time. Or in my case peep at my husband trying to buy porn. HAHAHA. He didn't like the window. It had a nice couch. The room though, was hot. There like the air conditioner had one vent by the window and it doesn't do a good job at making the room cold. Kinda important in Vegas ya know what I mean. The buffet delicious, casino okay, overall nice for the young hip crowd. Yes the sink and plumping makes a weird noise and that's because the pipes are old. I am used to it because I lived in old ghetto apartments all my life.

Delicious assortments of food. Usually buffets don't have great food on a Wednesday, but Rio did! On top of that our waiter Robert P. was very friendly and always knew when we needed refills or have plates taken away. Five stars for sure!!!!!

BAD!!!!!!!!!! I can't tell you enough on how BAD this place is...from elevators that wobble back and forth to the water that trickles out of the faucet to brush your teeth. There is NO room service between 11am thru 5pm so you can just forget about relaxing in you antiquated room with a good lunch. We ordered breakfast and got it in container like they have at McDonalds in bags and it was cold  This place has gone to the dogs!!! The only redeeming qualities to this place is the beds are comfy and the Vietnamese restaurant downstairs!!! Stay at your own risk!!

I used to love the Rio. I especially loved the "show in the sky". I recently visited the Rio and they had discontinued the show!! So bummed. Plus I didn't remember the casino being so dirty. I guess the years just haven't been good to the Rio.

First off you pull into the parking garage and there are only reserved spots on the first floor. The handicapped spots aren't even on the first floor, you have to drive up to the second!! We have been waiting in line for 10 minutes to check in and have barely moved. Only 6 of the dozen or so computer stations are open and the line is snaking out past the marked line and almost to the front door. At least they sent a lady along handing out water, but she would have probably been more helpful behind the counter checking people in. After about a half hour waiting in line we finally got checked in and got to the room to find a trail of sunflower seeds and cup stains on the sink. We pulled out the couch bed and it was a flimsy little thing and there were no sheets to be found.

Older casino, away from the heart of the strip. Smell of cigarette smoke infused into the main casino floor. Shopping area is very small compared to what you find at Caesar's or Mandalay Bay. Only thing I liked about this casino is KJ Kitchen (dim sum restaurant). With so many other casinos to choose from I would never stay at the Rio.

Just stayed at Rio again on the 4th of July (great rate) and wanted to update my review.

Check in: Check in was ok, but can be a tad slow. The Front desk clerk offered a bottle of water when i approached the check in desk which I thought was a nice touch.

Room: The first thing i noticed about my room was that it smelled nice. The room appeared to be clean, but alot of things in the room clearly showed its age and that takes away from it a bit. Nonetheless the room was ok in my book

Pool: The pool area is large, and has multiple pools, Compared to alot of hotels they close early-6pm even in July. There was a DJ at one of the pools spinning beats while you swam.

Bars: It appears the bartenders were all very friendly, some even shaking your hand.

Buffet: The buffet is above average and has a plentiful selection of....well....everything.

There werent any mishaps i can think of while staying here.

Upon arrival the woman at the desk somehow couldn't charge my card, so I was disappointed because the trip did not count to my rewards card. She didn't even want to try it a second time. I was a bit annoyed. Then we asked for an upgrade and she said no without looking. She stated everything was taken, not we arrived on a Wed. Really??? The woman ends up assigning us a room all the way to the end of the hall, next to the stairway emergency exit. It would have been okay but my bf has difficult walking due to an accident where he almost lost his leg.
Anyhow the rest of the stay was pleasent.  Everything worked appropriately, shower, toilet, sinks, drains, tv, lights, dryer, coffee maker, fridge, safe, sliding doors, lamps, alarm clock, curtains, ect..We ordered breakfast in the room and it was very good. Everything cooked to order and at the appropriate temperature. We also ate at the Voodoo Steak Lounge and everything was delicious. Plus the staff was professional. 
The room was clean and cleaned by housekeeping every day. They did a great job each time. And I was happy to know they are honest too. I forgot my pillow which I took there and it was returned to lost and found. They contacted me and shipped it out to me in a day. Would have been nice if they picked up the tab for the shipping but I was the one to have forgot it. So oh well, one less star for the chic with a dry personality checking us in, for not comping the shipping for my forgotten item, and not giving me credit for out trip on my rewards card! Otherwise it's all good at the Rio. 
Definitely will stay there again. For those complaining, you get what you pay for! Rio is known for its affordable prices too. And hello, they do have non-smoking rooms. Oh and Valet was on point, quick and professional too.

Um, so much for having another stellar experience this time around...

I really didn't appreciate the interrogation by the front desk girl and felt as if she thought I was going to harbor a rowdy group of my pinoy kin in our room when it was just my hubby and I. I also didn't find the fact that she demanded she see my wedding ring to see if we were really married amusing. I especially disliked the fact that they charge you an additional $200 fee onto your card as a deposit on top of your room charge without notice or clear explanation.They said it was only when you used a debit card but the last time we were here and used the same card, we experienced no such charge. What gives? 

We got the standard room which was cool as it was very large and clean albeit a little unpleasant. Why? Perhaps because of the fact that there was this echoing of a thundering drip every time we used the sink. BOM BOM BOM...BOM BOM BOM. The loud noise would go on and on even after an hour of using the sink. Chinese water torture anybody? We tried to swap rooms but they wanted to downgrade us to an even smaller room. No bueno. We said never mind and decided to man it up in the dungeon with the drippy pipes.

This time around, the casino was dull, dismal, dark and everything seemed closed. What a disappointment from my last grand experience here. Don't think I'll return anytime soon...sorry Rio.

Garbage hotel. I stayed here and found that the shower tub was clogged and the sink was clogged. I called the front desk and they told me to wait for a plumber 1 a.m. in the morning. when requesting for another room instead, they told me they didn't have the power to do that over the phone so I had to go to the reception desk. At the reception desk I found a one hour line, with only three receptionists to help. it was such a waste of time and complete lack of customer service. I really feel like the Rio, while it looks great on the outside, is nothing more then a bad motel experience.

I booked this hotel based off the reviews and I ended up being very disappointed! I specifically booked a non-smoking room\/floor but apparently they still allow people to smoke in their rooms. When I called to let them know the front desk clerk told me to tell them to stop if I see them. Wtf? That's not my damn job. Anyway, the second problem is there was no hot water to shower. It took them forever to come and fix it. This was the first and last time that I will ever stay at Rio.

The plaster is cracked and chipping in the corners of rooms: don't know if the building has gone through one too many earthquakes and is getting ready to collapse Mexico City style, or is showing its age.  Was this built before the end of atomic testing?  Who knows... minus 2 points.

It's very expensive here: two 1\/2 liter bottles of water cost $4.00 each.  Ouch!  What, the casino isn't making enough money? Minus 2 points.

The really good thing about the hotel\/casino is that it's a paradise for those of us who like to get in our aerobics without sweating in the 100° F blazing-sun outdoors.  Getting anywhere usually involves 15-20 minutes of walking, sort of like the Atlanta airport but without passenger flight boarding announcements.  Bring your walking shoes and get a couple of miles of walking in every day -- more if you're attending a conference.  Who ever needed walkways when you can thread your way in between miles of slot machines and gaming tables?

The drinks they pour are generous.  Plus 1 point.

The lights in our bath and closet area weren't working this morning, so we had to gather our stuff in the darkness to leave the hotel.  No big deal this morning, but last night, it would have been a real inconvenience.

Over the years I have spent some time in the Rio. I had always been curious what it was like to stay at this Brazilian themed hotel. In late March when my dad flew into Vegas to spend a week, we decided on the Rio. In similar style to my reviews reporting on staying at a Las Vegas hotel, this is broken down to categories. Before I go on, since my dad paid for the hotel, pricing is omitted.

The Room: 

  The Rio's strongest point are their hotel rooms that are suites. We stayed in a room up in the Ipanema Tower. This is the largest Las Vegas hotel room that I have stayed in. It provided a northwest view where I enjoyed seeing the sun rise.
