The two flaws of this grand size room were that there was only a two drawer bureau for clothes and that the TV was to the side of the bed giving The Rio the honor of the first hotel room where the beds did not face the TV. In all honesty we were too busy hanging out at the Strip instead of in the room. The last thing I will write about the room is that the Maid did a great job keeping it clean.

The Casino & Public areas:

   Whereas the room was grand, the casino and public areas were ordinary bordering on dull. Unfortunately Rio Management dethemed  a large area of the Masquerade Village replacing Brazil meets Vegas with dullness. Gone are the parade,floats in the sky, and carnival vibe. In its place are banks of slot machines bordered by a sundry of vacant stores. In an attempt to bring some excitement to the Masquarade Village, the Rio opened a Kiss Miniature Golf in the former Seafood Buffet. 

   When in fact excitement is missing from the air, on the positive side so is smoke. The casino and public areas have strong ventilation that eliminates second hand smoke.

   When it comes to gaming, the Rio is competitive. The large casino offers acres of games of chance from live Black Jack to video Keno. Being that my game of choice is Keno, the casino satisfies my gaming needs by providing a spacious Keno lounge with a plenitude of Keno machines. 


Restaurants & Coffee: 

    The Rio is the home to Carnival World Buffet which happens to be one of my top Las Vegas buffets. I appreciate the 25% off for locals. On the other hand, I do not appreciate that the Rio replaced their cafe with a Hash House Go Go. In my opinion the casino cafe adds to the Las Vegas resort experience. Now instead of a cafe offering a variety of food 24 hours a day there is a void in dining during the late hours of the night. Hash House Go Go closed around 3 pm. Isn't Vegas 24\/7? Obviously not because the main Starbuck's in the Penn & Teller Theater Wing closed at 1 pm. Worse than closing early in the afternoon is closing for good. Recently the Rio replaced the Burger King Whopper Bar with a Smashburger.

Location:

    The best thing about the Rio's location is that the guest can spend most of the time on the Las Vegas Strip. The Rio runs a shuttle til 1 am between Bally's & Harrah's. Believe me we were on that shuttle twice a day. 

    The Rio is one of the three casino resorts making up a miniature Flamingo Road Strip. On my last day of the stay-cation, I walked this mini Strip. There is signalized crosswalk providing a safe crossing to the Gold Coast. Now in the Gold Coast, I walked through the casino to the southwest exit. Soon, in a signalized crosswalk, I crossed Flamingo Road to spend time in the Palms.

   If you are a local like me, the parking garage is advantageous. Parking is still free at the Rio. On the contrary to parking at a Strip resort, parking is as easy as 1-2-3. This makes it convenient to combine the Las Vegas Strip with the local spots.

Amenities:

   In my opinion, the greatest amenity at the Rio is the resort pool complex. If the weather had been a bit warmer, I would of spent hours splashing around in the vast swimming pools. However, I did spend a few hours relaxing on the chaise in the shadow of the Rio's towers. The Rio resort pool complex is more than a place to splash around and relax. It is a tranquil spot to enjoy an adult beverage in the sunshine.

   When it comes to the amenity of adult beverages, there are a couple of neat bars and lounges. The Voodoo Lounge up in the sky is one of the spots that I would like to try and add to my "Rise Above It All" list. If I was in the mood for Kiss music, the Kiss Miniature Golf bar would make for a spot to spend time with an adult beverage or few. In reality, the best spots to have adult beverages are on the Las Vegas Strip.

   One of the best amenities of staying at the Rio is that shuttle traveling across Interstate 15 to the nearby Las Vegas Strip. However, there are non guests using this shuttle to avoid the paid parking on the Strip. The consequence is that the shuttle is constantly filled to capacity.

My verdict: 

3 Stars "Okay

An absolutely disgusting example of a allegedly nice vegas hotel. Why?

1) Security is horrible - two straight days we walked into our room while the maid was cleaning and she didn't ask us to verify our key
2) The rooms are dirty - mold growing near the showers...spotted carpets..,you name it. 
3) The pool area is awful - stuff floating in the pool, filthy deck chairs, garbage laying in the common areas. 
4) Rude staff - when you mention 1,2 or 3 they act like you are the problem
5) The buffet is terrible - cold and over priced food
6) The little things - like how about having elevators that all work...or buttons that exist...and\/or don't get stuck

The place needs so much work. 

Edit\/addition: I've been staying at the Rio for 10 plus years...2-3 times per year. It will be my last time. 
Good luck!

Being in Los Angeles, I'm a frequent Las Vegas weekender. We have gone there 9 times this year and have stayed in many great hotels, like Manaday Bay, Arias, Westin Lake Las Vegas, or ok hotels like Stratosphere (which is a better hotel than I had expected). It all depends on which hotel had a good deal for the weekend. 

I did a blind express deal and got Rio as a 4-star hotel. The price was great but I was concerned about the hotel, what with people saying it was dated, the rooms and linen were dirty, service was poor, etc. But my actual experience told a very different story.

First of all, I like the location. It is right off Flamingo Blvd, which is the very near the heart of Las Vegas at the junction of Flamingo Blvd and Las Vegas Blvd. No you can't just walk to the main strip from the hotel because I-15 separates you from the main strip. But we drove in, and it was not a problem. (Tip: if you want a room right on the strip for low dollars, go for Hurrah's. It's right in midst of the hustle and bustle but it is an older hotel.) Second, you should know that as the hotel's name implies, all the rooms are suites. That should be worth extra dollars but you don't end up paying extra.

I liked the check in experience. We dropped off the car with the valet and walked right in to the very large and colorful lobby. Check in was a breeze, and one big reason was because the check in counter was actually in the lobby. That's not like with many other expensive hotels where they make you walk through the entire casino to get to the counter (the Aria and the MGM Grand come to mind). Since it was already 9pm I asked if all the good rooms were gone. The clerk just smiled and said yeah most of the rooms are gone but no worries we are upgrading you to the Samba King suite. Sweet.

The elevator was clean, bright and polished. The hallways on my floor was coloful, festive, clean and bright. The room? Very big, clean and tastefully decorated. Even though it's a suite, there was no separate bedroom with a door. I don't want that anyway, but I suppose parents with kids might enjoy that privacy. The living room has modern and comfortable furniture. The king bed was firm and, most importantly, very clean. The bathroom was huge! Double vanity, separate shower room, and easily the size of a small motel room by itself. Young folks and budget-concious folks take note: you could sneak in 6 other people with sleeping bags and they can all sleep in the vanity room comfortably. Not that I would advise it cause you would have to step over them to go wash your hands or brush your teeth, but hey it can be done.

Anything negative? 1) Ok I did find one noticable stain on the bed-end sofa bench. Left by a romantic couple during their intimate fun, perhaps? I don't want to know but I don't sit there anyway. 2) They do charge you for coffee in the room and there is a resort fee, but that's par for hotels 4 stars and above, so I don't count it against them. You want coffe in the room and free breakfast in the lobby? Book a two-star motel and you'll be perfectly happy. 3) The Voodoo Lounge on the rooftop was pumping out massive amount of bass that resonated through the room. I talked to the front desk about it. They could move me back to an ordinary suite on a lower floor, but I really liked our room. So we stayed up until the music stopped around 1:30am. They did give me coupons for free entry to the Voodoo Lounge (if you can't fight'em, join them), but we were too full of food and alcohol to go anywhere lol! It was a Saturday night, so you should decide if the noise was unreasonable or not. We were not exactly happy about it, but we dealt with it. Rio has a young crowd and they party down, so be prepare to join them or stay away.

Overall, I like the hotel. You get a huge room for a cheap price (if you know how to hunt for the bargain), and it's centrally located. Tip: upgrade to a strip-view room for very little money. Ditto with the Samba King suites.

This place is ok. It has passed it's prime. The decor is dated and the signature pink and blue exterior window film has seen better days. If you not fussy about everything being current with the times, this place will do nicely. I remember there was a time where the seafood buffet at Rio was the hottest ticket in town. How times have changed. No hotel has been able keep up with the newest competition. Looks like the life span of a hotel in Vegas is roughly 15 years if not less.

3.5 first night, honestly not impressed. First of all, there is no coffee maker in suites, what the hell? Even Motel 6 have coffee makers! Employees have been rude. My whole floor smells like pot. Just wished I did better research before picking a hotel

For $60 a night on Groupon, this was quite a steal! My friend and I enjoyed the spacious room, scenic view of the Strip, complementary shuttle, and the nice comfy beds in our hotel room. My favorite perk was that our Groupon Deal came with free buffet passes! It was the perfect price and location for a getaway. The only critique is the smokiness of the first floor casino (which is the case for most hotels in Vegas) and the fact that many amenities (such as the pool) were closed during our visit. Overall, it was a nice (and yummy) place to stay on the cheap.

Have had success a two-deck blackjack. The servers are active so a cocktail is not out of the question. (ALWAYS tip when you get a free drink or win a couple hands or have some fun.) They have lots of locals perks, The Carnival World buffet is a great go and a deal for locals as are some of the shows. They created a bunch of pink parking for locals....oh you have to be a diamond player...okay they took away a bunch of the parking but still worth a go. easy to score a 2 fer so you can ride on a float in the masquerade show and throw beads at unsuspecting slot players. have gotten rooms on a local rate for as little as $19 and no resort fee (that was directed at mgm and station.) they have a good comedy venue and penn & teller. they have a good conference facility and shuttles that will drop you off at i think harrahs or ballys. (tip the driver...it is good blackjack karma)

The one thing I have to say about this hotel is that they are very accommodating.  We had a problem with our room being a pet friendly room and my g\/f is allergic to pet dander, they were able to upgrade our room and comp us for buffet.  They made the problem right, I would have preferred they get it right the first time, but making it right works too.  The world buffet use to be one of the best buffets in Vegas, but that's not the case anymore.  The food has become bland, boring and predictable.  I get that they have to cater to a variety of different people, but the food should be at least good.  At least they have Champagne!

Check in: We arrived at the hotel around 2 o'clock end it was very long check-in line, it took us about 20 or so minutes to get to the front.
I slipped the front desk person $20 in between my ID and credit card and told him we were there for our anniversary (we were) and asked for any free upgrades.
He said he could not except gratuities for non-service related things then offered us water which we took.  He gave us a coupon book, he upgraded our floor to the 18th, and he gave us to admission passes to the voodoo lounge on the roof.
 The room was cool and the view was all right.
In general the room is nice, staff was friendly and helpful.  I grew very annoyed at the timeshare people who kept trying to hit us up whenever we would cross the casino.

I would stay here again.

So sad how this place has become a has been.  Rooms are old.  I checked in to my room with a strip view only to have a window film for Penn and Teller obstructing my view and the A\/C didn't work.  Beds were mushy.  

They moved me finally but that was a huge ordeal.  If you stay check out your room before committing.  My room now is ok.  The shower water is not hot and no separate shampoo and conditioner.  Only a Pert substitute.   Also.    Real bummer. No half and half for coffee.  Only non dairy creamer.  

I would not recommend this place even for free.  Pillows suck!

Went here for a hot weekend with my former girlfriend to see what I should do.  The rooms are very nice, and the tower has great views.  The shower has little windows to see in and out, which I thought was odd, but she wanted to get married all weekend and wouldn't shut up, so I dumped her and married the other chick instead.

You really have so many other good options in Las Vegas that are as\/more affordable, so I can't justify any reason to stay here. The Rio is one of the more depressing, smokier casinos I've been in; nobody in the place knows how to mix a decent drink; and the rooms are horribly dated. A two-star rating is generous.

As far as "entertainment" goes, it seems like no decent restaurant can remain open, leaving you with few dining options, and there really isn't a good bar. Yes, there are bars; I said "good" bar. What they do offer is as tired as the rest of the "casino resort." That said, the one thing I felt when I stayed there was tired. Vegas is supposed to energize you and make you excited to be in Vegas, not drain the life out of you. 

Even if you're there for a convention, I'd recommend getting a room somewhere else. Most of the better places to stay are a very short cab ride away. And if you want to actually enjoy your time in Vegas, you're going to need to take a cab somewhere else anyway. My advice would be to stay away from the Rio unless you absolutely have to go here, and then rest assured that you can cab it back to your better hotel when your Rio commitment is over.

Having been to vegas numerous times and stayed at numerous hotels, this by far has been the worst experience of them all!! our stuff was stolen. someone actually broke into our room and stole our wallets, clothes, shoes, perfumes, tequila, jewelry....and even our underwear!! to my surprise their are NO cameras in the hallways or by the elevator. none. nice security. to top it off they placed in a suite with non functioning keys, a phone that didn't work, AND the room had this door (which couldn't be locked) that lead into this dark ass hallway where their were other doors. management could give a rats ass. I used to love the rio but security is atrocious. I came to have fun. not to worry about people lurking the halls waiting to violate anyone and everyone they can. security needs to be improved big time. NEVER AGAIN!!

-Make sure you Read this Review before staying here.
11\/2017 Updates; other travelers have noted elevator backups, but Not stating which Tower. In the past, I've noticed backups in the Impanema Tower. People have also noted Legionnaires Disease during recent stays. One traveler posted a Letter from the Rio claiming detection of the bacteria in the water system.

I've read many other reviews and have faced many of the Same Problems noted. Let's be fair and first state some Positives; large rooms, fast elevators, fairly convenient parking, and friendly front desk workers. Some Negatives; Resort fee, Long checkin line, 4P checkin, 11A checkout, Don't have room booked, and Outdated or lack of chairs in some rooms. I've always had friendly workers at the front desk. I think some travelers are taking out frustrations on the workers. But, it's not the workers fault for corporate decisions. You should be mad at Caesar's who owns it.

BEWARE OF RESORT FEES. Not anything great here, the rooms are large. But, is the resort fee of $30\/night justified, NO. It's also taxable. One reason for the long Checkin line, is a lack of staffing and the checkin time is 4P. Any Earlier has a Fee, unless you have a higher player card level. The line moves slowly per many times they don't have the room you booked. Plus, there's a lot of customers. Also a long walk to the Masquerade tower.

BEWARE OF THE 72HR CANCELLATION POLICY. Here's the issue. They state 72hrs (3 days), but it's actually 96hrs (4 days prior). Example; Arrival is Sept 10. You need to cancel on Sept 6, to get a deposit refund. Sept 7, is too late and you will lose your deposit. Rio, you are more than welcome to dispute this, and remember, you can't checkin until 4P. That's 2\/3 of a day lost. When you factor that in, it's really a 4 2\/3 days cancellation policy.

CAESARS or HARRAHS?. Unfortunately, many of the hotels\/casinos have merged. They were Harrahs, but decided to change their name to Caesars. Short history, Harrahs in Vegas was Holiday many yrs ago. then it became Harrahs. They were known for good values and customer service. Harrahs bought a bankrupt Caesars, and thought the whole chain was now Caesars. When corporations begin merging, that's when profits and margins rule the day. Sad.

Our hotel room (masquerade tower, classic room) is HORRIBLE and a poor excuse for a "suite". It looks like the room was placed on the renovation schedule and they started taking items out one at a time- the shower head feels like an oversized spray bottle with lukewarm temperature water, the sink in the bathroom is leaking, no microwave, coffee maker missing (looks like it was supposed to be there and got unscrewed), one of the lamps is falling off the base and flickering, there was an exposed socket with no cover, and to top all that off, they took nearly AN HOUR TO BRING OUR BAGS TO THE ROOM!

Online booking made this hotel seem great.  However, things went downhill starting at checking.  They could not provide the room I had requested.  The room provided was an old shabby room with ripped carpet , old ugly wall paper, tiny desk.  I thought I was in a run down holiday inn.  I asked to be moved to the room I requested, front desk said a manager would call back in 10 mins.  Did not  happen.  I will see if I can change hotels tomorrow!

Update:  I am bumping up to 3 stars.  While a manager never called me back, I went to the front desk and a nice gentlemen moved me to a much improved room.  King size bed, higher floor, nice view.  Just what I had originally asked for.  I will also say housekeeping service was good.  Overall, I would recommend the Rio for a future stay, just be aware this is an older hotel, and some rooms have excessive wear and tear.  On the positive side, rooms are very spacious.  

It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the strip from the Rio.  Not bad.

Customer Service Review Alert:

Okay so first off I want to say, book your stay at The Rio. I say this because of he experience we had his evening at the restaurant. And I want to preface this with the fact that I am a manager at my job in the customer service industry.

We bought a 24 hour buffet pass today and at the point of sale were told that if we wanted to upgrade this evening to the seafood buffet, we could, for an additional $15. Which we were planning on doing because that's what we did this time last year during our stay.

But when we got to the register we were not only told that it was going to be an additional $25 to upgrade, but that they don't know who would have told us that it was $15 because it had been $25 for a while and that's just the way it was. 

There were three of us so that's an additional $30 more than we were expecting to pay for one meal. Now granted, $30 isn't a lot of money, especially in Vegas, but it's the principal right? You get told one price, that should be the price.

Once the manager found out what was going on he took very good care of us. Actually upgraded us to the VIP seating section and paid for the difference they were asking for at the register. All in all that's the most I can ask is if there is a mistake made, a business owns up to it and makes it right. We will be back next year.

My first time staying at the Rio and I just was amazed at how great the service was. Yes this place looks like it is still in the 80's with that ugly color on the outside but the rooms in the inside weren't bad at all. 

Got comped rooms at the Rio a queen bed that also allowed our doggy. It wasn't a bad place to stay and I was actually really surprised! Also we got two free cute doggie bowls for our new puppy. He loved them! 

Stayed for the weekend had a great time and everything was free what else can I ask for? :) 

The only thing that I would suggest is not to valet your car because the self park seems much faster to get to the hotel. Also they do have a lot of these weird shows which half naked girls are dancing in what seems like underwear. A lot of people were looking at it. The music was good though. :) So no complaints on my end.

Old, run-down, musty, just not much going on at all in the casino. They have a ghetto club called Crown Nightclub that attracts all the wrong kinds of people and if you are of a classier calliber, stay away. The rooms are decent, a little dated but clean and nicely decorated. Off the strip and it just kind of feels like you are stuck at some dated Vegas nightmare and you will probably want to cab it back to the strip after about five minutes of being in there.

Quite possibly the worst hotel in Las Vegas.

Starting with a short (for LV) checkin line that takes 45 minutes.  A clerk at the counter who clearly doesn't like her job serves me and my group.  One reservation screwed up, not billing at the same rate as the others in my group, another 20 minutes and a manager escalation to fix it.

Reach the room, it's raining outside, and the window is leaking, Drip drip.  No rooms available to move.  The carpet wet. Don't walk on the carpet with bare feat either -- their black after a walk around the room.

Two days later someone else gets keys to my room!  They reset my key, not theirs.  I cant get in my room.  Luckily I knew the people, nothing stolen\/damaged.  Getting my key to work takes another day, their equipment doesn't work late at night to issue a key when I realize the key doesn't work.  Security takes 20 minutes to let me in my room.

In gets better:  my company sponsored a deck party at the pool, goes well, decent food.  Invitations have 12:00 as the shutdown time.  Security starts moving people out at 11.  At 11:30,  a man in a suit starts making threats to the guests and me up to and including calling the police to remove us (these are geeks, it's a tech event and the people aren't roudy - remember they think the event ends at midnight).  I complain.  The person yelling, is the security manager!  He tells me there are "40 police officers outside" and how his job is difficult and he doesn't care about my guests or my business.  $50k my company will never spend again at this hotel - a big investment for a party of this size in Vegas.

Voodoo lounge party we co-sponsored went off at least went off without a hitch but the same unhappy staff served everyone.  

Overall the entire experience couldn't be worse.  Probably the worse LV hotel I've ever experienced hands down.  The staffs level of job satisfaction is visibly an indication of a serious problem.

Won't be staying there again or sponsoring events that are hosted there.

The check in lines are long. They had over 10 staff checking in but still not enough to accommodate the flow of customers. This hotel is a lot older. It smells, it's outdated furniture and still has wallpaper peeling off the walls. If you don't care and just need a place to stay, go for it! But I'd check around before settling with this hotel!

We got a free upgrade to a penthouse suite; the room was awesome, the staff were awesome, and it was overall a really relaxing weekend.  I know some people don't like this place because it isn't on the strip, but if you need that, then why are you staying here and then blasting the place for being what it is?  Anyway, I was happy :)

I come to Vegas at least once a month and have never had a issue in a hotel until last night. We asked for a non smoking room and we get a room that is "optional smoking" we didn't find that out until we go in the room and it smells of smoke so we decide to call and and complain about it and they say "come down to the front desk and we will change you rooms" we pack all of our stuff up, go downstairs, stand in line AGAIN to be told "we can't move you we can clean the room again and it will take a hour" so we did that while we were at dinner than come back to a party being thrown in the room next to us (the room is the ones connected with a door inside) from 10:00pm-2:30am we called security 3 times there was at least 10 people in the room. Worst part because theses rooms are optional smoking they were smoking we had to put a towel at the bottom of the door to keep the smell of pot and cigarettes. WORST HOTEL STAY EVER. Also to add the only thing done in the bathroom was towels were changed, the shower still had a old soap bar and it was dirty.
Update:  I received the itemized bill for my stay only to learn that Rio staff failed to accurately credit the resort fees as promised.  Unacceptable.

This young child Tyler that works the desk is rude and could not care less about any concerns and issues that myself or my friend and his family presented to him. 
In fact, Tyler looked directly at us as if to call us towards his desk, then walked away behind the wall for about a minute.   
Then he came back and called us forward.  Wish we never dealt with this incompetent employee.
Right from the start, this worthless dude..Tyler made our lives miserable.  Tyler barely communicated with us except with his sarcasm.  All three rooms were supposed to be on the same floor, but Tyler barely responded to my questions.   It appears (so Tyler says) that he was trying to get hold of someone to put our rooms on the same floor.  But his telephone conversation, seemed more like a personal conversation and I didn't hear anything mentioned about rooms. I think that he went out of his way to...........
"NOT ACCOMMODATE OUR NEEDS."  
And as for the $25.00 voucher that goes towards food and drinks. That Tyler shut me down on that.  Where did they get this guy???
Then Tyler said that the hotel is all booked out. But there wasn't that many people in the hotel. 
And also their parking lot was very empty as you can see in my photos. He also had me booked for a smoking room.  It took forever to explain to this inexperienced person that......."HELLO DUDE...... I am "NOT A SMOKER."
I kept trying to tell Tyler I'm not a smoker,  but it didn't seem to register with his tiny little brain. . This guy didn't seem experienced at all on handling people. Absolutely no people skills whatsoever. 
So once upstairs I called the desk manager and the hotel manager and got the runaround. Bottom line...the hotel blamed Expedia and Expedia blamed the hotel. 
In reality there's nothing you can do once your booking has been charged then approved and you've checked in..
Also, they couldn't care less about my fall in there buffet area. I was walking to the seafood buffet to check it out to see if it was worth the extra $20. 
As I approached the Seafood Buffet entrance to talk to the girl who was checking people to see if they had a stamp on their hand , I went flying on the floor after stepping on something very slippery. 
As I got up I hit my head on the counter.  They made me fill out a  report on some piece of paper that didn't even look official.  They probably threw it in the trash can right after I left because no one from management contacted me about the incident.

But heres where it gets weird...if not creepy.
That buffet manager (less than 6 feet away) just kept smiling  and staring intensely at me. I asked him what he was staring at and he said he was waiting for security. Weird???
Once their security arrived, this same manager contradicted everything I had said in front of him to security and the EMT. 
 Even their own security told me not to pay attention to him.   Thank goodness that the people from my group were there to witness his irresponsible  non-professional statements. 
I told him that to go check out the cameras. They don't lie.

It just seems like the managers weren't concerned about any of the issues that I had spoken to them about. There's much better places to go to then this place.

Wow. I have never had a worse experience at a hotel. I have been a loyal Total Rewards member for many years and have had good experiences with all the Harrah's hotels I've stayed at up until Rio. 

I made reservations at Rio for Fri-Sun and arrived late Friday night\/early Saturday morning at 3:30am. Upon arrival, I was told that our room had been given away because the reservation only held until 3am. This made absolutely no sense to me since I had already been charged $80 something to hold my spot for the room. There were about 2-3 other parties at the counter that this also happened to. The manager (Gia) claimed that all their rooms were booked for the night and that if she had a suite or a penthouse she would give it to me but she didn't, which I think was complete BS because the place was totally dead (which is unusual for Vegas hotels even at 3 in the morning).

So my friends and I left Rio and drove to the strip desperately looking for a place to stay. We went to Harrah's and explained our situation and what happened over at Rio and I am SO HAPPY we did. The lady at the counter was very apologetic (Rio and Harrah's are under the same umbrella) and accommodating. She even told us that, "they're not supposed to give your room away if you reserved it." Her and the manager ended up upgrading us to a top floor suite and lowered the price for us several times.

Overall, chances are this won't happen to you as long as you don't arrive super late like we did. But if you want a guaranteed good stay with quality customer service, don't stay at Rio.
The place little outdated. The hotel is not on the strip but has some good views of the rest of the strip. They have Penn & Teller as a permanent show.

I got the deal through Hotwire.  I have been to this hotel a number of times but find that over the past few years it has not been maintained well. The free show they had is no longer running.  They also started charging me extra $35 per day of resort fees which is now standard for hotels in Vegas.  The deal offered on Hotwire is bogus and additional resort fees and taxes will add at least $100 to the bill.  I am rather pissed off that they quote one price and they charge you something different when you are there.  If a deal is offered it should be transparent without hidden fees that will cost an additional 30%.

I've been coming here for the last seven years, for the WSOP every July. And it's not the worst place in the world, but it's sad to see this place get cheesier and more rundown every year. There are more shop vacancies every time, restaurants come in and disappear with alarming frequency, the live show previews are scaled back, room maintenance is pretty bad, and they are taking nickel-and-dimey steps to make up for lost revenue. 

This year? Downgraded toilet paper that decomposes when hit with any moisture, a new mandatory $20 "resort fee" for local phone calls, gym access, and WiFi for ONE device per room, additional devices are $14 per day, even though they cost the hotel nothing. I'm not sure what any of these things have to do with a resort. But the most insulting cheapening was the outfitting the rooms with a K-cup coffee brewer, but no complimentary coffee- if you want any, you are supposed to buy a pack of 3 pods for $8 from the convenience bar. This is the first hotel I've ever stayed at that doesn't give you a couple servings of coffee to go with the room coffee maker. Is this a deal breaker? No, it's a petty complaint. But the petty complaints I have been accumulating for this place keep on accruing. It used to be a nice enough place when we started coming here, but it has become shabby and threadbare. 

And I'm not even going into how, for the last three years, they screwed up our reservations by bad communication between desk staff. I'm stuck coming here because of the WSOP, but will be staying elsewhere for any other trips.

We stayed at the Ipanema tower, which seemed liked the older tower, and omg! I had Bed bug bites all over me!!! I have about 50 or more bites that are soo red and better not leave a scars!!! Be careful when you go here, Bring a green light or something! I should've.

Some family came to town to celebrate a birthday so we decided to stay here since we hadn't before and could get such a great deal on hotels.com. I have mixed emotions with this place so here it is -

Pros:  Got a pretty nice room for only $30. Room was clean and spacious. There's a Starbucks right outside the elevators. Staff is friendly.

Cons:  Bed and pillows are so uncomfortable I had trouble sleeping and woke up sore. The air conditioner doesn't work very well because we turned the thermostat down to 66 and it still was warm in the room. We have to pay a resort fee and yet we don't get wifi. The give us a keurig coffee maker but no coffee. Called the front desk and was told we have to buy coffee from the mini bar. 

Would we stay here again? I think if we were on a tight budget and couldn't afford something else then we would. At least it's clean. 

Note to self for future visits...... bring my own pillow!

Horrible customer service bad experience over all..never again will I stay at Rio
Didn't feel welcomed the bell man brought our luggage at 3am! We were told there was 30 min wait. Turned into an all night wait
 we had plans on going out but were cancelled due to such delay.

CARNIVAL BUFFET-- came and stood in line for 45 min. There was no organization among the staff what so ever and after becoming annoyed from the long wait, someone had the nerve to cut in front of me three ppl ahead. Once the ppl in front of me told the staff that some lady had cut in front of us all she(the employee) just looked at all of us like,"what do u want me to do about it?" and STILL continued to help the rude customer. I finally jumped in and said something to the employee and asked for a manager. It wasn't until then that she told the customer she could not cut. The customer service was horrible and they were definitely under staffed with only one cashier working. I would NOT recommend for anyone to attend this buffet! McDonalds would provide faster service and better service with a smile.

Definitely the best value for your money in Vegas.  Newer than most hotels on the Strip and boasts the buffet in town.  Also has a convenient shuttle that takes you to and from the Strip (Harrah's).  Everything here is perfect except for shower water pressure.

We were in Vegas for Kingston's Bachelor Party.  We checked in at 4:00 am and were in and on the floor within minutes.  The room eas much larger than the one we stayed in at Bally's and the foldout couch was great for the extra homies who came along on the trip.

For $50.00 what can I really complain about.  Its not Bellagio or the Luxor but when we are running around gambling, eating and hitting the gentleman clubs, who really care about the thread count and filler of the pillows!!!

The only negative thing I can say was the quality of the toilet paper... Its Vegas, please!!!

Me and my fiancee stayed here for a  Valentine's day weekend for a little stay-cation, the rooms were wonderful we stayed in one of the suites. The view was absolutely wonderful especially at night at a with the lights of the strip twinkling . All the staff were helpful and polite, the wonderful night ended with a Penn and Teller show.  Definitely will stay again!
I love going to Rio whenever I go to Vegas.. The seafood buffet is to die for and the hourly shows where you get free beads is just an added perk to going to this casino.

Rio 
oh Rio
Where do we stand. I loved you and I hated you at the same time. On the one side I stayed in the Rio and that was a different experience from visiting you. so the good and the bad.

The Bad
If you reserve a room with 2 beds. Its not guaranteed. You are only guaranteed a room and when you get there they see what they have. 
The good
Its an All Suite Hotel. 
The Bad
the Suites don't have kitchens. 
The Good
They are pretty big rooms. 
The Bad 
There is a freakin window looking into the bathrooms. What the Deuce. 

Overall I think the Rio is a very fun place to stay because of the free shows every hour. The people staying at the Rio are characters. The bartenders and staff are awesome. The bad and the good leave me leaving three stars.
Had a great time. Even upgraded my room with ease. Only issue is that parking is really far from check in, so Valet your vehicle to avoid this.

disaster!!!! This hotel has been the worse customer service I've ever experienced in Las Vegas. To begin my room was not properly stocked with soap and lotion upon arrival. My bath tub was missing a stopper (I waited a total of two hours before it was provided), the iron was broken, the restroom light was burnt out and needed to be replaced, the food ( 1\2 rack of ribs) was reheated and tough however they did replace it. Last but not least I spoke with a total of 7 people in the attempt to get these things resolved to include the hotel manager. Each employee with the exception of two displayed nasty attitudes. 

After missing the event i arrived for i was compensated a $32 resort fee and an experience that would convince anyone to check out immediately. This is definitely one of the few hotels in las Vegas I wouldn't recommend.

Clean room in newer tower but no coffee for the in-room coffee machine. I called housekeeping and they said we have to pay for it. Rio wins as the first hotel I have ever stayed at that does not offer complementary coffee. Sham on them!

My wife and I stayed here for our Honeymoon. Because we have 8 kids, we don't have "high roller" money, even though we make a very good living. First the pros:
- Room check in online was convenient. We walked right up to the keys counter and got our keys. However, it wasn't explained that we'd need another $100 to pay upfront. I figured they'd just charge my credit card. Nonetheless, it was quick and easy with online check in.
- Room was exactly what we paid for. Nothing more.

CONS:
- Room cleaning people were terrible. They didn't leave us fresh towels two days in a row, although they picked up the used ones, so we had ZERO towels.
- Pools - VERY DIRTY!!! Hot tub and pools were dirty with leaves and candy wrappers floating around. Lounge chairs hadn't been clean in a year. Nasty pool area.
- No one at the hotel even mention how to get around, a map or even that pool towels were complementary. We walked down with our room towels because there isn't even a guide for first timers in Las Vegas. This hotel was unfriendly and confusing.
- Food. VERY, VERY, VERY EXPENSIVE!! The Rio has not cheap eating except for a burger king by the parking garage. ALL the other hotels in vegas have food courts with several cheaper venues for eating. Even though we ate one nice expensive meal, we enjoyed paying regular blue collar prices the rest of our trip. We didn't eat at the Rio because everywhere else had cheaper food.
- Don't get suckered into the TIME SHARE garbage. They told us they'd give us cheap tickets to Cris Angel and the gondola ride and it would only take 2 hours of our time.  After 5 hours, I had to get a  little mad and loud and demand our tickets and a ride back to our hotel. They wasted our entire afternoon. If they'd have told us it was 5 hours up front, I would have just paid for the tickets to the show.  FYI: ALL THE HOTELS HAVE THE TIME SHARE SCAMMERS IN THEM, SO BE CAREFUL!!!!!!
- The RIO doesn't care if you're on your honeymoon.  We met severral people who were on theirs and their hotel gave them show tickets, free upgrades and other special things. The Rio doesn't care about honeymoons, so DONT STAY HERE if you're going on a honeymoon. Stay somewhere else that isn't owned by the Rio either. Remember MGM owns several hotels, Ceasars owns several hotel and others do too. Find out who owns the Rio and don't stay at their hotels for your honeymoon. They won't do anything to help make it magical. More like miserable.
TIPS:
 -We used Self-Parking, and if you do this, be prepared to walk about a miile to your room each way. It's completely on the other side of the Casino.  Since we drove everywhere, we still walked 9.2 miles in day one, 8.3 miles in day 2. Regardless if you drive or not, you'll be walking, and walking and walking and walking. 
- Don't get suckered into the TIME SHARE SCAM.  That's all it is, just a scam. They try to sell you $29,000 worth of time in a hotel, that's all. They dropped it all the way down to $5700 once we said no about 10 times. So you KNOW it's a scam if they go that far down.. No, we didn't buy it even at that price.
- GO TO BLUE  MAN GROUP!!  Greatest show we've ever been to.

I had high hopes for the Rio being that my first over 21 experience in Vegas was heightened by winning $300 at this casino. But that was then and this is now; that was their casino and this is mostly about their rooms. Here are some pros & cons:

Pros:
-Room service
-Room size
-Carnival world buffet
-Village seafood buffet

Cons:
-It was a non-holiday Sunday night and they gave me a room with a view of the trash can, 3 floors up, with no tub because it was handicap friendly. Apparently this was the only non-smoking king room they had left.
-Stains on the room furniture
- OLD tube tv (why don't you join us in the 21st century Rio, thanks)
-TV internet option SUCKED
-Location: This allows them to put a $15 table limit on games like black jack when other casinos on the strip have $5 tables just because they know a lot of their guests don't want to drive to the strip. BOO!

If I didn't LOVE LOVE LOVE their buffets so dang much and if my rooms weren't comped this review would've been more like a 2 star. I would never pay to stay here.

Spent 3 nights at the Rio this past weekend. The room was ok, although I was in the older tower that needs a remodel.

Night 1: No hot water. Called front desk, they said they hoped to have it working in the morning.
Day 1: "Hot" water was lukewarm. Maid didn't come in room 
Night 2: Hot water working properly
Day 2: Maid didn't come in room
Night 2: Nothing to report, other than dumping trash in hallway can
Day 3: Still no maid service
Night 3: Nothing to report, other than dumping trash in hallway can
This is some real BS I usually only come here for the buffet. This is my 1st time staying here. Your elevators are not working  the Spa Pools are out of order, and you got Stalker at the Pool.

First time in Vegas, but  I have traveled globally on business and personal travel. I stayed at the Rio because it is a conference location.

Working 12-14 hour days at a conference and not seeing outside, you notice everything.  Conference staff is attentive, flexible, and provides 5 star service although they do like to have their "exclusive" contractors that are a bit overpriced for the area.  The service makes up for the added cost.

Check in was a bit disappointing.  After a long flight and knowing my arrival time, they charged a premium to check in 1 hour early of $25.  Considering the amount of money being spent on the conference,  conference staff that needs to be checked in and working... should not have added fees.

Room cleanliness is a crap shoot.  I guess it depends on who is working that day.  One day, the room was spotless, the next... they didn't take out the trash, did not make the bed, and in fact never left fresh towels or replenish soap as requested.

Again considering the money the conference is spending, give me a break.  I am weighing the value of the service against the add on costs.

Main bar at the lobby  -great staff.  Relaxing to kick back and play a game with a cocktail.  Food is excellent, but on the pricey side. $5 for an 8 oz bottle of soda or water is a little over the top. 

If I came to Vegas on personal travel, it probably would not be at the Rio.

Stayed here for a quick weekend trip and it was okay. It was very affordable and the rooms are nice (all suites remember!) but it's definitely "older" Las Vegas. The casino is a little smoky and busy, but okay. They do a show on the weekends called the Show in the Sky where there's some dancing and singing followed by "parade floats" hanging from the ceiling that rotate around their track and throw out beads. They do it every hour on the hour between like 6pm and 11pm, Thurs-Sat I think. It's not a great show, but it is something to do while you're sitting at the bar or at a slot machine. 

The pool area is really nice and free. There are several pools and hot tub spas spaced around, with waterfalls and sandy beaches around the edge. There's also an adults only pool that costs to go into (we were quoted $20 for guys, free for girls), and says it's "european style". We didn't pay to go in, but my guess is that means girls can be topless because it's surrounded by pushes so that you can't see into the area. They have a DJ there that was playing some good music too. There are plenty of bars around the pool areas as well. 

The best part about the hotel is the fact that Penn & Teller are there. We got a coupon book with our stay that got us 2 for 1 tix, which is always worthwhile. Their show is awesome!

They have some good restaurants as well. I don't recommend the Dim Sum restaurant unless you're for trying something a little different, it's very traditional. The all-american grill was good, but didn't have the best service. There's a frozen yogurt place in the casino that I was quite fond of ($5 for a cup).

Loved the overall experience of the hotel price is right no charge for valet but they definitely need more people to check you in. Kiosk wouldn't scan my drivers license so couldn't self check in. Also 1 pool was closed and maybe guarantee valet for there guests ... had to park in garage my last night and have a problem walking long distance.

I stayed here because it was cheap, but was disappointed by a lot about it. There was mold around the bathtub. When I called to tell the front desk, in poor English I was told "We give you 'nother room."
I was already unpacked, and it wasn't worth the trouble. I just don't understand why you don't spray bleach around there and get rid of that.

Also, it was perhaps the only hotel I've ever stayed at where they have a coffee maker, but the coffee you have to buy. Most hotels have tea and coffee there for you.

There are other complaints, but it's after midnight right now and I just don't care enough to get into them all.

Maybe if I win more next time in Vegas, I can afford a fancy suite and a bigger casino.

Out of my 20+different hotel stays rio is my first review. Lol. Yes it's a little older.  Yes it's off the strip. Yes it doesn't have the Big Bang of strip casinos. But Im pretty sure I can speak for locals and most of us love this casino. We don't like being on the strip and all the "woo Vegas" tourists. Room is a pretty decent size. Bathroom and room are clean. They even have a fridge which is a hard find on strip casinos (it gets super cold btw). Nice tv and good views. Employees are all nice, professional, and helpful. A O K with me!

Stayed at the Rio for a conference and compared to the previous location, it was a step up in every way. Customer service, lounges, conference areas, food provided during the conference. All excellent. Two Starbucks and the Hash House A Go Go all made me happy. 

The suites were nice. Very spacious and nicely decorated. Awesome bathroom space that was huge! Housekeeping was nice and unobtrusive so I appreciated that. A minor quibble being that they provide a keurig and they can provide k-cups, but you have to ask and they won't provide more if you don't. 

My biggest issue was the shuttle. Two different shuttles can take you to either Bally's or Harrah's. It's a first come, first board service... Except if you have a players card which allows you to board first. No big deal, expect the bus fills up fast. So if that players card person walks up right as the shuttle gets there, it doesn't matter that everyone else has been standing in the 100 degree heat for 30 minutes, they board first. That means you're possibly left waiting another 20-30 if you're unlucky enough to be at the back of the line. I know it shouldn't bother me because it's an awesome incentive for their hotel, but I found it irritating. Either have a second bus running to cut on our long or drop the card for the shuttle. It rubbed me so wrong. Not to mention the round about way the shuttle takes to get to Harrah's, you'd almost do better getting a cab. 

Add being far enough from the strip that walking was a challenge and I couldn't give the Rio all the stars I wanted to. Awesome hotel, but battling the shuttle and not being on the strip bothered me a little.

DISGUSTING. this hotel is sorry excuse for a good clean time in Vegas. As a Vegas regular I try to change up staying places but my heart stays at the MGM and Mandalay bay but after receiving total rewards discounts for the rio I decided too try it out the newly "remodeled" rooms which come to find out are  cheap ran down And the decor is  untasteful. the pool was gross hair, band aids and sludge can be found in the jacuzzi and middle heated pool..

Okay, i stayed here because my girlfriend (who gambles a lot) got a comped room. 

Room:  The room was very impressive.  Although I say that with a grain of salt because we got a room on the top floor of one of their towers, we needed to put our hotel key in the elevator to get to our floor.  I was fairly pleased.   I also did check out one of their 1 bedroom suites.  It was nice.  It was set up like a one bedroom and it had a living room and a dining table (i think).  The bathroom was huge and clean.  

Casino:  Okay, I'm not a gambler but their casino seems really outdated.  it just had an outdated vibe and fee.  They really need to do something about this to be competitive with the other hotels around.  

With that said, I felt like the clientele was kinda ghetto.  I saw a lot of athletic jersey wearing guys (not hot).  They had a fair share of mature gamblers...which is fine (atleast they aren't ghetto).  But on a Thursday it felt really dead.  On Monday night, walking through the casino at about 3am, it's like you can hear a pin drop.

If you want you want to get away from the strip this is the hotel for you. 

Pros: Free parking garage and Hash house a-go-go Restaurant (better than the one on the strip and lines are way shorter). 

Cons: Deposit fee and check-in. We stayed for 3 days and 2 nights which was ~$300. But once you check-in its additional $50 per night deposit fee they charge on the card you used to booked the hotel with. So actually at the end of the stay my total card was charged $400. But after 5-7 days I was reimbursed the $50 per night, so $100. I wouldn't recommend staying here if you plan on staying for more than 3 days. I also heard from one of the hotel guest instead of charging the $50 per night deposit at check-in you can give $200 cash for whatever nights you are staying  and when you check out you get the $200 cash right away. 


There's also check-in\/out kiosk. In which people didn't use, so there was a long long line for the hotel registration.

Saw a concert at the pool and had a great time. The drinks were reasonably priced - sort of. I didn't leave with an angry feeling after drinking, so that helps.

During the day, there were a ton of girls walking around in heels. Some were very scantily clad - read: thongs, tops barely covering their nipples. I don't know if they're paid to be there or they're just there... but... they're there! Look at all of the potential grammar fuck ups in that last sentence. I nailed it!

A pool is a pool is a pool... to a point. The other hotels on the strip (MGM, Caesars, Encore, etc...) all have MUCH nicer, bigger pools, but if you're at the Rio, there's nothing wrong with this one.

I have not stayed in the rooms but, I actually like it here a lot. It has a lot of locals offers (many you need to have a players card for)
It is pretty big and has a great buffet. It also has the least flattering cocktail outfits that make that make the hottest girls look like they have 80's mom ass. 
In all honesty I should give a 3.5 star but it is just not quite a 4 star just because of its age and few improvements.

Nice from outside, but very old and behind from strip hotels., but I have to give credit to their look, still looks nice and specially at night, pool is still nice and better than most of strip hotels such as Aria.

a grand hotel in past life...once weathered by age and little renovations...but, returns fully charged and fully renovated....rooms quite large...comfortable plush beds, but finding a tv to the side annoying...sofa bed in every room....tired morning rise and headed downstairs to the conference rooms on casino level..passing the large casino floor...all the typical slots and card tables...longest of journey...conference rooms quite far...already committed and trekking on....don't give up and continue walking...it's there...

The room was "ok" for $35\/night but had no coffee maker in the room, cleaning staff ignore the privacy signs and enter your room when you're still there, shuttles are unreliable and can leave you stranded at the end of the night.

I may stay here again since it's so cheap but eh... just barely OK

The Rio nickels and dimes you for everything. Bottled water 4.00, seafood buffer 50.00, 24 hour WiFi 14.00, domestic beer 6.00, etc. I would recommend staying elsewhere. There are other nice casino hotels that do not do this to their customers. The Palms for example has 15 buffet. One last note....Caesars properties only have Pepsi products!

Can't check in or out with rooms or kiosk, slightly behind the times. Horrible, good thing it was a slow weekend so the wasted time was their idea if good service. Beds need new mattresses. Minor health warning, good grief, should be a disclaimer when booking, see photo

First night: the bed is as stiff and uncomfortable as they get. The pillows are very thick and I have now been on hold for 10 min with the front desk to ask for feather pillows. Unacceptable.
The room is nice and large and is modestly decorated.

This review is specifically for the All American Bar and Grille in the Rio Hotel.

We came on Thanksgiving night and it was our worst meal and service we had during our week long stay in Vegas.

I get that the servers probably were loathing the fact they were working on Thanksgiving night... However, you don't need to show your customers your anguish and lack of manners.

Food was mediocre at best, which was surprising considering the Rio buffet has such a good rep...

Our server though avoided us for most of the night, was non social, and could have cared less about our experience... 

Not a good way to treat your customers.

I'd give this place 2 1\/2 stars if I could. It wasn't the worst ever, but I've stayed in nicer places. We stayed here on a whim because we saw a cheap stay offered on groupon. We checked in an hour early for free. It was a quick process, but the woman that helped us (Bianca) looked like she hated her job. Smile a little! We also were charged a 32 dollar "resort fee" (which basically all hotels do now) that covered our wifi, gym use and local phone calls. Our room in the masquerade tower was spacious but pretty lack-luster. The beds were comfortable for the most part, and the AC worked great which was a bonus. We had a partial view of the strip, but mostly overlooked the residential areas to the west of the strip. 

The unfortunate thing was our bathtub did not drain quickly - I was afraid to take a decent shower for fear of the tub filling up. The sink faucets also leaked on the counters when turned on. The bathroom also had a weird window where people in the main room could look in to the shower. Not sure what the point of that is. 

 In addition to that, the walls are paper thing. We could hear our neighbors chatting and laughing for hours. Luckily we were only there for one night so we didn't have to put up with it for long. 

The groupon included a breakfast buffet for two which was a nice touch. Honestly that made the deal worth it, because buffets are so expensive in Vegas. The cooks were the some of the nicest staff I encountered in the entire hotel. The food was good too! I enjoyed the "made to order" pancakes they cooked for me. 

The Rio is located off the strip, but they offer a free shuttle to and from Harrahs and Ballys which was super convenient! Parking is also free which saves you a bit of cash. 

I'm not much of a gambler but I noticed that it was fairly quiet here compared to the casinos on the strip. That might be a bonus for some people who can't stand the big crowds. 

Overall it was good for a bargain, and a one night stay. If you're in Vegas for a longer period of time, or you have more money, other hotels would probably be a better option.

Sort of a basic hotel that is off strip - a bit older of an offering with a smaller casino layout that is pretty easy to navigate through 

Restaurants in the hotel are pretty basic, there are 2 different Starbucks to keep traffic to a minimum - I have not stayed here, but I am here once a year for the national go-kart race that is in the parking lot each year -- which will be changing to a different location in 2015...

The main attraction for the Rio is the buffet which gets very crowded when there are larger conventions or events going on at the casino - to which I have not been impressed with the food all that much. The Casino can get smokey and is probably not the best place for kids

All in all - a cheaper off strip hotel probably one of the few originals that are left from the early 90's that came at the time right before the strip expanded past the mafia ran casinos that were torn down for what is there today.
It's a great place to pop in and pop out. I'm not one for gambling but I do love the hotel room view and the pool side.

Chippendales and buffets..what else can you ask for?!?! I was sold as soon as the word chippendales was mentioned LOL.

I didn't stay at the Rio Hotel but my friends and I tried the Carnival Buffet. Holy smoking cowsaz! The line in this place was no joke! We decided to come way past lunch hour thinking we were smart.. boy! were we wrong! On the weekends they have brunch until 3:30ish for $25 (not including tax). We were waiting in line forever. We decided the fast track and add the extra $10. TRUST! it's worth it! especially when it's almost 3 pm and you partied like a rockstar the night before, like I did!

The food was great! They still had breakfast available PLUS mimosas! They had a great variety of food. From Mexican to Chinese to American to Japanese and salads. ooh and the endless crab legs and shrimp!!MmmMmm! The desserts were ahhhmazing! they had a gelato bar the served coconut, cookies n cream, mango, vanila, etc.! My friends and I came out of the Carnival Buffet with food babies!

Definitely be back to try the other buffets!

This is a pretty terrible hotel\/casino. I have a dear friend who works here, so I feel bad dissing her workplace, but every restaurant has very slow service, the food is mediocre, and very expensive. 

The hotel feels like it's falling apart. In-room appliances are noisy. The casino is one of the worst for cigarette smoke; it wafts everywhere.

If it weren't for the Star Trek convention, I'd never stay here.

I only stayed in this hotel because of a conference. We thought the group rate would be cheaper but it turns out we could've gotten the same room for $20 less per night which included WiFi when we booked 7 mos ago.  We upgraded by $20\/nite for a larger room in the Masquerade Tower and were disappointed.

1. No coffeemaker. They told us only rooms above floor 15 get coffeemakers when we checked in. They lied.  I texted a friend to get a room above floor 15, who was flying in the following day and when she arrived she got a much better room (smaller) but cleaner, remodeled, newer furniture but no coffee maker. She called to ask for one. The person on the phone told her she had to be in the room to deliver it. She went out with us and when she returned to the room, there was a roll out bed delivered to her room. She called and asked if there was a mistake and they intended to deliver the coffeemaker and they came and removed the bed.  On a 3rd call when she inquired about the coffeemaker again, the person on the phone told her they do not provide coffeemakers!  The woman on the phone even had the nerve to tell her that she could go to WalMart\/Walgreens and buy one for $10!  How rude!
Poor service.

2. Our room was large but the furniture was old and the bathroom was dated.  At least there was a safe, refrigerator. NO coffee maker.  Hubby is a addicted to coffee and they told him he could go downstairs to one of the 2 Starbucks to buy coffee!  Who wants to pay $4 for a cup of coffee everyday?  The front desk told us that "no hotels provide coffeemakers!"  Having read other Yelp reviews, we brought K cups because they said there was a coffeemaker but no coffee.  We ended up lugging the K cups home.
We brought our electronics and was told us the service fee was $28\/night if we wanted to use our phones, WiFi or gym. So, we decided to not pay for that and ended up without use of our laptops for 5 nights!

3. The first night there, they had a water shut down and Hubby could not take a shower that evening.  He called and they said there would be no water until 6AM. He got upset and they said they would compensate with 2 bottles of water.  At 2 AM, someone knocked on our door and delivered 2 bottles 10 oz water. He only had enough water to brush his teeth and we couldn't believe it that they would knock at 2 AM to give us 2 bottles of water when they could have brought the water earlier.  He asked to speak to the manager and was given $30 hotel food credit the next day. 

At least the bed was comfortable.  The conference rooms are huge and ample. The meals (chicken dishes) served during the lunch symposium lecture were very good.  There is a small gym with a couple of treadmills and eliptical machine. They have a couple of large pools outside.  We had breakfast one AM at the Hash A Go Go restaurant downstairs and I went to the spa for a massage. The spa is very nice but expensive ($195 for a medium pressure 80 min. massage) but you can use the facilities (sauna, whirlpool, shower) all day if you paid for a service.  My massage therapist was very good.

The irony of all this is that we drove to Anaheim and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn where service was impeccable and the rooms all had Keurig coffee makers with K cups even 'tho staff at the Rio try to misinform customers that hotels no longer provide coffee makers.
Very bad service and poor staff training. They are not customer oriented.

Not the worst I've experienced but leaves a lot to be desired.  Lots of hidden charges that are in the fine print on the price quote.  The worst part was not having coffee available in my room.  You have to pay premium prices to get coffee.  So you have to walk over to one of the coffee shops and buy coffee to take back to your room.  I'm sure there's a huge kickback going on there.  Lots of unhappy people working there....lots of bad attitudes and i don't give a fuck attitudes which means bad management.

Just got in. Self checkout was a disaster. The guy helping everyone did not look happy at all. Safe is locked so now we got to wait for someone to open it. Fridge doesn't work and the trays are disgusting. Looks like a soda blew up in the freezer. My daughter tripped on the rug that's peeling off the floor. This should be a fun trip :( the bathroom shower. Has the last person soap scum. Gross

Not a bad hotel for the price we paid. It was the least expensive hotel we could find. We got the room for $32, but also had to pay a resort fee of about $32 as well. 

The room is a pretty good size, and comes with a fridge. It was a non smoking room, but still smelled a little like cigarettes because the hotel in general was just very smoky. Our view was of the freeway and the zip line that goes between the two Rio towers. 

Everything was in pretty good condition, except the couch was kind of grungy. You never know what happened on that couch.. What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas lol! 

Overall, I would stay in this hotel again if I was on a budget. The beds were nice and the rooms were big and had good AC. They also have the awesome buffet in the lobby, which they give you a $10 off in the coupon book if you stay at the hotel.
Nice rooms, a little dated.  Friendly staff, but long lines for the buffet.  Pool is too small, extra charge for nice pool.

Only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because our room was infested. In total spent time hunting for 5 beetles that kept getting in our room and our stuff. It made my wife paranoid and she didn't want to use the restroom anymore, when I finally convinced her to go ahead and use it in the morning it should be clear there was another one that we covered up with towels and left. It ruins your  vacation when your hoping not to run into giant bugs at every turn in your own room or that you might wake up with one that climb in bed with you.

It feels like a motel 6..although you pay more than what you would pay to stay at Mandalay Bay or Caesars Palace.  Called for a roll away bed and the first person tells me it's $20 per night.. called back 5 mins later and they tell me it's $30 per night.. Not the best experience I've had in Vegas.

We went to see Penn & Teller and the Security Lead Johnny was extremely rude. 
He had no regard for sensibilities. Johnny rudely yelled at us that we could not bring in our drinks to the show. Then when the show was almost over we were smoking by the restroom. Johnny came over and strongly grabbed the cigarette from my girlfriends hand and put it out while rudely informing us that it was a non smoking area. Then Johnny slyly said leave now the exit is there while another security agent spoke to us about the show very courteously. He is the most rude security guard who has no clue how to handle the public. Just to be sure it was head security guard Johnny. Very rude and doesn't deserve his job.

This all hotel suite is off the strip and part of the Harrah's family. I'm a loyal total rewards member, so I was able to get our rooms comped for thu-sat nite, and $45 for sun nite. I really don't gamble that much so I suggest being loyal to some program to get these perks. While it's off the strip, it is down the street from the Palms and provides a free shuttle to Ballys\/Paris and Harrahs quite frequently.

The rooms are suites, so it's very spacious. With 2 queen beds and a pull out couch, you can easily squeeze 6 in and more on the floor if you're strapped for cash. There is a sink outside the bathroom and huge mirrors for girls to do their makeup without tying up the bathroom. there's also a fridge (big plus!) so you can stock up on your own alcohol instead of getting them at the clubs.

+the store downstairs is 24hrs so you can stock up on food, alcohol, etc, anytime. 
+there's also a free hourly show on the weekends, where they throw beads.
+we stopped by the pool on friday. it had 3 pools, 1 was for kiddies with a sand\/beach area. another was a lap pool, and the last was a pool with a waterfall. beautiful and serene. voodoo beach is towards the back, but you could hear the music in the family pools at a much tolerable noise level.
+we played at the tables on sunday. our dealer named Lucy was an older lady but very nice. she was such a sweetheart. it made our playtime fun.

Some issues we had with the rooms... on Saturday nite, for some reason none of our keys were working. I called down to front desk and they sent security up, but i was impatient so i went downstairs first. they reactivated my key. and security sent up 2 more key cards that were working. we also had housekeeping come in early mon morning and disrupted our sleep, but i forgot to put the privacy sign out, so that was my fault. Lastly, we woke up to an alarm... not a fire alarm, but one that said "we are investigating the reason for this alarm..." and later said "we have determined that it was a false alarm." annoying

we also partied at the voodoo lounge (-) and ate at the carnival world buffet (+) and martorano's (italian). search for them specifically for my reviews.

on a side note, we did the buffet of buffets. 7 buffets unlimted for 24 hr period. i totally recommend it. just be prepared to wait in lines.

Just got back from the Rio - Excellent experience.  Great room - very spacious.  Terrific bed! - very clean.  The shuttle service is sooo convenient.  Very friendly staff.  Fridge works very well.  So very comfortable - good security.  Found two places to eat that were marvelous.  Hash House  A Go Go - zagat rated - and a steak and hamburger restaurant (can't think of the name). Neither expensive.  Only complaint  way too much food.  Share the order.  Really don't like monstrous amounts of food - such a waste - for me anyway.  But it is delicious - especially the hamburgers! - Terrific breakfasts.

Awesome hotel! I knew it was all suites, but haven't stayed here in a while. Got the basic room, and it was ever so spacious with a fridge, big living room area, desk, huge bed, and enormous bathroom with separate door and sink for the toilet and shower. Best of all... a fully stocked Keurig coffee maker (rare these days in Vegas with most greedy hotels pulling coffee makers out to force you to go downstairs to their Starbucks in the lobby for coffee). Front desk service was also superb. Yeah it's not on the strip but who cares... they have a quick and easy frequent shuttle taking you to all the action for free. The "resort fee" kinda sucks... but you get FREE WI-FI, so really it's not that bad I guess. If not for that resort fee I would have given 5 stars for sure!
Worst customer service at registration.  They do not have a separate line for vip or regular lines. Did not explain themselves either

This hotel used to be really nice when it was one of the few All Suites Hotels.  Haven't stayed here in about 5 years or so until this past May but that was only because I took my parents to Vegas for the weekend and they like this hotel casino.

Rooms are ok but have become quite dingy and not as well taken care of as they were before.  I always remembered their showers having a small window into the living room area which could also be used to see in but my room during this stay didn't have that, which wasn't a big deal since I stayed in my own room.

The restaurants here are mediocre at best.  Steaks at the All American Grill are decent and reasonably priced.  The World Carnival buffet which is usually the big hype of this hotel's dining has a lot of selections, but seems to have lost some of its luster compared to how things used to be.  Maybe this is because we're getting spoiled by how much better the other buffets have become.  Always entertaining to watch the bartenders on the Masquerade side with all of their tricks and juggling.

Sports book is large and comfortable when betting on horses and watching your sports.  The rest of the gaming area is spread out across the whole property from one end to another.  The table games area is rather small with limited tables.  

Not a bad hotel, but I prefer others.

Check in was fairly quick and the gal who helped us was friendly and helpful. We had a remodeled room in the Masquerade Tower too bad they don't put new mattresses in these rooms! The bed had a huge dip in it.  Also, this hotel is off strip, if you want the hustle and bustle then stay somewhere else. And finally, what hotel doesn't let you have a late checkout if you ask for it?? Not this one:-( I won't be back!

we arrive here friday 12\/16\/16 suite 2 queen beds and good view...no water in our room, called the front desk told us under repair. what kind of customer service didn't even gave us a new room!!! not coming back here at all!!!
Update!!! 5am no water still called the front desk again...after how many times we complain finally move us to a new room but still disappointed because only 1 bed and no view at allthese place SUCKED!!! NO STAR AT ALL!!!

14.95 a day for wi-fi. Give me a break. This hotel is a dumpasaurus rex. Line for the front desk took 40 minutes. Off the strip, but the shuttle at least comes in handy. Just be prepared to wait a while for it to show up(don't forget to tip). The new hotels far exceed the grandeur of the Rio. Although the rooms are "all suite" as they claim, they are all suites that have been transported from the year 1990 to the present. Big tube TVs, ugly couches and plenty of birch and purple in the room to take you back in time. time for an update.

ROOM
The suite we had was nice enough - two queens and a large couch that serves well enough for an emergency bed.

FOOD
The restaurants lean towards standard fare - three separate bar and grill types, for instance.  Nothing wrong with any of the three, just not exciting, either.

GAMING
I only played craps when I wasn't playing poker - they had enough tables, but out of the six, there was only one team that seemed interested in entertaining.  

WORLD SERIES
They definitely keep making the setup better - more rooms with better table spacing, much better food options, more bathrooms.  There are more windows for sign-ups, but pre-registering and going through will-call is the way to go if you can manage it.

Some things can still get better:  the hallways are crazy during breaks and their over-flow tables were practically back in the casino.  That's a crappy experience for those who put up the money to play in the most popular poker events in the world.

FUN
The Voodoo lounge is fun enough on the weekends.

Rio is the worst place I won't be back. I've stayed there for the wwin show twice a year but has I said never again . Hotel manger was rude and told us well u are in Las Vegas. We got there on Sunday started out with a room looking look 1982 brown and dark . Bathroom plumbing was loud , hallway was a mess and next door room crazy first day girl banging on door and sitting out side door , next new girl comes loudest noise all night (sex) hitting walls etc etc ..... then 5 a.m they start fighting. Banging yelling . She's wrapped in towel his going crazy out side door . We go out ask them to stop . girl is scared crying his tell her get out . Big mess .I talk to her is now in corner crying telling me he won't let her go been keeping her there . Cops come and hotel security are there and guy is telling cops his been in and out of prison long stay 10 yrs and off and on for years . Great .... well in the end we did a police report and they moved r room you would think to a better one NOPE . Pitchers missing off wall no coffeemaker room dusty . And was told we give you 2 tonight's of resort fees off and You are in Las Vegas. So we had to move rooms and worst of all they don't give a sh.. about guest. All this set r day back by 31\/2 hrs . Don't stay at Rio

We came to Vegas for a bowling tournament and we stayed at the rio for the first time and it was horrible! The room that we had smelled like smoked BBQ, I called guest services and they sent someone to ionized the room so it would not smell anymore. They asked us to  leave the room and return in two to three hours. So we did and when we came back it still smelled like smoked. I called them again and informed them that the room still smelled like smoke and they said they couldn't do anything else about it and they did not have any other rooms available. Which was fine and I totally understood. The bad part about this is that since it still smelled like smoke it triggered my asthma at night making it hard for me to sleep. 

So the day of check out I talk to the manager about the situation and he was so rude and he couldn't offer us anything to make up for our stay at the rio. The best thing he was able to do was not charge us for the resort fee. I felt like the manager did not try his best to help his customers. 

Honestly I don't think I will stay here again. 

I usually do not bad reviews but I was very disappointed at my stay here.

I've always stayed at other places, but this place was recommended to me by a coworker so I figured I would give it a shot.  

Overall, the room was fine.  The check-in process seemed rushed compared to other places I've stayed on and off the Strip. I understand the resort fees are pretty much the norm, but $28 a day gets you less than most at The Rio.  The resort fee only gets you "free" local calls, slow Internet access for two devices, and fitness center access.  Apparently, the K-cups that were lying by the Keurig machine cost $8...

My biggest gripe was the phone.  Toll-free (1-800...) calls are not free!    I used the phone to try to call my bank but hung up after 10 seconds because the phone was so old and had so much static it was unusable.  Lucky I hung up when I did or I would have had an insane charge on my bill!  I could not get the fee waived. 
I will stay elsewhere next time.

The suite was large and roomy. It is not what I expected, I was pleasantly surprised. It's close to the strip, we taxi around the strip anyway, so might as well save a few $ and stay at the Rio.  Since this is our first stay here I will give this place another try. But first time is deserving of 4 stars

Rio has been our go to hotel for Vegas.  We love the location. There is a complimentary shuttle to the strip, which is convenient. The employees are generally nice. We booked the room yesterday at 6 pm and arrived from California at 9:30 pm. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite. Thank you! The room was nice and clean. As always we enjoyed our stay. Until next time Rio!

Wow what a waste of space. This place is where you go if you like meth and mites. The lobby registration is an hour wait.. Then the elevator takes another 20 minutes. The place needs to be completely gutted out. This is a not a clean place. Rooms are full of fumes and smokey. Smells like a cheap motel.

Vegas has become one of my favorite places to visit this year =)

The Goods:

1)Large spacious suites.  Each and every one of the rooms here are suites.  Marvelous!! During my first experience here, however, we had a little of an inconvenience and we were also in a much smaller room than anticipated- a king sized suite ( which was basically a large bedroom).
