WHY DIDN'T ANYONE TELL ME THAT FAMILIES LIKE TO STAY HERE?! We were placed next to a family with a baby. And I knew that they had at least two children because one was screaming and crying nonstop throughout what felt like most of the night, and the other was just screaming. The walls are not very thick. That family might as well have been in the same room as us because it clearly made no difference. 

On top of that, the beds were not very comfortable (pillows are lumpy), and the sheets  have stains. If you feel icky about that, bring your own pillowcase and maybe some sheets. 

This is overall not a bad place. It's really cheap, and the rooms are big. However, since having a good night's sleep is important to me (even in Vegas), I don't want to stay here again unless I absolutely have to. With earplugs. And my own personal pillowcase. Maybe bring my own pillow.

If you want an extra roll out bed, it will be $30.

Remember that saying you get what you pay for? This is one of those places.

This was absolutely the worst hotel experience I have ever had. They lied to me over the phone, guaranteeing a specific room type, then not providing that room type. Further, the 22-something "supervisor" essentially called me a liar because I could not provide a recording of the call and spoke to me in a very condescending manner.  They made no effort to fix their mistakes, and informed me if I wanted it switched the kind I reserved I would have to come tomorrow in a specific time frame that did not work with my meeting schedule.  I went through great lengths to be there at that time, and they took forever.  They finally put me in the correct room type--in a room with a broken toilet next to a room of Russians cursing loudly all night.  Security was called and did nothing.  Allegedly they sent someone to fix it the toilet, then "left a message" saying I would have to change rooms.  There was no message left and again they called me a liar despite that they could not pull up any message.  I had to change my room at 2am and the room they put me in smelled heavily of marijuana.  Their bell hop insisted he had to come into the room despite me being very uncomfortable granting an angry 50 year old man ranting about how he makes his money and union rules into my room.  When I brought it up with the front desk they dismissed my discomfort saying it was "industry practice" (it is NOT--in fact most hotels would prefer their employees not enter a room with a guest alone.)  Because I would not let the "gentleman" into my room after his aggressive response when I asked if I could load the cart myself and bring it out, I was refused any help with my bags.  When I checked out they refused to sign anything confirming no incidentals had been consumed, saying it was against policy.  Now I see additional and fraudulent charges on my bill.  The customer service at this hotel is the absolute worst I have ever encountered--in any country or hotel I have ever stayed at, including no stars, 1 star-5 star.  Look at other places to stay, and avoid the excruciating experience of dealing with condescending liars and fraudsters who try to cite "industry practices" and "laws" that do not exist.  This entire experience was disgusting and not only will I never stay at the Rio again, I will avoid all hotels under the same management.

Stayed here recently as a birthday gift from my husband.  My husband paid a little extra for an upgrade for a view of the Strip (which really wasn't that much), but if you consider industrial buildings as your main view, with a little bit of the strip to the side... then I guess that's fine. I was a little disappointed because my husband booked a non smoking room with a king size bed (we even brought the reservation confirmation) but the concierge told us we can only get two queen beds or a king size bed but in their smoking side. Neither myself out my husband are fond of smoke smell so we opted for the two queens. We supposed we could just push the two queen beds together, but it was not possible coz the beds were too heavy and there was a lamp stand separating the two beds... not so romantic :( Overall, the rooms were okay, we found two half finished bottle of soda in the fridge (yuck). My only question is... Why do hotels do this? What's the point of making reservations waay ahead of time if they just give you whatever the heck they want when you get there anyway?

I don't think I'd ever step foot in the Rio again or any other total rewards hotel. 

I don't mind paying a resort fee if you are getting something for your money but not when you can't use a gym because its too small for a big hotel and it's over packed with a basketball team. Add to that the pool being closed makes it that much worth. 

The fact that multiple responses from customer service were thoughtless and proved no care what so ever was the straw that broke the camels back. 

There are plenty of places to stay where you are appreciated and you get what you pay for.

We stayed here for 5 nights. The pillows are uncomfortable. We finally just stopped using them. My 3 year old tossed and turned and i asked her what was wrong. She said it was not cozy enough and for us to not come back to this hotel. Pillows were hard, trash bags were so cheap, everytime i put something in there, it flops inside the trash bag. The towels were low quality and they just gave you 3 towels, 2 hand towels, 2 wash cloth. They never replaced the tissue box which was also really rough. The air condition was loud and we set it to 55 and still it was not cool. It was also really far away from the pool. We were in the masquerade tower. Also, they only allow u to connect 2 devices onto their wifi. It doesnt matter if its active or not. We had connected a laptop one day to check on some stuff then put it away and didnt use it the whole week. In the mean time, we connected our phones and were charged 14.99 for a 3rd device even though we werent even using the laptop. In addition a 32.00 resort fee per day. I would not return.
This place is a horrible, water leaking through the roof, and black mildrew growing in the rooms, HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!

Let's see where to start.. First if you decide you want to get clean after arriving into town you might want to try a better place because their sowers are horrible. Sprinkles ate much better then this shower. Secondly i booked a room for 3 nights at a rate of 47$ a night so around 160$ total. A friend of mine booked a month and a half in advance due to attending the 5linx conference and paid 637$ for the 3 nights. Being told they were getting the best rates because the convention was extremely big and so many people from this company booked with them and it was supposedly the best rate around until she seen how much we paid. Pricing needs to be fixed because this is outrageous tripled the price. Third when calling house keeping expect to wait 30 minutes to and hour for anything, and that is even if u are able to get through to them. This was the worst place to stay even for the price. Away from the strip and being a 4 start hotel i could have stayed at a 5 star.  Don't recommend unless it's very convenient.

I would give zero stars. Room is terrible. Not what you expect at a Las Vegas strip hotel. I was in the casino and I am 39 years old. While gambling money staff asked for my ID. I left it in my room knowing I am 39 years old and do not need it to show anybody. I am at a table and just bet 100 on black. Security made me leave and go get my ID. I lost 100 dollars due to the security not clearly knowing I was 39. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! Casino is tiny and brutally terrible. BEWARE!!!!!!

Do not stay here! Elevators don't work, it takes 10 to 20 mins to get up to your room or down to the floor. They locked the stairs so you can't use them. This seems like it would be a fire hazard. No room service till 5:00 PM no water in the room, shower took 10 mins to get warm. I have no clue how this hotel stays in business or why people would stay here. Never again.

I was here July 18-20 2012 with my parents on a "wild" road trip to Las Vegas and the Grand Canyon. We stayed here two nights because I found an awesome rate on priceline.com. It was 36 dollars a night and the total came out to be roughly 81 dollars for three people and two nights. The room was on the fourth floor of the Ipanema Tower and the view was definitely a 36 dollar view. We had two queen beds, a desk, tv, beautiful bathroom, and a couch. The room was in pristine condition and the beds smelled great (in case you're a rate by smell kind of person like me). The hotel is about a mile from the strip, which is not walkable in the crippling, triple-digit Las Vegas heat. But they have a FREE shuttle that takes you to either Harrah's or Bally's at Paris resorts, which are on the strip, every  15 minutes-ish. We kind of got lost trying to get from self-parking to our room because there are different towers, but I think all hotels are humongous and you'll get lost in all of them, but I would have hoped for a little more staff to direct us in the right direction. 

One of my goals in life was to see Penn & Teller and low and behold their home is the Rio which was very convenient. The show was amazing and I really enjoyed the comedy and the tricks they performed. Just make you sure you get your tickets for any show at Tix4Tonight located along the strip because tickets are half price there for most shows. We also saw the CIrque Du Soleil Viva Elvis show, also very entertaining eye candy in that one. 

The Carnival World Buffet at the Rio=Gargantuan and scrumptious. We paid about 45 dollars for three people because we got the discount voucher at Tix4Tonight. So much food variety, I can't explain how many options there are. I loved the sushi and the pastas. I am a sucker for dessert and the gelato and cake selection were heavenly at this buffet. 

All in all for the affordability and pleasure that the Rio offers to strip-goers (not strippers) is great. If you don't mind doing the shuttle thing to save some money, then please come to the Rio. One knock is that I lost 30 bucks here at the slots, which I am dumbfounded why that is? I thought it was easy to win boatloads of money at the slots :P But my Dad did win 60ish bucks so kudos to him!

This place is horrible. Horrible customer service. They try to nickel and dime you for everything. They try to overcharge for resort fees. The food at the restaurants is advertised well but over priced and poor quality. If you're playing a hot table they close it down. Ask for a late check out, denied. Check in lines are horrible and counter is understaffed.

Sad but true story.  I went to stay at the Rio since it was close to Caesars Palace and less expensive while at a week long convention in Las Vegas.   I reserved a non-smoking room and check in.  That night, I could not sleep at all due to cigarette smoke in my room.  I called the front desk at 1 am and complained and they said they would get me a room in the non-smoking tower for the following night.  I had to pack up and move to the room the next day on my own without help as promised.  I was completed disappointed by this casino as well due to the poor ventilation in the casino and non-paying slots (based on my casual observations.

Several weeks later, I received a notice and warning that the hotel is a host for Legionella Bacteria and guest have been getting sick.  It is sad that a hotel owned by the same owners of Caesars is in such poor condition.  Based on this, ANY hotel or casino owned by the same group will be banned by me, my friends and family. I'm tossing my players club card in the trash as well.

We went to Las Vegas for our 5th wedding anniversary - the first week of September. I was a tiny bit apprehensive at first but decided to have fun. My husband and his brothers stayed here 5 years ago and they really enjoyed it. 
Our check in was relatively painless. Our room was clean, comfortable and had no odor(that is a plus for me). We were charged a resort fee which they say pays for pool use and internet. Not sure what that was all about. Especially since when we booked on Expedia it plainly stated no resort fees. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the pool but the Jacuzzi did not work and I was sad about that. We ate at the famous Carnival Buffet. It was very good and the variety was grand. The casino has ticketed as well as free entertainment. The Rio has a party scene atmosphere - it was cool. The overall look and feel of the Rio was that is was older- had character and affordable. The Casino has a shuttle that takes you to the strip daily every 30 minutes until 1am. I wanted to ride the elevator up to the 51st floor just to take in the scene but was not allowed  to because the elevator is for club Voodoo patrons only.
I would stay here again.

After nearly a decade I'm afraid I've got to give up on the Rio. Paper cups, dripping faucets, lumpy couches ... it's all too much. It's become a 50-storey Motel 6. It's too bad. Every year I make my WSOP pilgrimage and staying at the Rio is so convenient. But no more. I'm off to other, more professionally maintained establishments. I always have a car so I'll just drive to my poker tournaments in the vast caverns of their convention center which, I suspect, they use as a meat locker when the WSOP isn't on.

We stayed at the Rio from Sept. 28th- Oct. 2nd as we were there for a softball tournament. Let just say I wish there was a negative star rating to check.  Starting with check-in line was not too bad but got busy and longer behind us as we were waiting, and kiosk was really not being utilized, seems people tried and gave up and went back in line. Our friends booked the suite for us months in advance as we were thought was supposed be in upgraded rooms . As for the price we were charged per night we should of had a penthouse suite. As the clerk Was not very personalable or welcoming at all said we could be upgraded for another outrageous charge! Mind you this was booked through a third party so We tried asking to speak with a manger and was basically escorted off to the side and waited and waited, no manager, back in now a longer line. So another attempt another clerk, AGAIN basically said they could only give us "basic suites" and for upgraded room we would have to be charged for an upgraded room! Well we just gave in as we were exhausted from flying all day. Asked if we wanted room service for another 40.00 dollars a night on top of the resort fee we already were charged for!! Just ridiculous and of course I opted to pay so I can have clean towels and room cleaned while on a mini vacation! 
        The "upgraded room" we had outrageously overpaid for was a room overlooking a rooftop with the fan turbines and a parking garage! Furniture was so old ,worn out, dirty stained looking, carpet was stained ( would not walk barefoot) just a very disappointing and to go down and asked for another room was going to be more of a hassle and from reading past reviews knew we could be placed in worse rooms and was happy it was not a smoky smelling room convinced ourselves again just be sleeping there and not in room all day. 
        We had a day to go sightseeing to the Hoover Dam and came back wanted to go lounge  by the pool and have some drinks it was around 4:30 by the time we got down there and just as we starting to feel relaxed the pretty young lifeguard comes over to us and says "sorry but it's now 5:50 and the pool will be closing"! We asked why is pool closing she replies because we are understaffed and she has school tomorrow!! That She is in High School! So basically we could not sit by the pool as none of us was going in the pool as the sun was down already and we just was relaxing there. All the pool bars closed down as well! We all were in disbelief!! Another disappointment!! 
        Casino is a big disappointment, needs updating! Played a few slots, some blackjack but just not a place where I would let more of my money be sucked into it! Definitely recommend elsewhere! 
        Here is just another reason I would not recommend this place... our friend was stuck  in the elevator on The 20th floor!!! Our rooms was on the 5th floor, apparently the elevator went straight up to the 20th floor without stopping! Finally did, waited a few sec. to see if door would open, nope! Presssed the emergency button , picked up the phone someone picked up and our friend told whomever on phone that he and two others were stuck on the elevator, the person hung up on him!! Attempted few times and finally was told Security was on way!! Waiting now our friend got frustrated and finally just tried pulling doors open manually to see where they were, he got the door opened and elevator was luckily stopped on the 20th floor where all 3 jumped out! Let's just say this ...what if someone had a medical problem on that elevator?? Getting hung up on a few times when seeking emergency help!! No words just unbelievable how horrible this hotel is!! 
     The night of the horrible shooting was our last night there and we opted to stay there and just play a few slots to hurry the night up as we returned to our rooms before the shooting started as we had an early flight Monday.  I can say we were not warned of anything to stay in our rooms, or not to go outside because could Not be safe! We got Nothing! No announcements!! If it was not for the the TV being on and news interrupting and our friends calling and texting us to see if we were Ok we would perhaps not even heard till the morning! 
     I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!! The RIo is an Overpriced dump!

Never again. Waited an hour to check in. Room not ready so had to take a non-smoking 2 queen for my husband and myself that smells like Patty and Selma had the room before us.  Carnival buffet was not worth the money at all, will not be eating there again. Disapointment all around. Who ever thought Atlantis in little Reno would be better than Vegas!?!

Nice size room,, free wifi. Good food, clean casino.  fridge didn't work well and my sheets had a small stain, that is nasty. Price midweek reasonable, pool is nice. Shuttle to ballys, paris was cool.

will come to the voodoo but would not stay at this place. This is the first hotel in a very long time that for the money I find the room to have a standard big old fashion tv. Not only that but we had to hit the tv every so often to get the color back. They charge for everything and I mean everything. I was amazed that when we asked for towels and blankets they did not charged us for that. Even in a small town in northern california or a hotel in the middle of china this was the first time that a hotel charged me for coffee. The internet was crazy expensive at 13.95 per day. Again what kind of freaking place charges this to that amount. They give you two queen size beds and two towels which is ridiculous. Now for the bedroom furniture. This was very outdated like the couch. You think that if they are making money they would at least start improving the rooms. The other restaurants the food was okay to average. Old towns food to me seemed to be better for what you are getting.

While not the classiest place to stay in Vegas, compared to some of the newer, high-end hotels & resorts, I still love coming to the Rio, either to stay, or just partake of their mondo awesome seafood buffet.

I stayed last Summer for 4 days with my girlfriend and got a great deal through Vegas.com. Plus I got a coupon book upon checking in that had plenty of good deals, including free drinks, 2 for 1 specials and free admission to the Voodoo lounge club upstairs. It was nice going to the club when it wasn't so crowded. We pretty much had the place to ourselves and got our drink orders very fast.

Since we went during the week, Vegas in general was pretty quiet and uncrowded too. This was great, since everywhere we went, the places weren't packed and we could take our time enjoying ourselves.

Overall, the Rio could use some renovations as far as new carpeting, paint, etc. But as far as service and quality of the food and amenities, we had no complaints whatsoever.

I didn't stay in this hotel but I friend of mine did and I saw her bedroom. The bed was uncomfortable, the "white" sofa was dirty with some brown spots. I stayed at the Encore hotel it was great and my friend end up staying with me because her room was too nasty. The main reason I'm Writing this review is not because of the room( I guess you get what you pay for) but because in the casino they are people offering " deals" for a show. I'm disappointed and angry because Rio people did lie to us saying : "you get the deal if you go in a tour that is about las Vegas shows so you can go back to your state and tell your friend and family about it". It was a total lie they took us to " The Grandview " they gave us a tour of 4 hours( Rio people said the "vegas show" tour was going to be only 2.5 hours) . They worst part is that "The Grandview"people tried to sell us a timeshare and they were extremely pushy and rude. I said i was not interested from the beginning and they just wouldn't stop being rude. This is the most awful experience in Las Vegas i ever had. I blame Rio because they lied to us about the tour.They never said I was going to be offered a timeshare by rude and uneducated ( Nick the salesman and Tyron Kyser, who is the manager)people who disrespected me just because I didn't want sign for a rip off deal.Every single person who was part of this scam was angry.

http:\/\/www.tripadvisor.com\/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d91673-r288725637-Rio_All_Suite_Hotel_Casino-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

Rio used to be our favorite hotel to stay in. My kids love the pools and the buffet. Unfortunately our stay this week has us concerned that Rio is going down hill. First complaint was there was no coffee pot in the room. There has always been coffee in the rooms at the Rio. We called the front desk to complain and they said they changed it and only some rooms have the coffee pot now. So now they want you to spend a fortune on coffee at Starbucks downstairs. 2nd complaint was the Buffett doesn't have breakfast on the weekdays anymore so we had to take the bus to flamingo to eat the breakfast Buffett cause we got the 24 hour Buffett ticket before knowing about this. Then we came back to Rio and the pool closed down. Next complaint is there were hardly any blackjack tables open the past two nights. Yes I know these are weekdays but there were a lot of people waiting for people to get up at the $10 and $15 tables. They only had a few open. Next complaint is the elevators are all mostly broke so it takes a very long time to catch an elevator downstairs. Today we checked out at 11am. With only two elevators working it took us over 30 minutes to get downstairs and that is only because we decided to go up first instead of down. Every time a elevator opened and going down it was already full with people.  The only way to get around that was to take elevator all the way up then back down. So with all this being said I don't think we will be staying at the Rio anymore.
Very in exspensive pretty bumpy at the beginning but after checking in everything was great just lost to much money lol

I attended a great event at the Rio in one of their ballrooms last weekend. A fun time was had by all. Great music with a live band followed by a DJ. Dancing, partying staying much later than planned. Only 2 stars I did not feel the food was up to par. I have eaten at other Rio restaurants and had better. The wait staff was neutral. No complaints but definitely not memorable. I will come back for the event hopefully it would be better food experience.

This is for the Convention Center section

I came here for the Star Trek Convention this year. Hell yeah I'm a Trekkie. I've stayed here before many times as well but not this trip. 

Note: They do have a rate for convention goers - you need to call and ask and show proof of entry to the convention.

Anyways, we used the conference rooms for the Trek events and they were spacious and the rooms had their own outlets every few feet - to charge phones and cameras! YAY!

I got to charge my phone while taking photos :D

The only problem is - you can get lost in here. I couldn't find the convention area. The signs were tough to read. I know I came to the convention last year, but I don't remember where to go. :P

Rooms are nice tho! I've stayed before for bachelorettes and the conventions before.

Stayed at the rio for two nights and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. The staff is not friendly at all, I didn't have a credit card so the lady tried to charge $260.00 to my debit card with out even telling me. Then when I told her I would like to pay the deposit in cash and that I needed to go to the arm to get it out she said ok and gave me everything back and told me to get back in line when I had the money. Instead of holding it and letting me run to the atm that was 5 feet away. So when I came back the room that I was going to get was gone and was given a handicapped room because "that's all that was left in a king bed". After going through all that the room had a nasty odom to it. Needless to say I was hardly in the room to stay away from the smell. Upon check out I was told that I "took" three things out of the mini bar which is hilarious since no one ever touches the mini bar because of the outrageous prices plus I was barley in the room because of the disgusting smell. Needless to say I had to argue about not taking anything from the mini bar so she would take the charges off. After all of that I handed the last my receipt that I paid in cash for the deposit in which she proceeded to hand me $104.00 because the woman that checked me in "in error" couldn't add and put the wrong number at the bottom but it clearly stated I gave $200 for the deposit and 56.00 for the resort fee. So after going through hell and back to get my deposit I was beyond ready to leave! I will not be staying at the rio ever again and would not recommend to my worst enemy.

They have spacious rooms but I was not impressed. We stayed here because Krave was supposed to be here. When we got here we found out it was at the Hard Rock :( I  only stayed here one night so I can't really say much other than the place looks outdated. If Krave comes back I would definitely stay here as the place is not expensive.

Rio, the place I called home for 2 days\/1 night in September 2015. Right off you realize a negative- it's off the strip :( I mean, if you like being off the strip, this is the place for you, but you have to pay for almost-at-the-strip prices. It was ~ $250 a night here. 

First thing, coming from the parking garage to the hotel lobby, you discover the Burger King Whopper Bar. Bar. Yes. Seriously. Then you have to go through slots and the table games and then hit the lobby around 5-10 minutes later, depending on your walking speed. Check in line took about 10 minutes, because there were a lot of people waiting in line on a Friday at 3.30pm. 

After checking in, we went up to the rooms [got 2 adjoining + door in middle that we unlocked to open access].. and the room looked spacious. There was a cabinet with a TV, a sofa [bed], a small table, a desk, 2 beds, and then the bathroom\/sink. What I found REALLY weird was that there was a sink in the bathroom... and then after the door separating, there's another sink. Why not build 2 sinks outside? Utterly confused. Iono. The shower is a source of water too? O_o Anyways pass this...

Going with the view from the tower that begins with an I... ipanema? You could see the strip buildings, the zipline from the other tower, and a lot of colors. We could also see the pool, which looked spacious and looked really comfortable to just soak away in 100+ degree heat. Downstairs, there's the sports bar where you can make your wagers, There's a bar where you can play Keno on the table and drink. There are a lot of tables and slots and pretty music and smoking as well!

They also have 'entertainment'. You wanna know what entertainment was? Gawking at pretty women attempting to sing dressed in skimpy clothing. Cuz Vegas. I will say that their singing didn't make my ears bleed (It was not really really off key)..it was ticks below decent. Cringeworthy? Iono.

Oh yeah if you want to stare at pretty women who are strip tease dancing or whatever that's even called... ugh I need to learn these terms. Um.. skimpier women dancing, there's are tables with women dressed sexily and a woman in the middle who decides to rock the single dance floor. If you like gawking that's for you [night only]

There also are two buffets here, a seafood buffet and the World Buffet, along with a dim sum place as well. That's about all I traversed through in the Rio.

There is a rooftop lounge, but I never really saw it.


Get drunk, look at pretty women, gamble. The Vegas way! Or is that life.....

The rooms are spacious for sure but also a little rundown and old. The bathroom wasn't exactly small but I was a little panicked when the water was turned off for some time without warning. Seriously, if I needed to be somewhere and needed a shower I would've been SOL. When the water finally came back on it ran GREEN for awhile....kind of gross and definitely strange!!!! Additionally, I seemed to run out of hot water after only a few  minutes. How does that even happen in a hotel?! The water pressure was torrential though, so big points there. That said, I didn't love this place. It's a ways off the strip, and again, rundown. They charge for pretty much everything from the gym to Wi-Fi which is kind of lame considering.

This is by far the best place to stay in Vegas! You can get great deals for pretty cheap room rates if you look. The casinos rock and there are bars and entertainment everywhere!! Be sure to use Facebook or Foursquare to check in to get other deals! Plus, if you have a Total Rewards card, you can get extra points by joining Topguest on-line!!

Recently on a trip to Vegas, we decided to stop by here to check it out and ended up doing some gambling. Maybe I just had some better luck here but I managed to win a lot more at the slots here than just about anywhere else, more often too. The same goes for video poker, I won quite a bit there as well. I played probably 4 different slot machines and at least broke even on all but one. My luck with slots was way better here than just about anywhere else. 

The table staff are very friendly, and make for a fun environment. I played blackjack at three different tables, craps, and roulette, and every single dealer was exceptionally friendly and ran some fun tables where everyone felt comfortable. I noticed that many staff of other casinos are generally pretty quiet and don't exactly nurture an environment where people feel comfortable. This was definitely not the case with the Rio where I felt like I definitely am going to plan to come back to this place the next time I'm in Vegas. Despite all the other casinos on the strip we visited, this is the one I've been raving about to friends since I got back.

The people here mix some above average drinks, better than other table drinks at most places I'd say. My whiskey sours where great tasting (and had quite a kick to say the last). The waitresses are very friendly and attentive. Coolest thing ever, someone stops by with an iPad so you can see all the available options and not even 2 or 3 minutes later (without fail!) they bring you out your drink. I've found myself waiting for 10 minutes at some other casinos.

Moral of the story: If you want a great atmosphere, some great staff, and great drinks, this is the place to go. This casino was friendly and upscale, yet didn't have anything to prove like the other ones. It was comfortable and not too ostentatious. The people gambling there were also very friendly when compared to other casinos. I would highly recommend it for gambling if that's what you're here for. I can't really attest to the food as we didn't really eat anything substantial here, nor did we enjoy the nightlife or stay in the rooms. But if you want a great place to gamble, this is definitely it. I'll surely be returning next time I'm in Vegas.

SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE! room service is $40 just for one meal, the toilet paper hurts your genitals, and they don't give you conditioner unless you ask for it. when i asked for them to bring me more "shampoo, conditioner, and soap" they only brought me shampoo and soap. i had to call down again and wait another 20 min for them to bring me conditioner. While i was staying there they had a problem with Legionaries, a deadly bacterial disease that luckily i did not catch. The room was spacious but a bit run down. The hotel itself (casino, etc) isn't very attractive compared to the other hotels on the strip
Way off the strip, it's one of the sketchier casinos I walked though.  It was pretty dark and felt dingy. It's not worth it to go to their buffet either.

We didn't stay here but came here for a uh...show and we had a good time!  Rio is where the regular normal people come - no crazy outlandish outfits.  People are regular people who want to play and have fun - I can respect that!  We had a good time and caught a cab quite easily at the front.  They also have these frozen alcoholic drinks at the front of the hotel that you can get served in a cup that changes color when cold drinks are poured in them - my friends enjoyed these and took the cups home as gifts.

FIRST OF ALL!!! We booked this deal thinking we would have a great experience and let me tell you, it was the "Worse experience ever!!! I've had better service at a motel 6. The customer service crap. They are really rude and everything they offer as complimentary is either broken, filthy with a ridiculous effing price....people this is a scam! Whatever you do do not stay here. Stay at your own risk!!
Been in Vegas for 4 days! Went to just about every hotel and casino on the strip! Rio is by far the worst!!! Worst location! Worst food! Worst restaurant options! The absolute worst!!!

I ordered a drink at the Voodoo Beach Bar today. The Moscow Mule premium frozen drink listed Tito's vodka, so I chose that because I'm gluten free and Tito's is made from corn. The bartender poured WELL vodka into the drink and handed it to me, then I asked what liquor he put in there. His response was "vodka". Like I'm an idiot. I said I saw you pour well vodka and I specifically requested the Tito's drink. He said if he made it with Tito's it would be watered down. What? Then he said he could remake it with Tito's if he could find some. And then didn't bother looking. I asked why they have it on the menu if they're going to trick me into well vodka. He basically wanted me to leave and charged me for premium liquor and sent me on my way, disgusted and allergic to the drink he made me pay for.

As I walked through the casino back to my room, they were playing Sunday Bloody Sunday on the casino speakers. Not like there was just a massacre outside three days ago on Sunday or anything. This song should be removed from their playlist.

Great room!! It was awesome, the strip view, the beds were so comfortable and elegant looking. What I loved was that it had a velvet couch and chair and oval coffee table too. The view I guess was what blew me away. Get strip view, not mountain view. 

Casinos were cool too and loved the interior design of the whole hotel. Not much of any smoke smell which was at other hotels I stayed at. Definitely stay here.

I really loved staying at RIO! The rooms are extremely spacious! The staff there are very kind and polite. They even let us hold our luggage there because of a later flight after check-out time. The only thing is they are off the strip but everything is pretty close for the most part. Make sure to have uber app or lyft you will need! The voodoo zip line is not as scary as you think! Really quick not totally worth it unless you find a groupon deal for it. Overall, great stay will come again!

Terrible.. Just Terrible. 
  First off... I've visited the Rio prior to our stay and based on what the hotel looked like on the bottom I thought it would be a great alternative to the Palms Place (my favorite hotel but it was booked that weekend). WRONG! For the amount of money they charge for the "suites", resort fees and security deposit Blah blah blah, I expected much more. We stayed in the Masquerade tower finding the elevator to get to the tower was a challenge. As soon as the elevator doors opened on our floor the horrible stench of cigarettes and cigar smoke filled the air. The next thing I noticed was the filthy carpets in the hallway. The overall size of the suite was large but useless. The rooms are so outdated I didn't want to touch anything in them. The shower\/ tub combo looked like something from the 80's. 

  The only positive thing I can say is the beds were comfortable and they give you lots of pillows. I also liked the vanity area outside of the bathroom, perfect for doing makeup. I thought it was great that the hotel offered vending machines on each floor until I found out the price was $3.00\/each. Save your money and sanitary wipes, go to the Palms! 

  Also, in order to get a chair at the pool you have to pay either $25 or $45 even as a hotel guest. LOL

I first stayed at this hotel for my 22rd birthday with some friends. At the time, this was one of the top hotel\/suites to stay in along with the Palms. I loved everything about it. An awesome buffet, starbucks, gambling, clubbing ECT. 

8 years later the boyfriend and I return to stay here for a night. Welll actually we booked this for a "napping place" before heading home, but instead stayed an extra night in Vegas. The Rio does have some amazing deals on the weekday. If I can remember, it was $ 55.00 for a night. In addition, they do not charge a resort fee like the other hotels do, which makes it a hell of a deal. Make sure you have a Total Rewards card the more points on that baby that better you will be later on. However, with such a good deal comes the pit falls.......................

When we arrived, a tour bus just let off a bunch of international tourists who had just came in from the airport and were eager to start their own Vegas experience. So picture this, a full lobby swarming with adults, kids, and granny's all with their luggage waiting to check in. Since I am such an amazing girlfriend, I let Minh stand in line to check us in while I watched our stuff.

It seemed like the staff at the Rio was working double time to get everyone checked in and moving onto their rooms. It probably took Minh about 20mins or so to get everything squared away and we were off to our room.

Our suite was on the fourth room, okay not too bad. Highlights included:

-600 square feet of spaciousness

-Floor to ceiling windows. Our view was of the delivery area (awesome) at least we have curtains to cover that up!

-Lounge area (One chair and a couch that turns into a bed)

-25" Television. You have to pull it out and twist it around to watch TV in bed. Make sure you push it back into the entertainment center otherwise; you will knock yourself out walking into it in the middle of the night. 

-Normal king size bed, with a down comforter and some flat pillows

Now the not so great things:

-Super paper-thin walls. They were so thin that we could hear our neighbor to the left of us sneeze and cough.

-The guest who stayed to the right of us setting the alarm clock and it going off while they were not in the room. We were woken up to the beeping of the clock, which went on for almost 2 hours before we figured it was the room to the right. Called the front desk who apologized and sent security right away to the room. Within 15seconds, all was quite again.

-While lying in bed talking the guest staying above us must have had either a pet or a small child staying in the room. As we kept hearing marbles rolling around the floor at all hours of the night.

-After coming back from having dinner with our friends and finally falling asleep around 4:45am I was woken up to the sounds of high heels clicking up and down the outside hallway. This went off and on for about an hour.

-Around 6:00am our neighbors above us have a heavy footstep and I honestly feared my life as the ceiling above our bed creaked and made scary sounds. All I kept thinking was I was going to see feet poking out of the ceiling pretty soon.

-Water pressure in the shower was horrible along with nonexistent hot water. 

-No free WIFI. It was a pay per day deal which kind of sucked!

11:00am was our check out time. Minh and I are not early morning people but we were eager to get the heck out of this hotel fast! We were pretty much zombies driving back home!

As others have said, wish there was  no star.  I have stayed on and off over the years, at the Rio since  they first opened in 1990 it was really a fun up beat place. now its a has been washed up waiting to be sold dirty dive.  Too many nice places in the same $$ bracket to throw your money away on this has been.  First the rooms are just worn out and dirty.  From my bed I could see two french fries under the sofa.  I don't eat french fries....ooo eeeuuuu.  The ceiling the the shower is peeling .  There were many stains in the carpet i never took off my flip flops.  The buffet is $30 and it is nothing but a bunch of frozen food yuck and double yuck! 
 I sat by the pool for three days and not once was I able to get drink service at the pool The girls chatted with themselves and waited on men and  people who rented the  cabana , but not women alone.  It got so bad other single women in my area noticed it too.  The only way we could get a drink was to walk to the bar and pick it up ourselves.  I moved to different sections each day to see if it mattered it didn't.  I guess they figured if they could flirt they would be able to make  more money so they wrote me off.  Horrible or shall I say non existent service pool side. 

I arrived around 11 am and was told i  could not check in till 1 pm so ok, I returned then got  to stand in  a line that took 35 minutes for me to be able to check in and get a room.   Customer service is not important here at all.

As I said there are just too many good hotels in the same price bracket for anyone to go here.

They have monthly free poolside concerts, yay. They have no consideration for the disabled, boo. The problem with these shows is that every show has different rules and the Rio nor the radio station promoting them let anyone know the changes until you get there.  The best example is my girlfriend is disabled and cannot sit on the hard ground.  The first 2 shows we went to there was lounge chair seating, the next show we were told we couldn't sit in the loungers, the next show after that we could, then couldn't.  Last month we tried to go and was told no seating but we could bring our own chair to use.  I asked security "Any chair?" and was told "Yes" but I know for a fact if we came back with just any chair they would not allow us to bring it in so we had to leave.  The other things they change is one show you can swim, the next you can't swim but you can use the jacuzzi, the next show both are off limits, the next show the pool is open again, what the heck?  And the last reason not to go is the alcohol, they offer an "open bar" which consists of 1 free drink of whatever they decide that night whether it be flat, warm, foamy beer or watered down who knows what.  The Fosters big can is the best deal but one show it is x ounces for x dollars, the next show the same can goes up 2 dollars, the next show the price goes back down but the can is smaller, the next show the price is higher for the smaller can.  Its been 3 years that I have been trying to attend these shows and nothing has changed in that time, still inconsistent and just plain wrong.  If you want a good pool party\/free concert with open bar go to Hard Rock on Fridays in the summer, its always righteous and a good time without all the frustrations of the lame a$$ed Rio.

We got things STOLEN from our car whiled at valet. Didnt notice it until when we clean out the car half an hour later at the car rental return.  

Called to file a report with security at Rio but they took it very lightly.  Asked what measure would be taken when I called back.  The person at the security office refused to help nor give me his name because I wasnt the person who had filed the report originally.

Also worth mentioning, the valet guy hustled my bf to give him tips prior to taking our car in valet... claiming the valet section is full (on a Monday)... he asked for tipping in advance before willing to do his job... 

Never had anything stolen from hotel valets before... I suggest to stay away from Rio valet if you want to keep the thing you bring to Vegas.

The saying should be changed to:  

What you bring to Vegas,
Stay in Vegas...

Before my family and I moved to the Venetian as our standard Vegas hotel, we used to stay at the Rio because the rooms were big and cheap.  Unfortunately, one night - the night that made us change our minds about ever staying here ever again - there was some drunk guy banging at our door demanding to be let in at 4AM.  We had to call security on him because he was getting really scary.  I guess this hotel just got really ghetto over time.

Okay Rio, it is honestly time for an upgrade or you are going to end up just like the Sahara. This place is dirty and old inside. The parking structure is no where near the casino. Honestly, I think the only thing keeping this place alive is the buffet. Even that didnt look to exciting to me.

Rio, of course I wouldn't be reviewing this Hotel outta the blue. Of course this is where we stayed at during our weekend trip to vegas! I know there are a lot of people that prefer to stay on the strip and what not, but seriously staying just a little bit off the strip I have no problem with. Plus we had our room comped, so I wasn't complaining at all! Rio is a pretty big hotel, which also holds the biggest and to a lot of people the best buffet. 

I loved the Rio though, why because they seriously have like 4 tables right next to each other all three card poker! Of course vegas being vegas, during peak hours fri - sun all the tables are 10 dollars. I was itching to play three card poker the whole time, and so I tried it out on 10 dollar tables, and yeah it destroyed me! Our dealer was really funny, and very talkative, and that seriously makes table games fun! She told us to come during the morning, usually its not busy and tables are five dollars, so right away I set my alarm at 7am to make sure I am down here for those 5 dollar tables! 

The buffet here is seriously really huge, you can literally burn your first plate walking down the different options of food! You can get full, and just walk up and down looking at what to try next, and by the time you get your plate full..you will be hungry again, no joke!! Huge brownie points for having delicious crab legs!! 

I love that the Rio also has a show that is visible to the public. Usually consists of singing and dancing, and then after that these like huge boats and stuff circle around a certain part of the casino, and the louder your cheer for the dancers and what not, it rains rio necklaces! I scored me one, cause yeah I can cheer and yell pretty damn loud! 

Overall Rio is an awesome place to stay at, their rooms are pretty much suite's, they are all big and spacey. Again if you don't mind being off the strip, I think Rio is the best bet, awesome place to gamble, eat and of course drink!

Just checked into this hotel and our room is gross. There's food on the floors and hair on the pillow. The carpet has holes and it's extremely outdated. I'm very disappointed. $120 after fees and then added $20.00 early check in. Hopefully the night gets better.   
After going to the front desk to request a room change we were told our options were to pay an additional $220 plus tax to upgrade rooms or stay in a room of the same quality. The young lady that assisted us openly admitted that all of their rooms are in similar shape unless you book their top two rooms for $300 or $500+ per night. We paid to upgrade and the room was alright but way over priced. We decide to try their buffet and it was disgusting and not in great shape. Never again.

Holiday Season 2015:  We checked in on a Monday and stayed a total of 5 days. It was a horrible week here at this Hotel\/Casino.  Basically, if I could give no stars I would!

First of all, somebody needs to alert the Fire Chief for their poorly maintained Fire escapes and elevators.  My husband waited 1\/2 an hour for an available elevator but got frustrated along with some other hotel guests.  They went through the stairs only to get stuck at the first floor, (really?) locked exit doors on the first floor???

Then in our room, our 2 kids fell through sofa bed because the hotel neglected to fix the springs at the end of the bed. When brought to their attention, they said there's nothing they could do.  WTF?

My eldest son called Housekeeping and asked for extra blankets ...and the staff brought towels instead (duh?)

Then in the morning, the fridge shelf broke (hinge was rusty and couldn't connect) and all drinks fell down.  Shattered sticky glass was all over the floor.  They gave no further compensation for their horrible maintenance upkeep.  

The entire 9th floor hallway had no lampshades on the light fixtures. It looked awful and when you walk down the hallway, you get a bright light shined in your eyes.  We told the a so-called "manager" at the front desk (Jun-a short chubby Asian guy with an attitude). He said, "Why change it?  People are only going to brake it anyway."  WTF. I f@#*ing can't stand this place.  

We also tried to take a shower but drain didn't work first two days and the dirty water kept rising.  

Oh and here's another thing; Security asking me to take off the hood of my sweatshirt???  I'm cold---WTF!?!   Other people are showing their ass but security is not saying anything about that.  

SERIOUSLY, Save your money and don't go here.  STAY VERY FAR AWAY!

From 5\/13\/15 
The Rio is another off the strip casino, located on West Flamingo. We came here to kill some time before our movie at Brendan Theaters, and could not get over the way this place looked- I don't mean that in a good way. 

The name of this hotel does not match the city Rio De Janeiro. The Rio smells like defeat and shame, covered in sadness, with a very lackluster ambiance and décor. However, if you are killing time there are things to do, they have the Chippendale show here, there are a few shops, some bars,  restaurants, a few buffets, and a tattoo place.

The rooms are very nice (the only thing I don't get is why they have a round window on the bathroom wall...) and the Buffet is great but I've never had any luck gambling there.  In a nutshell, the gambling is much better downtown.

Check in process was pretty speedy. The area when entering from the parking lot into the casino smelled like the sewers. Gross! We stayed in the Masquerade Tower which is the older tower. There as a window on the wall connecting the bathroom and the bedroom. Weird...good thing it was only my bf and I. I don't want no peeping toms watching at me shower! The rooms were dated but spacious. They need to provide a comforter. It was hella cold at night. Also their toiletries suck ass! Well what can I expect paying $60\/night.

This hotel has issues. First, half the elevators are broken, so plan on waiting 5-10 minutes before getting one and hope it isn't full.

Second, the concierge is awful. I rented a scooter yesterday and was told nothing about how to operate or store it overnight, which I just parked it near the other scooters. This morning my scooter was gone, and the concierge was not helpful dealing with the situation. I had to file a report with security and now I'm waiting for someone to review the tapes to see what happened. This is not something I should have to be dealing with on my trip to Vegas.

Third, last time I stayed here the room service kept taking all the towels and not replacing them. This was infuriating to wake up and not be able to take a shower.

Fourth, the registration line is almost always out the door and at least an hour wait time. Other Vegas hotels can have long lines too, but the Rio is the worst.

My husband and I have been regulars at the Rio for many years. However our last stay on 9\/19\/13 left much to be desired! We were given room # 512 in the Ipanema tower that was directly above the All American Grill . As soon as we walked in the room smelled like someone had been barbecuing in it . As the evening wore on the smell got stronger and stronger .
   I went downstairs to see if we could be moved to another room due to the awful smell . The check in woman referred me to the manager Christopher Manville who actually brought a security guard out of the back office with him! 
   I explained the situation and was told by him that there were no other rooms available without even a sorry or any alternative solution. He then told me I could go to caesars.com to register a complaint . I did that twice but to date have not received a response .

All the lights and LV glam aside, this place is on par with a budget hotel. They upsell you with a resort package which as far as I can tell just got me 20\/mbps wifi (wifi is not free) which was just fast enough to watch a movie stream skip. They also sell a breakfast upgrade which is $9 at a single Starbucks every morning serving a giant tower of people so the line to get crap coffee and a stale bagel is immense. I was put here for work, but if I were footing the bill I'd dish out the extra cash for somewhere nicer with actual amenities and pampering 'cause it's not like youre in town for the "culture.

The Rio is a relatively nice place. It's comfortable, and the property is large with good amenities. Pool area is good. Staff is friendly. Why 3 stars?? Although the property is nice, there are some repair needs that seem to be blatantly avoided. Management should step up and put in some repairs and updates to make this place competitive with the newer hotels.

It's been a few years since we've stayed at the Rio.  The MU received an offer for three nights\/$375 in slot play so we decided to give it another shot.

The rooms are called "suites" since they include a sofa, coffee table and a chair.  Our room had seen much better days.  The carpet was frayed, the furniture was saggy, dirty and old, one of the sinks barely drained, there were strange stains on the ceiling and the mini bar fridge wasn't cold.  The view of the strip was fantastic, however.

We called down to housekeeping to complain about the warm mini bar.  No one ever showed up to fix it.  We requested extra pillows since the ones they provide are more suited for children than adults.  They would only bring us two.

I've never enjoyed gambling at the Rio.  Fortunately, we spent very little time in their casino and didn't waste our money.  The rooms are in desperate need of renovation or a thorough cleaning.  I did not want to walk on the carpet in bare feet for fear of catching some type of lethal foot fungus.
The Rio is the same, hasn't been upgraded but feels so original still. Great tables and of course it's home to WSOP! Believe it baby!

DISGUSTING. Stayed here for the fist time and definitely will be the last. First, we were told early check in is $20.00 before 2:00 pm and free between 2:00 and 4:00 pm. When we're checking in at 2, they wanted to charge us an early check in fee. So we walk in to our room and it smells like what I imagine Snoop Dogg's house would smells like. I'm glad someone enjoyed getting high, I just didn't want the aftermath of it! I clearly missed the party. I call the registration desk and they offer to come and spray the room with air freshener. No, thank you. I prefer the room not to smell like bathroom air freshener mixed with Snoop's after party. I head back down to the registration desk to speak with management. I ask her how she is, she responds with "fine". Okay, great, I'm well too thank you for asking. Bad bad bad hospitality. We get to the point and she offers to move me. Ok, thank you. Once I was moved, I realized the grass was not greener on the other side and that you probably need to be high to stay here. These rooms are absolutely gross. There are holes in the carpet, stains on the toilet seat, chipped furniture, and peeling windows. The service staff said the rooms are being upgraded in the spring. Okay, great, your management also needs some upgrading. Enjoy the pictures, and use them as a good warning sign to not stay here.

I have stayed at many a hotel in my life in Las Vegas. Each one notable within the time frame and age.  But I have to tell you about the Rio All Suite Hotel and Casino. This was probably the best stay I have had in a long time. The rooms were large, updated, clean and comfortable. A nice choice of restaurants to meet every budget. A nice ambiance and feeling amongst the staff. Located away from the strip, but for those who want to be a part of the bustle, a free shuttle is available every half hour. The pool area is inviting, including a sandy beach. Plus, was able to actually go home with winnings in my pocket. I will definitely stay there the next time around.

No coffee makers. Check in and check out is extremely long even though hotel is deserted. Dirty and old rooms. Furniture (couch) is stained and outdated. Mold in bathroom. Don't bother -it is a motel six with suites.

Since I've now stayed at just about every hotel it seems down in vegas, looking back over the last several trips, I can say that I really enjoy the Rio.

Great pools, great rooms, I like not being on the strip in some instances (in other's it's pretty handy to be RIGHT there) 

When I go to Vegas, I don't go for the rooms, give me clean and comfortable and i'm happy.  This was actually a step above that - we had a killer room, with a huge couch, and a neat glass block wall between the bedroom and bathroom, and great lighting for the make up area. (just what girls want)

The enterance to and from our tower was a bit of a pain in the ass, but aside from that - pretty nice place to stay.  It's in my top 3.

I just....this is the shittiest hotel. 


 We were supposed to have rooms blocked off for a friend's wedding.  Instead we were at the end of a hall full of at least 50 barely legal kids partying in the hall.  I know it's Vegas but I'm pretty sure half of those people weren't even staying at this hotel and when we asked to move rooms the staff flat out said no.  Never saw another wedding guest so I guess they just scattered the rooms around the hotel.  



The hot water lasted about 30 minutes.  There was mold in the shower and what I assume was crusted and dried toothpaste on the sink tap.  The place just looks run down with nearly every light fixture in the hall broken and everything chipped and\/or broken. 


I also nearly broke my damn ankle because someone spilled grape jelly all over the elevators and it had been tracked all over the place. 


In short, I've stayed at Holiday Inns that were nicer than this place by a substantial margin.

This is only a review for the free shuttle from Rio to Ballys. I know it sounds lame to rate something that was free but it's been bothering me. 

I went to meet up with my friend who was staying at the Rio so we can hang out. Unfortunately I valeted my car because I thought we were just going to meet up for dinner inside the hotel. She remembered that the hotel offers a free shuttle to the strip so we chose to do that. 

When the shuttle drove up we noticed everyone scurrying to find their card. We thought they needed a room key to prove that we were staying at the hotel. My friend shows the driver her room key and he says , "I don't need that ...that ain't nothin" he scoffed. I need to see your Diamond card. The Diamond card members are allowed to go first. She was no longer a Diamond Club member so she didn't have one. We were the last ones to board . I thought the issue had passed but the driver made another comment about the card. My friend was clearly already agitated so she said, "Thanks for telling us because we we didn't know". Then he sarcastically said "Then now you know". 

My friend was livid by the time she left the shuttle so she filed a formal complaint with the hotel. She told the management that it's wrong to treat people based on their player club status. She was a Diamond member once but now that she's not the hotel shouldn't look down on her. She was mainly embarrassed because this happened in front of a lot of people.

Stayed in the Pet Room, the carpet was old and faded, the room decor was very dark kinda medieval looking and the bed moved like a water bed every time we moved.  On the plus side it was a pretty large room and we were happy we could bring our dogs with us.  Overall this casino needs to brighten up a little it's sorta dark overall, maybe upgrade the lighting a little bit.  They definitely need to improve check out apparently they'll try to charge you for another day if you check out late or something, so beware.  I think the one bright spot is their Carnival World Buffet the food was good.  Another thing I noticed is that some of the staff in the casino, bar, restaurants seem miserable; I don't know if it's because they're not paid well or are being treated poorly but this is one area casino's cannot afford to overlook if a paying guest has a bad customer service experience or the ambiance is not what they are looking for it's not likely they'll hang around or want to come back.  Las Vegas is supposed to be fun and relaxing, work on your employee morale, get rid of people that don't step up their game and hire people take pride in doing their job (as difficult as that is nowadays).

I spend a lot of time in Vegas.  Rio comped me over New Years which was nice.  The hotel was perfect for what I was looking for this particular stay.  Rooms were ok.  Not great. I stayed in the Masquerade Tower, which they said was the newer tower.  I prefer the other tower.  Masquerade Tower is in need of renovations.  It is very convenient located though.  Rooms had outdated decor, and couch was super small and old.  pretty worthless. 
This trip was with the kids, and they had a really good time.  The seafood Buffet at Rio is very pricey but worth every penny!  I think they sometimes give coupons for buffet.  Rio Voodoo lounge used to be the spot back in the day.  Now it's not very crowded.  The music was very good.  DJ played a good mix.  The view from top of Voodoo lounge is not to be missed!  It really was beautiful.  Took my 21 year old son there. He is very shy.  This was a great place to bring him to listen to good music and try to socialize without being overwhelmed.  I will def go to Rio again.  I would recommend for an average hotel that gives you all you need.

My experience at the Rio was very disappointing. The first night I booked a regular king room, mountain view, upon arriving in room, I found some disgusting brown stuff smeared on back of toilet seat, the housekeeping supervisor came, took pictures & had someone clean it. I was told they would get back to me with a resolution, etc. My 2nd & 3rd nights stay, I booked a super king, not cheap, check in time is 4pm, we were not able to check in until 5pm. It was my bday & I had a group reservation, everyone else were checked in early. Upon arriving to room, it did not look like the pictures on the Rio website of the room I booked, the front desk told me that they didn't have the room available & that the remolded rooms are extra, none of this was explained online. You click the room with the remodeled picture and expect that room. I argued that the price I paid (a lot!) is for the room that I saw on the website! They adjusted my price, but they made my birthday very stressful, with the mess on the toilet, back and forth issues regarding the room, & not getting the room that I choose on the website because the Rio does not tell you that this is not what you will receive. As much as I paid for the room, I was better off going to Aria, Cosmo, etc.. Also, the staff never resolves the issue with the unclean & disgusting bathroom upon checking in my room.

This was my fourth (and last) stay at the Rio. It was about four times more expensive than any other time we've stayed and about a third as good. The lines for everything were really long - which is fine with me when there are a reasonable amount of people working - but two people to check in a long line of people at 4:00pm?? That is check in time right? Are you surprised that we're here?

Then we get to our non-smoking room only to have to move b\/c it was so smoky. Hm. I wonder if I was supposed to choose non-smoking as in we really don't smoke. 

When we got to our new room we decided that we would have a drink. So, I called room service to please bring up some wine glasses. I was told that it would be $3 per glass. WHAT? Why? Never in all of my hotel staying life have I had to pay to borrow a glass. Especially when the room I'm staying in is over $300 a night. For goodness sakes - give a girl a glass. So, we decided we'd go Italian style and drink out of the small glasses in the room. Too bad they had dried orange juice on them. I guess I'm just not a girl that likes leftovers.

In general I really felt like there wasn't a single person at the Rio that cared if I came or went. Point taken Rio. So long.

I gotta say, I was enormously happy with the hotel.  We were six people in one room, and we all fit--quite comfortably I might add.  Granted, if we were six girls, we may have had a problem with the bathroom, but at least there's a sink outside the bathroom.  The water pressure was fantabulous!!  It's not often I enjoy showering at a hotel. 
The sofa bed was comfortable enough for a sofa bed.  (I was confined there the second night, since I had apparently kicked and punched and scratched my sister the night before in the bed.)  There was still enough space in the room for a rollaway bed.  So, all in all, really roomy, really comfy, and really convenient.

A coffee maker in the room would have been nice, but oh well, we survived.  Also the covers on their pillows need to be longer, or better tucked-in.  Your face scrapes into the mosquito-netting, burlap covering they use on the inside of the cover.  Not so great in the middle of the night.

...i thought i heard an echo when i yelled for no reason just to see if the room is really that big.  in reality, no echo, but i startled the cleaning lady..!!

ya the room was pretty big but the lackluster decor didn't give me goosebumps of any type.  but hey, no one ever sleeps in Vegas, right?  unless you have 'someone' with you and you're tired from showing off and performed your God-given talents (you know what i mean).  the view wasn't that bad either facing the Flamingo Rd. looking towards the strip, and like any other Vegas hotels, the large window pane had me one time or another, the notion of stripping down to my bare butt and see if anyone would notice my butt cheeks planted against it.

since there were plenty of room, they had another sink in addition to the the restroom as well as a small fridge.  definitely a plus if you have more people in the room.  the shower was pretty good and i love the powerful spout the shower head provides.  one weird part: there is a small window you can peek out or for someone to peek in while showering.  well, i guess it's nice if you are with your girlfriend or boyfriend and have yourselves kinky moments, but since i was with one of my buddies,  we just watched tv and resent the fact why there weren't any girls with us....

I like rios casino Kuzz the food is reasonable for me that can afford to pay for all my family to eat  room is big and service is good  Oh and the food was great compared to other casino n their price    Good job rios  I am coming back next year again  and hoping getting good service as we'll like this time
overrated hotel... rooms are old, carpet stinks . 2016 and the room does not have an usb port to charge your phone. overpriced will not come back again ... very disapointing

Our whole floor (#32) smelled like cigarettes.  Our door's lock plate fell off when we opened it.  Holes in walls and peeling wallpaper.  Open electrical boxes everywhere. Room was comped so I didn't want to bother to switch. But in general the place is outdated and poorly kept up.   View was great however. 

But I wouldn't want to stay there again.

Had it not been for the actions of a few key employees this would have been a much worse rating. 

I was offered a room upgrade for a small fee upon check in and I took it. After a discussion about payment and a lot of condescension and attitude from the clerk, I was ready to see the room. What the clerk failed to mention was that I would be right next to the launching area of the zip line so I would be hearing screams from the riders all day and into the evening. He also failed to mention that I would be below the rooftop lounge leading to loud music filling my room well past midnight. I was able to handle this the first night.

Second night, as I'm falling asleep to the sounds of a bass drum around 1am, there was suddenly a strong odor of sewage in the room. I found the source to be the bathroom and the technician came to take a look at it. The room REEKED and I requested to be moved. The front desk informed me that no rooms were available, which was a complete lie, especially since it was a Monday night during off-peak season. After expressing my disbelief, I was then told there was a room available but I would have to go to the front desk myself to speak with the manager. While this was happening I noticed a bug crawling on the bed and thankfully the maintenance technician was there to see it too. I explained the situation to the front desk again and I was told they would get in touch with the manager and abruptly hung up. 

The maintenance guy must have noticed my frustration and he was able to get the manager on the phone within seconds. Big props to him! 

The hotel manager was pleasant and informed me that I would be moved immediately. The bellman that was sent was incredibly cheerful, especially for it now being 2am.

I've loved staying at the Rio in the past, in fact I've stayed here 3 times this year, but this time was definitely different. It's unfortunate that the front desk staff, being the first point of contact, feels the need to lie to guests and be so incredibly combative.

Me and my husband stayed here for his bday. There was a few positives. Nice staff, clean big rooms and several things to do in hotel. The rooms are really old. No new decor. The only thing that was modern was the bed. I suggest getting a newer room, but if your on a budget and don't spend time in your room, then this could work for you. When we go to Vegas the room is very important to me since that's where I spend most of my time.

I will Never stay again I checked in nov 15 checked out nov17 the last night I w as there I saw a roach walking across the carpet safe malfunctioned toilet overflowed.... It is dirty & not maintained properly ........ I shook all my luggage   Before I went home I'd. Rather pay more  if I am on vacation .....  I couldn't  wait to get home to  a clean bug free environment !!!!!!

We came here for the Penn and Teller show so I have never actually stayed here.  

We got here early and planned to try and kill time before the show. After wandering around the floor for about 45 minutes we ended up back where we started and really had only entered a couple places. There were several "crappy Vegas t-shirt" shops and a tattoo parlor and that was about it.

Decor was okay, even though it seemed a little dated. All the waitresses\/servers wandering the floor seemed to have the skimpiest outfits I've ever seen on a waitress in Vegas. I was surprised that kids were allowed to wander around the edges of the floors, honestly.

Not a terrible hotel, but shows it's age. My room was in a smoking tower, and there was a smell lingering. Bed was comfy so that was a plus! The rug was old and bathroom outdated. In fact, the door was so old that the cross-latch to keep intruders out broke off! (I assume so, since I used it night one and it was gone after that). 

Towels in bathroom rough, as were tissues. Very low to no frills in terms of a room, but it had space! 

Staff was okay on site; gift shop pretty cool and smash burger rocked! The Starbucks was way too small and overcrowded at all hours of the morning! Valet guys were nice. 

It's an average hotel but a few steps below my past stays at Caesars Palace!!! I'd give it a C and may or may not return.

Clean and very comfortable. We were upgraded to a suite, which was very nice. 
The gym was good too. Very clean, tons of towels,  lemon ice water. Too bad it was raining so we couldn't use the pool. 
Overall, clean and comfortable. Definitely recommended

This review is for the hotel only. Gave it a week before I write this so I could cool off.  Stayed at the hotel for three nights. Asked for extra towels every night and never got them. Shower was luke warm at best every time I showered. Let the front desk know and all I got was "someone will look into it".  Got the same response everyday.

I will never claim to be an expert when it comes to hotels, or the party life of Las Vegas. We were recently there on a company trip to a convention that was hosted in the Rio, so it made sense to stay there. My coworker and I had a room on the 14th floor, facing away from the strip. We were lucky enough to see the erectile dysfunction, as well as bailbonds billboards every morning. 

As a whole, the hotel is not great. The hallways to rooms have torn wallpaper, the lighting fixtures have super ugly exposed screws, and the hot water in the showers can be gone as early as 7:30 in the morning. We were there for five days, the showers were all cold in the morning. How is this even a thing?

The room wasn't bad aside from that, but damn did this place feel dated. The staff were very nice, and there were plenty of places to stop and get whatever you need to make it through the day. 

The worst part about the hotel though, was the fact that you could not walk five feet without seeing another photo of Guy Fieri. The frosted tip douchebag, who everyone in my social circle thinks is a complete tool is absolutely everywhere, trying to get you to visit his shitty restaurant. He looks sweaty in all of the pictures, and it's just a general bad time.

We stayed here because of the convention. If I ever go back to Las Vegas, I will not be staying here.

Here's the positive: The rooms are larger than LV average.

Yeah, that's it. and they need to be painted and cleaned (at minimum)

I've been here six days and not once seen the show that runs every hour on the hour (because it's "on vacation").  no, I'M on vacation YOU run the freakin' show.

Internet is $13.95.. PER DAY!! and wireless doesn't work.

Shuttle to the airport?  No.

Built in 1990 and lightly remodeled twice since. Unless your convention is at the Rio I wouldn't stay at the Rio.

The rooms are like 2 miles from the convention space also. (exaggeration) but you have to walk forever to get down there.

Poker Room isn't even a room.  It's like a poker space.

Last gripe ATM's charge $4.95 PLUS 4%.  That's stupid.

Nothing really positive about it.

Check in was ridiculously slow , and that was at 8:am in the morning when no one was in line. Our bathroom reeked of urine smell and even after more cleaning they didn't get rid of it. Also the courtesy and attention you get at most of the hotels on the strip is completely lost here. There is a free shuttle to the strip which is nice and the drivers are all cool. But this would be my worst hotel experience in Vegas and I've been here over a hundred room nights.

Concerning the shooting of armed robber in hotel on Dec. 7...Hotel operations, not interrupted? My daughter was staying at the hotel and was trampled by a panicked crowd, she was treated by a squeamish hotel EMT who said, her forehead gushing blood was making him nauseous! The hotel did not make sure she was taken to the ER and they had to take their own cab! The hotel did not bother to check on her or her friends who were also in the middle of the chaos.  Were they treated so poorly because they were young adults? She happened to be staying at this hotel because her Friend was celebrating his last USMC ball as an active duty Marine! Thanks for making it memorable for them, the staff could have shown a little compassion and offered some kind of assistance!
Sincerely, Mary Carter
Orlando, Fl

I wish I would've just stayed on this trip. I could've paid the same price for something right on the strip. The TV sucks, the rooms are big, but not pretty. A plus is you don't spend much time in your room when you're in Vegas. As far as restaurants goes their aren't  too many to choose from. Unlike the hotels on the strip there's so many restaurants around you don't know what to choose. When I checked it and I felt like the Asian lady at the counter had an attitude, because I asked a lot of questions. The valet is so slow when getting your car, but their very friendly and professional. I wouldn't be staying there again and I don't recommend it. Just stay on the strip.

We always like having a staycation at the Rio. This was the first we had 2 nights. Theres 5 rooms in total that was booked. Our rooms was great in size and everything worked. The room didn't have the privacy sign and when we came back to the room a little before the pool closed, it wasn't cleaned. It took a while for them to arrive but they did a good job. The elevators need to be fixed. Theres 2 banks of elevators and not all of them are working. 
The cabanas in the pool needs some mist. The fan and tv was good. Service took a long time but our server was pleasant. Will come back.

Now is the time to go to Las Vegas, and now is the time to stay at the Rio. My go-to casino is very close to the Rio, but I usually stay at the Palms or whatever hotel I can get the best deal at. And the deal I got at the Rio was pretty freakin amazing - $39\/night. And yes, that is on two WEEKEND nights. Although I am proud to say, that is not the cheapest I've paid for a Vegas hotel room. =) But for $39, that is a real steal for this hotel.

Like I said before, I'm very familiar with the Rio but I've never stayed here. So it was interesting experiencing the hotel from the other side. Let me start by saying that I received the best service I've ever had in Vegas at this hotel. And I'm not just saying that because they upgraded me when I asked, although that DID help. But from the housekeeping team that was there within TEN minutes of my calling them, to the friendly staff at the Carnival World Buffet who never stopped smiling despite seeing us three times in one day =X, to the bouncer and hostess at Voodoo Lounge who were WAY friendlier than any door ppl I'd encountered in LA. 

I could go on, but I'll spare you the details and just leave you with these highlights:

- NO RESORT FEE (this is HUGE..a stay at Treasure Island will now include a $20 fee on top of the room)
