- Parking Garages on both sides of the hotel (saves you the trouble of walking allllllll the way through the casino to get to the rooms, i.e. PH or MGM)
- It's away from the strip which means NO STRIP TRAFFIC. which is why I always stay on this side of the 15
- Free shuttle service to Caeser's, Ballys\/Paris..saves you the hassle of driving and parking

So for those of you who are hating on the RIO, I say..you get what you pay for. And if you're lucky like me, you will get all that you pay for and THEN some. Thanks, RIO! Even though I dropped $$$ on the tables, you guys still made this trip a good one for me!!

This is by far THE worst hotel I have EVER stayed in. Absolute worst. It served as the host hotel for my convention, so I decided to stay solely based on convenience and access. Awful idea. Registration is an absolute nightmare. Ridiculous. The lines are so long and don't move quickly at all. My non-smoking room was smoky and not fresh. I immediately called to request a change and was informed they were sold out. A housekeeper came to "deodorize", which consisted of spraying a chemical on the floor. It didn't help. The hotel is also very old and needs major renovations. My furniture was outdated and ripped in a few places. The very random two way window in the bathroom shower with a view of the bedroom is a bit creepy. The first morning there was no hot water. Ugh. Very tepid water that never got hot in the shower. When I finally shifted rooms, it was an improvement, but still a mediocre experience. The room smelled much better and I could breathe, but the furniture and bathroom left much to be desired.  The room itself was very spacious. When trying to charge something to my room, I was told that my room charges were revoked. What? Why? So of course I was sent to the super long registration line. The guest services rep said she didn't know what happened but it should be fine now because she fixed it. Very inconvenient. I did have dinner at the Guy Fieri restaurant. It wasn't bad and they were pretty quick. Finally, the shuttle. Another nightmare. There is no organization, especially on the return trip from Harrahs. Guests are pushing and shoving.  Very chaotic. Many of my colleagues and fellow convention attendees expressed their displeasure of the hotel. It is safe to say that I will not return or recommend others. It is bottom of the barrel and there are so many other competitors that do a better job.

This hotel is wonderful! First of all, all the staff we encountered were super-friendly, helpful and nice! Great customer service! Gorgeous huge room with incredible view! Very clean, great amenities, all around thumbs way up!!!

Nice hotel not too many smokers and there's a big restaurant as soon as you walk into the doors and you can't miss it it's a very fun type of hotel but still not for kids. I stayed here for a week and a half massive rooms the largest I've ever seen in my life besides Crowne Plaza in St Louis Missouri at Clayton

Okay...so it's not the nicest hotel in Vegas but if they're gonna comp the room I'm staying here. Now...if you don't know the secret...I'll let you in on it. Ask for a room in the Impanema Tower~!! Cuz ya know what? The Masquerade Tower is pretty damn ghetto. I've stayed in both and what a world of difference. 

Impanema Tower is a lot newer and bigger. They give you separate shampoo and conditioner but the Masquerade Tower gives you the 2 in 1 kind. Uh...I need to have soft hair. The Masquerade Tower has old sheets (I found a hole in our sheets), furniture and even TV. I mean...it's imcomparable. 

The swimming pool was pretty nice. We even got free admissions to the Sapphire pool, a topless pool. For ladies, it's $10 regardless of what day it is. For guys, it's $30 on weekdays, $50 on weekends and $60 on holidays. Hahahaha. What a price difference. Anyway, I was curious so I checked it out...with my top on, okay? Guys, save your money for the strip clubs...it ain't a pretty sight in here. Lots of old, saggy and cellulitey bodies. Eww. 

I guess I shouldn't complain...cuz it was a free room and a free admission to the pool but next time...if I ever stay at Rio again...it will be in the Impanema Tower and the regular pool. For sure.

Made reservations here a couple of months ago since I was going to attend the UFC expo. Instead of checking in on Thursday, we checked in on Friday at about 12:30am. Unfortunately, they had no more rooms in the Ipanema Tower. Which is the tower that I preferred to stay in since the rooms are a bit newer and cleaner than the ones in the Masquerade Tower. They only had rooms available on the pet friendly floor which was located in the Masquerade Tower. So I was stuck with that room and even though I told them that my bf and I have very bad allergies to animal fur!!! They couldn't do anything to get us a different room.

So we were stuck there for one night and were informed that we can change rooms the following morning at 11am. But since I was going to head to the expo at 9:30am I wouldn't be able to do so. I asked them if they can just hold a room for us since we wont be back until late evening since the expo ends at 6pm. I was then told that the latest would be 7pm but then again with the traffic coming back to Rio from mandalay bay, I was not sure that we would make it back in time. So I asked if they can hold the room until 9pm and they couldn't do so. The latest was 7pm. GRRR..
I don't understand why they couldn't just hold a room for us since I made reservations or at least check me into a room without having me to be there physically! I could have picked up my card keys after I came back from the expo. But NO! because of this I had to leave the expo early and went back to Rio and check in then go back to the expo! what a waste of time! I have stayed at RIO many times during my stay in vegas but this will be my last time with them! It's about time they switch out their TVs to flat screens and have Pay-Per-View in their rooms. We wanted to watch the UFC 148 in our room by ordering PPV but they don't even have it!!!

Oh oh forgot to mention, I looked at my credit card statement today and noticed that Rio charged me an additional $200!! I was not sure why I was being charged an additional amount, but when I called Rio they said it was a deposit in case there were any damages done to the room. I thought this was strange as I never encountered any additional charges during my stay at Rio. But after talking to some friends, they did mention that the $200 deposit charge is probably because we stayed in a pet friendly room! So disappointed that Rio never informed me about the $200 deposit upon check in!

Maybe I was in the economy tower, but I woke up Tuesday morning to no water, when I called down I was told it 'should' be coming back up soon. Soon is not an answer when you've go to be at a meeting. When the water did come up- it never did get hot for the remainder of the stay. It was tepid at best Wednesday and just cold Thursday.  The water pressure just absolutely sucked. No one at the front desk when I called seemed to be too bothered.

The television would cut off at will or go to snow. The couch had several small stains on it. In addition, the ventilation was poor, could smell the cigarette smoke thru the vents. It was a lingering odor.

The 12th floor lighting fixtures leading down the hallway towards 1255 looked like they had been in a fight. bent, cracked and in a couple of places just missing.  I am certain with the amount of money that place draws in- that they could spend a few dollars and upgrade the  Ipanema Tower.

The best thing that happened to me during this stay was the Valet guys, because I knew when I got to them, I was leaving!

Really guys? After a day that went from 2am until 11pm, you have me and 20 other schlubs stand in line for 45 minutes to check in. 20 people in line and you have TWO desk clerks? TWO? IS THIS YOUR FIRST TIME?? I know you have had busy Wednesday's before and I'm sure you had more staff waiting. Last time you get my money for your Dung heap of a hotel. Motel 6 would be the same anyways, but I would have been in bed an hour ago...

This place is the most dishonest casino I've ever stayed in my 20 years going to Las Vegas I request the rooms non-smoking and guess what we get a smoking room begin to complain downstairs to a manager  she told us that they will spray my room with chemicals and they will not change my room because they don't have any rooms available we have to stay away for 3 hours , when we came back is still smell like a  dead skunk this is not The same Rio that was 10 years ago, now they charge $11  for Reservation plus &25 per day for I don't know what  will never go back to this place there costumer service not exist zero totally agree with previous reviewer Gevorg exactly same thing happened to us

i had a driver's license that was expired....does that mean i'm NOT 21 anymore??? the stupid guy named jose who sounds like a french dude said i can't drink there at the pool...OMG, then i left without a hassle and he chased me and my 3 friends down and called the security...don't know why.. LOL, he was just an underpaid guy who was upset with something that day...i don't know. whatevers.. i mean, i can't imagine why they wouldn't want to sell me an $8.00 beer and profit, ya know?? haha, unbelievable.. The RIO is great to be honest with you, just be aware of the french accent "jose" at the rio's pool bar :)

I am forced to give them a one star since I can't give them a ZERO.  I came for a conventional which I made reservations several weeks ago. We waited in line over 3 1\/2 hours and then were told they are sold out and we only have a room for one night.  I will never come back.

It truly pains me to have to write a bad review of the RIO, unfortunately my last 3 stays have been terrible. Every year I play at The WSOP I stay anywhere from 2-3 weeks in Vegas. The last 5 yrs I have stayed 10 days at the RIO and the rest at the WYNN or Mandalay Bay. Over the last three yrs the AC in the room was either broken or was very poor at cooling room. My last stay from June 26 thru July 5th my AC did not work for 5 days I complained on 3 different occasions finally after I ranted to a hotel supervisor I got maintenance to come and fix. I understood the delay due to a power problem however I was only comped the resort fee which was insulting. The rooms are generally run down compared to the better hotels so I must say go with one of the other quality hotels and save yourself the Grief. I paid extra to stay in the new updated room samba and was disappointed. Important note for some strange reason they decided to add a clear window on the shower stall which means anyone can look through at you while taking a shower or doing any other bathroom business. poorly thought out design. I go to Vegas 3-4 times a year and have stayed in all the Major Hotels and many of the others. Sadly the RIO is no longer on my list of acceptable options.

I enjoyed my stay at the Rio.  The beds are amazingly soft and comfortable, they make you not want to get up, and the staff are friendly and helpful.  The rooms are pretty large compared to others for the same price and there is this freeky mirror\/peek-a-boo window from the sleeping area into the bathroom.  I found the mirror\/window pretty amusing...LOL. The young lady Danielle who came with a wheelchair to help my grandmother was very nice. 

I would have given the Rio 4 stars but they did not follow through on the room change.

My family and I booked for two rooms with double beds but when we arrived to check-in they were out of double beds, so we were given rooms with king beds and they brought a roll away for one of the rooms.  The lady that checked us in asked for our cell phone numbers so that someone could call us the next day to change rooms, however no one ever called myself or my aunt to say they were moving us or they still did not have any thing available.  

I would go back and this time use the resort features since you have to pay for them anyway.  I pretty much paid almost $30 per day in resort fees for nothing:(

So we booked for the night due to plumbing issues at our home. The gentlemen at the front desk tried to act like he was giving us a discount on our security deposit which the site already said its $100 and thats what we were charged(refundable). The faucet in the bathroom pm the cold water side was so hard to turn my son couldn't use it and i had troubles as well..the other faucet in the area with the vanity like sitting area was leaking water all over the place and i didn't notice until i went to use the hair dryer and i set it down to get my brush and nearly electrocuted myself when i picked it back up and the handle was SOAKED! There are actual hard water stains from how long its been leaking.. My son picked up what looked like old rotten grapes off of the floor next to the sofa in the room. Never again will we book here, ive spent less at Excalibur and had a terrific stay with no issues. Not to mention their slot selection in the casino sucks. Im not one to typically write bbad reviews but when youre spending money on a place hoping to relax after having a very frustrating day only to become more frustrated it has to be done!!!!!

We begin with the poker room.

I don't play cash games, so my perspective is entirely that of a tournament no limit hold 'em player.  I bought into a $60 tourney of 3,500 chips.  I took the 2,000 chip add-on about 45 minutes in.

There were 18 players at 11am.  I managed to cash in second place.  There was a moment where drink service was a bit slow, but I was satisfied with the room in general.  A good group of folks there, lot of friends there.  Friendly crowd, and while the levels, at 15 minutes, were pretty quick, the starting chips made it work so I had time to establish a conservative image before the blinds forced me in.  I had fun.

Oh, and there was a cute cocktail waiter.  How about that?  Yes, sometimes I am that shallow.

The fun part about the Rio poker room is that it's next to the sports book, and so the roar of the crowd during divisional playoff weekend is your cue to check the monitors for the instant replay.

Can't complain much since the room was comped, but there are definitely nicer rooms out there. It's also kind of a hassle that it's significantly off the strip. 

Fairly spacious room, long couch, strange window in the shower that allows people to look in from the bedroom. Pretty much your basic amenities. You can also request for an extra bed, in which someone will graciously bring up.

So much for a 4 star hotel and casino. I've stayed in better second rate hotels in Los Angeles. Where  do I start. Well if you like the drain in your showers to work when you clean your self think again. If you're  looking  for  safety... nope Dec.7  2014 police crime scene as soon as you get out of the elevator  in the morning. Wanna book your room in advance to save some money? Nope!! I paid close to $80 when I booked over 2 months in advance. Well if I would have waited I would have paid $45 at the desk. But that's not it there's an awesome $100 deposit and $25 per-night Resort fee!!! So what started as a $160 stay turned into $300 stay where it wasn't even safe to walk around in the Casino\/hotel. Sorry but this place is a pass honestly. You're better off finding somewhere else to stay.

Never never book in this hotel there is no security they don't care about your safety at all i was sleeping in my room and someone come inside my room took my laptop bag and my passport my phone watches every thing that can be stolen and when i told the security they were trying to make it my fault and they trying to makes me thing that was my friends .. Finally if you want your safety don't stay at this hotel and if someone need proof i have the police report and the security. What if i woke up and the person saw absolutely someone will get killed .

This place is OK.  I have a thing against it, since they once fired my partner because he missed "one meeting".  Yeah.  That is cool.  Anyway, the casino is compact and squished.  Ick.  Very dark, considering its supposed to mimic Rio.  The rooms though are very large -- and roomy.  Good Hotel.  Bad Casino.  Good location.  Bad Starbucks.

This is our go to hotel in Vegas. I always feel safe knowing that the rooms are clean and customer service is excellent. Huge rooms for decent prices and you don't have to deal with crowds on the strip. Free parking is also a plus and the valet is quick and efficient.

If you use Lyft or Uber it's only about a $7 ride to downtown Fremont Street.

This hotel is so outdated. When my husband and I first arrived we were put in a room that clearly hadn't been updated since the 70's. we explained it to the front desk, and she already knew about it because there wasn't even a fight put up. They give you a crappy room at first hoping you won't complain. 
The second room was a little better, emphasis on a little. Maybe updated in the 90's. Don't expect a clean crisp room with bright lights. 
They want you to do a tour of the new Rio next door but they have done nothing to keep this one up to date and are still having people stay here full price. 
The hotel is about a mile from the strip and we were informed they have discontinued shuttle service. What a rip off! 
I don't gamble but the casino was very dark, outdated, and full of smoke. No ventilation. Overall very disappointed.

I just got back from Las Vegas after staying at the Rio. Its interesting that this hotel gets so many bad reviews because my experience was excellent. I only payed 128 bucks to stay wen, thurs and friday. That's a bargain to me. 

As far as the room goes it had a big bathtub but the bath area does have a little bit of a claustrophobic feel to it but then again I did get the cheapest room. There's a big couch and full size window which had a big, elegant view of the strip. Everything was clean except for the iron being in bad shape. I called to have it replaced and they had a new one in about 15 minutes. 

The casino is really fun because they hire very pretty girls for everything and dress them very sexy. Also there are two popular clubs there which bring in a lot of attractive girls. If you want a casino where you'll see lots of eye candy while you gamble this is the place. All the staff was friendly and one security guard I was talking to noticed I was way drunk. He was very nice and told me to make sure to keep my room number and key on me so that If I get to drunk they could put me to sleep. I found it funny and nice he said that but I definitely didn't get too drunk that I couldn't  walk. So for the price I paid this was definitely a very good casino and one awesome place to party.

The Rio has lost some luster as a place to stay, but they do a great job of hosting the WSOP, which is what I visit for. The casino employees are classy and professional, although drink service is severely lacking. 

Aside from that, the Indian restaurant, Buzios, and the All American Bar & Grill are great places to eat at.

Ok, the last time I went to Rio was gosh knows when.. I think it was like 10 years ago. As I arrive to Vegas I reminisce on how much i use to pig out at Rio cuz of the 1000s of variety of food they had back in the days when they called themselves World of Buffets. I was starving and couldn't think of what to eat during lunch time..and I remember Rios buffet was pretty awesome when they opened up like in the early 90s. The last time I went was like 2000s and it was really lousy and the food just seem like Circus Circus. But this time it was shockingly good.Could be new management or something.. Everything seems fresh.. I thought I was in another hotel. Best part is the real hanging duck they had in they're Chinese section.. they also had roast pork..also the prime rib is to die for.. the clam strips super yum..hush puppies.. pretty good... pretty good...

I've stayed at quite a few hotels over the years, including many hotels in Las Vegas, both on and off the strip, and it's apparent that Rio is NOT focused on keeping customers happy. 

We arrived to the Rio about an hour and a half before check in. The entire reservatuin area was unorganized chaos with patrons utilizing self help kiosks and two lines at the counter.  One of the lines was labeled "keys and mail" and we witnessed several people step out of the longer line we were in to get in that shorter line, and be serviced before us.  When we pointed this out and other people around us noticed as well, we appealed to the employees at the counter to police the line a bit better, and were essentially ignored. I guess if you want prompt service, cut the line...

Despite the fact there were about 6-10 employees behind the counter, it took quite a while to get through the line because half of them were either interacting with one another or had no sense of urgency.  When we finally got a rep, we questioned about early check in. The rep gleefully exclaimed that our room was available, but then told us it would be an extra  $30+ to access it 1.5 hours early.  I have never had a hotel not allow me in my room, if it was ready upon arrival, without fee. 

We opted to stow our bags with the Bell Hop, and went in search of food.  I had heard great things about Guy Fieri's restaurant but they weren't open til 4:30, so we opted for the American Grill instead.  I wish I remember the older lady's name who helped us, because she was extremely friendly...which apparently a rarity in this establishment. 

We paid extra for a premium suite, and while the room is spacious, it's still nothing spectacular. We weren't provided with sufficient towels\/wash cloths upon check in, and had a long wait for more.  I called the Bell Hop to have our luggage delivered, and they had written the wrong # of bags on our slip (saying we had 1 more than we actually did) and the guy on the phone proceeded to argue with me about how many bags we must have.  I finally convinced him to bring the pieces he had available (which actually was all we had) and at least they arrived quickly.

After settling in, we headed to the casino. My father had forgotten his TR card at home, and we went to get one reprinted.  Alfred at the counter was rude beyond words. He was snippy, dismissive, and not attentive.  We asked for cords for our cards and he waved us away and said "we don't have those" even though I had just seen another patron get one.  He had a tray of waters next to him that he apparently forgot to offer, and I asked if we could have waters.  He nonverbally set one in front of me.  I pointed out there were three of us at the counter and he slammed two more in the counter.  He didn't thank us or say you're welcome after we thanked him for the water he begrudgingly gave us. It was just a strange encounter and didnt add to the less than stellar first impression we had of the Rio.

We mostly play slots, and didnt find the selection at the Rio very appealing.  Payout was low and the cocktail waitresses were hard to flag down.  My dad did some gambling at night once we had returned to our hotel, but my mother and I mostly gambled elsewhere.

We finally got to eat at Guy Fieri's restaurant and the trash can nachos are a must!

Our first evening was the night of the terrifying and tragic Las Vegas mass shooting.  We had to take cover in another casino then after receiving the all clear to leave, we were able to catch the shuttle back to the Rio.  The whole shuttle ride was spent expressing fear and shock with the other patrons. Upon arrival back at the Rio, we were yelled at by "security" to show room keys to be able to enter.  There were people on the streets who couldn't access their hotels because of the crime scene and apparently the Rio woulednt let other people inside. Post shooting, we had to walk through 3 different hotels\/casinos on the strip and no other property disallowed entry to their property. 

The seafood buffet was much more expensive than other properties on the strip, so we did that for brunch at the Aria instead. 

The shuttle was fairly consistent, but did get crowded with long waits at times.  We opted to Uber in those situations.

The walls are thin and we heard music blaring from our neighbors all day and night long on the last 2 days of our trip.  After lack of sleep last night because of this, I called early this morning to request a late check out to give us a little more time to get everything together, especially since we're out on a red eye this evening.  The rep at the front desk let me know I could extend my checkout for an extra $25.  This too shocked me, because offering at least another hour complimentary is customary at any other hotel I've been at.  

All in all, the nickel and dime game of the Rio, coupled with the lack of stellar service, makes me question whether I'd stay here again or not.

Rio is "Meh." The rooms are big, the restaurants are pretty good, but something is just lacking at the Rio. The casino definitely has a Reno flavor to it. The carnival shows each hour are kinda cheese. Best way to say it, it's off the strip - and it's got very little attraction so it is quiet and boring.

I finally stayed at the Rio's hotel rooms on my most recent visit to Vegas. I was able to pick up a Monday & Tuesday night for $50 TOTAL. Good rate, and I didn't have to pay the Resort Fee due to my status. The room was pretty basic but was big, which was handy as I had to unpack and repack my luggage. They said the room had just been remodeled, but I heard the remodeled rooms had Keurig coffeemakers and this one did not. Also, there are no outlets next to the bed. You can pull the mattress out and get at an outlet, but come on, this is 2016, that shouldn't be necessary.
We bought 24hour  buffet passes and.found out Rio don't serve breakfast buffet next morning.  I asked two staff and were told.by both staff that they knew nothing about it.  Bad customer service!!!

I have been coming to Vegas for years. I have found a new favorite casino and hotel to stay & play in.  Seafood buffet is great. Hash house a Go go in the hotel is a cool place to chow down.  The rooms are very nice. I was able to up grade to the suite for just a few bucks more. If you like pools they have at least four that I can see. Gambling layout is great with lots of options.

Came here for a convention during the week for my job.  For how big it was and how much money was spent, it was very disappointing! I was shocked to discover it was an add'l $13.99 a night for Wifi and $24 if you wanted to use other amenities' like the spa and gym.  Maybe I am spoiled but I have always found it to be a given. My coworker and I got rooms across the hall from each other.  She says hers smelled funny.  I thought maybe it was because we were on the smoking floor but no, it did smell funny.  It smelled like a mixture of stale smoke and sewer.  As a matter of fact several parts of the casino had that sewer smell esp out by the shuttle area.  She tried it out and couldn't take it so asked for another room the next morning.  They said she would have to wait til 3pm when the rooms were cleaned but before 6pm before they get all checked out.  WTF???  so we couldn't go anywhere and that was our only free night. Then the room itself was pretty beat up that they seem to find acceptable.  While the AC worked well, it was extremely loud and noisy.  Not a hum but a rattling that kept waking me up when it would kick on.   My flat screen TV was visibly crooked with wires hanging all about. I tried to straighten it but it was stuck there crooked.  The lamp was cracking.  Furniture edges were worn\/chipped.  The shower has two vertical nozzles that 'once' had a cover and now its these two rubber things protruding from the wall.  Looked awful.   It is off the strip but they offer a shuttle to go to their sister properties on the strip Ballys or Harrahs.  Both properties are pretty far from the Luxor or Stratosphere.  The food here is very expensive if you just want a small bite to eat.  Even the burger king was pricey if you want to spend $7 for a whopper.   The only positive that this hotel has going for them is the size of the room is very spacious and the gaming had a decent variety.  I would never stay here voluntarily again.  They also nickel and dimed our company for silly charges after bringing in over 1000 ppl in attendance.  We did go back to another person to try and get my friend a room replacement earlier rather than later and she was very helpful and friendly and why I am giving 2 stars and not 1.   See my pics!

We decided to stay in the Rio for a change of pace. We are in Vegas at least four times per year and like to try different hotels each time if possible. The Rio is a very nice hotel, well maintained but not the best or worst of Vegas. The value for money is outstanding.

The rooms are very large suites with excellent bathrooms. The showers have a glass window looking into the bedroom which is either sexy or disconcerting depending on your perspective (the latter for me). The bed was comfortable, the water pressure excellent, the view okay (over the suburbs of Vegas), service very good. In-room internet access was about the same as most Vegas hotels - $12 for 24 hours or something close. The rooms were a little noisy, we could hear people in the halls almost all the time but there is no street noise.

The hotel doesn't have the best restaurants in the city but the seafood buffet is good despite being pricey. RUB BBQ restaurant was awful.

If you are planning on being at a convention at the Rio this hotel is a perfect choice. If you're doing the tourist thing the distance from the strip may be annoying. It isn't a comfortable walking distance as the hotel is on the opposite side of the freeway. Cab fare is about $10 - $11 to get to the closer end of the strip (Treasure Island, Venetian, Wynn, Mirage, Paris hotels).

All in all, pretty good but not my favorite. With all the other choices available I probably wont stay at the Rio again unless we're attending a convention there.

    * Liked -- The rooms are large and pleasant, service is good. Excellent business services center in the hotel.
    * Disliked -- Distance from the strip was inconvenient.

I am giving it a four star cause of the room size, awesome concierge (ugh I forgot his name-Hubert???), and price. I was here for a convention so didn't really have time to play on the slot (not a gambler anyway). My stay was enjoyable.

Pro:
Voodoo Lounge- really good steak and clubbing scene
cheap price for the gigantic clean room
Mardi Gras party
Chippendale and Penn & Teller show
Nice concierge

Con:
 Rio Carnival- food not so fresh or good for the price
The breakfast restaurant-eh forgot the name but it is overprice

It's honestly not worth the money. You are so far from the strip, and the shuttle does not come on time. If you stay here, you are at the mercy of the shuttle to get anywhere downtown. Stay anywhere else on the strip.

I've been a fan of the Rio in the past, but hadn't stayed here in a while.  On our last trip, we were a bit disappointed by a few things.

First, the mini bar and coffee hadn't been restocked.  There was NO coffee at all in the room, and the mini bar was over half emptied.  And if there had been coffee, it was going to cost a ridiculous $8 for three pods.

Otherwise it's pretty good for an older hotel.  The room wasn't perfect but it was in reasonable condition for the age.  The bathrooms are pretty nice and roomy, as is the entire room.  I like the space a lot so you don't feel closed in like most rooms.  Price was in the middle range.

We prebooked a one bedroom with a king bed. Check in time,we're told IF we want a King we'll have to take a walk in shower...ok,no big deal...
They failed to tell us it was a handicap shower. Not great for a 6 foot tall guy!!
Also, the shower hose was leaking.

It was called a non smoking floor?? The floor reeked of pot all weekend!! Lol!!

Btw Rio, thanks for the nasty view of your ugly rooftop.

Not impressed for a first timer. Tried to tell your check out person & all She could say was "uh-huh" over & over while looking at her monitor.

YELP...I MEAN, YEP...thank you too!!

First time checking out the RIO. 

Although this hotel is not located on the strip they provide a great free shuttle service to Bally's and Harrahs (it runs about every 30 minutes to 1am).  It took us about 20 minutes to walk to the Strip.

 Every employee we interacted with were friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was one of the newly renovated rooms in the masquerade tower. It was very clean and quite large although we could faintly hear the bar (?) even on the 37th floor.  

We only ate at the American Grill for lunch on our first day, it was a good veggie burger option, cold beer and great bar service.  

When we travel to Vegas we want a clean comfortable room... at the end of the day the Rio delivered.

Thank god the rooms (regular ones might i add) were nice, pretty spacious and most of all CLEAN otherwise this would've been a 1 star rating.

Moving on, 
The things that made this review a 2 star include hookers (we actually saw hookers getting arrested), Also a hooker at our starbucks meeting a hotel guest by the Inpamena tower elevators!  So this place was infested with hookers and very shady looking people.  

We ignored the hookers, but couldn't escape the late check in! HORRIBLE!  We showed up pretty early at 1pm.  They gave us a paper saying to call back and check if our room was available.  We called around 3pm and no success.  4pm we try again and were told to wait until 6pm because they are backed up.  Seriously? what hotel does that?  We ended up settling in our rooms around 630.  Wasted our first day in vegas!

Location? Well....it didn't even feel like we were in vegas.  Sure we had a car, but how inconvienient is that to always drive around, where as hotels on the strip you can walk around whenever you feel like it.  

Rio buffet was a bright spot however.  Not sure if its the "best in vegas" but it was better than average.  

Room service...I tried ordering $16.50 chicken strips, NO FRIES, and was told it would take an hour and fifteen minutes.....at 1am. On a tuesday!  okaaay...canceled that really fast.

Everytime I come to vegas I stay at one of the ceasars properties. The rio has always been good cause the room as pretty big and usually pretty nice. I upgraded to the so called samba luxury suite. Don't waste your money, get the regular suite. All they have done to this room is put a couple of colorful pictures up, changed the carpet and a new headboard. When I put my clothes away the closet door would not open and there was trash inside the dressers. Check in was not very friendly, but I think it was just that person cause everyone else in the property was really nice. This property is off the strip but they do have a free shuttle. Overall it was an ok stay and I would stay again. I just wouldn't be paying the extra for the samba room.
Nice hotel big rooms all suits nice staff and big lobby.its off the beaten path of the strip.rooms are pretty cheap

Worst hotel I ever stayed at in LV. Not very clean, rooftop music going until 2 or 3 am, got a sewer smell several times, parking garage was filthy, could hear tv, conversations, and other stuff from neighboring rooms. Check in took 45 mins (line got even longer, friends took 1.5 hrs!)... less than half the computer stations had a staff person. Had to pay for wifi (even Motel 6 offers free wifi). Food overly priced and not that good. Slots were extremely tight. Moved to another hotel.

Nice hotel off the strip but very close ...room was nice and clean ...everyone is very friendly ...sports book very large and a nice place to spend a football Saturday and Sunday... only thing is check in can be better staffed the last thing you want to do is stand in line for an hour and a half after a long day traveling

We were at the Rio Hotel carnival buffet over the Labor Day weekend.  We loved this place for the price, the quality of the food they served, especially the crab legs.  This time, it was a different story.  The quality of the food was poor and less than what I could experience locally.  However, our compliment goes out to the serving staff.  They respected our opinion and was courteous. Especially the manager Sal, tried all he could to keep our business and to have us return.  Thumbs up to the Sal and his staff.
Try the buffet in Rio yesterday night. The food was not good, some seafood smelled or eaten not fresh.

We wanted to stop by Vegas for our road trip to LA. We decided to stay in Rio because of its somewhat low price compared to other hotels directly on the strip, which were more expensive on this dead week.

Service was great, the room was even better since we got a free upgrade to a VIP room, which was more than amazing, 70 bucks for a normally 500-600 a night room, and that's on non-busy weekdays.

Recommend getting a cheaper room here and taking a taxi with a group to where you want on the strip.

After some time, I went back to the front desk for a status update and spoke to another clerk. I also asked again about the "free early check-in" on the website. He told me that it would have to be booked specifically through the Rio website and it might be from a promotion where the early check-in fee is included in the final cost. Wait, if it's "hidden" in the final cost, then how can you call that "free"? Anyway, I had him check the status and he said that housekeeping hasn't started on the room yet. So he placed a rush order and said it might be ready by 1PM. He also gave me the direct number to the supervisor (probably the most helpful thing... you should ask for this number if you're having issues).

Once 1PM came and no phone call, I called the supervisor's number for a status update. The supervisor on duty was Will. He checked in with housekeeping to see what was holding things up. He found out that there is a facilities issue with my room and that it is not available to rent out. So he transferred me to another room that was already available. We probably could have gotten a room around 11AM if someone found out that the room we were assigned can't be rented out.

The next day, we went out for lunch for a couple of hours and when we came back, our entire room reeked of cigarette smoke despite our room and floor being non-smoking. It made us sick, we didn't want our 1 year old to be exposed to that, and our poor dogs were in their kennel inside the room during the time. We had to wait out in the hall for an hour while I called the front desk to do something. They sent housekeeping to spray an air freshener spray, but that did nothing for the smell. They told us that there was no other rooms available for me, and that they could use an ozone machine, but we'd have to leave the room for a few hours. Well, the reason we came back to our room was to rest; our 1 year old was fussy and needed his nap. We also had event plans and reservations, so we didn't have the time to leave with our dogs for hours. After calling the supervisor again demanding they either put us in a different room or another room at a different hotel. The supervisor was able to book us a room in a different floor. So we rushed to pack up all of our things to be transferred to the new room. Which was a lot smaller and dirtier. There were cum stains on the couch, molding in the shower, stains in the bed sheets, dead smell from the bathroom, filthy carpet and just filthy everywhere else. We only had 30 mins to get to dinner so we didn't bother complaining again. I'll take a dirty room over a smokey room. Non of the dead bolts in either room worked, the hinge lock from the first room was missing screws and didn't close properly. In the last night we stayed, i had bed bug bites on my arm, see photo...luckily my son wasn't bit. We packed up our stuff right away and decided to check out early at 3 - 4am. 

When my husband tried to inform the manager on duty, Leilani Vasquez of our horrible stay she was as lackluster and inadequate of a person as the rest of the front desk staff. The entire time she did once take accountability of their terrible staff, but tried to make it our fault to cover their asses. She kept insisting we file an incident report of the bed bugs which only happened a few hours prior to when we checked out. And that we call house keeping. For what? more excuses and dirty sheets with cum stains on them? No thanks! Instead of trying to understand our situation and apologetic, she was rude (no proper training in hotel etiquette). The best she could do was remove the $20 early checkin fee which shouldn't be charged in the first place.

I called and filed a complaint with guest services and the general manager about our stay there and the terrible manager, Leilani Vasques. That didn't do anything. The guest service that recorded the complaint was also rude and lacked hotel etiquette, also placed blame on us. She reminded us that it is a huge hotel and it was a busy weekend, so house keeping service normally takes them longer. I told her again that this was not our first stay at a Las Vegas hotel! We stayed at a more classier, more expensive and much bigger busier hotel. The difference is that the bigger hotels on the strip actually give two shits about the people who stay there. They are fully train to deal with any situation. If she thinks the Rio is the largest hotel and the busiest as an excuse for the staffs incompetence, she is high as a kite. I've worked in a 5 star hotel for 4 years before. I know a lot about hotel etiquette. As far as the general manager goes, William Leslie was only able to comp $44.80 off our bill from the extra dog charge. He stated that the website listed a $75 daily charge for pet stay fee. SO WHERE DID THE $85 DAILY CHARGE COME FROM?! FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! They taxes on bs hidden charges for sure. The general manager said that was the best he could do. I filed a incident report, awaiting outcome.
Theee best $27 we spent for a hotel suite through Hotel Tonight APP. Sister in law paid only $17 for completing a survey.

Very nice staff, but the rooms are run down. Old, worn out looking furniture and ripped, raveling industrial carpeting in the room. A large piece of duct tape held the carpet down between the bedroom and the dressing area. I do have to say, though, the bed was extremely comfortable. 

If you stay in their luxury tower, be warned there's a train yard behind you. You will hear trains all day and night whenever you're in your room. If luxury is your thing, The Rio is not the place for you. 

The pool area is beautiful. Four pools; three with waterfalls and one lap pool.  There are plenty of lounge chairs and a nice clean changing area and bathroom. The pool area is a pleasantly landscaped area, as well.  

If you get a bargain deal on room rates, this is an acceptable place to stay. If they're not giving you a deal, don't stay here. There are so many options in Vegas, you don't need to pay full price for a run down room.

We got comped a suite for 3 nights while at the Rio. The rooms were average, but had a nice view. Very clean and the staff is great. 3 stars because we got back into the room at night ready to shower and go to bed, only to find the water wasn't working. Front desk said the water won't be on til morning. Highly disappointed and aggravated.

Not bad for free.  We spent two free nights in a dull, outdated room that overlooked the Mirage side of the strip.  There were no bed spreads, but I preferred that actually given the unseen fluids that permeate most hotel linens.  The room had one really weird aspect--there was a window which allowed you to see directly into the bathroom from the bedroom.  Why was that there?  Although not walking distance to the strip, the hotel provides a free shuttle to the strip.  I would have been really pissed if I had paid for this room, but for free, it was okay.

I struggled between 3 and 4 stars on this one. It got 4 because the rooms are amazing for the price. The room was clean and huge. We got a smokin deal on it.

The thing I hate about this place is the smoke in the casino. It seems that the newer hotels have a better venthilation system, because it normally doesn't bother me. I actually went up to the room early because the smoke was soooo  bad.

My friends and I stayed at ario for a day. We went out at night to have fun, by the time we were back all our valuables from the rooms were take. We ran to the manager and security to report this, no one cared and handed us just a file to report. No one even said sorry. The security was so rude. This hotel dosent care about their guests and you will come back crying from this hotel.
It was fine, but way overpriced for what you're actually getting. I think calling themselves a four-star hotel is misleading.

It was ok. I wish they had better ventilation, but whatever. We had a group who stayed with them for a week, and we were only provided feather pillows. I called down a couple of times to get non feather pillows as I have a sensitivity to them. Never got them.

**WARNING: BED BUGS.  BEG BUGS. WATCH OUT. FILTHY COVERS.**
I found a great deal online with Rio Hotel and Casino. I stayed there for two nights. The Hotel room was very roomy, although some of the stuff seems a little bit old. The customer service was decent. And also, the pool was very nice. There are three pools and two Jacuzzis. Compared to other hotels, Rio Hotel and Casino doesn't have much to offer besides a few things. I believe it's because it's one of the older hotels that's why it's different from the other ones near the strip. 

Overall, It was a great hotel but there is one big deal breaker during my stay at the Rio hotel. BED-F*CKING-BUGS. When I got home from the trip, there were bed bug bites all over my body. And it was very irritating, I could not sleep the night after my stay. I felt so disgusting. I don't think they ever change their covers so watch out.

I would post pictures after all the bug bites I got from sleeping at Rio, but it's so disgusting. Although the swelling did go down the next day, it was still hell dealing with that sh*t. I had rashes all over my shoulders, my arms, my legs, and especially my thighs. Never would I ever stay there again, their bed is f*cking disgusting and I hope no one else has to go through all that bed bug bites that I went through. 

P.S 
I've read other reviews on Yelp and turns out other people experienced this as well. 
I would have rated it better but those bed bug bites ruined everything.

I enjoyed my stay at the Rio got a great deal through Groupon and recieved $25 food Credit along with free drink vouchers since it was my first stay with them. Location isn't far from the strip they provide free shuttles till 1am but left is about 5$-7$ which is not bad.

Valet parking is FREE. We stayed in the masquerade tower and had a strip view which I really enjoyed. Also the pools are awesome they have a children's section pool and the adult pool sectioned off with DJ and alcohol :) 
I probably would stay at the rio again && I recommended it!

WE FOUND A USED NEEDLE IN OUR ROOM....

On August 20th, my family and I drove to Las Vegas for a short trip before my kids went back to school. We decided to stay at the Rio Hotel resort and Casino. While we were there, we had a great time. The pool was nice, the concierge was very professional and the Voodoo Zip-lining was amazing. 

As our trip was drawing to a near end, the last day we were there, we discussed extending our trip and staying the weekend. As we browsed the internet to check availability, my three year old daughter walks up to me and hands me an exposed needle. I quickly but carefully take the needle from her hand and ask if she was hurt by it and she reluctantly said no. I then proceeded to secure the item and checked my kids for any bruising or traces of blood. I ask my daughter where she got the needle and she told me it was in the couch. I couldn't believe a needle was in the crevasses of the couch in which my kids were playing on and jumping on. Keep in mind, we had already been staying there a few days and I thought to myself and said, "If they missed a needle, what else could they have missed". I began to search the rest of the room for anything else out of the ordinary.

I was infuriated and called the front desk to speak with a manager. I spoke with a manager and her name was Rosana. I explained to her what happened and expressed how upset we were with how irresponsible the cleaning staff was to miss something as dangerous as a needle. The manager apologized for the incident and we had to make a report of the incident however everyone involved acted like it wasn't a big deal. The supervisor that came to our room picked up the needle and walked out with it, no plastic baggie, nothing. Then another guy came to our room to collect the needle and we said it had already been taken care of. Then he came back a while later because he needed a report. It seemed that no one knew the proper procedures to take place for an incident like this and took about another hour and a half of our time while we were trying to leave. Considering the risk and that this is a safety issue and what could have happened, I would have thought they would try to be more apologetic or at least try to offer some type of compensation to try to earn my business back. 

It made me sick to my stomach to think that my kids could have been hurt or killed by this exposed needle. We don't know whose needle that was or what they did with it before it arrived as our roommate. We have decided to never stay at the Rio or any of its affiliates. Not to mention the large collection of dust and debris on top the TV stand and on the carpet that looked like it wasn't cleaned for an exceptionally long time, and no one acted like this needle thing was a big deal. 

Overall, Rio will never have my business and will never be a place my family and I will stay. I can say that our experience at the Rio will scar our memories as well as give us another reason not to go to Las Vegas for a vacation.

So far,  meh. The check-in process is terrible as the line keeps piling up with guests and there are only three clerks at the counter. While two clerks who seemed available,  went to a back room and another keeps walking back and forth to the same two computers. Maybe she's trying to look busy? Everyone in line looks peeved and I'm keeping my fingers and toes crossed that the rooms are well worth the wait. :(

Be careful if someone tries to sell you a package and says free nights with tickets etc...it's not all that, not at all.
A rep of this place sold me a package but of course what he guranteed didn't actually happen.
Shocking, (it's actually not, rather fraudulent on the hotel's part) and when this happens, how do you expect myself to trust you again? 
Why should I stay at your resort when you have your own associates lying to customers? You do know this only hurts your business, but of course youre vegas right so you don't care.
Don't you think with so much competition, this only makes it easier to choose another place? 
I only stayed here since I bought the "package, sorry lack there of" beforehand. The package was supposed to be a better deal, but wasnt. It would have been cheaper had i made the reservation elsewhere. That's why this is ridiculous, I bought it straight from an associate. Don't you want to raise your stars, better your image and brand? Well you defintely lost with me.

This property is in need of an overhaul.  Everything a bit frayed.  At a bargain basement hotel the wifi and room coffee are free.  Not here, it's $9.00 if you want to make a cup of coffee in the room.  Also part of the blackout curtain was not hooked up to the rod so I called guest services and housekeeping and no one answered. Called front desk, the person says they would call someone and get back to me.  Of course that is the last I heard from them.  So we were up with the sun. Our last stay at the Rio.

Buffet is extremely disorganized! Waited in line forever, then a little longer since we're loyal Total Rewards members and had a voucher. Really Rio? Penalizing customers who frequent your business in favor of those paying cash?? I won't be back.
Meh.. the hotel is pretty worn down, but the rooms are spacious. This is not a great hotel but it's about what you would expect for the location and price.

Came here twice by myself. Both times I got a free upgrade, the first being an upgrade to a higher-level suite, the second being an upgrade with a better view. 

I really like this hotel because it is away from the Strip which gives you a little more privacy. The great thing is that because it is not on the Strip, it is typically cheaper! 

No complaints with the room or housekeeping. Everyone I spoke to, the casino tellers, waiters, concierge, front desk, and housekeepers were polite and very nice-- though that could also be because I looked like I was 15 years old...darn my height!!

However, I would say, as caution to the single female travelers, if a guy says hi to you, don't say hi back (unless you are looking for some fun...what goes on in Vegas, stays in Vegas, I suppose)! I was walking back to my room and a mid-20s guy greets me as I walk past him. I reply hi back, and then he says, "Wait", walks back to me, and says, "Hey, so what are you doing tonight? If you are free, do you want to go back to my room and hook up, or I can treat you at the bar for drinks?"

I had the heart of a saint because I initially said no, but when I saw his crestfallen face, I decided to give him an ego boost and said, "Maybe, what room are you in? Okay, if I am interested, I'll stop by."

See ladies? I am so nice...and then I promptly went back to my room and went to bed. 

But that said, yes, will definitely come back to Rio with a stern look on my face to ward young men off as I pass by them.

I've eaten at the buffet here before many years ago, but never stayed here. In July, I booked 2 rooms 1 room with a King Bed and 1 room with 2 Queen Beds for our stay in September. When I went to check-in, the lady at reception said that I had 2 rooms with a King bed (uh, that's not right.) I showed her my receipts and said one of them was for 2 Queens. She asked if it were okay to switch that room to a 1 King instead, but we would get one of the renovated King Luxury Suites. 

She said one of the rooms was ready and gave us the key, but the second room was not and we should come back to the Key\/Mail line which would be shorter. Long story short, we came back at the time she told us and the room was STILL not ready. We finally got our keys at the end. 

I have to admit, our room was BIG and  roomy with desk, couch, coffee table. The bathroom even had a stool and vanity. The "new design" was "groovy". LOL. The room itself was not really my style. They didn't upgrade everything, mostly just the carpet, bedding and art. There was a tiny fridge underneath the T.V., but there was no coffee machine nor microwave. 

They didn't have a lot of good food choices inside the Rio. We ate at the buffet the first day and it was terrible. Not like how I remembered at all. The dim sum restaurant across from it would have been a better option. Oh well. 

The Rio also offers shuttle service to Bally's and Harrah's. We took the shuttle once to walk around the strip. 

The front desk informed us that we could go to Starbucks and were allowed $9.00 per person daily. We should just charge it back to our room and it would be no cost to us. Well, when we checked out 2 days later, I saw the Starbucks charges on my bill. We called the front desk and asked about it and they said that it was not included. *sigh!* I think they meant it for the OTHER room we book for my sister-in-law. 

Overall, just an okay stay. Not my favorite hotel in Las Vegas.

103\/100 Reviews for 2016

Large room, ok bed, worn out sofa.  Lousy shower.I booked the room because it was a good price and Expedia rated it as ****. Not four star hotel. The food at the hotel was lousy, won't return to the Rio

I stayed at the Rio for the first time on July 17. The rooms were very spacious and they also have a huge gaming area. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Rio and I would most certainly stay at this resort in the future.

I have been a platinum member since just a few months after I turned 21. I spend A LOT of money at this hotel and being a lot of guests here. I have always been very happy with my service. Until this last weekend. I had 5 additional rooms, as well as my Masquerade Suite, booked for my birthday. I spent the entirety of my Saturday at the VIP check in and on the phone trying to figure out these random charges they were charging my account. Apparently a $6 beer out of their refrigerator constitutes $200 being charged to your account "just in case." I was finally told that after speaking to SIX "managers" and "VIP hosts." I emailed my concerns to my personal VIP host on Saturday and she has still yet to get back to me. I will never stay there again. At check out another $224 was mistakenly charged to my account "because someone pressed a wrong button." It was taken care of until I got back to San Diego where they decided to charge it to me again. One guest was just charged $442, another $111. I was appalled and embarrassed at how my guests saw me treated and how they were treated as well. Every time I was in a platinum line or a VIP check in\/check out I was questioned. I understand I am young, but I am clearly old enough to spend my money there. This place has a bull shit staff that refuses to assist anyone on anything. My "upgraded 1600 sq ft suite" was disgusting. (Although Rose at the VIP check in didn't believe I would have been staying in that one and had to double check the room number.) the shower door didn't shut, the couch was stained, wall paper was peeling off of the wall, etc. I go to vegas at least once a month and the Rio will never receive my service again.

We stayed 7\/16\/17 - 7\/19\/17 (3 nights)

Room was very clean, bathroom was very clean. Premium Suite room (floor 36 in the Masquerade Tower) looked exactly like the pictures on the Rio hotel's website. The bed was VERY comfortable, sheets were clean and crisp. Nice view of the strip from Ceasers, to the south. Windows had a heat\/light shielding inside the glass to help keep the bright light and heat out. Air conditioning kept the room very cool. Toilet had a pressurized tank, flushed hard and fast. Shower had an adjustable shower head with a nice massage setting, and taking a LONG shower the water stayed hot the entire time. Hotel was full, but we couldn't hear ANYTHING from the rooms surrounding ours. 

My only complaint: elevators. In the parking garage, only one elevator was running and even though there were only 4 floors in the Masquerade parking garage - it took FOREVER for the elevator to stop on a floor. Every single time. In the hotel, 6 elevators went from casino level to floors 2 thru 22. 6 other elevators served floors 23 through 51. Typically, we had to wait 5 minutes for an elevator (both on our floor 36, and on the Casino level).

Great room at a GREAT price ($139. Per night plus "resort fee" and taxes). Would definitely stay here again!!

I've been to the Rio before but never stayed there until now. I have to say it looks like they've improved it.  It's pretty good It has such a party atmosphere and is a really great place to stay if you want to avoid being on the strip.

The rooms were pretty clean, I mean they're nothing like other rooms, but they have great deals, especially on suites. 

Their suites are pretty big so they're nice if you are staying with a lot of people or you want to hang out in your hotel room before going out.

The pools are really awesome and the waitresses are super nice! 

It is also a pretty easy hotel to get around.

Unfortunately, I did not like their bars or restaurants too much. I wish they'd bring some better places in.

It wasn't as smokey as some of the other hotels.

There are better hotels in Vegas for sure but I'd stay here again if the price was right.

What a difference 10 years makes!  Back in the days...mid to late 90's our crew use to love this joint.  Cause back then, this was one of those hidden gems that was popular, but not crazy popular.  

Went on a small family outting back in Dec.07.  Wow...times have changed.  The hotel is showing is age.  The "PRETTY" cocktail waitress' must have all moved on to bigger and better things.  Because in the MARDI GRAS AREA, they've replaced them with "Chippendale'  guys....no offense, but I'm use to a getting a cocktail from the pretty ladies.....

Food is avg.  Buffet is avg.  Casino is Avg.  The crowd has even changed....no more hip young 20-30 somethings....heck, i dont even know how to describe the patrons....

Only 3 stars for the following reasons:

1.  $75 per nite.  Even Paris Hilton would say:  "thats hot!"
2.  Lounge Bar in the Middle of the Joint is "UBER" cool....This may be the hotel's only saving grace.
3.  $1000 Video Poker Jackpot Won at 2AM, where nobody was even around.   Pretty fucking sweet if you ask me.....

Absolutely no good! Richard Tenhet a manager at Rio is very unprofessional on handling situation. He needs more training on handling customer service. I can't believe Rio hires a person like Richard Tenhet who was not able to calm himself down in front of the guest. No smiles on his face and no suggestions on how things can be better. Because of that I will never ever recommend Rio to my friends and family. Worst experience service I ever had.

Ok so I checked out today and I must say this place is far more than I bargained for. Based of some of the reviews here I was very skeptical about this hotel. However low n behold  I was pleasantly surprised ;+) This hotel was very nice for the price$$ It was hassle free parking.  I almost felt it was to gud to be true especially having experienced driving around several times while staying on the strip hunting for parking. As far as the room 1747. Our view was nice. Especially at night with the lights off n our room. And the room SIZE itself was larger then all the standard hotel rooms I've stayed n thus far. The beds was comfy. All I can say is alot of the reviews here on Yelp clearly down play this hotel.  I feel if one has Dom Perignon taste with Kool Aid money $ave urself the time n book at Belligio$ or Ceaser$ Palace. Other than that if ur not caught up on being directly on the strip then the Rio is a win win. So over all this hotel is now one of my top 3 hotels. If not my #1 choice. However it also depends on what ur situation is too. If u want strip life etc w\/relaxing sun bathing then Ballys or Plant Hollywood.  If u want strip life with a fun,friendly pool for adults n kids then Flamingo. And if u want a happy medium nice hugh clean affordable rooms but with in minutes of the strip Rio is the place 2b. 

Pros:
hassle free parking
comfy clean beds
clean room
wifi
LARGER than norm standard rooms
location (if u want off the strip\/but close to the strip)
affordable ;+) 
refrigerator incl.

Cons:
POOL HOURS  6am or 9am-6pm ;+(
Bcuz of the pool hours is why this hotel didn't get a 5 out of 5 stars from me. After we checked n and grabbed a bite to eat the pool was closed. However the signed posted read pool hours 6am-6pm. So before we checked out we got up early to get a 7am swim n the pool hours was changed to 9am-6pm. Being that the pool is a must for my fam n I we was very disappointed ;+(

Stay away from this place like the PLAGUE. I took my girlfriend to Vegas for her birthday in early May 2015. I spent somewhere around $250 per night (it was the week of the Mayweather Pacquio fight so everything was packed and expensive). The room was spacious and clean- but a tad outdated- we had no problem with our accomodations- what we had a problem with was ILLNESS. Our first couple nights in Vegas were okay. On the second night we decided to eat in the Hotel Cafe. The food was overpriced and of very low quality. My burger looked like something out of one of those microwave dinners, and it was cold. My girlfriend's steak was rubbery and tasted like cheap meat (i work in a meat department for a living, i should know.) This wasn't the bust of our trip, though. 

The bust was when we decided to give the Rio's Buffet a chance on our last night there. We ate around 8PM. We left the buffet sometime around 9PM. We went back to our room to get ready to go clubbing and i started feeling queasy. Within the next hour i was lying down on the bathroom floor, hugging the toilet, vomiting uncontrollably, wondering when this hell would stop. It ended up not stopping all night. My girlfriend stayed up with me, feeding me ice chips to keep me hydrated because if i put anything into my stomach too fast it would send everything back out. By 1AM we realized that our night wasn't going to turn around so we called the Hotel Lobby to file a claim- i had either been poisoned by food poisoning, or the cooks of the buffet had cross-contaminated the dishes with shellfish (i am deathly intolerant to shellfish and i've experienced a similar experience when accidentally eating crab in the past.) A hotel security\/medic came to our room to assess the situation. He witnessed roughly an hour of this torture i endured. He sympathized for me, and begged my apology that the hotel lobby wouldn't let him bring me more than one tiny water bottle. I was the most sick that i had ever been in my life; after paying 750 for three nights, they couldn't sacrifice more than 12 ounces of water.

The guy left after writing the report, and i stayed up all night, moaning and groaning on the floor like Ripley from Alien, waiting for some extraterrestrial to pop out of my stomach... Seriously, it probably wouldn't have hurt any worse than my stomach felt those 12ish hours. The vomiting turned into diarrhea around 8 in the morning and we were able to check out of the hotel. I was told that i would be contacted by the Rio's claims department within two weeks. I wasn't. I kept calling the number i found online and getting the run around from everyone in that company. I finally got a call back sometime around August, or maybe September- saying that the claim had been processed and I'd recieve something in the mail.

You know what i got? Nothing. They told me there wasn't sufficient evidence to prove that the hotel made me sick. No apology. No X% of your next stay, no reimbursment for our last $250 night that was wasted with my face buried in a porcelain bowl... Absolutely zero.

I wish i had remembered to review the Rio much earlier. I would hate for anyone to have to experience the service that we received. Being 23, and having a LOT of friends that party and spend time in Vegas- i will be sure to make sure none of them EVER spend a dime at this resort.

That night, and the 5 hour drive back to San Diego, stopping a dozen times an hour to poo water- i will NEVER forget my experience here!

Don't stay here. Worst room service ever... Poor customer service. 

Since most hotels were all booked so all we had left was to stay here for two nights. Our rooms were NOT cleaned by the staff. They only clean when you call and request for it. Ordering food to our rooms, took almost 3 days for them to clean up all the plates sitting in front of my room like a stack of garbage. Disgusting. Seems like it wasn't just our room that had this lack of professional service! 

Checked out after two nights. Checked in at Bellagio feeling happy :)

I purchased Groupon deal for 3 night stay and they claimed I was going to get classic 2 bed room, when I got there I was very disappointed and dissatisfied. I will never stay there again. The place is so old and worn out, had stained carpet and couch, the sink was making drums sounds when the water was on. I purchased the deal based on the pictures they posted onlone. It was not even close. Everything was worn out and old. The had paper clip holding the side curtain of the bed.

I have always liked staying at the RIO.  The casino is great.  There are plenty of nightclubs at the Rio, so you don't need to leave.  The buffets are awesome.  The pool area is great!  There is a shuttle that runs back and forth from the strip.  I've been coming here since college and I don't think the rooms have ever been updated.  The rooms are always clean and big since its a all suite hotel.  I would give this place 4 stars, but I think the Rio is in dire need of a update to compete with all the other hotels on the strip.

We came here to play roulette and had a great time. Donny was awesome. I loved that the cocktail waiter came by many times!  I rarely find this in any casino these days. This place is very trendy and fun.

Overall, it is middle of the road for me. I brought my dog with me on a long road-trip with stop-overs in Vegas and there is only a handful of hotels that allow dogs. I actually would give 3 1\/2 stars but appears to be no half measures with Yelp. Sooo...

What I liked: Allows dogs. They allow them and allow us to be up farther than the 1st floor. Not much farther to the 4th but my room actually looked out  over the road and I could see the strip. They give amenities like bowls and a bag full of treats upon check in which is nice. Also on several occasions, staff offered me more individual treats when out walking him.

I didn't eat there except for BK so I can't review food. 

Did not like: As with all casinos, the smoke is overwhelming. And that reminds me, my pet-safe room was supposed to be non-smoking but someone must have been smoking in there for a while because the lingering smoky smell was powerful. Don't get in the way of Grannies and walkers because they will run your butt over. That said, it didn't appear to be any older than any other casino.

Myeh: Penn and Teller show is there. Nice theater with a good view of the stage but up in the mezz. section, you couldn't really see what was going on in the up close tricks and they don't project anything on screens so much is lost.

Liked: It appears that they are really chasing the younger crowd because there were lots of dancer tables with young women dancing, with a big set area by the masquerade tower. While I didn'to to Vegas for looking at that, my impression was that they were changing to keep it current but I'm not positive as I rarely go to Vegas (3rd time in my life). It had a good energy to it all

Myeh: location wasn't terrible but wasn't good if you're comparing it to the Strip. You're a free shuttle ride away to a central location so driving the strip at night is not necessary. Physically, you're approx 1\/2 mile or so so walking is an option. They don't allow dogs on the shuttle unless they are work dogs so leave the pooch at the hotel. Reviewing location is difficult but to me, this was better than Circus Circus because to walk the strip at night over a mile to get to the Bellagio to see the show is just nuts. 

Liked: The rates and room was great . Dogs get charged an extra $50 so for $94 and $80, I got a (seemingly) monstrous sized room of 600+ sqf. Bathroom is seperate (imagine a big room with a wall placed 2\/3 in the middle) but has a small window looking into the shower from the bedroom. Leading to the bathroom is an extra sink with fridge and closet with a safe. My cold water handle was leaking and there was no security latch on the room as it was broken but I forgot to mention this. Overall seemed clean.

Liked: back to dogs. The doggie relief area is actual grass out in front of the hotel. Other areas to walk are around present with bushes, trees and dirt. Compared to Imperial Palace and other Strip located dog friendly hotels, this place was a virtual oasis for the dog. I understand that space for parking is a premium and so on but if you put a pet-friendly hotel out there (Imperial Palace \/Harrahs) don't use fake grass and never clean it. No one likes it especially the dogs. Oh, and the room location to the dog area is good at Rio. Not so with the other places mentioned before.

That's enough. Eliminate smell of smoke better, and this place would be given more stars. The staff was friendly and helpful. Total rewards staff was great so use it...I would stay here again absolutely.

Sorry, I've never written this bad of a review but this was not a particularly great experience. Long and slow checkin line. Poor customer service. Difficult to get answers to basic questions. Room service didn't answer my call then was conveniently closed. 
I had an urgent situation and couldn't get anyone on the phone to help me. I kept being told to leave a message. 

I'm now trying to resolve a billing issue (was billed incorrectly). I tried to call and was redirected to another separate phone number to call. I called and was disconnected. 

I say roll the dice if you get an amazing rate. It's off the strip and probably not worth the savings.

We got in around 11:30 on a Thursday night. The World Series of Poker was being held here so it was understandably crowded, but the line to check in was over an hour long. Mainly because only two people were working the desk. When we finally got to our room it reeked of vomit and cleaning products. There was no bedding, the bathroom countertops were filthy and the floors were still wet and stained from trying to remove vomit. We called the front desk right away, and they said they would send a bellman up to check things out. 45 minutes later my boyfriend had to go to the front desk and get new keys for another room.

The second room was clean but smelled like a wood burning fireplace. We called the front desk again, and they said several people had complained and it was due to cleaning out some grills but would go away. Two days later my throat was on fire, my boyfriend and I were both stopped up and with the A\/C on 60 were melting at night. 

That was just the problems with the rooms...restaurants and casino were also outdated and gross.

Will NEVER stay here again!!

I've never experienced such lack of follow through and chaos at a hotel in Vegas until staying at the Rio. And, on a slow week mind you. Travel to Vegas, lived there...spent several thousands over the years in room bookings. Always superior and prompt service elsewhere. Rio...unfortunately not. Casino floor odors, faulty elevators and out of service escalators, wrong room check-in twice, overflowing room toilet, no hot water in shower, melted plastic in sockets, excessive waiting for bell hops, hour upon hour phone hold times for management resolution, final room transfer took hours not minutes, combative "front desk" staff (by phone), the list goes on. In the end...upgraded to a double size suite, but all I was refunded and\/or comped was a $20 room service credit (I didn't use) and resort fees. I lost three paid work appointments due to issues at this hotel caused directly by their hotel and staff. I'm easy to please and this was an awful experience from start to finish.

Definitely not as bad as some of the people here are making it out to be but this hotel does have its share of problems. I'll start out with the positives first. The rooms were clean and spacious although when the Groupon deal said I would be getting a classic two queen bed suite I assumed it would come with a kitchenette and bar area which it did not. The rooms were really just slightly bigger versions of a standard two queen bedroom with a couch. However everything mostly was clean and well kept. The sheets were comfy and easy to fall asleep into and the bathroom sink was made with marble. There were two sinks one in the bathroom and one in the suite area which definitely made things more efficient. We also had drawers and plenty of closet space which was convenient. All of the staff was friendly and courteous and I never had any problems with them. Also, if you book the hotel through Groupon the $20 dine-in credit can be used at most restaurants in the hotel. And Wi-Fi at the hotel was surprisingly fast. It seems that you have to pay the "Resort Fee" if you want access to things like the Wi-Fi and gym but that was already stipulated in my Groupon so I didn't mind.

As for the negatives, there are definitely quite a few. Firstly, calling the front desk for help can be a pain in the ass. I don't know if it's because they are short-staffed or what but I tried calling more than once with a question and was put on indefinite hold multiple times while waiting for someone to answer. Secondly, our shower head was old and rusty which isn't something you want to see when you're about to take a shower. Third problem is the atrocious state of the hotel's jacuzzis. It honestly is no surprise that there was an outbreak of Legionnaire's disease here a few months ago given the poor status of the jacuzzis. When we went there were 5 jacuzzis but each and every one of them had a problem. One was completely broken, another did not have hot water, and two had no functional spa jets. The fifth jacuzzi was completely functional but once I stepped in I noticed what appeared to be vomit floating in the water and immediately stepped out. I informed the life guard of what was happening and he apologized but didn't offer to remedy the situation. For the price I was paying for my suite you'd think they would do something to address the situation. 

Fourth and worst aspect of this hotel is that it's not on the strip. Although you can see the strip from your room it's a 30 minute walk there and definitely not recommended in the summer heat. Also, although they have a free shuttle you can sign up for it only goes to Harrah's. Therefore we just decided to use Uber instead which was much more convenient. But I definitely wish I stayed on the strip so I could've walked to most places instead of having to take transportation every time. All in all the hotel is okay if you're getting a good deal from the Groupon and you're on a budget but when I go back I'll definitely stay at another location that's closer to the strip even if I have to pay more money.

My Husbands review (Ian S.) Pretty much details our account in full. It was bad. 

The only reason this place gets 3 stars is due to the nice size rooms, the view and the staff in the restaurants there. The hotel staff were very unknowledgable and rude, check-in for my party and our friends was an absolute disaster. 

Our friend was downstairs at 2am (mind you he got in at 11pm) with the concierge trying to fix his reservation which was no fault of his own.

Best part? I called the concierge's desk during my stay and received voice mail, and left them a message and they never called me back. 

Bottom line you get what you pay for: I would not stay here again, ever.

Lo Siento Rio, but you made me kind of sad and I did not even have to pay for you!

First, I did not think our room was super clean when we arrrived, Our shower soap holder thing had a gaping jagged hole in the bottom that looked kind of dangerous. The shower curtain bar is not attached to the wall and falls down if you pull the curtain too hard. Ooops... 

The pool is really nice, but why are all the pools not heated? The one next to the ultra expensive cabanas should most definitely be the most toasty of them all since we were paying extra for our luxury style ovens to watch the World Cup game in.
