Came here for a weekend getaway and left a happy customer! Ok, let's just say it... this hotel is a little older, not on the strip, and could use some tender lovin' care. BUT, if you can get a GOOD deal, I would definitely recommend staying at this place!

I scored a great deal and was thoroughly impressed with the whole stay. I arrived at 11am, well before the checkin time, and the front desk lady let me check in early and helped pick out an available room. The room was actually pretty impressive, it was big and had a great view of The Strip. It was a standard quality room,  but certainly didn't disappoint.

The hotel has a casino floor (standard, nothing too extravagant), restaurants and buffets, a pool (ehh, could be better), and a shuttle that runs every 30 mins to take you to the strip. The shuttle was actually one of the best parts about the hotel. I mean you're paying 1\/3 of the cost of other hotels and within 5 mins can be right in the action on the strip!

Overall great experience and I would come back!

I hate it. So far my stay has been horrible. There is a lack of communication between the staff and guests. There is a lack of information for the guests and lack of care from employees. I will never in my life come back to the Rio. Pick a different hotel, trust me. Unless you like being disappointed in which case the Rio is for you. Ghost town, not enough servers and overall did not like the way I was treated. The Rio sucks.

We booked our room through Priceline and, as our trip grew closer and we read the yelp reviews, I began to panic. Reports of dirty rooms, poor customer service, poor plumbing and shoddy service had me wondering if we'd made the right choice. Below are the good and bad that led to our 3 star review:

Good: (4 stars from me)
1- Spacious room. I was thrilled with the size of the room and the fact that we had a sofa. I wouldn't really call the room a "suite" but it was three times the size of the Hampton Inn room that we'd stayed in at the beginning of our trip.
2- Clean room. The sheets were fresh and the towels were bright white. Yes, it was a little shabby and showed it's age, but the digs were clean, including the shower, which functioned perfectly.
3- Friendly, attentive staff- Requests for extra towels and pillows were responded to quickly and with a smile.
4- Two sinks- one in with the toilet\/shower and a second in the vanity\/dressing area. This is great when traveling with a group of 4- we were able to shower\/get dressed\/primp in tandem.
5- The Indian restaurant- the buffet was very reasonably priced at $15 and we were able to take the food to go. My son even went back for more naan and it was provided at no charge.
6- Pool area- this was good for the family and we were easily able to get chaises within sight of the pool we were using.
7. "Free" wifi for two computers in the room (see #5 below for the downside.)

Bad: (deduction of one star)
1- The bed- it was very firm, which can be a good thing, but after three nights, my back was killing me. This is, of course, a personal preference thing, but it was enough of an issue, combined with those below, to warrant a star deduction.
2- Drink Prices at the pool- For one beer and two small bottles of water, we paid $15. Larger bottles of water in the gift shop were $3 each (which was comparable to what we found on the strip) so the cost of pool-side drinks seemed disproportionately high. Obviously, after that round, we learned to bring our own water bottles with us, but that's the only "outside food or beverage" they allow, so if you want a beer, be prepared to pay the price at the pool!
3- Carnival Buffet- There was a tremendous variety of food, but with the hefty price tag of $30 each was quite a reach for a family of 4. We went for brunch at 11am and much of the food was already dried out from sitting on the line.  It was NOT worth the price, and we would not do it again.
4- List of restaurants\/menu availability. We saw signs for the Hash House restaurant, but never actually came across it. Our room had a book\/guide with, what appeared to be, a room service menu and the list of restaurants, but it provided neither menus for those restaurants nor directions\/location for us to go find them. We were all over that hotel during our three day stay and I cannot tell you where the Hash House restaurant is located. I don't recall seeing it. Our breakfast options were the pricey buffet or deep fried Burger King (blech.) If you're not big breakfast people, stop at a convenience store and pick up cereal\/milk and save your money for lunch\/dinner at the restaurants.
5- "free" wifi for two computers in the room, which would re-set daily (so with 3 laptops, we would have rotated.) This is problematic in that if two laptops were connected on  one day, they automatically connected when they were opened the following day, leaving the third out cold.

Neutral:
1.  I liked that the hotel was away from the strip and was happy to pay the small cab fare to get there. That being said, if you want to be able to go back and forth during the day, it can get pricey. They DO have a shuttle that can be caught at Bally's but we were only able to catch it once, of the three times we tried.
2. Price- Through Priceline, we paid $65\/night and then upon checkin we had to pay an additional $28\/night "hotel fee." That fee seems high, but at $100\/night, the price is still reasonable.

I wanted to give this 3.5 stars, but had to settle for 4. 

First, the bads. The lighting in the rooms is pretty rough. I'm all for energy efficiency, but I hate these d@mn fluorescent bulbs. A lot. Every lamp was equipped with them, and it really made the room feel like a convenience store. Also, the bathrooms had this odd window from the shower to the bedroom. Anytime my suite-mates turned on the bathroom light at night, it shined (shone?) right into the eyes of people trying to sleep. But who sleeps in Vegas?

Next, the Seafood buffet was given a resounding thumbs-down by my parents. I didn't eat it, so I can't speak for myself.

Finally, housekeeping was a little slow, and room service wanted to charge us $3 a champagne flute (sans sparkling wine). I guess I get it, what with it being New Year's Eve and all, but come on. 

The goods. Yes, there were plenty of goods to be had, which is why this got a 4 star review instead of a 3. 

First, the rooms are very spacious, with a sectional sofa and beds and a large bathroom with a sink in and out of the tub area. Very cool. Large closet. Comfy linens. 

Next, the cocktail servers were all very friendly and very prompt. Getting free drinks at the slot machines is a Las Vegas must, and if you develop a friendly relationship with these ladies and gents, they won't disappoint. 

There is a free shuttle that runs from the Rio to either Harrah's or Ballys, so getting to the strip is very easy. The longest I had to wait for a shuttle was 10 minutes. Not a bad way to get around, and very cost efficient.

Finally, the Rio Show in the Sky. Really, really cool. It starts late at night and hits every hour, on the hour. The singers are great, the dancing is good, and then they all go around in these floating Mardi Gras floats and toss beads to the crowd. Everyone in the casino gets really into it, and though I was supremely skeptical, I found myself shouting at the swan-pulled chariot for some "Harrah's Reward's Zone" blue shiny beads.

Vegas, baby.

Intentional deception.  Saying rooms are non-smoking when it actually is.  Saying there are no available rooms when there actually are.

Booked two non smoking rooms and was told both rooms we got are non-smoking. Other room stunk of smoke and was assured 32nd floor is non-smoking. When we got to our rooms, I complained to someone at the front desk about the smoke smell and was assured (again) that the 32nd floor is non-smoking and that it is a non-smoking room.  They will have someone come up and clean the air.  We went to dinner so we thought the problem would go away when we came back.  After coming back, the room still stunk so I called front desk again but this time was told that the floor IS A SMOKING FLOOR and the room IS A SMOKING ROOM.

Now stuck trying to get a refund and at 12 am trying to secure other non smoking room.

** update ** called front desk again and was told they could not do anything because they are fully booked.  They said I could come down to the front desk and ask the manager for a possible refund.  I went down and the guy I talked to - not even a manager - said they had two available non-smoking rooms.  WTF!?!?!?!?!?!  I got the non-smoking room and helped my in-laws pack up their stuff and move rooms at 1am.  Really, RIO?????

** update 2 ** no free toothpaste if you forget to bring yours.  $3 for the small tube and $5 for the "a little bigger than small" tube.

I stayed at Rio for memorial day weekend 2017 and things could not have gone smoother. I think people should give credit when it's due when a group of people are working to serve you. When I first arrived my car was parked for me and a bellhop gathered mine and my gf's luggage and gave me a ticket to be delivered to my room later.  
Once inside we used the check in kiosk which is very easy to use, throughout my whole stay I never had to speak to anyone at the front desk. The machine gives you your keys and a receipt and that was it.  I stayed on the eighth floor of the Impanema Tower in a deluxe strip view two queen room.  The room was very clean, The maids did an excellent job of putting the room back together each day for us.  The room was also very spacious, about twice as big as Excalibur and Monte Carlo, comparable size to Tuscany suites. I had a great time and will definitely be back.  I don't trust a lot of the reviews on here and check it out for yourself, The customer service and service was perfect for me.

Ok.  Clean, but WAY off the strip.  They do have shuttles to take you back down to Paris\/Bally's & Harrah's, but I can't recommend the walking bit.  We did that the first night and the area doesn't look or feel safe to walk back to at night.  

Cabs are readily available ($10-20 from anywhere to or from on the strip back to the Rio).  The Rio seems 1970's old and outdated (can you say Circus\/Circus or Miami Vice?).   There was a REALLY strange window cut in the middle of the wall in our room that went from the shower into our main room.  So when my husband was in the shower in the morning and the light was on, it came right into the bedroom.  Bizarre!   Totally 1970's Miami Vice or something!  Decor is old and outdated.  The room was clean though.  Housekeeping did an okay job on the days they made it to the room (which was only 3 out of 5).  

Room service was great the one morning I ordered it.  Faster, better, hot and fresh - better than other hotels I've stayed at on the strip so I'll give them the thumbs up on that, but for $30 for breakfast for one I'd expect good food and good service. 

Otherwise, the food and the hotel was 2 star at best.  The casino itself was old, dark and dirty.  Smelled odd, smoky.   

The "I" bar in the main lobby was a joke.  The waitresses wore some kind of get ups where their boobs hung out the bottom of their criss-cross tops (lovely) and they wore thong bottoms with a shear skirt deal over this.  Periodically, they'd get up on a lighted pedestal and "dance."  Hilarious.  The only thing worse was the watered down drinks, pathetic circa 1970's MTV style videos on the bar TV monitors, terrible "musak" in the bar, and all the OLD people there -- oh yeah, and the old fat hookers.  The VooDoo lounge upstairs was even worse.  This is like the hotel where people go who can't go anywhere else.  Just awful.   

The thump, thump, thump from the music every night was a KILLER (very thin walls apparently) especially if you actually needed to get up in the morning.  I didn't sleep all week.   The bed was a back breaker and the pillows were TERRIBLE.   

The room was large, but I'd rather have a smaller room and a better bed, better pillows and LESS NOISE!!! 

Oh and the cherry on the sundae:  NO WIRELESS internet!  And you have to pay extra for internet in this old run-down trip back to the 1970's hotel!  Are you kidding.  So you have to go downstairs, get a cable to have internet and pay extra for it too?!   WTH?!   They must be kidding!!  

Won't say here again!

I really would give the Rio 3.5 stars. I like it here. I've stayed here probably 3 times since the 90s. It was nice then. When I stayed in the early 2000s it seemed degraded, but now the rooms seem nicer and upgraded. We had a suite for 4 guys and plenty of room. Great view of the strip from our suite.  Other hotels have flat panel TV's now. Our still had a big CRT. The couch was nice ... pretty new with a chaise on the end. The shower was interesting - there was a small square window from the shower into the room. Hung out at the pool for a couple of hours on Sunday and it was pretty nice. Large area, with a bar and restaurant. They have a cool-looking bowling alley across from the buffet called Lucky Lanes which i'd like to try out sometime. I like the Seafood Village buffet, but didn't try it this time. It gets crowded but worth the $30 if you like seafood.

I was never a big fan of the casino here since I always got my ass kicked here. Actually did okay this time, so i'll give it a thumbs up.

This hotel was awesome from the moment we arrived. Since it was our anniversary they upgraded us for free to a suite and it was amazing. The pool is really nice, even though the hotel is off the strip their are shuttles that take you to Harrahs, Ballys, and Paris until 1 am for free.  Cabs cost about 7 bucks to get you to the strip if its past 1 am. The only reasn they get a 4 out  of 5 is because the rio buffet had a really long line and it wasnt too great but they do have an awesome deal of spending $45 for all you can eat buffets all day long at Rio, paris, imperial palace, and 3 other hotels I cannot remember.

We booked the Rio because Vegas was unusually busy the weekend that we wanted to go and hotels on the Strip were unusually pricey.  After logging into my Total Rewards account online, I saw that the rate for Rio was quite low for Friday and Saturday and Sunday was free!  The rates on Expedia for the same rooms at Rio were noticeably higher and Sunday would not have been free.  So from a room rate perspective for a busy weekend in Vegas, we got a great deal on 3 nights for Rio by booking online through Total Rewards.

During check in, we were offered an upgrade to a recently remodeled room for $20 per night.  The agent recommended this as a very good deal.  The un-remodeled rooms were last remodeled almost 10 years ago vs. 4 months ago for the upgraded rooms.  We took the upgrade and the rooms were pleasantly furnished and carpeted.  The rooms are approximately 600 sq feet but it feels like a lot of wasted space because there's 1 small couch, and a cocktail table in the "living area".  There is no separation of a wall or anything between the "living area" and the sleeping area.  There was 1 older flat screen TV but it doesn't swivel easily between watching on the bed and watching from the couch.  (It didn't swivel at all actually, you have to turn the entire tv and the non-swivelable tv base toward the couch.)

The pool area is decent. The lounge chairs are older but not terrible.  The nice thing was that there were plenty of them because the Rio pools are not exactly a hip happening place.

The Carnival Buffet is solid and clean and we ate there as part of the 24 Hour Buffet of Buffets for breakfast and lunch.  Without the Buffet of Buffet passes, we wouldn't have eaten here though because the weekend prices were surprisingly quite high.

Unfortunately, of the 4 elevators servicing the Masquerade Tower, only 2 were operational during the entire 3 night stay!   Apparently 1 of the 4 elevators is meant to be a service elevator for the service and cleaning staff.  That was one of the elevators that was broken so we were sometimes sharing already cramped elevators with service staff.  In addition, the UP escalator from the casino floor to access the parking garage was non-operational during our entire stay as well.  There were no visible nearby stairs.  This wouldn't have been so bad but they blocked off access so you could not walk up the escalator on your own either.  This was very annoying!  You then had to backtrack to a nearby elevator that just runs between the 1st and 2nd floor. On Monday morning, there were finally 2 service technicians working to repair the escalator.  It does suck that Rio didn't care enough to fix the elevator and escalator issues as soon as possible to minimize visitor inconvenience.

Overall, we were satisfied with the value because we did get a really good rate when other hotels were 2-3 times the price, so I'm giving it 3 stars.  If not for the double whammy of the aggravating escalator and elevators during our entire stay, I'd have been a happier camper.

It's a great value you get the biggest room for your money in Vegas have the best buffet in Vegas the casino is fun to be in.  It's not a five star hotel. Given the size of the rooms and staff it's a great place to stay.  In the last 10 years I stayed here several times and it's one of my favorite destinations to stay for business or pleasure.

I lived in Vagas for 3 years and stayed here for vacation 3 nights after we had moved away. The cost to stay here is very tempting but we soon found out that the customer service is NOWHERE close to the level of other resorts. Overall staff and especially bartenders at the pool go out of their way to be rude and hostile. The bartenders rudeness was especially difficult to swallow as I was one for 5 years and know how to provide good customer service.

They are the equivalent to the Spirit Airlines of the hotel industry. Lots of add on costs and ridiculously expensive food and drinks. Even for a Vegas resort. They even charge you to use the in-room coffee maker. Hotel 8 doesn't even charge for that. 

If you do not accept the up charge for a newly remodeled room, you will mostly get a run down room where lights, door locks, sink faucets and shower heads do not work properly. 

Spend the extra money upfront for another resort. You'll end up spending the money anyways. 

Also, I NEVER leave bad reviews but my experience was so terrible I had to leave one.

I'm downgrading the Rio from my first review. The room we were stuck in this time was awful and it wasn't even what I booked for our stay. The carpet is filthy, the shower won't drain, the counters are gross and the tiles look filthy as well. Quite a change from when we stayed here last time. I doubt we will stay here again.

Pros: Large room with double sink in bathroom, nice casino, pet friendly.

Cons: Have to take a taxi to the strip, bed was super uncomfortable.

This place is not too bad. A little off the strip, obviously it's not Cosmo or Aria but they have a free shuttle that drops you off at Paris. I asked for an upgrade and got a 180 view almost 2,000 sq ft room for free
Wish i could give zero stars for the rude casino staff. And lack of places to sit down in hotel. No benches or chairs except in front of slot machine

Where do I begin..... Took my fiancée here for her birthday weekend and her first time in Vegas.  My first time at the rio. Our first room was a " nonsmoking " room that reeked of cigarettes, and the shower had lime scale all over the shower head, and mildew in the grout. After complaining to the front desk, we got assigned a new room. Shortly after getting in bed, my fiancée started complaining about an itchy rash all over her legs. So in true hotel impossible style, I tore the bed apart looking for bugs. Didn't find any, but what I found was equally disgusting.  I found not 1 but 4 pubic hairs of neither of our hair colors and a nasty scab stuck to the sheet. Also, there was a puke filled ice bucket in the hall all day. When checkout time came, i told the manager on duty, requested a comp, and he said "sorry, no.  But thanks for telling us about it.  This will be the last time I stay at a harrah's entertainment property. I usually stay south strip and that's where I'll go next time

Little strange, but let me start with the bathroom....it was the best hotel bathroom I've stayed in.  The towels were really high quality, the shower was fancy and everything was exceptionally clean...I'm a germaphobe which is challenging enough in Vegas.

You may need GPS to find your way around your room because it will be HUGE.  You won't need navigation to find Voodoo.  There is a Voodoo restaurant that is excellent (I'll review that separately) and a Voodoo Lounge where you can get smashed on the roof with a great view.  Both are a short elevator ride back to your room.   

The staff was very polite, check in was a breeze and the casino is nice and great bathrooms.  With some updating in the rooms and casino this could be the 5 star it probably was 7-8 years ago.
Hotel was okay despite the fact that I did not have one warm shower. They really need to improve their food options. I would not stay here again.

The rooms are big, but the Impanema Tower is renovated where as the Masquerade Tower is still a work in progress - and the beds in that Tower are HORRID. 

The choices for food\/shopping are good. The slot choices are good. The Table minimums are kinda high, but a short walk across the street to Gold Coast saves you from those issues. The shows are "ok", but could use some updating. VooDoo Lounge is STILL my favorite place in town - good drinks, great music and a SPECTACULAR view!! 

The worst part of the Rio is the AWFUL drink service...if you are playing a slot and are lucky enough to actually flag down a server then do NOT expect that drink to be in your hand any time soon! Likely you should order another one before they walk away - or you will be waiting a LONG time again! 

The new 21 and over topless optional pool is GREAT, so nice to be able to get away from the kiddies and chill by the pool...and hear some good music while doin' it!

The Carnival World Buffet Brunch on Sundays is not to be missed either - worth every penny!

Overall, the big rooms and choices make this a great spot (with the VooDoo locking it down for me!), but it is off the strip so that is a little inconvenient sometime...but again there is a balance with a free shuttle to the other Harrah's owned properties running every 30 minutes.
Number 1 buffet in Vegas! Amazing .. clean .. affordable! Everything was amazing! Hotel was very clean and enjoyable!

Rio does a lot of things right, but very few things exceptional. Eliminating complimentary valet parking makes the unfriendly to Local's. They are weak when it comes to greeting guests and getting them through a check in process. However, their suites are a nice change of pace. UPDATE: Complimentary Valet Parking is back if you are a hotel guest at Rio!  

HOWEVER: The rotating door was union and despite having hands full of luggage and stuff, not a single nearby RIO employee offered or tried to hold the main entry door open for me or my wife. That is just plain rude when there were half a dozen Rio staffers right there within ten feet.  THAT'S WHY this property only rates 3 stars... even at Motel 6 they will hold a door for you to enter.

Been to Vegas dozens of times, and on our most recent trip, We decided to stay here for the first time.It's partially because of the pictures my friends posted and the suites looked open and spacious ... which is exactly what we we're looking for. 

To sum up our stay, there were a few things that went right, but the things that went wrong outnumbered them. 

Right: 
* When there was a long line to check in, there were kiosks that allow guests to check in electronically, w\/o waiting in line. The down side is you can't make any requests for higher floors or Strip views. 
* We stayed in a corner suite in the Ipanema Tower, which gave us a partial view of the Strip, from Caesar's to the Stratosphere and beyond to Downtown, and out of the other window, the view expands to the mountains & Red Rock Natl Park in the distance. 
* Starbucks was located near the elevators of our tower. Not my fav., but certainly convenient.
* The temp control works well and quietly.
* Plenty of seating and fairly spacious 

Wrong: 
* Shower cannot maintain hot water. It turns on hot & within a minute, the water becomes lukewarm to cool. Taking a shower with cool water after coming in from the cold isn't the best experience. 
* I called Front Desk around 10pm to report the problem, and was told the engineer is very busy, so there's no ETA when he will come by. I called back to cancel the request for maintenance because I didn't want to stay up all night waiting. After 12:30am, someone calls and asks if anyone came by. Didn't he think guests might be asleep? We weren't, but that lacks any consideration for guests. 
* Hair dryer did not turn on. We tried pushing the reset button on the outlet, turned the dryer on & off for 5 minutes before it started to work. 
* Next morning, housekeeping decides to open our door without even knocking, even though we had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. Then she quickly apologized for a 'mistake' There was A SIGN on ... the ... DOOR! 
* The sink drains clogged. Both of them at the same time. So we had to wait for the water to trickle down before doing anything else, since it could have easily flooded. 
* The furniture in the room should be replaced, at least reupholstered w\/  new cushions. Sofa and chair are both very worn and sink down as soon as I sat in it. 
* Check out time is 11am. At about 10:20, housekeeping decided to let herself in again without knocking, and apologized again. And yes, we had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on ... AGAIN. Either she has no clue what the sign is for, or these are her first 2 days working there. Regardless ... WTF woman! 
* Getting from the parking garage to front desk is no easy task. Take the bridge on the 4th floor of parking structure, go inside the casino. Take elevator down to 1st floor, walk across the casino floor. It's a lot more annoying than it sounds, because guests are doing this while lugging around heavy luggage.

If everything in the room worked smoothly, and housekeeping didn't keep barging in our room, this review could have easily been a 4 star, but the staff here doesn't seem to have any courtesy or common sense when it comes to their guests. As much as I enjoyed the space and our Strip\/ mountain views ... their mistakes will probably keep me away. 

You should know: 
As I mentioned before, if there's a long line, use the kiosk to check in
If you want to request certain rooms\/view ... wait in line
The Masquerade Tower is the closest to the parking lot for convenience.
Unlike Starbucks at other casinos that don't accept the reward cards, this one does. All of their food items are a rip-off. 
Hash House a Go-Go & Smashburger are both here for grub.

Visting Las Vegas for the first time, staying at the Rio was a true Las Vegas expirience. The ambiance is amazing. The casino is clean and busy all the time. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful and the food and bars were great. The pool has an amazing set up and the whole hotel promotes true Las Vegas style fun!
Here referring in the 39th BCAPL National Championships. Looking forward to all the Individual players and teams coming out. Shoot well and have fun.
Good price .. Decent service .. Big rooms .. Easy access to the strip.. Im sold!

Two stars because if you stay in the Masquerade tower below the 27th floor it's really crappy.  Very old\/used look.  My wife was smart enough to ask for a better room from the bellhop. 

He said floors 27 and up were remodeled.   He was right but we had to pay $30\/night more.  Well worth it.  See pics then compare to others.  Doubt I'll stay again until they remodel.

Just stayed here for two nights  and the room was pretty good but when checking out they wouldn't honor a voucher for the stay they had issued and accepted when I had checked in.
 Honestly, I still can't believe it. Beware if you stay here and have a deal they might try and pull the old bait and switch on you too. Very shady and I had expected better of Harrahs. They could not have sent a stronger message that they do not value their customers.

I recently stayed at the Rio while in town for a hockey tournament. It was offered at a discount through the organizers of the event... otherwise our team probably would have been content to stay at any number of cheap hotels.
The bell desk graciously stored our foul smelling gear bags for a few hours before we got to our rooms at no charge. We were able to check in at about 12:30pm with an additional fee of $20 (they will drop it to $10 if you have a player's club card) and checkout at noon without any additional charges. Rooms were accurately advertised, clean and nothing to write home about. One of our guys upgraded to a masquerade suite which made for a nice "team headquarters" for post and pre-game partying\/meetings. 
The pool is great. Several different pools with waterfalls and lots of room to relax. They have an adult section full of fat old dudes, with no women anywhere. The good looking women you DO see here are clearly employees and they are jaded, bitter, angry people. 
There are some ok places to eat here but as with most of the larger popular casinos, everything is ridiculously expensive and of questionable value. The do have a Burger King that serves beer. It is directly adjacent to the entrance to the Chippendales show, so at night it was a fantastic place to check out the babes attending.
The cheapest table I saw had a $15 minimum even at 9am on a weekday... a little too spendy for me. Gold Coast next door had tables as low as $3 but it stinks like a dirty ashtray and you'd be lucky to find anyone under the age of 65 in the place.
Not much within walking distance of the Rio. You can easily walk over to Gold Coast or maybe the Palms if you were feeling like a nice stroll. I did walk to In N Out Burger during the day but it was pretty bleak and took about 25 minutes each way. There is a hotel shuttle to the other hotels in the same corporate family available but we opted for taxis and never used it. Do yourself a favor and hit up a grocery store on the way in from the airport and stock up on some snacks so every morsel you eat doesn't have to cost you $18.
Like I said, we would have been happy with just the bare essentials. The Rio isn't too bad.... it certainly isn't the off-strip hotspot it maybe once was, but it definitely felt like a decent value given the circumstances. I guess I was pretty satisfied overall.

I stayed 2 days for a conference.

Rio isn't horrible, but after staying at hotels on the strip I feel like Rio's heyday was in the 80's. This is what you have to expect from some of the hotels off the strip.

My room happened to be right above a kitchen on a high floor. I was able to smell food in my room during the night. 

The rooms are spacious. The hotel itself is old-school and is in need of an upgrade.

I came here on a different conference visit just to eat because a colleague swore by the buffett, but the buffett was just as good as any other casino buffett IMO.

The other restaurants in the hotel were just okay. There's a burger king available as well if you feel like saving some dough.

Rio isn't a bad choice if you are getting a REALLY good deal...especially if you are going to spend most of your time outside of the hotel.

This is a review of the Pool Bar and the Rio\/Voodoo Pool itself. 

The bartenders were ridiculously nice! He gave us compliments (telling a girl she looks wonderful always makes a girl smile) and made numerous jokes (about the topless pool Sapphire). Great personality!

My friend and I ordered a Miami Vice (half Pina Coloda, half strawberry daiquiri). We asked him to put a couple extra cherries on top, and he loaded the drink with at least 10 cherries on there...A delicious drink poolside...what could be better?

Side note: on the website, it says that there's happy hour from 4-6 at the Voodoo Pool. It doesn't exist...No happy hour :(

The only reason this got 1 star is because I haven't found any bugs in the room, yet. We came in for a conference at this hotel and arrived in the morning, with no sleep. I'm not surprised that they first told that check-in is at 4pm, but the front staff offered no help in trying to acquire a room, even after we offered to pay for the previous day, just so we could get a couple hours sleep before the conference started. I hardly believe that a single room at any rate was not available, on a Monday morning. Come back at 12:30 for early check-in was the response. 

We asked if there was any quiet area where we could rest, or somewhere my wife could freshen up to get ready for a meeting. Again, "no" was the answer. The concierge told us we might find something on the second floor. We did. A cold stone bench. What kind of hotel doesn't have comfortable seating for relaxing, waiting, small group meetings, discussions, etc.? Well, this one.

After taking no more than 30 minutes of the stone bench, we left. We came back at 12:30 and checked-in to a long line. Early check-in is $20 plus tax extra. Internet, found free in most every hotel in the world, is also extra.

I was under the impression that all rooms were suites. This is not a suite but a single large square room. There is a TV (that you cannot see from the bed) and minibar opposite the window, bed and couch occupying the remaining walls. There is a small alcove with dresser, safe, and a sink to vomit in outside the simple nondescript bathroom which could have come from a Motel 6. The Motel 6 quality continues to the bed, a squeaky overly firm king size with so-so sheets, no bedspread,  a depressed center, and hard foam pillows smelling of cigarette smoke.

I opened the minibar to insert a soda which I had earlier purchased to get cold again. Within 15 minutes a maid appeared with a milk crate and proceeded to empty the entire contents and drag it away. Her stated reason was that their contents was being altered with different brands. She also stated that there was a sensor in the minibar that alerted staff that it was being used and we would be automatically charged for it's use.  WTF? 

I do not wish to be unfair to Motel 6, but there, you don't expect a JW Marriott, here you do. What you get here is a Motel 6 with a casino under it. It's redeeming quality is that the Gold Coast is next door and you and go there for the inexpensive breakfast.

$29 per day BOGUS Resort Fees and NOW they've ADDED a $15 transaction fee if you chose to call to make a reservation vs. trying to book a room via their app while driving.

A (2) day stay =  $29 * 2 days = $58 plus $15 Transaction Fee = $73 in BOGUS fees for 2 night stay.

Any hotel that charges a resort fee starts at one star for me.  They could earn back a point or two if I were blown away with service, but their starting point is 1 star due to the bogus resort fees.

Go across the street!  Gold Coast Resort fee = $17.91 per night, NO transaction fee.  AND they are renovated - nice rooms .. Rio added new headboards and call it a renovated room. It's Disgusting - OLD room from the 70's.

Largest bar on the casino floor is closed Sun-Thurs. A lot of retail space empty and boarded up. You could shoot a canon through the place and not hit a sole, BUT they're holding strong to their $29 Bogus Resort Fee. 

Bartenders are rude and talk about their union a lot. I found the bartenders at Gold Coast MUCH more friendly. Rio charges your bank account a $50 deposit for in-house charges, BUT try. Just try to open a bar tab and charge it to your room. The union bartenders tell you that you don't have charging privileges. 

I'm done with Rio and Caesar's Entertainment.  Take your Resort Fees and cram it !!

I've stayed at the Rio a couple times now, most recently because it was the cheapest (for a decent hotel) on only a couple days notice.  The rooms are nice and the rooms are huge.  There is a complimentary refrigerator for your in-suite beverages and plenty of room to get ready if you are staying with multiple people.  The place is huge and has pretty much every you need on site from eating to gambling to drinking to entertainment (though I've never seen a show there).  The rooftop bar is nice, giving you a great view of the Strip.  The only downside with it being a bit off the Strip I probably saw most of my savings going towards cab fares.  Otherwise a nice hotel for the price point, I'd probably stay again.

This review is based on the casino only.  We played blackjack for a couple of hours and had an ok experience.  Nothing to rave about or complain about in that aspect. The casino was full but not overly crowded on the Wednesday night we were there. I would come here again to play Blackjack and a few slot machines.

This place is as undesirable as living on the street and I have done that. The carpet has the odor and stains of a cheap motel while the furniture bare similar resemblance to something I left in front of my yard for donation. 

As with anything in Las Vegas, you pay for what you get. 

Next time my buddies want to go to Las Vegas and book the Rio, I will turn them down.

The room was nice customer service not so great.  Stayed 3 nights. . No discounts to shows or fun giveaways.  Had to go to the strip to tix4 tonight to buy tickets for shows at their casino. shuttle to strip is nice. Probably wouldn't stay again.  Didn't win anything exciting.  MJ Live show was awesome... oh and they have a Starbucks! !!
Horrible hotel, shitty casino, really bad customer service. Internet sux, tv sux, people sux. Never again will I stay at this casino.

You'd have to pay me to get me to come again
Pros
Spacious rooms

Cons
Poor customer service
Tacky decor
Nickel and dime charges
Unprofessional dealers

The room was big and clean. That's all that I expect, that's what I got. Every other part of my experience was a disappointment. Some stories from my 3-day stay:

Where's my toothpaste?
My toothpaste was confiscated at the airport, so I called housekeeping for some toothpaste. I waited for one hour, then I went to sleep (this was at 12am). I woke up at 4am (jetlag) and went downstairs to gamble. Along the way, I ask the front desk to get me some toothpaste. They call it a "dental kit", as they don't give individual tubes of toothpaste. After a couple of hours I head back to my room and lo and behold, there's a bag hanging on my doorknob! It's...new bedsheets, no toothpaste. I call housekeeping again and 20 minutes later, I finally get my toothpaste. Third time's the charm, right?

Haha, you lost your money
I was playing blackjack with a couple of other strangers and we were all losing. One guy decides to bet big and puts down $400. Great, he gets a 20! But oh no, the dealer gets 21. :( Okay, no big deal, it's not the dealer's fault. But then she says, "Haha" and takes his chips. Wow. Really? Seriously? We are already losing hundreds of dollars, we're feeling kinda crappy, and to be funny you say "haha"? Wow. Thanks for that. Listen, we know we're playing a losing game. We know the house could easily get blackjack. But, when you are on the winning end and we are on the losing end of the odds, you don't mock the player and rub it in their face. Shortly after that I left the table and didn't play another round of blackjack at the Rio.

How dare you ask the Concierge desk for help!
As I was happily leaving the Rio, I asked them what time the shuttle service to the Strip started. The gentleman at the front desk took one look at my bags and said, "Oh, they won't let you on with their luggage." Seriously? Okay, I asked, what are my options. He literally shrugged, told me to walk or get a taxi and went back to his work on his computer. Not a single follow up comment. This was at 9:30am and there was no one else in line for help.

Others
There's a Chippendale's Dancing Theater, which adds to the less-then-classy atmosphere, and very disparate décor. You have the luxurious Whopper Bar to treat you to your Burger King obsession. They also charge $13 per day per device for internet. Really? Is this the 1990's, where wi-fi is a fancy technology? 

I may never go back to Vegas. But if I do, it will not be at the Rio.

How do they get away with calling this place an all suites hotel?  Just because you slap a sofa in a hotel room does not make it a suite.  The room had the most akward layout ever.  You could not watch TV from the sofa or the beds comfortably.  The old school tube TV was suck in a cabinet and while it did pull out, it did not swivel.  Had to move it by hand, and pray it wouldn't fall over.  Each bed had three pillows, all different but all had a plastic cover below the case.  Move around; crunch, crunch, crunch.  So annoying.
       My room was so dirty, I've stayed at Motel 6's that were cleaner.  The carpet was coming up, the wallpaper was peeling off.  I saw candy left on the floor near the bed.  In the bathroom someone had wipped bloody boogers on the wall.  The mini bar had dust so thick on it, it  look like it had never been touched.  The best part though was a half-eaten pickle wrapped in a napkin sitting in the fridge.  It was the only thing in there, how could you miss that?  The sundries also sucked.  Two bar soaps, one lotion and one shampoo, that's all.  So don't expect too much from this place.  I won't be back to stay.

I can't speak for everyone but for me the Rio was a very nice place to stay in. The rooms are huge and the seafood buffet is the best. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I can't wait to go back.

We came here for a conference. This is my first time and last time staying here at this hotel.

A notice about their recent Legionnaire's disease slipped under our door the night before we check out. Are they serious?

The lines are long and they move like snails. They charged me $20 to be put on the wait list for early check-in. They called me when my room was ready and I had to line up again for my keys.

The room and furniture was outdated. The bathroom sink drain made a loud noise every time you turned the water off. The shower was HORRIBLE. The shower head only halfway worked at best and the rest of the water was still coming out of the faucet below. Screws were coming off of the shower doors. And the toilet would not flush! You have to go back after the tank fills up to flush again and pray everything goes down! The carpet between the bathroom and the outside was unraveling. My toes got caught and I nearly tripped. A knob was missing to one of the table lamp so no light for reading.

The toiletries provided were a bar of soap, hand lotion and shampoo. No body wash, no hair conditioner. Some of their white towels are gray. The tissues were like sandpaper on your face.

The headboard\/curtain was falling off the wall. The blankets were thin and the sheets were rough.

The convention center is nice but if you need your mid afternoon coffee? Forget it, Starbucks and Hash House A Go Go closes early. Walked across to another Starbucks with no seating but, for your pleasure feel free to return to the closed Starbucks and sit at their closed, lights off dark lounge.

The CEO\/Manager of this hotel should be fired for allowing such poor service, dirty rooms and a bad and unsafe facility for their guest. The room looks nothing like the pictures on their website.

We went here for my friend's bday celebration and since some people in our party had access to the frequent stayer's card we received really good rates on our rooms. The rooms themselves were very big for the price we paid, complete with couches and chars and tables, and a HUGE vanity area which for a bunch of girls all getting ready to go out in vegas is a huge help!!! (there is never enough mirror space for checking out outfits, hair and make up ha ha) This hotel isn't on the strip really, but they have shuttles that will take you there during the day so really not as bad as some would think.

The restaurants in here were only so so food wise, but one of their buffets (carnival i believe) was probably the best deal anyone could ever have! For $25 which seems pricey for a buffet, you get unlimited mimosas with your brunch\/lunch and all you can eat everything including crab legs, shrimp cocktail, a mexican bar, asian bar, sushi bar...the list goes on and on! I have never felt so full in my life, but a trip to vegas isn't complete without a little buffet action!!

One of the few hotels who allow pets. We had our dogs. My husband drives truck and takes his dog. I went down to meet him on a last minute trip. The staff was friendly. Bell hops were prompt and very friendly. You can check in and out online which makes it great cause the lines are long. Our room was clean, spacious and comfy.
We stayed two nights. The beds were heaven!  We asked about the shuttle and was told they didn't have one when the signs said they did. So we took a cab. The valet staff was quick on getting us a cab. It did take a minute for them to park our car upon arrival. There were only two cars a head of us and we waited 20-30 minutes. Other than that, no complaints.

You pay for what u get here. Very bad rude customer service. Also the beds are very uncomfortable here. Never again. They gave me a smoking room when I requested for a non smoking room. I Don't smoke. If you are a nonsmoker this hotel is not for you. The smoke is so strong through out the whole hotel. When I called the front desk and told them my room is a smoking room, the manager or front desk act as if its my problem and didnt apologize or offer to switch my room. She gave me an attitude and says they will come spray it??? Wtf. When i said yes, please do come spray then she switched my room to a bad view room. Uncomfy hard bed. Stanky pillows. No more cheap stanky motels.

I stayed here last October when I got married in Henderson.  When I'm in Vegas, I usually like to stay on the strip for convenience but for my wedding weekend, I wanted to stay off so I wouldn't have to deal with traffic running around doing last minute wedding stuff.  Anyway, the casino and hotel aren't glitzy and glam like The Palazzo or Wynn but it's still nice.  I love how huge the rooms are since they're all considered suites.  But they don't have upgrades like flat screen TVs.  I like that the self-parking lot is really close to the elevators that take you up to your room.  Sometimes I don't like to valet because it actually takes longer to get your car out (this is at all valets, not just Rio).  While on the topic of valets, the Rio valet guys are really, really nice, like noteworthy friendly.  Rio is also home to my family's favorite buffet, The Carnival World Buffet.  The parade in the sky show that they have above the casino every hour is fun too and I recommend anyone new to Vegas to check it out.  I also hit up the souvenir shops at the Rio for trinkets to bring home (magnets, shot glasses, mugs).  Rio also has the Sapphire pool which I believe is topless.  I've never been before but would be open to checking it out.

I would definitely stay at the Rio again and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Booked a room for $40 a night and was amazed how cheap. The resort fee was kind of lame, but it's where I needed to be. The room is huge and amazing. Little bit of a pain in the ass to get to because of the casino maze. Only real complaint is the vending machine for a soda or water was $5. Uh why?

What a blast! The front desk took care of everything we needed from the start. All of the staff were super friendly. Shout out to the spa and Collin for taking care of us! The hotel was clean, the pool was beautiful, and the spa was phenomenal. We are definitely booking our entire next trip here! I loved our room, plenty of space, clean as a thistle, and everything was updated and just gorgeous. We paid a great price for great service, friendly staff, and a super clean atmosphere. Thank you Rio!!

I'm ashamed to say that I stayed here, but now that I'm back in school and not working, I have to be "frugal."  The first night I crashed in a friend's room that had an extra bed and the second night was only $60 including the resort fee.  The first night was a typical comp room from the old days.  Dirty looking old room and you could see dirty grout in the shower.  I was in the room to sleep for 5 hours so I was fine--didn't shower there.  The toilet paper holder was broken.  Ghetto!  That was room 1512 in Ipanema Tower.  The second night my room was better but still a typical standard room but for whatever reason the dead bolt would stick out so it would slam loudly every time I tried to close the door and then it didn't actually close the door.  That was room 1042 in Ipanema Tower.  That's a huge liability and safety issue.  Please always make sure your doors are closed and locked whether in the room or leaving the room!  I read a review here that said a stranger went into their room and was able to get security to open the safe in the room--I'm wondering if this is what happened?  

Anyhow, it is offstrip.  No one is really here so it's dead (but I kinda like that).  One elevator in each side of the tower was not working and the elevators are slow.  Everything is outdated and old (compared to the new hotels).  I did take the free shuttle but it's honestly easier to take a cab--$15-$20 each way to\/from the strip.

I tried the spa--it was okay.  The robe was a bit rough for me so I didn't use it.  The slippers and shower amenities were okay.  I got a free scrub to use in the shower that smelled like baby powder.  They had pretzels and water and juice.  The only thing I was grossed out about is I saw two girls that had arrived before me (I assume cuz they were changing out of their regular clothes) and they went straight into the jacuzzi tub without showering.  People--you are supposed to shower before entering the common shared areas like a jacuzzi.  The steam room was perfect but a little dirty.  Someone had left their used towel and bucket in there.  Plus you could see hairs and dirt.  Also, the lockers are the old manual key lock so you have to carry it with you everywhere.

I went to eat at the pho place.  Don't.  Staff was friendly but the soup was too salty and ingredients weren't the best.  The summer roll wasn't that good either though I liked the sauce.

I gambled a little here.  Staff were okay but I had one very intoxicated lady playing next to me and they gave her another drink and let her keep playing.  It was so weird cuz in the past, they would stop serving drinks and if bothersome, ask that person to leave.  She was getting flushes though--good for her!

I've seen Penn & Teller before and was looking forward to seeing them but they're currently on Broadway:(

If you're on a budget, stay here.  Otherwise stay at Cosmopolitan, WYNN\/Encore, Aria, Vdara...anything on the newer side.  Sooo much nicer!

No free wifi.  In 2011.  Really?  REALLY?

In 2011 wifi is ubiquitous as toilet paper.

The smoke in the casino is horrible.  It hits you like a wall as soon as the elevator doors open.

If you buy one of the drink packages (for example, you pay $75 to get $100 worth in drinks), you NEED to check out in person in the lobby.   The video check-out will not account for the drink package at all.  The woman behind the front desk told us this.  Gee, I wonder how ethical that is.

Avoid this dump.

Very old rooms.   Needs updating.  Only two staff to check in entire 900 rooms.  You do the math.  In line for over an hour and I started as number 20.
RUN!!!!!  Don't do it.  Don't come here!

The Internet only works in the room you can't even be mobile when you're checked in its come outofntour resort dfew, so tough. . Go to a pool party they won't even let you in security won't let you go past we need to go despite having a bad customer service at the registration desk basically blows you off and you're tough you can only use an internet hotspot every once in awhile. Bathroomal fixtures garbage, falling apart. No coffe maker in room but does have fridge. If it wasnt for penn & teller i would NEVER return or recommend this should be a dirthole to anybody

My husband and I have been to Vegas 14 times in the past 5 years.  We have stayed almost everywhere on The Strip; so we decided to try something different\/stay at the Rio.  I didn't know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised.  Customer service was great and the room was awesome.  It was huge, the bathroom was spacious, had a separate vanity area with stool and the view was fun.  The only downfall was one of the two sinks was clogged but not a deal breaker.  There were two sinks.  Since The Chippendale's show is in the hotel; it'd be great for a bachelorette party.  We will refer Rio to our friends and family for sure.

We had long plane ride got to hotel and stood in line to check in for an hour staff could have cared less.  Person in front of me has been coming to Vegas 40 years "never again will I come here".  Met a chap in long line in hotel at Starbucks next morning he commented about the line and then added of his own volition nothing like the check in line 2 days ago.

Pros:
Fairly quiet at the end of a hall


Cons:
-Stale cigarette smell in our room
-Worn carpet with holes, which seemed grungy.
-AWFUL beds, more like hammocks, slanting to one side.  Need to spend some of that ridiculous "resort fee" charge to replace beds.
-ONE "free" WiFi allowance for ONE device.  Never could get it to work. 
-Poor cell coverage in our room, usually barely 1 bar. 
-Room had a generally funky smell. 
-Worn and torn bedding

Wish I could give them NO STARS! We were told the shuttle service starts at 10. Which it did. So we arrived 10 minutes earlier. Of course a lot of people did as well. But enough to fill 1\/2 of the shuttle. At 10 we got in our 1st shuttle. Mind you I said 1st. We were told to get off because they made a mistake. It wasn't handicapped accessible, therefore they needed to switch the shuttle bus. We all got off and finally the new shuttle came in. By that time more people came on and we didn't get on that shuttle. The driver said another shuttle will come in a few minutes. Which it did, but with another destination because they have 2 shuttle to very different destinations. We waited 30 minutes in total and still no shuttle. How is that?! So instead we got an Uber and went way off the strip instead. We wanted the Paris buffet, but instead we went to Cici's pizza for the buffet there. I can't wait to get back to talk to the concierge.

Rio has always been one of my favorite hotel to check in too.  

Rooms Are spacious. Each room has a couch, refrigerator and coffee maker. 

Casino area is small but the environment is fun. Different kind of table games, 4 craps table, and slots. It's mainly for grower crowd but you'll see some young adult as well. 

Plus side is... they have a Starbucks near the hotel rooms. HEEEYYY!!! Love it. 

You have to try out their restaurant too. Rio buffet or at the food court... smash burger. Yummmy. Don't have to go anywhere far.

I spent several days at the Rio attending the Star Trek convention.  I did not stay there (I'm a local), but did use many of their facilities and interacted with their staff:

1.  The urinals in the mens room in the convention center all broke and were not fixed during the convention.  This was a real pain considering that  there were about 4000 people attending.
2.  One of the security folks was horrible to the guests.  There was a display that could only handle a few people at a time so security was required for crowd control.  But past this display were a few others that did not need crowd control.  The security person completely lost her sh*t when people who were heading to the other exhibits refused to get into the line for the special exhibit.  She couldn't get it through her thick skull that there were other exhibits and that the people who paid A LOT of money to attend the con didn't need to get in line and definitely didn't need to be treated like crap by this TSA reject.  
3.  All the food choices are way over priced.  Smashburger was the most reasonable.
4.  I heard many con attendees complaining about water getting into their rooms during a rain shower we had.  Hey Rio, there's a new invention out there called caulk.  Try it sometime.

All in all if I didn't live here in Vegas and wanted to attend the con I'd stay in the Gold Coast.

I had to wait 45 minutes to check in; not acceptable.  They had 5 and then 4 windows out of 15 open.  Not cool at all.  Rooms were large and spacious. Our non-smoking room smelled like it was really non-smoking and not a room that was converted from smoking to noon-smoking.  Staff was not friendly,  In fact they were downright grumpy.  At midnight I started hearing a lot of noise and music from the room next door; paper thin walls.  I got out of bed and went next door to ask then to quiet down and I saw a cleaning crew cleaning the room.  when I told them that they woke me up and asked them to quiet down, they did not even apologize.  Small bank of elevators and a couple were not working, so there was a lengthy wait time to get up and down the elevators.  Security was helpful; helped me find my car (it was in a different parking structure).  For a reduced price from what is available on the strip, if you can deal with mediocrity, then the Rio will suit you fine.

This place is a dump.  Came here for a convention and found out the prices that were being charged for the convention rates were $100 more per day then the regular rate that I could have gotten if I booked on my own.  Day 2 something happens to the elevators where you had to wait 5-10 minutes to get an elevator and then it was a hit or miss whether or not you would make it to your floor.  Day 3 at 6am the power is out in the room and they aren't sure when it will be fixed.  Rooms look run down and old.  Furniture is outdated and banged up.

Staying at the Rio hotel. The room is nice with a nice view but no one told us about a $150 hold that they take out of your bank account and you get it back when you leave. My husband and I rarely go on vacation and no one told us about the hold. Our first night in Vegas we could not go anywhere or do anything because we needed that $150 in our account WHILE WE ARE IN VEGAS! Really disappointed that the entire staff here failed to mention the "hold" at all. We are working class people who only get 1 vacation a year and the incompetence of the staff here really made our first night in Vegas really bad. If we would of known about the hold we would of prepared for it. But we did not know so we didn't. Because of this hotel the start of our one vacation a year was really bad. If we ever get a chance to come back to Vegas we will not stay here.

On our last trip to Vegas for a friends wedding, we were looking for an inexpensive hotel with at least some decent looking rooms. My bf has a reward card which allowed us to see what hotels we can get at a good price. Even though Rio is not on the strip its still pretty close to everything. 

Once we got into our room we were pretty surprised at how nice the room ended up being. Big king size bed with separate toilet\/shower and double sinks with a mini refrigerator. The closet has a two way opening on both sides one side leading to the door the other opening to the bathroom area. The room is very spacious with a couch as well. Big window glasses with a view towards the mountain and old strip. All this for $145 this is a two night three day stay. So I'm not complaining. 

The hotel has a free shuttle that takes you to the strip as well. Which was helpful if we didnt want to drive, because we wanted to drink. It all worked out because our friend got married in Paris and there was one shuttle that took us to ballys which is connected with Paris. They have other shuttles to take you to different hotels. 

On days that we wanted to drive, it would only take about 5 mins. 

They are also known for the world buffet which is supposed to be the best buffet in Vegas. Which unfortunately we did not go because we were eating elsewhere. 

But we will definitely book at this hotel again and we will try their buffet.

We stay here every year on our trips to Vegas.  We have received excellent accomodations, and service each time.  We like the fact that it is off the strip just a bit.  This way we can ride the shuttle to the strip, but when we've had enough we can come back to a nice place and escale the madness.  We also enjoy the fact that it is just across the street from the Palms, another of our favorite places!

Came here for the first time to try out the carnival buffet I had bought with a groupon. The buffet is pretty pricey but there is a lot of choices! Nice, clean, lively atmosphere and most the food I had was good. The Casio area didn't offer the variety of slot machines I am used to seeing in most places and the layout i found to be strung out and crowded feeling! Not sure I would come here again, way too many other places to spend my time and money.

Very poor customer service. They never told me that the resort fee only cover two devices' internet access. And they insisted the front desk has informed me verbally about this when I checked in.  They asked me to look at my reservation, but it didn't mention this 2 device policy. And their response is that it stated "somewhere" on their website.  I always dislike sneaky fees & charges.

After driving back from Denver, our car decided to act up, so we needed a place to stay overnight while it was being serviced. We needed a pet-friendly hotel for a reasonable price since we would only need to stay for 6-7 hours. The Rio popped up on a web search, so we instantly booked it for $100 while waiting for AAA.  

When we arrived at the front desk at 4 am on Monday morning, we showed them the booking for Sunday, 4pm check-in from the previous day, but good thru 11 am on Monday. The concierge let us know that it was not valid. We were thoroughly confused, but exhausted, and ended up paying over $160 for the same room. No offer to honor the valid booking at all.

The room was filthy. The drains were clogged with hair, and the bed was horrible. It looked like the room hadn't been updated since the late 90's.

When we got up the next morning to check-out, we saw an old women literally spit up phlegm onto the casino carpet. It was absolutely disgusting. Watching that happen described our experience at the Rio perfectly. 

We called the Rio today and they offered to comp us the resort fee of $30. Considering we were only there for 7 hours and they did not accept our online booking, we're not impressed.

When I stayed here, I really hated this hotel since it was very low-rent. The rooms (a.k.a. "Suites") were outdated and dirty beyond belief. The casino was gloomy, smoky, and ugly. However, The Village Buffet here is very good.

The things I totally detested about the Rio were: the cleanliness of it (or lack there of), the décor, the hotel being off-strip, and the smokey casino. Some of the things I liked about the Rio were: the size of their rooms (600 Square Feet), free in-room personal fridge, large windows in their rooms, and the awesome buffet.

The room is NOT A SUITE!!! Lets get that straight. DONT EXPECT A SUITE. They claim all the rooms are suites...nope!!! They're just large rooms. And our friends room was even smaller than ours! We used to get suites at the Sahara, and we paid $75 for a REAL SUITE!! Everything was white, Chrome, silver, gold... Nice! Very up to date. Huge tub, the works, we had a mini bar, & a completely separate living room with the door closed off from the bedroom. Like I said, these rooms at the rio are not suites!!! The rooms at Rio are nice but need to be remodeled. And we were on 20th floor and ws heard the trains every night. Wtf. And when we used our outside sink, the sink in the bathroom would make gurgling noises.

was refereed here for the seafood buffet
oh how my wife loved this place so much
thank you

We enjoyed our stay of the Rio. Every member of the staff was so friendly. The rooms were spacious including the bathrooms and make-up area. The room also had a small fridge which was nice to keep water cold. Clean rooms. The hotel had an ice pool area and good choice of restaurants. We were there for a convention but would go back for fun.

We booked our family mini-vacation during Spring break and Easter this year.  Checked in the evening and first room, things on the walls were missing, door lock was broken, and bed was poorly made with missing items.  Top it off, AC didn't work.  Called down to front desk and told them so they moved us to level 8th floor.  Room was fine this time but the hallway has a marijuana smell so since I'm pregnant, I called front desk to let them know.  They sent security up and used a air wick spray?! You kidding me?  2nd evening, another marijuana smell incident.  Front desk again can't handle it.  Worst stayed ever.  Food at the buffet were horrible.  Husband got food poisoning same night.  Never staying at Rio's again.

I was incredibly disappointed with my stay at the Rio. My room, while surface clean was obviously not updated and clearly run down. The shower head was missing the aerator, the shower door is missing an interior handle and there was about 2 inches of dust in the bathroom vent. The hotel is old and smokey. I only visited the Starbucks for breakfast and it's fine if you expect the "inflated hotel" Starbucks prices. A sparsely filled fruit cup was $5!

I came for a business trip and requested a room location that wasn't completely booked. I was given an adjoining room and could hear my neighbors through the door while I was trying to sleep (well after midnight). It's my fault for not requesting a non-adjoining room; however, instead of sending someone to talk to the loud neighbors they said I could move. After midnight, when I had to be up in 6 hours. I declined their offer.

I did receive some compensation for the maintenance issues - the shower head was replaced but the shower door wasn't fixed.

Stayed here with my family during the summer vacation.
Honestly I thought Rio was going to be a low end hotel because from the outside it doesn't look so great.
But boy was I wrong.
1. VALET PARK YOUR CAR. it's FREE you just tip the guys who get your car for you.totally worth it and convenient.
2. the rooms were REALLY nice. I think they might have re modeled but I shared a room with my sister and I felt like we had a suite!
Two LARGE queen beds, a HUGE tv, a bathroom with two sinks, fridge, safe, shower\/tub, couches. 
3. BUFFET.
omg. I don't think I even tried all the food in the buffet but they have so many different stations and I stuffed myself with at least 5 plates.

The pool is pretty nice except they closed early on the days I was there due to night events at the pool.
The casino is kind of small, BUT I can't complain because I won $50 from a penny slot machine:)

TIP: even though they aren't on the strip, they offer free shuttle buses that go from rio to Bally or Harrah's hotel on the strip every 30 minutes.
It's air conditioned and comfy and hey as long as I don't have to walk in the 105 degree heat or waste my gas then that's fine by me!

Stayed at the Rio this weekend and will be my last visit at this hotel. Canceling my Total Rewards card and will be staying at a non Caesars entertainment hotel and casino going forward. I visit Vegas 2 to 3 times a year and usually stay at the Rio and this was the worst hotel experience I've ever had. Upon entering my room I was greeted with a large wet stain on the couch. I shrugged it off and went down to the casino. While walking down the hallway on the 15th floor in the Ipanema tower I noticed that EVERY SINGLE light fixture was either missing or damaged as if someone put their hand through it. There also a large piece of molding laying on the ground that used to be on the wall. I called up the front desk and I had to deal with 3 people passing the buck for 15 minutes until all I got was excuses with a dismissive attitude. Left to hit the strip the following day and upon coming back to the room I was greeted with a pair of latex gloves sitting on the bed.  Pretty nasty. While gambling at the roulette table I asked for 2 bottles of water and as the cocktail server brought back my order I asked her if she could break a 20 so I could tip her and she said she couldn't and got all pissy and walked away. Later that night I was at the wheel of fortune slots smoking and here comes the same rude waitress walking by and throws an ashtray on the counter next to me and says I might want to use an ashtray. lol. Finally I went to complain about my stay and all I got was ok we will address that and sorry. What a joke and not how you take care of your best guests. Find a better casino hotel to stay at. The Mirage is awesome on all levels.

This was the host hotel for a week-long professional training seminar I attended.  The hotel was average at best and a bit deceptive based on circumstantial evidence.  I really needed to stay here as it was the host hotel  - when making reservations they repeatedly denied knowing about the seminar negotiated room rate (I called several times and spoke with multiple people in reservations.). I was stuck at the higher room rates.  I have never run into this with any other hotel and have attended numerous seminars over the years.

When I checked in they made absolutely no mention of the wifi, pool access, and gym access I found out later that I had a mandatory "resort fee" for.  I made the bad assumption you only paid if you used those amenities.  They made no mention of this until checkout.  Even when I checked out they denied knowing anything about the seminar that had gone in all week in the hotel.

It is not on the strip so sundries like drinking water, band aids, coffee, etc. are at a premium.  The cheapest pint of water I could find was $3 in the floor machine.  There is a Keurig in the room with 3 single K-cups for a $9 charge.  I have stayed all over the world and have never seen this setup.  I have stayed in rooms with no coffeemaker but never has there been a coffeemaker minus the complimentary coffee.  The best I could do was nearly $18 at the downstairs Starbucks for 12 K-cups.  I am one of those people who needs coffee immediately when my eyes open.

The Carnival buffet and our lunches during the week were very unimpressive.  On the bright side, the Hash House and Indian buffet were very good.  If I was staying somewhere else I would take a taxi to go eat at the Indian restaurant there.

I loved Vegas but will stay elsewhere when I vacation with the family.

This hotel USED to be great. Now it's like the hotel from 1980, except the prices are very much 2016.  First off, I paid 44.00 per night, a sunday and a monday. Pretty good right. Wrong! After you pay for the room plus tax then you get the boom lowered on you. 32.oo per night stay resort fees, If you want coffee in your room, seriously 32.oo per container of burnt Starbucks coffee, 10.00 for a cheese danish, there were 3 of us. So for two days of coffee and 5 Danishs plus hotel fees, our room for 2 nights ( oh and we had 2 Rooms) for just one room, two nights out the door 498.00. So much for 44.00 a night. The prices there are extreme for an old hotel. Like I said, 10 years ago it was so do-able. Not anymore.  They don't serve any food room service wise 
After 11 pm so don't even think about it.  Vegas in general is just a big lit up TRAP. The casinos don't even let you win a little, it just takes and keeps on taking.  If you wanna just get away for two days, forget Las Vegas and take a 3 day Mexican cruise. At least you get something for your money.  The Rio just doesn't have it anymore.   Unless your 21.....Vegas in general, SUCKS. whata let down.

Not the best hotel in Las Vegas. Although I haven't had time to visit the pool party. The rooms are usable or maybe not! Thinking about it, I was missing a shower head and some stuff look old. Some tiles were broken. It is spacious, the walk is long. Casino is okay. Too far for me although we had a mustang to take us places. The Buffet was horrible. Okay now I think i should rate this hotel 2 stars instead of 3. Haha! sorry owners. Also, when you check out it's a long line.

Overall, it's a decent hotel for the price. The rooms are called suites and are decent in size but the quality of the suites are average. Let's just say a suite at the Hardrock has the wow factor where these suites dont have that feeling. They are nice because they have two beds and a couch.

The carnival buffet is nice for a variety of foods while the seafood buffet is awesome. The other restaurants are pretty good although I find this hotel lacks nice late night eateries. 

The hotel is a tad dated and is off the strip. So I guess it could be a plus or minus. The hotel does offer a shuttle to Harrahs which is on the strip though.

Like most hotels they have self parking and valet parking.

The Rio does seem to be one of the cheaper hotels in the Caesars chains.

We had a very nice and large room for the really good price we paid (around 37$ \/ night). The person at check-in didn't seem to care a lot about us though.

The casino has no smoke-free area and  the room kinda smell of cigarette, even if it was a non smoking room.

Also, you have to be careful not to touch the things in the mini-bar if you don't wan't to  be charged. Everything is magnetized and as soon as you lift it up from the shelf, you're charged even if you put it back without using it. The employee at check-out removed all the mini-bar charges (we were curious and lifted some of the things in the mini-bar) and she told us it happened a lot.

We were disappointed the Indian restaurant was closed all the time we stayed there.

We stayed at the Rio for a bachelorette party in August, and had a decent experience staying there. First, the not-so-great things about Rio: there's constant room renovations, and we were in the wing that needed some serious updates; this hotel is definitely showing its age. We waited an unnecessary amount for an ironing board. And because like most hotels in Las Vegas, Rio is a themed hotel, there were also some pretty Cheesy with a capital C things going around the hotel, like that random show they have where they threw beads. OK, actually that was pretty awesome. 

Otherwise, Rio's an overall good choice for our party. You get what you pay for in the hotel rooms, in that it's a basic four-star accommodations. It's got a great rooftop club with amazing views of the Strip. The Chippendales perform here, and now that I've seen Jaymes and James compete on the Amazing Race, I kinda don't giggle in incredulity anymore. The pool area is huge and renting out a cabana is a great deal for a big group. It was definitely the perfect veg out experience, so very Vegas.

Really don't like the fact we have to leave the strip to come here, but there is a few cool things here. We came for the Village Seafood Buffet. The only buffet I come to because they have unlimited fresh lobster. Yum. 

Also they have Hash House a Go Go which is always great! Walked in and looks like it really needs a renovation looked pretty run down. They have a burger king bar that you can buy a beer combo with your whopper. 

Never stood at the hotel based on the mixed reviews and personally I like to get sauced so I need to be on the strip at all times. Kinda bummed because we were supposed to go to the Voodoo Rooftop club but never made it up there.

My first trip to vegas was amazing!!  If there was a down part of the trip it was the hotel we chose to stay at.  My girlfriend is Brazilian so obviously we had to stay at rio for our first trip.  However, if anyone thinks this resort has anything to do with rio or brazil they are in for a rude awakening.  We waited almost an hour just to check in to start our trip.  Once we checked in our room keys didn't work so I had to walk back down and get someones attention to help us.  We finally got into our room and it was nice.  Not sure why it is called a suite but it was nice.  Big comfy bed, nice bathroom, spacious, terrible view, and a couch.  Maybe the couch makes it a suite?  I sincerely hope the other hotels that are prices similar to rio are nicer because the experience we had at rio wasn't nearly as nice as what we experienced walking through other hotels on the strip.

The casino part of rio is a huge let down compared to the other we visited.  It was pretty much a ghost town on Friday night which isn't really a bad thing but the waitresses don't come around at all we didn't see any of them dance until the last day and that was kind of a joke.  Don't advertise something if your not going to do it!!  

The worst part of the resort for me was the front desk.  I simply asked if they would print my boarding pass for me and they refused.  What?  They made me walk to their computer lab and pay to print one.  Did I pay resort fees?  That doesn't include the price of printing a boarding pass?  Ugh.  Not to mention the front desk staff were all too busy to even talk to me.

We are headed back to vegas in a few weeks and we will not be staying at rio, going to rio, or even going anyplace near rio.

Good luck Rio.

I stayed at the Rio for the first time this past weekend and my boys and I had a great time. 
 We went to the pool party and kicked it under the water fountain macking chicks and straight up got rad as fuck for 3 days. 
 It was clean. The service was great and the room was impressive. 
It was tidy, spacious and the bed was comfortable for the 3 hours total that I slept.

I would definitely come back to get rad and party like chow again.
Thanks for a great stay Rio.

I would give a zero if I could.  Check in was over an hour and very rude service... Definitely never coming back.

Too bad since this was once my favorite place in Vegas.
Best hotel great deals on our room and it's pretty nice and big.. Their buffet selection is great!!! Especially the lobster tail and crab legs

The Rio is a pretty decent hotel. The rooms are spacious and the whole hotel is very clean. It is a mid range priced hotel, but using Total Rewards you can get a number of nights comped if you are staying for a while, which makes it quite a cheap option.
The club on the roof has amazing views of Vegas, so I definitely recommend taking a trip up there to take a gander.
I do have to say though that the location is a bit of a pain in the derriere. It is a good 15-20 minute walk to the strip and the main road is a little sketchy, so I would not advise walking it on your own. There is a free shuttle bus that takes you to Bally's and Paris Hotel's every 30 minutes, so that helps, but it can be a little on the slow side.

Update:  I decided I would share with the manager our dissatisfaction. Not really to get anything out of it but rather to share the responses we received from their staff and how it bordered argumentative and lacking any regard for $$ spent at hotel with a less than stellar experience. 

With that said RIO had redeemed themselves. I 100% did not expect anything and ended up with a full comp for our stay. I told manager that it wasn't my intent to request a comp. but he insisted.
