Because they decided to make things right I am changing their 1 star rating to 4 stars. I will stay here again in hopes to give them another chance. 

Good job RIO!

-------
I have stayed at this hotel many times and typically I am satisfied with my stay. Although this trip I am giving it a 1 star rating!  

When hotel guests book at a resort hotel they expect to be able to use all amenities. This is why we choose a resort hotel right? 

Well I believe they have four or five pools. For the three days of our stay all pools were closed for resurfacing!  When I called to ask about it they said it isn't included in the 'resort fee' and said no more. 

I was so upset I hung up on the guy who cut me off when I was speaking to him. In my opinion if you are going somewhere and something as significant as all water amenities are closed guests should be either discounted their hotel rate or allowed to cancel without penalty. 

This trip sucked thanks to RIOs lack of regard for their guests!  Not everyone wants to drink and gamble all vacation!

Shame on you RIO!

What a bunch of crap. They make you prepay for a room and then they don't have the type of room that they made you prepay for. This was one of the hotels I used to like to stay at, but this will be my final visit. Then they act like they are giving you something by bringing a crappy rollaway bed to you for free. Never again and I will be spreading the word to everyone that will listen.

Stayed at this hotel for the first time and my overall experience was just "okay" which then turned into somewhat of a "nightmare" the morning before I checked out. After checking in, my family and I take the elevator to the 20th floor and stepped out into a loud buzzing environment with lights flickering outside of the elevator which did not sound good at all and looked more of a hazard. I looked up to see that the corner of the ceiling had a burned mark and that the light bulbs could potentially start a fire. This made me wonder how long it's been this way and if the hotel even cared for the safety of its customers. At this point, we felt like we were in a scene of a horror film. The room appeared clean, but the entire fixings of the bathtub can use some repairing and cleaning since there was mildew and mold in every crevice. Disgusting!!!! Anyways, fast forward to the day of checking out... I left my hotel room with my family for about an hour to get breakfast and come back to my room to find a coffee pot placed next to the sink. I had the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign hung outside of the door knob, but house keeping (or "whoever" which disturbs me just thinking about it) obviously ignored it and decided to enter. Helloooo?!?!? Are you serious?!?!? No one in the room ordered coffee or any appliances! On another note, we always check to ensure our room is completely closed each time we leave. We checked to see if any of our personal belongings were stolen, but luckily, nothing seemed to have been tampered with or taken. This was quite bothersome! Knowing that someone entered our room made us feel unsafe and uncomfortable especially with the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign. What's the point of it then???? I filed a report with security and a complaint with the supervisor who says they'll look into it and check who entered the room during the time we were away. I just want to make sure that this hotel takes our situation seriously to ensure the safety of others who stay here and will respect their privacy because even if this were a mistake (ie. house keeping wasn't paying attention with the room number and do not disturb sign), THIS SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN AT ALL!

Seriously if you want to have a good time Do NoT stay here! It's the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff is very rude, it takes forever to check in and out. When I stayed here someone walked in my room I guess they had double booked my room soo some random guy had the key to my room!! It's unbelievable how this happened ! Never staying here again.
Clean but needs some updating! Pillows are terrible and the in suite amenities are not up to today's standard.

Was in Vegas for daughters wedding. Decided to stay at Rio for a Groupon offer. Boy was that a mistake! 
1)
Went to check in, and room wasn't ready for another three hours. Was told to come back and go to the key line and will be able to get in and out very fast.
2)
Came back three hours later, went to the key line as they helped six people in the check in\/out line no one even recognized me until I said something. Even then, I was given a attitude. 
3)
Light bulbs were burnt out.
4)
Some of the towels were dirty.
5)
Drains were very slow, and sink faucet was leaking.

I complained about this and besides given a resort fee credit. They did offer me another room, however it wasn't going to be ready for another six hours! I was not going to be back in until late that evening, after wedding and reception. Nothing else was offered. 
Never coming back,

After, escalating my incident further from my last review I have to bring them back up to a 3. If I didn't have to complain and escalate my issue myself rather then them taking care if it right away I would have giving them a 4. After my complaint I gave to say that they have taken care of the employee, as well as my husband and I. 

Good
1. Pool is amazing 
2. Rooms are huge 
3. Both buffets 

Bad
1. No coffee in rooms
2. Poor customer service at total rewards (but was taken care of after some persistence)  
3. No 24\/7 cafe. No late night meals. Like good breakfast deals.

This room is sooodope. Totally wrth the extra money for a suite. Surprisingly really enjoyed this hotel. As I said the hotel room was very nice, huge and had a great view of the strip. Also wasnt super far off the strip so def convenient etc. Will stay here again

Last time I came here, I was attending a wedding in the mid-90s, I vaguely remembered the buffet offer was large.  And there was some kind of sky show at certain hours.  It hasn't changed much from outside and inside, checking was painfully long on this day because of Deathcon, now I regret staying at the event hosting hotel.  I'm just glad we didn't have to split up to wait for the badges as well since a friend took care of that the day before. And you would think the hotel would put more ppl at the checkin desk for the surge of the guests, and be well prepared of such surge from many years of hosting the same event which attracts the ppl from over the world.  Apparently, our reservation was not to be even though I had confirmed the day before, but we were offered an upgrade $150 to stay at one of their premium suite on the 20th floor of Ipanema Tower, on top of the base rate which came to $340 per night plus the resort fee.  That seems to be a decent rate to me, because I remember paying almost that much in Stratosphere for one tiny room years ago.  We did not have another reservation somewhere else, so why not?  

The problem with this suite is that one of my kids has to sleep on the couch, as they only allow one roll away bed per suite.  

The suite was fine, very clean, contemporary but not showy which I like.  I LOVE the big tub by the window, and its switch operated shade.  Nice touch with  the panelings above the shade in the sitting room, they brighten up the room a bit and gave the otherwise dull looking drapery a classic look.  The furnitures were plain and worn out somewhat, the decoration was minimum which suits me.  My other favorite part of the room is the vanity and the stool that comes with it, albeit the stool could use some cleaning.  The walking closet has a safe which didn't work, because the battery has worn out.  I called the front desk, the repair man came and fixed it.  

Took me a while to rinse my long hair in the shower, because water leaked at the faucet, so only two third of that already economical flow came to the shower head.  While drying my hair, I was distracted by their shower window which I haven't seen it elsewhere.  Don't think they designed it with mitigating the slow shower flow in mind, rather it was a fashion statement or a way to let lighting in from the bedroom, any way, it's quite unique and I like it.  

Warning: don't use their shaving kit, because the blade can actually hurt you.  Also, I'm glad I brought my own Q-tip, because their Q-tip can't hold candle to the store bought ones.  

Keurig coffee single cup brewer and the two TVs worked fine and the AC worked great also.  The bed was firm and comfortable, no complains there.  I did not smell much smoke except the third night and I hardly heard any noise.  Had trouble using wifi, very slow or not working at all.

We use to stay at the Black Hat hosting hotel for the last few years, this time we decided to stay at Rio.  Little did we know that dinning could be a challenge.  The buffets have long lines before they were open, the American Bar and Grill was bursting out of its capacity, so I opted to dine out, thankfully there is Gold Coast.  Lots of other deathcon attendees went over there as well, judging by their distinctive attire with flashing or non flashing (minus the battery) badges. 

Didn't get to try KJ's dim sum, but we tried their dinner which I have to say, not impressed.  To sum up the experience, big price for small portioned mediocre overly salted food with halt service. 

There are 10 lifts for the tower, the average wait for the lift could be from 1-6 mins,  I heard someone saying there isn't enough lift for this tower.  I bet it's not like this everyday.  Also, one needs to insert the room key in the lift for the 20th floor, it's just one extra thing to do.

The bill was large, our splurge for the year, or whatever makes the man happy.  We are working poor but we can make the boat float by regulating the flow economically for the rest of the year as well.

Was worried at first being off the strip...but shuttles every 30 minutes, rooms are massive (great value for money!) Usually stay at the hard rock so was a bit wary of making a change but all in all awesome spot for value for money and what it offers.

One of my favorite place to stay when I'm in Vegas even though it is off the strip. Rio always have promos and great deals for me. The staff are always super friendly and welcoming. The room are always clean and super spacious. They offer free shuttles to the Harrahs for you to get to the strip. They do not charge you for parking (which is hard to find now in Vegas). The only complaint I have is the AC in our room wasn't working as well. It wasn't as strong or cold enough, but we were to lazy to switch rooms. I would definitely stay here again! 

Overall:
Service:10\/10
Cleanness: 10\/10 
Price: $70 for 2 nights on a Friday & Saturday

We thought we booked our room for the weekend of May 1-3 a few months ago through the hotel direct.  Come to find out it takes you through Roomstays.com which is part of Expedia (without you realizing it). When we were leaving for our trip I checked the rates of the room on line and found out the rooms  rates had dropped 50%.  When I called the hotel I was told I did not book direct and to call Expedia, I was told when I called that the room was already paid for and they do not price match. Bait and switch on the Rio's part and I will not only never stay there again (after spending close to $500 at the Voodoo Steakhouse)  but after using Expedia consistently over the last 10 years will never use them again either.

I use to love this pool. It use to be very clean. We would go swim here once a week or twice a week. We would have lunch etc. 

Every summer this pool gets dirtier and more run down. I knew something was up when the cocktail waitresses started wearing uniforms that didn't match. LOL! I use to cocktail so, I pay attention to this kinda stuff. 

We didn't have a pool or a lot of options. Even tho I lived by a rec center and a YMCA. I finally got fed up after someone pooped in one of the pools and I went to check out the YMCA. It's cleaner and cheaper! It's not as bad as I thought it would be. No loud music, drunks, hookers etc!!! Yes, hookers at the pool!!!! 

Now, I have a pool so, thank God I don't have to spend $50 to $100 a dat visiting casino pools or deal with toooo many kids at the YMCA plus, my daughter is older the rio pool is better for little kids. They can play in the sand! If there's no poop in it.

I used to love this casino because of sentimental reasons (my late aunt introduced us to the Rio) but the service has taken a downward slope.  After an inconvenient delayed flight I spent hours and $$ on the slots, tables for a waitress to come by 3 times.  The front desk told us our room was one of the nicest suite's and it's an old dump.  I'm unsatisfied with arriving late, losing and rude ass waitresses\/dealers.  Would've been happy at least getting to my room with a good buzz.  The Rio used to excite me to the fullest as my husband and I stayed here for our birthdays and anniversaries for more than 10 years but it's time to find a new happy place in Vegas.

I realize it was built in 1989 but it's old and tired.  Casino is the money maker so in decent shape.  Rooms in the old tower are lacking ... beds are old and linen isn't what you'll find in most other places in Vegas.  Bathroom tub surround caulking have mold. The vent in the bathroom has more lint than a commercial dryer screen in a laundromat.  Furnishings are old ... OLD! The sofa is a sleeper judging from the crushed cushions was new in 1989 when the first tower opened. The room had 2 queen beds so you'd expect bath linens for multiple people but only one wash cloth and one hand towel. It's a place to sleep but they're are better for the money in Vegas. Carpet is stained and seams are obvious and coming apart.
The casino is getting kind of old. But I had to visit the place that hosts WSOP.

Feels like I got forced into a time machine and got transported back to the 80s. Casino looks really run down... Stay on the strip. Only reason we are here is cause the wife and her gf wanted to see chippendales. Lots of old timers and people that look like they have a gambling problem.

I wouldn't exactly say this is an all suite resort. I booked this room through travelocity, it was for my husband's 30the birthday. From the pictures, we were excited. Strop view, nice tub for him to soak in, four pools. I knew it was too good to be true. Check out was pretty fast, expreds check in through the kiosk. Kept offering room upgrades, never happened but should've taken it. When we got to the room, I immediately stated, "this is not worth $150 for the night." The room looked nothing like the pictures, it was obviously dated which is not included in the pictures, the curtains are two bits away from falling apart (the track was off), the toilet ran from morning til next morning (it's been running all night and here it is 0853, I can still hear it), the shower doors did not close and when you tried to close it, the screeching sound that came from the bathroom was UNBAREABLE (it was soul wrenching). After I sort of got over the initial infuriating shock, we decided to go to the pool. We stopped at the gift shop for smokes and sun screen. First, cigarettes are $14 FOR SHORTS and second, a small can of spray on sunscreen was $30. Pero like, porque?! We get out to the pool, one pool is shut down and drained, we go to the big pool with the hot tubs and all the cool waterfalls, I couldn't go into that area because I didn't bring my photo ID to show the bouncer. I DID NOT BRING MY PHOTO ID TO SHOW THE BOUNCER TO PROVE I WAS 21 TO GO INTO THE POOL AREA. Let's let that soak in for a minute. Besides the fact I've had issues in the past with vacations and stolen wallets and IDs, no where on any sign or any document or even on line was it stated you needed to bring ID with you, even if you aren't drinking because it's a million freaking degrees outside and I'm sorry I don't really wanna live through my own "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas", you cannot go to that pool, all the way in the back. So that left me with two choices, the kids pool or the kids pool. Needless to say, I'm pretty angry. Nah. I'm hella furious at this point. After all of this, we ordered room service because everything else was crazy busy, there was an $8 service fee just to bring the food up to the room, we asked the guy if we could just charge our card, heooked at me like I was speaking another language then said " uh. I guess. I need to use your phone though." Like, what?! Then, probably twenty minutes later, the person for room service, called back and said they couldn't process any payments because of the high amount of service calls they were getting at that time. Like that's my issue. Because it REALLY isn't.  I didn't even bother going to front desk because after reading the reviews on Yelp, they aren't gonna do anything anyway. We leave today and we won't ever be coming back to the Rio. My aunt and uncle also visited at the same time as us, they stayed the West gate, got an INSANELY better price for the same room if not better and it was a hell of a lot closer to the strip.

This review is based on casino\/dealer experience...

Mike and John were my black jack dealers and they have been the BEST DEALERS IN VEGAS PERIOD!! 

We've literally been playing in all the casinos and the dealers vibes are very negative and makes your whole vibe change. 

But not the two dealers in the Rio Casino. Their vibes both have been nothing but super fun, humble, and playful through out the whole time. Even losing money with them was enjoyable and that's hard to say but it's true! 

I can't rave about them enough! They're so amazing!! Vegas needs more people like them to deal cause wholly molly these other dealers don't look and are not happy to be around.

Overall it was OK but really dislike no free coffee in the rooms. I accept paying $5 for a Pepsi from the vending machine but how cheap do you have to be to not have coffee free to your guests in the room. Little thing but with so many choices I will never stay here again.

Rio made me sick!

I have been heading to vegas now for well over a decade and have stayed at many properties, I will never set foot in the Rio again, I am a poker player and have considered the world series of poker, but now I think not!

I realize that Las Vegas is the desert, but seriously lets throw some humidity in the air please, dry smokey stale nasty!  My room was dated, which is fine, but the air was even unbreathable in my room!  I literally would start to gag when I walked through the gaming floor!  Here I sit back in Chicago with a stuffed nose a sore throat and an overall disdain about me!

Rio could offer me 2 weeks free stay in their best room and I would say NO!

The sad part is, the staff was relatively nice and accommodating; all things considered...

The poker room dealers and floor managers were great, clearly the company shifts their dealers from property to property, I recognize most of the dealers from Caesar's Palace.  Even the action in the poker room was fun and exciting, but all that goes out the window when you can't breathe... (guessing they rotate because no one wants to be stuck in that nasty air every day)

My coworkers experienced the exact same thing so I know it was not just me, One of my coworkers woke up with bleeding noses and feeling hung over when he was not even drinking or smoking...

Having stayed at dozens of properties in Las Vegas this is not the norm, far from it in fact!  At the top of my List is the Renaissance Las Vegas (non-gaming property), but also have enjoyed Caesars, Bellagio, The Hotel @ Mandalay Bay, here is the kicker even the Imperial Palace which last I stayed (2 years ago) was super out dated, still manages a cleaner more humidified breathing environment!

I was so devastated by the air quality I couldn't even complain because I knew whatever they would offer me would be in that hotel and every minute I spent in that environment would have just made me that much sicker!

(I gave it 2 stars not 1 because of the service and great poker room staff) 

Im thinking if you are a heavy smoker, then this may not bother you, but even if you smoke, that does not compensate for the exceptionally dry air....

this is a good hotel for families. it is off the strip and away from the madness. i noticed that not many people at this hotel smoke which is nice.  we did have a problem with housekeeping - they never came until we complained.  it took them about 45 minutes to bring us towels and they kept throwing away my friend's hair ties. ??? weird.  it's not the greatest hotel in the world but it's decent and you get what you pay for.  the rooms are clean and the view is nice. the rooftop lounge called voodoo lounge has an amazing view of the stip and it's nice and open so you feel the breeze - very nice. the actual loung (indoors) is disgusting and smells of vomit but once you get passed that and move on outside you will def enjoy the view.

Wow almost made me cry for being a good customer. I was playing their electronics craps machine, the machine would not let me clear my beat or cash out my money. An employee passing by and I asked for help, he was short and said press that button (collect) it miraculously worked.  My husband though it was me not machine so I tried playing again this time with a smaller bill as I didn't want to risk loosing too much money. It happened again. I gave up playing and after several games the machine let me collect my money. I just realized they don't let u take out ur money unless u loose!!!!
Steve D., gambling Manager, comes over without being called and asked what the problem; I was surprised as no one called him. When my husband and both tries to explain, this tone got nasty! I was so embarrassed! It was only $3 each hand that had been lost that I could take out. I never asked for it, I didn't ask for him yet when we tell him what he doesn't want to hear belittles customers. I have spent thousands as a customer and they lost me over Steves tone. Everyone in the machine was in shock over his tone. Never coming back!

Smoker's alley inside an entire hotel. Look who smokes: Men, Women, Old Fogies and Old Ladies. Watch the slot machine aisles, that's where it's worst. It's not impossible to find some good old fashioned sin at this place -- i.e., $10 b.j. tables (that's short for blackjack), frozen chiller alcoholic drinks, dancer cages, the Voodoo Lounge. Hey, about the Voodoo, it was 120 degrees during the day, which means, at night the 51-floor rooftop where I danced til I dropped cools down to about... 105 degrees (I dropped after two minutes, it's like an open oven up there). Hey, my visit was the end of June, so of course it was extra hot & muggy. I think I paid $13 for a drink up there at Voodoo, but I'm unable to recall what it was. Smokey memory, err, foggy memory. The valet is short on employees, it took forever to escape. #likereally

I would not stay here again.  although the rooms are quite large it feels old they need some serious remodeling felt like i was in the 70's but that's not the worse of it they are so cheap.

There's no WiFi- Big NO NO.    extra charge for it and often gave us problems.

The toilets flush so loud... too loud!  

they give you this cheap little shampoo maybe a cream and soap that's it, not all the standard things you get at most hotels like shower caps, I use My shower cap every time at a hotel.  especially Vegas you spend so much time straightening your hair you don't want to get it wet right before heading out for the evening. 

coffee and tea always in every hotel I've stayed at.  It's there for you to make for your self this hotel in the mini bar you have to  pay for it WTH!!!!???? 
I don't get a breakfast , a buffet, a shower cap,WiFi, NOTHING! the least they can give me is some damn tea in my room, 

We payed all that money to stay there no deals no discounts so disappointed!

We stayed a couple nights here about four months ago and it was fine. The rooms are large and some have been recently renovated, with newer \/ updated bathrooms, although a lot of the furniture \/ fabrics still seemed dirty & old. We didn't really spend much time at the Rio, but it's a relatively inexpensive place to stay in Vegas with free parking. It's a bit of a walk to the strip, but they do have a shuttle or it's an easy taxi \/ Uber \/ Lyft ride to most places.

So, I would have probably recommended this place until about a week ago when we got a letter in the mail saying there had been cases of Legionnaire's Disease at the hotel around the time we stayed there and their water has tested positive for the bacteria. Neither of us got sick but this is so gross. We won't be staying there again.

Not the best, by far not the worst either.

I am in this hotel probably 20 times a year as this is the hotel of choice for the guy i fly for.

the staff has always impressed me.  Whether it's the limo drivers, the valet service, concierge, or the host....they have always gone above and beyond.  I do take that with a grain of salt as the guy i work for is 7 stars, but that is the only service i have seen here, and this holds true when i am not with my boss.

the rooms here are large.  it's true they aren't exactly suites and are pretty much just really big basic rooms, but let me tell you from someone who is hotels much of the year, i would choose a large basic room over a small basic room any day.

It's true they the beds arent that comfortable, and they charge me $14 a day for internet which i think is ridiculous but it's a casino...they want to keep you on the floor.  I figure i can't complain too much as there is 100 hotels out here and i chose to stay here.  

I have never had a problem with cleanliness here.  If you want to get something a bit more like a sweet as for something on the 20th floor as the rooms here are much fancier (though the basic room is still just a big square).

They do have lots of actual "suites" here....but you arent going to get them for $30 online.

the ipanema tower is where we prefer to stay.  They have two towers here, and this one is much nice, and in the middle of the hotel.

Everywhere i have eaten here is amazing.  Buzios is top notch sea food, Martoano's is a fun Italian place with great food, loud music (not so great for chit chat..but it is lots of fun).  the all american grille serves awesome steaks (chicken fried steak is amazing) and they are open all night.   There is a couple fast food places if you look really hard (down at the end by the masqurade tower upstairs, though expect the prices to be jacked high too). 

i don't gamble much, but the table rates fluctuate greatly depending on the weekend you are here.  If the casino is packed, then the rates are high.  If you want low table rates you have to come at a time when the casino is slow.

Either way there are much better places to stay in vegas, but there are also much worse places.  I have always thought even with internet rates, hotel fees and such that if you aren't getting your room comped and have to pay for it...a total charge of $60 a night is cheap anywhere you go.

The rooms are huge! It's cute...but dead and boring, which is not how I roll in Vegas. The service was almost non-existent. I don't remember seeing staff smiling or welcoming people in. Just kinda of chilling in a zombiesque way through the building. 
If I had a free room, perhaps I'd go back, but in general...not so much.
The casino was empty.
There was a good variety of restaurants to choose from including sushi and a brewery\/deli, but it just wasn't unique or cool in any way.

Left feedback on Tripadvisor but was removed? Rude staff, disgusting rooms. Upon arrival, I was immediately discriminated by staff, and was given a room that had pee stains on the floor, and a molded restroom and it smelled so bad. Sheets were stained as well. When I called for the manager Cher'ree Johnson, she could care less and basically told they did not have anything else to accomadate me and basically told me to go home. Literally told me my other option was to go home and then laughed Really?? I drove over 400 miles and get treated this way? It took over 6 hrs before she moved me to another room that smelled like marijuana really bad. Next door it looked like someone was smoking when I called her she again could care less and said I could leave the room for an hour (it was 11pm at this time) and she can have someone come spray the room. All I wanted to do was to sleep after a long drive. My whole night was ruined. I asked for her superior which she refused to give me,and also gave me a "corporate" number that I came to find out is the Rios hotel number. So unprofessional! I have never been treated this unfairly, I was going to stay a couple days, but seeing that no one cared for my business, I went to another hotel who treated me with the utmost respect that the Rio did not. Next day, when I told her I wanted to cancel the rest of my reservations, because I did not feel she cared for my business and did nothing to make my stay better, she could care less and said have a nice trip! Really?? Would NEVER recommend this hotel!

We have been visiting Las Vegas at least once every year since 1998 and we still go back every visit to the Rio. Their free show in the sky is worth an admission ticket. It is fun and entertaining. The Rio used to have the best buffet in Las Vegas, but sadly, I never go there anymore; overpriced and overcrowded. But some of the other restaurants make up for the shortcomings! Excellent. And the view from the restaurant and lounge on the 40th floor is flat spectacular, worth photographing!
I highly recommend at least a visit to this convenient Casino when in Las Vegas!

I couldn't find the Yelp "check in" for the Carnival World Buffet on my phone for some reason so I'll just post it here.  Pretty decent food for a mid-level Vegas buffet.  Very wide selection from around the "world" prepared pretty well.  Dessert section is pretty good although it seems to a smaller selection for what I remembered during my last visit about 10 years ago.  if you need a "Vegas buffet" experience without having to break the bank, this is a decent option

Broken toilet, broken dead bolt to the room, no extra toilet papet, a total of 4 kleenex in the room(box was virtually empty without replacement, a\/c didn't work, bed low to the ground and not comfortable...  Good thing we weren't in the room much!  However, Parker, at the I-Bar was great!!

We decided to stay an extra night in Vegas for my fiancé birthday weekend celebration and rio had the cheapest rate and we had never stayed there before. The rooms were spacious but they had awkwardly put the entertainment center right in the middle of the window area, one of the phones in the room didn't work. But what bothered us the most was their customer service. I asked valet if I should take my own bags as opposed to waiting for the bellmen and he assured me it was not busy and there was no long wait to get luggage to our room (Sunday late evening) so off we went to wait in along check in line at 9:30pm as they weren't many people working the front desk. We are in the room and waited 45 minutes for luggage and every time we called to check the status we were placed on hold. Thought they weren't busy? That's not how we wanted to start our evening. We even went downstairs and I was about to grab my own luggage when the manager called me and said bellman was coming up and wait in my room. Never once did she apologize for inconvenience. We decided to hit up voo doo to try to get our minds off the poor customer service, the dj was playing nothing but hip hop. I asked an employee if he would be playing a mix of other genres and she said yes but nope it was just hip hop. A young gentlemen even went up to dj to request some songs including the weeknd and dj replied back with a no and said he didn't have that or any of the other well known songs he has suggested. After that we left. We will not be staying here in the future

We'll upgrade you to the suite"

Wait what? why? I had no idea, but we only paid $150 for this upgraded suite. best deal in vegas! we better not get charged for it.

Whoa, there's a kitchenette
whoa there's an L shaped couch
whoa there's another huge bedroom!
whoa that's 2 LCD tvs AND one TV in the bathroom!
whoa there's 2 bathrooms
whoa there's a jacuzzi with seperate shower
whoa there's adjustable lighting
whoa there's even toothbrush

O M G the panoramic view of vegas! Although of the side of the stripe and desert but it's panoramic! We paid $150 for all this? I really wish we stayed here on Saturday instead of Friday!!!

The hotel itself is alright, parked at the masquerade, big mistake, my bf did not enjoy being greeted by naked guys and it's about a mile walk to the lobby. So second time round, parked in the Carnival parking lot. a much closer walk.

Check in took like an hour. omg. but with the free upgrade, no complaints here!
The casino in itself doesn't look grand or friendly. The carnival buffet is only a one-time experience (I wrote a review for that last year) The voo doo lounge does give one of the best views in Vegas. but the crowd was not appealing to me. 

Tip: Park in carnival NOT masquerade if you're staying in the hotel. or eating at the carnival. Exit flamingo rd. on the 10e

Favourites: panoramic view of vegas! Free upgrade! jacuzzi! omgomgomg! all for $150!

Do not want: hm, the hotel itself isn't too appealing

Last words: Best deal in vegas!
This is one of the places I enjoy when in Las Vegas. The rooms are a nice size with a great view. The casino and pool area too are quite fine. Not on the strip but who cares.

Checked in and went to players club sign up. They tried to sign me up for a Visa card. Found out 25$ a night extra fee auto added for Wifi then they tell you it's slow and you can pay more for actually usable speed. Got hounded every 100 feet to sign up for this or that culminating with a harassing lotion peddler that  finally told to F OFF after he was blocking us from walking.
Room has an uncomfortable window from shower to living area so unless your sleeping together haha who designed this crap?
Booked a week early for strip view and yeah, you can see it if you stand against the glass and strain to look sideways.
I like to party, hey I'm in Vegas, but every night till 3AM the Voodoo Lounge is so loud we have bass thumping in our room 10 stories below it.. WTF?
Also a nice touch, the zip line goes right along side the Masquerade Tower so we hear people screaming as they ride it! SERIOUSLY another WTF.
Breakfast Buffet was a nice 65$ for 2 not including tip.
The overhead carnival was discontinued so now the ambience is dark dirty looking something from New Orleans? IDK... This place is heading downhill fast and needs to just go away. 
entire walk way from the east parking garage into the hotel has all the lights out both nights of our stay. didnt feel safe.
Wish there was a negative star review, I feel like they should have paid me to put up with this stuff. It really was this bad and this is my first bad hotel review!
STAY ELSEWHERE!

The old girl needs a facelift. The hotel decor is tired on the inside - room had poorly functioning AC, 150,000 watts of old bulb lamps that heated up the bathrooms, and crappy beds.  Also the hotel had no water for 20 minutes while I was there.   It WAS good for our conference though - good food at conference, good staff, and can't beat those room rates. Still though would not say here other than for conference.

This was my second stay at the Rio.  Two years ago, we really enjoyed our stay.  This year.... not so much.  We'd requested a smoking room, waited 2 hours, and still didn't get the room we'd reserved.  Got to the room, the safe didn't work, make-up mirror was broken and there was electrical tape repairing the carpet.  When I called about the safe, I was told I should have been told upon check-in (NOT).  When I complained (because, really, I didn't want to carry all my cash around Vegas), management's response was pretty much non-existant.  Overall service was just so-so (except for the spa).  Too many hotels in Vegas to put up with attitude.

Nice rooms and huge casino. Pool is nice and same with the arcade for kids.  Great food.  I would recommend both the buffets, just be ready to wait in line unless you're platinum or above in they player's club.

We stayed here last summer, and it was Ok, but definitely not the best. 

We checked-in at around 8pm, thinking the lines were going to be short. No. We spent about an hour checking in. Our room was equipped with two queen sized beds, and it was a fairly large room in the Ipanema tower. The carpet was in need of replacing, or just a deep cleaning. I wore my sandals at all times, never barefoot. The housekeeping ladies were extremely nice and helpful though. 

$30 daily resort fee added on, and I wasn't really impressed with what was offered with it. The pool closed early, the wi-fi was for one device and really didn't work well, and that's about it. 

As for gaming, a lot of people were still smoking (something I thought was strange), but we had luck with payouts on some machines. 

Would I stay here again? Probably not. It's a block (which is a LONG way) from the strip, and they do offer shuttles that take you to other casinos, but I would prefer to stay on the strip. Between the daily rate (which was do-able) and the daily resort fee, we could have stayed on the strip. Now I know.

The Rio seems to value the phrase "I'm sorry to hear you're having this issue" rather than correcting it. During my 3 days stay, I have continually been unable to charge to my room even though I'm on the reservation as well as guaranteeing all charges with my credit card. I've been promised it will be resolved on the first night by the front desk, the second night by the front desk manager and the third night by a manager in customer relations.I will never stay at a Caesars property again! I've stayed at all least 25 properties on or near the strip. Never have I encountered this type of lack of service.
BTW - we asked for a blanket since no comfortable was on our bed and was told they were all out of blankets. They brought 3-additional sheets to the room for warmth. What type of hotel runs out of basic amenities. The Rio does!
Have additional rooms book at Caesars in January for a convention and I'm cancelling them.
Horrible service, they have a line for check in and its useless, and we get different answers from guest services, we will never stay here again

Penn and Teller are the only highlight here. Very average overpriced food and outdated rooms. Came in the entrance next to the Chinese restaurant and the entry way was littered with trash. Very little attention to detail which is not what we expected.
Steve Wynn or Donald Trump would never allow this at one of their resorts.

This wasn't the worse hotel I've stayed. But it was definitely my least favorite amongst the hotels I've previously stayed in Las Vegas 

I booked a last minute ticket and hotel. And this is where I ended. The price was great online. But what Expedia failed to add to the price upfront was the 34 dollar a day resort fee. It kind of sucked because I didn't even stay at the room neither night in Vegas. (Hey!! I was on vacation) 

The staff really does harasses you a lot about coupons or getting a free room. It's cute at first. But eventually get very annoying. 

The hallway on the tower I was in was a bit dated. But it wasn't trashy or anything. It was kind of like staying a Hilton that hadn't been renovated yet. But not outdated. 

Would I choose this hotel again. Probably not. But if I just needed a place to lay my head. I suppose it would be okay.

i really didn't even want to write a review.

Pro's: Large rooms.
got lucky at check in. The line was about an hour long. Guest services pulled us and about 5 others out of the back of the line and took us to the VIP check in. Check in took less than 5 minutes after that.

Con's: almost to many to list

Smelly. Outside smells like smoke and farts.
Rooms need updating and to be better taken care of.
The check in line was ridiculous. 


I have stayed here once before. If it hadn't been for a cheap deal on priceline I would have picked somewhere else.

I most likely won't stay here again.

ps. I have read the reviews about having no wifi or an extra charge. That's really not accurate. It's free with the resort fee, but you can only use 1 devise per day.
Nicer than the Palms Penn and Teller show was fabulous and entertaining Walking through Casino with teenage boys was awkward

It takes 30 minutes or more just to check in to this place. 3 people working the front desk. And this is at 9pm on a Monday. I can't imagine what a busy night looks like. When I got to the room I quickly realized how filthy it was. I've posted several pictures. It was also in disrepair. The toilet paper holder was broken, the tub drain was also broken, and the shower head was in bad need of replacement. The mini bar was missing many item. Hopefully they don't bill me for that, I'll post an update

I like the Rio.  Its really affordable.  When in vegas who cares where you stay when you aren't supposed to be spending any time in your room anyway?!

Its really really affordable.  

The Voodoo Lounge is tons of fun, and its all about fun without the pretentious nature of the strip.  :)

The pool area is large with some nicely placed hot tubs away from the pool so you can really relax.  Not quite a grotto but close.

The best part about this hotel is that Penn and Teller are here!  I've been to Vegas quite a few times now and have not missed them once!  I always bring Penn a bottle of Jelly Apple Red #054 by Essie.  :)

LEGIONNAIRES DESEASE? LONG LINES AT CHECK IN? CHANGED ROOMS 3 TIMES? Yes! All this and more!!

We usually stay at the Palazzo but as it was our first time playing in the WSOP (World Series of Poker) we figured it would be more convenient to stay here. Major mistake. Never again. Here is a list of all the fails:

1. If you like to see shirtless tattooed men with bear belly's walking around in flip flops this is the hotel for you. I guess the low prices bring in low class. 

2. Lines at the front desk were always long. Not enough staff.

3. Um, are you kidding me? Which I believe is what I said when they told me that my pre-paid room wasn't available but for an additional charge we could be upgraded. I called BS on that one and asked for the manager. I promptly told him that was a bait and switch and was totally illegal. After rounds of negotiating and debating my room magically appeared. 

4. Then we were told we would have to change rooms in the middle of our stay due to a "maintenance issue" which later turned out to be legionnaires decease in the water. Really? 

5. Then we had to change rooms again after that. As we were staying for a week this was a major inconvenience. 

6. Went to Guy's Burro Burracho, the wait was long and the food was mediocre. 

7. Best option was pizza by the sports bar. 

The RIO is gross and we will never stay there again.

Lived here for years, have never stayed here before. We decided a little staycation was in order so we booked a room. Not a bad place to stay, nothing super great either. The room decor and overall feel is a little dated (we stayed in the Masquerade tower). We were comfortable enough, no noisy neighbors, bed was fine, we slept well. Nice sized room too. Fridge, safe, hair dryer, two sinks.
The staff was friendly. The pool area was decent, again, a little older looking but decent enough. Food and drink prices weren't too bad, I want to say $7 a 16 ounce beer. Got an order of chicken fingers and fries at the pool bar, $9 for 4 good sized fingers and fries. Not bad. Overall I'd probably stay again.

$20 per night hidden fee revealed at check in per night adding $100 to the trip.  Food overpriced at all the hotel restaurants, high prices in the one store.  Non-smoking room has cigarette burns on all the furniture, frayed fabric.  No fan in bathroom, sinks don't drain, fridge doesn't work. Not allowed to bring gatorade in plastic bottle to the pool area so you have to buy more overpriced refreshments inside.  TV\/Cable frequently shutting off, as does the $14 per day wifi.  Never again...

Upon checking in we were told the only option (despite our making the reservation a long time ago) was either a smoking room or a room on the pet floor. So, despite our allergies and aversion to smoking we had to take the pet room (at no reduced cost) and then pack up all of our stuff to be moved to a different room for the next day. Our room was rundown, circa 1980, burned out light bulbs, and had old food in the refrigerator. There was a bag of garbage that lived outside our door and I could hear the casino music even with my earplugs. If you're looking for a comfortable stay at a decent place don't choose Rio.

Update: moved to a new room where the keys never, ever worked. Had to change them out 4 times. Beware- go somewhere else.

I've seen previous reviews and I don't get where these people giving 1 & 2 stars are coming from.
We checked into the Rio on Saturday 9\/9.   There weren't long check in lines, but we opted for Kiosk check in, which took less than two minutes to scan drivers license and it provided us with two room keys.   A few employees were in the lobby to direct guests to towers and answer any questions.   We found our room with no trouble and it was BEAUTIFUL!  LIving area, dining area, wet bar, bath and a half (the main bathroom had a massive shower with a rain tower.  A separate bedroom with a jacuzzi.  Free WIFI.   Three TVs - living\/bed\/bath.   Everything was spotless!  Each day our room was cleaned before we returned to change for dinner and each time it was as clean as it was when we first arrived.  We had a great time in the casino, while we also went to Harrahs, Paris & Flamingo and spent hours at each - The Rio was the only one where we were offered drinks while gambling - the other casinos were offering I'm sure, but their staff must have been on long breaks.   We ate at smash burger - tasty stuff.   The All American Grill was great for bacon & eggs at 11pm as well as a huge steak & cheese sub.  The Chinese restaurant was good, but pricy - however, we were invited to 'ask questions' which I thought was mainly about some of the traditional dishes (you won't find Chow Mein\/Lo Mein\/Egg Foo Young -Chinese fast food here) Though we ordered Sweet & Sour Pork (highly recommend) it's not like what you can get down the street.   It was delicious, as was the Young Chow Fried Rice.    Everything is ala carte. We also ordered the Cashew Chicken, which was good, though bland.   If you go, just one order will feed at least three hungry people.   The pork and rice we each had 2 hearty serving of and almost half the bowl was left of each.   They encourage sharing as you each have a plate and bowls of entree and rice are separate with large serving spoons.  So, we didn't need the Cashew Chicken entree and spent $20-something more than we needed to - but really not disappointed, just never thought to ask how large the portions were. It was after 9 pm when we arrived, so there were no tables near us to see what the servings looked like, though several tables became occupied before we finished.  
The Starbucks lines were insane and I prefer DD anyway, so while our room had a coffee pot, we opted to hit the casino floor to gamble and got coffee from servers - all who made it back to where we were before our cups were empty.   We've stayed at Ballys, Luxor, Flamingo, Treasure Island & Caesars prior - no complaints about any, but for the $ (under $500 for SSM nights) and the fun we had, we'll definitely be making our next reservation in Las Vegas at the RIO!

The Rio is the go-to spot whenever my guy makes a trip out to Vegas. Being the huge poker fan that he is, coming to Rio is a no brainer due to this being the home of the WSOP (World Series of Poker). For anyone who has a love for this card game (beginner or pro) or simply wants to test out your luck- look  no further. Rio is sure to please with the daily poker tournaments, has non-stop poker action, and offers just about any poker game you can think of. 

So what about all the non poker enthusiast like myself??
When i found out we would be staying here for the weekend I was definitely let down and very skeptical. All I could think about was: 1) how far it was from the strip as opposed to actually staying on it.  2) The hotel just comes off unappealing IMO.

Fast Forward:
This is not the most fabulous looking hotel from the outside but the amenities in the room and the size in itself is awesome. Our room had a beautiful view of the multiple pools- yes!! i said MULTIPLE!! The room was good in size and includes a nice size\/super cold fridge, huge comfy couch, & the BEST vanity mirror. 
There are a number of things to do and see within the hotel: Penn & Teller Comedy and Magic Show, Chippendales male strippers, WOW (World Of Wonders) choreographed acrobatic show, VooDoo Zipline which will provide you with complimentary access to VooDoo Rooftop Nightclub. Last but not least, the table games such as Black Jack, Craps, Baccarat, Pai Gow are always lively and entertaining.

I was absolutely blown away and would definitely come back in a heartbeat. There was nothing but positive experiences here at Rio.

My stay in this hotel for the superbowl weekend was ok. Honestly, I dont know what else to write.. Had fun playing roulette with the boyfriend... And there were some hoes there offering my man friend(is that a word?) BJ's for $50.00..where these hoes come from? Anyway, I dont know if I would stay here again but my stay was ok. Penny the housekeeper was a cool lady, talking to you Miss Penny made my day better.. 
Well alright folks, that's pretty much it..:)

Customer service is ridiculously slow and incompetent. Called three times for extra sheets and pillows and waited over an hour and a half just to get sheets. Waited up until 1:30am just to get sheets so I can go to bed. The room however was nice and had a good view, but they definitely need to work on their customer service.

I was just there this weekend. I really liked this hotel!

Clean, housekeeping was nice.. All staff I encountered was super!!!

What is happening with the Rio ? Or maybe I should say what happened ?  Am I seeing the death of a big resort first hand?  Is this the sad ending to a once extremely popular hotel ?  

I will say some good things still exists here. Buffet still rocks (Minor issue, see below)  All American Bar and Grill is still good for Sunday Football. Room was very clean and housekeeping took care of everything to a T. The personnel that worked the front desk, valet, and our waitress were great and I am glad that the Rio has kept up the tradition of good friendly hotel staff. 

It used to be such a nice change of pace staying away from the strip away from the hustle and bustle and you never even had to go to the strip because there was always so much to do here. Look I was a fan and stayed here many many times over the years. The pools were always so much fun, and now later in the year (November and it was 78*) even though the weather is still co operative, pools are closed and one is drained and empty. Shops are now empty, and what shops are open are having 50% off sales and pushy sales people hocking their crap. Escalator has been "roped off" for four days now. No soft serve at the buffet!  WTF!!!  Trash cans have been filled to capacity like they cut back on janitorial staff. The rooms have been advertised as recently renovated. And by that, I mean leave the chipped tile on the bathroom floor but throw a coat of paint on other things.  Free wi fi for only one device per day that you still pay a resort fee for so ultimately it isn't really free. And it's spotty service at best. 

And no more show in the sky ?  Really ?  Has the economy been so bad that they eliminated something that originally put them on the map ?  Sad. I would like to have the old Rio back that was synonymous with A Good Time.  Everyone has a place they stay at in Vegas. And I used to always say, without hesitancy, The Rio.

What was the main reason I had to check out this hotel???  

Well, it was actually because my wife had stayed here a few years ago and had their Buffalo Hot Wings for Room Service and they were one of the very best she's ever had.  

Soooo.......  
After ordering it and trying it, I would have to agree with her.  They were indeed really, really great!!!  

The rooms here, at least the one we got was okay.  It is REAL BIG!  I'll give them that.  All their rooms are suites and ours was no exception but it is somewhat outdated.  Of course, the prices are okay to match the outdated rooms so I can't complain too much.  

But definitely no WOW factor.  And the bed was not too comfortable so that's a BIG FACTOR in how I would rate a hotel.....

I stayed out there last weekend with my boyfriend. Hotel was great!! The lady that checked is in was so nice and helpful. The bellmen were super nice too. I love the pools too. Went to their restaurant and that was great too! The only person that was rude was either a pbx operator or front desk person that answered my call from the room and her name TINA. Still haven't forgotten her name because she was so rude. Anyway, we do plan on coming back though. Thank you

I am staying at the Rio for a conference and must say I was really apprehensive about staying here after all the negative reviews.   However I have been totally pleasantly surprised!  At checkin it was very busy, they opened their VIP lounge and checkiin and the lines really were taken care of quickly. Now for the room.   It is huge!  Floor to ceiling windows, two vanities with sinks, a bar, coffee maker,   It was also very clean. As for the Casino, I'm not a big gamer but it looked exciting and fun. All the staff I have come into contact with jace been friendly and helpful.  I've stayed at the Mirage before, and the Rio isn't on that standard, but I didn't judge it the same because the Rio was less than half the cost.

Felt a bit cheesy and was quite a letdown after seeing the exterior and expecting so much more. The rooms were adequate, but nothing too memorable. I do seem to recall that the lobby area is somewhat confusing and winding, generally unfriendly to navigate. Alas, they're probably hoping that you get lost and manage to find your way to the casino floor.

It seems the art (or science of good customer service has been lost forever. After waiting until almost 5:00 to check in, a perusal of the room was adequate, until turning down the bed and finding the sheets were not clean. Housekeeping was notified and after 90 minutes was remedied--all for a 30 dollar credit on the bill. Really??? Has prebooking eliminated follow up, courtesy, and satisfaction???

I love coming to Vegas!! We always have so much fun . We stay at the rio because the price is nice!! The rooms are comfy and they have great views! The buffet is also very delicious!! We enjoy staying here every time!!

Good size rooms for the price. Easy parking. Sports book good for hanging out to watch some games. Maintenance dept is poor. Tried for two days to get through to have them fix safe but no luck. Overall, good but not great.

2 1\/2 stars.  Received a comped room, so I can't squabble about the price.  As far as I know, however, prices are always pretty reasonable here versus something on the strip.  

Here are some highlights for a standard room in the Ipanema Tower:

*Rooms are large, but not suite-like.  It is basically a large room with a sitting area\/pull out couch.  

*Tube TV, mini bar, in-room safe, and mini fridge

*Shower head was like a fireman's hose, practically shot holes through my skin

*Furnishings\/Decor are dated, but not eye poppingly horrendous

*The room is furnished with a Keurig coffee machine; I brought some K-cups from home and saved myself $8.

*Valet service is great, everyone is super nice.  Front desk and bell desk were exceptional as well.

Overall, it was just okay.   I do not like being so far away from the strip, and the room was just meh.  Can't beat a free room though, I guess.

This hotel couldn't put any of my family in joining rooms and they had gotten a room on the smoking floor in which my asthmatic son and sinus infection other son had suffered. They also lacked in room service where we had to ask for things multiple times for it to be delivered, and to get to your car or any where else in the hotel in requires a long commute by foot at least spanning 15. min.

Our room was old and in need of remodeling. The thing that struck was the cheapness of everything. Additionally, all the prices were jacked up for SEMA week. We will not be back as this was also the case last year at the AC harrah's.

The gambling experience has gone from OK to horrible over the last 7 years since Harrahs announced that they were lowering payouts to increase profits. You can't even get a drink at there bar without having your play rated. My wife and are heavy video poker players typically spend thousands. We feel hustled. 

The MBA'S at Caesars are doing like UAL with the 1K's a couple of years ago. Now they are kissing our rear ends to get us back. One bar tender even told me how they we're doing play rating to clamp down on Diamond members. Same language as the UAL CFO A couple of years ago in the Wall Street Journal. Soon, the business model will focus on just hussein the tourests. The good news is that we have now discovered the local casinos. The D just showered my wife with $350 in free play and $200 dinner credits yesterday.

So, from one of your elite mooch players, good by Caesars entertainment.

Not the best service at this hotel. My friends and I were suppose to have a room with two beds, that didn't happen and by them accommodating us was them sending an extra roll out bed to the room. That was ridiculous. The room definitely needs to be remodeled. From water damage stains on the ceiling to the bathroom being all jacked it was a joke overall.

This place is a DUMP and the staff is really rude.  I stayed in the upgraded Samba Strip view rooms and the room smelled so bad of smoke, the water got hot only after 5 minutes of leaving it on at full speed, there was a broken light bulb and there was something splattered all behind the bathroom door.  The staff was not friendly at check in and were very slow. Whenever I called for housekeeping I was brushed off. Even the rewards person, I found out later, didn't offer me an upgrade based on my points as she should have.  Oh, and the casino floor smelled really bad of sewer!  I refused to spend anymore money there and didn't dare eat! Sooo Grosss!!  This place has definitely seen better days!!!

Paid extra for "upgraded" new room.  That meant new sheets, pictures, carpet and drapes, and glad over old banged up tables.  Size of room is nice, though, and great view.  After six hour drive came to casino, paid for kids to do mini golf and hubby and I sat outside entrance at kiosk bar to have a drink.  Even though we out $20 in machines and I was playing max bet for Keno, we were charged $10 per drink.  Underwhelmed to say the least.  I've never been to a casino that didn't comp drinks while you played the video poker machines.
This place sucks. The rooms are nasty.  And the front desk is unhelpful. I will NEVER stay here again.

This hotel is okay the rooms are spacious which is great  for kids running around but they desperately need updating . Another con  room service food isn't that great and closes at certain hours of the day the room was pretty inexpensive but I guess you get what you pay for

This is our favourite place to stay when we're in Vegas - every time we're there, we're a little more impressed by this off-strip hotel.
The rooms are massive, the casino is beautiful, the staff is FABULOUS.
We've eaten at most of the places there but the most charming one in our opinion is the Indian buffet.    It's very upscale with terrific food.
The Voodoo zipline is about 500' in the air and is amazing, you have to try it!
More fun.....how about glow in the dark KISS miniputt?    Not to be missed!
Bonus - it's a dog-friendly hotel.
Another bonus - a 24 hour Burger King.    I'm not too proud to say that I've sat on my bed munching down on a Whopper at 3:30 am after a crazy night of drinking  :-)

I actually like staying at the Rio. Big suites and clean. Great casino area for everyone! Lively crowds. 

Yes, only downfall is, it's not on the strip!

Room service food is actually not bad.....or was I just drunk.......no can't be....I believe I've had room service a few times here! I surely can't be drunk everytime now!

My first chance to stay here and it was great.  What I really was impressed with was the staff's attentiveness to the guests (ala us). The minute we rolled up to valet, we were told it was complimentary to guests (no charge, just tip the guy getting your car). The room was clean and was always stocked up with towels and extra blankets whenever we asked. The best thing about the Rio also was their FREE shuttles to the other hotels located in the middle of the strip. Every 30 minutes you can catch a shuttle to those hotels or back to the Rio in the designated spots...translation no cabbie fare to pay for since the Rio is a bit off the strip. I would definitely stay here again for sure.

Had mostly comped rooms at one of the Total Rewards casinos (Rio, Harrah's, Plant Hollywood, etc), so we opted to stay off the strip and check out the Rio for the first time.

*Casino Floor: The gaming area is huge, and has more than enough tables for everyone there.  Had a great time playing craps, roulette, poker, Mississippi stud and 3-Card Poker.  Didn't have a chance to check out the poker room though.  

*Rooms: While I will say that they are very big and roomy, they can definitely use an upgrade.  There were various stains on the carpet, and it could use a good thorough cleaning.  The beds were OK, as I have slept on much nicer and comfortable beds.  Hard Rock Hotel has them beat.  But who stays in the rooms all day anyways?? And when most of my stay is comped, I really can't complain.  We had connecting rooms which is always great when we need to steal towels, toiletries, cologne, borrow the restroom or just bug our friends next door.

*Food: They have lots of restaurants, but only the All-American Grill is open late into the wee hours.  Visited the deli at the sports book, both Starbucks, the Carnival World Buffet and the All American Grill.  A small cafe with quick eats would be great here.

*Pool Area: Their pool is OK, as it does have three (3) different pools that you can choose from. There are lots of reviews for Voodoo beach, check those out if you want to read more on that.  

They did seem to card more than usual this time out, but I don't mind.  The Rio was fun, but we did miss the hustle, bustle and just generally being able to walk around the strip without having to cab it everywhere.  I have no problem staying at the Rio again, but next time out it's going to be Planet Hollywood as they are right in the middle of the strip.

Refuse any room on 9 in Ipanema Tower.

Only one bank of elevators stops at 9th floor. Noticed that call button didn't light up at that bank on 9, so we'd have to keep moving to other bank and wait again hoping to catch an I crowded car. Was told at checkout by employee that the hotel will never fix the elevators because it cost too much.

Also on 9, our corridor didn't have any lamp shades over the annoyingly bright hallway lights. Thought they were in the process of replacing but it stayed like that all 5 nights we were at the Rio. 

And forget about talking to a manager. When I asked for one I was told Rosana Sava, the Hotel Director had the day off. Must be nice to be the boss and be able to take busy days like Friday during July 4th week off while the rest of the staff suffers. Will try calling her at number they gave me. 702-777-7880. Maybe if she gets enough calls, they'll consider fixing the elevators.

I've stayed at the Rio two times, once was this past July. Personally, I think it's a great place to stay. We stayed 2 nights for $120 total. There's a Burger King, Wetzel's Pretzels, and other small stores you can check out if you're bored. Unfortunately, there are a lot of people who will stop you and try to sell you stuff. Overall, I think it was a nice view with clean rooms. Bathrooms don't have a vent, so don't room with someone you're not comfortable with. The staff was a bit lacking, check in took forever. The guy working the bar at the pool was also pretty rude. I would recommend checking out through the phone and utilizing the free shuttles they offer that take you to Bally's or Harrah's. If you're on a budget, this is the place to stay. Otherwise, pay a little extra to stay somewhere else.

I got a really good price via travelocity, $30 inclusive!  Upon check-in, I was offered an upgrade for just $75 more for a VIP suite -- done!  The room size was impressive, 1600 sqft, and tons and tons of windows in every room, but was not sexy at all. It's dated and just not deluxe in any way, shape, or form, and felt more like a timeshare, decorated in beiges and browns.  Full-size living, room, dining room, jacuzzi bathtub, shower stall, and 1.5 bathrooms.  While I accepted it due to the price, I couldn't believe that it didn't have a mini-bar, stocked with little bottles and snacks!  I need my overpriced snacks darn it!  Front desk said that they don't offer it right now.  UGH!  Thanks, I just had a pizza and a water delivered from room service for $30 instead.  THAT SUCKS!

Positives:
-------------
1. Lovely check-in service, professional and efficient.
2. Lots of dining options, incl 3 different buffets (recommend the Village Seafood Buffet, see my review at http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/village-seafood-buffet-las-vegas#hrid:ORgHZND2Wh-r-WNeAXTK0g)
3. Free show in one of the main gambling areas (to the right of entrance).  A hip\/hop, pg-13 burlesque show (called "Show in the Sky") -- fun, sexy, but can't say it's amazing singing talent -- hey, but it's free.
4. Chippendales show -- you know you're curious for some hunka, hunka, burnin' love.

Bookmarked for another time:
--------------------------------------
1.  Voodoo Steakhouse - is gorgeous. Walked around and loved what I saw.  
2.  Martorano's Italian - open for dinner only, didn't get a chance to go, but this is SOOOO bookmarked!
3.  Irish bar - Told it has very limited days and hours, and unposted to boot!

Eh:
------
1.  Voodoo Lounge - amazing 270 degree view from the 51st floor, great music, luscious go-go dancers, and fun bartenders - but that's it - 2-3 star (see my review, http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/voodoo-rooftop-nightclub-las-vegas-2#hrid:syIIUeiEBe2eFH60M9JuCQ)
2.  $13.95 extra for wi-fi, and Yelp has blocked the IP range for the hotel.  No access for Yelp!
3.  Location - it's off the strip, so I'd only recommend staying if it's an extremely good deal.
Bad service and rooms are not worth the money. It takes forever to check in. The seafood buffet for $50 is terrible. Most of the seafood is so bad you literally can't eat it. Avoid this hotel.

Stayed in suite 32001 it was soooooooo nice - I was extremely impressed didn't know they had suites like this at the Rio. 
Our room had a jacuzzi which I used multiple times. 
TV game has been stepped up, everything has been upgraded and updated - seriously can't get over how big the room was - plenty of room for anything in this suite. 
Black out curtains were ok - probably would be my only complaint. 
I called room service and attendants plenty of times on my stay and had no complaints of "a strong smell of marijuana in the room" which was nice (hate Debby downers). 
Upon my check in I got 2 free breakfast vouchers to the buffet here which was exciting because the Rio is known for its amazing buffet .... which was amazing!!!

Will be back soon - always a pleasure vegas :)

SOMEONE CAME IN AND ROB US WHILE WE WERE ASLEEP! 

Do not stay here! We didn't leave our door unlocked and someone came in and stole our money from our purses. Security tried to make it seem like our fault and did very little to reassure us that the issue would be resolved! They do not care about the safety of their customers and they don't have a quick response to security issues! I had to call the front desk to be transferred to security - by that time, the thief had already left! We expressed concerns that the their entered using a card but when we asked security to check he didn't want to give us information about OUR MISSING ITEMS! The ruined the entire trip and can't trust the staff to have your best interest! Stay somewhere else - it would be worth!

I'm going to review twice because I feel that this one situation deserve a one-star, but all others deserve 5,so decided to do the two separate reviews. The 1 star is based on one siruation. We checked in at 5:30 got ready went to a show came and got ready  for bed at around  11. The bed was wet with URINE. I don't know if they change the sheets and because it had gone through to the mattress as soon as we laid on the bed the sheets got covered in urine or they didn't even bother changing it  and just put a new top sheet  and called it a day. Don't know either way not okay with  laying in urine. I called the housekeeping right away they came in and put a new mattress and change the linens on both beds, but I'll take it over an hour and by then we were tired and it was 1 in the morning by the time we got to bed. The response was fast don't get me wrong, but seriously urine just disgusting.

I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. My husband, myself and some friends recently stayed here for the weekend. Upon arrival we were very excited for a weekend away. Being tired we got Into out rooms and headed to bed. The next morning we went to shower and found MOLD in both our showers in Separate rooms. We notified the manager who handled it so nicely and was so kind to us. We were moved to new rooms, which was wonderful and we were so please despite it being a but run down for the prices we've paid. We wanted to stay one more night, my husband and his friend went down to the front desk to ask if we could keep out rooms and stay one more night. The lady at the desk was HORRIBLY rude and gave my husband the run around and directly told him the price and said he cannot afford this room. Excuse me but last I knew you diddnt run our bank account. We quickly went to tell the manager about this very rude remark from her and the manager did not care what so ever. It's crazy how much you'd spend for a room let alone a resort fee of $62.37 a night and not be told that the pool and hot tubs are all closed and under construction. Only available hot tubs are the one at the spa which has a "clothing optional" uh ew. We WILL NOT be returning to this hotel, and will not ever recommend this hotel to anyone. You've been warned from our experience. Please spend your hard earned money at a place where you get treated like a guest and get your money's worth.

I'm not sure why the Rio is receiving such low ratings.  I stayed there on the 21st of Dec 2013 for my anniversary and it was amazing.  The staff was great.  The young lady at the front desk named Gina was really great she gave us so much information about the area and things to do other then just giving us a pamphlet and reading off of it. To be honest she was one of the highlights of our trips.  Its always nice when members of staff go out there way.  Our room was greattttttttt it came with a full vanity equipped with vanity mirror and chair to apply your makeup for the night with ease it also had a wet bar in the area and it was super clean.  We went to the buffet there and the food was good.  We also went to Michael Jackson Experience Concert and it was so fun.  So overall from Gina, to the food, Michael Jackson and our huge perfect view room we had a amazing time and whenever I visit Vegas again the Rio will be my choice of hotel.

Old School with a capital O!

But I can't help but love this hotel and casino.

For the deals I have gotten, I will take the outdated rooms and lack of nightlife. Because, to compensate, those outdated rooms are HUGE! And you have a starbucks right as you exit the elevators. They also have the best video poker machines, and it is located right across from the Palms - A super quick and inexpensive cab ride to go party.

I've also heard their basement winery and pool are amazing, and cannot wait to try that out in the Summer.

I stayed at the Rio with a conference in July. It was dirty, musty, mildewed, the pool was closed a lot during normal hours of operation, the food was okay. The game floor was run-down, dirty, stinky (like someone crapped their pants-all the time). The elevators were often crowded and we had to wait in a mob to get on an elevator. There were always long lines at reception and concierge. We were there on weekdays. The shuttle services was poor - always waiting for the second or third shuttle to pick us up from the strip to come back. A cab would've been easier and worth the money. We had a great rate but it was similar to better kept hotels on the strip.  I would not ever stay there again with all of the other options in Vegas. I only stayed because of the conference or I would've changed hotels after the first night.

I have stayed here 3 times now and I love the Rio! My husband and I booked a room for a 5 day stay and we were very happy with our experience. Rooms are spacious, clean, and well furnished. We had a great view of the pool and the strip which made things even better. 

The hotel as a whole is great, the only reason why I feel it is 4 stars and not 5  is because the food selection is very slim. There is only 1 real "fast food" place (BK Bar- which is terrible!) and the Sports Deli is next in line for a quick bite (I only had a pizza slice there- it was okay). Everything else there is a sit down meal or the buffet. I think this hotel would do well with some sort of food court. The best food we had during our stay would definitely have to be Carnival World buffet. 

We will definitely be staying here during our next trip. I love that this hotel is close to the strip but far enough away to where you are away from all the craziness. Shuttle service is great as well- 10am-1am every 30 mins drop off\/pick up at Harrah's or Bally's.

Okay, so I got a free room offer as a total rewards member.  So free offer you can't refuse from Las Vegas right.  So here is my review and experience at the Rio:

Goods:
*  Rooms are very nice and comfortable.
*  Casino has a big variety of gaming options.
*  Very nice spa and the service in the spa is A+
Bads:
*  Maid service ignored my service request when I called for room cleaning at around 3 p.m., came back at 2 a.m. and room was still not cleaned.  Had to wait 45 minutes for them to bring me towels since I was checking out early the next morning. 
* Night club located on the top floor of the rooms,  heard the bass late at night from the music
* Pool bass was loud and couldn't enjoy the movie in my room during the day.

This review is for Shutters bar (center of Casino). For the last 10+ years coming here, the bartenders have been awesome. Big shout out to Santiago, David & Michael. Those 3 been there forever and makes my trip more enjoyable. Hell I even make it a point to stop by when not staying at Rio. 5+ stars!

This place needs major renovations I stayed at the masquerade tower, it looks like a room from the 80s and not in a cute way... The carpet smelled gross the bath tub looked musty I preferred not showering there, I got a groupon "deal" but you end up paying $30 per night resort fee I felt scammed. One thing I can't complain was the bed it was comfortable. Will not be coming back

The rooms are nice (suites) and the staff is nice.  The pool is pretty nice.  I booked a room through bestofvegas.com and this hotel was quite expensive despite the fact that I was able to save a lot on resort fees (using bestofvegas.com).  In addition, wireless Internet was expensive to use (about $14 per person per day).  Both days there were trays left in the hallway (kind of an eye sore).   I'd recommend using bestofvegas.com and staying at Palms Place (a little off The Strip but very nice suites at a great price) or going budget and staying at Motel 6.

This casino is a dump and needs to be demolished or gut renovated.  From the moment you step in you are stepping back in time. Don't let that fool you into thinking your gonna hit it big here. Slots are not loose and bars want you to bet max to get a drink.
Hope to never come back again

I knew it was an older hotel. It did have its hey-day back in the 80's and 90's. The price was really good and can't seem to avoid the resort fees anywhere so that's where I decided to stay. I politely asked for a remodeled room. 60 bucks extra a night for that. haha I could have stayed at a dozen other places on the strip for that price.

The room was spacious... and I mean really big. The sinks didn't drain so I called the front desk. No answer just music. I called again... no answer.... just music. It's what you expect from a big name cell phone company to put you on hold for 10 minutes plus.. but a hotel? I finally called the operator to get someone to fix the issue. 30 minutes later and another call to the front desk... no answer... and someone came out. The hotel also allows dogs. There are dogs everywhere. I came back to my room one night only to hear a dog barking for 1 hour straight. The owner just left the tv on and went gambling I guess. I called the front desk and of course.. no answer. Even Motel 6 has the courtesy to have a manned front desk. 

I would never stay at the Rio again. With as many choices there are in Vegas, why would anyone subject themselves to a non-responsive staff.

Well I must stay this stay was great thank you Parker for the room upgrade because of my problem last time , room was beautiful. I had to take two stars away because the shower and bathtub had globs of dark hair( I'm a blonde ) Who ever cleaned the room obviously overlooked the shower\/ bathtub. I was looking forward to sitting in the bath tub and over look the strip but that grossed me out !
I have pictures I posted separately .

We checked in 3\/3\/12 and stayed for 3 nights completely comp from my Total Rewards.  This is our 3rd stay at the Rio.  Always had a great experience.  Front desk and concierge is always very helpful.  Rest of the staff were very polite.  Good morning, good afternoon, have a good night, good luck.  Wait staff even in the casino always introduce themselves.  Even though it takes forever to get a drink.  We stayed in the Inpanema tower.  Never in the Masquerade tower (rooms are outdated the times I've visited friends in that tower).  They still have tube tv's in the room.  Who cares, how much TV do you watch when you are in Vegas. It is a old hotel, don't expect rooms like the Wynn, Mandalay Bay, Vdara, Aria and other newer hotels. We were only in the room to sleep.  Did not use internet this time around because it is cheaper to pay your cell phone carrier $20 a month to use your iPhone or Android as a hotspot.  Reception and 3G is spotty in the hotel.
