I drove up and valet didn't turn me away for being too full since I was a guest, the front desk was super nice and fast. When I got to my room I was impressed by the size and shape considering the property is 23 years old.

The casino floor has everything to offer, the tables were great and reasonably priced for playing, the restaurants including the buffet are all one of the best in Vegas.

Overall it was a great experience. I would give it a full 5 stars but there were a few items: waited too long on drinks and some of the dealers were like robots.

Had a great suite on a 7th floor corner. Loved it. We ignored the time share people. We didn't eat at the Buffet because Yelp made us reservations and they didn't accept them. Plus the fact that you had to stand in line to pay, and then stand in line to get seated. We went to the American Bar and Grill and had a much better dinner. TV in the bathroom didn't work, there were some lights out, and this morning, instead of getting to sleep in, there was construction work above us. Sounded like the plumbing lines above were being snaked. Nothing like a lot of noise.

Stayed at this hotel for one night. Left for a few hours and all my stuff was robbed. The safe was too small for my important items like computer, electronics. Dont go here! Complained and the supervisor and he wanted to call security it was rude. The door was locked i have a habit of checking the doors when i leave so im not sure if it was broken into or someone had a master key.

**They claim that it is not their fault but not having cameras or doing anything after so many room robberies is negligent. **

Spent 2 nights there,  I felt we were charged 5 star prices for a 3 star hotel,  High prices for food and other amenities,  The rooms are clean but old with low technology, not like the 5 star sister hotels on the strip.  They even charge for wi fi, give me a break!  Unless you need to stay there my recommendatiion is to consider the newer hotels on the strip the newer amenities and the extra comp.  services offset the price difference..

This is a legit hotel for the bargain price. I booked through Priceline and underbid for $42\/night plus taxes and resort fee in late December. I saved 75% easy and for that I give the Rio a decent review. The room was clean, you don't get any amenities like free coffee, water bottles or any of that... You pay for it all here. There was a bar of soap leveling a table, kinda ghetto but it's not a five star resort neither. The crowd here is old and families period, you may see some young twenty something here but mainly foreigners. It's a legit and safe hotel period. I suggest booking through Priceline and underbid for the area you want to stay, if you get rejected you don't get charged... Beats paying retail value.

This place needs to be demolished. Nothing works. Smell is awful and let's just say it can double as a homeless shelter. Also to charge 8 to get your very own money for a place that is struggling as bad as this is a crime ahainst humanity.
WSOP was going on when we were there that was awesome!!  I didn't play buy-in was $10k to rich for my blood.  Free shuttle to the strip from Rio

This hotel has the worst front desk stafff and specially the manager in the morning.  He has no personality and NO WORD OF HONOR. before I checked in they offered and promised us a rate of $89\/night if we extend a another day. Then the next morning I called the Front desk and said to come down  and extend the day.  When I came down they gave me $199\/night and not honor what they offered.  They even called a security for us to leave the place. Then the manager offered me half way and he said $159\/night.. That's not half way!!  This hotel is coming down soon!!

Il buono, il brutto e il bello
(The Good, the bad, and the Beautiful)

I know, I know. A riff on an old spaghetti western is an odd theme for a Brazilian themed hotel, but try to play along...

The Good - It's spacious. I like a room that does not feel like I'm being put into storage for the night. All that space also allowed for extra wall outlets. Now, I'm probably not unusual here, but when I travel, I bring a laptop, an iPad, a cellphone, and my wife. While she does not need to be plugged in, she also packs a cellphone, and a tablet. We may be a little more tech-geeky than the norm, because she also has a work cell and a work iPad. That's 5-7 wall outlets needed for charging devices, and the Rio delivers here - without unplugging lamps (that you will forget to plug back in for the next guest).

The water pressure is the shower is great. Strong enough to blast all of that sunscreen off of you as you head into evening.

They have an in room coffee maker. Now if you've ever seen "The Good , The Bad, and the Ugly", you would know that Clint Eastwood (the Good) wasn't all that good...

The Bad - The coffee maker uses K-Cups, which you have to purchase from the mini-bar, 3 for $8. Oh, and the mini bar wouldn't open. It wasn't locked, just broken shut. I mean really, you theme your hotel as Brazilian, yet I cannot get coffee?

The room is old. The hotel was opened in 1990, so it appears that the room was 10 years out of date when it opened. It is also falling into disrepair. The sliding shower door has no handle on the inside, just the screws where the handle used to be. One of the shower doors is also off the track making it very hard to move that door.

The shower-head is noisy. It sounds like a rocket taking off. If you thought you would take a shower while your room-mate slept, you were sadly mistaken (unless they are not disturbed by the aquatic NASA launch in the next room). You may also want to take that early shower with the lights off, because there is a window between the bathroom shower and the sleeping quarters, so when you turn on the bathroom light, you are effectively lighting up both beds.

You're kind of trapped in the Rio. It's about a 45 mile walk from our room in the Masquerade tower to the doors out of the hotel. You have to navigate through the casino spotted with smokers, who stop in the walkways because that's where they put the ashtrays. Then you have a maze-like parking lot you have to hoof around to get to the street, where you are bound realize that your clean shirt now smells like you just rolled around in an ashtray. From here, you have a choice - just under a mile walk in the desert sun to reach the strip (and then some, unless your walk to the strip was to watch the traffic at Flamingo and Las Vegas Blvd), or a 1\/2 mile trek to the Palms. We opted for the Palms, but found that 117 degree weather sucks for a leisurely stroll past vacant lots, abandoned buildings, and the Gold Coast hotel\/casino. They do offer a shuttle to the strip, but given how the rooms and casino were, I really did not trust the shuttle.

The Beautiful - The view. When on vacation, especially in a late-night town like Las Vegas, It is important to have blackout curtains. But the view of the city lights was so magnificent, I left them open every night. During the day, I could see the mountains in the distance, as well as from the shower\/launch pad.

This place is horrible. Our room was given away after we called to confirm twice! We originally booked for a room with two beds but since they gave away our room they gave us one with one bed. Not only that but when we went up to our room it had a padlock on. We went back down because obviously we couldn't get it. They send us back up with security to get it open, turns out the room is occupied! So ridiculous. To top that off when they finally gave us a room, still with only one bed, none of the keys we got worked! So we wasted more time going back down to the lobby to get keys that actually worked. Worst experience ever. The only good thing I could say about it is the house keepers provided amazing customer service and the shuttles to go to the strip. Other than that I rather pay more than to stay here. And won't recommend to anyone.

Well, I gave it a try and I don't think I'll be staying here, again. I booked a few nights at a very affordable price and couldn't pass it up. I honestly have to say that the room was cleaned everyday and housekeeping was good. However, the Rio needs some serious upgrading. It's so dated. O hate that the check-in kiosks still have you see a cashier when checking in or out. What a waste because the lines are long and slow. They gave me a 1-hour later check-out and a room on the higher floor.  Broken floor buttons in the elevators, tacky!  Nope, never again. You have to pay to print boarding passes. I'll stick with the higher end hotels.
The hotel is outdated. But the Penn and Teller magic show is a must see. We came here for the show and decided to take off the minute it ended.

Our room was pretty dated with respect to the interior. There was a small window from the bedroom looking into the shower which was a bit weird. Of course, that can be a pro\/con depending on who is with you.

This hotel is obviously a bit off the grid, although there are shuttles to the strip. Again, pro\/von depending on what you're doing here. Definitely a lot less traffic to get to than hotels on the strip. The view was pretty nice though overlooking the vastness of the desert, and parking generally was not a problem when we were there. 

Worst part was checking in, after driving for 9 hours I don't want to wait in line for 90 minutes to get to my room. Please consider some self check-in machines. There is no excuse for those these days. 

Also, they could have better restaurants\/cafes there. Pretty empty or poor selection.

The Rio is not one of the hot spots in Vegas but for the purposes of this trip, it served its purpose and served it well. 

This was the hotel that my husbands team stayed out during their most recent hockey tournament in Vegas. The rooms are all suites so the single guys were able to bunk up and the couples had enough room to spread out away from all the stinky hockey gear. Plus, they provided discounted rooms for just over $100 a day so perfect for those on a budget. The rooms and the facilities aren't all that bad either so if you can get past that, you'll be ok.

They do have a work out facility but you have to either pay for a treatment at the spa OR spend $25 to use the gym. You also have to pay for wi-fi. The spa is ok but don't expect anything super luxurious - just comfortable (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/rio-spa-and-salon-las-vegas#hrid:LOKuIdrMxaY8xiUAvHcGug). There are two Starbucks (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/starbucks-las-vegas-44#hrid:CvJgGgBFtQitf0q6XDbKZA)and many restaurants to chose from. I actually realized we didn't eat at any of them, although, I did order a cobb salad to the room one night and it was pretty decent. 

If you stay here, don't expect anything fancy but you will at least be comfortable. Our main focus was the hubby's hockey tournament (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/las-vegas-ice-center-las-vegas#hrid:6v6HbPaPwAOLW6aWR3gR-g) so I wasn't really planning to spend much time on the Vegas strip and was ok with this hotel being off the beaten path. 

I give the Rio 4 stars for the price and for meeting our needs during this Vegas trip.

Run away!  This hotel is not just a little bad it's horrific. I stayed here only due to a convention I was attending. It rained the night after we checked in and we woke in the morning to sodden floors and water running down the large window.

After some arguing the hotel moved us to another room. Seriously we had to argue. Apparently they expected us to stay in the room with sodden carpets and a leaking window.  Hotel amenities close promptly at 7pm clearly they think they are in Florida half the population of the hotel doesn't even get out of bed until then

Restaurants also close ridiculously early. Some as early as 1pm. Even with 3000 convention attendees checking in the hotel didn't put extra staff on check in causing the line to take hours at both check in and check out. 

I was locked out of my room in two separate occasions due to a faulty door. This is the only thing the hotel felt the need to apologize for. After much protesting that they couldn't comp me anything (of course they can its Vegas) they finally caved and comped two nights off my resort fees. That's what you get when you loose access to your room for ten hours. Then when I checked out they tried to charge me for the resort fees they had comped me. 


There was an elevator that kept dropping and engaging and he emergency brakes. We nicknamed it the elevator of death. Even though we reported it the lift was still dropping on the day we checked out.

The convention area is 0.8 miles from the casino floor making ideal for any kind of fitness convention but probably not anything that may include the elderly or handicapable folks. My Fitbit read over 40 miles on one particularly busy day.

To close don't book here if you have a choice. If you have no choice brace yourself it's going to get ugly.

I always stayed on the strip when I go to Vegas but I gave Rio a try since I got a deal on it.  It was not a disappointment at all.  The room was so spacious for the two of us, there was plenty of places to eat and the strip was only $10 taxi cab away.  I would definitely stay here again for the cleanliness and spacious of the room.

I didn't stay at this hotel but my brother, his wife and kids did. The suite they stayed in was pretty nice. Pretty spacious, clean and comfy with a nice view of the pool area. 

The pool area was also another nice thing about this hotel - they have four big ones - one was even heated and a couple of hot tubs. 

My brother and I tried out their new Zipline - it was fun but not intense and I guess a little expensive for a minute ride but it did give you a nice view.

This is a pretty nice hotel - fair price and I would considering staying here next time.

We stayed here with our dog to end our road trip. The room was dated, but clean (thank goodness!). The room was also spacious and had a fridge. We stayed on the 4th floor of the Masquerade tower. It was a bit of a trek for us to get outside to let our dog go potty - no direct way to get out...but we have no complaints. My dog got used to the route and everything went fine. They had a real grass area for the dogs. Parking was good. Buffet was ok.  Not bad for a Las Vegas pet friendly hotel.

We stayed here for 3 nights this past Memorial Day weekend. I chose the hotel because the price was a little cheaper than the strip hotels (and Palms). The little bit we saved was not worth the grief we experienced - LESSON LEARNED! 

Upon check-in, the reserved non-smoking room smelled like cigarette smoke and featured 2 ashtrays. The room looked as if it hadn't been updated since the hotel was built - old furnishings, outdated look, and everything desperately needed repair, including the lovely duct tape plastered atop the windows in the room. The wi-fi didn't work, even though we entered the exact information they told us to at check-in. Oh, and the fridge wasn't stocked with things (albeit severely overpriced) you could buy (hello, it's Vegas!!). 

When we went to bed, around 1:00am or so, the neighbors were excessively loud. They were screaming, yelling, fighting - it all sounded like it was happening at the foot of our bed. The walls are SUPER thin. I know it's Vegas, but I'd still like to sleep at some point. I called the front desk - well, I tried to, but the phone beside the bed didn't work. So, I used the other phone. For the noise, they sent security up (it worked a little, but we could still hear the neighbors). For the wi-fi problems, they connected me to an unhelpful tech support number. I'm sorry, I didn't realize I came to Vegas to pay a $32.48 per night "resort fee," and still have to do the hotel's job of figuring out why the wi-fi doesn't work! Tech support said it was the hotel's fault, the hotel said it was tech support. 

The next day, I found out that the hair dryer didn't work. Frustrated, I went downstairs and complained. They switched our room from the 8th floor to the 21st. The room smelled better and was a little nicer, but everything was still outdated. Plus, we had a nice welcome gift in the form of a pill in the center of the bathroom floor, which housekeeping somehow missed.

The reservation came with a $25 food and beverage credit, good for all but 2 of the restaurants in Rio. We used it for breakfast at Hash House A Go Go. They also gave us issues - because no stay at the Rio would be complete without issues - and had to call someone before they were able to use the credit. Nothing is easy here. 

The front desk told me that my resort fees would be removed due to my less than stellar experience and continued issues with the wi-fi, which never worked. Apparently, they didn't note this on my account. Since the charges are still on there, I called the Rio today. I was transferred from guest services, to billing, and then back to guest services - all because there wasn't a note on my account saying the resort fees would be removed. The final lady spoke with a Rio manager, Will, who agreed to remove ONLY ONE resort fee. Really?? So, I guess in Will's opinion, the other $64.96 I paid in resort fees for the disgusting rooms and NO wi-fi was worth it?! Never again.

I don't care what the price difference is, don't fall for it. It's not worth it. Pay a little more. Avoid the Rio at all costs!!!!

The Rio use to be one of our favorite places to go.  Its gone down hill big time. The rooms need a revamp. (if not at least deep clean) The last time we stayed there we changed rooms twice.  We stopped due to the changed room was worse.  Charging resort fees now.  That's if your not Diamond or Seven Seas player.  Lack of security.  People running up and down the halls in the middle of the night.  Pot smoking smell in our rooms.  Dirty and gross.  The Buffet was so expensive and did not live up to the hype it was advertising.  When I checked out I told them our bad experiences with the room changes etc. and the issues with the rooms and they did not care.   NOW, today we received a letter from the Rio Management (which by the way was not signed) that if you stayed in March and April there warning you two people contracted Legionnaires disease.  Apparently it resides in the hot water.  Horrible experience and will never stay there again.

Obviously the Rio has seen better days, but if you have some Total Rewards comps burning a hole in your pocket, have already checked out the Palms and some of the top spots on the strip, then by all means, give it a shot. Probably worth stopping by on the way to the Palms on a prior trip to make sure you don't mind the vibe.

Know what you're getting: you can get an awesome suite here cheap, but you can also get a standard boring room here cheap :)

I'll just break it down for ya:
PROS:
1. Friendly staff.  Literally every single person we interfaced with (hotel front desk, convenience store clerk, on site restaurant staff, pool servers, etc) was executing their role perfectly.  Friendly, personable.  They give good service here.
2. Trash Can Nachos at El Burro Barracho. Don't miss these.  Diet, schmiet.  You're in Vegas.  Do it.
3. Pools (Over 21 Pool specifically) - I was nervous going to the over 21 pool because I am welllll over 21.  I thought it might be a meat market.  What I found instead was people from every walk of life just chillin' and having a good time.  I never felt uncomfortable.  I never felt too old, too heavy, too unhip, too whatever to just go have a great time.  Very cool vibe.  And DJ Too Tall is the bomb.  Also the Rio has 3 other pools which are great for kiddos...so it definitely has pools going for it.  But heads up - if you don't plan on getting a cabana, get there before 11am or you'll be out of luck for a lounge chair.
4.  Rooms are huge and affordable.
CONS:
1. Off the strip - so don't even think about walking in the heat with the exhaust fumes of passing cars, yuck.  You have to wait 5-20 minutes to take the shuttle which can get crowded at times.  It lets you off at Harrahs, which may or may not be close to what you want to go see....IMO, being off the strip is just a big hassle.  
2.  We went in May 2017.  At that time I had read Trip Advisor reviews about theft being an issue at the hotel.  I would definitely agree with that.  Since I read those reviews, I always kept my cash on me, never left valuables in our room or cabana - and I didn't have a problem.  Can't say the same for the cabana of 3 dudes next to us.  The dudes in our party never left the cabana the whole time and the only people we saw go into the cabana next to us were cocktail servers.  Still, one of those guys got his wallet stolen.  It was found 2 hours later in Lost & Found missing $250.  Mmm hmm.
3. Don't eat the salad!  Or drink water that isn't bottled. I warned you.

terrible terrible old ran down hotel!! there was an old moldy banana in our room and from a distance it looked like a mouse... ew!!!! cleaning ladies don't know how to clean... okay so that was fixed they came and cleaned it up and brought champagne and strawberries because the were "fully booked" and couldn't switch our rooms. that was okay. the next day saturday my family took a trip to the baker to vegas run. it was awesome well mean while i was in the pool and room, calling my local friends to meet up with them. keep in mind i was using the hotel room phone... (not knowing i was going to be charged almost $300 dollars) saturday night my family returns and were hanging out in the room when we come across another old moldy banana! like really??? can they clean up?? the shower handle broke off while taking a shower that night as well. (dangerous) sunday! we head to the desk to check out and pay for the 2 nights we stayed.... then a random amount of $700 dollars was charged.... the few phone calls i made were almost $300 dollars! wow! cheap hotel, every other place ive stayed i was never charged for my phone calls. long distance or not. and then there was about 4 to 5 hundred dollars charged for miscellaneous bullshit. if i can give this place no stars i would... cheap old ran down hotel needs to close down... they don't even have the show with the marti gras girls anymore.... that's what they were known for... now i know them as the worst hotel i've ever stayed at.  never again...

I stayed at the Rio this past weekend.  The room was actually very nice.  I stayed on a bit of a business trip at a pretty good rate with it being March Madness and all.  However, I did notice that some of the waitresses were not as friendly.  I sat and played at countless tables, only to be skipped by the waitresses.  Even a guy next to me made a comment and said "I guess this hotel doesn't serve drinks to the players".  I sat playing blackjack for at least an hour and I promise you that I did not get even 1 drink.  I only wanted a beer.  So I end up going to the Ice bar ( I believe that's the name of it) to order.  Ironically, it took me almost 20 mins to get the waitress attention there as well.  I was going to stay a bit longer on Sunday, but I end up checking out at 5am to avoid traffic and leave since I didn't feel as welcomed.   I've stayed here before, but I was with the kids so I didn't really gamble.  Needless to say I probably won't be staying here again.

Rio wasn't what it used to be. 

Pro: has 3 swimming pools that are kid friendly (meaning that they are shallow)

Cons: 
-bed was very uncomfortable
-water head in the shower was set to conserve water...which is fine but the way it sprayed out it actually made showering longer!
-elevators were super slow 
AND there's no complimentary WiFi Seriously?! In this day and age you can't offer free wifi?!

HOTEL REVIEW ONLY.

I haven't stayed at the Rio in so long. But we were all there this weekend. Compared to the Westin in Vegas...this hotel rocks though! LOL!

Rooms, not bad. Bigger "suite" rooms with fridge and such. The two wings (Impanema and Masquerade) are kind of far from each other though. 

Need more $10 Blackjack tables for the poor folks like me. 

Even though the hotel is off the strip, they still provide shuttles to Harrah's and Caesars. 

They do need more fast food restaurants in the hotel though (the BK doesn't cut it). 

Elevators and some areas need a touching up though.

Dog friendly hotel. Cool! Love the singing and dancing waitresses!  :)

Great hotel. Very clean. Don't like having to pay a $34 resort fee (pool, wi-fi & gym) for services not used. They found a way to legally steal $34 from people. It would look better if they just raised the room rate instead of telling someone they're being charged for service they didn't use.
Have to pay a resort fee, then in order to get a chair by the pool, commit to purchasing $25 of highly priced food and drink.  Just paid for breakfast at the hotel.  Not happy.

Stayed at Rio 26,27 and 28 of June the room was clean n comfortable... The bad part of this hotel is the hidden fees when you reserve they don't tell you about the deposit at check in $200 to be exact and then you get hit with a $60 dollar phone bill at check out which by the way is a hassle.  Valet is free just tip the driver, but when you request your car to be brought back it takes 20-30 min and you must wait on the side under the 115 degree heat so make sure you are patient and love the heat... Otherwise use self parking

Honestly, staying at this hotel was a waste of money. I wish I had spent a little more and actually gone to a clean hotel. I was extremely disappointed with the quality of the room. The shower head had so much calcium surrounding it that the water was spraying very little amounts. The night stand had so much dust on it, you could see the handprints of the previous individual that had stayed. Our "new" and "clean" bed sheets had little pieces of hair on it. I will never be returning to this hotel, nor will I be recommending it to anybody. It is very upsetting to have an opportunity for a vacation and this is what we end up with. Do yourself a favor if you are reading this, pay an extra couple hundred and stay at a different hotel that is actually clean. These photos should be enough for anyone to take their money elsewhere.

Rio 4 stars. Better then circus circus and those other crap, close to new york new york but not close to ceasers or belagio. Rio always has the best shows though, they have a lovly inside aswell and the marti gra performance i think it is, with people flying around and everything suspended above the ground is wonderful to look at visit at least once in your life time, Arcade is fairly decent so kids no worries...then again i was a little boy when we would stay  here maybe if i go back i wont like it as much!

TFR

DO NOT BUY ANY COUPON or deal for this hotel, ( ie. Living social \/ Groupon \/ etc.) 
I purchased (4) at $159.00 each for a group of us to go to Las Vegas. The value of each coupon was for $318.00 each.  Every time, I have tried to book a hotel using these coupons for the past 5 months, that I purchase for $159.00 each, I have been declined for some excuse or another. I have attempted to use these coupons at least six times in the past 5 months. 

Today, I have been on the phone for over 1 hour and 36 minutes so far, trying to get to someone to explain why I can't use the face value of the coupon that I paid for which is $159.00 each. 

I have been told that they have not been paid by Living Social, like the Rio Hotel is going to allow that...yes, and the wheel was invented yesterday. And many other excuse's including moving the date of our families religious event.
  
SO DON"T BUY A DEAL FOR THIS HOTEL unless you have excess amount of hours every week to spend trying to book the deal. And customer service is not their concern.

Used to be my hotel of choice in Las Vegas. A few things have me staying elsewhere, and even passing on comped rooms. No 24\/7 coffee shop?? What!? Sao Paolo restaurant is open for just a few hours most days, and not at all on others. Other food (Sports Grill, All-American) aren't that great, and don't offer the options of what I call a coffee shop\/diner type 24\/7 food joint. 
Rooms that I've had comped are dated and in disrepair. I'll pay for my room at Orleans before I stay in a beat-up "suite" at Rio. Pool complex is too spread out.....18 different bathtub sized pools with little variations at each. Often private events here and there in the pool area....too much BS for me. Just give me a damn pool and some lounge chairs with a bar close by! 
Used to LOVE to go to the VooDoo Lounge for happy hour. The sunset as viewed from the lounge is awesome. Bar is a bit pricey, but it is (or was) an outstanding way to begin the evening......any evening. Now, the lounge is closed until 7 PM. WTF? 
Sad and disappointed, we've moved on to other properties. Bottom line; Rio is a nice property with potential to be great, but there's better off the Strip and in a few cases maybe even better on the Strip.

I quite honestly kept my expectations rather low when going into my recent first-time stay with the Rio.

The things that I knew from previous casino floor visits and\/or general presumptions were relevant - It's a bit off the main strip, it's an older hotel, and some elements seen around and about are understandably rather dated and worn.

However, during my stay I experienced exceptional service; in some ways exceeding that of the finer, newer, far more expensive hotels found on the strip.  It might not seem like much, but think about the last time you had the following offered at other Las Vegas resorts:

-  Bottles of water were given to EVERYONE waiting in line to check in.
-  The maid cheerfully greeted me in the hallway as I made my way to my room.
-  On the way from my room to the elevator the next morning, bottles of water were offered once again by a polite gentleman employee who declined tips.

These small but important gestures will not go unnoticed Rio!  I will be back to wager my hard earned dollars with you again in the near future.

Staying here in the Rio hotel for a convention. It's off the strip close to the Palms hotel. 

Walked into the lobby with my business partner looking for our suite. One of the staff person actually approached us to inquire if we were looking for our room. We gave her our room number and she quickly told us where to go. We were impressed. 

Up on the 19th floor, the view from the suite was nice. The suite was fairly large. Larger than the suite at Encore some of our other partners stayed at. The decor is not as nice, but who needs nice decor when you're just staying here for a convention. The view is not as great. No golf courses to look at, no pools. 

The staff here is very nice. Provided us with extra bed sheets and covers every night we stayed here. 

Would stay here again the next time I visit Las Vegas.

The hotel and casino are alright. I like the large room and that the price for the room can be very reasonable if you book on the total rewards web site. The cons to this place is that anything food or drink related in this casino is waaaayyy overpriced!!! Example bag of chips is $6 in their snack store near the elevator. The buffet is 32$ mid week for dinner....the problem is that there is not any competition close by so they gotcha once you are there and want to eat.

Stayed at the Rio July 14-17 for a birthday. All it all, it was good with very large rooms. I heard that one of the towers was remodeled so I asked for that and got a room that was updated. I also had a view of the strip which I did not ask for so that was nice. The Rio is on the other side of the freeway so we ended up taking cabs quite a bit as I did not rent a car. Did not try the shuttle but every time we went by it there were a lot of peple in line. Tried the Chinese restaurant for dim sum. I knew it would be pretty good because it was full of local Chinese. I booked the Rio through a vacation package on Southwest. I would stay again if I could get a good deal. Just remember that the Rio is not on the strip.

The Rio is our choice whenever we're looking for a cheap stay for a random weekend during the offseason (Winter). While the rest of the strips older hotels are all renovated, this one seems to still be a little older with small renovations to the bathrooms. 

The rooms are huge and clean. We have 4 girls and there's plenty of vanity space to get ready, couches and seating to relax and pregame, and the beds are clean and comfy. 

They're frequently on Groupon too.

Not bad. I have stayed here a few times and the last time we stayed we got upgraded to a suite free of charge.  Rooms are pretty modern.  Hotel is away from the strip, but they do provide shuttles to and from the strip.
They just lack good food places in the hotel but other than that, the hotels are always so clean and spacious for such affordable price!
All the casinos are pretty much the same to me (well, OK, that's not really true, but I'm not a huge fan of any of the casinos). However, the Rio has Penn & Teller, so they get four stars.

BED BUGS!!! Bed bugs!!! And more BED BUGS!!!!! 
Extremely disappointed with our stay on 4\/24\/15 we stated 2nights everything was going great till my husband started getting a bunch of lil rashes on his body! I was scared it might have been Chickenpox but went to the Dr the following day since he couldn't go to work bcs the possibilities of it been contagious! We went to the Dr. To our luck the Dr said it was BED BUG BITES!!!! We called the hotel on the 29th made a complaint! We where told someone would contact us in regards our complaint! 3days later we get a call stating their gonna open an investigation and have to send in the lab to get inspected for an infestation!!! Today is 5\/7\/15 and till this day that SAME ROOM #10007 on the 10th floor in the Mascaraed Tower is being occupied!!! My husband called to check up on the status of the complaint and was told once the room got "Vacant" it would be inspected!!!! You mean to tell me you never quarantined the room for inspection?!? WTF!!!! This past weekend of the fight people stayed there! You mean to tell me you guys can careless on your customers and all you care about is the money?!?!?   This will definitely be the last time we stay here!!!!! I wish I didn't even have to give them the star!!! 
EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED!!!

The best part about Rio? It's an all suite hotel...which is nice because I love spacious rooms and large bathrooms :)

Probably not on the list for the best places to stay at in Vegas, but they do offer some pretty sweet deals. We were able to book a suite for 2 during MLK weekend for less than a 100 bucks total. Our king size bed was surprisingly comfy and the room itself was fairly clean.

There are 2 buffets inside the Rio - the carnival world buffet and the seafood buffet. The carnival one was just your average everything buffet. Don't expect anything too great. I love their seafood buffet though! 

If you want to catch a show, Penn and Teller performs there and you can get a nice discount for tickets since you're staying at the Rio.

And on a side note, since this hotel is off the strip, expect to be paying for a lot of cab rides to get back and forth because you'll most likely want to visit other hotels for gambling, shows, and clubs.

The plusses: the room is about 350 sq. feet. After being around crowds all day, it's nice to have a little breathing room. The sheets are soft, and an abundance of pillows, too.

The minuses: getting to your room is like walking the hallways of the damned. I forgot my room number - that's how long it took. Diamond Lounge is only open for 4-5 hours a day, like the early bird special. 

And, it's a $20 cab ride to the airport? When did that happen?!
I was very happy staying here. They took care of every need. The pool was great as well as the service. Skip the buffet, they need one or two more restaurants here and perfecto!

My family and I stayed here over the weekend. Arrived Thursday and left Sunday.

Upon arrival, my dad (he was the person under the reservation) checked in. There was a huge like with 20+ people and also only about 6-8 registration desks open. 

The check-in person let us know that the room was not prepared for 4 people... although we upgraded our room 4 weeks before arrival. Since it wasn't prepared we had to pay an extra fee for the staff to "prepare" the room for 4 people.

We went up to the room and noticed that our bathroom had only 2 shampoos, lotions, soaps. My family and I always bring those extra items but why charge us to prepare our room if it won't be ready? Our closet door was broken and we had to call for it to be fixed. We called at about 3:30 or maybe even 4pm. We could not open our closet or put any things inside until it was fixed. We waited about 3 hours and nobody showed up, except the shampoos showed up 30 mins later. We left to explore the strip, came back at 1 AM and found the closet fixed.

We were setting up our things and my brother stood on top of the bed and noticed there was cigarette packs and trash on top of the wardrobe where the TV and mini fridge go! YUCK!!

At check out, on Sunday, there was also a huge line yet this time it was even longer than Thursday when we arrived! There was about 50 people in line this time, MAYBE even more! There was only 3 registration desks open. When we complained about the trash in the room the person only said "I'm sorry to hear that, I will let the maintenance know to check the room." We then spoke to a "manager" over the phone. The "manager" said sorry and they hope we can find a better experience next time. When we said we will not be back they did not say anything.

Customer service at the front desk is WHACK! 

The "free shuttles" run every 30 mins but you must be a reward member. Get that the first day! Also if you want to take the shuttle arrive early! If there is no more room you have to wait another 30 mins to load a different shuttle.

Overall, my experience was okay, but not worth anything over 2 Stars. 

Pool was neat, 3 or 4 pools. One is heated.

Casino is just like any other casino, nothing special.

The zip line going from one building to the other of the hotel was a nice touch. You must be 18+ and over 48" to ride. After 10:30 it is only 21+. We went on Saturday and it was a 60-120 Minute wait since there was high winds. (Not their fault so that doesn't affect my rating)

Very dissatisfied.

WHAT AN AWESOME HOTEL!
Amazing customer service!
Very clean!
Huge!
Fun environment!
Starbucks inside !!
Casino and 3 Pools!
Rooftop club!

Exactly like the photos!
I will definitely stay here again..
Was 5 min drive to the strip!
Never got robbed ..
Stayed in the deluxe 2 bedroom

Came here for the MJ business expo this week. Our company had a booth here. First thing is, this place is huge!!!! The expo halls are all the way in the back. Walking through the casino is so damn smoky!!! I was sick to my stomach. I did go to the gift shop, and two of the restaurants, while I was there(see separate reviews)
Employees were decent, found parking in the front of the hotel both days, no problem. My co worker got a room here, it was nothing special to me, especially for 150.00 a night! Very crowded during late afternoon\/evening hours, and noise level high. Bathrooms were kept clean throughout the entire place. I havent been to Vegas since 2005, but glad I chose a hotel that was non smoking, and more of a resort feel.

Now that I know people are listening, let me share my experience at The Rio. I have always enjoyed myself at The Rio. I would start my day next door at The Gold Coast Hotel. They have a great breakfast buffet at a good price, if you're a B Connect players club member. 

I used to eat a coffee and almond croissant at a little bakery\/cafe The Rio used to have a few years ago, but the got rid of it. They didn't ask me, or I would've told them to keep it. 

However, I eat all of my other meals at The Rio. I eat lunch at the food court\/deli next to the Sportsbook. They have a variety of food to choose from. I get something to eat, buy a drink, and enjoy a game... or two.

For dinner, I eat at the All-American Cafe. I always order the same thing-prime rib with mash potatoes and asparagus-because it's so good and I don't want anything else. But my other family members say, what they've eaten is good as well. 

After dinner, I hit the tables. The action is centrally located, so the excitement and energy is concentrated in the center of the casino. As a regular card player, I can tell you, I've always felt that I've gotten a fair shake at The Rio... I've won quite a bit and lost my fair share as well, but never felt cheated and had a GREAT TIME in the process. 

At 3am, when I go to bed, I get to go back to one of the largest STANDARD rooms in Las Vegas. I love all the space, the comfortable bed, the spacious couch with a coffee table and TV. You can practically have a party in your room, but why would you with all of the action downstairs. 

The ONLY thing I don't like about The Rio is that it's not on the strip and if it wasn't such a long and complicated walk to get to the strip, it wouldn't be such a big deal. Furthermore, I hate paying $20-25 for a taxi, every time I want to go somewhere else. There is a free trolley to other Ceasars casinos, but it's like waiting for the city bus, and I don't like taking the city bus.

Booked a comped room through Total Rewards for a Monday night. Arrived early and changed reservation to Sunday easily and with no fee. FREE UPGRADE TO PREMIUM SUITE UPON CHECK-IN. Comped resort fee upon check-out. 

Because of all of the above, the Rio get 5 stars from me. Customer service and front desk staff were fantastic. Check in \/ out were fast because I was in the Total Rewards line.

I last stayed at the Rio more than 10 years ago. I had not been there in many years, and my expectations were low, so I was pleasantly surprised. Self parking was fast and easy. The casino atmosphere was nicer than I expected. Decent shops and food options. The suite was nice and the bathroom was huge. My only critique is though the bath tub looked clean, when I filled it there were quite a few hairs visible in the water. I showered instead. 

A very pleasant stay. Thanks Rio.

Stayed for the weekend for $149 great price. However they placed a $340 hold on my credit card YIKES!!!! The room was huge and very nice. We had a great view. The flat screen TV the picture wasn't that bright & NO COFFEE in the room. You had to pay $9 for a box from the bar if you wanted coffee. The hotel was very nice had a lot of good places to eat as well. Would go back in a heart beat.

I got a full body massage here at the Rio Spa....wow Dexter the man with the golden hands.   That massage was probably the best massage I've had so far.  If in Vegas treat yourself to a Massage by Dexter.  You will not be disappointed.  Let's not forget the awesome  staff that works in the spa.  The attendants are on point. Excellent  customer service all around.

Big rooms with bigger couches for my friends to sleep on, yay! Superb room service as we asked for extra towels almost twice a day! Employees were very friendly except for those working at Burger King. Minus one star for that and the fact that we had to pay 14 bucks for Wi-fi daypass.

Just returned from a good stay at the Rio hotel and casino. Room rates a very reasonable, all the hotels are charging resort fees and I really hate it. We never used the pool, gym only Wi-Fi. $28 bucks well all the hotels are ripping off their customers in Vegas no different here. Back to the pros and cons. The room was big clean with a great view of the strip just across the freeway, Our room was with a king size bed, it was ok, the couch was a bit on the over used side since it was a pull out bed, still clean. Great shower with a bath tub which my wife really likes. The valet service  was no problem as was the bell hop. The food was good at all three restaurants Hash house a go go, Carnival buffet, and All American grill. There was no need to leave if you want a great meal here. I like coffee in the morning and most hotels have some coffee for their guest in the room. However here $9.00 a cup in room Wow!  I'll get dress and go down stairs We did some gambling and made a bit of money, the staff was really friendly. Overall a no brainer Yes We will stay here again, and visit the casino if we don't stay at the hotel.

Once upon a time this was my favorite casino to hang out at.  When I first moved here in 1993, this was more of a locals joint than a tourist spot.  Now, it's more of a tourist spot than a locals joint.

The last time we were here, we came to meet friends for drinks at the Voodoo Lounge.  It's the same lounge that I remember, but it lacked the vibe and energy it once had.

Despite the decline and aging of the hotel, The Better Half and I enjoy Staycations here.  Several times during the year we'll be able to find a great rate and we'll getaway from the house for a few days.  The rooms are spacious and the view of the Strip is great.  

The restaurants here are ok, they aren't as good as they use to be.....don't know why.  The highlight of this place is Steve Martarano's joint......I love the pasta there!

Overall, it's a great value if you can find low rates.

Return Factor - 70%

I'm here for a conference, but if I knew this was what it was, I would have stayed somewhere else and Ubered in. The room is so tired and outdated. All I wanted to do was soak in a large Vegas tub like in all the other Vegas hotels I've stayed in. Um, no. There is a tiny tub, no bigger than an old school tub in an apartment. Sadness. Plus everything in the bathroom is a gross, odd grey color. The adjoining room door has wide gaps so I could hear everything. Check in took forever and the front desk people are not nice or welcoming. No direction on how to get to our room and no one around to help us.  Soooo many super drunk people wandering around the casino. No conditioner, just shampoo and no conditioner to be bought. So if you are a lady with hair like mine that requires conditioner, be sure to pack some. Because you won't be able to find it here, and you sure as hell won't be able to find someone to help you!!

Reserved two rooms for five people got one room with one bed. Over charged by $300. Room and pools are a dump and it's all topped off with some of the worst customer service I've ever experienced. Will never return to this hotel from hell.

This was a great place to stay. I went to Vegas for three days this week and had a good experience at Rio Hotel. The shuttle bus that took us to the strip was good. The shuttle will be available for the guest every 30 minutes.The staff was friendly. The pool was amazing. We stayed at the 10th floor so we had a good view. The maid also comes to our room to clean our room once we come back it's already clean. Mini bars were also available. I'll comeback to Rio again during summertime just to check out the pool.

Wow
Our room was Great.
Large, Clean, Well Laid out.
The View was Outstanding.
The service was good and helpful 
and the food was Great.
Went to the PENN & TELLER SHOW Christmas Eve was Fantastic.
Spent Three nights including Christmas Eve And Christmas Day and enjoyed every minute.
Will be back again.

I really liked this place. Besides the fact they take pets.  The room we got was a suite, as all the Rio rooms are, and it was big enough for the dog.  It had a nice sized bathroom we could leave the dog in while we went downstairs to eat. The dog got some treats and bowls at check in, how cool is that.  Yes I'd stay there again even without the dog.

One star for the I really don't give a damn attitude of the staff at check in.

I made a reservation and questioned the agent extensively about the pool as my 9 year old son was going to be with me.  I knew part of the pool area was topless from previous visits but being an adult it didn't matter to me. I made sure he could use part of it, play under the waterfalls etc.  Sounded great and I made the reservation.

Upon arrival TWO days after making the reservation I was told upon check in that the pool was CLOSED for the season.  The front desk person appeared not to care.  I said the ONLY reason we had chosen to stay there was because of the pool.  They would not move me to another property that had a pool or let me cancel my reservation.

I was mad and still am.

Yeah, the rooms were clean.  We all know that by "suite" the Rio really means big room.  Not a room with a separate bedroom and living area.  Whatever.  

This was not my first time to stay here but I feel it was my last.  It's amazing how just one poor employee can ruin it for a business.
It's ok. Nice rooms, but a club on the 30 something floor going all night??? I'd stay again. Food was good at the deli at 2am. Nice location off the strip.

We only dropped by to get alcohol at the cellar that they had... and it wasnt open.  It's too bad... because we were definitely looking forward to it.  

The casino was alright and the Vallet service was decent.  Three stars for our Vallet being real nice.  

Rio is super far away from the strip -- at least getting there was rough.  Getting from there to the strip was fairly simple, surprisingly enough.  What was with that anyway?!

As a former employee of the Dirty Bird (The Flamingo) I can attest to the fact that Caesars Empire is on its last legs...although our room was "comped" we still had to pay the outrageous resort extortion fee. The only thing exceptional about our stay was the view...through dirty windows, but still nice. The room was a big box, the bathroom was disproportionately small and plain. The ceiling in the casino is very low, causing it to be too warm and smoky. The slot and keno people were friendly, the front desk ok, but the worst was the valet....after a 40 minute wait, I went back to the valet to ask, "Dude, where is my car?"...they couldn't find my keys...after calling security, they located my car, but no keys...after another 25 mins, they found my keys, without the valet tag in a drawer....wow...the security manager said they would "comp me" for the inconvenience.....still waiting for the comp. Caesars is doing a vast disservice to Las Vegas's image, but worse..to all the people that work in their crumbling empire. Not many happy campers when you talk to them....

I'll just say it up front...I love the Rio. I always have. It's not the Venetian or Palazzo, the Wynn or Encore. It has its own personality and they update it just enough every few years to keep up with the newer big boys. I really do like that it isn't on the strip but just a short shuttle or taxi cab away. You can catch a free shuttle to Cesar's or Paris from here anyway. The rooms are all suites and I don't know about you but I hate checking into a room that's smaller than my bedroom at home. It's BS. 

You can usually get rooms here at far lower rates but you don't sacrifice or miss out on anything Vegas. In fact in many ways you experience more of it. Rio gives you a glimpse of Vegas past and Vegas future. 

The card rooms are still card rooms and you get great service. They now have hash hash a go go downstairs so you have a premium stop for brunch and of course they have their regular buffet and their world class all seafood buffet. 

With age i have grown a littler wiser. I know how to appreciate value and I know how to appreciate being away from the turmoil of the strip. This is my go to!!!

As a Total Rewards member, I have to say that I was not totally thrilled when I found out the only place I could stay complimentary (still had to pay resort fees) for this most recent stay was Rio All Suites Hotel and Casino.

First of all, it's off the strip, out of the way, just seemed rather inconvenient. They do offer a shuttle which takes you to Bally's or Harrah's, which is a great idea in theory. Leaving the hotel, we waited approximately 15 minutes to get the free shuttle down to Bally's. We were able to do some shopping, gambling, and dinner while on the strip. Then we decided to get the shuttle back. We lined up at Bally's and waited. And waited. And waited. After 30 minutes in the blustery cold, we opted for grabbing a cab back to Rio. The cab ride was only $10, so we decided from that point on, we would just take cabs to the strip, as it was cheap, quick, and would avoid waiting on shuttles.

Believe it or not, the only real drawback of staying at Rio was that shuttle service. I mean, it's great that they offer the shuttle...and if you don't mind spending part of your trip waiting for it to get there, then it's a great service.

The rooms were big and spacious. All had couches, chairs, refrigerators, etc in them. We had a nice view of the strip The buffet was great..we ate there each morning for breakfast, and did eat one dinner there. Dinner was a bit pricey (but we used our total rewards points). We never had to wait in a long line to be seated, and the wait staff was very attentive. This casino was within walking distance of The Gold Coast...so we did walk over there for a visit as well.

Overall we were very happy with our stay here, and we would definitely stay here again in the future.

This hotel is HUGE.  No one that works here is the least bit friendly.  I had to visit here for my company's convention.  We had plenty of room that is a good thing.  The bad thing is that the rooms for our convention were about a miles hike to get to.  My company is mostly caters to older people.  They had a lot of issues getting around.  Luckily the hotel rents out wheel chairs and electric bike chairs on an hourly and daily basis.  
We had to keep asking for water to be brought and trash to be dumped which is odd. The rooms themselves didn't have coffee pots in them or any amenities for that matter.  A couple of the days we stayed there, they took our dirty towels and left NOTHING.  No towels WTF?
The hotel itself has a big casino in the bottom of it.  You can never tell what time of day it is.  EVER.  It all looks the same.  There is also people smoking everywhere.  I myself am not use to that at all.  They do keep the fans sucking smoke out of the air going at all times.  This leads to the smoke leaving but it also dries out that air itself.  My lips where rough as tree bark and that was with constant applying chap stick.  I used 2 sticks of chap stick while there for a week.  
There are a few options of places to eat in the hotel and tons of places to gamble.  
Let it be said.  I am not a fan.  I will not return.

As long as you stay in the Ipanema tower, your stay will be great! The room was clean  and spacious and the view was decent. Room service took about 45 minutes to get to the room, but if you're getting room service at 9pm it's not really like you're in a rush! Great buffet with unlimited mimosas at brunch!!

This was my first time staying at the Rio. I have had dinner at the Voodoo Lounge and actually partied there a couple of times but never had the pleasure of staying here. The check in was painless, there was a couple of people ahead of us and took about 10 mins but nothing outrageous. The person helping us was polite and gave us a quick run down of the casino. The elevators to the rooms are located close tot he main entrance so you don't have to walk a great distance like some casinos. They have a good array of restaurants to eat at, it isn't too far from the strip. The room's are spacious (though they have my king bed available and had to settle for a double queen). Parking when we first arrive was a little hectic, but we did arrive at 8 pm Friday night. Overall, i would stay here again.

It had been about 10 years since we stayed here. The property has definitely gone downhill in that time. It is a good value for the money; however, you should not expect a 5 star experience. The room was in disrepair. I had to call maintenance within 10 min of our arrival because the safe didn't work. So, I had to hang out and wait for the person to come and fix it. New batteries were all that was needed. Simply having a safe check on the housekeeping checklist would have been all that was needed to avoid this problem. Next things we discovered is the hair dryer in the room didn't work. We called. No one came. We called again. No one came. We found a maid in the hallway, she called. No one came. Finally on the fourth call, a guy came and replaced the hair dryer. He also noticed the outlet was loose in the wall and put in a maintenance request for that as well. One of the mattresses in the room was completely collapsed on one side. I called about that and they offered a room change but could not guarantee the view so we elected to tough it out with the crappy bed. The alarm clock in the room next door started going off about 9pm on the first night of our stay. We called about that. It finally got turned off about 3 hours later. Hard to get kids to bed with an alarm clock going off in the next room. Our alarm clock went off in the middle of the night as well. Seems like someone thought it would be funny to set the alarms clocks to go off. Not the hotel's fault on that issue. The pool area is in an extreme state of deferred maintenance. The concrete around the edge of their sandy beach pool was cracking and the chicken wire underneath was exposed and sharp edges were visible. The material under the sand was also exposed and creating a trip hazard. We still had a good stay. The kids loved the place and didn't notice any of these issues. This is an aging property which has not been well maintained over the years. I talked to a manager about all these issues and she said she's give us a late checkout the next day and credit our account $50 for the trouble. When I went to check out the $50 had not been applied, so I had to call and talk with another manager. She increased the credit to about $60 to cover all the "resort fees". They charge a $24\/day resort fee for the wifi (which works very poorly) and the fitness center which is also in great need of updating. All-in-all a successful stay at the Rio. Get a strip view room. Without the great view, there is absolutely NO reason to stay here.

Haven't been to the Rio in like over 10 years as well main reason is because it off away from the strip so getting here is tough if you don't have your own car. This is a cool Hotel\/Casino they have the Mardi Gras theme they do a little parade thing and throw beads on the main Casino floor which is fun back in the day they were known for the best seafood buffet but with all the new casinos giving them competition it had gone down. This is another place to visit if you're a first timer in Vegas and wanna see all the different themes that all the Hotel\/Casinos do everyone is unique and the Rio is definitely a unique one to see as well.

Nice rooms, large casino floor and nice staff.

The only issue with the hotel is that it isn't on the strip. And why go to Vegas if you're not on the strip.

Because of this, the hotel usually runs cheaper.

First time we stayed here.  Booked it because we got a great rate from Groupon.  Well like they say you get what you pay for.  Very old rooms.  Only good thing...the bed was comfortable.  We had to pay $20 dollars for an early check in.  BS!  If you don't mind rooms that haven't been remodeled over 10+ years, no hot water in shower, bad room service, no drinking cups, off the strip, etc. go for it.

4 Stars from May-July since it the home of the WSOP and since I get the friends and family discount the place is very inexpensive! Plus they don't charge a resort fee.  When you check in make sure you present your players card too.

Another good thing about the hotel is the buffet, the carnival buffet has a lot to choose from and the food is good.

Quick Tip: It's better to Valet than self park, it's closer walk to the rooms.

My room itself was fine, the bedsheets seemed clean and the bathroom was clean. The towels delivered were stained and the hot water stopped working on the 2nd morning and was freezing. I had all sorts of problems with their customer service. They charged me for things that I wasn't suppose to be paying. Now that I have left los vegas I found another charge that isn't suppose to be on my card. If you want to stay somewhere were they will charge and not notify you then stay here. Calling the billing department is a task in itself because they are only open for 4 hours in the morning when people are at work. The lady I spoke with was less than helpful and didn't explain much. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again and would not recommend it to my friends.

We re here for the world series.  Everything is great... We even got an upgrade to a bigger n nicer suite.  Our suite is furnished with modern furnitures, a comfortable bed, flat screen tv n a beautiful dressing area.  However, there s music blaring from the pool!!!  We re on the 34 th floor n it's still bugged the heck out of me. :-(. I was offered to switch rooms but who wants to deal with that hassle?  So next time I ll be sure to request for a room that will be a little quite.

My favorite place to stay

I love this hotel in Las Vegas. Heard rumors it was being sold - hope not.

My co-worker stayed here last week for a convention.  He doesn't have a Yelp account, so asked me to post on his behalf.  

His review:

fucking shithole.

This review is for the new remodeled rooms. Rio desperately needed a makeover the rooms have taken a beating in the last serval years. Finally they got a remodel, I believe only some floors not all got it. They're called samba rooms, colorful and much nicer than days of past. 

They installed stainless steal sinks and nice comfy new beds. If you get unlucky and get a old room than its like staying at a motel with large space and old tube tv and all.

Thank you RIO for coming through big time for me. I had a death in the family and had to leave for Vegas in less than 24 hours; and had no place to stay. I called Harrah's (I'm a rewards club member and Harrah's has seven properties in Vegas), they offered me two choice's; $500.00 a night at Cesar's or $150.00 a night at The Rio. Well with the economy the way it is and it being the end of the month...this was a no brain-er. 

So we arrive and Kwambe at the front desk greets us; I tell him my sad story and is there anything they can do for us. Kwambe goes to see his manger and then returns... 
- Kwambe - OK we have you all set up; go to these elevators and insert your room key in the elevator to access the 20th floor 
- Me - OK... 
We get in the elevators go up to the 20th floor and when they open up we are greeted by a very large lounge and concierge desk. I'm thinking what the hell. We go down the hall and all of the door are double doors, again I'm thinking what the hell. So we open our door and OMG I nearly fainted. We had 1600 square feet of room with - 
* A breathtaking 180 degree view of the city 
* Formal dining room with wet bar 
* Master bedroom with Jacuzzi tub and walk-in shower 
* Upgraded sound system 
* 1 1\/2 Baths 
* 2 flat screen TVs and one smaller TV. in the mirror in the bathroom 
* Electronic open drapes and sooooo much more 

I'm not sure what this room goes for; but the sign next to the door showing you how to exit in an emergency lists the room at a maximum chargeable rate of $5,000.00 a night. Thanks Rio & Kwambe; I got it for $130.00. We didn't leave the room that night and I only lost $40.00 on the Roulette table, Sunday morning. So it was a win\/win situation all around. I'll be back, under better circumstances next time.

I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and every time it's an issue. Last time I stayed here the power went out. This time around they gave me a horribly located room near the zip line that runs all day and night until 12 keeping me up.Then they next morning when I'm finally able to fall asleep the room service MANAGER knocks at my door at 11:30 asking if I'm going to check out.i said no and advised her that I had a do not disturb sign posted and she proceeded to argue with me rudely about check out being at 12. Check out for me is always two pm being that I am I platinum member. She was too rude to let me reply and walked away.

Stayed here for the first time for Memorial Day weekend. Staff was nice and friendly but unfortunately the rooms are outdated and need some remodeling. We stayed in a pet friendly room but the smell of pee was not pleasant. I know they are let friendly but please wash the carpets the smell was really bad that I went to the store and bought an air freshner and spray.... Rooms are spacious but carpet definitely need some shampooing... I wanted to change rooms but did not ask because I had my parents and they were settled in and did not want to move. Rooms were comp due to my mom but paying for one night was still too much with the odor that never went away.... I will probably not stay there again unless the update the pet friendly rooms...

We landed in Vegas at an ungodly hour on a Saturday morning and arrived at the Rio around 2am. We were greeted by a check in line that was ridiculously long, check-in kiosks that only let a select few actually check in, and quite possibly the slowest hotel front desk we've ever encountered. After almost an hour, we make it to the front only to be told that they don't have any double rooms left for the night - so they offer to upgrade us and waive the resort fee for the day. My friend and I were exhausted so we agreed to share a king for the night. The woman said that she would put us on the waitlist for a double room, but that we could keep our upgraded room at no additional cost if we wanted. Despite explaining to her that we would want to get a double, she seemed insistent that we'd love our upgraded room so much that we'd want to keep it. 

We got to the room and it was old and dated. It had this terrible (or amazing, depending on your decoration preferences) pink velvet couch and seemed to be right underneath the Voodoo night club - which you could hear the loud music playing. The bathroom had this strange window that looked into the bedroom which gave my friend and I a chuckle as we both got ready to go to bed around 3:30am. At some point that night, we were awoken by loud arguments occurring in the room next door. We eventually gave up trying to sleep around 7 when we got up, had some breakfast, and headed to the pool until we could switch rooms - strangely enough, we weren't as in love with it as the front desk at 3:00am thought we would be. 

While waiting for the pool, we were approached by another hotel guest offering blow, weed, and sex. Oddly, we declined, but he let us know that he was staying in the same tower we were currently located in.... so after spending some time at the pool, we headed to the front desk to change rooms - and towers! We were moved into a double in the Ipanema tower and the room was way nicer than our "upgraded" room in the Masquerade tower. Once moving, our entire experience improved and we never ran into that hotel guest again. 

Overall, it was a pretty lame experience having to share a king in a room right under the night club at the Rio, but the way the staff handled it and the comps we received for the inconvenience made it worth it.

Maybe it is just me.  Maybe I am just too stupid to make the connection.  Maybe I don't pay attention until I care.  Maybe I am self absorbed . . . 
or maybe it is I know the Cidade Maravilhosa . . . . Rio de Janiero . . . 

I had no idea that the Rio is a Rio de Janeiro themed hotel . . . Ipanema Tower . . .  Buzios Seafood Restaurant . . . come on I should have connected the dots immediately . . . Ipanema is an upscale neighborhood and beach . . . Buzios an upscale resort town north of Rio . . . I have figured it out immediately but I did not . . . somehow even with all the clues it just lacked the clues I need for it to be Rio.  But back to that later . . . 

I got a great rate so off to Rio I go.  The hotel is your typical casino resort . . . except all the rooms are suites.  Great, I like some space and space is what I got and it was delivered in a clean, efficient manner.  Nothing to complain about especially for the price, $43\/night.  The food left something to be desired . . . but hey I can be a hard ass about food especially when the value proposition is askew.  I ate at the All American Bar & Grille and VooDoo.  Look at those review for detail, but the first is OK at best (what it has to do with Rio . . . no idea) and VooDoo . . . well don't you doo the Voodoo . . . enough said unless all you care about is a fantastic view.  

Wait back to the topic at hand . . . the hotel . . . I don't gamble . . . It was a nice room everything was adequete . . . the bed was not as luxury as last week's at the Golden Nugget.  I guess that is the issue  . . . It was just a bigger room done adequately . . . so disconnected from the expectation I formed once I connected the dots and realized that somehow they were trying to give me a Rio experience . . . Rio is SOOOOOO much more. 

I tried to be fair . . . late one of the nights I went looking for something that connects me to Brasil in a heart beat some cachaça . . .  Real Rio is the home of the Cachaça Institute a place where you can choose between 3000 + different types of cachaça . . . Off I went on my quest . . . certainly they would have some of my beloved cachaça velha . . . one bar, then the next . . . always the same . . . Leblon . . . fuck that is bastardized cachaça distilled by a Frenchman and majority share owned by Bacardi . . . aged in american oak.  I can't taste Brasil in it and it is harsh like pinga (a term used with cheap cachaça).  But wait finally some hope . . . Sagatiba (say it properly Sa ga chee ba - not Sa ga tee ba . . . proud of you, keep up the good work.)  at the final bar . . . my own version of the walk of desperation . . . 'Excuse me did you say Sagatiba?  Puro (aged only to the minimum - used in mixed drinks) and Velha (aged long enough to give it a tint and smooth it out to sip it although a bit rough . . . not true velha)  . . . The bartender said only one let me show you the bottle . . . Puro . . . but authentic Brasilian cachaça nonetheless . . . Maybe the Rio has hope to live up to that expectation . . .  I looked at my momentary best friend and ordered an authentic caipirinha . . . instantly I was just a bit closer to the Cidade Maravilhosa . . . 

Just for that I will return to the Rio, the clean, large rooms and Sagatiba but only for the right price.

To me, it was a great hotel and a great hotel suite. In the room, the TV has the AV connections open so if you bring a DVD player, you won't be disappointed that there's a block where the AV connections should be. I've been here 3 times and the first 2 times, there was a window in the shower so you can see the TV when you're taking a shower. The hole is not big enough or low enough as to people seeing you. I'm not 21 yet, but my dad didn't like the casino because the minimum bets at the Blackjack tables were $25. And of course, their renowned buffet is awesome. I would come here again.

Here's the Rio:

Great value (if crashing is all you're doing here).
Hard to find a spot so connected to all the places you'll want to go, without having to pony up for the "cool tax."  But if you're paying north of 100 bucks a room = not worth it.
*Room was a suite and it was nice!

Irrelevant facility.
Nothing really going on here.  Pool is lame sauce, bunk club, etcetera.

Staff is great.
Ricky at the front desk was on point.  Everybody was nice, that's all yo really want in a spot - for them not to get in the way of your stay.  Everyone seems to make the most of their "Off Broadway" status.

*Breakfast at Hash House is a must.
Highlight of the spot.

Only bummer: the ventilation on the casino floor during peak weekend hours is brutal if you're a non smoker.
We found the accommodations to be very nice.  We loved the buffet.  It has a great casino with machines we didn't find anywhere else!! The spa was great too.  Would come back!

Terrible hotel and casino.

We stay in Vegas once a month for about a week for work. We try new spots often and hate this spot here's why.. 

Terrible food, nothing over 3.5 stars, all have weird hours nothing past 11:00 thats decent. People keep talking about the buffet but common, if you use yelp, go to a 4-5 star place please. Please don't eat at smash burger. 

Everything is outdated and sad, just look for yourself, this feels like downtown without the new vibrant scene. 

Rooms are old! Anything above the 10th floor look out. 

Front desk will tell you the upper rooms are newly renovated but that's a lie, don't switch for anything above the 10th. 

The pools are cool or could be if they were cleaned properly, why does the pearl pool have black mold everywhere? Just wondering.. common! Adult pool is cool enough, dj plays 90s jams, but could step it up with all the beautiful edm out there. 

These are things I most care about. Always looking for a clean room, delicious well made food, and a nice and clean pool. Not here, not this hotel. 

Middle finger to this whole establishment, you can have my money this week but won't be seeing me again in this life time. Peace
The price was not bad compared to everywhere else. Visiting you a conference. Rooms are clean not amazing but nice. The suites are a fair accommodation.

When the heck did the Masquerade in the Sky just become a bunch of ho's flirting with my boyfriend? Didn't the dancers used to be Mardi Gras-themed? Got plenty of beads (although most were given to me by my boyfriend, who caught a lot of them from the pretty dancers who fell in love with him)... also found a $3 Fabulous Las Vegas sign t-shirt here, yay. There was an announcement that there would be a parade at 4 pm, then there wasn't one until 6 pm. Nothing like waiting around for nothing. Left, then came back later in the night.

The Rio Suite Hotel and Casino is one of the more successful casinos off the strip. With the success of the 2 buffets the hotel and casino continues to draw in crowds of all ages. Gaming here can be expensive; however, the party atmosphere will make you want to sit down a throw a few dollars away.

The rooms are extremely large which is great when you have a big group of friends.  Not that you would even think about breaking the 4 person per room policy here.  People who care for a view of the strip will pay top dollars to sleep.  People who don't care for a view will see the not so beautiful side of Vegas.  Then again, if you're sharing a room with 8 other drunk guys and sleeping on the floor, who cares what the view is like right?

I will start by saying that the last time I stayed here was over 10 years ago and I enjoyed that stay. This time we checked into the hotel for a Tuesday through Friday stay. Check in was nice and we had already done the "E-Confirm" for an upgraded from which we got. Entered the 1600 sq. ft. room and found it totally outdated and somewhat trashy. Stains on the carpet, holes in the wall and some torn wallpaper. This room has seen better days as it is not near the quality I would have expected. A\/C never got as cool as we wanted and as I write this we are waiting for maintenance to come to the room to check it as it is way too hot to sleep. To this moment it has been over an hour that we have waited! Seems to me like the Rio has cut a ton of corners and the quality that I once knew is not here anymore. Will certainly not be coming back.

Didn't have our room available that was booked months in advance. No upgrades given for the inconvenience just waving the resort fee for a night. Poor customer service. Won't come back to this hotel again.

Alright.....I was going to give it one star and that was only for the 24 hr decent priced room service (I took pics of the menu that I will upload here so you know before you go).....but I am a social worker and am taught to find redeeming qualities in everything. 

The Mask tower is a DUMP. Dump like Imperial Palace, Gold Coast, Circus Circus, Riviera, I could go on. Its so outdated I honestly felt like I was living in Three's Company. I wonder what crazy situation Jack Tripper will get himself into at the Voodoo Lounge\/Regal Beagle. If you can, get the Ipanema Tower, not the Masquarade Tower. If I was in the Ip Tower I might give it 3....not sure, maybe not, I'm grouchy. 

It was my BDAY and I was an invited VIP (not because of my Bday). The whole check-in process was miserable. People who thought they were more VIPS just walk right up to the counter whenever they feel like it. 100 people saw my id and NO happy bdays! It's the same day as today! Hello can't you read! You're checking that I'm old enough!  I had to wait over 4 hours to get a room. Keep in mind that I flew from PA, was up all night or on a plane and was completely exhausted...The need a whole new front desk area. It's too confusing and annoying. Makes me want to give it 0 stars. 

Ok so redeeming quality - Room Service. Now this isn't the best food you have ever had....it's better than Denny's and more like Eat and Park for my PA friends. What would it be to the rest of America.....hmmmm.....Coco's? Marie Callenders. Whatever. Anyhow, it's open and delivering to your room 24 hours a day and almost everything is reasonably priced - much much cheaper than other hotel RS. They only charge you the $2.50 delivery charge and not the additional 17 or 18% unless you have more than 8 people in your room. 

Yes I have 5 free nights and I'm still complaining. That's how much I didn't like it. AND I am passive aggressive and don't like to complain directly to the property when I could prob get it fixed. 

Welp Yelp....I'm off to finish my chocolate cake. Then I will see what Janet and Chrissy are up to.

I've always wanted to stay here because I love the seafood buffet, and the parade in the sky. My wife booked us here for my birthday. When we arrived, there was only about 4 people in front of us checking in. Check in was nice and I was handed a stack of beads since it was my birthday. The room was big, in some ways it seemed too big. The trek in the middle of the night form the bed to the bathroom took a while. The room has ceiling to floor windows. We stayed on the 26th floor, and had a view of the strip. You could see from Caesar's all they way past Mandalay Bay. The bathroom had a shower\/tub, toilet, and sink. Right outside the bathroom was a changing area with another sink, closet, safe, some drawers, and a mini fridge.
The television was old school, and the picture was rather crappy. But I guess it's safe to say that I didn't travel to Vegas to watch TV. The mini bar was under the TV, but I didn't really pay much attention to it.
The casino wasn't all that impressive. It wasn't very fancy and it wasn't very large either.
We tried two of the buffets here, and I will review them in my "cons" section. So onto the breakdown.
PROS:
Very large room.
Friendly staff (that I encountered).
CONS:
Pool was overly crowded and the water was nasty looking.
Raw sewage smell in the casino near all the shops.
Carnival Buffet line was WAYYYYYY SLOW, and the food was mediocre.
Village Seafood Buffet-food quality was sub-par(compared to my previous visits). See my review of that.
The hotel needs some cosmetic attention, and the room decor was dated.
The Parade in the sky only runs Thursday-Sunday. I stayed there Monday-Thursday morning.
