This last little blurb is on all hotels, not just the RIO. I hate those damn time share people.

This hotel is definitely "off the strip" and you need transportation to go anywhere. They have shuttles to Harrah's but it's a joke. Too small for the number if people waiting plus it takes too long between trips...need more vans. There's no coffee maker in the rooms and you have to rely on the Starbucks in the lobby area, but be prepared to wait in line at least 20 minutes. Wish I could put a picture here to show you the lines we encountered EVERYDAY. They have 4 nice pools but only two were open...WTH? And, they close up by 5:30pm! Anyone attending a convention here that doesn't get out until 5pm is never going to see the pool. Even a Red Roof Inn has coffee makers in each room and pools that are open to 11pm! Our room was nice but we visited others that were in need of help. Most of the staff is friendly and helpful but that alone won't make us return here.

I got a free room and only had to pay the daily resort fee, so I thought it would be a good idea. I was wrong. I would have rather paid to stay somewhere else than stay there for this deal. 

We had a pet room since I had my dog with me. First of all, it seems like they don't take care of the pet rooms because they think pets are gonna mess them up. I have a tiny dog that doesn't mess up furniture or anything, so I want a nice hotel room, not chewed corners on the couch and carpet that's coming up. Next, the room smelled horrible. I think this probably goes back to being the pet floor. My thoughts...if you have animals staying in your hotel, that floor needs extra attention from housekeeping! Seems like common sense to me. 

My biggest complaint about staying here is how inconvenient it is to get to your room. If you park in the garage, you take the elevator up to the second floor, but then have to go back to the casino floor in order to get on the next elevator to go to your room. It's the worst design ever! If you valet, it's at least a five minute walk to the elevators. (I walk fast) Being a local and not wanting to deal wth the casino, made this super annoying. 

Other things that happened during my stay, the phone was broken and they were supposed to send someone to fix it but never did. Also, they were supposed to send a maid up for a deep cleaning after I complained about the room and that didn't happen either.

I stayed at the Rio on 5\/8 to 5\/10. I will never stay there again for many reasons. When I checked in I was impressed how fast they get you checked in. Well first thing they never explained how much there resort fee was. They put two hundred dollars on deposit for room charges which was fine and typical. It was the $28 a night resort fee that she never informed me about
OUCH!! That's way more than most places in Las Vegas. It is what it is but man that's a lot of $$. The girl didn't tell me that wifi was free and what my code was to sign on to it. I signed up agreeing to pay 9.99 the first night and the second night was $13.99. I went to the concierge to ask if the about the resort fee and get some directions. We were greeted by a young lady and there was a gentleman standing next to her looking at the computer screen. I asked how much the resort fee was because I saw it on my bank charge earlier after I signed up for the wifi. The young lady was very helpful to my girlfriend about giving her directions. The gentleman wouldn't even look at me when I asked how much the resort fee was. He must have been embarrassed at how much they charge. He just mumbled $28 a night.
The young lady told us that the wifi was free and we wouldn't be charged and
Told us the pass code. So I'm not real happy but buyer beware on me for not checking before booking the room.
We get up to the room very nice it was a suite. I see they have a coffee maker very nice BUT where's the coffee. I call housekeeping they inform me that you have to buy the coffee out of the mini bar to make coffee in the maker they provide for you $9.00. I booked as unite not just a room and no coffee?
Ok so the next morning I get up at 6am go downstairs for some breakfast. Well the place that sells breakfast doesn't open until 8am. If you want coffee get in line at the Starbucks. So no coffee shop open until 8am. 
The girlfriend and I take off to go out sight seeing come back valet the car.
Now it's time to hit the strip. It's $20 in cab fare each way with a tip.
That ads up over a weekend. Now it's time to check out. The in room check out would tell me that I get a $200 credit I only owed for the two day resort fee of $56. It wouldn't check me out. So I go to the desk check out.
I look at my bank balance and I see they charged me $256 not the $56. I called them today and was told it takes 5 to 10 days to get you $200
credited back to you. 
To sum it all up. It's not a value. Resort fees to high,customer service weak at best. No free coffee in the room. No early morning coffee shop except Starbucks. You throw in that their not on the strip so cab fares ad up.
I will never return and glad to tell friends not to either. 
I've paid less and gotten more at other places.
Thanks for reading
Mark Colonna room #464

I really liked the Rio.  The price is great! The window view was pretty nice and is very spacious since they are all suites.  Great service.  I love the American Steak House Restaurant; the prime rib was soo bomb! The Rio Buffett was also great too !! I love the crab legs with butter! =) 

Pretty much the Rio has it all !!

I have to say that service is just terrible! Express machines for check in and check out don't work. In the front desk only two people which creates a huge line. Staff is rude. We wanted an hour earlier check in and they asked 22$ for that. We were surprised since we never been asked to pay extra. After we asked why is that girl on the desk got angry and told that all rooms for early check insurance were just taken! Had to ask for the management to solve that. 
Have to mention the are only two waitresses for the whole casino. We never got someone came to us when we were gambling.
Rooms are okay though

Chi chi chiiiii!!! I love it here!! Many people really dont appreciate this gem because its off strip! But being a local you tend to appreciate these types of casino\/hotels! I love that they offer local discounts! Most other places rarely pay homage to the people who actually live in the city of sin but the Rio takes care of us pretty good!!

Sure it looks radical with its purple and red lights at night but its really a great place!!  They have many things to do if you're old enough. They have a lot of night entertainment such as VooDoo ROOFTOP lounge, and Crown nightclub. They also have different shows you can go see plus a bowling alley for the kids!

Rio has many different eateries that you can try but when we go we always go to the Carnival World Buffet, locals get 50% off and even if you're not a local its still inexpensive!! I have a 5 yr old and they dont charge him, so thats nice. 

I've never stood in the hotel rooms, so maybe one day I can review them! It's a big casino and they have good slots also! They waitresses are also very personable and attentive, unlike other places!!

I will def go back and think you should give it a try even if it is off strip!

The service was pretty poor. The gentlemen who checked me was in very rude. I had a few questions about my stay and he answered with thinly-veiled contempt, and he didn't mention any of the accommodations of the hotel. The room was decent, although the wifi gave me no end of trouble when trying to connect.
Also, when I went to pick up my bags from the bell service, there was no one at the desk, and it took me about 30 minutes to track someone down to get my things.
Rooms are killer, room service coffee, full-on Starbucks, shuttles to the strip. Awesome (specially since the rooms were free) Get the Rewards card my friends. Pays off.

I wish I could give a good review.

Did not like: On entering, strong smell of smoke. Many other casinos can filter this out. Hit with higher fees. No coffee makers. No complimentary breakfast. WI fi is at an extra fee. TV station selection is poor. 
 Every time water is used the plumbing gurgles like a pluged up toilet - including turning on water to brush teeth. Water has a lot of minerals that will settle in any container you put it in. TV does not turn so if you are in bed or on the couch you are looking at a 45 degree angle. Note the TV is permanently mounted on a cabinet and the cabinet does not move. Conveniently located a couple hundred yards from a train track. Train is not too noisy but still woke me up over night once. Hard to figure out where elevator is up to the main floor. Eventually had to ask a food vendor with an answer "I think you go down one flight of stairs..." (this was from the entrance from the self parking)

Some may or may not like: Bed is good if you like firm. If you like soft, good luck. Window from bedroom to shower seems odd.

Now for the good: A friend said they liked this place. Price did not seem too bad - until they started bumping up fees significantly.  Close to the strip with a free shuttle. Convenient gambling and entertainment. I did not try their entertainment. Figured if they want to skip out on what you normally find at hotels, I will not give them more money.

Next time I am in Vegas, I will go elsewhere.

Stayed here for my anniversary with my man and our room was beautiful! King size bed was comfy, and the bathroom was very new and modern. Check in took a while, there weren't a lot of concierge people working. But our room made up for it! We went to the buffet for dinner, and as a vegetarian I usually am limited on my choices but they had so much to choose from and the quality was great too! Then we went to the pool Friday afternoon and they had a dj spinning which added to the awesome experience! The pools are all designed really cool and super clean! The only bad thing was the $200 resort fee. They couldn't process my discover card which was weird cause I had more than enough money. I put it on my bank card and it took a week to be refunded.

Rio has always held a special place in my heart because of the nostalgia. This was one of the main spots the wifey and I would visit back in the day (before kids). My wife even won a video poker tourney here one time netting a cool 12K; royal flushes are possible and people do win. My wife wanted to take the money and throw it all on the bed but we took a check and some cash for fun. We spent many summer days out by the pool and have had cabanas in the past. The Rio has always been good to us and just like in the past on our most recent trip the Rio did us right. 

This time we visited during the Thanksgiving week from Sunday thru WednesdayI. Make sure to use the new self check-in kiosks. It makes the process so much quicker. On this visit we used our Total Rewards players' cards to secure us 3 complimentary nights. Unfortunately, you will still be charged a resort fee of $30\/night so I figured that was a wash for us since we had over $180 in rewards credits to use. The room was decent for us. 2 queen beds, mountain view, 10th floor. What I like about the Rio is the rooms are large. The rooms are mini-type suites. The couches and good sized desk are perfect. Plus, there is a nice lounge chair to kick up your feet. There was a refrigerator in the room but I did not figure that out until our final night. The bathroom area is great as well. Plenty of room for all your stuff and 2 sinks, one in the shower\/toilet room and the other on the outside. 

The fitness center is located in the Spa, which is across from the large Starbucks. The fitness center is included with your resort fee. There are plenty of treadmills and ellipticals, free weights, weight machines, etc. The weight area was very cramped and there was only 1 bench to use with the weights. I was able to get some good use out of the place. If you get there after 8am you might be competing for space. 

There are plenty of places to eat. The carnival world buffet is okay. I should probably do a different review for that place. Room service is not available during the day after breakfast and begins promptly at 5pm and runs til 11pm. All of the employees at the hotel were great. I enjoyed myself at the Sportsbook. Plenty of drinks as long as you are betting. Overall, it was a great time. If you are looking at being close to the strip you should probably check out a different Harrah's property. They do offer a free shuttle but I suggest grabbing an uber\/lyft back to the hotel. The uber\/lyft area is next to the free shuttle and parking garage. I suggest visiting during the warmer months to get the full experience of the resort by taking advantage of their pool. Have fun and good luck!
Only went to the Rio to gamble and check out the Show in the Sky,, earned me some beads, watched some hot men shake their ass,,,,good times at the Rio

Mardi gra in the desert.  Purple and gold everywhere.  Nightly show where they actually have dancers shuttling on a float via ceiling throwing beads to fans below.  Mcfaddens, where drunken girls strip for free drinks, and have nearly naked hola hoop contest.  And no they dont work there.  Chippendales, and many other sources of entertainment for your do not ask dont tell vacation.

The Buffet is lovely, if you like Buffets.  Its just a good time, and if you get bored u can always shuttle down to the strip.

The zip lining my man and I did off of the Rio it was 500 ft up both can go together it's like a bucket bench swing with a seatbelt, but the adrenaline is crazy, but you can see the whole Vegas street all the way to Fremont street it was awesome definitely would do it again. We used a Groupon for it so it wasn't that bad for us.

I went to the Rio to see Penn and Teller, who were fantastic. I wasn't initially going to review this place, but my husband and I experienced something that was so shocking that I needed to mention it.

After the show, like most people who have attended an hour and a half long show, I needed to use the restroom. My husband and I were a bit turned around while looking for the tram to Harrah's in order to get back to our hotel and ended up near the lobby, and ended up deciding to use the bathrooms to the left of the front desk. My husband did his business just fine, but when I went to use the ladies' room just past the VIP lounge, the entrance to the bathroom was barricaded and a very intimidating man was standing behind the barricades with his arms crossed over his chest. I had a feeling I was not going to get to use the restroom, so I returned to the entrance to the men's room to wait for my husband. When he came out, I told him what happened and he told me that two women were in the men's room because this same man was not only belligerent, but threatened to call security on them for trying to cross the barricade.

My husband and I agreed that we will probably return to see Penn and Teller, but we will not spend money at the restaurants or at the slots because of the egregious behavior of this gentlemen.

It has been years since I stayed at the Rio. Last time I was here they had the bronze statue of the naked showgirls in the lobby. The hotel has changed since then. My boyfriend and I ended up at the Rio after planning a last minute trip to Vegas. There were so many events going on that this was the closet hotel still available near the strip. 

The hotel itself is okay but nothing fantastic. The casino area was well kept but very empty. Doesn't seem like this hotel gets too crowded. On a positive note they did have a free shuttle that would drop you off at Harrah's or Bally's which are right on the strip. 

Our room was clean but there were some things that needed to be fixed. Our shower head for example was loose and halfway detached from the wall. 

Also in my opinion this hotel lacked restaurants. They had a bunch of buffets but nothing that was a quick and tasty bite. We did end up eating breakfast at one of the restaurants and it was pretty disappointing. 

Overall the Rio wasn't great but it also wasn't bad. If we needed to stay here again I wouldn't mind it but I would first try to book a room elsewhere.

We arrived late around 10pm and had a 2 queen reserved. They said they were out of 2 queens and only had a king to offer. I actually paid more to book 2 queen, but their response was that read the fine print; they hold the right to change rooms. Than the room had chairs and bed frame that were ripped. This seems like a 2 star motel.

My husband had made a reservation for 1 room with 2 beds. We got there and they said there wasn't any rooms with 2 beds available. My husband got upset and they offered to bring 2 rollaway beds free of charge. Okay fine, they said they had put in the order for them to bring the beds into our room. 3 hours later and no beds. I call the front desk and they said that in their notes it only says 1 bed and that there would be a charge. I tell her to go talk to her manager because she was aware of our situation earlier. She comes back and tells me that she has put in the order and between 30-45 minutes we'll receive the beds. Mind you it's 12:15 am, so we have to wait until approximately 1 am to be able to sleep. This hotel is HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. Their way of doing business is just wrong. A bunch of empty promises. Don't stay here because it's cheap, you get what you pay for. Never again.

Your first impression can be your last impression. 

Rio is known for their Carnival buffet (which we didn't try since i was disappointment with them), voodoo zipline, and their pool; however, the experience we receive wasn't so pleasant, therefore, we had to give them 2 stars.  

First off, their express Kiosk machine was only for a one day stay which there isn't any sign stating so and it was non-functional (very expressed of them). The registration line took about 1 1\/2 hour with 7 employees working and there were only 5 other folks in front of me. When we asked the service provider to talk to the manager about the situation, the security guard jumped in and was rude about the situation saying  "what do you think?! You think they have magic of something to add more workers to accommodate you?"  This dude needs to stay in his lane. 

When we finally got check-in and got to our room, the room was not the room that we paid and booked for. We've paid for a strip view but got a garage view instead, so i had to go back to the registration desk to ask why they booked us in a room which didn't match our reservation. The manager tried to say that they overbooked so they couldn't put us in the reserved room... wait... it was a Wednesday, it wasn't a holiday, the casino floor was empty, and their garage was empty, why in the hell would she tell me that they "overbooked?"  They finally told me that they can put us in the strip view the next day of our stay. I sucked it up and agreed to it. 

ROOM PROS:
Small refrigerator to store your food, good space and size. 

ROOM CONS:
Outdated room, wallpaper pealing, cracked tile floor, broken iron, missing painting on the wall, dirty and broken curtains, dirty carpet, broken AC, itchy bed-sheets, no lights over the bathtub.

The best part about the hotel was the pool. Our kids loved the waterfall and the spa.

Pros: 
-A lot of food selection IE. All American Grill
-Rooms were pretty large and clean. 
-Short tower is the better of the two towers
-Diamond Lounge is awesome, free drinks and food (Diamond members only)
-Very nice pool area

Cons:
-Valet took forever \/ both picking up and dropping off my car
-Crown Club is a joke!! (looked like I was at Compton High's Prom)
-Games were on the older side
-The Bartenders were cheap asses...The first night they told me I had to bet more then 25 cents per hand to get free drinks. I started to bet 75cents. The next day a different bartender said I need to bet $1.25 to get the free drinks. Wow...what a joke.

Don't go there!
45 minutes at the valet. Dirty room and dirty carpet. Very small bathroom.  Charged me for resort's fee ( wifi and gym$25 X 15 days) $375 extra and wifi didn't work. Worst place in Las Vegas.

Stayed here during the weekend of Life is Beautiful and for a more economical price on a hotel, I have to admit that staying here was a great option for me and my friends.

I booked a 2 Queen Bed Classic Suite Mountain View room for 3 nights through Agoda. For check-in, I called for a late check-in the day of my arrival as I realized I wasn't going to get to the hotel until close to midnight. Thankfully, they were able to accommodate with my request despite the fact I called last minute. When I got there, I was able to check in through their express check-in & check-out machines. The machines are easy to use and efficient. It's similar to checking in at those kiosks you see at the airport. 

We stayed at the a room on the 3rd floor at the Ipanema Tower. The room was quite spacious as there were 2 queen size beds and couch with LOTS of floor space. For the bathroom\/pamper area, there's a shower, sink and toilet in a separate room as well as a sink and counter outside. If you think about it, this layout is ideal if you have a big group just because you can have one person showering while have someone do their makeup\/get ready outside (LOL just saying). The quality of the room was pretty decent for the most part (e.g. beds were comfy) but there were some equipment that was a little bit run down (e.g. I could barely hear the person on the line when I used their phone). I forgot to take pictures of the room but I thought the room looked like the pics that I saw when I booked on Agoda. Price wise, I think the entire booking came out close to $560 (including the daily resort fees), which was a decent price that was split among the size of group I had.

In terms of housekeeping, one thing that did caught me off guard a little bit was how early they knock on the doors (9am), which might not be ideal for those who typically stay out late in Sin City. Me and my friends actually ended up opting out of housekeeping just because we were out for the most part and we didn't really want to deal with it. As for parking, you can valet or you can park at their structure next door for free.

well the rooms are not all suites, cuz mine wasn't, just felt like a regular standard room. the casino is nice, i enjoyed the poker room during my stay there. i had the breakfast buffet for $4 (price was discounted from my $5 coupon and my players card $ i had accrued during play). everything there was pretty cool and simple. the pool was nice, however $25 for buckets of beer (5 beers) is kinda redicoulous.

other than that stuff, ill prolly go back there again to play @ the poker room, i dont know if i would stay there though.

Well we came in on the 15th of June  staying through the 21st Front desk 4 star Valet 4 star the other staff where all a soild 3 star Now the problems going to sleep and waking up to the smell of pot. That would be fine if this was a smoking floor But it's non smoking floor I know EDC BUT your stinking ass dirt weed can wake  me up cause it smells so bad.
Called to let them know of the problem.
Called and left a message for the hotel manger Will see if that call will ever be returned.
I know its hard to police but I'm sure the cleaning staff could tell them. Where the smell is coming from.
Problem #2 was woken up to yelping dogs oh and the stank of someone's stink weed.
Room 3 star clean ok. 
Problem #3 Resort fee $35 a night for what? Went to gym GET THIS U CAN'T USE THE LOOKERS EXTRA CHARGE CAN'T USE THE SHOWER EXTRA charge CAN'T USE THE JACUZZI OR THE STEAM ROOM EXTRA CHARGE. What the F is the resort fee for a pool that opens at 9 closes at 6 it's 112 degrees at 8 pm and you can't use the pool I'm just saying 10pm is more realistic.
I'm just tired of being told oh well

100% horrible experience. 
I arrived at 2 in the morning on July 1st. 
When arrived me and my boyfriend went up to the clerk desk and we asked to book a room, the employee helping us some how "forgot" to mention that if we booked a room at 2 am that we would be charged as if we came on June 30th. (so our 1 night stay would be 30th - 1st. Keep in mind we were planning on leaving Sunday July 2nd) She had only mentioned that our parking was free and that our check out would be Sunday. 
I had received an email Saturday at 930 to go check out on time so i was a bit confused, i went down stairs and talked to 3 different employees at the desk none of which were helpful. 1 employee kept insisting that all their rooms were booked and that she couldn't help me. She was extremely rude and unhelpful. I then asked to speak to a manager about the issue, i explained the situation and let them know that their employee at 2 am gave me the wrong information and didn't inform me correctly. (All the employees including the manager had different response for us. None of them were on the same page.) 
The manager then asked for my confirmation paper which WE DIDN'T EVEN GET FROM THE PERSON WHO BOOKED US OUR ROOM.
We were charged $250+, for staying 10 hours. The only thing the manager could "help" me with was a "discount" on a nightly rate for Saturday July 1st, of $280+. ( EVEN THOUGH WE HAD ARRIVED ON JULY 1ST AND ALREADY PAID A NIGHTLY RATE) 
After and hour talking to employees and managers we then decided to pack our things from the room and leave. 
THIS HOTEL IS UNORGANIZED AND HAS HORRIBLE GUEST SERVICES. 
Multiple guest arrived next to me complaining about 1 thing or another.
If you want to have a horrible time in Las Vegas this is the place to go.
ME AND MY BOYFRIEND WILL NOT BE RETURNING TO THE "RIO" HOTEL EVER. 
Save your self the money and book else where! With their prices you might as well book on the strip!

A bit off the beaten path. I think people who buy isolated houses on the hills with views would like this place more than city center people.

If you live in a big city center and are used to going downstairs walking half a block to bars, convenience stores and the like you might not like this hotel. Its the exact opposite. Its like living in the isolated hills and needing a car to get to everything outside of this resort. 

That being said once you get here you don't ever have to leave. I'm sure the gift shop could fill in as a convenience store and restaurants, bars, and everything else is here.

The huge buffet, the incredible pool - complete with sandy beach, the rooftop club way up high with Strip views... its all here. 

Rooms are also a big, big plus. They are large. They are considered suites but according to Webster's dictionary they don't really fit the textbook definition of a  suite. They are just one big room instead of two rooms as in a proper suite. I've had proper suites - the great part is if your with a few friends the one grumpus can go to sleep early, shut the bedroom door and the rest can keep the lights on in the living room. Can't do that here in the standard suits.

I like the value aspect of this property. But when your on the other side of the highway it gets you better views but you also feel like your missing out.

For the same price I would usually pick Flamingo unless I'm stuffing a total of four people in one room - but they are so inexpensive there is never a need to do that.

I really don't like Vegas, so it might make sense that I wouldn't like The RIo, but I found it dated and very average for a mid-tier hotel. Watching people hang out at the slots just feels tragic. And it's really about the casino.  Still, if you're going to run a hotel . . . The $29 (?) "resort fee" added insult to injury.

Warning, my bed clothes reeked of cigarette smoke *after* I left-- from sleeping in the room. No bueno.

This hotel needs some updating.  The bed sunk and was very uncomfortable so I slept all four nights on the sofa which fortunately was very comfortable.  There's no hot water during peak hours so be prepared to take cool showers.  You get what you pay for in this case so don't expect too much.

Cheap rates as compared to other hotels on the strip. Two nights here on a weekday cost me around $80 total, and I got bumped up to a premium suite on the 29th floor with a king bed and a strip view. The room was a little dated, but an effort was made to update it a little. The linens were neat, no ugly 90's geometric pattern on the comforter, unfortunately it was on the curtains and on the carpet. The bathroom was small, but clean. If you don't want to drive to the strip they offer a free shuttle to Bally's and Harrahs every 30 minutes.  The Valet is a little slow.  The pool was great, two pools (not including VooDoo) with waterfalls, one with sand bank. third pool was temperature controlled (I think), perfect temperature, not too hot and not too cold. Overall good hotel if you're looking to just get away for a few days, but not over spend.

Well, we arent at the Venetian, but for a cheap weekend and a decent place to stay I would be here in a hot minute.  They recently remodeled and it turned out pretty nice.  Checkin time is REALLY late, 4pm.....and checkout is 1pm.  To checkin early its an extra $16.  I didnt even ask what it was to have a late checkout.  
Very close to the strip, a cheap taxi ride and right next to China Town where you can get some awesome food!

I rate hotels in Las Vegas different from most hotels because when I stay at a hotel in Las Vegas I gamble there, I eat there, I'll usually go to the nightclub or lounge there and possibly shop there.  I might go to other establishments for anything I mentioned above but it's nice if I don't have to.
   All the rooms at the Rio are considered suites.  They are large but pretty much an over sized room with a large couch and coffee table.  They say all the rooms are the same but I didn't have a refrigerator in my room every time. 
   I love the buffets here but the last several times I stayed here the Seafood Buffet was closed for remodeling.   It has reopened though and was well worth the money.  I believe it's at 38 bucks now
but well worth it.  The Carnival Buffet is great too.  This buffet is divided into sections of the different ethnicity's and types of food.   You'll have Chinese, Italian, Mexican, Japanese (sushi included,) pizzas, salads, etc.   
  Keep in mind if you gamble at the Harrah's Properties which include the Rio, Caesars, Harrah's, Paris, Bally's, the Flamingo and the Imperial Palace and you happen to be Platinum Status or higher, you will be able to go into a separate line...sometimes immediate seating when the normal line is an hour or longer.   This should be true for all the buffets at the above mentioned properties.
  Normally, I wouldn't mention the swimming pool but here at the Rio, don't expect to relax and kick back.  It's quite loud with music blasting and people dancing and drinking all over the pool area.  If you're up for drinking and partying it's great but there's no laying out to relax here.
   Here's one of the few places I stay in Las Vegas and I don't go dancing here.  I don't care too much for the Voo Doo Lounge.  If you're going out to meet people, the Voo Doo Lounge isn't very big.   If you're just going out to drink and have fun with friends then it's great and has a nice view of the strip.
   If you're staying at the Rio and planning on going to the Voo Doo Lounge on a Friday night you can go to the concierge desk and ask for passes.  If they have them they'll give the to you for free.
   There's not too much shopping here but if you want to go to Caesars and you don't want to want to deal with driving and parking you can take the free shuttle outside of the Carnival Buffet area.  You can also head to the other Harrah's properties with the shuttles.

Awful, the sports book is old and the people working here are all rude as can be. Was only person sitting at bar watching game... Bartender changes channel of game... Tells me "his bar his rules." Awful experience. Just play somewhere else.

Not a good experience in Vegas, thanks to the Rio. 

The reason we made reservations at the Rio, is because my boyfriend had a convention at this hotel.

We rented a car and drove to the hotel).
Right from the start we were disappointed. Unless you want to valet your car, you have to park in the parking garage on the other side of the hotel.  So checking in was a slight nightmare. 
 

Our room was very dated. No complimentary coffee in room (bring your own k cups). We were told the k cups in the minibar are about $18. 

The restaurants are astronomically priced. The Americana buffet was 30+ dollars per person (for so-so food) and the seafood buffet restaurant is about $45 per person. 


 Normally at a casino, you would hear people yelling and cheering for their wins. The only sounds we hear are the ching-ching of the slot machines. Doesn't sound like much winning here. 

We just tried to valet our car tonight after a night on the strip and was told it was a 30 to 45 minute wait for valet. 

My boyfriend found out that we have to come to this convention yearly (to keep his credentials) and it will be held at the Rio. We don't want to spend anymore money at this hotel or casino so we will stay elsewhere, from now on.
Waited 2 hours just check in.  Should be zero stars for that.  One star was for the 1$ blackjack machine next to the check in line. Another one for the nice housekeeping staff.

This was OUR hotel from the early 2000s.  It used to be fun, lively and sexy with the dancing waitresses.  Now it seem old run down and doesn't have the mojo any more.  too bad because i was comfortable here and knew all the crap dealers and some of the waitresses.  WTH is up taking away parking spaces in the back and reserving for locals.  Not cool.
Our non-smoking room smelled like stale cigarettes, the decor went out of style when Clinton entered the White House, and the location was inconvenient.

I wish I could give 3.5 stars, but overall I liked the Rio. 

I have stayed at a few different Hotels in Vegas and like the Rio the best, but its like every hotel\/casino in Vegas, some are better than others in different areas.

Rooms are huge at the Rio, I really enjoyed the room...clean, bed was very comfortable and quiet when you did want to sleep.

Vodoo Lounge is a cool bar, can get pretty cold at night though.

I thought the food sucked at both buffet sucked and the bar and grill in the lobby had very average food too. Good service though.

The check in process was a nightmare, took forever. 

Other than the food I enjoyed the Rio....all my food at the Rio was free so that is why I didn't leave to eat.

Rio poker mon 8\/30 12:30 am
Sat down and played for about 30 minutes, then this couple sat in seats 1\/2 i was in seat 4. I raised on my bb $35, everyone folded and sb has $100 left shows jc2c and is trying to make a decision wether to call or fold and seat 2 tells him to go all in. I told him he should stay out of this hand and shouldn't give people advice. He called me an idiot and said I am too serious. I said There are rules and we all should follow them. The dealer didn't do anything. A few hands after that seat 2 wins a pot and hands seat 1 about 50$ in chips. I asked the dealer to run the game,  And explained her what happened. He called me an idiot and asked me to go to the parking lot. At this point I called the floor. Debra came by and couldn't handle the situation so I left. I won't be playing in this poker room as long as this floor person and dealer are there or they train their employees properly.
Floor person: Debra 
Dealer: AJ

Can't really complain about the Rio, even though I am still perplexed and saddened that they no longer have the show in the sky.  Heck the damn track is still installed on the ceiling, fix it up and get it going again!! Rio used to be sexier.  I miss that.  
During the week Rio is pretty quiet and boring.  On the weekends it is more upbeat with live music.  We stayed in the Masquerade tower.  The bathrooms have tiny "peep show" windows in the shower that allow you to peep into the shower. I like this whimsical and different touch.  I loved how HUGE our room was (after all it is called Rio All Suites hotel!)  I LOVED that I had my own huge sink and vanity and my husband had his own in a separate room with the toilet!  The pool area is beautiful.  Multiple pools and good music playing.  It is very easy to navigate inside the Rio.  
To me the Rio from the outside is one of the prettiest hotels at night, not to mention its Voodoo Lounge has maybe the best view OF Vegas.  I would ABSOLUTELY stay here again.

Highly disappointed. First thing was you have to pay $13.00 per day for wifi. WTH???? The hooker hotels have free wifi and I'm not dropping $$$$$'s there and a $40 breakfast. Second. Put A\/C down to very cold. Never got below 80. I've been in way better rooms for the money. Not a place I'd go out if my way to stay at again. 

Here for 3 days so far and have not heard one alarm or people yelling as if they were winners. This place is tighter than a frogs butthole.

What i do love about the Rio, the little extra room making it a suite room is huge on my psychological happiness. everyone can say that the down point is that it's not on the strip, but to me it's next to sonics so that competely makes up for it.
  The other thing is if you're a partier the palms hotel is across the street. which was nice for us since we went to he Pimp n hos costume ball.

I was accosted and harassed by hookers so many times I lost count. Was pick pocketed and scammed in the elevator. There is no security making sure that only guests are going to the floors like most other hotels here have. When I checked in the first room has literally every piece of furniture damaged and first thing I see is a roach scurry across bathroom. Oh and the concave sagging bed. I complained and was switched to a much nicer but smaller room. When I complained about the hookers in the elevators and pick pocketing I was told "welcome to Vegas" and the apologetic staff stated that there was nothing they could do for me or about the problems.

Pretty nice hotel. Staff is nice rooms in the new tower are nice and clean. The casino is pretty decent I didn't get very much pay out here. The only thing that sucks here is that the walk sucks to the strip. But they do have a free shuttle every 30 min to ballys. Starting at 10 am to 1 am.  There's also a fair amount of decent looking ladies of the evening in the casino. My wife and I had a fun time watching the setting up of dates. Between old duffers and these woman.

Rio used to be my favorite Vegas place to go to (seriously), but it's fallen down on my list recently.  They have cut back on maintenance like a bunch of other Vegas properties and it really shows -- the paint on the outside of the properly is visibly peeling in places., among other things.

The Show in the Sky used to be a fun thing to ride on.  They would give you a huge stack of beads to keep and another stack to throw out to the crowd.  In addition, they gave you a special medallion that only people who had ridden it could get.  Now, they give you three token beads and that's it.  You don't get any to throw out anymore and the special one is gone.  Staff say the management cut back to save a few pennies per ride (Keep in mind that you typically pay to ride the thing).  

Speaking of the Show in the Sky, their revamp last year sucks.  They went to a  stupid "more adult" theme that doesn't fit the theme of the show or the property.  They should have sticked to the Samba type theme, hello, "Rio" ?!.    Also, they have cut it back to only running a few nights a week and when it does run it's a very short show now, only ~10 minutes.   Sigh.

The iBar had some Microsoft Surface tables in it that sort of made that bar stand out, but now most of them reboot when you are using them.  They also used to allow you to order your drink at the table, which I thought was way cool, but that option is gone now.  Also, you used to be able to chat with other tables nearby but that is also gone.

Voodoo up on the roof is still pretty cool, though the clientele is kind of interesting now that they're giving away so many free passes to get up there.

I don't mean to sound too negative about the place -- it's still pretty decent.  It's just not what it used to be and people coming now probably have no idea how much they have cut back on the fun.

[Edit: I forgot to mention, check in sucked big time this time around.  There was a HUUUGE line going around the lobby and only three people working.  They were trying their best but they were obviously overwhelmed.  It wasn't very welcoming.]

First time here with my family, last time we'll ever stay here. Rooms are old and outdated, definitely not kid friendly. Air conditioning is horrible, furnishings are from the 80's. What a huge disappointment! We'll be at the Orleans next time, just as we usually are and always enjoy the room.

I  booked the Rio last minute as I needed room while attending CES (my decision to attend came very late). I've stayed at my share of Vegas hotels. The RIO is by far the worst room I've ever had. I've been in the Rio's Casino and have had drinks at one of the bars and enjoyed myself so I was confident that the rooms were decent. I was not expecting The Wynn or Four Seasons but I did expect amenities from this decade or maybe the last. My room was on the  4th floor in the Masquerade tower and looked as though I'd stepped into a time capsule with its outdated furnishing, dingy rug, and brass fixtures. I get it Vegas Resorts don't want you to spend time in your room but when I do I'd like it to be at least of the quality of a budget chain hotel. This was not even that. Not to mention the fact that when I arrived it took nearly an hour to check-in. Once I did check-in almost all of the restaurants and room service were closed except the Vietnamese Pho' that by the was not serving Pho at that time (I love Vietnamese noodle soup). This place is in serious need of upgrade I'll know for the next time. Definitely wouldn't recommend.
Why in the world would they close the pool(s) at 6 pm when the temperature outside is still 118 degrees?  Where does one take the kids?

Old outdated rooms, my shower had luke warm water and I was told by hotel staff there was nothing they could do about it... and suggested I try running my sinks, flushing my toilet over and over and again to get hot water....

Totally inept check in out staff or system.  I waited in 4 person line for 45 minutes to get a final billing statement.  

Never coming back here again.

It's an okay place to stay 
  We had to wait 45 min to check in Thursday night, but the girl was nice enough to upgrade our room. 
Rooms are ok, beds are bad and the shower walls showed mold, especially under the wall paper.  
Valet guy was super rude, better to self park 
  Won't stay here again

So normally I don't really review places other than eating establishments, but this review seemed necessary after the craziness that went down my first night in Rio.

It's 6am and I can't sleep. The time difference has not been my friend. I get up, and decide i'll waste some time at the gym. As I exit the elevator that connects the hotel rooms with the actual casino floor I am suddenly met by a big black sheet that spans the entire width of hall way. Along with the ominous sheet is: a handful of casino security, 3 or 4 metro police officers, and very tired looking casino managers. Everyone immediately points to an "employee's only" door to my left and directs me through. I walk down winding hallways, at each checkpoint another police officer pointing out the proper directions. Eventually I get out to the casino floor, and I notice another black sheet. Apparently I had just taken a detour via staff-only hallways in order to avoid a small portion of the main hallway that leads to the elevators.

So I decide that it is best to not hang around and I start to head to the gym, only to be met by police tape. Now I was a little more curious. I ask the guard what happened, and she immediately cut me off and insisted she "could not talk about it at this time." So, me being the savvy millennial I am, I pull out my phone and google the Rio. Turns out undercover security shot an alleged "repeat offender" who was attempting to the rob the casino. A man was killed my first night in Vegas.... Definitely a story to tell.

At first Rio really did not handle this well. They didn't accommodate the people trapped out of their rooms (once you left your room and came downstairs, police wouldn't let you back up. "Security measure"....I was locked out for about 5 hours.)

my boyfriend and I weren't too angry about being locked out of our room because we were sure the hotel would be accommodating their customers and giving them things to do as they waited to back into their room. This just seemed like pretty basic crisis communications. When we went to talk to the manager though, this was not the case.

The hotel managers and staff wouldn't actually listen when we spoke to them. They just kept droning over and over, "we cant let you up into your room, once metro is involved we have no control." This wasn't what we were asking though. We didn't NEED to get to our room, we just wanted something to do while we waited. We weren't the only ones either. People started getting really heated when they found out the hotel wasn't offering any kind of distraction. Eventually though, with quite a bit of complaining the hotel finally started giving people champagne brunch vouchers and waiving hotel fees.

It was too late though for me. Having graduated with a marketing degree, I know this first thing about marketing is to keep the customers happy. Angry customers can only lead to trouble. By the time the hotel finally connected the dots too many people were mad. 

Overall this is a very long way of saying Rio needs to remember that at the end of the day, if the customer isn't happy: you aren't doing your job.

The exterior can be a bit blinding. Overall, I had a great time at the Rio. Visited during the summer time. Hot, hot. Spent time in the pool,and mostly shopped at the gift shop and stores off the strip. I loved our room. Had two beds,and a long sofa , where I stretched out, while watching a movie. I recommend this hotel for your next visit to Sin city.

I have stayed here twice and would stay again.  The rooms are really big, for being their standard two bedroom queen.  We had 4 people in our room and it was very comfortable and didn't seem crowded.

The unrenovated rooms look a little worked over but for the price, you can't beat it.  It is a suite and comes with a couch, fridge, seperate bathroom and changing area.  

I didn't like that the hallways look like they haven't been taken care of in a year, or so.  Someone dropped a drink in the hallway, we were walking down the hall the next evening and it was still laying there.  Even worse, two days later when we were leaving, it was still there.  

I love that they have a free shuttle from their hotel to Bally's\/Paris and Harrah's and back.  This shuttle even runs until 1am.  Bonus.

I recommend signing up for the Harrah's Reward Card.  You don't have to get a bungy chord for it but you do get great perks if you gamble.  My friends and I just had a comp'd night.  Holler.

I do like a couple of their bars as well.  I recommend McFaddens for a few reasons.  1.  They might be the only bar in Vegas that serves Smithwicks.  2.  Their bar food is actually really good.  3.  Beer pong.  My friends and I also enjoyed the VooDoo Lounge and iBar.

I do recommend swinging into Burger King for drunk dinner.  You can substitute a beer for soda.

We didn't pay for the upgraded room so in addition to our downgraded room, we got a downgraded view of the roof and a lot of satellite dishes.  But, it is a much better view than the one from my desk.

Stayed here during the week last week (7\/8-7\/10\/15) with my gf before she leaves to Pittsburgh for a year. Gotta get that quality time in! Not only was the room super nice and spacious for the money, the pools were awesome and the casino areas and restaurants were great too. Their world buffet is awesome! We got a last min deal on Expedia for here and it was cheaper than other places that weren't even close to as nice. Loved it. We plan on staying here again actually.

Rio is an A-OK! :) it does the job of find a place to stay.

I've stayed here a handful of times and have never been disappointed with the price you pay ranging from ($50++ per night). The rooms are cheap and huge! I've stayed at the regular room with two beds, and it has a spacious living room area and big bathroom. The bathroom is also separated with a shower, toilet and sing in one room, and another outside sink that is extremely useful if you have a group of people.Room also comes with an empty mini fridge. 

Only downside, is that it's not near the strip. BUT, they do have a shuttle that takes you there and is open till 1 AM. 

Other things:
-No free wi-fi in the room
-Self parking available
-Make sure to catch a show in the casino and grab some beads!
-$20 resort fee per night

DISGUSTING, put me in a "pet friendly" room that reeked of dog piss.  Refused to move or refund me. Was forced to find another hotel and left Challenging the CC charge.

The manager said, we can't refund you but will send housekeeping up to spray the room with fabreez. 

I have never been treated so poorly.
Lovely pools and rooms. But no in room coffee. I dont know about you but when in Vegas thats a deal breaker. Everything else was perfect thats why we always try to stay here. No longer.

Loooove their locals deals. 25% off any restaurant. My absolute favorite place for salad in all of town is their sportsbook bar. I'm a vegetarian so good options are really tough in casinos but this was such an awesome surprise!

My husband and I stayed here during a convention. The rooms were huge! The rates were reasonable, but everything like internet was an extra charge. The only drawback is that the restaurants inside are very expensive, and the outside restaurants are too far to walk to. I would not recommend staying here if you are without a car. Otherwise a good stay. The staff were very efficient and friendly.

Oh Rio! What the hell happened? You used to be nice and happening. Now, there are stains on your carpet and teenagers running around in their underwear in the hallways. A really pregnant woman in a halter top served me a margarita. A Steelers fan threw up in a plastic football cup. The casino has lost some of its flare which is something you will notice when you hit up some of the other casino alternatives. That said, at least this isn't Circus Circus and the price is right when you want something simple, clean, and off strip.

I like that during the week it is free for locals! Also you can bring your kids there is a pool with a sandy area which is great for all ages and if your kids are in the teens you can let them hangout it the under 21 area... and you can go to the adult pool which is only open on weekends. They have a dj but it's just okay.. I think that pool used to be the sapphire pool. Also there drinks are kind of boring they need a menu redo.

i lose way too money to have a good time here...i know its not the hotels fault, but unless theres a hole in my pocket, i always leave in the red.

rooms are spacious...not fancy, but it does its job!!! how many hours do u need in bed anywayz while your in vegas????

Nice  
Quiet.
No sneak smoke smell (in non smoking).
Big rooms.
Easy kiosk in\/out phone Checkout.
Comfortable bed.

Bring your own shampoo\/conditioner and body wash.
No microwave.
$8 for using room service (each time).
Small tub\/bathroom. 

We didn't eat or hang out otherwise but it was clean and loiter free. 

Always tip valet staff it's just good manners

Customer service here is great! Staff is super friendly. The buffet was delicious! Food was amazing. I recommend gambling there I put $20 in and came out winning $500 !! It was my lucky day I can say. The place itself is very clean! I enjoyed my stay here.

rooms are big and roomy--comfy bed, clean and spacious...
great price for having a total rewards card!!!

This is a delayed review but I just wanted to point out that with the Rio "all suites" it can be very hit or miss. And this visit was a miss. Stopping by for one night while driving through, it started off bad:

The hour+ long wait to check in and the attitude received at the desk as a result was unacceptable. 

Then came the room. Ugh. Does maintenance not check anything? Or is it a result of the room cleaning not reporting anything, or even worse, management not giving a damn all together? 

The undersides of the small bench seats were slashed open, the mini Kcup maker had no Kcups. That's useful. The door pin in the bathroom was about to fall out. The trash bags were missing. Lamp on the table, broken. And the view from the room was a wonderful view of the low roof.

Update:

So trying to check in. 3 so called employees at the counter "working". The express check in machines are pointless. They tell you to go stand in line. Why?  Why do I keep giving the rio a chance. I guess I'm stupid for thinking that management cares at all.   More to come-

Do you want to go to the pool and relax in the later afternoon? Do you want to cool down at 7pm, when the sun is no longer burning you to death? Well you're SOL. They close the pool at 7pm. In August. When it's 100 outside. Yeah... that makes perfect sense.
Fun little hotel a bit off the strip but has a fun atmosphere and free shuttles.  Check out the pool for a fun time.

This place is unorganized,  under staffed,  and the staff they do have doesn't seem to care. Rooms are very clean,  but equiped like an extended stay hotel.  Vegas hotels sperate them selfs by service and this one doesnt seem to have any real service.  This hotel\/ Casino is closer to extended stay then a casino resort.  The valet are the most caring on the property and great. I wouldn't stay here again,  and I come to Vegas 4th times a year.

Generally overpriced in every fashion (even for Vegas).  Sub-par quality.

The Good:

Our front desk person seemed nice.  We got tons of free mardi gras beads.  

The Bad:

To me the Rio is the Lindsay Lohan of Vegas hotels:  once a hot and promising place for fun; now it just looks sad and weathered.  

Rio Advertises itself as an "all suite" hotel with large rooms, but merely providing more of the same putrid carpet space to stare at while you wait for maintenance to come fix the hot water does not a "suite" make.

My "suite" experience at the Rio officially started with me walking into the room and noticing the television bolted down and tilted in a fashion not viewable from the beds.  Not even a flat screen (let alone flat panel) television, this thing looked like a throwback to something from the 90's.  Here's a tip guys:  if my single, elderly, mother has a more state-of-the-art television in her living room than you have in your "suites," maybe it's time to upgrade.  Fortunately I was able to muster the strength to tilt this massive dinosaur to face the beds.  

In addition to the television, I also noticed these "suites" didn't have many of the conveniences I have come to enjoy in suites from other hotels.  For example, often times hotel rooms (suites and non-suites) will have some type of semi-adequate sound system, or even an ipod docking station.  The closest thing our Rio "suite" had was one of those old fake-wood-paneling alarm clocks.  We didn't have much luck plugging our ipod into that.  The "suite" did have one of those newer coffee machines, however.  Unfortunately, we couldn't locate the coffee.   Were we supposed to purchase it from the mini bar?

Then there was the plumbing.  Oh the plumbing...  The only thing more enjoyable than amassing a thick layer of "Vegas" across your skin after a long day of heavy gambling, drinking, and cruising, is not having hot water in your shower to wash it off.  At best, the water in our "suite" shower reached lukewarm.  I called maintenance and the front desk requesting assistance.  They said they would send someone up.  We never saw anyone come up, and the problem continued.  Furthermore, the bathtub backed up while we took showers, so we had the benefit of not only being showered with cold water, but also soaking in cold water as well.  Lucky us.  

As if that weren't enough, our toilet in the "suite" hardly had any water going into the bowl.  This is great news for those of you out there planning a nice romantic weekend at the Rio; nothing gets you in the mood like going to the bathroom and seeing the fat dump your girlfriend left in there an hour ago.  

The Ugly

When we called and asked to speak to the manager, she made it seem like it was our fault for not calling.  When I told her that we called and spoke with maintenance, she made it seem like it was our fault for not calling the front desk.  When I said that we did call the front desk, she made it seem like it was our fault for not calling the front desk a second time.  Seriously?  

In summation, my experience at the Rio reminded me of that old Duran Duran song, "her name is Rio and she SUCKS!..."


*Additional final thoughts:  the Rio is located off the strip, so you'll either have to fight the crowds and wait a substantial amount of time for the tram to the strip, drive yourself, cab it, or walk a considerable distance.  Either way it makes for an expensive and\/or unfulfilling trip.  If you manage to fight the hoards and snag a seat in the shuttle, plan on a short night out, as the shuttle stops running relatively early.  Often times we felt stranded there because we didn't want to drink and drive and we couldn't get a shuttle.  Perhaps they count on people feeling trapped there, which is why they make their food so overpriced.

Also...the clientele there seemed a little sketchy...my friend (a 49-year-old Filipino man) was openly verbally assaulted by a seemingly drunk woman on the first night we got there, merely because his wife sat down and played in an empty seat she had long-since left.  Security never came to stop her.  It was a little scary, and a lot ghetto...

Just okay. You'd think that there would at least be a microwave or coffee in the room for the $240\/night price tag. First thing I noticed when I walked in was the beer cans and Styrofoam cups everywhere. Reeks of beer and cigarettes, even though this is a nonsmoking room. Entire "resort" is 10 years outdated. Next time, I'll spend the extra chunk of change for a hotel with more of the basic amenities.

Rooms although clean are teeny tiny. Stayed here one time during the WSOP, and was very disappointed that they took major advantage of the poker players, by not having any table games that were under $25. Seemed like they raised their prices just for the poker players. 

Not close to anything, so you have to take a cab, and so...the cab line is a joke. No reason to stay here, unless the room is free.
So far not a great start ... I've been waiting for my room for hours!!! I'll update after my visit.

Older hotel but price was right for stay. Room was clean, guest services and staff were fabulous! Show in the sky is great. Shower pressure was weak. Carnival buffet was by far the best!!! (did the buffet of buffet). A little outdated makes it a 3 star.

Want to say thank you to Mary the hotel mgr at the rio I came in late we'd night  had major issue wallet gone my rooms were comped but I had no money for deposit or resort fees she still checked me in treated me with respect and dignity shout out to chasers entertainment that deal with people and not just policies me and family stay here all the time anyway thank you rio for your loyalty to your guest I will always be a total reward player please everyone stay with these people and when at rio say hello to Mary thanks Mary

We arrived around midnight. We got a free upgrade to a suite. Very nice. Everything is clean and the staff is friendly. Only negative is that the way from free parking to the front desk pretty  far is to walk.

MISSING SOME BASIC NECESSITIES. My husband and I just returned from our stay-cation at the Rio. We are local but still wanted a change of scenery for our anniversary. The Rio staff was friendly and although they did their best to make our stay comfortable they were missing a few things I just cant go without that you can find at basic hotels. NO MICROWAVE: Brought food to the room after check in and wasn't able to reheat,  called front desk to see if i could reheat anywhere and got a straight up "No" awkward. NO COFFEE MAKER: not in the room, granted there was a Starbucks in the hotel\/casino just an elevator, escalator, walk across, around the corner trip from the room! NO CONDITIONER: Conditioning shampoo yes, conditioner no. And it was a harsh shampoo but its hotel shampoo. Staff couldn't help me either. Next, If you are a guest, the fitness center is available but other spa amenities are not. No sauna, no steam room, no hot tub because those are a separate charge. Doesn't mean you cant spend some time back there though ;) I may get in trouble for saying that....Last thing. l was unable to get more than an hour of sleep on the king bed. too soft asked for alternatives staff said they would provide padding. AKA a mattress cover and a thin blanket. I went to the bed to the couch tried the floor back to couch then at 5am back to the bed so I could spend our last night close to each other. I also forgot to mention there were cigarette burns in our no smoking room comforter. :(

So over all next to nice staff but not a lot of alternatives to make my stay comfortable. honestly free coffee would've made my trip. next time we will try another hotel hopefully I remember to ask what is available in the room.

Walked around inside.. didn't gamble. 
The dancers aren't all that .. my fam said it looked like they were doing ballet.. lol
Went in to the bar a beer and @ $ 5.00 Margareta \/(advertised) added up to $16 how IDK.. 
Voodoo was crackin' (its a  roof top club and restaurant.)

It was cool for what it was.. not too much... LV seemed empty .. this economy sux.

Just had a stay for the weekend of Jan 29-31, 2016. This was a quiet weekend before Superbowl weekend. I am a Total Rewards Platinum member and I was comped the 2 nights but I still had to pay the $30\/night resort fee. The Internet fee was included and Internet was good. For the value of the resort that is away from the strip and free shuttle service to other skate hotels on the strip, this is a great deal. I can't imagine how crazy it would be if the WSOP is going on. 

As far as the rooms, it's dated but not as bad as the older hotels on the strip. The King mattress was unconfortable. Lots of space in the rooms. 

I would definitely recommend this place just don't expect it to be like Bellagio or Wynn.
One of my favorite places to stay.  BEST buffet :-)  Great service.  Awesome rooms.  I'll be back here on my next trip!

The Rio is my favorite hotel to stay at in Las Vegas. Yes if you pay a lot more money at another casino you'll receive a bigger, fancier room but that's obvious. I only payed about 60 dollars a night and the Rio always has great deals if you check online. The casino has a whole party atmosphere to it and there are always really good looking girls everywhere. The reason is that they hire very good looking workers plus there are two clubs there plus you have so many girl tourists walking around. So if you want a casino with lots of eye candy this is the place. I gambled at the bar and they were constantly giving me free drinks. They also have a show where some boat thing goes around the casinos and everyone's goes nuts when it happens. Its quite entertaining. In addition I  was happy with my room. It was clean and had a huge wall to wall window that I could see the whole strip. For the price I played this place was awesome.
Recently stayed for a conference, everything was good. I wasn't thrilled with having to pay for an Internet connection that never even worked, but I let the desk clerk know and they waived the fee.

Had a great stay. Always played here, but first time staying. Had a king room with the strip view. It was my bday weekend and I was comped to the VIP floor. Huge room, a little run down, that's the only reason for minus a star. Pool area is resort like with 4 pools, but only 2 were open. We had a great time.

I booked a single room at The Rio this weekend and it exceeded my expectations. The beds were queen sized and huge! I was surprised how much room we actually had between where the huge L shaped coach was and our beds. I could have done a couple cartwheels and flips without knocking over anything. 

I got the rooms pretty cheap too for $270 for the weekend. Day of check out is usually at 11am, but if you want to check out late, they will only extend it an extra hour. 

I strongly suggest you valet on the day of check in. We actually self parked and we ended up at the far end of the casino. Now imagine carrying your luggage all the way to the front for check in. Just valet and pay $1. 

I got to admit though, I did not spend much time at The Rio, since I was out and about the whole time. I did get to have lunch at the All-American Bar & Grille but that is a review of its own so I cant tell you what happened there. 

The following entertainment is available at The Rio: 

Penn & Teller
Show In the Sky
Chippendales
VooDoo Lounge.

Hungry and at The Rio? Look no further. 

All-American Bar & Grille
Búzios Seafood Restaurant
Martorano's
Carnival World Buffet
Gaylord India Restaurant
Hamada's Asiana
Janelas
Mah Jong
McFadden's
RUB BBQ
So Paulo Cafe
Sports Deli
Starbucks Coffee
Village Seafood Buffet
VooDoo Steak & Lounge
Wine Cellar & Tasting Room

No need to write about there being slot machines, blackjack tables, sportsbook, etc since this is just like any other casino. However, some of the other casinos are much more better looking but who is really here to look at casinos.  

The Rio is located very close to the strip, not walking distance, close enough to get there in a matter of minutes by car. I would definitely stay here again, if the rates on the hotel and room were not expensive.

My 4 friends and I stayed her recently and had a great experience.  I purchased a TravelZoo Deal so two nights between 5 girls came to under $50 per person.  Awesome!  I was worried because none of us had stayed here before and I didn't know how clean\/nice the rooms would be or if they really were suite size or smaller.  With 5 girls we need all the space we can get for little money.  We were all pleasantly surprised at the size and cleanliness of the room.  We had two queen beds and a sofa - perfect sleeping arrangements.  There was plenty of floor space for luggage without feeling like we were on top of each other.  The bathroom had the toilet, shower, and sink plus a separate area outside with another sink, huge mirror, mirrored closet, and a fridge.  This was the perfect size room for all of us.  We liked that the hotel was off the strip because the casino wasn't packed with people wander through.  We spent Saturday at the Topless Pool (which was not as scary as I thought) and bought one of the lounge couches, with umbrella for my pasty skin, at only a $100 total minimum tab which we exceeded with one round of drinks.  The drinks came in plastic take-home tumblers with straws which we used for drinks the rest of the weekend (and have been deemed our drinking cups).  Our server at the pool was super friendly and awesome,  she even remembered my drink when I ordered a second one which is impressive considering the amount of people she was dealing with out there.  At night we went to Buzio's for dinner, which was very good and then headed up to the Voodoo Lounge for drinks and dancing.  The view up there is awesome and the music was a good mix of old school and current hip-hop.  

Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely consider going again.  Yes, the hotel is a bit out-dated but is still clean, nice, and spacious.

Would not stay again. Our room was connected to some kids doing gymnastics. After a long time of discussing the kids trying to enter our room and dealing with the noise they moved us. Oversll the place felt dirty but we were in one of the remodeled rooms. The drains are slow. The food is highly priced but thats everywhere in vegas. Get a player's card to save a few bucks. The valet is very slow.  I would say the good thing about the place is the view which does cost of course. The beds are okay too!

All the rooms at the Rio are suites and very spacious. The rooms are in good condition, but a little dated. If they want to be relevant and competitive then they should invest in updating their suites. 

Overall, the hotel is very smoky and our room was not ready at midnight - when check in begins at 4 p.m. They've recently added check in kiosks to expedite things. I am tech savvy and found that the kiosks were not user friendly. My Nevada drivers license would not scan properly after several attempts. I noticed several other people having similar issues and there rooms were not ready either. Although my room was dirt cheap, this will probably be my last time staying here.

Gone are the good ol' days of the 90s - when the Rio was the spot!

Decided to try the Rio this past weekend for my fiancé's surprise birthday trip, and was extremely disappointed. 

I don't really enjoy leaving bad reviews, so I'll keep it short with why I would never stay again:

The shower pressure was HORRIBLE! I'm not sure what the plan was here but the water barely came out and what did come out, just came out all half-assed and made it pretty difficult to shower comfortably without having to be directly under the shower head for water. I uploaded a photo so you can kind of see what I'm talking about. 

Like another reviewer mentioned, the WiFi here was also horrible! Dial-up like speeds is an understatement. Why charge for it, if you can't even access it? I ended up having to be connected to their IT people for about 20 minutes before thy finally ended up resetting their port connection to finally get it to work the day before we left. 

Checking out was a nightmare trying to use my Total Rewards balance to pay for my resort fees. I continuously showed the reception lady emails showing I had a balance and she couldn't help me unless I went to go sort it out at the TR desk.

Yes, the rooms are a bit bigger compared to rooms on the strip, but they definitely look a bit outdated. The only other thing we did like was the free shuttle over to Harrah's or Bally's every 30 minutes if you want to go walk\/drink without having to drive. 

Other than that, it's definitely worth more money to just stay on the strip...

Was the Rio the worst hotel I've ever stayed at?  No.  Would I go out of my way to stay again?  Also, no.

I stayed off-strip at the Rio because the convention I was attending was being held there and it was just more convenient.  They do have a free shuttle that goes to the strip and and I found the drivers to be efficient and polite.

Housekeeping was also excellent.  The room was cleaned in a timely fashion every day and when we asked for extra towels, we got them for the rest of our stay without question or complaint.

The casino is also fine.  I didn't play any table games but the slots and video poker are what you would expect.

But, we had major and minor issues with our room and while the staff was polite and handled everything we had problems we shouldn't have had.

1. The TV\/stand was not secured properly to the wall and when I pulled it out, the whole thing tipped over.  Luckily, we were able to push it back upright before disaster, but one of us could have been hurt.

2. The A\/C only worked if you turned it down to 55.  The coldest our room ever got was 74.  There was also a constant dripping noise coming from inside the wall, presumably from the A\/C.

3. The hairdryer was horribly and obviously broken.

4. The toilet paper holder came right out of the wall.

While a few of those things are minor, it just proves that the Rio isn't ready to compete with the big boys.  We shouldn't have had to deal with our TV falling over or our A\/C not working properly.  You just don't see the level of service or the quality as other Vegas hotels.
Great Buffet!!! Awesome 50% off local special!!

I lived in Vegas for 20 years. Occasionally we'd stay in a hotel as a staycation.  Since we moved to CA we had to stay in a hotel this trip. The Rio was low cost so I made a reservation.  It was a really nice hotel a while back, what happened. 

The smell of cigarette permeates the air as you walk in.  The lines to check in were outrageous.  Luckily I had pre checked in online so my wait was reasonable.  My hotel clerk was brand new, very slow and nervous.  I asked who the VP was and he said he had no idea since they change them so often huh? 

My room smelled of cigarette though I requested non smoking. there was no room service menu and the TV wouldn't work.  I asked  the housekeeping runner if we were on a smoking floor and he said he had no idea...did he smell the cigarette smoke? Maybe? he said.  Store this under you get what  you pay for.  Speaking of pay, $25 for a Resort fee with wifi that doesn't work 

I'm going to try to remember the Rio of old when Harrah's cared about this place, the employees were well trained and it was the place to be

What a dump..!!  Interior was extremely dirty and out dated. Staff and security are a bunch of thugs!  Everything I saw in this hotel had original interior, with tears, dirt, and god knows what. Bathroom was the tiniest, dirty bathroom I've ever seen. What a waist to spend money staying at the Rio... there is much better in Vegas for the money. Tried a couple of the restaurants, including Voodoo steak, and everything I had was terrible. I certainly will NOT go back to this dump!

Valet: I believe that they must be slowest in Vegas and they don't even have their fans on outside. It's 106 degrees and I've asked two different employees.

Update: it was a 20 minute wait for my vehicle and still...no fans
Tried to go to the buffet.  Power went out twice (probably due to the heat wave).  Obviously not there fault...BUT it was handled poorly.  Terrible customer service.  Won't be back...

I am currently staying at the Rio at this moment I just checked into my room and to my surprise I found some dog poop near the bed. It's between the nightstand and the bed. This is disgusting! 

I called guest service desk and they have no explanation for it. Didn't offer me anything but just a different room at my inconvenience. I have two little ones and switching rooms was quite challenging. 

Come on, how gross is that! Please take a look at my photo. Always inspect your room before you start settling in.

The Rio is large, clean, the staff is friendly, it's away from the strip and best of all our room was only $27 a night! We came here for Christmas and the Rio was by far the cheapest. My only complaint is the $40 a day resort fee.... That's crap.

I was sent here for a ACE Fitness convention for my fire dept along with 4 other people. They told me they couldn't charge the credit card they had because it had to be the one used to make the reservations. (which isn't true because companies pay up front for group rates on one card) We were then told we had to have an actual credit card  (not debit card) to put the security deposit on. Unfortunatly i offered mine up since i was the only one in thr goup who had one. The RIO ended up charging my card over 15 times for 4 seperate rooms. 

Its taken me about 2 months to get them to credit my card and charge the cities card as they were supposed to. There was some type of problem with the DC gov't credit card so they went to the only one other one on file (mine) without authorization. 

The only reason they got two stars, friendly (yet not competant hep), nice rooms with decent views, good -not great- location for decent prices, free shows and a good shuttle service.  I didn't like the overly priced drinks, all of the "working girls" , extreemly smokey atmosphere some nights. The gym there was about 20-25 a day (rediculous) One of the guys with me had a leak in his room and they didn't imediatly move him to a new room to repair the leaky ceiling - he was supposed to be comp(ed) free internet and that was also charged to the wrong credit card (mine).The internet was $15?? a day or week (cont remember exactly) WHen most hotels offer free internet. I've contacted them about this several times and was offered no apologies after haing to move alot of money from my savings to my checking accounts to cover their mistake.

Stayed here July 31, 2017 in a room above the train tracks with a strip view and won't ever stay here again.

Carpet and room DIRTY! I was afraid to take my socks off. 

Vinyl on desk chair more peeling of vinyl than what was left on fabric base. 

Furniture beyond worn out, bed extremely lumpy.

Human hair in tub\/shower.

Stained towels look as if they weren't replaced after previous guest left.

Did the buffet, yikes it was as bad as the reviews state.

Like I said I would never stay here again and I am a REWARDS customer and given a room in this condition!?! I guess they do not value my business.

We had a fabulous time staying at the Rio. 
Though it's off the Las Vegas strip, you can conveniently access it via the Rio - Harrahs shuttle, which runs roughly every half an hour pretty much all day and night (until 1 AM).  It's rather accessible and very awesome. 

I really like the Rio because I love the vibe here.  The pool is really fun and the hotel also looks really cool from the outside.  
The Rio buffet is one of my two favorite buffets in Vegas and it is consistently good and has a lot of variety (I wrote a separate review for that). 

The other restaurants in here are cool and open late (we had late night food here after a night of clubbing).  Overall I really like the Rio hotel and highly recommend it.

Stayed here while attending the Star Trek Convention. 

Plenty of dining choices, fairly clean, and most everything is conveniently located. I recommend going to the Indian buffet EARLY, because by the end of the service the food in the chafing dishes are less than appetizing. The Italian resto is pretty good, and the seafood buffet is quite nice. 

Our room was spacious and only cost four of us around 100 bucks a piece for 3-4 nights. The strip is just over the bridge and more specifically the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace.

我于6月6日入住该酒店433号房，第二天退房时遗留儿子价值300美元的有完美包装的矫正隐形镜片，7日晚打电话及发邮件给该酒店都没结果，8日晚我们再前往该酒店咨询但还是没找到。如此重要的东西，酒店方怎能因客人的一时疏忽而把它丢弃呢？酒店有严重的管理问题。
     We checked in Rio in June 6,When we checked out next day ,we left the lenses that is for correcting vision at room 433. They are in a clear bottle, and we put in a clear bag with a bottle of eyes drop.They value USD $300. We called and emailed the lost and found at the evening on June 7, and we went to Rio Hotel in June 8 to ask, But they didn't give me a good answer. The room cleaner shouldn't throw the valuable things away.  Rio has a serious problem in management!
Love the buffet!!! Half off for locals too! about 30 bucks for 2 people... for locals... great deal. especially if your wanting to get your grub on!
