So far pretty shitty experience. Didn't have the room we booked. At 6pm or 7:30. Machine kept telling us to come back later. Went to the desk after the line dissipated. Guy tells us w attitude he doesn't have 2 queen beds. We can deal w a king or pay to upgrade $50 a night. We take the king. Get to the room and there's a technician in the room fixing the AC.

The room was nice. The pool was fun with heated pool and a DJ. We had a great view of pool and zipline which fun and entertainment. Staff was helpful. The environment was fun, clean, and a good place to relax or have fun.

Nice room very clean and big the food I had breakfast the food was not very good 
Starbucks was over priced the pool was great
Great stay, clean, comfy, and great area. Next to the strip and big casino. Big rooms and cool shows

Don't do it. Do not stay here. Sure, it's cheaper than a lot of hotels in Vegas but the service is terrible. Our introduction to the Rio came in the form of a 30-minute wait to check in. Throughout our stay we noticed the line never got shorter. It's always like waiting at the airport security line. Then, our key card didn't work for our room so we went BACK in line to get a second key card that also didn't work. 90 minutes later, I'd argued with the front desk clerk to get our room changed so we could actually get inside of it. The Rio is also in a bad location - super far off the strip so you have to take shuttle to and from. Not fun. The only redeeming quality was that the room was clean and a good size. But overall not worth it. I won't be staying here in the future.

Still a nice property with a fun colorful carnival feel\/theme. Free shows- the Show in the Sky one tosses beads into the crowd and the bevertainers for a song (dancing). Two good buffets- worth going to, and I don't say that too much about casino buffets; sometimes there is a locals promotion on selected days (not weekends). Some shops include: Bijoux Terner store- where everything is $10.00, Harley Davidson, and Wetzel's Pretzel. The VooDoo Lounge is pretty nice but so crowded, it could feel claustrophobic at times- I went there a few times. Still the view of the Strip is pretty nice. The seafood restaurant, Buzio's, is pretty good. I ate there a couple times. The pool got good reviews but had some arrests on counts of prostitution (last summer). All the rooms are suites- saw it a few times whenever friends from out of town would visit. Pretty nice. This casino was the first one to introduce the cocktail waitresses in thong back outfits (since changed).

Stayed here for a night on my last trip to Las Vegas for work and was pleasantly surprised at how nice and spacious the rooms were compared to the cost. Had absolutely zero luck in gaming so my recommendation is to stay here and gamble elsewhere.

I stayed last weekend, only bad experience was because I reserved a hotel with non-smoking. Already paid and when I get there I get a smoking room or either I get downgraded to a regular king size room. I paid the extra for the strip view and non smoking. I hope they fix their system if you reserve a room it should be there until you check in. Smh

BEWARE OF HIDDEN CHARGES!!! $21\/per night automatic for Internet and 'resort access' (to use sauna, even if you don't use either you will be charged)! Long distance call is $12, even if you call and no one answers. If you do use the Spa, they round your charges... They do not charge your actual receipt amount. The front desk is unable to adjust charges even if you have receipts that prove the charge has been altered (rounded).

The rooms were nice but don't believe your getting a deal, they will steam roll you with HIDDEN CHARGES!

I am not rating the casino.

I am rating the buffet. Why my friends and I stopped by here? NO IDEA. WORST VEGAS DECISION EVER.

Luckily we had the "buffet of buffets" and could eat here free. Otherwise they wanted 29.95 for it. I have no idea WHO would pay 29.95 for it. 

Just think of your high school cafeteria. That is what this place is like.

Old, dingy, smells like cigarettes. Big rooms... with old, non-LCD TVs for that retro feel! This place needs to be renovated badly. I didn't pay for the stay, so I can't say if the prices justify the overall crappiness of the place. 

The one saving grace is that it houses Penn & Teller. But I'd much rather have stayed in a hotel that has been updated in the last 20 years and take a cab to see Penn & Teller.

I really like Rio, I really really do! All rooms are suites with flat screens! For the price this hotel is great. Clean, Clean and More Clean rooms! with a large couch that has a pull out bed as well. The room I was placed in had a great large window that I could see the zip line from the window. Neat but Crazy. 

The Rio has two buffets, one with regular food selections which I found to be just ok and then the Seafood buffet, I must admit I am crab leg kind of gal!

Rio also has a Burger King, a pretzel place as well as a pho place to choose from, Indian food, breakfast place, Mexican food location from Guy F. Man options to eat whatever you like! And drink what ever you like!

Rio even has a wine cellar! Super nice great please to get a glass of wine and champs!

Rio has a large nice size pool,  I haven't heard a dj at the pool like other locations but a nice pool they do have! 

Check out the rooftop night club for great views, great hip hop and an all together great time! 


Rio really will give you your bang for your buck

I remember when this place was cool -- large suites at great prices, an awesome buffet, and a generally cool vibe.

Now, when I go back, I feel like the the Harrah's vacuum cleaner is trying to get my money as quickly as possible. Everything is double or triple the price it used to be.

The rooms are way overpriced, considering you are off the strip.  And some of the rooms haven't been remodeled in a while, like when they only had the one tower.

Everything (I mean everything) is a cab ride away, because it's too far to walk.

And this place takes the whole theme thing to an extreme, with the masquerade show and all.

I'll just boycott the place until it gets better.

This review is for the convention \/ meeting room facilities. And I am NOT IMPRESSED. In many other cities the Rio's convention and meeting room facilities would be considered downright opulent and something a city would be proud to have for hosting events. In Vegas, it's like yawn, been there, done that, it's a little dated and not all that. 

Service: Hustle was the word of the day for our visit from the manager we directly worked with. Got service with a smile too. When a technical difficulty came up their IT staff was on the ball with a quick response. I always love that and give it mad praise when you get that kind of service. 

Food: The food was average. Pretty to look at, slow to get on the table, servers didn't pay attention and were sloppy in getting food on and off the tables and it is insulting to tea to lump their so called offering into the category of tea. Bleech. 

But that's where the positive comments come to a halt. Seriously if you're paying premium money to rent a room for an event and they roll out a cheap projector that is broken to the point they put a 9 volt battery under one corner of it so it would project a level image onto the screen? Seriously? Of all the comps I've ever received in Vegas, a 9 volt battery to fix junk equipment is the worst on the list. (See the picture, you can't make this stuff up.)

If you forget a clicker for your Powerpoint, it's a cool $125 a day rental for something I could have bought for half price had I had the time to grab a cab and run to Fry's to buy one (including the cab fare and cabbie tip). I ended up making changes so it wasn't needed but the price they quoted takes "FLEECING" to a whole other level. 

When I compare the Gold Coast to the Rio in terms of price vs. square footage, quality of the space, quality of the A\/V equipment, and yes even the staff, the Gold Coast quite frankly kicks the Rio's ass HARD. Anyone renting space for a meeting and considering the Rio needs to think long and hard about it as most likely they are not receiving the best value for their money. 

2 Stars, and even the second star is one I'm on the fence about giving. But a placement on my Jackassery list is a must. As yes, I think sticking a braying jackass in place of the Rio's management team would do a better job of handling this place. (Again our one on site rep who I can't name was awesome considering she was working with crappy equipment). Oh and the extra valet we paid for...can someone give those guys some 5 hour energy before letting them loose to retrieve cars? Yeah, not happy. We deserve better. And we'll be getting better.

oooh oooh oooh....Go here Go here!!!!  Okay we didn't stay here, we just visited the casino but still...GO...GO...GO.... 
                                           ***FREE***
They have a floating float show that they put on over the casino on a track suspended from the ceiling and you or your kids (mine loved it) can dress up in revolving themed stuff, (all provided) and ride on a float....Joining in the show...JUST GO HERE!!!!!  ((NO COST))   
My kids are 13,13,14 and there was lots of little ones...all LOVED it !!!!
                                            ***FREE**
                            NOT  cheesy and dumb...its fun
The best place to see the show...and catch the cheesy beads... is on the second level... sit down, have a drink, lots of cafe's (inexpensive)

We didn't stay here so I can't comment on hotel. But the show is a huge production done many times throughout the day and so worth a visit, check the internet for times.

Worst place to stay in Vegas. Never again staying here in Rio!  Bad customer service from Joanna. Damn hidden fees during check in. Front desk need to learn some manners and ethics on how to please a visiting guest! I've never been treated so badly during a hotel stay ever. This place makes me sick! Curse this damn establishment!  Again, curse this place!

Update...I gave 1 star in the beginning but Ginger(Mgr) called back and fixed the problem so she gets 5 star for that, just her though.....

This hotel is really under appreciated. It's got great games, great entertainment (hello Chippendales and performance in the sky), but best of of all, it has an excellent buffet. 

Rio has two buffets - one "world cuisine" and the other seafood. We went to the former. It was one of the best buffets I've been to. The selection was fantastic - prime rib, spanish food, great seafood, sushi, etc. Everything was cooked to perfection - the meat just fell apart. Everything I had, which I'm sad to admit was tons, was excellent. Totally worth the wait and the money. The best part? The dessert bar is to die for. They have a gelato bar plus mini desserts, so you don't feel bad when you eat like 3 of them. Well, you may, but you have an excuse - they're mini!

We stayed here because my son was playing in the WSOP. When booking the reservation I was happy because alot of the nights were compted. When arriving it was dirty and had not been updated since the 70's. The resort fees are a joke and upon leaving they charged a $56. fee for leaving early. Kinda a joke because compted is not compted. Cost was close to $400. On the first night at 5:00am security barged in our room unannounced and said they were doing random security checks. At 5:00am with no knock on the door and left without saying anything to us. The front desk offered a $15 credit for food. big deal. I checked into the Hard Rock hotel where free is free. There are no resort fees and taxes. And it was clean and new. I will never stay at the Rio even if the host the WSOP.

I've been here many times over the past 5+ years but this time was pretty rough. We parked in the parking garage on the side because we were just going for an early lunch into the buffet. There was a horrible sewage smell from the minute we walked in the doors all the way going down the hallway where you enter the casino and the restaurant. The buffet was just OK this time not nearly the quality it has been in the past. You could really see the way the places falling apart from the paint on the building to the restrooms to the carpet and like I say the food on the buffet was just not what it once was. I truly always like this hotel I hope that the owners\/management read these reviews and correct it.

I will not come back again. Poor service especially the manager. One of their staff promised me to change to 2 queen bed room on Sat. When I talk to them, they just transfer to manager. The manager was having a poor attitude. He even said that he didn't promise it, just his staff. He can help me check out if I want. His attitude made me feel terrible in this Vegas trip.

Stayed at the Rio for a short business trip earlier this year and most likely will not stay here again. The decor is older and the atmosphere was not that great. I've stayed at the MGM Grand and Mandalay Bay multiple times and those resorts are definitely worth the extra money spent. The seafood buffet at the Rio was overpriced and did not meet my expectations. The food was average but your money will be better spent at another buffet on the strip. 

For anyone considering staying at the Rio or a resort on the strip, if you can afford the extra cost my recommendation is to do it.

I stayed the night at the Rio and it was amazing!!! 

alright.. parking sucks if you are stopping by to see a show or eat at one of the spots downstairs... but what hotel on or near the strip is good?

the staff was very friendly as I didnt know where things were, they helped by pointing me to the right direction. 

Price was great, as I stayed for free through a family's discount.

the room I had was very spacious and clean.

Came here for 4th annual Marijuana Business Conference, so I got a room here. The room was nice no complaints and the buffet was good also, and Free for Vet's, nice. So here is where it got Great. after checking in I got to my room, freshened up and then went downstairs to grab a beer or two. They had the World Poker Tournament there and we were watching the end of it on tv. When it was over and they were showing the new champion they had last year's winner on there also, Martin Jacobson. So I'm a few beers down and not knowing much about the tournament I was just in awe of the stack of money the guy had just won. Then I get a tap on my shoulder and turn around and this guy is there and I ask him if I know him and he tells me it's him, Martin Jacobson, the guy on TV right then. I can't believe it, we proceeded to talk at length about all kinds of stuff, this guy is awesome, he was so nice to me I was stoked.  O yeah he had won 10 million dollar's the year before. I'm going to say it one more time, he was a awesome person,  down to earth and very easy to talk to, very humble, that in itself made my trip. So I guess this review might be more about Martin Jacobson then the Rio, but my stay there was awesome because of meeting him. My only regret was that I didn't have my phone with me to take a picture with him.

I'm an attorney and judge.  Reserved a room for my wife and I for 2 nights.  On arriving, there were signs on entering the property pointing to Registration. Drove up to find no parking to register.  None. No one came near front entrance driveway to assist.  Drove around in a circular driveway back again to the entrance to the casino.  A valet I found told me to drive out to another hotel roadway to register.  Drove around, still no place to park or talk to anyone there. Another valet advised I park on the taxi's exiting driveway AGAINST A RED CURB (ILLEGAL IN ALL OF THE U.S.) WITH OTHER HOTEL REGISTRANTS then walk across 7 traffic lanes with NO MARKED PEDESTRIAN WALKWAY again to the front entrance I had already driven by twice to register.  Did that and spoke with a clerk at Registration.  Was then told to park in the Masquerade parking structure and go to the casino elevator by MashBurger.  No signs in parking structure to tell you which level is the casino\/hotel elevated walkway entrance.  Eventually found the right level.

In casino NO SIGNS TO ELEVATORS.
Walked with luggage along 2nd floor walkway past many stores with no signs and by mere chance found elevator from 2nd floor to first - AGAIN no signs showing this elevator leads in any way to rooms.

By mere chance walking along floor of Casino with luggage found elevators to hotel tower.  Got to our room. 

Called a manager by room phone who WAS NOT EITHER HELPFUL, ASSISTIVE OR ACCOMMODATING.  ALL SHE SAID WAS, "We will talk to the valet" then hung up.

SERVICE IS EVERYTHING TODAY.
EVIDENTLY NOT FOR THE RIO OR THEIR OWNER CAESARS -  IN LAS VEGAS

John Armington

I had an awesome time playing at the World Series of Poker as well as seeing the energetic wait staff dance periodically.  The Seafood buffet is amazing, be careful of the line ( We players didnt have to wait,...) , the pool scene was fun, ( including the topless area) Thank you to the staff and management of the Rio for an awesome time!

You live and you learn from your mistakes. This place surely was a mistake! At first when I checked in (room 1617), the front desk person (Brian) was really nice and gave me some free VIP passes to the Voodoo lounge and etc. He put us in a suite that overlooked the swimming pool. We got to our room noticed it was pretty nice for the price we paid 325 for three nights is pretty cheap. 

The location is a bit off the strip which kind of sucked but the shuttle was sorta helpful but sucked if you were the group that couldnt make it on the shuttle and had to wait another 15-30mins. The pool is pretty murky which was kind of gross! We only went one day after our first visit. They seriously need to clean up the pool hahaha! Some of the food there is pretty good too like the chinese places Mah Jong.

Now here was the problem. Called in earlier in the evening about our bathroom having this foul sewer smell. Waited about an hour and a half, no one came. Called back then finally a facility worker came. By the time he came the smell sorta went away, so he said it was no problem. We left for the strip, came back after 4 hours and the foul smell was there again. We finally realized that when people around our room was using their water it made our room sooooo bad! Anyways called again late at night and a guy came into our room around 3am. We were already told that we would get a new room. Oh I also forgot to mention the dead bolt on our door would not shut unless you wiggled the handle from the inside so when you left your room the door would not close. So the facility worker tried to fix the door which didnt help at all since he opened it and cleared out all our keys, tried to put some kind of cleaning solution down our drains which only masked the smell. At this time my gf was annoyed that there was this guy in our room at like 4am still trying to fix this when she just wanted him to leave. Instead security was called cause he thought she was being rowdy. The front desk manager was not apologetic at all to her, was pretty damn rude. They never called us in the morning to switch rooms, I actually had to call and tell them to move us. Never really got a sorry from them. I think we should of got comped a night for all that drama. We were moved to room 1477 which had no problems but no view, but we really didnt care anymore.

The customer service sucks at the Rio. Oh yeah not to mention when we were leaving our 1617 room the cleaning lady is even said I dont know why they gave you guys that room since its out of order? WTH is that!
Stayed here as part of a package for a Hockey tournament.  Ugh.  Ghetto ugh.

I have been coming to the Rio since they were still working on the first tower. Well over 20 years now. I have had a few issues over the years but this is still my home away from home in Las Vegas. I have tried many of the other so call "strip" hotels and most are over rated. I also should say I am a long time Diamond gambler with Caesars. It helps a lot make no mistake.
I read some of these reviews with amusement that folks want diamond service and don't even gamble. HELLO......it's Las Vegas they want gamblers! If you want a 5 star hotel go to Palm Springs or Hawaii......Vegas caters to gamblers folks!
I never wait to check in, get my car from valet.....or to eat in any place inside the Rio or any other Caesars hotel in Las Vegas. I also have a casino host to make my arrangements. Yes it's a perk....but I earn it by gambling on my trips here.
Also remember that all employees here are minimum wage folks....and a well placed "TIP" works wonders! Tip the bellman, the bartender, the sports book employee, the slot folks, the waiters\/waitresses...and guess what........you'll be surprised.
If you're a cheapskate that can't afford a hold on your credit card for a room.....go somewhere else. This is VEGAS! There is perks for gamblers.....and then there is everyone else.......
I'll be going back to the Rio because I know most all the employees here and they treat me great!

This was my first time at the Rio although I go to Vegas 4-5 times a year. This trip was unplanned and I simply booked the least expensive room I could find for a quick trip. I was very happy with the Rio. The room was beautiful, the bed amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was excellent (plenty of towels, water pressure and lighting)
Will definitely stay here again. Also, loved the American Bar & Grill at the hotel, please see separate review.

Where do I start..... This is my first time and last time staying here at the hotel. I get to the casino and right away I have an issue checking in.. the line was long and they only had 4 people working the desk and moving slower than molasses. I have a chronic pain disease and I looked over at the desk they had for disability and they had no one working it or signs that show a line to that disability desk. I agree I was a little irritated when I went to the desk. I asked the worker how does one access that disability desk and how come no one is working it. I told her I had a disability and she looked at me and said " what's wrong with you, you look fine to me". I looked at her and asked excuse me? She said you look fine to me.. I then proceeded to tell her I have a medical condition and had to educate on my disability. The issue got worse as she gave me my room keys. I was in Vegas for the night for a bachelorette party.. so instead of heading to my room I went to the party room. When I went to my room that was suppose to be mine, as I walk in... there are underwear everywhere, makeup, and TV on.. I immediately leave the room and call the main desk.. they inform me that they made a mistake with my room and double booked it and had me walk down to the desk to get new keys to the room. Our rooms are far to walk to.. so I get the new room, go check into it.. It smells like cigarettes, smoke or something was burning. The room was also dirty as in dusty vents, carpet was stained and really outdated furniture, I call down again to make a complain and they switch me once more to another room. At that time I tell them I can be doing anymore walking, my pain is hurting me a lot. They send a bellhop guy to give me my keys and I ask him to smell it. He's like oh yeah. Maybe one of the vents are leaking from the kitchen and the Mesquite smoker is leaking in.... last time I checked I'm not a piece of meat that needs smoking. I might be a little thick...They did comp me 30 dollars for food for everything that I went through. Pros are they have a good buffet and the Chippendales dance show was cute. Not much for slot machines!!

great hotel. the breakfast ham steak is the best I've ever had. large portions and they even cook your eggs perfectly in olive oil if requested. daily maid service is prompt and friendly. rooms are always nice with kuerig coffee makers in room. pool is nice too. 3 stars as I wish they would offer free wifi & get better air circulation for the smoking.

To some degree, I don't blame The Rio.  Most Las Vegas guests treat hotel rooms as playgrounds and perform circus feats that they would never likely do in their own homes, so updating the guest rooms every few years does not make sense, however, The Rio is shabby.  Not shabby chic, but shabby, worn and on par with a dirty Motel 6.

Stained carpeting, broken bedroom lamps, dirty curtains, dated furniture ... this is what you can expect at this rag tag property.

I was given a weekend stay at the Rio as a gift from my boss and took my Dad with me as a partner in crime.  The room was nice enough but the window between the shower and the bedroom was a little weird.  I guess it might have been a little less strange if my DAD had not been staying with me.  

The pools here were my favorite thing about this hotel.  Very busy as we were there during August and it was about a billion degrees, but the wait staff was always available to bring us more drinks.  

The views are nice from this hotel, but it was a giant pain in the butt to get to the strip from this hotel.  The shuttle never seemed to run on time and the location of the hotel makes it a prime candidate to put guests in traffic all the time.  

The cheesy "show" above the casino floor is funny and I do not believe they intend it to be that way.  It has a Mardi Gras theme and it is just bad.  They do throw beads so it might be fun for kids to try and catch them.

I would stay here again, but only if it was free.  I would rather stay at the Flamingo on the strip!

I recently stayed here while in town for work and was pleasantly surprised. All stuff including house keeping was exceptional. The rio is off the strip but the free shuttle to the strip will take you from the rio to harrahs or ballys- it's really a nice service.

I checked in today and asked for a nice view. I received a room on the fourth floor overlooking the entrance to the casino roof. I then asked for a room on an elevated floor with a view of the pool. I got what they called a renovated room and the couch must have been fifty years old without a pool view and was charged an upgrade fee. I gamble all the time! Not the attention to detail I was looking for!
Penn and Teller were amazing, especially with front row seats! Loved the atmosphere and the food was great. Check-in took a while though which was the only let down.

I did not stay here, just came for the casino. I don't see anything exceptional about this place. There's nothing really unique to distinguish it from other casinos. The neon sign is kind of cool, but there are neon signs everywhere! It's not even on the Strip- you have to take a shuttle. Technically, you could walk, but the path includes a major highway, so it's not like it would be pleasant or scenic stroll. If you're looking for a place to stay, I'd suggest spending a little more and staying on the Strip.

With all the new casinos popping up on the strip, not many people want to stay at the older casinos like Stratosphere, Palms, Circus, and Rio. Rio is pretty old & is off the strip, but their suite rooms are a lot cleaner than I expected. For the price you'd pay at Luxor, you can get a way bigger room at Rio w\/ a free fridge inside for use! Hooray for no more filling the bathtubs up w\/ ice to keep the drinks & alcohol cold lol. Plus the fridge helps when you've got ton of leftover food or need to keep snacks cold.

The pool area is really nice (there's about 5-6 different pools?), but the jacuzzi is small and is sort of unappealing after seeing it be crowded w\/ a bunch of fat hairy men. They've also got a kid pool area w\/ beach sand on it (no, sorry it doesn't look as nice as Mandalay Bay w\/ their  man made beach wave pool).

The only con about the rooms here though is that there's a random circular window that shows the head of the person taking a shower. The suites have such a huge amount of space you can easily fit 10 people in it. Sofa is comfy enough to sleep in and the beds weren't too bad either. Their room service and customer service were really top notch for an old casino. If you're too lazy to drive, they have the monorail that takes you back to the strip. Overall not bad if you wanna get away from the crowds on the strip.

This is an average hotel to me.  My pops is a platinum member so he always gets free rooms.  I can't complain with free but I just wish this hotel was more comfortable.

I have stayed here a few times and the rooms were kind of dirty to me.  The last time I stayed here, I had a towel with cigarette burns.  Gross.

I also wish blackjack tables weren't so darn expensive.  The minimum is $15!  The blackjack lady wiped me out in 2 minutes!  Also, this hotel is off the strip.  The only place you really can walk to is Gold Coast, another below average hotel.  No bueno.

Love this place... So comfortable.  
Clean
One of the best beds
Love the fitness center
Haven't tried the food at their buffet yet... too busy eating at The "M" and Caesars.  The  Mandalay Bay buffet never disappoints.  The Wynn, Aria, Cosmopolitan  are also tops.

WARNING:  Review is based off of comped rooms and someone who frequents Vegas at least a couple times a year...

FIRST IS THE WORST:  The first night, the four of us got put into a suite with one King Size bed and a sofa bed.  I believe this room was intended for someone on a quick business trip because A) the view sucked B) there were only 2 sets of towels, C) the sofa bed had no sheets, D) there were no trash cans AT ALL.  I was tempted to just crumple a bunch of toilet paper and pile them up next to the toilet floor in my disgust.  E) we could hear everything next door... EVERYTHING........it was an annoying couple with their crying baby.  I was tempted to do battle with them.  How dare you wake up at 7am in Vegas.

REDEMPTION:  After ranting to the front desk (but not too much since the rooms were comped), the rest of the stay, we got put into a sweet suite with two queen size beds.  Perfect except for a few stains... don't worry, they were merely some small gum stains on the carpet.  The room had a gorgeous view of the adjacent tower, part of the strip and the pool below.  Also, it was decked out with very clean and contemporary dcor.

PLAY TIME:  I can't comment on the gaming at Rio because most of my time playing was at the adjacent walk-able Gold Coast and Palms (whoever says it's not walkable is weaksauce), since they have better Video Poker and Craps, my two favorite games.  I personally loved the location because it is away from the craziness of the strip, but at the same time, they provide shuttles that head to Paris, Bally's, and Harrah's.  Compared to my previous stay at Paris, I'd rather stay at the more spacious Rio.  Show me a more spacious hotel and I'll check it out.  The pool area wasn't too shabby, with a nice little fake beach area.

We were in town for a wedding. Got a good deal on our room on Expedia.  The room, where dated, was huge and pretty nice.  I didn't notice a problem with the WiFi as some did, but I think the resort fee is a little high for what you get.  We went to the spa and had massages that were just OK, but the spa is nice, they have a good selection of juice, clean hot tub and steam room.  Took advantage of the spa area twice while we were there since it's included with the resort fee.  The spa attendent Collyn was super sweet and attentive and even gave me a little bag with some samples in it for my birthday along with a birthday balloon!

All American Bar & Grill was pretty good in the middle of the night when we got back from gambling.  Went to Hash Hash a Go Go twice for breakfast, this was pretty good.  Voodoo Steak was delish.  There is enough to do at the Rio that we didn't even go to the Strip during the two days we were there.  Will stay here again.

We just came back from the Rio. Never again. Panoramic view of a dirt lot and the Gold Coast casino. Three requests to fix our light. Then someone charged their Starbucks to our room. Pools roped off and the most unwelcoming, unaccommodating staff of all time. I guess the great customer service they gave us last time was a crapshoot. Or maybe they they thought I was Beyonce. This time, they thought I was Lil' Kim, because I got balls. You think you're getting a bargain, then sucka! They rob you with high resort fees and a $50\/night deposit. Yet I could not get a room change. Pro tip: crying Oscar tears will get your lights fixed by midnight.

I'm usually use to staying on the stir at the more popular hotel\/casinos. I only needed a night didn't want to pay a ton of money and the rio had a great rate on 5\/4\/15. 
First I checked in and kindly asked for a room with a separate tub and shower. Not a tub\/shower combo. The gentleman at the counter stepped away to ask management I guess.. When he came back he told me they are upgrading me to a suite. Although I thought they were all suites I didn't pay it any mind. I had to put down a down payment of some sort but I didn't mind. I thanked the gentleman at the counter and went to my room. I was suspicious at first because there were only four rooms on the 3rd floor and thought he put me in some room with no window or something. Trust me I had rooms like that. 
So I get to my room and it's the biggest room I've ever stayed in. Ever. 
It had a separate living room, dining room, sitting room, separate bedroom and the bathroom was to die for. There wasn't anything too fancy about it but it was comfortable. I truly appreciated the upgrade. 
I also would like to thank to folks at the poker table. lol. They really made my trip a lot better. 
I will stay here again just for the fact they didn't have to accommodate me like the on a busy day. I love good customer service.

I am really disappointed. My first time starting at the Rio and it is so run down.

We get to the room and the first thing I notice is duct tape holding the carpet down. So then get comfortable and take my shoes off and the carpet was wet everywhere. I wondered if they just shampooed a crime scene or something.

The beds are made so badly the sheets do not look pulled straight or tight. The good thing is they are not like sleeping on the floor or a sheet of plywood.

Yikes.  My first impression stepping into this place was roughly 1991.  I'd say it needs an update. But, it looked like some good cheesy fun, and it was. 

Fortunately, I got to the room and saw that the hotel owners must have figured that out and entered into the new millennium with renovations.  The room were huge and really neat and modern - the perfect place for a group of girls who will have their belongings spread out everywhere.... so we thought.

We went to the pool, where the time machine sent us right back to 1991.... Wait... Rewind further... 1989... Quick! Get me my pink Walkman!... Oh, nevermind, I don't need it, there's plenty of 80s music blaring from the less than clear sound system. 

Strangely, they painted parts of the bottom of the pool yellow and orange. I later learned that it is made to look like a clown fish from up above.  Interesting choice.  I get it.  I guess.  It just made the pool look dirty, if you'd ask me.    

So, being a couple of mighty fine females, we got comped back into this century at the special adult only pool - Sapphire.  The pool was legitimately nice, and it had better, newer seating, waterfalls, hot tubs.  If you can get over interesting tattoos and toplessness, it certainly was a better environment than the other pool.  

After a good night of sleep, I got up to treat myself with a massage, which was the best part of my trip so far for sure.  When I was done, I felt so relaxed and went out into the sun. 

For some reason my calves were itchy.  Hmmmmm.... must be sunburn... hmmm... they continued to itch all day and through my redeye flight... hmmmmm..  

When I arrived back home I got a text from my friend, whose mother slept in the same bed I did that night after I did. They had changed the sheets, but she woke up with itchy welts all over her. The hotel switched their room, but didn't do much else.

Check your mattresses folks.  Bedbugs apparently reside anywhere, even places that appear to be clean.  What a nightmare!!!!

stayed at the Rio for March Madness. nice spot for this poker room. located in the Ipanema Tower (my tower) and next door to the sportsbook. i was lucky enough to watch my brackets get busted on several occassions from the comfort of my poker seat. yay me. 

NL tourneys run at 1200, 1500, 1800 and i think 2100. not sure if there was a midnight one. $70 buy-in for 4000 chips. mostly tourists run this poker room during the tourneys. pretty tight players. cash games are minimum $100 for $1-$3 NL. they opened up an Omaha game once while i was here. they didn't get a full table though. 

the room itself is nice, clean and well organized. dealers were friendly and chatty. the chairs need some upgrading though. they didn't swivel or rock. and after playing for hours, one needs a little rock and roll. dealer chairs swiveled. 

overall, nice room and if we stay here next year, i'll be back.

FYI: this is NOT where the WSOP is played. that's in the hall.

I was here over the summer for a week long convention that I was attending. Other than staying for a convention because it is convenient...I can't imagine why anyone would be willing to stay here. 

The prices aren't that cheap and this place is a dump. It's in dire need of a remodel in every aspect. The casino is old and run down...and the rooms are the worst. Far from being a suite, it's a large room that resembles a Motel 6 at best. The carpet is old, dirty and worn out. The couch in the room has stains on it from who knows what...I wouldn't sit on it. The bathroom was barely OK. Enough to get clean and be on your way. 

All the staff that I dealt with (front desk, player's card, bell and valet) were nice and helpful. That's why they get two stars instead of one. Unfortunately, I'll be back this year for the same convention so even though they suck...I'm stuck. If you can stay elsewhere, do yourself a favor and do so.

Joey Ganz a security guard took such wonderful care of me. I had surgery and am using my room for recovery. She took the time out of her day to wheel me and my things all the way up to my room and even tucked me into bed. Amazing customer service!

Beg bugs in the room. We caught them alive and the management team didn't even care. They are completely useless. They told us to report to different people every time, and it took them forever to get back to you. Unless you stand in front of them showing them the bug, they won't do a thing. Whatever they promise, it's a lie as well. We had to stay there during the peak season, around 300 per night and got treated very poorly.

Wow is this place awful!

We stayed here during a golf trip during Mid-October, 2016.  We had our comp choice of any of the many Ceaser's properties and boy did we make a mistake with this one.  We chose it because of its easy location to get in and out to the courses and because of its decent pool facility.  Get this... the pools were mostly closed in 90 degree weather without warning of any kind on their web site or during the reservation process.  What a joke!  They had one small pool partially open that was so filthy that people made footprints on the bottom when they walked, not to mention the multiple "floaties" everywhere in the water.  Can you say YUCK!  People were lined up to use the one shower just to get cooled off as most were smart enough to stay away from the tiny toxic pool area that was open.  Of course, the drinks areas were close, despite being a 90 degree sunny weekend.  Pathetic...

This place is simply a cattle coral with promotion victims literally crawling everywhere.  At one point, we stopped and counted over 100 people in the reservation line!  The room was FILTHY with multiple, highly visible stains on the couch.  Again, YUCK!  How could any self-respecting maid let that go without calling for a cleaning of the furniture?  Also, these are not suites as indicated in the marketing.  They are simply large rooms with a couch thrown in, (albeit filthy).  The casino is a joke and be prepared to hold your breath.  They don't offer the newest games and the tables were all full.  Food choices are multiple and the one bright spot was the room service food.  They package it as a "take out" offering to make it easier to deliver which makes it feel entirely low end but the food was actually very good.  I think the best offering was their pizza, believe it or not.  The Voodoo Steak House was an attractive choice for dinner but be prepared to hose down your wallet.  My wife and I had a $50 bottle of wine, one $20 crab cake that was nothing more than a hush puppy, and two a la carte dinners.  The bill was over $300!  They try to make this place feel exclusive but its just another overpriced Vegas fake.  How can a restaurant with these prices have bathroom walls that are disintegrating, stained urinals, and amenities that don't even work?  Interestingly, they share the "exclusive" elevator between the restaurant and the thrill ride zip line which makes the attempt at being "exclusive" a pathetic fail.

I simply can't find a reason anybody would want to stay here with so many other great choices nearby.  Fellow guests seemed to indicate the same.  Never again...

Horrible experience! Let me start buy saying from the moment I checked in the staff was rude! At the check in desk VINCE (Illinois) was extremely rude to me and decided to cut me off, roll his eyes, shake his head and run to his manager... When his manager came over MARIA (Las Vegas) she didn't look at me once and only acknowledged my boyfriend (both of our total rewards numbers were on the reservation too!) I tried to kindly explain and she cut me off and said she wasn't going to talk to me. The room we got was not what we requested and paid for, it was old and outdated... The couch was ripped and old. The next day we got a new room and it was even worse! The tint on the condos blacked our view from the strip and it was all torn and run down also. When I went to check out, I was checking out early due to personal emergency and the lady wanted to charge me for more than what I paid for the room to check out EARLY! Even though I already paid for the night! Ridiculous.. On top of it all the pool was, okay and the gambling sucked! Don't stay here!

nice and the rooms spacious. Don the on line registration and check in ..the other line was ridiculous! Valet to get in on friday evening was a bit ridiculous but we self parked after that and was a little walk but honestly faster. I called the front desk when making reservations and they matched the expedia price!

This place is actually a lot better than I had expected.  When I first learned that I was gonig to the RIO for my girlfriends bachelorette party, I thought...the RIO is so far from the strip, we wouldnt be able to walk to any clubs and it sounds like a dingy place.  But I was wrong...and it wouldn't be the first time.  

Our suite room was spacious, we were provided an extra rollaway bed since we had so many girls and there were more outlets in the place than the venetian suites.  Theere were 2 sinks, one outside and inside the bathroom which were extremely convenient for a big group of girls.  Furthermore there was a fridge in addition to the minibar so we could keep our alcohol cold instead of filling a tub full of ice :)

Cab fares were about $12 each way to the strip...lets say RIO to cosmopolitan which isnt bad at all.  Bottom line...if you're tight on budget but still want to have a nice convenient room for a cheaper price...come to RIO.

Oh and if youre with a group of girls...watch chippendales!  sooo in love.

If you don't smoke, don't stay here. One of the smokiest casinos if been in. What happened to the LV clean air act? When the A\/C comes on in the room you can still get a strong whiff of smoke coming up from the casino. You won't find me coming back again.

I called the hotel directly to ask about the Guy restaurant El Burr Borracho. First we were given a whole different number to contact to find out about the restaurant. Even though they in the hotel with the restaurant. So we contacted the other number and was directed to the operator. They operator provide completely inaccurate and incorrect information. We were told that the restaurant opens at 11 am daily until 4pm. Then reopen at 5pm. 

We arrived at the restaurant and to our complete SURPRISE it was closed. Now these an issue being that we had called prior to even arriving . There is no accountability for the creating such a horrible experience while on vacation and birthday celebrations.

It's cheap and you get a good night's sleep.  Not much more to say.  Don't eat at the Rio buffet, it's gross.  The rooms may be old but it's clean and spacious.  My room was enormous and had an incredible view.  I stayed 7 days and paid a little over $800.  Fair deal for a non-gambler.  I was in town for a conference and it was fine.  Be warned - the shuttle service to the strip is lousy because it only stops at certain locations and doesn't begin early in the morning.  I ended up needing to Uber every day.  It is NOT walkable to the strip even though I've seen people say it is.

I like the place very much. Clean, friendly, we love huge room with plenty of space and wall of windows. Its bit older then others and some wear n tear shows. We totally loved though the pricing, service, it has more dining in different price options, like burger place and two Starbucks. Loved Royal India withits wonderful buffet.

I absolutely love the Rio pool.  I am not quite sure why but I know I love it.  I have been to the pool here as well as the topless pool called Sapphire.
The ambiance of this pool is always super relaxed and family friendly.  I never go with a family, but I have noticed lots of kids around.
Sapphire, the topless pool is not a family environment at all but I did meet great people there.  It is interesting when you have boobs all around you how friendly people can be.  When I went there weren't a lot of people in or around the pool but every girl there was topless.  The pool is completely blocked off from the other Rio pool so there is no need to feel unwanted gazes.  I had gone with my boyfriend at the time and I did not mind sharing the great view with him.
The only down side to this pool is the pool water.  It is salty.  Now I don't drink the water, but when someone spears you into the pool unexpectedly  you sometimes accidentally drink the water....I am not naming names.  This is the only reason this pool didn't get five stars.  You can guarantee that I will be back though....kids, salty water, and all.
It's an a nice casino with some great shows to watch and one of the main venues for the WSOP

There is a lot to like about the Rio Suites and Casino. The price is extremely reasonable, as I scored a three-night stay at $53.00 per night. The rooms are very large, with floor to ceiling windows with many of them offering an excellent view of the LV Strip, and the room was extremely clean. The casino areas are your usual mix of slots, table games etc., but the layout is very confusing. The pool areas were very clean, and if you party, this is a local hot spot. The Rio is across the freeway, and offers frequent shuttle service to two other of it's properties. The shuttles do fill up fast so you may end up waiting a while to get back the the hotel. Overall, a nice place just close enough to the strip where you can easily navigate without a rental car.

WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I went to Vegas for the first time and stayed at Rio because my boyfriends has comps from atlantic city. With that being said it was my first time i was really excited about this trip. I knew that the hotel is off the strip and taking taxis everywhere was not too big of a problem for us. 

As soon as we got to the hotel. I noticed the place is very old( kinda dirty looking). But I wasn't too worry about it because from the pictures of the room when we booked it, the rooms look very clean and nice.

When we got to our room we were speechless!!!! I thought i was in a cheap motel out in the middle of nowhere!! We took our shoes off walking around the room in our socks. My white socks were black within the seconds. It made me feel so uncomfortable and that was just the floor..

 As i walk thru the room and look at the couch and the footrest by the bed, there were stains on them (like someone spilled a drink and didn't clean up) We laid on the bed to rest a little and the sheets were so dry and hard feels like sand paper. It was a non-smoking room but the sheet cover ON the BED has cigarette burn holes on it!! 

When we booked the room, It saids we will have a flat screen. Not only it was an 1970's old style TV. The remote doesn't even work. That didn't really matter to us because we know that we won't be watching too much TV. But still, it was the quality of everything in that room that really made us angry. 

We tried to put some of our things in a safe later and that doesn't work. We called the front desk and they sent someone up to fixed it. The shower fan was broken so in the middle of my shower, it felt like I couldn't breath!!

After all those problems of the room, we were very unhappy. So my boyfriend went to the front desk and complain. After hearing all of our problems of the room she went like," I can't put you into another room because we are all booked and we can have someone clean your room better the NEXT TIME". So there was nothing we can do but deal with the dirty room situation.

On the day of our check out. We tried to check out on our TV but of course that didn't  work because NOTHING works in that room. We went down to the front deck  and there was a long line of people waiting to check out only one person behind the desk was helping all the people that were trying to check out. There were probably 10 or 12 people behind the front desk not doing anything. 

My boyfriend went up to one of the girls that isn't doing anything and ask her if we have to go wait in line to check out if we didn't put in any cash deposit. She was like," No. You can drop off your keys and just go and deposit on your card will go back in a week or so" My boyfriend asked," What if there's charges on there that not right or not supposed to be on the bill that I want to make sure?" Girl behind the desk:" Well, if you want to make sure then you have to wait in line ( with attitude and a mean face)!! 

At the point, we were trying to catch a plane and had it with this crappy hotel. So we dropped off the keys and left!!

It was no joke THE WORLD'S WORST DIRTIEST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED!!!!!!!

I stayed here for the weekend while being at the Pure Aloha Festival watching dancers compete and performing with my group. The rooms were nice suite style. They didn't let us ask for more then 2 extra pillows but oh well.
Overall they keep the rooms clean and tidy. They also have a shuttle that can take you to the strip without having to walk all the way over there. Believe me I did it and it wasn't a short walk! So if you are in heels take a taxi or the shuttle:))

Horrible service...got there 4:30 pm on a Thursday.  There was a long line to check in.  I am Platinum for total rewards and I kindly asked an employee Joon if there was a Platinum check in he said no!!!  Well, she lied!  there is and I had to wait 2 hours...Never been to this Hotel but won't go back...Dirty and smells YUK!

My first time staying here was 4\/3-4\/5\/12 and I enjoyed my stay. The suite was the perfect size, the food at the seafood buffet and breakfast buffet was excellent. I ate like a refugee at both, the food was so good. The people were very kind and helpful and overall had a wonderful stay there.

Needs a serious cleaning,  we stayed there because of the convention.  So at least it was free.   The shower doors have mold. Restaurants are way overpriced. You can go to the strip and get far cheaper food.  I would never pick this hotel for a vacation. In the restaurant, you can not substitute at all.  So customer unfriendly.

I absolutely hate this hotel not only are the so called upgraded rooms not upgraded. The beds sleep as if the bought them used from the motel 6. The front desk Staff were so horrible the keep passing not only myself but the older gentlemen in line up. When brought there attention it was o well. So rude! Bryant and Victor could use a class in customer service when I finally get up there to talk to them in regards to my room and get the key left for me he COMPLETELY ignored the question I had twice a tried to hurry me away. The key that he gave me didn't work after walking all the way across the hotel. Then the ROOM we were given this super luxurious 1 bedroom suite. Looks like it has never been upgraded since they built the hotel needless to say we are checking out and going to another hotel and disputing the charge here if they don't give me my one night back.  #DON'T STAY HERE

The Rio is the best hotel to stay at if you have a car. It's just off the strip so you can get in and out easily and jump right onto the 15. We've stayed here twice this year, for 5 nights in Feb., and for 8 nights in July.  Here's why: 
I would give the Rio 5 stars if the restaurants weren't so overpriced. We made the the mistake of eating there twice in the first trip but never again. This last trip we brought a $6.00 throwaway toaster from Walmart, paper plates and a cutting knife, stopped at a nearby Trader Joe's and stocked up on staples for breakfast, fruit, snacks and sweets. 
I bought 5 different restaurant Groupons in advance of the trip so we got to try some great new and different restaurants for even more savings (which I reviewed here on Yelp)! And I also found restaurants west of the Rio on Yelp before this last trip to try. 
The rooms are huge, with a living room-type area, and good sized mini-fridge and comfortable. The only problem we had was we could hear our noisy neighbors through the door between rooms. We put extra towels down and that helped alot.
We only use valet parking when we stay here because it's just too far to walk to self parking when you want to mazimize your vacation time. 
The boyfriend and I both have Total Rewards cards and for 8 nights we paid $150.08 including tax, 4 nights were comped. We gamble just long enough but low stakes to make sure I can comped for our next trip.  
I highly recommend the Rio as a great home base but we go elsewhere to eat, gamble and sightsee.

If you're looking for a cheap, rather large place to stay and don't mind being off the Strip, the Rio is for you. They have a shuttle that comes every half hour that takes you to Paris\/Bally's. Personally, I can't recommend this place.

We got the deluxe suite. The first room we went to had a strong and odd smell of bad perfume and hamburgers, and even looked dirty and old. I don't know how that mix came about, but it did and I was not having it. We requested to change our room and ended up getting the run-around. Literally, a run around. We had to hop onto the other elevator since our second room was on the other half of the hotel. The guest services guy told us that our keys were automatically changed to work; they didn't. We ended up going back to the front desk to get those reprogrammed and headed back up to our room. The process took about twenty minutes, which wasn't much of our time but definitely added to the inconvenience and discomfort of our trip.

The room we ended up staying in didn't look much better than the first but at least it didn't wreak of awkward smells, so I'll consider that an upgrade. The beds were definitely springy enough to support a jack-in-the-box for the rest of its existence and the bed pillows were actually square pillows. There was a tube TV, a yellowing-colored "safe" and a bathtub that had a window to the bedroom. What architect would come up with a brilliant idea like that? No idea. But of course, he\/she thought that taking a dump in the restroom did not require much privacy.

I can't say that my stay here was stellar, but life goes on. The best part of the experience was knowing that I would not come back again. It's not a bad place if you get the right hotel room for your requested price, but don't expect anything too fabulous like what the pictures offer.

I can't speak as a gambler.  But as a hotel I really like the Rio.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable.  It is off the Strip, but you can walk across the bridge or take the free shuttle to Harrah's (or Bally's), so it's not a big deal to me.

And the price is usually very reasonable.  Especially given how nice the rooms are.

And the buffet...the Rio buffet is one of the best.  Huge variety, generally really good food.  But that's a different review!

La estadía en este hotel , es horrible!
Hay mejores hoteles aquí en la vegas 
Por el mismo precio!

I dislike this hotel for many reasons.  

It seems to be smokier than most of the other hotels.

There's also the confusing advertising surrounding their seafood buffet.  Posters everywhere, even within the hotel, say it is "all seafood, all the time," but it really is not open all the time.  It has quite limited hours, actually.

It also has the most pricey Starbucks locations of any I have visited in Las Vegas.  I know the prices are inflated, but when kids' drinks are more than double what they are at my local Starbucks, I call foul!  

I've never won at Rio, but I haven't played a lot.  So, I can't really say how good it is to play at Rio.

I've stayed here in the past, but it was on a comp from a friend who plays a lot of poker.  I would not choose this hotel if I were paying for it myself.

I don't know why there are so many bad reviews for this place. My fiancé and I stayed here for 5 days in July and we loved it, for the most part. The hotel it's self is beautiful and there is everything you could possibly need right there in the hotel. There are multiple amazing restaurants, a convenience store, which is definitely over priced butt to be honest nobody goes to Vegas expecting to not spend a lot of money. The casino is awesome. We went to multiple other hotel casinos and this was our favorite. The table dealers were very helpful (it was my first time gambling) and they have some awesome slots.

The room itself was very nice and perfect for the price we paid. The bed was pretty comfortable and I love that the room had a ton of windows. There was a small fringe, a TV that pulled out of a cabinet, and a couch. The bathroom was average but there were full length mirrors on the closet doors which was awesome. 

Now here comes the one and only problem I had with this place. The water pressure in the shower was horrible! I have ALOT of hair and it took me so long to rinse shampoo out. I don't know if it was the shower head or the pressure through out the hotel, but it was really bad. 

The hotel had 4-5 pools, one of them being 21+. We didn't spend any time in the pools but there where always a bunch of people down there and if you have kids with you then that is a perfect place to spend the day. 

All in all this hotel was great. Good price, nice casino, nice rooms, just bad water pressure.

The older rooms are really falling apart. You can still smell the smoke through the AC!!!  Really a problem for anyone with sinus issues. Check out was the worst ever!!!  Over charged for items that weren't even in the room (like coffee!!!!). GM was more concerned about emptying the key return box than assist the long line that had gathered for check out.

I do have to say that the room was HUGE.  But the bathroom was the smallest I've ever had in Vegas.  So you just have to figure out your priorities.  For me, having a full wall of windows overlooking the pool and the lights of the Strip at night overweighed the lack of a huge tub.  

Many restaurants were only open for dinner.  One restaurant only served breakfast from 6:00 a.m. to noon and then closed for the rest of the day.  You can directly see how the economy is effecting this hotel.  

Checking in and out were easy.  Every Rio employee I encountered was friendly.  The business center closed at 6:00  p.m. but who's here to do business, right?

For the $79 a night I paid, this was a great place to stay.

Last week we stayed here for a pool tournament. All week everything was great till Sunday morning we woke up and realized the people that stayed in our room was robbed of about $5000! They came to room about 4:30-5 a.m. from a night out. About 6:15 I got woke up to the sound of a door closing and looked around to see everyone was sleeping or I thought I was dreaming and went back to sleep. Well when everyone was getting up to get ready to check out that's when they noticed the money was missing. I said what i thought I heard, so security (Alan) was called up and took there reports cause they only had money missing and nothing else. When I told security about what I thought I heard he told us they have people called "door pushers" that check and see if doors are open and come in and take things while people are out or even sleeping. Come to find out  I'm getting accused of taking the money and I have no way to prove someone came in the room cause the hotel doesn't have any camera's in the hallways at all, just the elevators! I think a big hotel like the Rio should have cameras in every hallway! Also when I tried to help the security with ideas to check for he tells the other people that's accusing me what I asked him to do for proof to try and clear my name...

Stay at rio hotel Las Vegas with my husband  last July 7 2013 and stay for only 1 night, I was so surprised for the room they upgrade. It was in 20th floor  a suite room and a 2 story room for no extra charge because I bought that deal in living social for only $129 with 2 buffet and 2 passes in voodoo club...so lucky!!!

This will be the last time we stay at the Rio. I can understand tightening up drinks at the bar, however not getting even your first drink before you drop $100 is rediculous. The bar tender was rude. We came from the strip and although the restrictions were the same the staff delivered much better service. This is the only casino that has ever treated me this poorly. I love Vegas but the Rio is not a place where you feel welcome. Most staff are excellent but the bar tender (s) are obviously out of touch with how to deal with new policy and still give customers a good experience.

Love this casino and resort. It has everything for everyone in my family. Lots of food choices that is open late. The best part is hash house. I went to see one of their shows and they provide a fee shuttle to the strip. Rooms are huge and clean. Will definitely stay at this location again.

Usually I stay at the Mirage but last year I stayed there five times too many, so I decided to stay at the Rio because it was comped! 

Now it's time for a change of scenery, even though I'm treated there like a VIP and receive high floors with strip views for free and have my own line for buffets and check ins. 

Speaking of checking in, the Rio needs to organize their Hotel Registration area and create a separate line for Diamond, Platinum and Seven Stars vs the regular Joe's (Gold Tier), the person in front of me flipped out because the person assisting the registration area let 2 people from the VIP line check in before us. Talk about lack of organization! 

This hotel may not be up to date with some of the other Harrah's hotels (Caesar's Palace, Paris, and Planet Hollywood) but it gets the job done, plus all the rooms are suites. So more room for, ME! My suite included: 2 Queen Beds (No Bedbugs), Wifi, Sitting area for guests,  A huge bath with a separate shower and toilet with a second separate shower and toilet, I thought was pretty odd. Also a refrigerator for drinks and snacks and a Keurig Coffee maker. 

Although the suite was not up to date, along with the whole resort, it was incredibly clean and did it's job. Hurray for the Rio! I didn't get to see Show in the Sky but it looked corny too me. =l I didn't have time to try any of their restaurants because I checked in around 10pm and I was moving to the Orleans the next day for a slot tourney. I didn't get to spend too much time around the Rio, other then the Casino where the drink waitresses were friendly. I will definitely give Rio another try, if my room is comped or is deep discounted. 

CARNIVAL!

We spent a whole week there for my tax convention a week ago.  The hotel is huge, long walk from Ipanema Towers to the convention halls, but we all need the exercise.  We logged almost 24,000 steps per day on our Fitbits.
I even used their small gym, sort of cramped but quite stocked.  It's through a locked door through the spa.
We ate 3x at the Pho restaurant, actually they sell chinese food.  Tried to go to the Mexican restaurant for Happy Hours but too late.  Didn't go up to the Voodoo on the roof, probably feel it's too pricey.
The rooms are huge, probable it's an older hotel.
Despite the other Yelp postings, the checkup kiosk is flawless, less than 5 min., and a guy was helping us out.  Checking out on TV or via email notice was flawless also, got email receipt immediately.
As Rio is off the strip, we used Uber everytime, the average is no more than 5 minutes.
All in all, it was a good stay for us. We wouldn't mind going back again for next year's convention, if such.

This hotel is always great if you come with a big group.. because the rooms are all suites.  you are also away from the crowded strip and you get a big room!!!  Taxi fares to the strip isn't much.. And the hotel has the great world and seafood buffet so you can purchase the 24hour buffet pass and eat all day! If you have the total rewards card, you can get really cheap or free rooms here if you gamble pretty often.

$99\/nite in the old wing. Don't know if this was a convention rate, but fair value for what we got. Free parking. The room was OLD, carpet was fraying, couch cushions were sunken. Bathroom has separate makeup counter and sink (nice) but the lighting was terrible for women. Public hallway lamps were tattered and old. The 50th floor Voodoo Restaurant was fabulous, food-wise and view! The 51st floor is the lounge where the zipline starts. For less than $30\/person, you zing down forward from the 51st floor to the roof of the old wing then back up backwards. Great lounge but no one was up there! Huge casino floor off the lobby but hardly anyone in there. Young people aren't into gambling. The Counts Kustom tattoo parlor for the Countin' Cars TV show is in this hotel. Really cool and you can buy t-shirts too. The airport bus pickup area outside is where you  catch the Counts Kustom party bus for tours but you MUST have a pre-paid reservation. Hash House restaurant is great for breakfast. Convention center is attached.

Check this place out.....a locals dream 
The slot rewards are very friendly and the buffet is out of this world. Always something exciting going on. Worth a trip

Even by Las Vegas standards this hotel is marginal at best. My flight into Vegas on Sunday was canceled by Delta so I called the hotel to tell them I would not be arriving that night and they told me they would still charge me the full rate for the room which was fine because they assured me I would then have the room when I arrived early on Monday morning. After standing in line for a half hour to check in I was told they canceled my entire reservation and no rooms were available even though I have been charged for an unusual room the night before. When I became more forceful and refused to step aside and wait for a manager, almost immediately a woman appeared as a manager and told me in fact they had a room available after all! Obviously I had not been told the truth. 
My room\/suite was relatively nice but, amenities such as shampoo we're missing. When I went back down to the desk to request change for a $10 bill to tip the doorman for a taxi I was told rudely I had to go to the cashier.
The few highlights were the maids always spoke in the hall and the spa attendants were excellent!  The HashHash Agogo restaurant was also very good but otherwise I will not be returning to this hotel again.

Unprofessional, unorganized, overpriced. From overpaying for the MJ Live show for the upgrade seats with a worse view, waiting in line for an hour for a show that was only 45 minutes long starting 15 minutes late, to listening to the shuttle drivers badmouth their customers over the radio so all the current passengers could hear... No point on traveling off the strip or even from Freemont for this crap!  Read my other dozens of Vegas reviews. The Rio is the worst.

When I called Rio and asked to talk to a supervisor about the crap we all had to listen to on the shuttle bus, the supervisor had no idea who was responsible, so put me on hold instead of even asking what the concern was. When I said "why not take the information down and then find out" I was told "no, we don't know if it is Rio or a contract we have for the shuttle"!  

Hey idiots! I am YOUR customer. I got on a Rio shuttle REGARDLESS of who YOU hire to drive. 

If not for your poker championships, you'd be in the toilet faster than Circus Circus would be if they didn't have their arcade games!

This is probably my worst experience in Las Vegas during my entire life time. We booked the ticket to the Chippendales show here for my friend's bachelor party. The server inside were being super rude and gave us a bad seat even if we purchased for VIP tickets. The show was ok, it's kind of overrated. But my friend got disappointed on the bad position. The worst part is I lost my phone at the restaurant afterwards and didn't  realize that until I came back to my hotel. The restaurant guy was nice and called me that they found my phone and gave it to the security. So I came all the way to Rio again to try to get my phone back. However, the security guy was being unbelievable rude and told me that he didn't have my phone and he can't do anything about it. I was being nice at the first place and told him that I already called and confirmed with one of the security guy there that my phone is there. But he was like "I don't know who you called, I don't have it, and I can't do anything about it." And it took him 30 mins to finally find out that the phone was actually right on his table. How sucks their system could be to make this obvious mistake! And BTW, their lobby and casino look crapy. And the service is even worse. I am glad that I didn't stay there! And I'm highly suggested anybody else not to.

My bf and I stayed here in March and had a really good experience. We booked our room through the TotalRewards (sign up for it, Lower rates on rooms).

We get there, check in line is HUGE. Again, another reason to sign up the TotalRewards because they offer online check in, so we didn't have to wait in that big line and checked in through the Express line. We were also offered an upgrade to a nicer room as well. The staff was super friendly. The casino is nice, little older than most, but not bad like people in other reviews. We had the samba suite (our upgraded room). Our room was nice. Big sitting area, comfortable king bed, flat screen tv, bathroom was clean, shower\/tub was big. Separate sink area and make up mirror. Small fridge, had a mini bar but we took nothing from that. We stayed three night, four days. We ate at one of the buffets, good food, love their Gelato station. Again, perk of the TotalRewards is you can buy the Buffet of Buffets, which is way worth it if you plan to stay there for a few days. There's a shuttle that takes you to the Ballys and Casear properties, but they come about every 30 mins or so, but cab fare isn't too bad either, depending on where you want to go

All in all we had a good stay, nothing to really complain about. For the price we paod, it was a nice vacation

Three stars is really about right for the Rio.There was a time when this was one of THE places, but with so much new in the area, even on this side of the freeway, the RIo is starting to show its age.  Check in was long (about 20 minutes even with most or all stations open, but they did offer bottled water to drink while we were waiting.  Since I booked through the agency sponsoring the conference I was attending, I was not able to check in online.  All the same, a kiosk function would have been nice.  Room was in the Ipanema Tower which is apparently the older tower on the premises.  That being said, room was spacious and clean, with the usual wear and tear evident in the carpet, drapes and bathroom (door slats that looked like they had been broken out and replaced with mismatched product.  All product for the in-room Keurig was missing, but housekeeping was good enough to bring it by when we asked.  But that's OK, you're in Vegas right, I mean how much time are you going to be spending in your room?

I ended up packing all my exercise stuff for naught since there is not a complimentary workout room and the $28 per day fee for use of the spa\/gym is a bit much for an hour workout.

The conference center is a fair distance form the gaming floor and the Ipanema Tower, but that eliminates the temptation to sneak out of a few sessions and try your luck I guess.  No issues at all with conference space or catering and technical support.

A good variety of restaurants on site: Hash House a Go-Go (5 stars), Martorano's (5 stars) and the Carnival Buffet (3 stars) is addition to Dim Sum, Sports Book Deli, Indian and an American Burger Bar.  Enough variety for a 3-4 day trip for sure.

Be sure to join the Total Rewards Club while here; even if you aren't much of a gambler; it's good for a buck off most meals and hey, a buck is a buck!

Gaming floor never really seemed to be that active while I was here, and I don't play much besides slots, so you will need to look to another review for that information.

No concerns with Security, Housekeeping was excellent for the duration of the stay (Don't forget to tip!) and checkout was a breeze as well (which it should be at 4:30am).

Overall, it just lacked a sense of vibrancy and excitement that I usually associate with Las Vegas.  It was, as the ratings suggest, A-OK.   If you can get a deal here and use this as a base to get out and explore, then go for it.  If the conference hadn't selected it though, it would not be my first choice for a Vegas vacation.

I actually could care less that it off the strip. I love the pizza there, the pools, and the assistance you get when needed. 

Only down side is the rooms are dated. The beds are super comfy though and the rooms larger than most.

Truly would stay here again. Maybe a suit next time for the upgrades?

Thanks
Jenny

Very nice accommodations.  But it just absolutely fries my cackles that they provide s beautiful keurig  coffeemaker, HOWEVER, the coffee packets are in the mini bar, thus you incur an additional charge should you desire a coffee at rise and shine time.  WTF!!  They just proved to be complete a-holes!  I may stay again, but I will bring my own coffee.  Dicks. That's why I prefer a Holiday Inn Express that actually appreciates my business.

There should be no reason there is a long line on Sunday night.

Two employees to battle a long line of guests at the registration desk.

There a plenty of emplooyes in all other departments. How about crosstraining?

Not acceptable. Not acceptable

This hotel was a nightmare. The water in my room stopped working in the middle of the night, i called the front desk but they didn't have any solution, so had to use the public restroom. + my room key didn't work so many times so i called the desk finally at 1am but they were just keep switching people and had to hold the phone for 3minutes. The solution? The security that came told me to get a new key tomorrow from the front. Isn't hotel suppose to serve its customers the best? The workers are so rude and hopeless. It's no worth giving even one star.

This was the first time I stayed at the Rio since the mid-90's. I sorta boycotted it after more than a few unpleasant experience's during that time. Well, let's face it, it's time to re-visit it again after 15 years. 

Check-in was easy. My room was in the newer tower. Walking in I remembered how large the room was with the king bed and large sofa. The bathroom had a sink and mirror area with a fridge before you entered the real bathroom with toilet and tub\/shower. I was disappointed because I've been spoiled with all of the other hotels having a separate shower stall. The TV was not a flat screen which was surprising as well. Okay, I'm spoiled, but this is Vegas. At night, the constant dripping of the toilet became annoying, even after shutting the door totally, drip, drip, drip. Oh yes, I enjoying being woken up by neighbors in the next room who were talking, not yelling. Paper thin, ugh.

Let me say this about the Rio, if you're interested in finding a hooker while you're in Vegas, worry no more. They're here and not so good looking either. My God, how many toothless woman asked me 'Where is your wife?" Obviously, security looks the other way. Actually, where was the security at this hotel? In all my years ( and I go back plenty) of staying in Vegas, I don't think I remember seeing a hotel without visible security in uniform until the Rio. Not a big worry in most casino's but damn, this crowd was scary. I mean "on probation" scary and your wallet is looking tempting to them.

Then of course, that wonderfully dated Masquerade in the Sky show. Good gosh, put that clunker to bed. Alright, there was eye candy for all but still, do they have to sing?? Any let's not forget the surprise performers who pop on random pedestal's sing karaoke for about three minutes and screw. Do they really think people enjoy this crap?

Oh yes, before I forget, how does the Rio not have a 24 coffee shop?? It's the staple of any Vegas hotel. I mean if I want breakfast when I get up at 1pm and am told there isn't any place here that serves breakfast anymore after 11am. WHAT??  I ended up having a burger at the All-American Grill which was good, but I wanted my eggs and greasy meats, dammit!

Alright, so Iater I went to the gym\/spa to workout and then get rid of the smoke out of my lungs in the steam and sauna. I must say, they had an adequate workout area, you know you make do with what they offer. The spa facilities had the obligatory steam, sauna and whirlpool area and to my surprise I enjoyed them all. What I didn't enjoy was the "attendant' who never left my side, upon my finishing my workout said "are you leaving?", no I'm just done working out. Later after showering after a hot steam, "are you leaving?" NO! Go find something to do, fold some towels or something. He was young and thinking he was doing a good job so I left him a tip regardless but someone should take him to another spa in town and let him observe and learn.

Beside not having my room cleaned on my first night, the Rio has the tightest machines in town, the most relentless hookers, the awful free singing , and the dirtiest casino I've ever seen. Hello, could someone wipe these machines down once a day and maybe empty the overflowing ashtrays if that isn't a problem??
