In case your wondering, I won't be staying there again and vow never to set foot in that place again. HARRAH'S wake up and get this place in order!  You can do better, much better elsewhere.

I was pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Rio for the Halloween weekend. I heard some not so great things about it, that it was old\/stale... but I thought it held up nicely for a "mature" hotel off the strip. 

Staff was friendly, room service and housekeeping were really quick to deliver, and the few places to eat downstairs were actually pretty good. 

Minus a star for the pool area. The entire area is totally shaded by the hotel itself until late afternoon... when it starts to get chilly. Whats the point of that? 

Oh, I also loved the bathrooms here. Even in our small room we had a great bathroom that had a separate sink\/vanity with a chair. You know how us ladies need our own space to sprawl out when getting ready... so it was perfect for my Halloween dressing room!

This was my first time staying at this hotel and I had a great time. I usually only stay on the strip, but Rio is close to many things so it's not inconvenient.

The hotel offers free self parking which is a huge plus! It's got a really cool carnivale vibe to it. The staff is courteous and kind. Service is great. Although did feel for the women as they were pretty much in their underwear and is freezing in there!

They don't do early check-in. We got there an hour before and ended up killing time at a cafe. 

The rooms are also bigger than I had imagined. There was a sink in the bathroom and a separate area that had additional sinks.  This was great. We also had a really nice view as well. There was a small fridge that came in handy with the leftovers we had. A microwave would've been nice to have, but it wasn't a deal breaker.

Overall, fun times at this hotel.  I do want to go back and check out the zip line they have.  That looked awesome!

Rio pool! No longer a hot spot free pool for local son the weekend. They started charging for pool entry a month ago for Friday - Sunday.  $20 per adult and $10 for children.  No wonder it's completely dead for a Saturday!

My husband and I were EXTREMELY disappointed in our hotel accommodations and experience at the Rio this past week.  There was food on the floor in the hallway and it reaked of pot.
The hotel itself was dated, dark and dingy and everywhere you went there were people trying to sell you something.

Our room was the farthest room from the elevator (we are disabled and requested a closer room). The bed was EXTREMELY uncomfortable, the lampshades were cracked, fridge broken, bathtub dirty and the room was dated and dusty.  I received none of the preferences that I requested on my reservation and was told that a room upgrade WAS AVAILABLE, however, I had to pay extra per night for it.  They didn't seem to care that I was on my Honeymoon and also a diamond member.

After 2 nights I was finally able to speak with a host!  He moved us, to another room and told me that it had a Jacuzzi tub.  Our bed in this second room was more comfortable, however, there was no Jacuzzi tub!!!!!!! 

We also were not able to see Penn and Teller because the show was sold out. We were told that our Joliet host should have reserved the show tickets on our reservation.  My Joliet host told me to go to Total Rewards when we got to Vegas and request the show tickets.

Totally disappointed to say the least.

Thanksgiving week, we had what I think was the smallest suite a 600 sq. ft. But for two XXL guys, this was more than adequate! We had a nice writing desk, a sofa, a nice bathroom and two sinks. Enough light to do a close shave, newer aircon system, wireless internet.

DO NOT STAY HERE! This place is trashy, dirty hallways, bad plumbing, rude staff, and their prices are very deceptive. Do not fall for it like I did! I purchased a groupon to stay here earlier this month and right from the start the lies started. They wanted to charge me $30+ per day as a resort fee on top of my hotel stay, they lied about the internet (which is included in the resort fee) and still charged me daily for that. They put a very long hold on $200 (other places simply do an authorization) and the place was filthy. Worst stay ever. 

After getting to my room I noticed the bed looked like someone was just in it, I didn't have towels, they left me only 1 bottle of shampoo and soap and the sink was already clogged up!! Keep in mind, I had the business class room! I called housekeeping and they fixed everything rather quickly but I don't want to deal with that. 

Random stuff on the floor in the hallway, a bad smell.... just trashy. I wish I didn't stay here and to be perfectly honest, I tried to stay out of my room. Honestly I wasn't happy at all. They also charged me for an early check in even though I called 2x (because I had a groupon) and checked the check in time. I should have stayed in a legit hotel because it would have been the same price anyway. Do not fall for their shenanigans. 

Rio staff, I would like to be refunded for my stay. Your place was a mess and nearly ruined my first Vegas experience.

Located off the strip at I-15 and Flamingo Across the freeway from Caesars Palace the Rio is a huge entertainment complex. I have stayed at The Rio 4 times while in Vegas. There are very cute waitresses and fun bartenders everythere throughout the property. The checkin has always run smoothly. The casino seems to always have something going on . Singers, Chippendale strippers signing autographs, etc. etc. From The the Show in the Sky to the Sexy Voodoo Beach, this place is fun! The I-Bar located right at front doors has awesome martini's and beautiful women in thongs serving them up to you! It can be hit or miss with the crowd. For dining options we have tried several. First the famous Village Seafood buffet. WOW!! From cut up lobster to prime rib its amazing. Be starving when you arrive! Its pricey at around $39 but its worth every penny. The World Buffet is very good as well and there are numerous coupons for it. The All American Bar and Grille is ok, nothing great, a bit pricey I feel for what we got. Then there is Cafe Martoranos? .....Very pricey Italian food, but good. The meatballs are to die for!! And the veal was very well prepared!!  But my favorite restaurant is the Voodoo Steakhouse. Located 50 floors up with fantastic views, its over the top outstanding. The bayou seafood platter appetizer is awesome. The scallops, the Tomahawk Ribeye, the dry aged NY...Its all well prepared but can be very pricey . Plan on $100-120 PP minimum with wine. After dinner at the steakhouse head up the staircase to dance the night away at Rio's Voodoo Rooftop Nightclub. The views are amazing. You can sneak up there for sunset as well and its well worth it. If you want to save money on drinks buy a witch doctor! They cost about $30 and you drink one or two of those and your night is set!! There are plenty of VIP seats and this place is generally fairly lax on the seating issues. This is not a Vegas hot club at this time, but it will get crowded!  If your early enough you can find places inside to set down without bottle service, which is an exception for most of the popular nightlife spots. The Rio's sportsbook is just average, while the casino floor is usually energetic! I enjoy most the dealers and staff at the Rio! Very friendly , nice, and fun!! Also to get to Vegas strip you can drive,take a cab, walk (17-18 minutes) or take the free shuttle which comes about every 30 minutes ."On to the rooms. They are large and always clean. If you can grab one of Rio's deals on the suites. Do it!!! The Masquerade Suites are HUGE! Over 1600 sq ft and I have stayed in them for as low as $119. Currently booking them for $125 on Harrahs website for April!! There is really not a whole lot of difference between the Deluxe Rooms or the Premium ones. Beds are fine, bathrooms ok. These Rooms could use some updating. The Pool is great and was very entertaining when the Saphire ladies used to work there!!! I think after a police sting or two, they are back at the club!!  Enjoy your visit, I always do!.

Great place to stay if you don't want to spend to much. The rooms are very large and the casino isn't bad at all. There buffet is one of the best Ive had. The place is ideal for a late night lets go to vegas!! tonight!! kind of night  lol. But i suggest walking over to the palms to gamble... way better looking lady's.

I decided to try something new and book a off the strip hotel. The Rio was the perfect choice. I paid around $26 dollars a night including taxes and resort fees (I do get hotel discounts through my employer.) I arrived at the hotel around noon, check in isn't until four so I opted to pay for early check in for $20... Well worth it to settle in and be able to enjoy the multiple swimming pools. As I was checking in the lady at the front desk told me that my room included $9 per person, per day to use at Starbucks. For me, that was a unbelievable perk! 
My room was very large, it was a basic suite, had everything that one would need including a fully stocked minibar. Room service could have done a better job getting it prepared for us, but it was clean and comfortable. The actual resort is unbelievable, there are three swimming pools one that is designed to look like the beach complete with a sand bottom, and multiple hot tubs... Plenty of shade and you can watch people zip line over head. The pool wasn't too busy, midweek in September, but the people we met were very friendly. I didn't eat at the restaurants, I opted to have dinner on the strip which is easily accessible via a free shuttle that runs every thirty minutes until one a.m. However the hotel offered many selections and had a very reasonably priced gift shop that sold sandwiches to take on the go. I would stay at the rio again.

I received $ 25.00 credit for food. Nowhere does my bill show that credit. I understand after a phone call that I did receive it, but would have also liked to have see it reflected in the numbers. Also, The resort fee was $ 30.00. As a fee I feel this should not be subject to TOT Tax. Or at the very least should again reflect a separate charge on the billing to help navigate all the charges on billing. Your phones trees suck!!!! I spent over 20 minutes being sent all over, even to a Foreign Country, With a person I could not understand. 
     I would still like you to know that I love the Rio!
There are many things that make it a great place to stay off the strip.

Where does one begin. The walls are paper thin. There is a fight next door\/ in the room next to mine. Security came up once\/ then did nothing. They are coming a second time apparently. 

The shower is ice cold and looks like a shower from the Brady Bunch- they don't even have a comforter on the beds, it's an extra sheet. I called down to the front desk about changing rooms but apparently they only have a downgrade option \/ can t get any worse than the ghetto fighters on the floor (too bad I can't record and post on Yelp). I the room is so dimly light , I think They do this so you can't see bugs or imperfections. The hotel, the second you walk in smells like smoke- casino looks like it's from the 1970s low ceilings and all.
Cramped, full of men.  If you're looking for a fun place to play poker, this isn't it.

I am a Las Vegas local who for the past 4 years has stayed at the Rio at least 1 time per month during the summer and about everyother month during cooler season. It USED to be my favorite hotel. Last summer I saw a major decline and this summer it is horrible. The pools were absolutely filthy. Grime on the tiles that hasnt been scrubbed, plastic cups and straws floating at the opening of thee pool at 9am. Grease, and scum floating atop the water at opening. There is no excuse that pools are not clean at 9am. The foul odor of cat urine surrounding the pool was horrid come to find out from employees that the hotel feeds and encourages stray cats to visit. Do something useful for the cats and have a rescue society come get them dont allow the pool to reak of urine. Pool chairs are few and far between come to learn that new chairs were promised but the proper tools to assemble were not purchased and the assembly job was left to the young life guards for completion.
Jack in guest services could not have been any more rude when asked to help understand something om my checkout receipt. And how dare him specifically mention to me how much I chose to spend in food and beverage.
My room was clean however both sinks quickly fill up and slow to drain seems to be common in the masquarade tower have had this issue on other visits, toilet seat not securely bolted and tub stopper broken so the option of soaking in a relaxing bath were quickly shot out the door.
On a good note my pool server Arlee was over the top wonderful.
Definitely time to take my business to another location and say goodbye to the Rio until someone realizes that it has fallen way below its previous standards.
Soooo very disappointed!
We stayed at the Rio many times. The rooms a spacious and clean, there is a good choice of restaurants and food places and the staff are very friendly.

The 1980s called the Rio to say "Thanks for never changing." If all you need is a bed & a shower, then find a groupon for $25 & win resort fee for $70 not bad. Not good either. They also have the tiniest gym for property this size. But at least the casino keeps getting smaller too. But you can see the KISS show in case the 1980s is too far into the future for you & you want to live in the 1970s. Too many other choices in Vegas.

It is disappointing about the standard of their cleaning service. I found the room smelly and looked a bit dirty immediately when I entered the room. The cleaning lady told me that the room was cleaned and called her supervisor to come and check the room.  The manager came and nicely asked me what she could do. I told her that it is smelly and she suggested to have the room sprayed but I needed to be out for 20 minutes. And she said the room filter will be replaced. I was exhausted at that time so I told her changing the filter would work. And later I recognised that my first feeling was not wrong. See the photos: the electric power boards are covered by dust and spider web.

Originally came here to meet a friend that was playing in one of the WSOP tournaments, they were on break so we decided to eat at the Seafood Buffet. I devoured all the prime rib and crab legs I could eat - translation 3.5 refills LOL To end the meal I loved the chocolate and strawberry gelato. Definitely worth the price!

Less than impressed. This hotel is advertised as a 4-star resort and casino, and while the casino ground floor is certainly impressive with a slew of gambling options, restaurants and entertainment, the room we stayed in was not. Worn carpet and walls, dirty shower & buildup on the shower head. Unclean seat and bathroom handle. Dirty finger marks on the painting. Would not recommend.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Rio.  We enjoyed the more intimate setting as the other hotels are just conglomerates and take you forever to get somewhere. Everyone and I mean everyone was as nice as they could be and we certainly took note of that. Yes, the furniture in the rooms could use  some updating. Overall, we had a very good experience
A good-looking casino. The big negative is that it's off the main strip. The big positive is Penn and Teller's show which is definitely worth checking out.

Since I didn't stay here I can only write from the perspective of a visitor for a conference.  Like many hotels in Vegas there's a casino.  Wasn't a huge fan of secondhand smoke but it's inescapable at least it seemed that way for casinos in Vegas.  The pool seemed pretty neat but it was too hot to enjoy it.  I mean, we're in a dessert.  There's a reason why it's off season.  The Defcon hacking conference has been growing in popularity every year.  There's no reservations and entrance fee was a steep 220 USD cash only obviously.  Careful about trying to connect to the wireless during that weekend.  Poor other guests at the hotel.  They may have unwittingly been put on the Wall of Sheep for being hacked on the wireless network.  Even with the price and excrutiating hot weather there were tons of people.  Fortunately we got to skip the insane wait and save 20 bucks by buying tickets from a speaker.  There was even a massive line just to buy Defcon swag.  As far as food options go there were quick sandwiches, pizza and salads for convenience.  The Dim Sum we tried within the hotel wasn't stellar quality but the price was pretty reasonable.  If you're willing to spend more there's a seafood buffet.  There's also another regular buffet and vietnamese restaurant within the hotel.

Was on a staycation. Beautiful views of the strip from the North and South. Room was big and very clean. I really enjoyed my stay for the past two days from check-in to check-out. The only thing I would ask them change would be to: ***PUT COFFEE POTS BACK IN THE ROOMS***. My husband and I love to drink coffee in the mornings (We bring our own coffee - Organo Gold) but we did not have any HOT water so we had to go all the way back home to drink our coffee. What a bummer. Thats a sad testimony for a hotel as nice as this. My ONLY reason for only giving 4 stars is in hopes management will see this and initiate a change!!! I was told by housekeeping that they removed the mini bars about a year ago because of some issues but please bring the coffee pots back! Also the resort fee is one of the more expensive ones. Why don't they just put the resort fee in the room charge instead of billing it separately. Especially since we do not have the option of opting out of the resort fee.

I actually enjoyed this place..I was skeptical to go with a 3 star average but it was a pretty comfy stay. The room and room services were on point.  The casino was good to us..and the pool was just 2 cute..especially with my little one. I'd stay here again. .oh n can't forget the vip service at the buffet!

Came here with some of my buddies for a weekend getaway lol, for the price that we paid it was great. The beds we're comfy and it was roomier than we had expected. Only downside was the mini fridge was noisy and the shower had bad water pressure.

So I just came back from my vacation at the Rio. I was there from 4\/6\/15 to  4\/10\/15. The Rio has some badass cheap promo deals for rooms during the weekdays. I got prices as low as $30\/day. The room that I got was the "Classic King" and holy damn that was the best room I've ever had in my hotel history. The room was large and all the accommodations were great. Now there are some points from other people here that have made reviews on the Rio that I will agree with and others I don't agree with.

Now for those that say that the service at Registration is lousy, I have to agree. I was lucky that when I checked in, there was no long line at Registration. However the woman that checked me in gave me horrible directions as to get to my room. My room was on the Masquerade Tower. I've been to the Rio before in the past but this was my first time staying there. Now unfortunate for me, I was carrying my luggage and I didn't think to ask the bell hop to bring a cart for me. So I was going around the casino trying to find the Masquerade Tower. I went back to main desk and asked a man at  next to Registration (I forget which station it was). I was already in a sour mood, and the guy gave me directions but with a bit of an attitude - not apologizing for his co-worker's lack of proper directions and didn't offer me any  help with my luggage. In short the man was a complete ass. 

Now I saw reviews of people saying that they were never informed of the hotel surcharge for the internet and gym. When I booked my room online (https:\/\/www.caesars.com\/rio-las-vegas#), I was informed of the surcharge there and when I checked in on 4\/6, the woman immediately asked me if I was aware of the surcharge. So right off the bat, I have to disagree with the users that are saying that they were not informed of the surcharge. 

Another issue I had is that on Thursday, a lot of people started to check in and there was a long line. I needed to go to Registration to get my rewards points for checking in but couldn't due to the long line and there was only about 2 or 3 staff members working at Registration. Friday I had to check out and there were still about 2 or 3 staff members and a lot of people checking in. I called the front desk several times and waited for a while just so I could ask for a bell hop to come get my luggage. Needless to say, no one picked up the phone. So I basically said screw it and took my luggage out (took 2 trips) to my car by myself. 

Apart from all these issues my stay at the Rio was awesome. The room was great and for the price that I got, it was a hella good steal. Also I've heard people complain that the Rio isn't on The Strip. I actually like it like that. The Strip is always traffic and being away from that is always good. If you need to get to The Strip, its an extremely short drive to it, just head down Flamingo 

Oh yeah and I got to see Penn and Teller's show and meet them in person!


PROS:

- Great room! Big room with big bed.
- Fridge in room.
- As cheap as $30\/night.
- A\/C works! And it cools the room fairly quickly!
- Shower has nice shower head with different spray modes.
- Warm water works immediately.
- Wi-Fi (is part of the $100 resort package).
- Big flat panel TV.
- Friendly house keeping staff .
- Penn and Teller!!
- Great parking at the Masquerade Parking Structure 
- Amazing food at the World Buffet 
- Burger King and Wetzel's Pretzels inside the Rio if you don't feel going to expensive restaurants
- Not on The Strip


CONS:

- Staff at Front Desk need better training at giving directions and need better manners and etiquette!
- Have at least 10 staff members working at Front Desk especially when there's a long line!


Other than these issues, the Rio is a great place. I personally recommend this place to anyone that is going to Vegas.

First time staying here and was pretty impressed.....staff was veey efficient, room was clean and comfortable, huge!! Had all the necessities and LOTS of elecrical outlets - a huge plus!! Free shuttle to the strip hotels in same chain is a great service too. I'll be back and recommend to my friends

I loved this place 10 years ago but it's slipped a lot since then, I stayed the 1st weekend of December 2011 and the place is looking tired. 1st off what dumb ass closes the pool and hot tub from November through March????? Really??? The snotty desk clerk told me I was welcome to use the hot tub at one of their sister properties on the strip though!!!! F Off!!! The desk staff was horrible, valet is totally understaffed for the volume of business they get so you wait to drop off your car and a LONG time to pick it up. I will say the wait staff as well as the casino staff were very friendly and on the ball. I will go back to Mandalay or Caesars next time.
More bang for your buck elsewhere;rooms have same carpet when I was here 30 years ago;suite with no microwave? Used to be a hot spot no mas

It took 45 minutes to check in. Only 4 people at the desk at an extremely busy time. Got to our room and discovered a few things. Our bed looked like someone sat or laid down on it, there were pieces of garbage behind the table, bar was not fully stocked (didn't plan on using it but didn't want to be charged either.) There were layers of dust around every wall and piece of furniture and the sinks weren't as clean as they could have been. We stayed on the 15th floor and could hear traffic and music from somewhere. Doors slam very loudly in the hall. 
Other than those issues, it's a fairly nice hotel. Awesome pools. Beach themed, nice and spacious rooms and friendly staff. If the price was right, I might consider staying here again.

I've been coming to the Rio for the past three years during the WSOP -- I will not be coming back. The first night we checked in and made it up to the room at around 1 am. Unfortunately our safe was not working. Even more unfortunate, neither was the door latch to our room. During the night, while sleeping, we were robbed of $700 cash. The next day we spoke to a manager about the incident and we were basically told it was our fault, that we didn't close the door properly, and that we should have reported that the safe was broken before we went to bed. Sure, the manager had some valid points, but he offered no help, gave no apology, and showed not a trace of empathy. It made me think this is a very common occurrence at the Rio. If you want to stay safe and keep your money losses at the tables, stay away from the Rio.

This place is the most unprofessional  hotel that I have ever dealt with. Management is completely rude and incompetent. My family and I arrive to this hotel for check in... they look us up and don't find us.... we waited several hours later to be informed that they gave our room away... my family and I vacation once a year ... sooo now what do me do?... we asked that rio fix their mistake... nope it gets better... they don't have any more rooms to give they are completely sold out. So they ask that we get a hotel tonight and come back tomorrow and their should be a room... come back ... yup no room... and the manager basically said sorry there is nothing we can do..so my family has to find a different vacationing spot... I don't recommend this hotel... they don't take responsibility for their mistakes... their staff and management have no authority to do anything for my family and I who now suffered through our vacation.

I wish that I was able to stay at Rio for more than 10 hours (we were actually able to check-in early, but we absolutely had to check out by midnight to catch our flight back home).  Nevertheless, I had a generally pleasant, hassle-free stay here - and for me, that's what's most important on a vacation.  

Pros:  
The front desk has separate lines for check-in and check-out.
The awesome floor-to-ceiling view from the hotel room.
Two sinks (one located in the bathroom, and the other located right outside the bathroom).
Five or six ample-sized wall mirrors (includes the large mirror over the closet doors)
The sofa and office desk.
Option to check-out from the room.
Professional, customer-service oriented staff, not just at the front desk but also at the logo gift shop.

Cons:  
The walk from the parking lot to the hotel itself is pretty long (I'm not sure if this was because we didn't know about the two parking garages).
Our hotel room was located at the end of a long corridor.

On a related note, Rio is home to Carnival World Buffet!  We got there about half an hour before closing and I wasn't too hungry, but what I did manage to eat was pretty yummy!

Horrible!! Did not get the room we reserved. The front desk people are rude. When we asked for a roll away bed because they only gave us one bed instead of two they bring it with no bedding and tell us we have to call back for it. Everyone in the place moves with no sense of urgency and does not believe in hospitality. Will NEVER be coming back here again. And will tell everyone I know to not come here.

I booked for 2 adults and 1 child. When we arrived they said there had been a mix up. A miscommunication with booking.com. The only room That was still available was a smoking room. We had been on the road for many many hours. We were exhausted and took it. When we got to the room... It was the most disgusting, filthy room I have ever seen. The carpet was so stained, it looked like someone had been murdered. The carpet was warped like the tub had flowed over. The couch and spread were covered with stains. I bet if someone turned a black light on in that room, it would have lit up brighter than the Vegas Strip. It smelled so bad. So keep in mind we had our daughter with us. THERE WAS A ONE WAY PEEP MIRROR FROM THE SLEEPING AREA INTO THE SHOWER!! It would have been like sleeping in a rent by the hour, prostitution motel, so we went back to the desk. They said they were completely booked and there was nothing they could do. We ended up sleeping in our car. One of the worst nights ever.

The rio last night offered me a deal 2 free tickets to go up inside their club if I bought a package for next year 3 nights 150. We signed up and went to the club that was closed after an hour of arguing with the guy who sold me the package he finally refunded my money. Place is a scam

First time here.  Came into town a day earlier that we expected, and just needed a room for the night.  Found a Groupon for a room for $26, figuring all we're doing is sleeping and leaving the next day.  Well, we got upgraded from the regular king room to a Masquerade Suite, 1600 sq ft and panoramic views - not bad for 26 bucks.  Yes, the hotel is a little older and the furniture shows it, but the beds were newer and comfortable, and the service was excellent.  That was the thing that surprised me the most - the service at this place was above what i would expect at a hotel of this caliber.  Everyone from the front desk to the housekeepers I met in the hallway to the pool boy and the attendant in the spa area were very attentive.  Was very surprised and would come back with the family again.  Pool area also looked excellent.  $28 resort fee gets you spa access for two (take advantage of the free juices and pretzels!) and wifi.

This is where we stayed when in Vegas and although slightly off the strip, the location isn't a problem as they provide free shuttle buses to the likes of Ceasars etc.


 Our room\/ suite was fantastic, clean and comfy and the lobby's were tidy too.


 The casino is full of all the usual slot machines, poker tables etc and lots of bars & shops inside too (for those of us who don't gamble).

I'm not a gambler a drinker, so LV is not really my kind of town, unless I'm off the strip. The Rio is just that, a little of the strip and closer to where the locals go. 

Upon arrival, I was upgraded to a larger suite, SWEET!!!. The room was very nice, looked clean, didn't smell of yesterdays smoke, alcohol, or any flow play. The bed was a nice comfy size, king. Not sure why the t.v. is placed on the side wall, kind of difficult to watch in bed even have to do the head crank when seated on the couch, opposite the bed. 

The bathroom was fairly clean. I don't understand why hotels especially of such caliber don't wash their shower curtains. Upon inspection, I opened the curtain an almost hurled because of the sour smell the curtain spewed. It was nice to see that they automatically provided those little things you tend to forget, such as toothbrush, toothpaste and shower stuff. The vanity area is a bit odd, nice that there is a single cup coffee maker, but why put it on a shelf and one has to pull out and place on the vanity counter. Couldn't they just raise the shelf above to give the coffee maker enough room to open for water and the coffee packs? I was tempted. 

The casino itself is like any other, noisy and people everywhere. The downside is the HVAC. It must be the original unit since every time I walked out of the casino, I smelled of stale cigarettes. Yeah, I didn't spend much time there. I did, however, spend enough time to try their Pho restaurant. I will be writing a review for this place, so I won't say much here except, that was Pho? Blah. 

The room was nice and the price was good, should I go back to LV, I may consider staying here again.

Stayed here since I was attending a trade show that was taking place at this location.

When I travel for work I do not have too many requests - all I want is a clean room, good internet connection and close to the trade show I am attending. I will say the Rio met all of my expectations and it was cheap too. I ended up getting a suite for about $40 a night.

One night the people next to me were being very loud around 11 pm so I did end up calling security. They came up and took care of this very fast. I do understand that people typically come to Vegas to party but  I really needed my sleep.

I will say the hotel if off the strip so if you are coming for non-work trips you might want to stay someone on the strip so you do not have to pay for expensive cab rides.

Disappointed. The rio restaurant was way overpriced 25$ for kids under 11 and 50$ for all older. We have little girls that ate four potstickers and a desert to fill up. This doesn't include a drink. Food was good but family felt ill next morning. The Mardi Gras show that they use to have in the main area on the ceiling is no longer a performance Paid for a taxi because I loved it last time....

The room we stayed in was great. But the hotel itself is not in the best shape. Case in point: I am walking back to my room barefoot at 8am (don't ask) and step in a huge puddle of water in the hallway. Gross. All I'm thinking is I hope that wasn't vomit or urine. It was probably just A\/C fluid. Happy thoughts Moner...happy thoughts.

That night when I was leaving my room again there was a security guard standing next to the puddle directing people around it.
Me: Wow, you guys are finally fixing that. I accidentally stepped in that last night. That is A\/C fluid, right?
Security guard: no ma'am, it's not A\/C fluid.
Me: I don't need to know more. Thanks. 

Also, the food places in here take forever to get food out. And I'm talking about the two casual places. All-American and Sao Paul Café.  We literally had to wait at least 30 minutes each time for it to come out. 

The 21 and over pool is fun...I would stay away from the other pools.  Lots of kids and ugly people.

Really enjoyed my stay at the Rio hotel, bed was super comfy and my view from the 15th floor of the masquerade tower was great! My husband tried the voodoo zip line and enjoyed it even though I think it was a little pricy and you're not allowed to take up your own camera or go pro equipment. Pictures cost $20 and their go pro cost $30. You also have to pay $10 just to watch someone zip line. Pool and hot tub were great. Only about 1.5-2 miles away from the strip not a long walk at all. I would definitely stay again.
Time to do some renovations. Paying a $35 a day resort fee on top of your room rate to be transported to the late 70s\/early 80s. No ma'am Sam!

We tried to stay at the hotel Dec 28-30, 2016. I get a knock on the door around 8 am by the fire department informing us that we had to evacuate the hotel. We had to go down through the emergency stairs and couldn't take our luggage down with us. We were told by staff that we will be getting updates every hour. All they would tell us was to go enjoy our day. I left my car keys in my room, hadn't showered, and was in my pajamas. How could I enjoy my day? The fire chief told one of the people in charge that all guest needed to be relocated since the power and backup generator were not working, this was at 9 am. They refused to start this process until 1 o'clock! They decided until 1 o'clock to give us a refund and relocate us. In order to do this we had stand in the check out line for two hours. After we got our new room at a different hotel we then had to go up 17 floors to get our  luggage and bring it back down through the stairs. We made it to our new room at 5 o'clock! All they did for this ordeal was comp the room for us. They wasted one whole day of our stay in Vegas, made me stand in line for hours, made me climb up and down stairs to retrieve my luggage. Since I booked through hotwire I also had to be stuck with them on the phone for over an hour in order to get the refund back for my room. It was the worse experience at Vegas and will never stay at this hotel or there partner hotels.

Only reason I come to RIO is it's usually easy to get comped rooms here.
Pros:  Easy to find parking, easy to get to.
Cons:  Not near the strip, No quality restaurants, Old

This place has been up for sale for a year or more now and I think that Caesars Entertainment would like to get rid of it...

It is close to Palms if you like going there which I don't really care much for either.

I'd like to start by saying I don't like Las Vegas, and I go into anything there with the attitude I need to be positive, grin, and bear it. I stayed at the Rio for RT Booklover's Convention and honestly, the place was sorta nice. Until we walked through the door to find that our early check in meant "wait in the express line for close to an hour." First meal in the Indian restaurant took nearly 3.5 hours because of untrained staff and poor technology, but you could totally see they were trying. Also, there were no coffee makers, leaky windows--the staff simply stuffed towels between the drapes and the wall and left them there for the entire stay, no one answered the room service phone, wifi cost 10.99 for the first two devices and 14.99 for anything further. Who only has two devices in a room that could conceivably be occupied by four people? Restaurant after restaurant served food that appeared to have been concocted by meth addicts on a dare, and NONE of that would have raised my EYEBROW if, when I asked for an extra hour to check out (after a six night stay) I was told no, not possible. I complained to the desk agent when we checked out because no matter where I stay, no one has ever refused a slightly later checkout. He was dismissive. I said I would be leaving a bad review on Yelp. After I said that, he wouldn't check me out, but instead, very punitively, I thought, made me go someplace else and wait for his manager. I tried to just drop it, but he put me in a separate area under a large camera, and when I walked too far away, he called me back and repositioned me. By this time I felt like I'd cheated at cards or something, which I don't even play, so I thought they'd inconvenienced me enough. I am human. I made a sarcastic comment about making sure his boss didn't have to walk too far to find me, and he said, "Don't get smart with me!" twice. I am a 55 year old woman, and I had my twenty three year old daughter with me. I felt angry and afraid. I will never return to this property again.

I am writing this review to let others know the level of service before they book at this hotel. I paid $2500 for a suite for the weekend. When I showed up my reservation was for a day later. The gentleman Jay told me don't worry bro I spoke to the manager and we are going to take care of you and he said he got me a hook up for $173 for Thursday night. I believed him and he said everything was good so I tipped him $100 cash for taking care of me. To find out now Saturday that the room was more and he lied. When I went to my room it smelt like cigarettes so bad that I woke up sick the next day. I had to complain 2 times to house keeping to get them to do something about it. Everyday I have woke up to random room charges from the Rio. Also my room keys just randomly stopped working and my buddy was locked out for 3 hours until I could get them to fix it. I had to go to a manager downstairs after calling twice to wait On hold for over 10 min. She was not helpful nor did she care that my buddies and I have spent 10k here this weekend on 2 suites and a lot of gambling. I was really hoping the service was better cause I loved the casino and sports book and the great lay out of the casino. Hopefully this review will get someone to realize that they need to take care of the guests. It is unfortunate that this is how my trip went. Next time I will stay at another casino.

My wife and I have stayed at the Rio countless times. NEVER had a bad stay. Watch rates carefully -- you can get a room circa $30 more often than not, however this is offset by an onerous and evil "resort" fee.

If you like seafood the Rio's seafood buffet is in my opinion only second to Caesar's Bacchanal buffet (but the last time we tried to dine there the wait time was 2 1\/2 hours). Go early for the Rio's buffet -- it gets jammed later.

Several negative reviews here. They baffle me. Try the Rio. If price\/stay quality is important to you, you'll like the Rio.

If you're dead set against resorts fees, try the Alexis Park Hotel instead.

Worst hotel- dirty rooms, negligent staff, poor service from the front desk. They lied about putting us in "newly remodeled rooms" see my attached photos. They refused to do anything to make up for their booking mistakes. Even had the audacity to say "maybe we can do something for you on your next stay".  Our next stay will not be at this filthy hotel.  If your looking at their photos of what they call a newly remodeled room, they're lies.  Don't fall for it. Unfortunately we were in town on a very busy weekend and couldn't change hotels. Such a disappointment.

I've never stayed in the rooms here but my friends and I always stop by and hit their World Buffet... It offers all different types of food from all over the world so there's something for everybody (pizza, salad, pasta, mongolian bbq, chinese, mexican, desserts, etc.). After 3pm they have endless crab legs and we can just sit there for hours grubbin on some goodness.

The bartender announces over the loud speaker hourly drink specials so that's a PLUS! $3 Margaritas... Gimmie 3!  Service is great, we always have an awesome helpful waiter\/waitress.  AND The guy at the dessert counter is always a crack up.. always makin jokes!

this will be the only meal you'll need to eat for the day! lol.. seriously!

Growing up, Vegas was always the family vacation destination.
and that was back in the 80's when the "family" portion of Vegas consisted of a small room with about 8 arcade machines and a bill changer.  Pops would give us 10 bucks and expect it to last all day while he Gamed in his own way...

With that said, Pops is Diamond at the Rio now, so his rooms are free (well free with gambling ;) ).  This is the spot we typically stay at when in town.  when he cant score us a room at the Rio we (my fam, brother, sister, etc) stay across the street at Gold Coast.
Rio is a hip spot.  They've re imaged it several times since it was open, sticking with the Carnival theme.  The Cocktail Waitress costumes changed several times also but usually centers around a set of tits in a thongish leotard.  Gotta love Vegas.
The place is very busy but big enough that its easy to find the entertainment you're looking for.
I wasn't impressed with the buffet this last trip, in my opinion they're trying too hard to be too many things to too many different people. but that's probably another review...
Overall, the Rio feels like home, maybe because I spent alot of time there.  I recommend it.
word.

Pretty ho hum casino in Vegas that's off the Vegas strip. And their little skyshow was dark last week so even more boring. Unless you are staying here, main reasons to come here might be the regular carnival buffet or the seafood buffet. 

And unless you have a car or want to take a taxi, it's a pain to get out here. They do have free shuttles to the Strip though.

Bottom line: Yawn. They do get a brownie point for letting anyone lie in the pool area as long as you have a room card or a Total Rewards card.

The Rio is not a bad hotel however, they could definitely use some upgrades. 

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 days back in March of 2014 for pretty much free since he had racked up $400 worth of points to use for Las Vegas from one of his credit cards. One of those really nice perks. He was able to get this great package deal from a Christmas\/Holiday Special Vegas was running back in late 2013. When he called back in February to check on the hotel to see if everything was still good, I believe it was stated to him that the deal could only be used in the month of February. He explained to customer service that he was never told that and booked the room for March. When we arrived to check in, we were told we were upgraded to I believe the Master Queen Suite after realizing there was a mistake on their end and which is how we got the free room upgrade, free internet and $35 room service voucher. GREAT perks! We would have been upgraded to the King Suite but they were all booked. The room had double beds and was huge! We had so much space to lay out our belongings. 

The place was very clean. The room had a TV, area for lounging, a huge vanity mirror, two sinks, spacious bathroom with a tub\/shower and granite counter space. Also, there was a large closet, more than enough drawers, small fridge, Keurig and a safe. Everything you need for a hotel stay. We had a FANTASTIC view of The Strip. We could see all of Vegas. Our room was high up and located on the side of the highway. The view itself sold me. At night, it was a site to see.

We ordered from room service which was very expensive. We shared some fries and chicken strips and had two drinks. It was over $30. Again, because we had so many points stocked up, it was essentially free. Also, we used the $35 room service voucher we were given as an upgrade. When we needed towels, we called down and they were sent up immediately. It was unfortunate we couldn't utilize the pool more but it was OK. The Casino was paying off very well. in total, my BF and I won $1500 our time there. 

Also, they have the Voodoo Lounge on the rooftop. WOW! The view is breathtaking. I was however bothered by the fact that if you wanted to sit on lounge chairs\/couches that were by the window, you had to buy a bottle of wine. I think that is was crappy. You already had to pay to get into the club and then you're told if you want to enjoy the view of indoor seating, you had to pay an additional charge. That was crappy but at least the drinks were decent. 

Where there was room for improvement was the carpet. It's old and outdated. Also, the toilets are VERY loud when they flush. I am not sure if this is due to piping or what but it was noisy. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my visit. It could certainly be because we practically stayed there for free but even if we did pay, I cannot say I complained much if at all with the hotel other than the smoke ( which really can't be controlled).

I used a Groupon deal for $27 and was it way worth it!! I loved our room and our strip view, and the free shuttle that took us back and forth until 1am. The food was awesome. We ate at the Hash A Go Go place yummy! Staff was really nice and kept our rooms clean. Best deal in town that you cant beat.
Great rooms and service was very friendly and helpful. Easy to get to the strip from here. Dealers were friendly too.

One of my fav hotels off of the strip. I was thrown by the size of the room and the comfort of the king size bed. I had a wonderful view (I thought) of the Palms hotel and I liked the voodoo lounge upstairs with their ginormous fish bowl drinks. Thats another story...that drink should NOT be consumed SOLO.

Friendly, accommodating and fun are 3 words that I would use to describe the Rio. The rooms are big, the staff was welcoming (BIG thanks for letting us check in early!) and I loved the party atmosphere.  Though the Rio is off the strip, they have shuttles that run back and forth from 10 AM - 1 AM.  

So why only 2 stars?

 Well, for starters, when we arrived, we were told that since we had pre-paid for our room, they were going to put an $800 hold on our card. We were floored that there would be such a huge hold on the card and asked the receptionist again. Yep, $800 hold!  Yikes! Luckily, we were able to use another card while we were there, but this could have put a huge damper on our trip, for sure. The weird thing was that when we checked out, we were told there was only a $100 hold on the card. We've contacted our bank and are still unsure of the actual amount held.

Aside from this, much like some of the other reviewers noted, the housekeeping was lacking. The room itself was pretty clean, but the hallways were just gross. They would leave food sitting outside of the rooms for an entire day. There were also dirty band-aids and floss littered about the hall. The outside area of the hotel where the shuttles pick you up smells like a dumpster as well.

I hope the Rio reads some of these reviews and fixes  these issues. This was my very first time in Vegas and I ended up wishing I had chosen another hotel for my inaugural trip. The staff was so friendly at the Rio and I really wanted to give them a higher rating. I will be watching these reviews to see if they improve.

It's off the strip, it's cheap and the rooms are huge. We stayed for 2 days comfortably with 3 girls in the 2 bed queen. The rooms had a living room and 2 sinks (one inside and one outside of the bathroom).  

It's a bit dated compared to many hotels in Vegas, but it was clean and quiet and that's all we really needed. (Room service wasn't bad and there was a Starbucks and a Sundries store right off the elevator). 

Seriously, what do you do in the room except pre-cocktails, recover and sleep). 

I'd stay here again.

We took our 2-year old to the beach pool at Rio today (same as we did last week) only today, we decided to have lunch pool side instead of in one of the casino's restaurants.

They had a nice assortment of hot and cold sandwiches, wraps, and such as well as California rolls, salads and chicken fingers. I had a $9 hot dog and my boyfriend had a $10  chicken burger  ($9 + $1 for cheese).  We made it a meal for $5 (add seasoned fries and a fountain drink).  The food was hot and fresh; I saw the lady grill our food to order.  Boyfriend thought that the cranberry-wheat roll they served his "Chicken Burger" on kind of threw it off.  Had I read the menu carefully I would have asked for a plain hamburger bun.

The only downside was that they didn't have any sweetener (sugar or sugar substitute) for their unsweetened iced tea, but the Chef tournant offered to fetch some from the casino if I really needed it... I said it was "ok" and just added some lemonade. No problemo.

OH, it was absurdly breezy today, too.  I was trying to carry a tray with 2 plates that were too big for the tray and a drink.  I lost a couple of ketchup packets and almost had my whole meal blown onto me but made it back to the pool A-OK.

I also ordered a 32-oz Miami Vice (half strawberry daiquiri, half pina colada, both ready mixed and poured from an adult slurpee machine).  I was a little confused because when I read the menu last week it said $12 for  16-oz and $16 for 32-oz but the bartender charged me $24. Oh well, I just left a smaller tip... not like he actually had to blend the things from scratch.



POOLS:
There were 3 pools open both times we visited (a fourth pool near the back was roped off both times).  Our daughter's favorite pool is the sand pool... she actually just likes the sand part.  Around 4 PM the sun hides behind the hotel and the sand bar gets shady and cool real quick.  This pool gets 3-stars.

We decided to move further back and check out the other 2 pools.  I tried taking her to the one in the dead center of the pool area but decided to get out when I saw a couple having sex near the lifeguard station. YUCK. This one gets a negative 1 star.

So we went to the 3rd pool which has a waterfall feature that was turned off (I'm guessing) due to the huge gusts of wind.  That was alright except for the A-holes that decided to play catch and take over the majority of the pool.  I'd give this pool a 2 star.

Bottom Line:
We'll probably be back again...most likely to play in the sand.  The pool food was actually pretty good and the prices were reasonable compared to other Vegas pools.  The Miami Vice was fun the first time I came.  The vodka red bulls were WEAK.  We may not go into the 2nd pool ever again. 3rd pool...maybe.  Depends on what time we get there and how dark we want to get.  They don't really check for room keys, but they will check you for outside food and drink.

I was pissed when I heard we were staying off the strip at rio because we had prior arrangements to stay at ballys on the strip. Now I am extremely thankful for the change. We stayed in the older tower so they didn't have uber new renovations but the rooms were big and had a large sectional sofa as well as a snack bar\/ alcoholic beverages\/pepsi products. the mattresses I'm my room were comfortable but everyone else  in my group had mattresses where you could literally feel the springs.i doubt understand why out room had good mattresses but the other 4 didn't. check in took forever! Because they had only booked us 4 rooms even though our papers and bill said 5 rooms so they fought with us alittle about that and then finally fixed it but one of the rooms ended up being on a different floor than all the others. The cocktail waitresses are prettier than any other ones that I saw at the other casinos and they had super cute\/revealing outfits for you guys out there. Plus its free drinks if your gambling.every restaurant I ate at there was great no complaints except for the service at the american bar and grill. We would either take the free shuttle or a taxi so not being on the strip didn't bother me. So overall, for being an older hotel off the strip I really enjoyed it.

Checking in here I tipped 20$ and got a bigger room on a really high floor so I would definitely recommend trying it. The only issue with having a room so high (the view was AMAZING) is that the elevators can take so long (seriously it takes forever). On check out the elevators had actually broken down so we had to walk down about 20 floors before we could get another elevator. 

The staff were really friendly but not invasive. The rooms are huge, good size closet and great vanity area. I liked that they provided a Kurig coffee machine and a refrigerator too so we weren't dependent coffee shops and could keep our own snacks. The rooms are pretty old though so don't expect the same standard you get in some of the other Vegas hotels (you get what you pay for)
The only thing that bothered me was the $14 a day wifi charge(per device), which is frustrating when you have two computers and two smart phones as it adds up. The location is off the strip but they do provide a complimentary shuttle bus to Caesars, and you can always get a taxi. 
Walking through the casino they had a lot of different mini shows going on, some waitresses would sing, bartenders would flare etc. 
 
We got a great deal to stay here so I was really happy to see what we got for how little we paid. (I paid about the same to stay on the strip for half as long and the room was very similar)

Nice place with great service.  Front desk checking was excellent.  Downfall only, is that it's off the strip and the place could use a bit more fresh air.  I like it because of the low price and it's a suite.  Room was very excellent, they actually upgrade me for free.  Gaming floor is pretty big compare to some others.  Not a big fan on their blackjack tables.  Single deck forces all cards to lay face down (hate that).  Free shows daily (Show in the skies).  And for the ladies.. Chippendales.  Buffet is a solid choice (even better if you are a local, discounts for locals) Carnival offers a huge selection and is remodel recently.  Pool is nice, they have a sand beach.  

Parking is a plenty, depends on where you want to be closer by.

Another hotel I get to stay for free.. so I really don't know the price.. Even though this is pretty far from the vegas strip but I know some people would like to be in a more quiet, relaxing enviornment. I stayed there all by myself again, I always stay at different hotels when I'm in vegas with my family. =(  but it's good in a way, cause I do have my privacy. =) .. 

For da ladies, this is the place to be. First of all all room are suite, even the regular suite are pretty big. then they got the Chippendales show.. LOL.. lastly, end of the night you could go 51 floor voodoo lounge\/club.. w\/a beautiful view. It's  a pretty fun place to be..

I love the Rio! I don't do Vegas all too often. Not at all actually. This was my first time being of age...(I'm 23). So you may wonder why I wasn't in the center of all the commotion and chose to stay at the Rio. 

My aunt gets comp rooms every so often and was wonderful enough to allow my family to stay with her. Our room had a great view, I got to enjoy the Rock of Ages performance for free as well, and we tried the buffet. 

The only downfall was that our room was next to a bunch of crazies. They were having a telly party until 4:30AM and my question is why did they choose to be couped up in their room opposed to out on the strip!

It was a great first experience (one night only).

I'll give this place 2.6 stars....we stayed in the impanema? tower (dk if i spelled that right).  i was impressed when i first walked into the room.....it was very spacious and nice.  the thing that keeps staying in my mind is the huge red stain on the carpet.  i mean it was in clear site and very noticeable.  i think it was wine...idk.  i mean at least they could've tried to cover it up.  and the other awful thing i found.....a big greasy full hand print above my bed on the leather headboard......YUCK! i was easily able to wipe it off w\/ a wet wipe. god knows what else they didn't clean! geez i get sick just thinking of it.  idk the room was nice but the cleaning staff should've done better.

Stayed at the Rio this past weekend because my friends and I went to the sam hunt concert at the cosmopolitan. Easy parking and also quick to catch a taxi. I was surprised on how big the room was that we had got. Nothing fancy but it was a comfortable stay. The rooms can use a little remodeling. But the view was great we stayed on the 10th floor. This hotel is off the strip but they have a shuttle that runs until 1am. Not too shabby. I would definitely stay here again

The hotel kinda smells like my ex bf butt. He was a really good looking guy but a super player. I do know my players now for sure but this hotel for some reason reminds me of players, maybe because ot that butt smell. Could be funky knickers smell too. I cant figure it out.

Anyways. McFaddens is supergreat! (see my review) the pool is pretty ok. I have seen worse. like my ex bf for example. That would make me a single chick on the prowl, but I dont seem to be able to hook up with someone hot at the pool there. Maybe because its like walruss island or grand central for not so fit guys. I am ok with guys with a little chunkers in the trunkers and above, but if dudes belly extends to Canada and is all hairy... not so hot. Please dudes! :)  good looking girls though for the most part!

I booked reservations for May 5-7 a month in advance. I called the hotel directly a couple weeks before my reservations for some questions I had and they were completely rude and did not help at all. They told me they were going to "put notes in my reservation" about something I was concerned about and come to find out they never did. When it was time to check it we got there at 1130 pm May 5 and checked in. We were expecting a room with 2 queen beds and walking into the room we had one king bed and not even pull out couch. We called and they said they "upgraded" us without asking and offered to comp $50. Which was nice but my problem with it, is that they didn't warn us and we had 5 people staying in the room with one bed and no pull out couch so we needed the extra bed.

The next night I called for a roll away bed and they gave me attitude telling me they were going to charge me for it because there's no "notes" about them messing up my reservation! And the manager also didn't believe I didn't have a pullout couch but I finally got them to bring up another bed. Overall it wasn't worth the price and I probably won't be staying there again.

This place looks old compared to the other hotels in Vegas. It's OK if you get a good deal but not a great place. I was "upgraded" to the Ipanema tower which was a bit of a joke as it looked like all of the other rooms I had seen online. The casino floor is filled with dealers who don't look to happy to be there but that are friendly enough. 

I would say that if you have a few days to spend in Vegas and are looking for a cheap place that is OK, this is your place, if you can spend the extra $$'s, go to the Venetian (just as cheesy as all of Vegas but nicer looking) or Caesar's Palace.

Worst experience ever.  Bathrooms sinks were backed up..  after 3 calls and complaining to the front desk finally got us a another room.  That room had issues as well.. One  of the sink didn't work.. Never again, will I ever stay at the Rio ..

If you're into drink girls wearing lingerie, this could be the place for you. But other than that, it's pretty drab and it's not on the strip, so it's probably one of my least favorite casinos in Vegas.

I had such a great time here! All the rooms are suites which are huge! Floor to ceiling windows which make looking out at night so beautiful.  We we're going to go to their famous seafood buffet but the line was sooooo long. We had tickets to a show so we couldn't wait. But we ate at another restaurant instead which was just as yummy! Obviously the hotel is slightly off the trip but just get a Total Rewards card and you get a free shuttle to the strip that comes every 30 mins.

It was perfect for the prize paid. The service is very good as well. Very convenient. Although it's a few blocks away from the main strip, I found this place to be great. 

The rooms are dated but specious. The cleanliness is questionable ( you can find an inch of dust under the furniture) but you can't but the views. We had a Mountain View which was picture worthy. 

The place is always busy which makes it a fun environment. We did not take advantage of all the amenities but I would give it a second try. 

If you are looking to safe a few bucks, this is the place for you. It's very convenient friendly and spacious.

The "suite" was pretty nice. You do have to use that term loosely. I mean, it's a big room with a sectional sofa. Mini-bar, mini fridge, and bathroom lighting that makes you look like a movie star. However, the aren't all "suites". No wet bar, no jacuzzi, and no seperate room. But I can't complain, it was comped.

If you gamble, always show your Total Rewards card. It's an easy way to get free rooms every time. 

Rio's got some life. I used to stay at Bally's and Paris exclusively. But the Rio was way better, and younger. It's a place for 30-somethings. Every cocktail server also dances or sings. Plus they also have girls offering massages while you play. Bitchin'!

One complaint. Paper thin walls. When you wake up at 5:00am to the sound of a hooker earning her baby's diapers in the "suite" next door, you laugh for a second, till your head splits wide open from the hangover.

When I think of best bang for the buck Casinos in Vegas I think of the Rio. The amount of room you get for the price is amazing. The staff is friendly and helpful. The food inside the casino is good. Plenty of bars and the Voodoo lounge is pretty awesome. Overall the place is the best for the money. Only thing that others have mentioned is the location. It's a little far off from the strip and a Cab can be anywhere from $10-$15 depending on how traffic is. Only thing that I hated was the Valet people were rude to me on several occasions.

We were there just last Sunday. Its a very busy hotel. We waited for an hour to get our keys and found out it was double book. Another guests tried to get in our room! We both went down again (he as well waited an hour to get his keys) to figure it out with the counter. Another hour wasted.

We got our booking from groupon. It says "includes breakfast". But they longer have breakfast so we got a lunch buffet. We thought it was lunch for every day that we stayed but after restaurant host called the hotel and I called the hotel too to clarify, it was just for 2 lunches for the entire stay. The deal was clearly misleading. When we checked out, we were overcharged for a lunch buffet. I made a complained about it but they insisted that we sign it and to go back to the restaurant to figure it out. Horrible service, horrible experience. Would never go back and recommend this hotel to anyone.

My girlfriend and I (early 20s) stayed at the Rio for 2 nights as part of a week-long spring break trip. Our suite on the 15th floor of the Masquerade Tower was large and spacious, with a comfy king-size bed and large couch, and there was plenty of room for us to toss our stuff everywhere. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but the presence of a second sink outside the bathroom and a makeup station complete with mirror and chair made up for it. While the furnishings weren't quite as extravagant as I expected for a suite in Vegas (the light on the makeup mirror didn't work, the couch upholstery seemed like it was at least 30 years old), for the price it was great. The free shuttle service every 30 min to the Strip was also a great touch.

If not for the water incident and a couple other minor annoyances described below, I would have given the Rio a solid 4 stars.

Minor annoyances:
1) There was no wastebin in the huge bedroom area, but there were 2 in the bathroom. Housekeeping negligence or lack of oversight by hotel management?
2) There was no coffee maker even though there were instant coffee packets lying on the table. I couldn't heat water to make a late-night ramen snack. Again, staff negligence?
3) There was an additional resort fee of $33\/night tacked onto the original rate of $45\/night, which I was totally unaware of. I booked the Rio through Explore Cruise and Travel, which made no mention of a resort fee. I first found out about the resort fee when I was forced to pay it in order to check out. After doing some research, I found that resort fees are common to Vegas hotels, but finding out that our fee almost doubled AS WE WERE LEAVING left a sour taste in my mouth.

Water incident:
This topped off our stay. I still can't believe that something like this could happen in a modern city, especially one as lavish as Las Vegas. My girlfriend and I came back at 2:00am from a night of drinking, exhausted and hoping to catch a quick shower, chug fluids to avoid a hangover, and sleep. When we went to the bathroom, we found that THERE WAS NO WATER. No water as in, no water came out of the sink or tub when I turned the knob, just a pained choking noise from my throat. We called the front desk and found that there was an 'emergency water outage.' From the curtness of the concierge's reply, it seemed like he had been fielding calls like this for a while. There was no explanation given, just a notice that the estimated repair time would be 2 hours. My girlfriend and I were stunned. We used what little drinking water we had to brush our teeth and went to bed dirty. The water was back when I used the bathroom at 6am. However, it was too late to save my hangover, which intensified greatly from the lack of water and left me feeling like a zombie until mid-afternoon.

I definitely will not be staying at the Rio the next time I visit Las Vegas, and I'll be sure to let my friends who are visiting in June know as well.

False advertisement!!! Do not go here thinking you'll get a cheap buffet.
They actually do not honor what it says on the website, and they charge you for more money. It's regardless there is an event or not. I've posted my receipt if you want to see what I'm talking about.

Bad business people.. False online advertisement on their own website!!

I kept meaning to leave this place a review! Anyways, about a month ago I tagged along with my bf for a business trip and he had told me that the hotel room was at The Rio. After yelping it I was immediately hesitant bc of their reviews... "Oh no! This is going to be horrible! Someone even mentioned their room was by the outside dumpster!" As soon as we got in, (after making our way to the hotel elevators   strategically placed on the other end of the casino) I was pleasantly surprised! The room was great! Well I believe it was a suite actually, on the 18th floor. It even had a couch, dining area, and vanity despite the other sink and mirror in the bathroom. I was totally comfortable, and had to make sure to give my two cents. I don't gamble... But next time there's a show out this way I know where I'm stayin!

If you're a SMOKER, you'll love this hotel. If NOT, avoid it at all costs. A hazy pall of smoke lingers over every inch of the casino and ground floor that is inescapable as you wend your way to the guest elevators. We chose a NON-SMOKING room, however the smell of smoke permeated every fiber in the room and was especially strong from the bed linens each night. While the maid service was excellent, their attention to detail could not overcome the poor maintenance of the room. The sink had no drain stopper; the shower controls were barely operable; and the desk in the room was stripped of its wood and wobbly on its feet. The mattress felt as though an elephant had slept in it for years and was so sagging in the middle that occupants could not help but slide down into the abyss and hope for some kind of sleep. The linen not only smelled of smoke, but were so worn and cleaned with an abrasive soap that they were scratchy to the touch. All in all, an adventure that will NEVER be repeated again.  For those who are even remotely considering a stay here: CAVEAT EMPTOR!

Rio De Janeiro

Please add...

*Looser slots 
*Cordial security staff
*More cute shops & under 21 crowd entertainment
*Some much needed glitz & glamor upgrades all around

To your already...

*Delicious seafood buffet
*Spacious rooms
*Fun vibe

...and it'll definitely turn the Rio back into a poppin' place! I'll be back nonetheless (YAY for rewards points).

Great hotel for the rate! From registration to check out, the staff was very friendly and helpful . Good spot to hit $5 craps and $10 roulette if that's your cup of tea . Also has some good restaurants at affordable prices. Pool was awesome! Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because our shower head wasn't working to its fullest capacity. Needs a minor fix, but besides that's everything was great!

Pleasantly pleased with this hotel! Got a great price last minute and my room was huge!! Pretty big bathroom and sectional in my room with partial view of the strip! Couldn't beat this at $38 a night! Very easy to get too and the front desk was very nice! Def recommend.

PROS:

All-suite hotel
Friendly staff
Shuttle buses to Paris and Bally's

CONS:

Located off the strip
Older clientele (think middle-aged and up)
Parking garage too damn far (or maybe I'm being a lazyass but I remember walking a lot)
Poor housecleaning (there were 3 used bandaids from the previous guest(s) the first time I stayed here. Two in one of the queen sized beds, and one on the floor, AND a beer bottle in the hallway)

I'd pick Rio over Luxor and Excalibur though. It's not too bad, but the used bandaids were kinda gross, even though I wasn't the one who slept in THAT bed ;)
Room service is expensive and the food was horrible, food came cold and on cardboard plates. This made the food taste like the plates. Because I ate a portion of the food I was not given a refund.

Good hotel. We must have stayed in the renovated towers as our suite was nicely decorated and very comfortable. We had a mini bar and fridge.a nice view and the staff were all pretty helpful and friendly. I went to the pool, not the topless one, but the main one (Ipanema Beach) and it was not that crowded, they have a few pools to choose from as well as, jacuzzi's..the bar is ok at the pool, no happy hour and drinks are expensive $26 for two so-so mojitos. I know, I know bartenders looove making those, but shoot, your getting a tip..Anyways, go gamble and get free drinks instead.
I give this place four stars because it was a good stay, not complaints about the hotel AND, my honey bear won $1000 dollars within 20-minutes of us getting there....that would make any stay pleasurable!!

This is one of my favorites casino in Vegas. You can play roulette or baccarat before you head out to the pool. Don't forget your room keys or you have to play a entry price.
Love the pool here.
